title: No More Statutes of Limitations for Rape
description: THIS week, Bill Cosby was charged with three counts of aggravated indecent assault. The felony charges stemmed from an incident more than a decade ago, in which Andrea Constand says Mr. Cosby drugged and assaulted her in his home. Mr. Cosby says he intends to fight the charges, and no court has found him liable for sexual misconduct.

title: Freddie Gray Complained of Bad Back Before Arrest, Filing Says
description: Freddie Gray, the 25-year-old black man who died of a broken neck after he was taken into police custody in Baltimore, complained of back trouble less than two weeks before that encounter, according to a document filed in court by defense lawyers for a police officer charged with murder in his death.

title: Justice in Taxes, Most Likely Short-Lived
description: WASHINGTON  Is the party over for Americas super-rich?

title: No. 1 Clemson Advances to National Championship Game
description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla.  No. 1 Clemson rose to prominence this season largely behind its offense and quarterback Deshaun Watson, who finished third in the Heisman Trophy voting. The Orange Bowl between the Tigers and No. 4 Oklahoma featured the best two quarterbacks in college football  Watson and Baker Mayfield  but the Tigers defense essentially ended the comparison.

title: ProsecutorsSecrecy Orders on Subpoenas Stir Constitutional Questions
description: Marked with an official seal, the federal subpoena arrived at the red brick offices of Zuccarello, Zerillo & Co., an accounting firm in Whitestone, Queens, in early March.

title: Ackman Sheds Some Valeant Shares
description: The hedge fund of William A. Ackman said on Thursday that it had sold some of its shares in Valeant Pharmaceuticals, the embattled drug company that Mr. Ackman earlier this year went to considerable lengths to defend.

title: Holiday Today New Years Day
description: NEW YORK

title: Howard Davis Jr., Who Beat Grief to Win Boxing Gold, Dies at 59
description: Howard Davis Jr., a boxer from Long Island who in 1976 won an Olympic gold medal and also received the Val Barker Trophy, awarded to the most outstanding Olympic fighter, over his teammates and fellow gold medalists Michael and Leon Spinks and Sugar Ray Leonard, died on Wednesday at his home in Plantation, Fla. He was 59.

title: Flooding in Missouri Raises Vexing Questions
description: ARNOLD, Mo.  Linda Thorne peered out the back of her trailer near here on Monday night to find water sloshing up the wooden steps.

title: As Brooklyn Park Stalls, Fingers Point at Religious Group
description: There is little to indicate that the misshapen expanse of concrete, bounded by a chain-link fence and at times dusted with crumbling pieces of the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway that runs alongside it is, in fact, a city park. A few thousand feet west is one of New Yorks glossiest green esplanades, the sprawling Brooklyn Bridge Park, alongside the East River in the same Dumbo neighborhood. But here, the only clue that the lot is not a car park or a stalled construction site is the green parks department sign proclaiming Bridge Park 2.

title: Why Fans Stand by Perennial Losers
description: Although they advanced to the World Series in October, the Mets last won a championship in 1986. For some fans, the vigor surrounding that team still has not worn off.

title: Chris Mullin Sees Mixed Signs in St. Johns Loss
description: With six seconds left in yet another loss, Chris Mullin, the St. Johns basketball legend turned first-year coach, sprang out of his seat and grimly trudged down the sideline to where Creighton Coach Greg McDermott stood. The two shook hands as the final buzzer sounded.

title: Experts Foresee Obstacles for Both Sides in Bill Cosby Case
description: For years, as Bill Cosby and his lawyers aggressively rebutted accusations that he was a sexual predator, his defenders could point to one incontrovertible fact: He had never been charged with a crime.

title: Things to Do in the Hudson Valley, Jan. 2 Through 10
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Monitoring of Terrorism Threats Has Risen, Official Says
description: WASHINGTON  A senior European counterterrorism official said on Thursday that spy services in several countries had increased their monitoring and surveillance, and governments had put heightened security measures in place, even before recent arrests in Belgium and Turkey.

title: Things to Do in Connecticut, Jan. 2 Through 10
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Things to Do on Long Island, Jan. 2 Through 10
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Things to Do in New Jersey, Jan. 2 Through 10
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: New York City and Correction Officers Reach Tentative Contract Deal
description: The administration of Mayor Bill de Blasio announced on Thursday that it had tentatively agreed to a labor contract with New York Citys correction officers union that included long-sought protections for jail guards, like provisions to make it easier to prosecute inmates who commit crimes while incarcerated.

title: Ice Problems and Injury Plague Womens Debut at the Winter Classic
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  The last three weeks exposed womens hockey to the hard business dealings of professional sports, along with its hierarchies and the need for more collaboration to advance the sport.

title: Scream Ones Head Off
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Happy New Year! Hope you are all recovered from your celebrations enough that you are up for a lively Friday puzzle by David Steinberg.

title: Bronx Man, a Father Figure in His Family, Is Fatally Attacked by 6 Men
description: Hugo Galindo had been scheduled to work at a private party at a restaurant on New Years Eve, but he was looking forward to it nonetheless. He and a cousin, both food runners at a Times Square restaurant, planned to climb to the roof just before the stroke of midnight, the cousin said, and watch the storied ball drop.

title: Lighting Up the Night, and the New Year
description: New Years Eve celebrations sparkled across the globe.

title: Wayne Rogers, Who Played Trapper John in M*A*S*H, Dies at 82
description: Wayne Rogers, the affable actor who starred as Trapper John in the hit television series M*A*S*H in the 1970s, died on Thursday in Los Angeles. He was 82.

title: A Hastings-on-Hudson Couple and a Friend Die in a Head-On Crash in Vermont
description: HASTINGS-ON-HUDSON, N.Y.  As she drove to work on Wednesday morning, Robin Friedman was surprised to get a call from the guidance counselor at Hastings High School here. Her children are grown, and have long since graduated.

title: Alabama Caps an Eve of Destruction, Setting Up a Showdown With Clemson
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  These moments are considered birthrights for the Alabama Crimson Tide, whose fans are famous for putting houndstooth hats in their childrens cribs as a tribute to the legendary Bear Bryant and for having incredibly lofty expectations.

title: Chinas Homeless Find Shelter Under McDonalds Golden Arches
description: BEIJING  He woke to the cry of the morning janitor. Put your shoes on! she said. Put your shoes on! She rattled a chair. This isnt your house! Sit up!

title: What to Watch Friday
description: The networks seem to have anticipated a lethargic viewership. Classics such as Them! and Rear Window begin around noon. If your big plan is to watch TV today, youre in luck, as the day proceeds with such light fare as The Hangover and Blades of Glory.

title: Corrections: January 1, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I woke up and there wasnt a person sleeping three feet away.

title: A Better Standard for the Use of Deadly Force
description: IN police shooting cases like that of 12-year-old Tamir Rice in Cleveland, grand jurors are typically asked to focus on one question: At the moment the officer fired, did he have reason to believe the person he shot posed a grave and imminent threat?

title: Privilege, Pathology and Power
description: Wealth can be bad for your soul. Thats not just a hoary piece of folk wisdom; its a conclusion from serious social science, confirmed by statistical analysis and experiment. The affluent are, on average, less likely to exhibit empathy, less likely to respect norms and even laws, more likely to cheat, than those occupying lower rungs on the economic ladder.

title: Haitian Migrants Plight
description: To the Editor:

title: Girls in Japans War Brothels
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Two Ways of Dealing With Guns
description: This is a big day for Texans yearning to flaunt their handguns in belt and shoulder holsters. A new open carry law enacted by the Republican Legislature goes into effect on Friday, posing a challenge for law enforcement, businesses and other institutions that are understandably wary of how social interchange will be affected.

title: 2016. The Shape of Things to Come
description: We've looked into it. It could be worse.

title: Nassau Countys Bad Bet on Gambling
description: The community of Elmont, on Long Island, may soon be getting a neighborhood amenity thats high-class and exciting, if you think a big carpeted box filled with a thousand video gambling machines is high-class and exciting.

title: Global Trade After the Failure of the Doha Round
description: After 14 years of talks, members of the World Trade Organization have effectively ended the Doha round of negotiations. That was not unexpected given how fruitless these discussions have been. Now, world leaders need to think anew about the global trading system.

title: Kim Jong-un Talks of Reconciliation in New Years Speech
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Koreas leader, Kim Jong-un, said in his annual New Years speech on Friday that he was willing to discuss reconciliation with South Korea, while warning that the Norths military would keep working to develop more diverse capabilities.

title: X-Rated at the Library
description: The New York Public Librarys erotica collection (yes, it has one) includes seedy Times Square ephemera, early transgender magazines and copies of Playboy.

title: Number of Traffic Deaths in New York Falls for a Second Straight Year
description: Despite a series of serious crashes in recent months, traffic deaths fell in New York for the second year in a row as the city continued to focus on improving street safety.

title: Lifting the Veil on the New York Public Librarys Erotica Collection
description: ***, the symbol was called.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Sound Sleep, Coconut Oil and Posture Woes
description: Take the Quiz

title: Why the Post Office Makes America Great
description: I WAS transported recently to a place that is as enchanting to me as any winter wonderland: my local post office.

title: ISIS War on Christmas
description: Oran, Algeria  IT might have been an occasion for collectors of omens to rejoice: For the first time in nearly five centuries, in 2015 the Prophet Muhammads birthday coincided with Jesus birthday. A cause for hope? Too little, it turns out.

title: Daech en guerre contre Nol
description: Oran, Algrie  Loccasion aurait pu faire le bonheur des collectionneurs de prsages : pour la premire fois depuis presque cinq sicles, lanniversaire de la naissance du Prophte Mahomet et lanniversaire de la naissance de Jsus ont concid en 2015. De quoi inspirer de lespoir ? Si peu, en fait.

title: A Lingering Taste
description: In 1984, while my parents traveled to the United States to assess a possible life there, they rented a chalet in the Lebanese coastal town Jounieh and left us in the care of my maternal grandmother. It was a thrilling summer for me. More than any of my siblings, I was tired of the war in Lebanon, which had been going strong for almost a decade. I was particularly fed up with living in constant fear  from the shellings, the sniper attacks, the bombings, the checkpoints, the kidnappings and the threats directed at my Palestinian-born parents, who met and married in Beirut. I spent much of my time daydreaming about a new, perfect and utterly normal life in America.

title: How to Listen to a Police Scanner
description: Dont buy special equipment, says Tom Coleman, who has been listening to Chicago police- and fire-radio communications 24 hours a day for eight years. (He says he has mastered the skill of half listening in his sleep.) Find the department feed you want at broadcastify.com or on a smartphone app like 5-0 Radio Police Scanner. Though Coleman himself owns a $600 scanner, he mostly tunes in online.

title: The 12.20.15 Issue
description: FIRST WORDS

title: new year
description: Selected by Natasha Trethewey.

title: Answering the Most Frequent Questions About the Book Review
description: As the editor of The New York Times Book Review, I am frequently besieged with questions, and not all of them come from authors (or friends of authors) wanting certain books to be reviewed  or to be reviewed more kindly.

title: How Is the Economy Doing? It May Depend on Your Party, and $1
description: Suppose it is dinnertime, and the phone rings. It is a polite survey taker with a simple question for you: How is the economy doing?

title: Eight New Products to Reset Your Mind (and Body) This Year
description: A new crop of wellness remedies aim to clear the air, cleanse the system and make room for good vibes and health in 2016. And theyre driven by no shortage of New Age principles (appropriate for the new year).

title: Dubai Hotel Smolders as Firefighters Tackle Last Gasps of Blaze
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  Firefighters in Dubai worked Friday morning to extinguish the remnants of a blaze that consumed a 63-story luxury hotel on New Years Eve, a few hundred yards from the worlds tallest building, the Burj Khalifa.

title: Munich on High Alert After New Years Eve Terrorism Threat
description: BERLIN  Hundreds of police officers remained on alert in Munich on Friday after a threat of a suicide bombing attack by the Islamic State led the authorities to evacuate two train stations on New Years Eve.

title: Stuff We Liked: Most-Pirated Movies and Twitter Talk
description: The weeks list of other peoples stuff we liked:

title: Coexistence on the D Train
description: Dear Diary:

title: Pope Francis Urges Overcoming Indifference to Attain Peace
description: In his first message of 2016, Pope Francis summoned humanity to show compassion and to transcend the apathy that impedes peace in a world that has been filled of late with conflict and suffering.

title: The Year the Studios Get It Right
description: In February, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences will consecrate a best picture, most likely choosing from among a roster of respectable, serious dramas. A few early favorites have already faded  does anyone remember The Walk or Everest? Sicario or Black Mass?  but the field of Oscar movies is crowded with aspirants. Meanwhile, movie audiences have had other ideas, driving box-office totals to record heights with their enthusiasm for reanimated dinosaurs, romantic trainwrecks and galactic battles. Popularity is not the same as quality, of course, but 2015 was a year when a lot of the best cinematic art could be found at the multiplex, amid the sequels and blockbusters.

title: Atlanta Begins Charging for a Streetcar Named Undesirable by Some
description: ATLANTA  The streetcar was stopped in downtown traffic, and before long Keisha Schwarzel figured that was enough of a first experience with the year-old addition to Atlantas transit system.

title: 1916: Hundreds Sink With the Persia
description: LONDON  The Admiralty announces that the P. and O. line steamship Persia, 7,974 tons, which left London for Bombay, was torpedoed and sunk by an enemy submarine on Thursday [Dec. 30]. The vessel carried 300 crew and 235 passengers, including 86 women and 30 children, and as only four boatloads escaped, it is feared that this culmination of the wholesale slaughter of innocents in 1915 by enemy submarines is only eclipsed in horror by the sinking of the Lusitania on May 7, when the sea-murderers sent 1,198 innocent persons, including hundreds of Americans, to a watery grave.

title: A Year, One Second at a Time
description: The Times reporter Daniel Victor aimed to record a one-second video every day in 2015 and patched them together using an app.

title: Why I Recorded a One-Second Video (Almost) Every Day in 2015
description: Assigning myself the project of recording a one-second video every day in 2015 seemed, on Jan. 1, as if it would propel me into a year of adventure, of never saying no when theres footage to be found outside my apartment walls.

title: Nostalgia and Surrealism Infuse Works of Chinese Animation Artist
description: CHONGQING, China  ZHANG XIAOTAO, one of Chinas leading animation artists, grew up in a village in western China where the ferocity of the Cultural Revolution left indelible marks on everyone. His father, a leader of the local Red Guards, emerged with his spirit broken by what he saw and did.

title: Gunman Kills 2 in Tel Aviv in Attack on a Busy Street
description: TEL AVIV  A gunman whom relatives identified as an Arab citizen of Israel opened fire in the center of Tel Aviv on Friday, killing two Israeli Jews at a crowded bar and wounding at least five others. The assault created mayhem along a busy street and led to an intense manhunt by the authorities. The suspect was still at large late Friday.

title: U.S. Doesnt Know How Many Foreign Visitors Overstay Visas
description: WASHINGTON  The question from the congressman to the Obama administration official was straightforward enough: How many foreign visitors overstay their visas every year?

title: Whats on This Week Around the World
description: Sydney, Australia

title: A Clash of Heavyweights, and Styles, for College Footballs Top Prize
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  So good was Alabamas running game, led by the Heisman Trophy-winning tailback Derrick Henry, entering Thursday nights College Football Playoff semifinal at the Cotton Bowl that one Michigan State coach charged with stopping it did not mind divulging the Spartans strategy to a reporter two days earlier.

title: A Vital Look at Ignored Realities in Midwest Flood Zone
description: After I posted on Twitter to promote a fine Times story about a Missouri flood victim, a reply* directed my attention to a column by Tony Messenger in the St. Louis Post-Dispatch showing, yet again, how communities ignore inconvenient hydrological and geophysical realities:

title: 1941: Air Line Keeps Rome-Rio Link
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  L.A.T.I., the Italian owned and operated air line which is the only trans-Atlantic link between the Rome-Berlin Axis and the Western Hemisphere, completed its first year of operations today [Dec. 23]. In spite of the war in Europe, it is still making weekly flights with land planes between Rome and Rio de Janeiro. It is an important line, for by it the Axis reaches South American countries and the United States without running the risk of confiscation or censorship at a British control station.

title: Robert Irwins Big Visions, Barely Seen
description: MARFA, TEX.  Robert Irwin is not a conceptual artist. But if he were, his trademark concept over the last half-century might have been devising hugely ambitious public installations that are virtually guaranteed never to be realized.

title: A Year of Highs and Corrections in the Art Market
description: LONDON  Looking back at the headlines, 2015 was a momentous year for the art market.

title: The Natty? Its Right After the Semis, of Course
description: The Super Bowl. The World Series. The Final Four. Big events that determine championships tend to have short, memorable names.

title: Obama to Consider Executive Actions on Gun Violence
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will meet with Attorney General Loretta E. Lynch on Monday to discuss what he can do to curb gun violence, sidestepping an entrenched Congress.

title: Happy New Year!
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Think Seriously About Spending for Play
description: Maybe you keep a budget. If you do, perhaps you have entries for travel or even specific entries for your hobbies.

title: How Jeb Bush Hopes to Save His Candidacy
description: HIALEAH, Fla.  Jeb Bush and his supporters still have a pile of money to spend, remnants of $100 million raised when he seemed early last year to be a sure bet. They have an expansive ground operation in New Hampshire. And allies have just begun a new ad campaign in Iowa.

title: Dayo Okeniyi, Getting Comfortable Wearing a Badge
description: In the new NBC drama Shades of Blue, Dayo Okeniyi plays Michael Loman, a rookie New York City detective who makes a deadly mistake on a drug bust with Harlee Santos, a detective played by Jennifer Lopez. The show, which has its premiere on Thursday, Jan. 7, centers on a tight-knit unit, led by Matt Wozniak (Ray Liotta), whose members sometimes step outside the law to protect their own. But loyalties are tested when Santos is ensnared in an F.B.I. investigation and reluctantly becomes an informant.

title: Gina DePalma, Acclaimed Pastry Chef at Babbo, Dies at 49
description: Gina DePalma, a pastry chef whose artfully simple Italian desserts helped make Babbo in Greenwich Village one of Manhattans most beloved and admired restaurants, died on Tuesday at a hospice in the Bronx. She was 49.

title: Taliban Attack Kabul Restaurant, Setting Off Shootout
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Taliban launched their first attack of the new year by setting off a bomb on Friday at a French restaurant in Kabul once popular with foreigners, and gunmen then engaged in a protracted shootout with the police.

title: At the Gym, Abs and Stats
description: In New York, gyms, commitments to which swell every January before being forgotten by Presidents Day, can trace their history to a man named Friedrich Ludwig Jahn, who began teaching outdoor athletics classes in Berlin early in the 19th century. Jahn taught gymnastics on devices of his own invention: balance beams, parallel bars and so on.

title: Turkey Says Hitler Comment by President Erdogan Was Distorted
description: ISTANBUL  Turkey issued a statement on Friday saying that comments by President Recep Tayyip Erdogan  in which he cited Hitler in response to a question about whether a strong presidency was possible in Turkey  had been misinterpreted.

title: New York Discovers Keyless Entry Systems
description: In the next few months, residents at a handful of buildings in the city will be able to walk up to their apartment doors and go inside without fumbling for keys. And if the dog walker or cleaning service comes by while they are out, residents can use an app to let them in remotely. Ditto for deliveries.

title: What I Love | Tim Blake Nelson
description: Home for the actor is the Upper West Side. Lately, hes been walking to work: His film, Anesthesia was shot in the neighborhood.

title: Tim Blake Nelson on the Upper West Side
description: Tim Blake Nelson is happiest when his household runs like clockwork.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in Greenwich Village, Chelsea and Boerum Hill, Brooklyn.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and Connecticut
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: For $30.5 Million, Fifth Avenue and Facing the Park
description: A vice chairman of the Blackstone Group, J. Tomilson Hill, and his wife, Janine Hill, paid $30,500,000 for a grand park-facing apartment at 834 Fifth Avenue, the majestic 16-story limestone building designed by Rosario Candela, where just last spring a sale set a record for city co-ops. It was the most expensive completed sale of the week, according to public records.

title: Fantasy Football Week 17: Rankings and Matchups
description: Fantasy football analysis for N.F.L. Week 17. You can also follow the Sablich brothers on Twitter at @5thDownFantasy and see their complete Week 17 player rankings.

title: Natalie Cole, Unforgettable Voice and Million-Selling Hitmaker, Dies at 65
description: Natalie Cole, a buoyantly jazzy singer who became a million-selling, Grammy Award-winning pop hitmaker with her 1975 debut album and went on to even greater popularity when she followed the example of her father, Nat King Cole, in interpreting pre-rock pop standards, died on Thursday in Los Angeles. She was 65.

title: Dallas Stars Visit New York, and Theyre Bringing a Defense
description: DALLAS  With an explosive offense and aspirations for the N.H.L. playoffs, the Dallas Stars convened for training camp understanding that the dirty work of defense needed to be addressed.

title: Hillary Clinton Raised $37 Million in Last 3 Months
description: Hillary Clintons presidential campaign raised $37 million in the three-month period that ended Dec. 31, filling the war chest of a campaign that has pulled in more than $112 million overall for the Democratic contest, her campaign said Friday.

title: S.M.U., With No Titles to Shoot For, Remains Undefeated
description: Only three undefeated teams remain in Division I mens college basketball. One is Oklahoma, the No. 3 team in the country and a candidate for this years national title. No. 24 South Carolina is also unbeaten, and is bidding for its first N.C.A.A. tournament appearance since 2004.

title: Before Ball Dropped, So Did Viewership of College Football Playoff Semifinals
description: Viewership for Thursdays two College Football Playoff semifinal games was down drastically when compared with last season, a clear indication that ESPN paid a price for the games move to New Years Eve.

title: App Makers Reach Out to the Teenager on Mobile
description: Over the past decade, advertisers have spent untold millions trying to turn Talia Kocar and her peers in the millennial generation into loyal customers. But on a recent afternoon in Santa Monica, Calif., in a kind of consumer torch-passing, Ms. Kocar, 25, watched a focus group of teenagers drink free Snapple and suck Doritos powder off their thumbs while answering questions about their smartphones.

title: Taking Flight
description: If the Jets win at Buffalo on Sunday, they will clinch an A.F.C. wild-card berth. Ben Shpigel breaks down the key moments that have led the Jets to the brink of the playoffs.

title: Eagles Snapper Used Magic to Fix Shattered Childhood
description: PHILADELPHIA  Soon after Jon Dorenboss mother was murdered by his father, he moved in with his aunt and returned to his hometown for a Little League all-star game where he witnessed his first magic show. Today, Dorenbos, the Philadelphia Eagles long snapper, says that 30-minute experience helped turn around his life.

title: Rules for Instagram
description: Leila Khan and Lucy Nemerov, two eighth graders from Palo Alto, Calif., and their friends explain why they delete their Instagram photos.

title: Want to Keep New Years Resolutions? Consider the Consequences of Failing
description: THE New Years resolutions are still new. And a cynic  or realist, given past performance  might say many of them will fail by spring, if not sooner.

title: With Win After Win, Tigers Leave Clemsoning in Their Past
description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla.  As Clemson pulled away from Oklahoma in the second half of the Orange Bowl on Thursday night, the former Tigers quarterback Tajh Boyd made his way down to watch the end of the game from the sideline. For the last few years, Boyd, the Tigers starter from 2011 to 2013, had been hanging around the program, both to mentor players and to watch it grow in prominence.

title: At C.D.C., a Debate Behind Recommendations on Cellphone Risk
description: When the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention published new guidelines 18 months ago regarding the radiation risk from cellphones, it used unusually bold language on the topic for the American health agency: We recommend caution in cellphone use.

title: Older Students Learn for the Sake of Learning
description: JOSH AND SUSAN FRIED attend classes three days a week but they never receive any grades or cram for midterms or finals. They are not trying to earn an additional degree or retrain for a new career.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Looking Beyond the Internet of Things
description: SAN FRANCISCO  If you have sent email on Google or used Microsofts browser or databases, you have touched the technology handiwork of Adam Bosworth.

title: New York Wants Fantasy Customers Repaid
description: The New York State attorney general wants the two largest daily fantasy sports companies, FanDuel and DraftKings, to give back the hundreds of millions they have made in the state and pay a stiff penalty for running what he argues are illegal gambling operations.

title: In Star Wars, Was the Death Star Too Big to Fail?
description: AT the end of Star Wars: Episode VI  Return of the Jedi, the heroic Rebel Alliance defeats the evil Galactic Empire, destroying the second Death Star, the empires central space station (and superweapon). Audiences typically respond to the destruction of the Death Star with triumphant cheers.

title: Jihadists Deepen Collaboration in North Africa
description: SAHARA DESERT, Niger  A group of light armored vehicles skated over the moonscape of the Sahara, part of one of the largest detachments the French military has deployed here since colonial times. Its mission is growing ever more urgent: to cut smuggling routes used by jihadists who have turned this inhospitable terrain into a sprawling security challenge for African and international forces alike.

title: For Bratton and Kelly, Linked Legacies and Locked Horns
description: For a quarter-century, they have circled each other as hard-bitten rivals for one of the plum jobs in law enforcement, the claim to the Tiffany badge of the commissioner of the New York Police Department, the countrys biggest police force. They are the only men to have held the rank twice in something akin to an extraordinary game of musical chairs.

title: A Tip of the Hat to Beach Blanket Babylon
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It is often the locals who blithely ignore the most storied attractions in their midst. Not until, say, an energetic Aunt Nora storms into town and insists on visiting the Statue of Liberty does a longtime New Yorker make a point of paying personal tribute to that grande dame  with or without an indulgent roll of the eyes.

title: Harvards Find of a Colonial Map of New Jersey Is a Reminder of Border Wars
description: The border wars between New York and New Jersey have seen fierce fighting over the years, from actual shots fired in the 18th century to trash-talking and legal wrangling over the ownership of Ellis Island almost into the 21st.

title: Jewish Deportee on Persecution, Past and Present
description: PARIS  Deported to Birkenau at 15, she last saw her father in the camps when he slipped her an unimaginable onion and a tomato, before he was murdered at Auschwitz.

title: Review: Bordertown and Cooper Barrett Debut
description: If you thought the political debate over immigration has devolved into a cartoon, just wait until Bordertown arrives Sunday night to finish the job. This animated sitcom on Fox is as subtle and amusing as a brick border wall.

title: Clarion Choir Delves Into the Liturgy of St. John Chrysostom, a Rachmaninoff Rarity
description: To kick off 2015 a year ago, Trinity Wall Street presented a performance of Rachmaninoffs Vespers by the Clarion Choir at St. Pauls Chapel as part of its Twelfth Night Festival. Reviewing elsewhere that night, I couldnt hear it, but to judge from all reports, the performance must have been stunning.

title: Armed Texans Celebrate States New Open-Carry Status
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  For decades, the south steps of the State Capitol have served as a staging area for rallies on issues ranging from abortion to immigration rights, but Friday was the first time that demonstrators walked around here with handguns on their hips.

title: Backstage at The Nutcracker
description: An illustrated look at the world in the wings of George Balanchines classic ballet at Lincoln Center.

title: Review: A Precious Harvest in The Pearl Fishers at the Met
description: When word gets around, the sleeper hit of the Metropolitan Opera season could be the new production of Bizets Les Pcheurs de Perles (The Pearl Fishers) that opened on Thursday night, a New Years Eve gala event. When a major house presents a new staging of a repertory staple, like Verdis Otello or, for that matter, Bizets Carmen, the creative team is under pressure to come up with something fresh, to make a statement that stands out. With a lesser-known work like The Pearl Fishers, generally deemed an appealing but flawed opera (patches of soaring music, a justly famous duet, colorful choral writing, but an uneven score with a stilted libretto), the challenge is different and more liberating: The production must make a case for the overlooked opera, must bring out its riches without refashioning its essence.

title: Bill Cosbys Wife, Camille, Must Testify in His Accusers Civil Case
description: On the heels of Bill Cosbys arrest on sexual assault charges, a federal judge in Massachusetts has delivered further bad news for the entertainer, ruling that his wife of almost 52 years, Camille, can be deposed in a civil case filed against him by seven women who say he defamed them.

title: A Word With Cherry Jones: Im Having the Kind of Year Actors Live For
description: Cherry Jones may have played the president on the Fox series 24, but she admits to being a theater snob who always thought she would do her best work on the stage. Then she saw the first season of Transparent, the critically lauded series on Amazon, chronicling the life of Maura Pfefferman (Jeffrey Tambor), who comes out to her adult children as a transgender woman.

title: Authorizing War Against ISIS
description: To the Editor:

title: For the Homeless, Help and a Steady Job
description: To the Editor:

title: Retiring More Comfortably in New York State
description: To the Editor:

title: Raccoons Invade Brooklyn
description: A truck pulled up at a small house with a brick porch and a garden on a recent afternoon, and a man wearing a hooded sweatshirt climbed out. A woman led him to the backyard. When they emerged a few minutes later, he was carrying a wire-mesh cage.

title: Conjuring the Magic in New Yorks Past
description: On the third floor of a tenement in Hells Kitchen, the sorceress awaits.

title: Wishes for the New Year
description: From Times Square to the web, we asked people to tell us their wishes for 2016.

title: A SmarterPlan to Make Retirement Savings Last
description: LAST month, President Obama inaugurated yet another way to encourage Americans to save for retirement. In the new myRA accounts, workers can save up to $15,000 in a low-fee investment plan that, like a government savings bond, guarantees the principal. The accounts are a small step toward helping households save, but they are not an effective solution to the coming retirement crisis.

title: Over 50, Female and Jobless Even as Others Return to Work
description: The latest signs of an improving economy were good enough to help persuade the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates for the first time in nearly a decade. But the better job market is not good enough to land Chettie McAfee a job.

title: 5 Years and $7 Later, U.S. Returns a Seized Hip-Hop Site
description: In the early hours of Thanksgiving Day in 2010, all the music at OnSmash.com, a popular hip-hop blog, disappeared. In place of its usual feed of videos, song links and industry gossip, the site displayed a seizure notice from the federal government, a result of a raid of dozens of websites suspected of trafficking in counterfeit goods and pirated content.

title: Chuck Schumer Seems to Relish Role as Chief Villain of G.O.P.
description: Republicans have put his face in their campaign commercials and spat his name as an insult on the debate stage. Presidential candidates and talk-radio hosts have invoked him as a kind of comic-book villain, thwarting Republicans at every turn.

title: Lets Rethink Our Homeless Shelters
description: MORE than 57,000 New Yorkers will sleep in a shelter tonight. In this city of glistening wealth, they lack a permanent place to call home. Thousands more suffer outside the shelter system; they are on the streets, bracing for the bitter cold ahead.

title: Man Crushed by Elevator at Building That Had a History of Complaints
description: Just minutes before midnight on Thursday, Erude Sanchez and her 10-year-old nephew stepped into an elevator on the third floor of her apartment building with a bag of trash, squeezing in alongside New Years Eve revelers and other residents.

title: Knicks Spoil Their Own Comeback With an Implosion in the 4th Quarter
description: CHICAGO  Coach Derek Fisher allowed 2 minutes 3 seconds to elapse before he motioned to an official for relief. Fishers first timeout on Friday evening was a needed reprieve for the Knicks, who gathered near the bench and enjoyed a brief stretch during which the Bulls were prohibited from driving for layups, sinking 3-pointers and causing general mayhem.

title: In America, a Man Discovers His Jewish Heritage
description: In 2006, Aleksey Bikov came to New York City from Tashkent, Uzbekistan. Simple things, such as well-maintained sidewalks and wheelchair lifts on buses, left him awe-struck.

title: Our Favorite Styles Photos of 2015
description: The world around fashion and style had a fierce digital appetite in 2015. With it came a hunger for images of all kinds: striking fashion, still portraiture and drama captured behind the scenes at shows and in daily lives. Here are some of the years photos that made us pause for a moment and really take a look.

title: Canadiens Mike Condon, Inspired by a Boston-Area Hero, Stifles Bruins
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  They still are not whole. But key people are filtering back into the Montreal Canadiens lineup, with the expectation that the beginning of the new year will be a lot better than the end of the old year.

title: Despite a Warmer Winter, Annual Polar Bear Club Swim Still Chills
description: The boardwalk crawled with Santas, mermaids and polar bears. Music was blasting from the speakers. People were dancing, spreading out blankets on the sand or sipping from flasks as they greeted old friends.

title: Pennsylvania: Cosby Thanks Fans in Message on Twitter
description: Bill Cosby made his first public statement since being charged with aggravated indecent assaultin Pennsylvania on Wednesday, posting a message on Twitteron Thursdaynight that said, Friends and fans, Thank You. The charges facing the 78-year-old entertainer stem from an accusation made by Andrea Constand that Mr. Cosby drugged and sexually abused her in 2004 in his home in Cheltenham Township, a suburb north of Philadelphia, prosecutors said. Aggravated indecent assault carries a punishment of five to 10 years in prison and a $25,000 fine. Mr. Cosby was charged after being dogged for years by sexual assault allegations made by dozens of women. In recent months, he has filed defamation lawsuits against eight of his accusers, including the former model Beverly Johnson.

title: Christian McCaffrey Dazzles as Stanford Runs Away With Rose Bowl
description: PASADENA, Calif.  On Friday, Christian McCaffrey presented an argument to extend the Heisman Trophy voting beyond the regular season, and Stanford made the case that defeats suffered way back on Labor Day weekend should be discounted when ultimately evaluating teams for bowl games and in year-end polls.

title: India and Pakistan Try Again
description: As they clasped hands while walking down the red carpet at the Lahore airport recently, Nawaz Sharif of Pakistan and Narendra Modi of India looked more like close friends than the leaders of two countries whose tense relations have long been a threat to regional stability.

title: St. Louis Area Surveys Toll as Flood Risk Shifts South
description: PACIFIC, Mo.  The floodwaters that swept away cars and swamped living rooms decorated for Christmas slowly drained from homes and businesses outside St. Louis on Friday, leaving behind months of cleanup as the threat of record-breaking floods headed south toward towns and farm communities flanking the Mississippi River.

title: Mr. Cuomos Challenges: The Short List
description: For Gov. Andrew Cuomo of New York, 2016 could and should be a year of great achievement. He is not facing re-election and is not seeking a spot on the national Democratic ticket. That means his considerable drive and political talents can be trained on making the state more livable for its 20 million inhabitants, and its government more ethical.

title: Alabama and Its Leader Rise Together
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Alabama quarterback Jake Coker and his teammates basked in a shower of confetti amid a boisterous celebration after their 38-0 victory over Michigan State late Thursday night. The final score indicated dominance on both sides of the line of scrimmage, a signature performance for a Crimson Tide team that had been criticized for not having more of them.

title: Cutting the Cord and Feeling Good About It
description: Nearly three years ago, when I first thought about living without cable TV, it seemed impractical. But given the proliferation of entertainment choices online, life without cable no longer seems impossible.

title: Our New Year Quiz
description: Test how well you blocked out parts of the last political year.

title: Friday Night Music: More Wild Reeds
description: A followup on last week. This is really lovely:

title: Mass Master
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Some puzzle constructors are attracted to a marquee phrase as their seed entry and some constructors cant resist the Scrabbly allure of the rarer letters of the alphabet when selecting a place to start filling their themeless grids. Today, David Phillips shows us what its like to fall for the allure of the letter X.

title: Qaeda Affiliate Uses Video of Donald Trump for Recruiting
description: Al Qaedas branch in Somalia released a recruitment video on Friday that criticized racism and anti-Muslim sentiment in the United States and contained footage of the Republican presidential candidate Donald J. Trump announcing his proposal to bar Muslims from entering the country.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: Today you might want to catch up on 2015 by watching two critically lauded films  from the directors Ridley Scott and Spike Lee. Or you can put a week of holiday stress into perspective by revisiting the trials endured by Greg Focker (Ben Stiller) in Meet the Parents and Meet the Fockers.

title: Corrections: January 2, 2016
description: NATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: My family has begged for food since the Ming dynasty. Im the 19th generation.

title: Confessions of a Columnist
description: EVERY New Years, in a spirit of self-examination, I try to catalog my worst blunders from the preceding year. But this year, like almost every pundit in America, I have one mistake that overshadows all the others, one confession that makes my other faults seem venial by comparison.

title: Iranian Protesters Ransack Saudi Embassy After Execution of Shiite Cleric
description: Iranian protesters ransacked and set fire to the Saudi Embassy in Tehran on Saturday after Saudi Arabia executed an outspoken Shiite cleric who had criticized the kingdoms treatment of its Shiite minority.

title: Spanx for the Holidays
description: Many of us think of the holidays as the giving season. I think of it as the stalking season. Thats because I have been relentlessly followed online by advertisements for shapewear. The emails have poured in, and every sales site I frequent  Zulily, MyHabit, Ideel  has touted their wonders.

title: Bill Gates: The Billionaire Book Critic
description: Evan Thomas, the best-selling biographer of Robert F. Kennedy and Dwight D. Eisenhower and the author of a half-dozen other books, has seen those books reviewed over the years by The New Yorker, The Washington Post and The Atlantic. But with the recent publication of his latest work, Being Nixon: A Man Divided, he experienced for the first time a new phenomenon: the Bill Gates bump.

title: F.D.A. Regulator, Widowed by Cancer, Helps Speed Drug Approval
description: BETHESDA, Md.  Mary Pazdur had exhausted the usual drugs for ovarian cancer, and with her tumors growing and her condition deteriorating, her last hope seemed to be an experimental compound that had yet to be approved by federal regulators.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted on @nytimes during the last week of 2015 took followers from an island in Antarctica to Times Square, before the ball dropped.

title: Gunmen Killed in Pathankot, India, Air Base Attack
description: NEW DELHI  At least four gunmen were killed in an attack at an Indian air force base that began early Saturday near the border with Pakistan in Pathankot, in Punjab State, the police said.

title: When a Doorman Is Underage
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Making And Using Models
description: Larry Summers, Brad DeLong, and yours truly are having a bit of a three-cornered dialogue about the role of models in policy, set off by Larrys initial post about why he believes the Fed is making a mistake in raising rates. Were now in round two  and before I get to the specifics, let me ask: Dont you wish real life were like this? (Let me pull Marshall McLuhan John Maynard Keynes out from behind this sign.)

title: For Donald Trump, Lessons From a Brothers Suffering
description: One evening in the 1960s, Donald J. Trump, still in college but eager to make it big, met his older brother, Freddy, for dinner in a Queens apartment complex built by their father.

title: Tips for Uber, From a Backseat Driver
description: The Haggler views Uber with a mix of delight and skepticism, roughly the same way he feels about KFCs Double Down sandwich, that improbable confection of bacon and cheese between two slabs of fried chicken. Part of him is tempted. The other part wonders, Is that even real?

title: Variety: Marching Bands
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Marching Bands puzzles are so much fun and it is beyond me why more people dont do them.

title: Bringing Solar Power to Indias Poor
description: A generation of Indian energy entrepreneurs is out to prove that a fast, clean and economical route to universal electrification is through solar home systems, financed with small bank loans.

title: Electrifying India, With the Sun and Small Loans
description: A few years ago, the hundred or so residents of Paradeshappanamatha, a secluded hamlet in the southern Indian state of Karnataka, gathered along the central pathway between their 22 densely clustered homes, and watched as government workers hoisted a solar-powered streetlamp. As the first display of electricity in the town, it was an object of mild interest, but, being outside, the light didnt help anyone cook or study, and only attracted moths.

title: FASB Proposes to Curb What Companies Must Disclose
description: Accounting rule makers are not generally known as flame-throwers. But with a new proposal, the Financial Accounting Standards Board has lobbed a miniature Molotov cocktail into the usually staid world of audit standards, upsetting investor groups and experts in the field.

title: Bernie Sanders Took In $33 Million in Last Quarter
description: Senator Bernie Sanderss presidential campaign raised more than $33 million in the final three months of 2015, as his wide base of small-amount donors enabled him to come within $4 million of the amount raised by Hillary Clinton, his rival for the Democratic nomination, his campaign said Saturday.

title: Ex-N.F.L. Players New Team Takes On Challenges of A.L.S.
description: Since 2011, Steve Gleason has traveled to Machu Picchu, road-tripped from New Orleans to Alaska and started a nonprofit. He also became a consultant for Microsoft and collaborated on a movie that was accepted by the Sundance Film Festival  even though he gradually lost the ability to talk and became paralyzed except for his eyes.

title: Telecommuting Can Make the Office a Lonely Place, a Study Says
description: Ever since telecommuting became a viable option for a broad spectrum of workers, some companies have offered it as a tempting perk. Why not make workers happier by allowing them to spend more time with their families, avoid long commutes and exert more control over their schedules? Plus, off-site work enables businesses to save money on real estate and hire talented people who live in far-flung locations.

title: A Job That Nourishes the Soul, if Not the Wallet
description: The lawyer was in his mid-20s. He narrowed his eyes, peered at me from behind his cluttered desk and said, So, why are you quitting?

title: Review: A Mexican Taco Dive Bar Thats Anything But
description: The name of Taco Dive Bar, a Peekskill newcomer, suggests an emphasis on drinks, and they are good. The house margaritas are strong and tasty, made with 100 percent agave tequila, a touch of agave syrup and fresh lime, and the tequila-rich bar offers a full menu of reposados and aejos, both varieties of aged tequila, as well as the usual fare.

title: Slow and Steady May Win the Race for the Knicks, Someday
description: Every few years, the Knicks seem to have a new guiding principle, a new mastermind, a new star or a new direction. But if there is a near constant in the never-ending remaking of one of the N.B.A.s original franchises, it is that the team goes at its own pace, and that pace is fairly slow.

title: On Perilous Migrant Trail, Women Often Become Prey to Sexual Abuse
description: BERLIN  One Syrian woman who joined the stream of migrants to Germany was forced to pay down her husbands debt to smugglers by making herself available for sex along the way. Another was beaten unconscious by a Hungarian prison guard after refusing his advances.

title: Review: Casa Margarita, a Cantina Where the Margarita Is Master
description: If margaritas are what you most hanker for when sitting down to a Mexican meal, Casa Margarita, in Southington, Conn., provides plenty of incentive to return again and again. From an impressive selection of more than 80 tequilas and mezcals, the restaurant concocts a bakers dozen of margaritas, including one seasoned with smoked salt, several spiked with rum, bourbon or gin and others muddled with cucumber or watermelon.

title: Its Not Cricket, but Its a Ballgame in Australia
description: PERTH, Australia  More than 10,000 miles from his home in chilly New England, Pawtucket Red Sox Manager Kevin Boles tucked a stopwatch into his sweatshirt pocket and clocked the first pitch of the game between his Perth Heat and the Canberra Cavalry. It was 80 degrees, a typical December day.

title: Sheldon Adelsons Purchase of Las Vegas Paper Seen as a Power Play
description: LAS VEGAS  Two days after Sheldon Adelsons lawyers lost in their attempts to have a judge removed from a contentious lawsuit that threatens his gambling empire, a call went out to the publisher of this citys most prominent newspaper.

title: Charities That Inspire Kids: The League of YES
description: This week, were sharing stories from children, teenagers and families about the charities that inspire them to give time, money and passion. The League of YES, formerly known as the Miracle League of Long Island, inspired Edward and Kelli Kanaley to write.

title: Review: Bank on the Seafood at Fish Urban Dining in Ridgewood
description: It would not be an exaggeration to say that the setting of Fish Urban Dining is striking. Situated in a former Bank of America branch on East Ridgewood Avenue, the restaurant has 30-foot-high ceilings with six huge chandeliers, and its sleek dining room extends into what was the banks vault, complete with a five-ton steel door.

title: Review: Beijing House Is Strictly Chinese, and Proud of It
description: Beijing House in Syosset is the latest example of the resurgence of Chinese restaurants on Long Island. Just a few years ago, nearly every Asian newcomer seemed to be fusion or Japanese. Diners who wanted strictly Chinese fare had to settle on the few, older and more traditional restaurants that had survived all the trends.

title: Panthers Receivers Deliver, Mystifying Critics and Defenses
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Among the more persistent slights of the Carolina Panthers, despite their 14-0 start this season, was the notion that they were the worst undefeated team in N.F.L. history. Perfect teams in the past, critics said, were more impressive, more talented and more worthy of that perfection.

title: Liza Lous Handmade Sea of Sparkling Glass
description: For those who wear glasses, the artist Liza Lou suggests taking them off when viewing her newest work, Color Field. The site-specific installation, a monumental, iridescent grid of colors, is part of the exhibition Liza Lou: Color Field and Solid Grey at the Neuberger Museum of Art. Color Field blankets most of the floor of the Theater Gallery, requiring museumgoers to walk around its periphery. As they do, the piece seems to shimmer and transform: now airy, now dense; patterns emerging and disappearing; tonal relationships continually shifting.

title: Beginning Greek, Again and Again
description: WHEN I moved my Beginning Greek course, last year, from the spring to fall semester, I did not reckon with the impact on my psyche of diminishing daylight. As the days grew shorter, my thoughts about the course grew darker. When the semester concluded, just before the winter solstice, those thoughts had also reached a nadir, giving way to the fear that I had failed, once again, in my 30-year quest to turn bright and eager undergraduates into readers, and lovers, of ancient Greek.

title: How to Cultivate the Art of Serendipity
description: DO some people have a special talent for serendipity? And if so, why?

title: Social Security in an Election Year
description: This election season offers an opportunity to reframe the debate over Social Security. It is necessary, of course, to ensure the programs long-term health beyond 2034, when the system is projected to come up short. But this cant be done by broadly cutting benefits. In fact, theres mounting evidence that Social Security, which has become ever more important in retirement, needs to be expanded.

title: Nora Volkow
description: The psychiatrist and brain researcher Nora Volkow is the director of the National Institute on Drug Abuse.

title: The Smell of Loss
description: LONDON  THE first time it happens is a dark winters afternoon, not quite a year after her death. Im at my desk working, and there it suddenly is: sharp, glassy-green, with that faint, musky undertone that catches at the back of your throat.

title: The Stately Gift Shops of England
description: WHEN I was a child, my parents would take me to visit stately homes. I grew up in a part of England that seemed to be filled with them  Tudor mansions, pseudo-Palladian villas, Gothic piles  and whole Sundays would be spent walking along their corridors or exploring knot gardens with a host of people I didnt know.

title: Is the Drive for Success Making Our Children Sick?
description: STUART SLAVIN, a pediatrician and professor at the Saint Louis University School of Medicine, knows something about the impact of stress. After uncovering alarming rates of anxiety and depression among his medical students, Dr. Slavin and his colleagues remade the program: implementing pass/fail grading in introductory classes, instituting a half-day off every other week, and creating small learning groups to strengthen connections among students. Over the course of six years, the students rates of depression and anxiety dropped considerably.

title: The Value of a High School Diploma
description: High school graduation rates are rising, but are the students ready for college and careers?

title: Marco Rubio Doesnt Add Up
description: MATH was never my strongest subject, so maybe Im just not crunching the numbers right.

title: Whatever Happened to Latino Political Power?
description: DEMOGRAPHY is destiny, or so the saying goes, but Latinos are learning this political season that destiny can take detours.

title: The Pentagons Insubordination on Guantnamo
description: In recent years, Congress and the Pentagon have stood in the way of President Obamas goal of shutting down the prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba. The legislative hurdles have been predictable in a Republican-led Congress that so often opposes Mr. Obamas initiatives reflexively. The stalling at the Defense Department, where officials have used every bureaucratic trick in the book to slow down the release of inmates, is startling, though, and basically amounts to insubordination.

title: Memories of Whistling Past Nuclear Armageddon
description: No one called it terrorism back then, but the angst of day-to-day existence during the Cold War was chillingly recalled with the release last month of the governments top-secret nuclear target list for 1959. Population was the obscenely brief title of target category No. 275  population, as in the citizens of major cities who war planners estimated would necessarily die by the millions.

title: The Dirty Truth About Clean Diesel
description: MONTREAL  AS scandals go, it was a juicy one. Volkswagen, one of the worlds highest grossing automakers, persuaded consumers it had created a new generation of so-called clean diesel cars  until investigators discovered that defeat devices, which activated emissions controls only when the cars were tested, were concealing the fact that its vehicles emitted up to 40 times the permitted levels of pollutants during regular use.

title: A Reign of Glory Ebbs Away for Tom Coughlin and the Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The focus of the New York pro football world on Sunday will be on Buffalo, where the jaunty Jets, in a surprise, chase a playoff berth that might lead the franchise to its first Super Bowl in 46 years.

title: Rock Out for a Good Cause at Light of Day Winterfest
description: The rock n roll troubadour Willie Nile tours so frequently that remembering what city he was in a week ago sometimes poses a challenge. But he always knows where hell be in January.

title: A Beat Unmistakably His Own
description: Sal Cataldi often performs his original music, which ranges in influence from Frank Zappa to Miles Davis to Nick Drake, behind a pair of belly dancers. After he finishes a gig, he heads home to his double-decker barge at Toms Point Marina, in Port Washington. His day job, in Manhattan, has included orchestrating a 50-zombie march across the Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Dale Bumpers, Liberal Stalwart of Arkansas Politics, Dies at 90
description: Dale L. Bumpers, a liberal governor and four-term Democratic senator from Arkansas who came out of retirement in 1999 to make a passionate closing argument defending President Bill Clinton against removal from office in a Senate trial, died on Friday at his home in Little Rock, Ark. He was 90.

title: Sundays Matchup: Eagles at Giants
description: 1 p.m., Fox

title: Sundays Matchup: Jets at Bills
description: 1 p.m., CBS

title: Coachs Fire Returns With a Fresh Attitude
description: HELSINKI, Finland  After his 18-season N.H.L. coaching career ended tumultuously, Ron Wilson needed time to decompress and fall back in love with hockey before he would even consider coaching again. Now, almost four years after the Toronto Maple Leafs fired him, Wilson is back behind the bench, and this time hes having fun.

title: A Mother Marks Her Sons Progress by His Confidence and Clear Speech
description: On Halloween 2014, Delquon Matthews refused to go trick-or-treating, terrified he would fall victim to ghouls and goblins. This past Halloween, dressed as Raphael, one of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, he took to the streets with glee.

title: A Different Note on Race at Yale
description: When Ian Quinn, a professor of music at Yale, attended his first sacred harp hymn-singing session in a stone chapel in Berkeley, Calif., in 2008, he was so impressed with the sessions openness to all comers, and the egalitarian message it sent to music-makers generally, that he decided to push for a similar session when he returned to New Haven.

title: At Insa in Brooklyn, a Mix of Karaoke and Korean Barbecue
description: Though Brooklyn has its share of hybrid operations, like a barbershop where you can get a cocktail, it has suffered from a lack of fine-dining karaoke joints, which have traditionally clustered in Koreatown, in Manhattan in the 30s. But just two weeks ago, the restaurant Insa opened in Gowanus, offering a wide array of Korean barbecue dishes and after-dinner entertainment in one of five karaoke rooms with wacky themes. Owned by Sohui Kim and Ben Schneider, the married couple behind the Good Fork in Red Hook, Insa, which occupies a sprawling former warehouse at 328 Douglass Street, may be the only place in Brooklyn where you can cook cuttlefish and octopus on your table grill and then repair to the Jungle Room for a performance of Hound Dog. Last week, a group of Brooklynites was planning to do precisely that  albeit with a bit more food and without the Elvis.

title: Ancient Rome and Little Italy, in the Bronx
description: Alumni like Denzel Washington, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, Alan Alda and Lana Del Rey know it, but for those who never attended Fordham University, its regal beauty might be a surprise. With its landscaped lawns, well-groomed hedges and Gothic architecture, it was a go-to location for collegiate dramas, including Love Story, Quiz Show and A Beautiful Mind. The reason for plebeians to intrude is the Fordham Museum of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Art, housed in the contemporary William D. Walsh Family Library on the campus in the Bronx. The intimate museum is a bit like Nick Carraway living next door to Jay Gatsby, its more illustrious neighbors being the New York Botanical Garden and the Bronx Zoo.

title: Winter White
description: The photographer Jan Stallers images capture those brief moments when the snow still lies unsullied on New York city streets and park meadows.

title: Jan Stallers Images Show New Yorks Untrammeled Snows of Yesteryear
description: Winters in the city are beautiful only for a moment. A pristine lace of snow falls, but then, within minutes, a taxi  or a dog  comes by to dirty it up.

title: How Aerin Lauder, Cosmetics Scion, Spends Her Sundays
description: Aerin Lauder is a granddaughter of Este Lauder, who started her cosmetics company in 1946 with a mere four products. Ms. Lauder, 45, spent 25 years working for the family business before introducing Aerin, her own beauty, home and luxury lifestyle label, in 2012. Beauty is my heritage, but my passion is home, so I love spending time there, Ms. Lauder said of her Sundays. She lives on Manhattans Upper East Side with her husband of 20 years, Eric Zinterhofer, 44, an investment banker, and their sons, Jack, 16, who attends boarding school, and Will, 15.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Printing a Nickname That May Leave a Stain

title: China Grants Courts Greater Autonomy on Limited Matters
description: BEIJING  This past year has been a time of ups and downs for Judge Jiang Huiling and his 20-year quest for legal reform in China.

title: Uighur Identity Under Siege in China
description: The Chinese government has taken measures to control the countrys 10 million Uighurs, the Turkic-speaking Muslim minority.

title: Xinjiang Seethes Under Chinese Crackdown
description: KASHGAR, China  Families sundered by a wave of detentions. Mosques barred from broadcasting the call to prayer. Restrictions on the movements of laborers that have wreaked havoc on local agriculture. And a battery of ever more intrusive ways to monitor the communications of citizens for possible threats to public security.

title: Foreign-Policy Trips Fill Obamas Schedule for Final Year
description: HONOLULU  With Washington increasingly consumed by the November elections, President Obama will spend much of his final year in office traveling the country and the world.

title: Record of the Year
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  If you thought that 2015 went by quickly, just try this puzzle by David Woolf. Hes going to set a record for making the year go by in a flash.

title: Wildlife Refuge Occupied in Protest of Oregon Ranchers Prison Terms
description: Federal officials said Sunday that no federal wildlife employees were in danger after a group of armed activists and militiamen protesting the prosecution of two ranchers took over a remote federal wildlife refuge in the rural southeastern corner of Oregon over the weekend.

title: Kratom, an Addicts Alternative, Is Found to Be Addictive Itself
description: DELRAY BEACH, Fla.  Three shaky months into recovery from heroin addiction, Dariya Pankova found something to ease her withdrawal. A local nonalcoholic bar sold a brewed beverage that soothed her brain and body much as narcotics had. A perfect solution  before it backfired.

title: Untangling an Accounting Tool and an Ancient Incan Mystery
description: LIMA, Peru  In a dry canyon strewn with the ruins of a long-dead city, archaeologists have made a discovery they hope will help unravel one of the most tenacious mysteries of ancient Peru: how to read the knotted string records, known as khipus, kept by the Incas.

title: For Game of Thrones Readers, New HBO Season May Hold Spoilers
description: The moment that some Game of Thrones fans have long feared may finally be at hand.

title: Donald Trump Shrugs Off Appearance in Terrorist Video
description: Donald J. Trump shrugged off his appearance in a recruitment video posted Friday by the Shabab, an Al Qaeda affiliate, saying there was little he could do about it.

title: Spoleto Festival Celebrates Its 40th Year with Porgy
description: Saturday Night Live recently celebrated its 40th year, as did The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Next up is the Spoleto Festival, which has brought classical and jazz music, theater, and dance to Charleston, S.C. since 1977.

title: Jennifer Spector, Joel Censer
description: Jennifer Frances Spector, a daughter of Ann R. Spector and Larry H. Spector of Philadelphia, was married Dec. 31 to Joel Richard Censer, the son of Jane T. Censer and Jack R. Censer of Fairfax, Va. Peter Sundheim, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at Society Hill Synagogue in Philadelphia.

title: Danielle DAgostino, Ethan Schmidt
description: Danielle Ashley DAgostino, a daughter of Barbara S. DAgostino and Guy R. DAgostino of Fair Lawn, N.J., was married in San Diego on Dec. 31 to Lieut. Ethan Theodore Schmidt, a son of Marsha Weinraub and Stuart M. Schmidt of Philadelphia. Philip Dillon, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina.

title: Jessica Weisz, Caleb Krell
description: Dr. Jessica Rosenbaum Weisz and Caleb Daniel Krell were married Dec. 31 at Whittemore House, the home of the Womans National Democratic Club in Washington. Rabbi Rachel Maimin officiated.

title: Francesca Oliva, Christopher Carozza
description: Francesca Maria Oliva, the daughter of Anne E. Oliva and Jose R. Oliva of Millbrae, Calif., was married Dec. 31 to Christopher Todd Carozza, the son of Linda S. Carozza of Manhattan and the late Raymond J. Carozza. Frank DiLella, a friend of the couple who was appointed a deputy marriage commissioner by San Francisco County, officiated at the Bentley Reserve, an event space in San Francisco.

title: Charles Cerulli, James Conrad
description: Charles Darren Cerulli and James Harold Conrad were married Dec. 31. Alison Gaylin, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the couples home in Saugerties, N.Y.

title: Marianna Koval and Stephen Burgay: Home Is Where the Heart Is
description: Marianna Koval and Stephen Paul Burgay were married Dec. 31 at their home in Boston by Matthew Burgay, the grooms brother, who received permission from the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

title: Jessica Freireich, Geoffrey Mattson
description: Jessica Rachel Freireich and Geoffrey Harris Mattson were married on Dec. 28 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Edwina M. Townes, a staff member of the New York City Clerks office, officiated.

title: Bonnie Lilienfeld, Damon Darlin
description: Bonnie Campbell Lilienfeld and Damon Darlin were married Jan. 1 by Angela C. Parker, a minister with American Marriage Ministries, at the Hotel Monaco in Alexandria, Va.

title: Martha Clippinger, Marshall Price
description: Martha McQuade Clippinger and Marshall Norman Price were married Dec. 31 at Sarah P. Duke Gardens in Durham, N.C. Rabbi Jonathan J. Prinz officiated.

title: Megan Simpson, Adam Collyer
description: Megan Elizabeth Simpson and Adam Edward Collyer were married Jan. 2 at Historic St. Marys Church in Lancaster, Pa. The Rev. Leo M. Goodman III, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Dana Walsh, Devashish Kumar
description: Dana Leigh Walsh, a daughter of Lisa S. Walsh and Daniel F. Walsh of Tinton Falls, N.J., was married Jan. 2 to Devashish Kumar, the son of Kusum Lata and Devendra Kumar of New Delhi. The Rev. Michael Manning performed the ceremony at Holy Cross Roman Catholic Church in Rumson, N.J. On Nov. 26, the couple had a Hindu ceremony at the WelcomHotel Dwarka in New Delhi, with Pandit Shyam Bihari Shukla officiating.

title: Lindsey Schwoeri, Jonathan Jao
description: Lindsey Alexandra Schwoeri and Jonathan Samuel Jao were married Dec. 31 at the River Caf, a restaurant in Brooklyn. Allison Bailey Blais, a friend of the couple who is a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Fabio Monteiro, Mitchell Travers
description: Fabio Malta Monteiro and Mitchell Reid Travers were married Dec. 31 at the Yale Club in New York. Stephanie Umoh, a friend of the couple who became a minister of American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated.

title: Veronica Brooks, Kevin Uy
description: Veronica Dublin Brooks and Kevin Jonathan Uy were married Dec. 31 at the University of Virginia Alumni Hall in Charlottesville. Pastor Robert F. Brown, a Baptist minister, officiated.

title: Sarah Baker, Scott Adams
description: Sarah Diane Alexandra Baker and Scott Andrew Adams were married Dec. 30 at Vernick Food & Drink, a restaurant in Philadelphia. Capt. Mary Ellison Baars OMalley, an Army chaplain and Presbyterian minister, officiated.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: When you have all the marbles, you can make the calls. And he has all the marbles.

description: NEW YORK

title: New Julian Fellowes Project, Belgravia, Treads New Digital Ground
description: There are few literary mediums that Julian Fellowes has not dabbled in.

title: West Ham United Finds Its Sweep Spot
description: LONDON  Money cannot buy what makes an English club intrinsic to the community in which it plays.

title: Ubers No-Holds-Barred Expansion Strategy Fizzles in Germany
description: FRANKFURT  Uber is rapidly expanding its ride-hailing operations across the globe. But here in this city of 690,000  less than the population of San Francisco, Ubers hometown  the company recently did something unusual: It retreated.

title: Many See I.R.S. Penalties as More Affordable Than Insurance
description: WASHINGTON  Clint Murphy let the deadline for getting health insurance by the new year pass without a second thought.

title: Please, Read My Book (Unless Youre a Friend of My Sons)
description: Im incredibly proud of the book I wrote. I hope it has some of the things I love when I read other peoples work. I want readers to find the story funny and sad; honest and relatable. My characters fall in and out of love, they try things they never thought they would and things they will never admit to. And some of these things are dirty. This did not have to be a dirty book. At several points, I could have faded to black, like a 1950s Hollywood movie. No, this didnt need to be a dirty book. It just gets to be.

title: Saudi Arabia Cuts Ties With Iran Amid Fallout From Clerics Execution
description: BAGHDAD  Saudi Arabia cut diplomatic ties with Iran on Sunday and gave Iranian diplomats 48 hours to leave the kingdom, marking a swift escalation in a strategic and sectarian rivalry that underpins conflicts across the Middle East.
