title: 2 Israelis Charged in Deadly Attack on Palestinian Family in West Bank
description: JERUSALEM  Two young Israelis were charged on Sunday in connection with a deadly arson attack in July on a Palestinian home in the West Bank, a case that Israeli leaders condemned as Jewish terrorism and that enraged Palestinians.

title: Obama to Hold Town Hall Meeting on Gun Violence
description: HONOLULU  Renewing his emphasis on the need for more gun restrictions, President Obama will participate in a live televised town-hall-style meeting on Thursday to discuss gun violence in the United States, according to the White House.

title: Cartoon: Heng on Japans Apology to Comfort Women
description: Shinzo Abe, Japans prime minister, supported an apology and payment for the Korean comfort women who were forced to serve as sex slaves for Japans Imperial Army.

title: Ex-Suffolk County Police Chiefs Arrest Comes Amid a Broader Federal Inquiry
description: Even today the crime is remembered, with a shudder, across Long Island.

title: Bernie Sanders, Needing Early Lift, Builds Iowa Ground Operation
description: DES MOINES  This fall the words of a Hillary Clinton backer were posted like a locker-room taunt on the wall at Bernie Sanderss Iowa headquarters: There is no Sanders organization.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Dance Theater of Harlem to Present New Works by Dianne McIntyre and Elena Kunikova
description: Premieres by Dianne McIntyre and Elena Kunikova, two stylistically different but longtime fixtures of New York dance, are in store for Dance Theater of Harlems coming engagement at City Center.

title: A Chinese Almanac That Takes a Wary View of the New Year
description: Joanna C. Lee waved her little red book for 2016 in the face of a man she had sent its predecessors, the little red books from 2015, 2014, 2013 and maybe even 2012. For a moment the man thought about 2015, a year bookended by the Charlie Hebdo attack in January and the San Bernardino assault in December, and said 2016 had to be a better year.

title: Its All in the Script
description: Written by PETE DOCTER, MEG LeFAUVE AND JOSH COOLEY

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Its a tough choice: Return to Downton Abbey or visit the United States-Mexico border in Seth MacFarlanes new animated comedy Bordertown. Jerry Seinfeld and President Obama take turns driving  and presidential candidates vie for the Oval Office seat on the Sunday morning news shows.

title: G.O.P. Candidates Warn of Obamas Actions on Guns
description: As President Obama moves closer to using executive action to tighten regulations on gun purchases, the Republican presidential candidates hoping to succeed him are accusing him of abusing power and promising to reverse suchmeasures if elected.

title: A Standout Year for Deals, in Volume and Complexity
description: Of all the ways to describe mergers and acquisitions in 2015, plain vanilla is not one of them.

title: Boston Globe Employees Help Deliver Paper on Sunday
description: Operating on the mantra that the news never sleeps, about 200 employees of The Boston Globe stayed up all night to help deliver newspapers to subscribers who were angry about widespread delivery problems last week.

title: How Do Sunni and Shia Islam Differ?
description: Saudi Arabias execution of the Shiite cleric Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr could escalate tensions in the Muslim world even further. In the Shiite theocracy Iran, the supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei,  said on Sunday that Saudi Arabia, which is ruled by a Sunni monarchy, would face divine vengeance for the killing of the outspoken cleric, which was part of a mass execution of 47 men. Sheikh Nimr had advocated for greater political rights for Shiites in Saudi Arabia and surrounding countries. Saudi Arabia had accused him of inciting violence against the state.

title: Armed Group Vows to Continue Occupation at Oregon Refuge
description: BURNS, Ore.  The protesters arrived in this old lumber town to support a 73-year-old rancher and his son who had been sentenced to prison for setting fires that spread to federal lands. It was billed as a peaceful demonstration, but after Amazing Grace was sung and hugs were exchanged, a small, armed contingent declared outside a supermarket that it was taking a stand and asked who wanted to join.

title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens Continues Box-Office Reign
description: Like one of its impossibly huge Imperial destroyers, Star Wars: The Force Awakens continued to cast a long shadow on the North American box office, collecting $88.3 million in its third weekend, as Quentin Tarantinos The Hateful Eight sold fewer tickets than some analysts expected as it expanded nationwide.

title: Dark Funds May Bode Ill in 2016 Election
description: The 2016 presidential campaign seems certain to feature not only more money than any since Watergate but also more money from undisclosed donors since the days when black satchels of illicit cash were passed around.

title: Hunt for Gunmen Continues at Air Base Near India-Pakistan Border
description: NEW DELHI  A shootout between Indian security forces and armed gunmen stretched into its second day on Sunday at the Pathankot air force base in Punjab, near Indias border with Pakistan. At least seven Indian personnel and at least four gunmen have been killed in the fighting so far, officials said.

title: Cuomo Orders That Homeless Be Taken to Shelter in Freezing Weather
description: As an arctic front barreled toward the New York City region, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo signed an executive order on Sunday requiring local governments across the state to take homeless people off the streets to shelters in freezing temperatures.

title: State Focus and Infusion of Funding Buoy Gun Control Advocates
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va.  With President Obama poised to act on his own authority to try to stem gun violence, his gun control allies are using big-money donors and shifting tactics to try to remake the political landscape in the national gun debate, challenging and sometimes even besting the powerful National Rifle Association in state-by-state battles.

title: Worst Comes to Worst for Jets as Playoff Spot Slips Away
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y.  The opportunity the Jets had been awaiting for a year arrived Sunday, and they seized it as if grasping at a tornado. The game spun away from them, kicking up everything they wanted, everything they craved, until it was gone  all of it.

title: Steelers Clinch Playoff Spot, but Could Have Achieved More
description: The Pittsburgh Steelers needed every victory they could muster in an up-and-down, injury-plagued season. In the end, they also needed some help.

title: Giants Finish Quietly, and Tom Coughlin Has Little to Say About Future
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The tailgate parties in the parking lots around MetLife Stadium were more subdued Sunday. The music was quieter and the congregations less boisterous. Once the game began, as many as a fourth of the stadium seats were empty.

title: Bringing U.S. Presidential Debates to a Chinese Audience
description: BEIJING  From his graduate student dormitory in the southern city of Guangzhou, Yin Hao works late into the night with an online network of about half a dozen other volunteer translators. Their task: to post the American presidential debates, with Chinese subtitles.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Jan. 4
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: The Breaks, a TV Movie on VH1, Examines the Year Hip-Hop Found Its Flow
description: In 1990, hip-hop was a subculture striving to breach the mainstream without losing its soul. The music had matured at breakneck speed in the 1980s. Rappers pushed past boasts and chants with storytelling, complex wordplay and sociopolitical consciousness, as producers vastly extended the sound-collage possibilities of sampling. Yo! MTV Raps, which started in 1988, was expanding the hip-hop audience beyond its urban core, and MC Hammer had a worldwide hit with U Cant Touch This. But at the same time the crack epidemic was closing down the New York City clubs that had been hip-hop laboratories, while radio stations still resisted hip-hops genuine innovators and major labels considered hip-hop a novelty that would run its course. Everyone involved was inventing the music and the business on the spot.

title: Alex Brightman Rides a School of Rock Wave
description: What kinds of backstage pleasures does a newly minted heavy-metal star enjoy these days? At the Winter Garden Theater, Alex Brightman, the lead actor of Broadways School of Rock, has furnished his diminutive dressing room with such not-so-hedonistic gratifications as a steam-inhaler mask, tasteful throw pillows and a collection of year-end award-season movies on DVD.

title: In Fiddler on the Roof, a Title Role Shared Onstage and Off
description: Pop quiz: Who plays the title role in the new Broadway revival of Fiddler on the Roof?

title: A Healthy Diets Main Ingredients? Best Guesses
description: First doctor: This morning for breakfast he requested something called wheat germ, organic honey and tigers milk.

title: Review: Superstore and Telenovela Play It Safe on NBC
description: Two new shows on NBC that address the shortage of Hispanic characters on television play the demographic game about as safely as it can be played, putting well-known Latina stars in nonthreatening, nonchallenging comedies. But progress is progress, and one of the shows, Superstore, is pretty good. The other, Telenovela, is just dumb.

title: Acts of Bravery
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Well, if you are going to break into solving crossword puzzles as a New Years resolution, this is a pretty decent one with which to do it. This puzzle by Herre Schouwerwou is mostly easy to solve and the plethora of theme material is clued easily, so it wont slow you down. Not only that, but you just know that any puzzle that debuts PINK FLOYD, POPPIN FRESH and PILLOW FIGHTS is going to be fun.

title: Laurie Anderson Puts on a Concert for Dogs in Times Square
description: Eight years ago, Laurie Anderson recalled in an interview, she was backstage with the cellist Yo-Yo Ma at a Rhode Island School of Design graduation ceremony when she turned to him and said, I have this fantasy where I look out, and the whole audience is dogs. He replied: Are you kidding? I have the same fantasy.

title: Review: In The Cabaret of Plants, Richard Mabey Demonstrates Their Richness
description: Imagine a picture of a jungle. There are the familiar palms and vines, and down in a corner a monkey sitting on a branch. Ask a number of people, What is this a picture of? and its a good bet that most will say it shows a monkey.

title: Arron Afflalo, With 38 Points, Carries Knicks Past Hawks
description: To start 2016, Arron Afflalo switched to a new pair of black Air Jordans as his on-court sneaker of choice.

title: In Israeli City of Haifa, a Liberal Arab Culture Blossoms
description: HAIFA, Israel  At Elika, a bar in the Hadar neighborhood of this hilly port city, a 30-something psychodramatist rolled a cigarette and sipped coffee with her father, a well-known actor in Israel. The bartender poured tall beers for two women who wandered in for an afternoon pint. Nearby, a 22-year-old woman with a partly shaved head and colorful tattoos sat alone, working on her laptop.

title: Whod Steal Lincolns Hand? Art Theft Baffles Illinois Museum
description: KANKAKEE, Ill.  Someone stole Abraham Lincolns hand.

title: Auto Sales, the Feds December Meeting and Employment Numbers
description: The first Monday of the new year will mark the first day of extended trading hours for Chinas currency, the renminbi. The move, announced last Wednesday by Chinas central bank, is the most recent in a number of steps taken over the last few years by Beijing to make the renminbi more international.

title: Closing the Farm-to-Table Gap in Alaska
description: ANCHORAGE  Across much of Alaska at this time of the year, as winter tightens its grip with darkness and cold, finding a nice crisp head of lettuce at an affordable price can be like prospecting for gold. Where the farm-to-table distance is measured in thousands of miles, the odds get long.

title: New Elections Likely in Catalonia After Separatist Leader Is Rebuffed
description: MADRID  Catalonia is likely to convene new regional elections after a far-left party there voted Sunday against allowing Artur Mas to continue as leader of the region and its secessionist movement.

title: Under New Leader, Discovery Channels Brand Reboot Shows Promise
description: LOS ANGELES  Hollywood loves a comeback story. And right now, there is perhaps none better than Rich Ross and Discovery.

title: Girl Scout Cookie Sales Go Digital, With Help From Visa and Dell
description: Now that the Girl Scouts have taken their cookies digital, companies are following them online.

title: Raine Group Finds Deals for Clients, and Itself
description: The Raine Group may not be as instantly recognizable as Wall Street fixtures like Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley.

title: Calculated Candor Inside Obamas Off-the-Record Briefings
description: WASHINGTON  Hours after President Obama announced in a 2014 speech that he was escalating his campaign against Islamic extremists, a number of prominent columnists suggested they knew exactly what he was thinking.

title: Accordion Stores Departure Signals End of Manhattans Music Row
description: For decades, musicians from around the world flocked to a segment of West 48th Street in Manhattan that was known as Music Row. Both sides of the block, just off Times Square, were lined with shops that sold and repaired guitars, drums, keyboards and other instruments.

title: Peyton Manning Returns and Leads Broncos to No. 1 Seed in A.F.C.
description: DENVER  For a little over a half, Peyton Manning stood stoutly on the Broncos sideline, not once appearing to favor his left foot, with a torn plantar fascia that had caused him to miss six games. Manning looked fine, which caused a woolen blanket of disbelief to settle over Sports Authority Field at Mile High during the Broncos regular-season finale against the San Diego Chargers.

title: A Homey Hangout for Broadway Stars Closes After 14 Years
description: Trent Rhoton was drinking a pint and a shot at the bar of Angus Cafe Bistro on Sunday afternoon when a friend wandered over to greet him. Its the end of an era, said the friend, John McMahon, as they clinked glasses.

title: Economists Take Aim at Wealth Inequality
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When pundits and presidential candidates talk about inequality and the tiny sliver of the population whose fortunes have soared, they often drop names like Warren Buffett, Bill Gates, Sheldon Adelson and Mark Zuckerberg.

title: ForTom Coughlin, a Tribute; for Pat Shurmur, an Audition
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Giants had one big edge over the Philadelphia Eagles entering Sundays season finale. Their head coach, Tom Coughlin, had been in the job for 12 years. Pat Shurmur, Philadelphias interim coach, had been in his job for all of five days.

title: Hocine At-Ahmed, a Pro-Democracy Algerian Leader, Dies at 89
description: ALGIERS  Hocine At-Ahmed, a leader of the Algerian war of independence against France that began in 1954 and a major opponent of the Algerian governments dominated by the military since then, died on Dec. 23 in Lausanne, Switzerland. He was 89.

title: John Holm, 72, Dies; Opened Linguistics to Creole and Pidgin Tongues
description: John Holm, a linguist who helped bring the study of creole and pidgin languages into the scholarly mainstream, died on Dec. 28 in Azeito, Portugal. He was 72.

title: Jets High Hopes End in Same Place: Out of the Playoffs
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y.  Im not sure what I expected from the Jets on Sunday.

title: Depression Leaves a Man Adrift, but a Stranger Helps Him Find Purpose
description: Thomas Torres was told he would not amount to much even before he learned at age 13 that he had schizophrenia. His brother called him slow, classmates called him retarded, and he was teased relentlessly.

title: Cowboys Star on the Rise in a Dallas Suburb
description: FRISCO, Tex.  Jerry Jones does not do small. He took the money-losing Dallas Cowboys and turned them into the most valuable team in America. He built AT&T Stadium, the biggest venue in the N.F.L. With the help of lucrative licensing and sponsorship deals, the Cowboys generated $620 million last year, the highest revenue in the league, according to Forbes.

title: Downton Abbey Season 6, Episode 1: Warts and All
description: This recap contains spoilers for Sundays episode of Downton Abbey.

title: Womans Death in Queens Is Citys First Homicide of 2016
description: A 19-year-old woman was killed on New Years Day, discovered face down in her bedroom in Queens, the police said; her death is the first homicide in New York City in 2016.

title: A Soccer Team, Its Foreign Owner and Local Discontent
description: THE HAGUE  A new Chinese owner arrived at the Dutch soccer club ADO Den Haag in early 2014, promising multimillion-dollar investments and better days ahead. Fans of the club liked the sound of that.

title: What We Know About the Standoff in Oregon
description: Here is what is known about the armed group occupying an Oregon wildlife refuge, and their beliefs and demands.

title: Bronx Man Dies in Apartment Fire
description: James Tutein was always around for his neighbors. He was the one who would hold the door open when they were carrying packages or make room under his umbrella if it was raining outside.

title: In N.F.L., Black Monday Was Sort of Gray
description: By the standard of the past two N.F.L. seasons, when bullying and domestic violence scandals swamped the league, this season has been tame. But that does not mean the league has operated smoothly.

title: N.B.A. Games of the Week: Grizzlies at Blazers; Grizzlies at Thunder
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose essential games to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Two Found Dead in Sheepshead Bay
description: Two bodies were discovered in a blood-spattered apartment in Brooklyn on Sunday night, the police said.

title: Library of Congress Anoints Graphic Novelist as Ambassador for Young Peoples Literature
description: Gene Luen Yang often mines his life for his graphic novels. He has explored being a second-generation American, and harnessed his love of computer programming. Starting this week, he will have a whole new experience to draw on.

title: Fidelity Switches to Visa for Credit Card Branding
description: Fidelity, one of the few credit card issuers that reward cardholders with a lucrative 2 percent in cash back on every dollar they spend, is making changes to its program.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | agglomeration
description: agglomeration  \-gl-m-ra-shn\  noun

title: The Best of Week 17 in the N.F.L.
description: Texans defensive end J. J. Watt was back to his old self, leading a dominant defense that helped the Texans rout the Jaguars and win their first A.F.C. South title since 2012. Watt, playing without a cast for the first time since breaking his left hand on Dec. 9, had three sacks, forced a fumble and recovered another. Watt leads the N.F.L. with 17  sacks. He joined Reggie White as the only players in N.F.L. history to have three 15-sack seasons in their first five years in the league.

title: What to Watch Monday
description: The roses have been plucked and the limo lined up for a night of first impressions on the 20th-season premiere of The Bachelor. Second glances let love bloom in Pride and Prejudice. (The one starring Keira Knightley. Sorry, Colin Firth fans.)

title: The End of Lawyers?  Not So Fast.
description: Lawyers have been described as the canaries in the coal mine in the face of a wave of automation now beginning to displace highly skilled white-collar workers.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: People have talked about returning land to the people for a long time. Finally, someone is making an effort in that direction.

title: No Corrections: January 4, 2016
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Earthquake Strikes Northeast India, Killing at Least 6
description: NEW DELHI  A powerful earthquake of magnitude 6.7 rocked northeastern India before dawn on Monday, sending tremors through neighboring countries and leaving at least six people dead and scores injured.

title: The Growth of Contemporary African Photography at LagosPhoto
description: A new book, Africa Under the Prism, captures the kaleidoscope of random energy, disorder and color on the continent, from work shown during the arts festivals first five years.

title: The Growth of Contemporary African Photography at LagosPhoto
description: Lagos is an African megacity humming with chaotic energy. Potholed roads and even the citys superhighways are crowded with traffic, overloaded vendors, earsplitting noise, choking pollution, piercing colors and powerful smells. Extreme wealth is set against a backdrop of grinding poverty, hope battles despair, daily acts of kindness and generosity are offset by cruelty, greed and corruption, and creativity is inspired by necessity because of the citys broken infrastructure and the looming threat of ruin. Between these extremes, and usually to the background drone of a generator, exist the rich and textured lives of some 20 million people.

title: A Culture Glorifying Victimhood?
description: To the Editor:

title: N.Y.P.D. Shooting Statistics
description: To the Editor:

title: G.O.P. and Birth Control
description: To the Editor:

title: A Lack of Compassion for the Dying in Prison
description: To the Editor:

title: Whats Going On in Our Prisons?
description: Leonard Stricklands  barbaric and unnecessary death at the hands of prison guards at the Clinton Correctional Facility in upstate New York highlights the need for independent oversight of the states prisons. His beating in 2010, the details of which have only recently come to light, is the latest in a long list of instances of brutality toward inmates in New Yorks prison system.

title: Elections Have Consequences
description: You have to be seriously geeky to get excited when the Internal Revenue Service releases a new batch of statistics. Well, Im a big geek; like quite a few other people who work on policy issues, I was eagerly awaiting the I.R.S.s tax tables for 2013, which were released last week.

title: We Need a New Green Revolution
description: DESPITE the four-year drought that has parched California and led to mandatory restrictions on water use, farmers there have kept feeding the country. California produces more of 66 different food crops than any other state, $54 billion of food annually.

title: Connecticuts Second-Chance Society
description: One day last month, Dannel Malloy, the governor of Connecticut, was sitting with a small group of inmates at a New Haven jail, where he had gone to announce a new job-training program for prisoners nearing their release date.

title: Trump Did Not Break Politics
description: Politics, were often told, is governed by rules  basic principles that explain not just whats going to happen, but what rational candidates and parties can be expected to do. Donald J. Trump seems to casually defy all these rules  insulting Senator John McCain, a veteran; disparaging women; and building a rhetorical wall to keep out the single demographic group that his party seems to need for its survival, Latinos.

title: Mexico Stubbornly Resists Accountability
description: When he campaigned for the presidency of Mexico, Enrique Pea Nieto used the title of his book, Mexico, the Great Hope, to explain the record he hoped to achieve and the nation he hoped to build. More than three years into his presidency, it seems more likely that he will be remembered not as the transformational leader Mexicans thought they had elected, but as a politician who skirted accountability at every turn.

title: Frances Diminished Liberties
description: Since President Franois Hollande of France declared a state of emergency after the terrorist attacks in Paris on Nov. 13, more than 2,700 police raids have been carried out. They have yielded very little that can be linked to terrorism, but have traumatized citizens and left havoc in their wake.

title: Accepting the Past, Facing the Future
description: How do we relate to our past, and what might this tell us about how to relate to our future? One of the most provocative approaches to this question comes from Friedrich Nietzsche, whose doctrine of the eternal return asks this: What if some day or night a demon were to steal after you into your loneliest loneliness and say to you: This life as you now live it and have lived it, you will have to live once more and innumerable times more? To ask myself the question of the eternal return is to wonder about the worth of what I have done, to inquire whether it would stand the test of being done innumerable times again.

title: The Defender, by Ethan Michaeli
description: Franklin Roosevelt held an average of 84 presidential news conferences a year  14 times the number given by Ronald Reagan and three to four times the output of Bill Clinton, George W. Bush or Barack Obama. Roosevelt charmed the White House press corps to within an inch of its life, leaked big stories to favored reporters and still made time for writers from obscure trade journals and others who were technically ineligible for press credentials. He nevertheless shunned the Negro press, shutting it out of the White House press corps until the last of his 12 years in office. By avoiding fire-breathing newspapers like The Chicago Defender, The Baltimore Afro-American and The Pittsburgh Courier, Roosevelt insulated himself from questions about what African-Americans saw as the burning issue of the 1940s: the governments decision to embrace segregation in the military. Separating military men and women  and even the plasma in the wartime blood bank  by race, the government ratified racial apartheid in the South and introduced Jim Crow segregation into parts of the country where it had been unknown.

title: Elizabeth Strouts My Name Is Lucy Barton
description: One of this nations most abiding myths is that social origins dont matter. Each of us is Gatsby, or can be, with the potential to be reinvented and obliterate the past. This is nowhere more true than in New York City, where, surrounded by millions, each person supposedly stands upon his or her own merits. If we reach a sophisticated urban consensus on how to speak, how to dress, how to live, then who will know what lies beneath the surface? Who will know what any one of us might really mean by words like home, childhood or love?

title: 1966: African-American Becomes Mayor in Ohio

title: Saudi Arabias Barbaric Executions
description: The execution of the popular Shiite cleric Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr and 46 other prisoners on Saturday was about the worst way Saudi Arabia could have started what promises to be a grim and tumultuous year in the kingdom and across the Middle East. It is hard to imagine that the Sunni rulers of the kingdom were not aware of the sectarian passions the killings would unleash around the region. They may even have counted on the fierce reaction in Iran and elsewhere as a distraction from economic problems at home and to silence dissenters. Americas longstanding alliance with the House of Saud is no reason for the Obama administration to do anything less than clearly condemn this foolhardy and dangerous course with a more robust response than its call Monday for both sides to exercise restraint.

title: A Warm and Rejuvenating Winter Tea Recipe
description: One of coziest things about winter is curling up with a hot drink, says Alissa Wagner, the co-owner and chef, along with Sabrina De Sousa, behind the chic, health-conscious Chinatown restaurant Dimes. In her mug for the new year: rejuvenating goji berry and ginger tea, which will be added to the menu this month. Its packed with ingredients to boost the immune system and even has maca powder for a blast of energy  a crucial bonus to help get through those long winter days, Wagner notes. She suggests doubling the simple recipe and keeping a jar in the fridge so the tea can be warmed up at a moments notice.

title: Review: Killing Fields, on Discovery, Examines a Cold Case
description: To the bubbling mini-genre of long-form true crime  Serial, The Jinx, Making a Murderer  add Killing Fields, a new series starting on Tuesday on Discovery. At six episodes, or just over four hours minus commercials, its at the shorter end of the spectrum when it comes to season-long examinations of a single criminal case.

title: Fliers Go Their Own Way With Airline Meals
description: Business travelers have plenty to think about when they fly. Once wheels come up, laptops land on the tray table. But diving into spreadsheets, business plans and email requires sustenance.

title: Death Sentences Surge, Even as More Countries Drop Capital Punishment
description: UNITED NATIONS  The death penalty is steadily receding toward the dustbin of history worldwide, with fewer than two dozen countries relying on it at all as a form of punishment.

title: G.M.s Investment in Lyft Hedges Against a Future With Fewer Car Owners
description: General Motors is hedging against incursions from Silicon Valley. The Detroit carmakers $500 million stake in Lyft is a way into the growing ride-hailing industry and brings another partner in the development of autonomous vehicles. The deal taps into potential changes in car ownership and usage  and even employment.

title: Hezbollah Attacks Israeli Military Vehicles
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Hezbollah attacked Israeli military vehicles on Monday in a disputed border territory, an assault the militant group said was in response to Israels killing last month of Samir Kuntar, a key Hezbollah operative in Syria.

title: Review: In Julian Barness Keeping an Eye Open, Paintings Worth a Thousand Words
description: Gustave Flaubert  the subject of Julian Barness magical novel-biography-meditation, Flauberts Parrot  argued that great paintings required no words of explanation. But as Mr. Barnes writes in Keeping an Eye Open, an illuminating new collection of essays on art, we remain incorrigibly verbal creatures who love to explain things  put us in front of a picture and we chatter, each in our different way.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: Billybobs Beef Brisket and the N.S.A.
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These are the places, faces and culinary selections of 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Activision Buys Major League Gaming to Broaden Role in E-Sports
description: Activision Blizzard, the publisher of Call of Duty and other hit video game franchises, has acquired the assets of Major League Gaming, an early organizer of professional video game competitions.

title: Pictures of the Day: Afghanistan and Elsewhere
description: Afghanistan and Elsewhere: Pictures of the Day

title: Jan. 4, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Afghanistan, Egypt, Iran and India.

title: Checking Out Pusha Ts Closet
description: Pusha T, 38, who is based in Norfolk, Va., has been involved in nearly every major facet of the hip-hop world, beginning with his early days as half of the duo Clipse. He recently signed on as president of Kanye Wests record label G.O.O.D. Music, and his latest album, King Push: Darkest Before Dawn  the Prelude, was released on Dec. 18. Here, five favorites from his diverse closet.

title: Behind a Shopping Center in New Jersey, Signs of a Mass Extinction
description: MANTUA TOWNSHIP, N.J.  Behind a Lowes home improvement store here, scientists are methodically scraping and sifting through a quarry pit that may contain unique insights to the mass extinction that eliminated the dinosaurs.

description: Hillary Clinton, to a voter in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, on Monday when asked about Donald J. Trumps attacks

title: Review: Exploring the Work of Delia Derbyshire, an Unsung (but Often Heard) Pioneer
description: The theme from the BBC science fiction series Dr. Who is instantly recognizable. Less well known are the contributions of Delia Derbyshire, the pioneering British composer who arranged Ron Grainers score for that show into its more famous electronic incarnation.

title: Reviews: Classical Music Albums
description: Alisa Weilerstein, cello; Inon Barnatan, piano

title: Gianandrea Noseda to Lead National Symphony Orchestra
description: Gianandrea Noseda, an Italian conductor whose international career has recently taken off, has accepted his first major post with an American orchestra. He will be the next music director of the National Symphony Orchestra in Washington, the orchestra announced on Monday.

title: Broadway Has a Record-Breaking Week
description: If Broadway needs a New Years resolution for 2016, it might try ending the year the way it did in 2015.

title: Jim McDermott, Democrat of Washington, Wont Seek Re-election to the House
description: Representative Jim McDermott, Democrat of Washington and one of the most liberal members of the House, announced Monday that he would retire at the end of the year, ending a tumultuous 14-term congressional career.

title: On David Bowies Blackstar, Turning to Jazz for Inspiration
description: A lot of questions arose when David Bowie unveiled Blackstar, the 10-minute title track of his new album, as a music video in November. What was the meaning of the clips sci-fi surrealism? What had inspired its ominous lyrics? And, perhaps more practically, who were these musicians helping to shape its gnarly but limber style?

description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

description: The most popular stories of the year from the Real Estate section.

title: The Migrant Effort to Cross the English Channel
description: From Calais, France, migrants fleeing Syrias conflict hop onto trucks or moving trains in a desperate  and often futile  effort to reach England.

title: Birth Control Without Seeing a Doctor: Oregon Now, More States Later
description: As of Jan. 1, women in Oregon can get contraceptives directly from a pharmacy, without having to go to a doctor first. Here are answers to a few questions about the new law.

title: Thom Browne Brings a Designers Eye toCooper Hewitt Show
description: Silver-plated shoes in pairs on the floor. Spectral figures, dressed in white, lying on gurneys in an operating theater. Row after row of identically clad schoolboys, standing at attention behind identical desks. For years, the fashion designer Thom Browne has treated industry insiders to presentations that look more like art installations than like a typical runway show. This March, when the exhibition Thom Browne Selects opens at the Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum on Fifth Avenue, ordinary civilians will finally get to experience Mr. Brownes theatrical sensibility firsthand.

title: Report Finds Juvenile Program Failed to Reduce Robberies, but Police Are Expanding It
description: For years, the New York Police Department has tried to stop robberies before they might happen by intervening in the lives of some young offenders. The approach was heralded by the author Malcolm Gladwell in a best-selling 2013 book as an innovative way to shake up the criminal justice process. Elected leaders gave $2 million over the last two years in support.

title: Yahoo Shuts Down Its Video Portal
description: Yahoos chief executive, Marissa Mayer, spent much of the last two years telling Wall Street that video was a cornerstone of her turnaround strategy.

title: Iran, Emerging From Sanctions, Faces Crisis After Saudi Arabia Embassy Attack
description: TEHRAN  When a Saudi state executioner beheaded the prominent Shiite dissident Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr on Saturday, the Shiite theocracy in Iran took it as a deliberate provocation by its regional rival and dusted off its favored playbook, unleashing hard-liner anger on the streets.

title: Donald Trump Finally Buys TV Ads, and Lots of Them
description: After months of waiting, Donald J. Trump has followed through on his promise to advertise, and advertise big, in early voting states in January.

title: Bipartisan Criminal Justice Overhaul Is Haunted by Willie Horton
description: WASHINGTON  Conservatives and liberals embrace it. Some of the most influential members of the House and Senate on both the Republican and Democratic sides are pushing it. Advocacy groups across the ideological spectrum are promoting it as well.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: A Daughters Tantrum, and a Lesson
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These are the places, faces and culinary selections of 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Saudi Arabias Dangerous Sectarian Game
description: WHEN Saudi Arabia executed the Shiite cleric and political dissident Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr on Saturday, the countrys leaders were aware that doing so would upset their longtime rivals in Iran. In fact, the royal court in Riyadh was probably counting on it. It got what it wanted. The deterioration of relations has been precipitous: Protesters in Tehran sacked Saudi Arabias embassy; in retaliation, Saudi Arabia severed diplomatic ties. More severe fallout could follow  possibly even war.

title: G.M. Chief Mary Barra Is Named Chairwoman, Affirming Her Leadership
description: DETROIT  In a move that consolidates power at the top of the nations largest automaker, General Motors said on Monday that its chief executive, Mary Barra, had also been named chairwoman of its board.

title: Streets, if Not the Air, Clear Out as Delhi Tests Car Restrictions
description: NEW DELHI  Traffic was flowing smoothly Monday morning on Outer Ring Road in South Delhi, usually jammed at that hour by subway construction and cars. An upscale market was dotted with free parking spaces. Monkeys ambled down one street in the colonial heart of the capital, easily dodging the few cars.

title: Libya: Islamic State Attacks Oil Port
description: Islamic State militants attempted to capture an oil port along Libyas coast early Monday, in fighting that left at least seven people dead and set fire to a storage tank of crude oil, according to witnesses. The militants began their assault on the Sidra oil port with suicide bomb attacks on a checkpoint, but by Monday afternoon, the offensive had been beaten back by guards. The Islamic State in Libya is regarded as one of the most dangerous affiliates of the extremist group outside of Iraq and Syria, and has gained strength in Libya by capitalizing on infighting among various armed factions. The attack on Monday was at least the second by the Islamic State on the Sidra port, and showed the determination of the group to expand its territory beyond its stronghold in the western Libyan town of Surt.

title: Illinois: City Lawyer Quits After Judge Finds Misconduct
description: A lawyer for the City of Chicago resigned Monday as a federal judge found that he and a colleague had committed misconduct by waiting to turn over key evidence in a civil case about a police shooting. The lawyer, Jordan Marsh, resigned on the same day Judge Edmond E. Chang of United States District Court threw out a jurys verdict that cleared the officers of wrongdoing and ordered Chicago to pay the plaintiffs legal bills. Thomas Aumann, the other lawyer, resigned in August. The ruling involves a 2011 traffic stop that ended in the fatal shooting of Darius Pinex by officers who said radio traffic had led them to pull over his vehicle. The radio recordings were not turned over to lawyers for Mr. Pinexs estate until the trial had started, and Judge Chang said Mr. Marsh intentionally concealed them. Also Monday, the acting chief of Chicagos much-criticized Independent Police Review Authority announced staffing changes that she said were designed to build trust in the agency, which has rarely faulted officers for shootings.

title: Confidence Games
description: OK, one more round in this models versus instincts go-round. As Robert Waldmann points out over at Brads place, theres a bit of bait-and-switch going on at this point; my Mundell-Fleming claim  that countries in a liquidity trap borrowing in their own currencies shouldnt fear Greek-style confidence crises  is being transmuted into the claim that confidence never matters, and the Blanchard result that is being cited has little bearing on that assertion.

title: Carmakers Set to Grab Spotlight at International CES
description: DETROIT  When Mark Fields attended his first consumer electronics trade show in 2007 as head of Ford Motors Americas division, the auto industry was hardly noticed among the thousands of tech companies gathered in Las Vegas.

title: Woody Hochswender, Fashion Reporter, Dies at 64
description: Woody Hochswender, a reporter who covered the fashion industry for The New York Times and later wrote popular books on practicing Buddhism in everyday life, as he did, died on Thursday at his home in Sharon, Conn. He was 64.

title: Ex-Officer Freed Pending Trial in Killing of Walter Scott
description: The former South Carolina police officer charged with murder in the April death of Walter L. Scott, an unarmed black man, was released on bondon Monday, nine months after the shooting that prompted a national outcry.

title: Shiite Cleric Gained in Status as a Rivalry Deepened
description: BAGHDAD  In 2008, an American diplomat traveled to a poor village in eastern Saudi Arabia to visit a thin, bearded preacher who was known for criticizing the government and wrote him off as a secondary player in local politics, according to a report on the visit released by WikiLeaks.

title: Arrests Begin for Migrants Who Lost Asylum Cases
description: Federal immigration enforcement agents last weekend arrested 121 migrants for deportation, Homeland Security Secretary Jeh Johnson said on Monday, starting a wave of removals of parents and children, mainly from Central America, who came during the border surge in 2014 and failed to win asylum in immigration courts.

title: Puerto Rico Defaults on Debt Payments
description: Puerto Rico defaulted on about $174 million of debt payments on Monday, as planned, stripping cash away from its lower-ranked creditors so that higher-ranked creditors could be paid in full.

title: Questions Over Cuomos Order on Homelessness
description: ALBANY  As the start of a sweeping statewide push to involuntarily remove homeless people from frigid streets loomed on Monday, questions about the practicality and impact of the plan continued to dog its architect, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo.

title: A Growing Conflict in Wall St. Buyouts
description: It goes by a rather innocuous-sounding name, the sort of phrase you might breeze past in a loan document: designated lender counsel.

title: Lion Point Capital to Nominate 2 Candidates to Ally Financials Board
description: A year after repaying taxpayers for its bailout during the financial crisis, Ally Financial, the onetime auto-lending subsidiary of General Motors, is facing new investor pressure. This time, though, it is from an upstart hedge fund, demanding two board seats and a potential sale of the company.

title: Jason Wingreen, Actor Who Voiced Boba Fett, Dies at 95
description: Jason Wingreen, a character actor best known for playing the genial bartender Harry on the hit sitcom All in the Family and for voicing the bounty hunter Boba Fett in the film The Empire Strikes Back, died on Dec. 25 at his home in Los Angeles. He was 95.

title: Ryan Fitzpatrick Laments After the Jets Big Loss, but Reflects on Returning
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Ryan Fitzpatricks eyes fluttered open around 4:30 a.m. on Monday. His weekly reflex kicked in, for the final time this season.

title: U.S. in a Bind as Saudi Actions Test a Durable Alliance
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Monday confronted the fundamental contradiction in its increasingly tense relationship with Saudi Arabia. It could not bring itself, at least in public, to condemn the execution of a dissident cleric who challenged the royal family, for fear of undermining the fragile Saudi leadership that it desperately needs in fighting the Islamic State and ending the conflict in Syria.

title: Vilmos Zsigmond, Cinematographer, Dies at 85; Gave Hollywood Films a New Look
description: Vilmos Zsigmond, a Hungarian-born cinematographer who helped shape the look of American movies in the 1970s, 80s and beyond, among other things lending a hyper-real glow to the arrival of space aliens and winning an Oscar for Steven Spielbergs 1977 science fiction extravaganza Close Encounters of the Third Kind, died on Friday at his home in Big Sur, Calif. He was 85.

title: Republicans Turn Up Heat in Iowa, Setting Aside Good for Bad and Ugly
description: BURLINGTON, Iowa  Four weeks before Iowa voters start whittling down the sprawling and fractious Republican presidential field, the nomination fight is taking on a decidedly dark tenor, with candidates warning of a country left weakened by an administration that would prefer to apologize for America rather than keep it safe.

title: The President Acts on Gun Violence
description: In the hope of combating Americas intolerable levels of gun violence, with Congress refusing to pass hugely popular gun-safety measures, President Obama is issuing a modest, limited set of executive actions on guns.

title: Robert Stigwood, Impresario of Rock, Film and Stage, Is Dead at 81
description: Robert Stigwood, the Australian-born producer, personal manager and music executive whose blockbuster hits with the Bee Gees and work on the films Saturday Night Fever and Grease made him one of the most successful impresarios of the 1970s, died on Monday. He was 81.

title: Bill Clinton, the Subdued Spouse, Makes His Campaign Debut
description: EXETER, N.H.  Eight years after aggressively defending his wife during her first presidential campaign, Bill Clinton was unusually understated and subdued on Monday during his first solo swing back in New Hampshire for Hillary Clinton, restraining himself even in the face of taunts from Donald J. Trump.

title: A Family Reunites and Embraces a Fresh Set of Priorities
description: More than once when Brianna Lebron was a teenager, arguments with her mother would turn into physical fights. Ms. Lebron would leave their Harlem apartment, stay with friends or family for a week or two, and return after tensions had cooled.

title: At Golf Outing, Furs and Friendship Trump Cold
description: With freezing temperatures finally settling into New York City on Monday, it was perfect weather for the annual Mink Open golf tournament on Staten Island.

title: Rangers Look to Reverse Slide as Seasons Midpoint Nears
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The Rangers, who have reached the Eastern Conference finals three of the past four seasons, seem to be at a crossroads.

description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  T anyone? When we last saw Jim Holland, he had made his New York Times debut with an equally alphabetic theme.

title: Architects Modernist Legacy Crosses the Hudson
description: JERSEY CITY  When Charles Gwathmey died in the summer of 2009, New York City lost one of its most prolific and influential architects. Adherents of the strict rationalism of Modernist design, Mr. Gwathmey and his partner, Robert Siegel, had still managed to infuse their clean lines and grand geometries with warmth and humanity in more than 400 projects spanning four decades, including the expansion of the Guggenheim Museum and a new building for the United States Mission to the United Nations.

title: Success Academy Principal Who Created Got to Go List Takes Leave
description: The principal at a Success Academy charter school who created a Got to Go list of difficult students is taking a personal leave of absence, a Success Academy spokeswoman said on Monday.

description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These are the places, faces and culinary selections of 2016s first proper bus tour.

description: Bundled in blankets and enduring the frigid temperatures that arrived in New York City this week, homeless people said Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo was missing the point with his executive order directing authorities to pull them off the streets when temperatures fall to 32 degrees or below.

title: Bill Clinton Is to Campaign in Iowa
description: Bill Clinton, just off his first solo events of his wifes campaign with two rallies in New Hampshire on Monday, will head to Iowa on Thursday.

description: HONG KONG  The fears among investors that sent shares tumbling on the first trading day of the year appeared to have abated, with global markets relatively calm on Tuesday.

description: Before the Nets 103-94 loss to the Celtics on Monday at Barclays Center, Coach Lionel Hollins spoke morbidly about the season-ending injury incurred by the starting point guard Jarrett Jack last Saturday in Boston.

description: If youre looking for another true-crime series but already binge-watched Making a Murderer, Discoverys Killing Fields begins on Tuesday night. title: The Age of Small Terror
description: On New Years Eve some friends and family members had a drink at a bar in Tel Aviv. The next day a gunman shot up the place, killing two people and wounding at least five. When I heard about the shooting I was horrified, of course, but there was no special emotion caused by the proximity 16 hours before.

title: Time to Talk Robots
description: Manufacturing  that is, the business of making stuff  has changed significantly over the past half-century. Perhaps youve noticed. While Americas share of industry has constricted, with fewer people needed to perform the same amount of work as in the past, its not quite time to start eulogizing.

title: An Investment Strategy to Save the Planet
description: If one of your New Years resolutions was to do your part against climate change, keep reading. Now you can  with your investments.

title: How You Can Measure a Senator as a Presidential Contender
description: Money is an easy measurement of business success. Life and death are clear signs of achievement for a neurosurgeon. Governors are rated by the laws they get passed and their states prosperity. Voters might use those yardsticks to choose between presidential candidates.

title: Dalian Wanda of China May Buy Majority Stake in Legendary Entertainment
description: LOS ANGELES  The Chinese conglomerate Dalian Wanda Group, which already owns the AMC chain of multiplex cinemas, is poised to buy a majority stake in a Hollywood production company that makes blockbuster-style movies, giving the politically powerful company with close ties to the Communist Partys ruling elite a foothold in the heart of Americas entertainment industry.

description: The French telecommunications giant Orange said on Tuesday that it was in talks to acquire Bouygues Telecom, a local rival, in the latest effort to consolidate Europes highly fragmented cellphone market.

title: What Are the Sounds That Make Up the Background Noise in Your Life?
description: Try the following: Take a break from whatever youre doing, and listen closely to the sounds around you for a few minutes. What do you hear? Are you surprised by anything you hear? If you get a chance, try the same exercise someplace else, perhaps in your backyard, kitchen or classroom, or on your fire escape or street corner.

title: How to Deal With Flight Delays and Other Travel Headaches
description: I flew out of New York City during Christmas week, when the temperature was in the 70s. I landed in southern New Mexico, hours before a giant snowstorm.

title: Makeup That Can Withstand a Workout
description: For Eve Kessner, an instructor at SoulCycle studios in Brooklyn Heights and Union Square, getting ready for the gym each morning goes beyond brushing her teeth and pulling on a pair of leggings. Before heading out to classes that often start before 8 a.m., she applies Eyeko Sport Waterproof Mascara and a face luminizer by RMS Beauty or Josie Maran Cosmetics.

description: With the restaurant abandoning its famed dining rooms, high-profile regulars are flocking there. How do they dress for the Park Avenue version of a last meal?

description: Salons dedicated to mens grooming are usually tricked out with leather chairs and badger-bristle shaving brushes. An assistant trying to make a guy comfortable may even proffer a cigar.

title: The Time I Got Stabbed in the Neck
description: On Sunday, Nov. 29, I was returning from Thanksgiving travel with my family. Our plane touched down at La Guardia around 7 p.m., and we arrived at our home in the Fort Greene area of Brooklyn at 8. Shortly thereafter, I went out to get some groceries.

title: Animals, Auctions and Death: Outside Albany, Some Lawmakers Serve Different Interests
description: Once upon a time in Albany, or so the Capitols origin story goes, the men who governed New York State from the Legislatures vaulted chambers were farmers: citizen-legislators who laid down their plows for a few months every year to represent their fellows before returning home to make their living from the land.

title: The Migrant Effort to Cross the English Channel
description: Niklas Meltio has spent much of the last four years covering Syrias complex and dangerous civil war and its spillover into Iraq, hewing to the front lines and living under frequent bombardment. While that proximity lets him get to know his subjects, it can also lead to close calls, which is why last year he took a break and returned to his home in Finland.

description: The New York Times/Kaiser Family Foundation survey on medical bills is based on interviewing conducted Aug. 28 through Sept. 28 with 2,575 adults nationwide from ages 18 to 64.

description: Here is the surest way to enjoy the peace of mind that comes with having health insurance: Dont get sick.

title: Gulf States Guarding Their Interests in Saudi-Iran Rift
description: CAIRO  For all the diplomatic dominoes that have fallen across the Middle East in recent days, with ambassadors from different countries flying home as a result of the explosive rift between Saudi Arabia and Iran, the map of allegiances has not significantly altered.

title: Samantha Hunts Mr. Splitfoot
description: I wonder if the best stories are those hardest to categorize. Bildungsroman or romance? Picaresque or metafiction? Stories change shape as one reads them. Understandings are loaded in, revised, discarded. Then, when the book is closed, a kind of spirit image remains in the mind, a revenant. Sometimes a reader knows that a lasting connection has been made only by the intensity of the effect, the memory and aftershock, after the book is back on the shelf.

description: PUPUKEA, Hawaii  The first step in making an omelet: Catch a chicken, advises the novelist and travel writer Paul Theroux.

description: A GROWING CONFLICT IN WALL ST. BUYOUTS | A new, insidious relationship has developed among private equity firms, the banks that lend them billions to fund their buyouts and the law firms that advise on these deals,Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column.

title: Jeb Bush Begins Swing Through New Hampshire to Pursue Elusive Momentum
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Jeb Bush has quipped that New Hampshire is his second home, and in the first full week of 2016, he is decamping to this winter abode for a three-day, seven-event trip through the state.

title: David Cameron Allows Cabinet to Pick Sides on E.U. Exit Referendum
description: LONDON  Acknowledging bitter divisions within his Conservative Party and his cabinet over Britains role in Europe, Prime Minister David Cameron told Parliament on Tuesday that he would allow government ministers to campaign for or against remaining in the European Union in a referendum that could take place as early as this summer.

title: Bernie Sanders, Speaking in New York, Is Expected to Call for Financial Overhauls
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont often bemoans the influence of millionaires and billionaires in America, and on Tuesday, he will be just a couple of miles from Wall Street to make his case for a major overhaul of the financial system.

title: The Cultural Contours of Saving a Life
description: A decade ago, while I was still a fledgling doctor in training, I worked in a tiny rural hospital in a village in West Africa. By our American standards, the word hospital would have been a fictional exaggeration of this barest-bones facility, but here, on the Liberia-Sierra Leone border, it was the only place that offered people access to Western medicine, should they seek it. The next hospital over  bigger but not much shinier  was at least a six-hour drive away in a four-wheel-drive all-terrain vehicle on a good day, without any rains melting the treacherous dirt roads. About two weeks after I arrived there, I was caring for a young woman who was seriously ill. At that point, I was bold enough to take charge medically, but still barely able to see the outline of the big picture  the cultural contours within which I should have been operating.

title: A Talk With Idris Elba
description: The British actor Idris Elba is up for two Golden Globe awards this year, for the BBC series Luther and the Netflix film Beasts of No Nation. He says his role in Beasts is his darkest yet.

title: Idris Elba on Fatherhood and Hollywood Stereotypes
description: It was a fantastic year for Idris Elba, and not just because he sailed through a dust-up regarding his suitability to play James Bond  a role he has yet to be cast in  with aplomb.

title: The Empty Threat of Boots on the Ground
description: Since the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, the United States has fought two very long, very costly and, in the end, not very successful wars. Barack Obama was elected president in no small part because he promised to bind up the nations wounds and withdraw its troops. Yet the enemy, in the forms of Al Qaeda and the Islamic State, remains and must be confronted, in part, the Obama administration believes, by the American military. The president has struggled to find a language that distinguishes between force, which most Americans want, and war, which they dont. He and his team have therefore promised, vowed, pledged that, come what may, they will not use boots on the ground.

title: Poll Watch: Americans Show Selective Objection to a Presidents Executive Actions
description: President Obama is expected to announce executive actions on Tuesday expanding background check requirements at gun shows and online.

title: To Catch a Rapist
description: A dull, frigid winter morning. Overhead, the sky was locked in gray, only occasionally releasing an ashen, icy flake or two, more like iron shavings than snow. On the third floor of the New Haven police station, Detective Kris Cuddy had just finished interviewing the mother of a young rape victim. After escorting the woman downstairs, she was returning to her office in the Special Victims Unit. Her square-heeled boots made a quick, hard sound as she left the elevators, a tock-tock-tock that could be heard above the ringing phones and cubicle chatter. The detective had an Irish face  blue-eyed, pale-skinned, puckish, her coppery brown hair shorn close at the sides into a fauxhawk. She was one of only four investigators in the S.V.U., and she had 32 cases open at the moment. But during interviews with victims or their family members, she never displayed any sign of the pressure she was under. Her manner was steady and reassuring. So were here to discuss an incident that happened recently, she would begin, making only a vague allusion to the matter at hand before stepping back to allow people to tell the story in their own way. She would offer water, offer a tissue. Let them talk, circling back later to gather more details. At the end of interviews with victims, she almost always told them they were brave.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Dec. 29, 2015-Jan. 4, 2016
description: Happy New Year! We hope youve taken our Year-End News Quiz for 2015, because many of the stories we covered in those 52 questions will continue to resonate in 2016 as well.

title: 1891: Battles With Indians
description: NEW YORK  There was a severe engagement last night [Jan. 4] between the United States forces under the command of General Miles and the Sioux, near Gordon, Nebraska. The fighting was desperate, and the Hotchkiss guns were freely used by the military. The details of the engagement are not to hand. There is a rumor that General Miles was killed in the battle, but this is not credited at army headquarters. According to a telegram received late to-day at Chicago, a battle between the troops and the Indians was fought to-day near the Pine Ridge Agency. Hundreds of Indians were killed, and the troops also suffered heavily. The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 6, 1891

title: Civilian Deaths in Yemen Spike Despite Cease-Fire, U.N. Says

title: 1941: Mexico Reports New Nazi Plot
description: MEXICO CITY  Nazi agents were reported on high authority today [Jan. 5] to be making progress in a newly conceived plan to disrupt preparedness activities in their hemisphere by urging Mexico and other American republics to try to collect huge cash demands from the Roosevelt administration before committing themselves further on continental defense unity. These German agents, with headquarters in Mexico City and Madrid, were said already to have split the Cabinet of President Avila Camacho into two camps. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 6, 1941

title: Bitter Debate Over Nuclear Power Simmers in Rural South Korea
description: YEONGDEOK, South Korea  Visitors to this idyllic stretch of coast marvel at the landscapes of emerald sea crashing against steep bluffs and undulating hills quilted with green pines. They stop at seaside restaurants with cheerful red signs advertising the local delicacy, known as bamboo crab, and watch trawlers sail back to picturesque fishing villages.

title: How Moby Begins Every Single Morning
description: My biggest hope for the new year is that we, collectively, stop doing things that we all know dont work, says Moby. We all know which things are bad and not working, but we keep doing them anyway, which is, simply, stupid. One thing that does work for the musician: his daily breakfast smoothie, which hes adapted over eight years from a simple banana, kale and berry recipe. It has evolved to include specialty supplements like omega-rich DHA oil and protein-packed chia seeds; now, he says, Its like drinking a giant antioxidant battery every morning. A version is available on the menu at Little Pine, the new all-day dining vegan restaurant Moby recently opened in Silver Lake, Los Angeles  though, he admits, The rest of the Little Pine menu is a little less virtuous.

Included in the mix was a former patient I recognized immediately, though I did not remember his injuries. That I remembered his face, but not the fact that he was missing both arms and a leg at the groin, caught me totally off guard.

title: Gerard and Kelly to Perform at Schindler House  and Glass House

Beginning this weekend, the dancers and visual artists Brennan Gerard and Ryan Kelly will use two of the countrys most beloved 20th-century houses  the Schindler House, designed by Rudolph M. Schindler in West Hollywood, Calif., and the Glass House, Philip Johnsons masterpiece in New Canaan, Conn.  as walk-in texts for a performance work focusing on what they describe as themes of queer intimacy and domestic space within the legacies of modernist architecture.

title: Thai Street Food, Now at the Lucky Bee on the Lower East Side
description: The Lucky Bee Rupert Noffs and his business partner, the chef Matty Bennett, are taking a farm-to-table approach to Thai street food. Its easy for Mr. Bennett, who was at the Fat Radish, a locavore spot. The setting, dominated by a big bar, is splashed with vibrant pink. The pink was my idea, said Mr. Noffs, and I think it works. In the front, snacks like salt-and-pepper chicken wings and oysters with nahm jim chile sauce are dispensed. The menu has crisp pork belly with palm sugar caramel and chile vinegar; grilled squid with sunchokes, coconut and shaved bottarga; and a green curry of vegetables with pickled mustard greens. The cocktail list features drinks made with honey: A dollar of each drink sold goes to the New York City Beekeepers Association. The partners hope to raise bees on the roof: 252 Broome Street (Ludlow Street), 917-262-0329, luckybeenyc.com.

His message was one of restoration, a how-to on building a winner from the ashes of a team that had lost 12 of 16 games the previous season.

title: Deadly Snits

We have people engaging in armed insurrection over the vast oppression of being asked to pay a small fee when grazing their animals on public land; surely an important part of the story is the fact that the perpetrators know that they wont face the consequences that would follow if, you know, some nonwhite group pulled a similar stunt  and theyre be Fox News heroes forever after.

title: Review: Jennifer Lopez as a Conflicted Cop in Shades of Blue

Jennifer Lopez plays a dirty Brooklyn detective on a crew full of them, and the choices that confront her and others arent between right and wrong, but between damage-control options.

title: Better Health Care Access in Kentucky and Arkansas, Study Says
description: WASHINGTON  Low-income adults in Kentucky and Arkansas have had similar improvements in access to medical care under the Affordable Care Act, a new study found, despite the two states differing approaches to expanding Medicaid.

title: Richard Sapper, Designer of Sleek Housewares, Dies at 83
description: Richard Sapper, an industrial designer whose sleek, precision-engineered prototypes spawned the Alessi espresso maker, the Tizio lamp and the IBM ThinkPad, died on Dec. 31 in Milan. He was 83.

title: Review: Living on Paper, Seven Decades of Letters From Iris Murdoch
description: Every letter, in its way, is a love letter, at least every personal one. The letters of the British novelist and philosopher Iris Murdoch contained more yearning than most. She was, to borrow the title of one of her novels, a kind of sacred and profane love machine.

title: Saudi Executions Seen as Sending Message to All Dissenters
description: CAIRO  Officials in Saudi Arabia have said that the executions of 47 prisoners on Saturday were a long overdue reckoning for militants, including accused Qaeda members who were said to be recruiters, propagandists or bomb makers who helped carry out deadly attacks in the kingdom more than a decade ago.

title: Kecia Lewis to Step Into Role of Mother Courage at Classic Stage Company
description: Mother Courage is motherless no more.

title: American Dance Institute to Move to Catskill, N.Y.
description: It has already transformed itself from a dance school in Rockville, Md., to an organization with ambition to present contemporary dance and help choreographers develop new works. Now American Dance Institute is moving north: It announced on Tuesday that it would build a new headquarters at a former lumberyard in Catskill, N.Y.

title: Help Sought to Close 18-Minute Gap in San Bernardino Inquiry
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif.  Federal investigators announced Tuesday that they had accounted for almost all the four hours between the time that a husband-and-wife terrorist team killed 14 people at a holiday party here last month and the time that they died in a bloody police shootout  all except for an 18-minute window.

title: A Cold Remedy You Can Make at Home
description: In retrospect, I think I was a little ahead of my time, says Barbara Close, the founder and CEO of the healing-arts brand Naturopathica. When she opened her East Hampton store in 1995, people would stop in and take these herbal tinctures and say, Ooh, these taste bitter  they didnt really understand how to use them, she recalls. Back then, she says, the path to health was: You get sick, you hope to get an appointment with your doctor, you get a prescription and it treats your symptoms. Now, wellness has become mainstream. And the biggest change, according to Close, may be how we approach it: Its the periods in between doctor appointments that are important. What are the rituals of self-care that you can do preventatively to keep your health and vitality at its best? She offers answers aplenty at Naturopathica Chelsea, her second brick-and-mortar location.

title: 13 Hours Gives Benghazi Attack Cinematic Treatment
description: LOS ANGELES  Michael Bay, known for four Transformers films and an action-romance about the Pearl Harbor attack, made a promise to Mitchell Zuckoff on beginning a screen version of the story Mr. Zuckoff told in his book 13 Hours: The Inside Account of What Really Happened in Benghazi.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: A Fawning Joke for a Key Supporter
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These are the places, faces and culinary selections of 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: A Conversation With Thomas J. DeRosa
description: Mr. DeRosa, 58, is chief executive of Welltower, a real estate investment trust based in Toledo, Ohio, that specializes in the health care sector, which includes senior living facilities. A longtime company director, he became C.E.O. in April 2014. Previously Mr. DeRosa served as a vice chairman and chief financial officer of the Rouse Company before its merger with General Growth Properties.

title: Bernie Sanders Attacks Hillary Clinton Over Regulating Wall Street
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont in a fiery speech on Tuesday laid out his plan to break up too big to fail commercial banks and pointedly attacked Hillary Clinton for taking speaking fees from the financial industry and, in his view, not going far enough in her plan to regulate Wall Street.
