description: MIAMI  A Florida Atlantic University professor who suggested in blog postings and radio interviews that the 2012 massacre of children at Sandy Hook Elementary and other mass shootings were a hoax designed by the Obama administration to boost support for gun control was fired Tuesday.

title: Saudis Applaud a Tougher Line Against Tehran
description: In recent days, Saudi Arabias decision to execute a prominent Shiite dissident has been assailed around the world as a rash act of provocation, inflaming sectarian tensions across the Middle East.

title: Oil Prices Decline More Than 5 Percent as Stockpiles Increase
description: HOUSTON  Oil prices plunged again on Wednesday by more than 5 percent as investors paid more attention to signs that global stockpiles are growing than to increasing instability in the Middle East and North Africa.

title: A Flawless Swing, but 3 Votes Shy of a Perfect Ballot
description: Consider the honor roll of Baseball Hall of Famers who were not elected unanimously.

title: A Star Who Gave the Mets a Jolt, and Not Just at the Plate
description: It was spring training 1998, a time when the Yankees were ascendant and the Mets were a dull portrait of mediocrity. Todd Hundley, the Mets biggest star, was out with an injury, and three little-known catchers  Todd Pratt, Vance Wilson and Tim Spehr  were competing to replace him.

title: Comparisons Dont Support North Koreas Claims of a Hydrogen Bomb, Experts Say
description: Military experts said comparisons of underground nuclear tests over the past several decades suggested that the North Koreans were exaggerating their claim on Wednesday to have successfully detonated their first hydrogen bomb.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: Missing Teeth and Knife-Fighters
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These arethe places, faces and culinary selectionsof 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Morgan Stanley Management Shuffle Puts a C.E.O. on the Market
description: Morgan Stanleys latest management revamp puts a chief executive on the market.

title: Drought and Heat Took a Heavy Toll on Crops, Study Finds
description: Droughts and heat waves wiped out nearly a tenth of the rice, wheat, corn and other cereal crops in countries hit by extreme weather disasters between 1964 and 2007, according to a new study.

title: Mark-Viverito, New York Council Speaker, Pays Fine to End Conflict Case
description: The speaker of the New York City Council, Melissa Mark-Viverito, agreed to a financial settlement with the citys Conflicts of Interest Board over free consulting services she improperly accepted from a lobbying group during her 2013 campaign to gain her current position, the board announced on Wednesday.

title: Stock Markets Shudder After Chinese Stock Plunge Forces a Trading Halt
description: HONG KONG  The market turmoil in China spread around the world on Thursday, as global investors grew more anxious about the countrys currency and the health of its economy.

title: Alan S. Gordon, Colorful Union Leader in Opera and Ballet, Dies at 70
description: Alan S. Gordon, a colorful union leader who represented singers, dancers and stage managers at many of the nations leading opera and ballet companies  and who sometimes used unconventional, theatrical tactics on their behalf  died on Friday in New Hampshire. He was 70.

title: Marco Rubio Courts Christian Conservatives With Ad
description: As Senator Marco Rubio tries to expand his popularity in Iowa, he is speaking directly to the states influential Christian population in a new television commercial, saying he shares their desire to accept the free gift of salvation offered to us by Jesus Christ.

title: Short-Term Retail Location
description: Administrivial Solving Alert! While the Thursday, Jan. 7 puzzle by Andrew J. Ries can be solved successfully electronically, solvers might find it easier solving on paper.

title: More Resolute in New Year, Knicks Finally Solve Heat
description: MIAMI  Erik Spoelstra, the coach of the Miami Heat, let out a polite but dismissive chuckle Wednesday afternoon when he was asked what his team had done to be so effective against Carmelo Anthony and the Knicks in the teams previous two meetings this season.

title: Donald Trump, With Overbooked Crowd, to Tread on Bernie Sanderss Turf
description: The police in Burlington, Vt., warned that Donald J. Trumps campaign has confirmed that 6,500 people plan to attend a rally on Thursday in an arena that seats only about 1,400.

title: Jeb Bush Finds a Few Words of Praise for Donald Trump
description: MEREDITH, N.H.  The man in the Patriots cap stood, thanked Jeb Bush for coming, and then asked a question that prompted boos from the crowd: He said he was leaning toward voting for Donald J. Trump and asked why Mr. Bush had called him a jerk.

title: New York Legislative Session Opens in Albany With Eye on Ethics
description: ALBANY  The opening of New York States 239th legislative session looked and sounded very much as it has in years gone by, what with its ceremonial prayers, promises of hard work and bipartisan cooperation, and all manner of handshakes, hugs and how-ya-beens.

title: Donald Trump to Speak at Liberty University
description: Donald J. Trump will speak at a Jan. 18 convocation at Liberty University, the conservative school that has been a stop for several presidential candidates this campaign cycle, and the place where Senator Ted Cruz kicked off his campaign.

title: Battling His Depression, a Caregiver Enlists a Companion
description: Harry Solomon and Lucky stood in their studio apartment, bound by a leash they did not need.

title: A Carjacking in Brooklyn Leaves a Trail of Mayhem
description: Stay off the Belt, the woman thought in silence as the man driving her vehicle approached the busy Belt Parkway.

title: Man Accused of Impersonating a War Hero Has a History of Forgery
description: It did not take long for Jeremy Wilson to return to a life of forgery and confidence tricks after he was released from federal prison in November, investigators said.

title: Guatemala Arrests Former Military Officers in Connection With Massacres
description: MEXICO CITY  The Guatemalan authorities on Wednesday arrested 18 former military officers on charges related to massacres and disappearances during the 1980s, the bloodiest period of the countrys 36-year civil war.

title: Joe Biden Says He Regrets Not Running Again for President
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. often sounded conflicted last year while deciding whether to run for president. Nearly three months after saying he would not begin a campaign, Mr. Biden said his decision still tugged him in two directions.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | furtive
description: furtive  \fr-tiv\  adjective

title: Seahawks Marshawn Lynch Returns to Practice
What to Watch Thursday
description: Life got you down? Check out NBCs Seeso, a new streaming site dedicated to laughter 24/7. On the tube, Jane Lynch and Jennifer Lopez do a good-cop, bad-cop kind of thing. And the Tatums shake their booties in Lip Sync Battle.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: 12,697 Steps
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These arethe places, faces and culinary selectionsof 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: North Korea is just thumbing its nose at China. Thats got to produce a reaction.

title: Corrections: January 7, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Clinton, Sanders and OMalley Save Sharpest Jabs for G.O.P. in Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS  Using strikingly similar pitches, Hillary Clinton, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont and former Gov. Martin OMalley of Maryland tried their best on Wednesday to persuade a room full of Nevada Democrats to support their bids to be the next Democratic presidential nominee.

title: Gun Control and White Terror
description: On Tuesday, in an emotionally charged speech, President Obama announced a series of relatively modest executive orders to aid in preventing guns from getting into the wrong hands.

title: How Donald Trump Loses
description: Donald Trump isnt going to be the Republican nominee.

title: Cornering the Anger Market
description: Lets talk for a minute about Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump.

title: The Supreme Court and a Life Barely Lived
description: IT wasnt surprising that a man named Joshua Braam, who died in November in Muskego, Wis., at the age of 36, didnt make the engaging lives they lived lists that appeared at years end. The life he lived was constricted in the extreme. A series of savage beatings by his father, who had obtained custody after a divorce and whose history of abuse had been reported to the local child welfare authorities to no avail, left Joshua comatose and permanently brain damaged at the age of 4. At 12, he was adopted by Richard and Ginger Braam, who cared for him for the rest of his life.

title: Guns, Tears and Republicans
description: President Obama shed tears on Tuesday as he called for new gun safety measures, and some critics perceived weakness or wimpishness. Really? On the contrary, we should all be in tears that 225,000 Americans have already died of gun violence in his seven years in office.

title: Beggars Banquet in Congress
description: Talk to members of Congress as they retire after years in the Capitol and a disturbing thread runs through their adieus that has nothing to do with serving the people  yes, the people. Far from it: Its more about how happy they are at having no further obligation to romance the donors  yes, the campaign donors. Departing lawmakers can hardly contain their joy at leaving behind the jobs awful necessity of darting from the Capitol day in and day out to cubbyholed precincts down the block known as call rooms, where they beg shamelessly for campaign money to keep their political careers going.

title: Why Doctors Shouldnt Be Punished for Giving Prostate Tests
description: BOTH of us have raised serious questions about prostate cancer screening. Nevertheless, we hope Medicare chooses not to pursue a strategy of penalizing doctors for ordering prostate-specific antigen, or PSA, tests.

title: North Korea Flexes Its Nuclear Muscle
description: There was a predictable ritual to the worlds reaction to North Koreas latest nuclear test, its fourth. Vigorous condemnation, followed by promises never to accept the North as a nuclear weapons state, followed by chest-thumping demands for more sanctions. The problem is that while the North Korean threat is real and growing, the United States and its partners have failed miserably at finding an effective solution.

title: The Latest Sales Tax Controversy: Tampons
description: Two members of Californias state assembly are trying to give residents a tax break with a bill that would exempt tampons and sanitary napkins from the states sales tax.

title: Paid Family Leave Gets More Attention, but Workers Still Struggle
description: This year is shaping up to be a big one for paid family leave.

title: News Qs | Behind a Shopping Center in New Jersey, Signs of a Mass Extinction
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Behind a Shopping Center in New Jersey, Signs of a Mass Extinction.

title: A Bachelor Pad for a BrooklynComedian
description: Yannis Pappas, Brooklyn born and bred, grew up in a two-family brick rowhouse in Park Slope. He left New York for four years at American University in Washington, D.C.

title: Before the Oscars, Some Films Face the Truth Test
description: LOS ANGELES  About 45 minutes into The Big Short, Adam McKays true story  or so it says on the billboards  of Wall Street greed, the actor Finn Wittrock turns to the camera and confesses, O.K., so this part isnt totally accurate.

title: Meet the New York Bachelors Who Yearn for Something More
description: Jean-Marc Choffel, a 42-year-old Frenchman who splits his time between New York and Miami, was mulling over his plans for the night. Nothing seemed appealing. He had worked late into the evening, and a December rain was coming down hard.

title: A Couple Find Instant Attraction, Longtime Love, Then Discord
description: In Unhitched, longtime couples tell the stories of their relationships, from romance to vows to divorce to life afterward.

title: First Medical Marijuana Dispensaries in New York Open
description: ALBANY  New York joined the ranks of nearly half the states on Thursday in allowing the use of medical marijuana with the opening of eight dispensaries statewide, serving a variety of tinctures, concentrates, vapors and other forms of the drug.

title: New York Prison Guards Instigated Attack on Inmate and Engineered Cover-Up
description: By the initial accounts, the assault at the Greene Correctional Facility, a state prison about 25 miles south of Albany, seemed fairly straightforward.

title: Marco Rubios Shiny Boots Stir Up the Presidential Race
description: This week boots on the ground took on a whole new meaning in politics.

title: From Rios Slums, a Judo Champion Is Mining Olympic Gold
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  On a narrow, steep street about five miles from where the Olympic judo competition will take place in August, near a pile of unused bricks alongside Rua Agostinho Gama, 31 concrete steps hugged the outside of a building, rose and turned out of sight.

title: Kamoinges Half-Century of African-American Photography
description: In the early 1960s, when African-American photographers were keenly aware of their isolation in a field dominated by white men, two collectives held a joint meeting. The result of that encounter was a decision to merge and form a more robust group they called Kamoinge, which in Kenyas Kikuyu language means a group of people acting together.

title: What Advice Would You Give to Your Mom, Dad or Guardian on How to Be a Better Parent?
description: KJ DellAntonia, editor of the Motherlode blog, has a tradition of writing about her New Years parenting resolutions at the start of each January. Yes, parenting isnt something anybody is perfect at. It takes work, patience and practice.

title: 1919: Theodore Roosevelt Dies
description: Ninety-seven years ago, Theodore Roosevelt died on Jan. 6, 1919, at the age of 61. He was the 26th president of the United States, serving from 1901 to 1909. Below, an excerpt from the obituary in the European edition of The New York Herald:

title: Rethinking Weight Loss and the Reasons Were Always Hungry
description: David Ludwig often uses an analogy when he talks about weight loss: Human beings are not toaster ovens. If we were, then the types of calories we consumed would not matter, and calorie counting would be the most effective way to lose weight.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Global Stocks, Charlie Hebdo, Netflix
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Ramadi, Reclaimed by Iraq, Is in Ruins After ISIS Fight
description: RAMADI, Iraq  As his armored vehicle bounced along a dirt track carved through the ruins of this recently reconquered city on Wednesday, Gen. Ali Jameel, an Iraqi counterterrorism officer, narrated the passing sites.

title: Morning Agenda: China Stops Trading After Less Than Half an Hour
description: CHINA STOPS TRADING AFTER LESS THAN HALF AN HOUR | Trading was halted for the day on Chinas stock market for the second time this week, as stocks plummeted on Thursday over concerns about the countrys currency and the health of the economy,Keith Bradsher and Amie Tsang report in DealBook.

title: New York Today: Treasures, Unlocked
description: Updated 9:11 a.m.

title: Zings Awesome Rice
description: An obsession with rice on the Lower East Side.

title: Liberal Policy Journal Offers Democrats Ideas on How to Be Change
description: The Democratic presidential primary has had its fill of policy proposals, but one liberal-leaning magazine is hoping to inject something else into the race: new ideas.

title: Zings Awesome Rice on the Lower East Side Finds Freshness in a Classic
description: Among the sins of fried rice: too much oil, vegetables that taste only of the freezer they were stored in, grains gone to mush or ossified into tiny, brittle fangs. And yet the dish, even when made without artistry, diligence or the remotest interest in freshness, almost always satisfies.

title: Donald Trump Says Hell Pull Scotland Investment if Britain Bars Him
description: LONDON  Donald J. Trump has threatened to abandon plans to invest more than $1 billion in Scotland if Britain bars him from entering the country over his comments that Muslim foreigners should not be allowed into the United States.

title: Ted Cruz and John McCain Share History in Questions Over Natural Born Status
description: McCains Canal Zone Birth Prompts Queries About Whether That Rules Him Out

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start the day.

title: Iran Accuses Saudi Arabia of Attacking Embassy in Yemen
description: TEHRAN  The already volatile showdown between Iran and Saudi Arabia escalated in Yemen on Thursday after the Iranians said their embassy had been hit by a Saudi airstrike, though witnesses said the building did not seem to have been struck.

title: Hillary Clinton to Open Asian-American Outreach Effort in California
description: As Republican presidential candidates brave the cold in Iowa and New Hampshire, Hillary Clinton heads to San Gabriel, Calif., on Thursday to court an increasingly important, and sometimes overlooked, demographic.

title: South Korea to Resume Propaganda Broadcasts That Angered North
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A day after North Korea claimed to have tested a hydrogen bomb, South Korea said Thursday that it would resume propaganda broadcasts at the countries border that infuriated the North last summer.

title: Who Should Control the West?
Below the Line: Shooting Sicario
description: Hes been nominated for 12 Oscars and helped bring many a directors vision to life behind the camera. Now the cinematographer Roger Deakins is back in the Oscar conversation for his work on the thriller Sicario, directed by Denis Villeneuve. (The two also teamed up on the 2013 drama Prisoners.)

title: Mexican Pork Chops, by Way of Brooklyn
description: Pipian is a classic Mexican sauce, thick with seeds and nuts, spicy with chiles, that takes its name from the pepitas, or pumpkin seeds, that are used in its creation. The version I make makes no claims to authenticity, though. The recipe does not derive from the fieldwork of great Mexican cooking masters like Diana Kennedy or Patricia Quintana (who might rail against it), nor from personal experience cooking in central Mexico with the women and men who have been making such sauces since the regions pre-Hispanic era. (They might shrug.) It is not red or green, as many pipian sauces are, but a delightful, almost pumpkiny orange and brown, with a texture that approximates the look of washed velvet.

title: Letter of Recommendation: A Field Guide to American Houses
description: A dovecote is a small, decorative shelter for pigeons often built on top of a house. It looks like a receptacle for secret messages from a fairy-tale world, and this whimsy makes up for the fact that no one actually wants pigeons roosting on their house. Dovecotes are especially common in certain parts of the Los Angeles suburbs, on storybook ranch homes  houses recast on the exterior to resemble a cottage that one of the Seven Dwarves might live in.

title: New Dietary Guidelines Urge Less Sugar for All and Less Protein for Boys and Men
description: New federal dietary guidelines announced on Thursday urge Americans to drastically cut back on sugar, and for the first time have singled out teenage boys and men for eating too much meat, chickenand eggs.

title: My Accidental Career as a Russian Screenwriter
Obama to Hold Event on Gun Efforts, Hoping to Reach Outside the Choir
description: Some lucky gun rights advocates will get the chance to tell the president directly what they think about his efforts to restrict gun sales during a televised town-hall-style forum on Thursday night, according to the White House.

title: Truck Bomb Kills at Least 65 at Libya Training Camp
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  A suicide bomber attacked a training camp for Coast Guard cadets early on Thursday, killing at least 65 people in one of the deadliest bombings in Libya in recent memory, according to security officials.

title: Many in Hong Kong Fear Beijings Reach After Editor and Colleagues Disappear
description: HONG KONG  A Hong Kong-based editor, who specializes in gossipy books about Chinese leaders, vanishes. His wife files a missing persons report with the police. She abruptly withdraws it after a faxed letter surfaces, apparently in her husbands calligraphy, stating that he is in mainland China of his own volition, helping with an investigation. Hong Kong border officials have no record of his ever leaving.

title: Q. and A.: Chen Tao, Who Runs Star Wars Site, on Films Impact in China
description: In 1998, 21 years after Star Wars was released in the United States, a teenage Chen Tao found a Star Wars video game on his first computer and, in the process, discovered a whole new galaxy.

title: First Draft Focus: Throwback Thursday  Best Seats in the House
Man With Fake Explosives Killed in Paris on Charlie Hebdo Anniversary
description: PARIS  French police officers fatally shot a man who was wielding a cleaver and yelling Allahu akbar as he tried to attack a police station in northern Paris on Thursday, setting off alarms as France marked the one-year anniversary of the terrorist attack on the satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo.

title: Walid Raads Unreality Show Spins Middle Eastern History as Art
description: Official political history is as self-assured sounding and logically suspect as presidential primary promises. This is the kind of history  a modest amount of matter plumped on clouds of hot air  that the Conceptual artist Walid Raad devises in his Museum of Modern Art retrospective: a set of fantastic tales spun from a few hard facts, with the live equivalent of an operatic mad scene at the center.

title: Roger Rosenblatt: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of the novel Thomas Murphy would like to meet Mary Shelley: Id ask her who the monster is meant to be. ... Then Id ask her how a 19-year-old comes up with this stuff.

title: Honoring Mom (and Molire) With Imagining the Imaginary Invalid
description: In 2012, the actress Ruth Maleczech, who was soon to receive a diagnosis of metastatic breast cancer, underwent an operation on her leg that left her temporarily bedridden.

title: 17 Workers in Lansing, N.Y., Rescued From Cargill Salt Mine
description: Rescue crews pulled 17 miners to the surface on Thursday morning after they spent the night trapped in an elevator 900 feet below ground at a road salt mine in central New York.

title: A Cultural Revolution in Malaysia
description: KUALA LUMPUR  Shila Amzah is a Malaysian pop star famed as much for her fashion sense as for her powerful voice. Her vast collection of striking, multicolored hijabs has made her a style icon and a role model for young Muslim women across the country. These days, though, she sings primarily in Mandarin, and  as her 2.5 million followers on the Chinese microblogging site Weibo suggest  a majority of her fans are from mainland China.

title: Absolutely Final Delivery
description: Dear Diary:

title: Saks Owner Clinches Deal for Gilt Groupe
description: Once emblematic of New York technology and innovation, Gilt Groupe has agreed to be acquired by Hudsons Bay Company for a quarter of its private valuation.

title: 1941: U.S. Steps Up Arms Production
description: WASHINGTON  President Roosevelt acted promptly today [Jan. 7] in furtherance of his pledge to Congress yesterday to defend democracy by sending ever-increasing numbers of warplanes, guns, tanks and ships to Great Britain, China and Greece. The action took the form of creating the Office of Production Management, whose duties, in brief, will be to speed up production of warplanes and all other essential war supplies in the interest not only of the United States but of Great Britain and all other countries which are resisting aggression by the Berlin-Rome-Tokio axis.New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 8, 1941

title: 52 Places to Go: Readers Choice
description: Use the hashtag #52places on Instagram to show us the one place you think people should travel in 2016.

title: 52 Places to Go in 2016
description: Its a big world out there, so weve narrowed it down for you. From the temples of Malta to the crystalline waters of the Yucatn, explore our top destinations to visit this year.

title: Venture Investing Declined Sharply at the End of 2015
description: Venture capitalists pulled back from making new bets at the end of last year. The number of deals fell to a nearly two-year low because of worries that there was too much froth in start-up investing.

title: Reader Idea | Students Talk to Students About Drug and Alcohol Use
description: Back in 2010, when we invented our Great Ideas From Readers column, we introduced it by saying:

title: Jonathan Lippman, New Yorks Former Chief Judge, Joins Latham & Watkins
description: New York States former chief judge has joined the litigation and trial practice of the law firm Latham & Watkins.

title: What You Need to Know About Guns in America
description: This collection of past Times interactive graphics and explanatory articles focuses on the American gun control debate.

title: Statue Honoring Comfort Women Faces Uncertain Fate
description: Since 2011, a haunting bronze sculpture of a young woman in traditional Korean dress has been positioned on a sidewalk near the Japanese embassy in Seoul. Barefoot, her hands clenched in her lap, she sits in a chair and stares impassively, a symbol of thousands of Korean women who were used as sex slaves by Japans army from the early 1930s until 1945.

title: In the Birthplace of Pizza, Pollution Rules for Ovens Spur Outrage
description: SAN VITALIANO, Italy  If there is one label that Antonio Falcone, a doctor turned civic leader, does not want to be known by, it is the anti-pizza mayor.

title: How to Add Currency Symbols to Text in Android
description: Q. Do you need a special keyboard to make a euro symbol on Android 6.0?

title: Daily Report: At International CES, Look Away From Your Phone
description: Lets recap a busy day at the International CES, shall we?

title: Man Arrested in Fatal Stabbing of Bronx McDonalds Manager
description: The police have arrested a homeless man and charged him with fatally stabbing a McDonalds manager in the Bronx, after the worker ejected him from the restaurant, where he had been camped out for hours, officials said on Thursday.

title: Think Like a Doctor: Thunder in the Head
description: The Challenge: Can you solve a real-life medical mystery involving a 59-year-old man tormented by a thunderous pounding in his head?

title: Tweets About Israel Land New Jersey Student in Principals Office
description: A New Jersey high school student found herself in a social media storm on Wednesday after she live-tweeted and apparently secretly recorded a trip to her principals office.

title: 52 Places: New Ways to Get There
description: So many places to go, right? But also so many ways to get to them. Here are a few to look out for this year.

title: How We Picked the 52 Places to Go in 2016
description: Each January, the editors of the Travel section publish our Places to Go issue. And each year after we do, readers wonder why their favorite destination was overlooked or why their least favorite made the top 10. To add some clarity to the process, weve decided to answer some frequently asked questions about how we chose our 52 Places to Go in 2016.

title: Lesson for Stalemated Sides in Oregon: A Texas Standoff Without End
description: TRINIDAD, Tex.  How long can the Oregon standoff last? If the one that dragged on here in this rural East Texas town is any example, the answer is at least a decade, and perhaps much longer.

title: 1966: Rebellion After Officers Exiled
description: SANTO DOMINGO  The Dominican armed forces today [Jan. 7] rebelled against a provisional government order for 34 top officers to leave the country in the interests of political peace. The defiance of the order  which applied to both rightist and former rebel leaders  started the worst crisis in the Dominican Republic since last summers four-month civil war. Provisional President Hector Garcia Godoy ordered 12 top officers, including former rebel leader Col. Francisco Caamano Deno and Armed Forces Minister Francisco Rivera Caminero, to diplomatic posts abroad. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 8, 1966

title: Law Firm Mergers Rose Again Last Year
description: Last year saw a record number of law firm mergers and acquisitions  91  and the largest-ever law firm merger, according to a newly released tally from the legal consulting company Altman Weils online tracking service.

title: You Asked, Rand Paul Answered
description: During a visit to the editorial board, the candidate took a moment to answer a question from a Times reader.

title: American Horror Story Season 5, Episode 11: Hotel California
description: It was somewhere during this penultimate episode of the fifth season of American Horror Story that I finally realized what the season is actually about: stagnation. For all the creepiness that a hotels transience lends to a story, what about the people who never leave? The Liz Taylors, the Irises, stuck watching as their lives pass them by, or Sally and March, stuck as the living pass them by.

title: Roberta Vinci, Still Aglow From Landmark Upset, Embraces New Normal
description: BRISBANE, Australia  After putting an end to Serena Williamss Grand Slam bid in the United States Open semifinals on an extraordinary September afternoon, Roberta Vinci has had to redefine what passes for normal in her life.

title: Muslim Brotherhood Supporters Clash With Security Forces Outside Cairo Hotel
description: CAIRO  Security forces and supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood exchanged fire outside a hotel in Cairo on Thursday, in a sign of political tensions in advance of the fifth anniversary of the 2011 revolution this month.

title: How the Government Has Responded to Armed Standoffs
description: Law enforcement officials response to armed antigovernment confrontations has changed over time. Here are examples.

title: Chris Christie Says Hillary Clinton Would Cut Marco Rubios Heart Out
description: When the super PAC backing Senator Marco Rubio assailed Gov. Chris Christies record in New Jersey in tough new television ads this week, it was as if Mr. Christie had been presented with a gift.

title: Fewer 1,000-Yard Rushers as Grand Milestone Fades
description: The 1,000-yard rushing season has long been the benchmark of greatness in the N.F.L. Emmitt Smith did it a record 11 times, and Hall of Famers like Walter Payton, Barry Sanders, Tony Dorsett and Franco Harris all racked up many 1,000-yard seasons.

title: Cynthia Harvey Named Artistic Director of American Ballet Theater School
description: Cynthia Harvey, the ballerina and teacher, has a busy year ahead. In addition to consulting work, she is to serve as a coach at the Prix de Lausanne, the global competition for young dancers, and continues to run her ballet nonprofit group, En Avant Foundation. But in the spring she will take on one of her biggest projects yet: She has been named the next artistic director of American Ballet Theaters Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis School, effective in May.

title: Bronx Man Charged With Slashing a Woman in Chelsea
description: A Bronx man has been arrested and charged with slashing a woman across the face in Chelsea this week, leaving her with gashes near her lip that required seven stitches, the authorities said on Thursday.

title: Donald Trump Says He Favors Big Tariffs on Chinese Exports
description: Donald J. Trump said he would favor a 45 percent tariff on Chinese exports to the United States, proposing the idea during a wide-ranging meeting with members of the editorial board of The New York Times.

title: Zhu, Chris Young and Wiki Release New Albums
description: Genesis Series

title: How an Unlikely Duo Became the Hottest Songwriters in Pop Music
description: LOS ANGELES  Ten minutes into a recent recording session with a Grammy-winning producer they had never previously met, Julia Michaels and Justin Tranter, the in-demand pop songwriters of the moment, had a bouncy new hook.

title: Video Review: Mercedes GLC300 Is a Midsize Crossover With Few Faults
description: MERCEDES-BENZ isnt new to the midsize crossover market. Its angular GLK arrived in America in 2009. Its replacement does far more than swap the letter K for a C. The new GLC300 is drawn with softer lines, reminiscent of the long-nose C-Class sedan. And why not? They share architectures.

title: A Bakers Antidote for Overindulgence
description: A life of everything bagel sandwiches and warm sticky buns can take its toll. I do a lot of baking and tasting of baked goods while I work, and I compensate by eating lots of vegetables and legumes, and drinking a lot of water, says Melissa Weller, the celebrated baker at the popular SoHo restaurant Sadelles, a New York Times Critics Pick, reviewed by Pete Wells this week. With balance as her goal, there are times when the baker completely eliminates dairy and sugar (and alcohol) from her diet. I will still taste what I am baking at work, but only small tastes, she says. Her other line of defense? A daily turmeric tonic. I go to this first thing in the morning when I wake up, says Weller, who started making the drink about a year ago at home. (Sqirls Jessica Koslow also touts turmeric for its restorative properties.) But babka lovers, have no fear: There are no plans of adding this drink to the menu anytime soon.

title: Georgia Prosecutors Seek Indictment of Officer Who Shot Unarmed Man
description: DECATUR, Ga.  A prosecutor here said Thursday that he would seek a felony murder indictment against a white police officer who last year shot and killed Anthony Hill, a black man who was naked and unarmed at the time of the fatal encounter.

title: In Britain, Shadows of Past Military Tactics Loom Large
description: LONDON  It was a time known to its detractors as a decade of hubris, when Western powers deployed the muscular military tactics of the 19th and early 20th centuries in the opening years of the 21st to project their power in flawed attempts to forge distant national destinies in Afghanistan and Iraq.

title: Obama Pleads for Stricter Gun Laws and Faces Tough Questioning
description: WASHINGTON  In an intense but civil town-hall-style event broadcast live on television, gun rights activists repeatedly pressed President Obama on Thursday night to justify his gun control efforts, putting him on the defensive over an issue that has divided the nations capital and the presidential campaign trail.

title: For Stock Markets, January Is a Cloudy Crystal Ball
description: As January goes, so goes the entire market year.

title: Jeb Bush Names Most-Loved Family Member. (Hint: Its Mom.)
description: LONDONDERRY, N.H.  The men of the Bush family hate being put on the couch, their preferred term for dismissing the news medias attempts to psychoanalyze their political dynasty.

title: The Finest Hours Relives a Perilous, Forgotten Rescue
description: QUINCY, MASS.  The Finest Hours, which opens Jan. 29, is very closely based on a real-life rescue that took place at sea in February 1952, when, during a noreaster at least as fierce as the one immortalized in The Perfect Storm, not one but two oil tankers broke apart off the coast of Cape Cod. They were T2s, ships hastily built of inferior metal during World War II and sometimes known as serial sinkers for their tendency to snap in half during cold weather.

title: Stephen Petronio and Anish Kapoor Team Up to Sell Art for Dances Sake
description: Once again the world of visual art, which creates durable works that can command astronomical prices, is coming to the aid of the world of performing arts, in which it is increasingly difficult to find the money to create and present works that last just until the curtain falls.

title: Review: In The Treasure, Digging for Something of Value in Romania
description: Costi, the Romanian Everyman at the center of The Treasure, leads a reasonably comfortable if not terribly exciting life. Played by Cuzin Toma, an actor with a melancholy, sensitive face and a gentle manner, Costi has an office job and a tidy, somewhat sterile apartment, where he lives with his wife, Raluca, and their young son, Alin (played by Mr. Tomas real-life wife and son, Cristina and Nicodim). The boy likes to hear fairy tales at bedtime, and his father soon finds himself on an adventure that has all the markings of a modern fable.

title: New York to Appoint Civilian to Monitor Polices Counterterrorism Activity
description: The mayor will appoint an independent civilian to monitor the New York Police Departments counterterrorism activities, lawyers said in court documents on Thursday as they moved to settle a pair of lawsuits over surveillance targeting Muslims in the decade after the Sept. 11 attacks.

title: Polands President Approves Controls on State Media, Alarming E.U. Leaders
description: WARSAW  Polands president, Andrzej Duda, signed a law on Thursday that gives the government greater control over state broadcasters, despite the objections of European Union officials who fear that the measure will weaken freedom of the press.

title: Parents Monitoring Teenagers Online, and Mostly, Getting It Right
description: Over the last few months, researchers from Pew have been looking at parents, teenagers and the Internet. Theyve looked at how teenagers live their lives online, and how they feel about that new (to adults) arena. Now, in a newly released report, the researchers are exploring what parents and teenagers say about how parents monitor teenagers online and, perhaps more interestingly, how they dont.

title: Oregon Pinot Noir Delivers an Element of Surprise
description: Recent vintages of Oregon pinot noir have been fascinating. But they may have also been confusing for consumers who would like a one-word association with the notion of Oregon pinot noir.

title: Reader Response: A Natural Hair Salon in Santo Domingo
description: Our recent article about people who travel to a salon in the Dominican Republic that styles hair in natural coils rather than straightening it drew more than 100 comments from readers. Many not only touched on the standard of straightening hair but also expanded on the view of race within the Dominican Republic. Here are a few edited excerpts.

title: Mama Mea Culpa: A Tattered Family Relationship Needs Mending
description: My mother-in-law plays favorites, openly doting on my husbands brother and his family. I ignored it for years; it didnt seem to bother my husband. I also ignored that I was treated worse. But things changed when I had children. After a visit when my mother-in-law spent little time with my children, praising her other grandchildren instead, I sent a letter telling her what I had noticed. It was badly received. We have settled into an icy standoff. My children have not noticed their nanas absence, but I hate to think of them not knowing her. What should I do?

title: Marco Rubio Aims New TV Ad at Iowas Evangelical Voters
description: As the Rubio campaign tries to halt the momentum of Senator Ted Cruz in Iowa, it has released a new ad aimed directly at evangelical voters, called Faith, in which Senator Marco Rubio discusses Christianity.

title: Judith Kaye, a Pioneer in New Yorks Courts [Updated]
description: Judith Kaye, the former chief judge of New York State  and the first woman to hold that very influential job  has died after an illness, The New York Daily News reported on Thursday. She was 77.

title: Marvin Newman Beyond the Single Image
description: Sequentially Sought, an exhibition at the Howard Greenberg Gallery, showcases Marvin Newmans sometimes tongue-in-cheek series from 1950s New York and Chicago.

title: Confronting the Oregon Standoff, What Would Teddy Have Done?
description: [On Jan. 26, one occupier was killed and seven arrested as law enforcement officials tightened a cordon around Malheur.]

title: As Rebel-Held Town of Madaya Starves, Syria Agrees to Food Aid, U.N. Says
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Amid mounting international dismay over reports of starvation deaths and images of skeletally thin children in the besieged, rebel-held Syrian town of Madaya, the Syrian government agreed Thursday to allow the delivery of humanitarian aid, according to the United Nations.

title: Judith S. Kaye, First Woman to Serve as New Yorks Chief Judge, Dies at 77
description: Judith S. Kaye, the first woman named to the highest court in New York and the first to serve as the states chief judge  a job she held longer than any of her 21 male predecessors  died on Thursday at her home in Manhattan. She was 77.

title: Tribeca Film Festival Company Names Andrew Essex Chief Executive
description: Tribeca Enterprises, the company behind the Tribeca Film Festival, has hired a new chief executive from Madison Avenue as it seeks further growth, in particular by turning its constellation of businesses into a more cohesive whole.

title: Why Polls Have Been Wrong Recently
description: The polling industry has been hit hard by high-profile misfires in recent years. Pollsters got last Novembers Kentucky governors race wrong, as they did the 2014 midterm elections. They have missed predictions in elections in Israel and Britain.

title: When Narcissism Mixes With Money in Politics
description: To the Editor:

title: 6 Tips for Investors When the Stock Market Tumbles
description: The impulse when the stock market falls hard for a few days in a row is to do something but it probably doesnt make much sense to overhaul an investment strategy based on a blip of market activity.

title: Kim Jong-uns Generational Ambitions
description: It was party time in Pyongyang. Workers scrambled to hang congratulatory banners in the lobby of the Koryo Hotel, my home away from home in the North Korean capital, where I was posted as an Associated Press correspondent. A gaggle of cooks, still in aprons and chefs hats, dashed out from the kitchen to watch the festivities, and mothers tightened the pink bows in their daughters hair as the girls fidgeted in anticipation.

title: Brother Velliess Aurora James Travels To Ethiopia
description: The designer finds inspiration in the people of the Omo Valley  and meets with craftsmen she employs through her work with the Ethical Fashion Initiative.

title: The Oregon Protest and the Battle Over Western Lands
description: An armed protest at a remote federal wildlife refuge was the latest flare-up in a decades-long struggle over control of federal land.

title: Factory Jobs and Robots
description: To the Editor:

title: Kevin Spacey Named Chairman of Relativity Studios
description: LOS ANGELES  Relativity Media, emerging from bankruptcy, is adding some star power to its executive ranks. On Thursday, the company said the actor Kevin Spacey would become chairman of its Relativity Studios unit and Mr. Spaceys business partner, Dana Brunetti, would become president.

title: Peoples Choice Awards Red Carpet
description: The fans do the voting for these awards, naming winners that include Homeland and the actress Priyanka Chopra.

title: Kitty Kallen, Big Band Singer of Bsame Mucho, Dies at 94
description: Kitty Kallen, her voice sweet and clear, welcomed the troops home from World War II, singing: Kiss me once, then kiss me twice, then kiss me once again. Its been a long, long time. She turned out hits like Bsame Mucho, Im Beginning to See the Light, In the Chapel in the Moonlight and Little Things Mean a Lot  many reaching the Top 10.

title: Football Injuries
description: To the Editor:

title: You Asked, Rand Paul Answered
description: On Tuesday, we asked you to submit questions for Rand Paul.During his visit to the editorial board, he picked one of your questions from a hat to answer on camera. Watch his response below:

title: A Designer Finds Inspiration  and Creates Jobs  in Ethiopia
description: As the founder and creative director of the three-year-old shoe company Brother Vellies, Aurora James often travels to different countries in Africa  such as South Africa, Kenya and Morocco  where she sources fabrics and manufactures all of her products.

title: Review: Germinal Sheds a Light on Creativity and All Creation
description: Let there be light, for starters. Thats the classic way to begin things, right?

title: This Is Her Face. This Is Her Face in Bread. Any Questions?
description: This is the story of a woman who became famous on Instagram for smooshing her face into bread products.

title: Rape Statute of Limitations
description: To the Editor:

title: Ted Cruzs Tax Proposal
description: To the Editor:

title: How to Regulate Drones
description: To the Editor:

title: Trying to Understand Chinas Market Upheaval
description: For the second time in less than six months, market turmoil in China is rattling the rest of the world. As in August last year, the trigger is a sudden slide in the value of the renminbi, which in turn has dragged down domestic stocks. Though the cause of the sell-off is uncertain, the implications for the rest of the world are ominous.

title: Peeking Into the Gilded Age at the Met
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art recently unveiled a new period room, and its a beauty. Called the Worsham-Rockefeller Dressing Room, its a consummate expression of Aestheticism, a trans-Atlantic, 19th-century design movement that combined European Renaissance, Modern, Islamic and Japanese styles into luxurious objects and sumptuous environments for well-to-do hedonists. Having recently undergone conservation by the Met, the dressing room joins 19 other period rooms in the museums American Wing.

title: Sharing a Cab, and My Toes
description: As I rode in a cab across the Brooklyn Bridge, a man I barely knew was sucking my toes. The lights of the bridge streaked overhead, and Manhattan was a jeweled kingdom shrinking behind us in the darkness of the rearview mirror.

title: Marco Rubio Reacts to Those Boots That Were Made for Talking
description: NASHUA, N.H.  This is craziness! Marco Rubio said on Thursday, finally addressing the buzz over his boots.

title: Ross Partridge on Lamb and Uncomfortable Viewers
description: The friendship between a middle-aged man and a young girl is at the heart of Lamb, a drama from the director Ross Partridge, who also stars as the lead character David Lamb, and adapted the screenplay from the novel by Bonnie Nadzam. The character, adrift and searching for meaning, meets an 11-year-old girl, Tommie (Oona Laurence), in a parking lot when she asks him for a cigarette. This begins an unlikely friendship, one that may raise eyebrows and cause discomfort for many viewers. The film, and book from which it is adapted, looks at the not-easily-definable contours of the relationship in compelling ways, but the subject matter is tricky to say the least.

title: tzi the Icemans Stomach Bacteria Offers Clues on Human Migration
description: An insight into the peopling of Europe has emerged from an unlikely source  the stomach contents of a 5,300-year-old body pulled from a thawing glacier in the eastern Italian Alps.

title: Can U.S. Remain an Island of Stability in the Global Economy?
description: The Chinese stock market is plummeting so fast that authorities there keep shutting it down. North Korea set off a bomb in a nuclear test. Two of the Middle Easts great powers, Saudi Arabia and Iran, are eyeing each other menacingly. In the European Union, political extremists are on the rise, migrants are pouring in and Britain may drop out (three phenomena that are not unrelated).

title: Genetic Flip Helped Organisms Go From One Cell to Many
description: Narwhals and newts, eagles and eagle rays  the diversity of animal forms never ceases to amaze. At the root of this spectacular diversity is the fact that all animals are made up of many cells  in our case, about 37 trillion of them. As an animal develops from a fertilized egg, its cells may diversify into a seemingly limitless range of types and tissues, from tusks to feathers to brains.

title: Based on Hall Vote, Bonds and Clemens Shouldnt Be Excited
description: When it comes to Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens, its time to ratchet things down a little bit.

title: After Outcry Over Lack of Female Grand Prize Nominees, Angoulme Comics Festival Opens Prize to a Vote
description: How do you say no girls allowed in French? That was the sentiment this week when the Angoulme International Comics Festival in France released its list of 30 nominees for its Grand Prix award and none was female.

title: Media General Agrees to Be Acquired by Nexstar, but Meredith Objects
description: Media General should be familiar with soap operas. The company operates 71 television stations across the United States. But it is having a difficult time climbing out of a particularly tricky mergers and acquisitions love triangle.

title: A Surge of Interest in East-Bloc Mementos
description: When Communist regimes in Europe were unraveling in 1989, collaborators and dissidents alike began destroying vital historical material, from statues of dictators to family snapshots of government informers to manuals that exaggerated the quality of East German car engines. Now relics of ordinary life and heinous acts in the Soviet bloc are resurfacing in museums, publications and auctions.

title: Julie Ault at Galerie Buchholz, the Curator as Artist
description: Julie Aults art mediums are collaboration and accumulation. She was a co-founder in 1980 of Group Material, a collective that treated archival-style installations as walk-through art objects. She created a memorable 2013 solo show at Artists Space, Macho Man: Tell It to My Heart, entirely from her personal collection of work by other artists gathered over many years. In the 2014 Whitney Biennial, she further expanded on this method of expressive, highly individualized curating by combining art owned and borrowed.

title: Planned Parenthood, in Its First Primary Endorsement, Backs Hillary Clinton
description: Planned Parenthood, which has become an ideological minefield in the 2016 presidential election, said Thursday that it would endorse Hillary Clinton  its first endorsement in a presidential primary in the nonprofits 100-year existence.

title: Paris Museums and Nightclubs Show Signs of Recovery After Attacks
description: PARIS  The first nights after the Nov. 13 attacks in and around Paris, dancers at the Crazy Horse cabaret donned their sequins and gamely performed La Marseillaise before empty tables and uncorked Champagne bottles.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: A Momentary Scare
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These arethe places, faces and culinary selectionsof 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: The Choreographer-Director David Gordons Archive to Go to Public Library
description: What do you get when a seminal postmodern choreographer donates his archives? A reconsideration of conventional archival methodology, naturally, along with a series of new, experimental workshop performances re-examining the artists past.

title: Signature Theater Names Paige Evans as Artistic Director
description: Signature Theater Company, one of the leading Off Broadway nonprofit organizations, has chosen a top official of Lincoln Center Theater to be its next artistic director.

title: Crowd Gathers to Greet Donald Trump in Bernie Sanders Territory
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  Hours before Donald J. Trump was set to hold a rally in the Flynn Center here, a crowdof supporters, hecklers and curious observers braved freezing temperatures to get a glimpse of the Republican presidential candidate who dared to set foot onthe traditionally liberal turf of Senator Bernie Sanders.

title: To Feel More at Home, Islanders Skip Morning Trips to Brooklyn
description: SYOSSET, N.Y.  Halfway through their first season in Brooklyn, the Islanders are, for now, stopping their game-day routine of morning commutes to Barclays Center and afternoon hotel stays near the arena.

title: Monika Baer Makes Emblems of Liquor Bottles
Michel Platini Ends Bid for FIFA Presidency
description: Michel Platini said Thursday that he was ending his bid to become FIFA president, dropping out of a race that technically did not include him and one that he is officially barred from winning.

title: Bill Violas New Video Project Is a Rebirth of Sorts
description: Bill Viola goes for big, cosmic themes, which he funnels into technically impressive video works of compelling, quasi-religious sincerity. The main event of this exhibition is an awesome video called Inverted Birth. The 15-foot-tall projection shows in slow motion and in reverse a man standing on a bare stage as he is subjected to a tremendous deluge of liquid. This is accompanied by the electronically amplified roar of pouring water.

title: Robin Winters Evokes Counterculture Flair in Free Standing Sentence
description: Robin Winters moved to New York from California in the early 1970s and later participated in Colab, a downtown artists group that mounted radical exhibitions like The Real Estate Show (1979-80) and The Times Square Show (1980). But he has always retained elements of San Franciscos 60s counterculture, in which he came of age, roaming among performance, painting, poetry and blown glass. His current exhibition is perfectly installed in Present Company, a cozy young gallery in Bushwick that describes itself on its website as an exhibition and social space.

title: The Creeping Expansion of Gun Control Laws: Readers on Obamas Executive Actions
description: At the heart of the debate about President Obamas planned executive actions on firearms was one question: Will the government ultimately want to confiscate weapons from responsible gun owners?

title: Saudi Aramco I.P.O. Is Weighed by Kingdom
description: There are big initial public offerings  the $25 billion stock sale by the Alibaba Group, the biggest on record; the $16 billion market debut of Facebook  and then there are really big ones.

title: Moonchild Sanellys Johannesburg
description: The musician and designer takes T to some of her favorite spots in her hometown, South Africas biggest city.

title: North Koreas Nuclear Arms Test
description: To the Editor:

title: A Trip Through Johannesburg With Its Coolest Resident
description: Describing Moonchild Sanellys look with precision is an impossible feat  its as if Sailor Moon took an acid trip through the continent of Africa. But its distinctly South African: wildly inventive, undeniably original and solidly homegrown. When we meet to take a shopping trip in her hometown Johannesburg, she is wearing a jet-black velvet jumpsuit of her own creation, set off by the electric-blue wool shes plaited into her natural hair to create a brightly-colored bob. (She calls it her moon mop.) In Johannesburg, Sanelly is something of a local celebrity, known for her performances and the pool parties she throws to celebrate a new song or fashion collection. Walking through the hip neighborhoods of Maboneng and Braamfontein, the energetic 28-year-old stops to say hello to nearly everyone, from the stylish women having afternoon drinks at an outdoor bar to the guys in the Adidas shop and the men selling grilled meat on the street.

title: Tony Yazbeck Will be the New J.M. Barrie in Finding Neverland
description: Neverland has found its next J.M. Barrie.

title: Mad About the Boy Opens in London
description: A new exhibition at the London College of Fashion explores mens wear and youth culture.

title: Things to Do in New Jersey, Jan. 9 Through 17
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: In London, an Exploration of Mens Wear and Youth Culture
description: Tomorrow, mens shows will officially begin in London  and just in time comes an exhibition, Mad About the Boy, that puts it all in context. Held in the gallery of the London College of Fashion, the show examines the link between garments on the catwalk and the youth tropes they drew inspiration from, and vice versa. Silhouettes from designers including Raf Simons, J.W. Anderson and Christopher Shannon are shown alongside fashion, street and documentary images.

title: A View of Mexico City
description: Above and beyond the Angel of Independence monument in the city's Paseo de la Reforma.

title: Things to Do in Connecticut, Jan. 9 Through 17
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: New Pee-wee Herman Film to Be Shown at SXSW
description: Pee-wee Hermans on his way to Austin.

title: Pictures of the Day: Serbia and Elsewhere
description: Serbia and Elsewhere: Pictures of the Day

title: Jan. 7, 2016  Pictures of the day
description: Photos from Serbia, France, the West Bank and Germany.

title: Review: Dynasty, Tom Hollands Chronicle of the First Five Emperors Who Ruled Ancient Rome
description: Nothing could be fainter than those torches which allow us, not to pierce the darkness, but to glimpse it, wrote the philosopher Seneca, shortly before his former student Nero forced him to commit suicide. And ancient history  where the record is fragmented and riddled with unknown unknowns  is a pictorial parade lit more by flickering torches than by a steady, burning light. Still, with his new book, Dynasty, the British historian Tom Holland has crafted a history of early Rome that has all the gripping detail and narrative momentum of a novel.

title: Review: The Cellist Okkyung Lee Tests Extended Techniques Boundaries
description: What Okkyung Lee does on the cello is often called extended technique, which means producing sounds by unusual means. But she more or less obliterates the need for the term. When she keeps her fingers choked up on the neck, pointing downward near the bridge, or rubs her bow against the strings to make sluicing sounds and hard, guttural rips, this is her standard; this is her usual. Its part of her language.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: Using Star Wars to Knock the Democrats
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These arethe places, faces and culinary selectionsof 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: How News From Seoul Found Its Way Into the Paper in 75 Minutes
description: David E. Sanger, The Timess chief Washington correspondent who has covered North Koreas nuclear program since its infancy, was watching television with his wife and children at around 9:15 on Tuesday evening when he saw reports of seismic activity in North Korea.

title: Portraits by Ethan James Green
description: The photographers photos, many of which highlight the fluidity of gender, are intimate, sympathetic and haunting.

title: Intimate, Haunting Portraits of New York City Youth
description: While his images are stylistically timeless, the photographer Ethan James Greens process is entirely contemporary: He actively uses social media as a tool to discover subjects for his ongoing series of New York City creatives. I think the rules are quickly changing! Green says. With social media, DIY has become much easier. Most of the people I photograph knew each other first online and now many are working with each other professionally. I think it has allowed the city to become a bit like the Wild West again.

title: Things to Do on Long Island, Jan. 9 Through 17
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Review: Anesthesia Ponders the Meaningfulness of Life
description: Anesthesia, Tim Blake Nelsons exquisitely compressed cri de coeur about the meaning of life in a hyper-connected world, begins as a knife-wielding stranger viciously attacks Walter (Sam Waterston), a wise, kindhearted Columbia University philosophy professor at the door of his apartment building. The circular story immediately backtracks to observe Walter, who is on the verge of retirement after 34 years, addressing a class and posing the same unanswerable questions he has been pondering out loud for more than three decades.

title: Venomous Sea Snakes Showing Up in Distress at Beaches
description: A species of highly venomous sea snake that made rare appearances on two California beaches in recent months has also been washing up thousands of miles away in Australia.

title: Review: Big Dance: Short Form Delivers Traditional Repertory With a Party Midway
description: A Ping-Pong table, a game of Twister, cocktail franks heated in a microwave and cans of Budweiser? No, it wasnt your typical intermission.

title: Ad Wars of 2016 Campaign Erupt in a Changing TV Arena
description: On WMUR, the dominant television station in Manchester, N.H., about 25 percent of commercial time is being eaten up by presidential campaign ads. Already this week, the candidates and their allies have fired off a dozen new commercials, a third of them negative, in Iowa and New Hampshire markets.

title: Things to Do in the Hudson Valley, Jan. 9 Through 17
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Movie Review: Anesthesia
description: The Times critic Stephen Holden reviews Anesthesia.

title: Review: In Angels Bone, Terrified Seraphim at the Mercy of Mortals
description: Smaller, louder and unmistakably of the moment: That seems to be the punchy vision of opera that drives the Prototype Festival, which opened its fourth season on Wednesday with Du Yuns audacious and searing Angels Bone. Its an appallingly good work when you consider that it takes on the subject of child trafficking and mixes in elements of magic realism and a musical cocktail of Renaissance polyphony, electronica, Modernism, punk rock and cabaret.

title: Maurice Hines Opens His Heart in Tappin Thru Life
description: The main difference between how Maurice Hines talks to a reporter visiting his dressing room and how he talks to an audience from the stage is that offstage the polished anecdotes dont smoothly segue into song and dance. Mr. Hines is an entertainer, one who has been performing professionally for most of his 72 years. He aims to please, and he knows how to do it.

title: In Puerto Ricos Debt Crisis, an Absence of Enforcers
description: The municipal bond market in the United States is desperately lacking enforcers. Puerto Ricos debt crisis is the latest example to expose the shortcoming. Foolish financial crowds had better wise up to other danger zones.

title: Martin Shkreli Used $45 Million E-Trade Account to Secure Bond
description: Martin Shkreli, the New York businessman charged by federal prosecutors with defrauding his former hedge fund investors, is worth at least $45 million.

title: Donald Trump Brings Gridlock to Vermont
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  Donald J. Trump brought gridlock here on Thursday afternoon, as the police shut down two blocks of the citys main corridor and braced for an overflow of thousands of political activists who would not fit inside the intimate Flynn Theater for his rally.

title: Review: John Luther Adamss The Light Within Highlights Ensemble Program at National Sawdust
description: During a performance of John Luther Adamss The Light Within, at National Sawdust on Tuesday evening, I had the luxurious sensation of being enveloped in almost tactile layers of sound. Indeed, on this program of multimedia pieces presented by the ensemble Le Train Bleu, Mr. Adamss work, despite being the only one without a visual component, offered the most alluring sensory experience.

title: Municipal Identification Card Program Offers Free Cultural Benefits
description: Its early in the new year, but miserly culture hounds can already reap dividends. New York City has just extended through 2016 the free enrollment deadline for its municipal identification card program. Benefits include free annual memberships to 40 institutions.

title: Review: Visiting a Lolita-Land of Sorts With Lamb
description: Lamb, a slow-burning creep-out about a kidnapping, would like you to see it as a requiem for the lost and the loveless. Set in a present that looks like real life but doesnt feel like it, the story pivots on its title sad sack, David Lamb, a habitual dissembler and possible sociopath mired in personal and professional crisis. Death, marital and work woes, a young mistress  Lamb has it all when one day he sweeps away an 11-year-old girl, taking her for, well, what exactly is the question that reverberates queasily through this movie, its hotel rooms and weepy moments.

title: Movie Review: Lamb
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews Lamb.

title: Bequest Adds Expressionist Layers to Dallas Museum of Art
description: Dorace Fichtenbaum had been generous toward the Dallas Museum of Art, donating funds as well as artworks. But the museum never expected this.

title: Theater Listings for Jan. 8-14
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Dakota Johnsons Evening Crop Top
Movie Review: The Treasure
description: The Times critic A.O. Scott reviews The Treasure.

title: Bill Clinton, Back in Iowa, Refuses to Respond to Donald Trump
description: Are there a lot of apiaries here?

title: Recordings Add Detail in Death of Woman Forced From Florida Hospital
description: State officials in Florida are investigating the death of a 57-year-old woman who was removed from a hospital by a police officer last month and then spent about 20 minutes on the ground in the parking lot before later being pronounced dead.

title: At the Studio Museum in Harlem, 4 Shows Engage a Cultural Conversation
description: For nearly five decades, the Studio Museum in Harlem has served as a cultural repository, reflecting the ruptures, shifts and spectrum of experiences for artists of African descent. Its current grouping of shows, culled mostly from the museums permanent collection, echoes this landscape, looking backward and forward. The main exhibition, A Constellation, includes the work of 26 artists and focuses on themes of abstraction, the figure and the history of the African diaspora. Black: Color, Material, Concept continues the conversation around blackness initiated by Thelma Golden, director and chief curator of the museum, who introduced the term post-black into the cultural conversation almost 15 years ago with the exhibition Freestyle. In the basement, a sculptural installation by Marc Andre Robinson weaves together formalism with black cultural history, while another, Lorraine OGrady: Art Is   offers a fantastic exhibition of photographs documenting Ms. Gradys performance piece during the 1983 African-American Day Parade, in which she skillfully weaves together art, activism and participation.

title: Starring Me! A Surreal Dive Into Immersive Theater
description: All of us have anti-bucket lists of things we do not want to do before we die, and mine includes any activity requiring potentially embarrassing public participation. Wearing a costume, declaiming before a crowd, playing spin the bottle, clapping along to a jaunty show tune, marching, chanting, speaking spontaneously into a microphone, ceding free will to a larger force, doing the hokeypokey and turning myself about  I have made it my business to avoid these things.

title: Review: The Forest Centers on the Search for a Twin at a Suicide Site in Japan
description: It needs to be said at the start that there is something unsavory about using suicide as the underpinning for a horror movie. Anyone who has experienced the suicide of a loved one should stay away from The Forest, set in the so-called Suicide Forest at the base of Mount Fuji in Japan, where an inordinate number of people go to kill themselves.

title: U.S. Prods China on North Korea, Saying Soft Approach Has Failed
description: WASHINGTON  In a striking public rebuke of China, Secretary of State John Kerry warned Beijing on Thursday that its effort to rein in North Korea had been a failure and that something had to change in its handling of the isolated country it has supported for the past six decades.

title: Your Thursday Evening Briefing: China, Hillary Clinton, Oregon
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Columbias WKCR Goes Silent Online
description: Streaming audio is more essential to the music industry than ever before, but last week WKCR-FM (89.9), the radio station of Columbia University, abruptly shut its online simulcast, cutting off the eclectic station from listeners outside the reach of its broadcast signal.

title: An Ice Cream Mogul and His Fellow Burlingtonians React to a Trump Rally
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  As a line of hundreds snaked around the block and down the street from where Donald J. Trump was set to hold a rally on Thursday night, more than 100 protesters gathered across the street, hoisting signs reading Bern, Trump, Bern and chanting that Mr. Trump should stay away. More demonstrators clustered nearly, holding candles in silent vigil.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: In Sweaty Betty, Two Single Dads and Their Pals Getting Through the Day
description: Hovering somewhere between fiction and documentary, Sweaty Betty makes unlikely heroes of two young single fathers and a 1,000-pound pig named Ms. Charlotte. Guess which of the three receives a dedicated segment on the local news?

title: Amy Schumer Is Actually Kind of a Fashion Plate
description: With the help of the stylist Leesa Evans, the raunchy actress has chosen sleek and sexy designer gowns for recent premieres and award ceremonies.

title: Giants Interview Steve Spagnuolo andTeryl Austin for Coaching Position
description: The Giants continued to work through their list of potential candidates for a new coach Thursday when they interviewed Steve Spagnuolo, their defensive coordinator last season, and Teryl Austin, the defensive coordinator for the Detroit Lions the past two seasons.

title: Review: Troublemakers: The Story of Land Art, a Documentary
description: Earthworks are an older tradition than oil painting, going back 3,000 years, the artist Carl Andre observes late in Troublemakers: The Story of Land Art, a cogent, brisk, sometimes thrilling documentary written and directed by James Crump. More than a couple of shots of Stonehenge turn up as supporting evidence for that claim. Mr. Crumps film, though, is mostly concerned with a group of American artists who, in the early 1960s, began not just working with natural materials for their pieces but also went out into the open, sometimes arid, spaces in North America to mold or scar, or both, the land itself.

title: 20 Years Ago: Pride and Prejudice Was Reborn on TV
description: The biggest surprise in the opening episode of the final season of Downton Abbey wasnt about Downton at all; it was  ohmygod, theres Wickham! Wickham, you old scoundrel, is that really you? And has it really been 20 years?

title: Comedy Listings for Jan. 8-14
description: For news about comedy, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Boulez Tribute to Be Held on Saturday
description: Pierre Boulez, who died on Tuesday, will be honored by musical luminaries on Saturday, Jan. 9, at Le Poisson Rouge in Greenwich Village.

title: Review: In Unlucky Plaza, a Comic Hostage Crisis via Tabloid Storytelling
description: Set in Singapore and just as densely packed, Ken Kweks debut feature Unlucky Plaza bundles loan-shark drama, culture-clash comedy, hostage negotiations and a talk-show framing device. The multicultural milieu lends an initial boost as Mr. Kweks jokes and plot entanglements take potshots at life in Singapore, but all the air seeps out of this attempt at zippy, tabloid-nutty storytelling.

title: Movie Listings for Jan. 8-14
description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. Full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: Pop & Rock Listings for Jan. 8-14
description: For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,364 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently.

title: Anatomy | Henry Gambles Birthday Party
description: The writer and director Stephen Cone narrates a sequence from his film Henry Gambles Birthday Party.

title: Classical Music & Opera Listings for Jan. 8-14
description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Jazz Listings for Jan. 8-14
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: A New Economic Era for China Goes Off the Rails
description: HONG KONG  When President Xi Jinping of China convened a group of top officials to discuss the economy last month, the highly publicized meeting was seen as a moment of triumph.

title: Review: In Henry Gambles Birthday Party, Sexual Repression (and Clothes) Start to Fall Away
description: In Henry Gambles Birthday Party, from the prolific independent writer and director Stephen Cone, teenagers and their parents struggle to reconcile their sheltered Christian lifestyles with the complexities of adulthood, sex and the secular world. Similar internal conflicts were the subject of Mr. Cones The Wise Kids (2012), an earnest, autobiographically inspired feature.

title: Barack Obama: Guns Are Our Shared Responsibility
description: THE epidemic of gun violence in our country is a crisis. Gun deaths and injuries constitute one of the greatest threats to public health and to the safety of the American people. Every year, more than 30,000 Americans have their lives cut short by guns. Suicides. Domestic violence. Gang shootouts. Accidents. Hundreds of thousands of Americans have lost brothers and sisters, or buried their own children. Were the only advanced nation on earth that sees this kind of mass violence with this frequency.

title: Loyalty Test for Those Wanting In to Trump Rally in Vermont
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  Want to see Donald J. Trump speak in Vermont? Then you better pledge allegiance to Mr. Trump.

title: Stephen ConeNarrates a Scene From Henry Gambles Birthday Party
description: Issues of spirituality, sexual identity and morality come together by the swimming pool in the drama Henry Gambles Birthday Party.

title: Venture Funding Slackened in the Last Quarter of 2015
description: Venture capitalists pulled back from making new bets at the end of last year. In the fourth quarter of 2015, the amount of money funding private companies fell 30 percent from the previous quarter, to $27.3 billion, according to a report from the research firm CB Insights. Deal-making dropped 13 percent over the same time period to 1,743 transactions, a level not seen since the first quarter of 2013. In 2015, venture funding peaked in the third quarter at $38.7 billion, according to CB Insights. In total, funding for all of 2015 hit $128.7 billion, nearly as much money as was deployed in 2013 and 2014 combined, the data showed.

title: Dance Listings for Jan. 8-14
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Insurers Brace for the Self-Driving Future and Fewer Accidents
description: AS autonomous driving technology advances, perhaps the most notable benefit is the promise of a striking reduction in accidents.

title: Paul Ryan Orders Closer Look at Authorizing War Against ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker Paul D. Ryan has ordered the House majority leader and the chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee to begin talking to members about the feasibility of a measure that would authorize war against the Islamic State militant group.

title: Museum & Gallery Listings for Jan. 8-14
description: Museums and galleries are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of recent art shows: nytimes.com/art. A searchable guide to these and many other art shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Chinas Economic Turmoil Sends Ripples to Global Markets
description: Seven years ago, the collapsing United States economy laid a dead hand on the rest of the world, a dubious role that was then assumed by Europe, whose sovereign debt crisis often pumped fear around the globe.

title: Gov. Paul LePage of Maine, a Christie Supporter, Makes Racially Charged Remarks
description: The first major elected official to endorse Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey for president made racially charged remarks this week about drug dealers entering his state and impregnating white girls.

title: Review: Sacred and Secular, Bach Closes a Festival
description: Trinity Wall Streets wildly varied Twelfth Night Festival, 13 days densely packed with new and ancient music, ended on Wednesday with a Bach concert in St. Pauls Chapel on lower Broadway. This was the third in a flurry of Bach at One events that began on Monday and comprised the festivals homestretch.

title: Louis Langre, Mr. Mostly Mozart, Brings His Cincinnati, and Tchaikovsky, to New York
description: The French conductor Louis Langre, who has been thriving as music director of the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra since 2013, may be a little frustrated that New York audiences know him better as the music director of the Mostly Mozart Festival. He can be proud of his accomplished tenure with the festival, which was stagnating when he arrived in 2003.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: The One About the Locusts and the Regulators
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These arethe places, faces and culinary selectionsof 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Earthquakes in Oklahoma Raise Fears of a Big One
description: Oklahoma was rockedWednesday night by two of the states largest earthquakes in recent years, further fueling scientists concern that the continued burial of oil and gas wastes in seismically active areas was courting a much more powerful earthquake.

title: Cuomo Announces $1 Billion Expansion for Javits Center
