description: Listen to this weeks podcast | Subscribe: iTunes | Stitcher

title: Craig Green: Fall 2016
description: Mr. Greens fall 2016 looks.

title: Big City Book Club to Discuss We Are Not Ourselves
description: The Big City Book Club asked readers to suggest the best New York-centric books they read in 2015. A few titles cropped up frequently, but the one repeated with the most enthusiasm was We Are Not Ourselves, by Matthew Thomas, a 2014 novel about a multigenerational Irish-American family in New York. With the author, we held  a live online discussion on Thursday, Feb. 11, at 6:30 p.m. Eastern time.

title: How Al Roker and His Wife, Deborah Roberts, Spend Their Sundays
description: With the dramatic temperature changes this winter, Al Roker might need to prepare to break his own Guinness World Record, set in 2014, when he gave an uninterrupted 34-hour weather report. But the 61-year-old host and weatherman of NBCs Today is also busy promoting a book he wrote with his wife, Deborah Roberts, a correspondent for ABC, called Been There, Done That: Family Wisdom for Modern Times. It kind of highlights our differences, Ms. Roberts, who is in her 50s, said. Im a Southern belle, a little more formal, and Al is a little more of a loosey-goosey guy who grew up in Brooklyn and Queens. The couple live in a brownstone on the Upper East Side with their children, Leila, 17, and Nick, 13, and their dog, Pepper. Mr. Roker also has a daughter, Courtney, 28.

title: Former Cardinals Executive Pleads Guilty to Hacking Astros
description: Chris Correa, a former scouting director for the St. Louis Cardinals who was fired for his role in hacking the database of the Houston Astros, pleaded guilty on Friday in United States District Court in Houston to five counts of unauthorized access to a protected computer.

title: Five Drink Recipes to Sip Your Way to Wellness
description: This week, the following five people shared with T their personal recipes to cure what ails you and start the day off right in 2016.

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Lena Dunham
description: For his bookshop and website One Grand Books, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is the actor, writer, director and editor Lena Dunham. She shares her list exclusively with T.

title: Refugee Tried to Assist Islamic State, U.S. Says
description: HOUSTON  An Iraqi-born refugee charged with attempting to aid Islamic militants made his first court appearance on Friday, telling a judge that he needed a court-appointed lawyer because he could not afford one as federal prosecutors pushed to keep him detained without bond.

title: Review: Dragon Boat Racing, a Sea of Love and Music
Review: Go Forth Finds the Living and the Dead Bound Together
description: In the midst of death we are in life, thinks the wonderfully human Leopold Bloom, contemplating the prospect of sex among the tombstones, as he stands in a churchyard in James Joyces Ulysses.

title: Popcast: Jazz in 2015
description: Listen to this weeks podcast| Subscribe: iTunes | RSS | Stitcher| Audioboom

title: For the New York Yankees, a Troubling Trade
description: Last month, a little more than a week after the progressive movements public relations guru Trevor FitzGibbon shut down his Washington-based firm amid allegations that he had sexually harassed and assaulted colleagues and prospective employees, and two days before the controversies surrounding Bill Cosby entered a new chapter, the Yankees acquired Aroldis Chapman.

title: Hillary Clinton Emails Released by State Department
description: The State Department released about 3,000 pages of documents in the continuing disclosure of emails from Hillary Clintons private account that she used while secretary of state. Below is a selection of the released emails that provide a window into Mrs. Clintons approach to electronic communication.

title: Review: New York Philharmonic Honors Boulez, Though With Composers He Snubbed
description: Alan Gilbert announced from the podium at David Geffen Hall on Thursday that the New York Philharmonic was dedicating its coming set of concerts to Pierre Boulez, who led the orchestra from 1971 to 1977 and died on Tuesday.

title: Seattle Seahawks at Minnesota Vikings Preview
Green Bay Packers at Washington Redskins Preview
Pittsburgh Steelers at Cincinnati Bengals Preview
Friday Night Music: Das Reygold? Das Rengold?
description: The four Star Wars movies  we will ignore the prequels  may not be high art, but they are sophisticated creations, full of knowing references to everything from samurai armor to Weimar. And John Williams knew from the start that he was composing a Wagnerian opera cycle:

title: You Dont Need More Free Time
description: AMERICANS work some of the longest hours in the Western world, and many struggle to achieve a healthy balance between work and life. As a result, there is an understandable tendency to assume that the problem we face is one of quantity: We simply do not have enough free time. If I could just get a few more hours off work each week, you might think, I would be happier.

title: A Group Show, Curated by an Artist Who Hates Group Shows
description: The artist Mark Flood plays curator this winter with The Future Is Ow at Marlborough Chelsea. The prophetically titled exhibition gathers together the most futuristic work of the Houstonians artist circle, which includes Chris Bexar, Paul Kremer, El Franco Lee II and Susie Rosmarin. Billed as a group show governed by a common interest in digital printing, it celebrates years of fruitful friendship both in and out of the studio  and the informal layout, which includes a mattress floor and plywood fortresses, is more reminiscent of a clubhouse than an exhibition. I get the idea and the title for a show at the same time, explains Flood, who has been collecting his peers work for decades. I dont think the future is going to look like a James Bond movie; I think it will be some shelter where everyone sits on the floor surrounded by art. Here, a look at Floods brave new world.

title: New York Jail Agency Seeks to Delay Ending Isolation for Young Adults
description: After a series of assaults on guards at Rikers Island, the New York City Correction Department is seeking to delay a plan announced last year to eliminate the use of solitary confinement citywide for inmates ages 18 to 21.

title: Pictures of the Day: Yemen and Elsewhere
description: Yemen and Elsewhere: Pictures of the Day

title: In Aramco I.P.O., Questions of Splitting Revenue With Saudi Government
description: On the face of it, buying shares in Saudi Aramco  the worlds largest oil company  is a no-brainer for any investor, even with the price of crude threatening to fall below $30 a barrel. But dig a little deeper and a potential initial public offering of Saudi Arabias wholly owned state oil producer comes with significant risks that could outweigh its access to the kingdoms vast reserves of crude.

title: Great White Shark Dies After Three Days in Captivity
description: The worlds only captive great white shark has died just three days after joining an exhibit at a Japanese aquarium.

title: Seven Male Models to Watch This Season
description: As London Collections: Men starts across the pond, T and the casting director Arianna Pradarelli pick the runways most exciting new faces  some making their debuts, others in their second seasons.

description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These arethe places, faces and culinary selectionsof 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Hundreds of Syrians Are Turned Back at Beirut Airport
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Four hundred Syrians who were trying to fly to Turkey were stopped at the Beirut airport on Friday and were being forced to return to Damascus instead, in a chaotic episode that illustrated how options are narrowing for those trying to flee the war in Syria.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

description: To the Editor:

title: San Francisco Office Rents Pass Manhattan as Most Expensive in Country
description: Move over Manhattan: Office rents in San Francisco have eclipsed those in New Yorks costliest borough as the most expensive in the country.

title: Seeing Mirs Majorca Studio, Just the Way He Kept It
description: PALMA, Majorca  In 1938, the Spanish artist Joan Mir, then 45, was living a precarious existence in Paris, moving from one insufficient studio to the next. His situation was scarcely better than it had been in Spain, where he had painted in tiny cubicles where I could hardly turn around, he wrote that year in I Dream of a Large Studio, an essay for a French art review.

title: For a Local Sinatra, Construction, Crooning and Despair
description: Just after 1 a.m. on July 28, Leonora Russo woke to a commotion at her home in Howard Beach, Queens. First came the yelps of her daughters Chihuahua, then the crash of her front door slamming shut. By the time she reached her window, Ms. Russo saw only a black Dodge Dakota receding into the night.

title: Review: American Realness, a Festival of Audacious Movements and Slitherings
description: Though it may feel out of the way  far, far east on the Lower East Side  theres no missing American Realness once you get there. In its seventh edition, this annual festival of contemporary performance announces itself boldly, its name projected in big block letters on the facade of Abrons Arts Center, home to most of the festivals 18 boundary-blurring productions.

title: Donald Trumps Son to Hunt Deer in Iowa
description: Donald J. Trumps son is going hunting for votes  and for deer.

title: French Proposal to Strip Citizenship Over Terrorism Sets Off Alarms
description: PARIS  The French police have carried out thousands of heavy-handed searches since the Nov. 13 Paris attacks, and a raft of new laws is poised to permanently concentrate even more power in the hands of the Interior Ministry.

title: London International Mime Festival:Wordless Physicality That Smashes the Glass Box
description: LONDON  Mime: Nowadays, you say the word, and people feel sorry for you, sighs Joseph Seelig.

title: A Way to Start Paying College Athletes
description: Joe Nocera is the new sports business columnist for The New York Times.

title: Think Like a Doctor: Thunder in the Head Solved
description: On Thursday we challenged Well readers with a difficult real-life case of a middle aged man who developed chest pain that radiated to his neck, followed by a persistent and loud whooshing in his ear. You were asked to figure out what was causing this patients pulsatile tinnitus and why he developed it. While several of you got half of the answer, as of this writing, no one put together both halves of the puzzle.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing: Cologne, Paul LePage, Philadelphia
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Donald Trump and Bernie Sanders Hold Big Leads in New Hampshire Poll
description: Donald J. Trump trails Senator Ted Cruz in Iowa but has a commanding double-digit lead in New Hampshire with less than a month to go before voting begins in the first contests in the Republican presidential nominating fight, according to new Fox News surveys.

title: Behind the Oregon Standoff, Youll Find Big Questions About Democracy
description: Arguments about federal land have been a feature of American political life since the birth of the nation. The details of the controversies may vary, but the theme is always the same: How should we use federal lands for the collective and individual benefit of the nation? The issue sounds abstract and philosophical. But given that the federal Bureau of Land Management administers roughly one-eighth of the nations landmass, its decisions confront the question in a very concrete way: What, fundamentally, is our land for?

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Obamas Pledge on Gun Control Sets Off Skirmish Between Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders
description: President Obamas pledge not to back any Democrat who does not support new gun-control measures set off a new skirmish late Friday between Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders, with Mr. Sanders facing fresh questions over his record on the issue.

title: Marco Rubios Iowa Supporters Beg Him: Come Visit. Often.
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa  Scott Schneidermann, one of Senator Marco Rubios supporters from northwest Iowa, saw all the hallmarks of a campaign on the upswing: a rapt audience of 200, nowhere left to sit, a crush of out-of-town reporters.

title: Deal Means No Fraud Retrial for Ex-Chairman of Dewey & LeBoeuf
description: Steven H. Davis, the former chairman of Dewey & LeBoeuf, will not face another criminal trial over allegations of accounting fraud at the once mighty New York law firm, but he will remain in legal limbo for the next five years.

title: Ted Stanley, Whose Sons Illness Inspired Philanthropy, Dies at 84
description: In 1988, something went terribly wrong with Jonathan Stanleys brain. A college junior, he was visiting a friend in New York when he suddenly suspected that secret agents were pursuing him. For three days, he raced through the citys streets and subways without food or water until the police found him penniless in a deli perched naked on a plastic milk crate.

title: Greater Risk of Crash Prompts Hyundai Elantra Recall
description: Hyundai is recalling 155,000 2011-12 Elantra models because the electronic stability control may malfunction, suddenly reducing engine power while trying to alter the direction of the vehicle, according to a report posted in December on the website of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. Hyundai blamed a malfunctioning sensor on the electronic stability control system, which is supposed to detect if the vehicle is sliding in a direction at odds with how the steering wheel is turned. The recall is necessary because the sensor may activate the electronic stability control when it is not needed, increasing the risk of a crash, the automaker told regulators. Hyundai said it was not aware of any accidents or injuries related to the defect. Some owners began complaining to regulators as early as 2013. It feels as if the auto is driving on flat wheels or on ice, a New Jersey owner wrote in 2013.

title: Evening Hours | New Years Eve at the Metropolitan Opera
description: Plus: An Art Deco party on New Years Day.

title: U.S. Gives States 2 More Years to Meet Drivers License Standards
description: The Department of Homeland Security has given states an extra two years to comply with federal requirements to issue driving licenses with extra safety features, meaning that residents of noncompliant states will have until January 2018 before having to use a passport or other official identification to board a domestic flight.

title: Brazil: Protest Over Higher Bus Fares Erupt in 3 Cities
description: Protests flared in the cities of So Paulo, Rio de Janeiro and Belo Horizonte on Friday night over increases in bus fares, reflecting resentment over efforts by the municipal authorities to cover budget shortfalls during Brazils most severe economic crisis in decades. Anti-riot police units clashed with protesters in downtown So Paulo. The unrest drew comparisons to the much larger demonstrations that shook cities across Brazil in 2013, which also crystallized over increases in bus fares. Some of the demonstrators in So Paulo destroyed buses, ransacked banking offices and threw rocks and bottles at the police, who used tear gas. Clashes also erupted between the police and protesters in downtown Rio de Janeiro.

title: Bill Cunningham | Winter Flair
description: Head wraps were inventively stylish, and fur bonnets were a favorite. Men wore shearling coats, and one woman swirled in a pleated Chanel coat.

title: Cause of Crises? For Rio Governor, Life Incriminates Art
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Just seven months before the start of the Olympic Games here, Rio de Janeiro State has declared a public health emergency, plunging oil royalties have officials scrambling to pay pensions, and assailants enjoy such free rein that muggings in downtown Rio are a regular feature on television news programs.

title: Bill Cunningham | Winter Flair
description: The doggies on Fifth Avenue were snuggled into winter coats, and the fountain in Bryant Park was a cascade of icicles. Head wraps were inventively stylish, and fur bonnets were a favorite. Men wore shearling coats, and one woman swirled in a pleated Chanel coat. Cat-eye bags provided a touch of whimsy.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: Benghazi, and the Benefits of Spanking
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These arethe places, faces and culinary selectionsof 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Florida: Ex-Leader of Salvadoran Military Deported
description: The authorities have deported General Jos Guillermo Garca, who was minister of defense in El Salvador in the 1980s, after an immigration judge found that he had a role in human rights violations in that period, including in the 1980 slaying of Archbishop scar Arnulfo Romero while the prelate was saying Mass in San Salvador. In a decision in February 2014, the judge found that General Garca, a close ally of the United States during the Salvadoran civil war, should be deported for assisting numerous acts of torture and extrajudicial killing while he was command, a Department of Homeland Security news release said. An appeal by General Garca, 82, of the lower court ruling was denied on Dec. 8. He was arrested on Dec. 17 at his home in Florida, where he had been living for many years, and was flown to San Salvador on Friday.

title: California: Gas Leaking in Neighborhood to Be Burned
description: Air-quality regulators have reached an agreement with the Southern California Gas Company to capture and burn off some of the natural gas escaping from a blown-out well, which continues to pump tons of methane, a powerful greenhouse gas, into the air and has sickened residents in the nearby Los Angeles neighborhood of Porter Ranch. The gas company will take measures within 10 days to use carbon absorbers and thermal oxidizers to capture and burn off some of the gas, according to the regulators. Though regulators still do not know exactly how much gas is escaping, they acknowledged it would not be possible to capture all of it. The agreement requires the gas company to conduct extensive air-quality monitoring, and to pay for a study of the leaks effect on residents health.

title: Firehouse Loses a Spotted Symbol of Healing
description: On Sept. 11, 2001, seven members of Ladder Company 20 on Lafayette Street in the NoLIta neighborhood of Manhattan were killed in the collapse of the World Trade Center, about a mile and a half away, along with seven members of Squad 18, which shared the firehouse at the time with the ladder company.

title: Lawfulness of Strip Search by Police Officer Is Under Scrutiny
description: Late one night in 2014, Tynneal Grant faced the kind of subterranean dilemma that often confronts New Yorkers: an absent-minded swipe of a MetroCard onto the wrong subway platform, followed by vague instructions from a ticket booth clerk about how to cross to the right one without spending another $2.50 on fare.

title: Pulled Once More Toward the Healing Power of Art
description: The death of her mother in 2011 left Tanya Nickolan inconsolable.

title: Stephen W. Bosworth, U.S. Diplomat Who Helped Oust Ferdinand Marcos, Dies at 76
description: Stephen W. Bosworth, a former American ambassador who pulled off a diplomatic coup in 1986 by persuading the Philippine dictator Ferdinand E. Marcos to allow free elections, and then personally delivered Washingtons pink slip to him when he refused to accept defeat, died on Jan. 4 at his home in Boston. He was 76.

title: A Republican Muslim Out to Expand the Ranks
description: WASHINGTON  Wearing a black hijab and a Pakistani ankle-length gown, Saba Ahmed lined up one morning inside the Rayburn House Office Building here, waiting to lobby members of the Armed Services Committee.

title: Over 200 Members of German Choir Were Abused, Investigator Says
description: BERLIN  At least 231 children who sang in a boys choir led for 30 years by the brother of former Pope Benedict XVI were abused over a period of almost four decades, a lawyer investigating reports of wrongdoing said Friday.

title: A New Old Plan for Penn Station
description: You could have gotten dizzy following the bouncing governor, Andrew Cuomo, around New York in the last few days, ahead of his State of the State address next week. To generate excitement about his plans for transportation and infrastructure, he has been leading a road show, spreading proposals one by one, far and wide. Between Proposal 5 (lower Thruway tolls!) and 7 (a bigger Javits Convention Center!), was one to make a New Yorker perk up: Proposal 6, transforming Penn Station.

title: Andr Courrges, Fashion Designer Who Redefined Couture, Dies at 92
description: Andr Courrges, the French designer who brought the space age to the catwalk and into the closets of women like Catherine Deneuve and Jacqueline Kennedy, died on Thursday at his home in Neuilly-sur-Seine outside Paris. He was 92.

title: Homeland Security Looked Past Antigovernment Movement, Ex-Analyst Says
description: Daryl Johnson once worked in the branch of the Department of Homeland Security that studied the threats posed by antigovernment groups. His former office was shut down more than five years ago.

title: Chinas Obsolete Economic Strategy
description: It was inevitable that Chinas economy would slow from its once turbocharged growth rates. But its leaders have made so many mistakes in recent months that they have turned what should have been a benign, natural slowdown into a chaotic descent.

title: Trump and Other Republicans Do the Gun Lobbys Bidding
description: Just when President Obama was attempting a reasoned debate on gun control this week, Donald Trump was engaged in his latest pandering to the gun rights crowd  vowing as president to strike down laws that bar firearms from schools. My first day, it gets signed, O.K.? Mr. Trump told a campaign rally in Vermont on Thursday. My first day. Theres no more gun-free zones.

title: Egypts Parliament Prepares for Session With Some Familiar Names
description: ISMAILIA, Egypt  As his jeep careened along a narrow country road, swerving to avoid slower traffic, Talaat el-Sewedy, a newly elected parliamentarian, juggled two cellphones as he fielded a barrage of demands from supporters.

title: Coach Takes a Big Step Back From Manziel and Favre
description: WEST DENNIS, Mass.  In many of Mike Shermans 33 years as a college and pro football coach, the winter was a time of bustle and activity.

title: Germanys Post-Cologne Hysteria
description: Berlin  ON New Years Eve, hundreds of men gathered in the plaza at the main train station in Cologne, Germany, groping and robbing scores of women as they passed by. By the end of this week the police had received 170 complaints, including 120 related to sexual assault.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: You Going to Eat Those Fries?
Dirty School Buses, Sick Kids
description: AS former state public health officials in Maryland, we were quite embarrassed and angry to learn that we had been driving around in little pollution factories, otherwise known as Volkswagen diesels. At the same time, we understand that the car owners are not the only victims of the companys deceptions. To make right by the environment and those harmed by air pollution, Volkswagen should stop sending us apologies  and should start replacing thousands of old school buses across the country.

title: Denna Laing, Who Fell During Outdoor Womens Classic, Has No Feeling in Her Legs
description: Boston Pride forward Denna Laing sustained a severe spinal cord injury after falling near the boards during the Outdoor Womens Classic on Dec. 31 at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Mass.

title: Yemen Reverses Decision to Expel U.N. Rights Envoy
description: UNITED NATIONS  The government of Yemen on Friday reversed its decision to expel a United Nations representative from the country, and its envoy to the United Nations said that he hoped for better relations with the world body.

title: Wanted: Straight Shooters
description: We have come a long way in the debate on gun safety. Well, actually we havent come anywhere at all. But weve certainly talked a lot.

title: George Elsey, One of the Last Survivors of World War II White House, Dies at 97
description: He went to the White House living quarters to hand President Franklin D. Roosevelt top-secret messages. When the first atomic bomb was dropped on Japan, he decoded the news and took it to President Harry S. Truman.

title: Center of a Defense
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Sometimes you can get yourself into habits that completely, entirely lead to your undoing. Dont worry; its the end of the week and Im just being melodramatic. Im really talking about puzzle solving.

title: Effort to Vacate Mans Murder Verdict Focuses on Work by Detective in Case
description: During his 1992 murder trial in the killing of an off-duty correction officer, John D. Bunn, then an illiterate 15-year-old, took his lawyers advice and did not testify. Things were different on Friday, as Mr. Bunn, now 39, took the witness stand in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn and testified tearfully about the case in an effort to have his conviction vacated.

title: New York to Add 300 Shelter Beds for Homeless Young People
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio, in his latest attempt to address New York Citys homelessness crisis, unveiled a plan on Friday to add 300 shelter beds for older teenagers, an age group that advocates say is underserved and especially vulnerable to suicide and sex trafficking.

title: Bronx Man, Arrested in Slashing, Is Charged in Other Attacks
description: A Bronx man arrested in the slashing of a womans face this week in Manhattan has been charged in a separate case with attacking a woman two months ago on a Midtown sidewalk, the authorities said on Friday.

title: Knicks Battle to End but Cant Faze Spurs, Who Win 31st Straight at Home
description: SAN ANTONIO  Like straight-A students in high school, the San Antonio Spurs have a way of making other teams seem inadequate. It has been this way for about a decade and a half.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: Abortion Comes Up, Briefly
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These are the places, faces and culinary selections of 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: Mad Max: Fury Road, a critics favorite last year, makes its way to cable. Judge Jeanine Pirro takes on the case of Steven Avery, the subject of the Netflix hit Making a Murderer. And Jason Sudeikis and Alison Brie try to avoid commitment  and each other  in Sleeping With Other People.

title: Corrections: January 9, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Foreign companies are starting to understand that you need a cute mascot to sell anything to Japanese people.

title: Doctors Unionize to Resist the Medical Machine
description: Early in the morning on Aug. 12, 2015, a 68-year-old man named Barry turned up at PeaceHealth Sacred Heart Medical Center in Springfield, Ore., confused and feverish.

title: The Lark-Owl Scale: When Couples Sleep Patterns Diverge
description: I learned about my friends sleep problems by accident. We were having a cookout with three families not long ago, and the children were off playing by themselves. The couples sat down for an adult conversation that might otherwise have turned to Hollywood, parenting or Donald Trump, when suddenly one of the women announced she had a confession: She never got to see her husband.

title: Parasitic Infections Common in Roman Times
description: Two thousand years ago, the ancient Romans introduced public multiseat toilets, hand-washing stations, sewage systems, aqueducts for drinking water, and heated public baths.

title: A Day at the Races
description: Wealthy landowners and businessmen in Punjab keep up some erstwhile royal traditions, including greyhound races.

title: Chasing the Lure of a Royal Past With Greyhound Racing in Punjab
description: FARIDKOT, India  A column of 4-by-4s turned off a dusty road in rural Punjab last week, past ox carts and farmworkers holding sickles, and came to a stop in an unmarked field. Servants circled around to the backs of the vehicles and unloaded, ever so carefully, the animals everyone had come to see.

title: Campus Sex  With a Syllabus
description: HARTFORD  Where did I learn about sexual consent?

title: Guns to Gloves
description: After his friend was shot on Christmas Eve in 2013, Chris Wilmore  known as Scarface  began recruiting for his backyard fight club, as a way to encourage people to settle disputes with gloves, not guns.

title: A Backyard Fight Club as an Alternative to Gun Violence
description: HARRISONBURG, Va.  Chris Wilmore was devastated after his close friend was shot to death on Christmas Eve in 2013, in a dispute over a woman.

title: The Week in Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took followers from the campaign trail in wintry Iowa to a wedding in Xinjiang Province, China.

title: E. Tautz: Fall 2016
description: E. Tautz presents looks for fall 2016.

title: A Tour of Animatronic Tails and a Potemkin Village at International CES
description: As usual, lot of strange stuff graced the floor of International CES, the consumer electronics trade show that took place in Las Vegas this week. There was a Roomba-like robot that cleans your grill  perfect for that post-labor future in which were all too lazy to spend 30 seconds running a brush across the barbecue. In another booth was a robot that roams around a tennis court picking up balls: Ballboys, youve just been disrupted.

title: Agi & Sam: Fall 2016
description: Agi & Sams fall 2016 show.

title: New York Police Officer Is Shot Breaking Up a Brawl in the Bronx
description: It was around 2 a.m. on Saturday when police officers from the 40th Precincts anticrime unit arrived at the scene of a large brawl in the South Bronx that officials said involved dozens of people, some armed with bats, knives and guns.

title: Astrid Andersen: Fall 2016
description: Fall 2016 looks from Astrid Andersen.

title: Broken System Allows ISIS to Profit From Looted Antiquities
description: SHUMEN, Bulgaria  Acting on a tip, the police raided four homes in eastern Bulgaria, looking for contraband that regularly traverses this country on the way to markets in Western Europe and America. In one rusting shed behind an apartment block here, they found a cache of looted antiquities: 19 classical statues and fragments of marble or limestone.

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: Cars With, and Without, Drivers
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: How Crazy Are the North Koreans?
description: WASHINGTON  AS someone who has spent most of the past 25 years of his professional life in the United States government, think tanks and academia trying to stop the North Korean nuclear weapons program, I found last weeks nuclear test and the events that followed depressingly familiar. They reminded me of Captain Renaults famous line from Casablanca just before he shuts down Ricks Caf: Im shocked, shocked to find that gambling is going on in here! The reactions to North Koreas 2006, 2009 and 2013 nuclear tests were the same  shock. Yet a decade has gone by and the North Korean nuclear threat has only grown.

title: SoHo. TriBeCa. And ReBeCha?
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Coach: Fall 2016
description: The fall 2016 show from Coach.

title: Marco Rubio Shows N.F.L. Fans Hes One of Them, and Smiles
description: With trick catches, textbook throwing form and more than a few smiles, Marco Rubio is showing a lighter side  both self-assured and self-deprecating  to football fans in a new ad to be released this weekend, titled Football.

title: Lou Dalton: Fall 2016
description: Lou Daltons take on fall 2016.

title: Christopher Cabrera of Xactly: Learning to Stay Above the Drama
description: This interview with Christopher Cabrera, founder and C.E.O. of Xactly, which provides employee-incentive software, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: One Market Prediction Is Sure: Wall Street Will Be Wrong
description: The stock market ended 2015 with a whimper and began the new year with a shudder. Even before Wall Street showed up for business on Monday morning, stocks fell 7 percent in China, and the turmoil that started in Asian markets cascaded around the world.

title: Drawing on Experience to Teach Independent Living Skills
description: Maricar Marquez, 44, is an assistant program coordinator for independent living at the Helen Keller National Center in Sands Point, N.Y.

title: Variety: A Wild Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Welcome to our first acrostic puzzle of 2016! I hope youve bundled up, because we are headed outdoors with Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon to explore nature and the circle of life.

title: Challenging Uber, Lyft Bets on a Road Wide Enough for Two
description: The word monopoly has a distinctly nefarious ring to it, conjuring up images of thuggish industrialists in smoky rooms, scheming to undermine their rivals.

title: Tom Coughlin Is Expected to Talk With Eagles About Coaching Job
description: When he stepped down as Giants coach in a news conference on Tuesday, Tom Coughlin said he had not necessarily given up on being a football coach again. The Giants had offered Coughlin a front-office job.

title: For Republicans, Mounting Fears of Lasting Split
description: The Republican Party is facing a historic split over its fundamental principles and identity, as its once powerful establishment grapples with an eruption of class tensions, ethnic resentments and mistrust among working-class conservatives who are demanding a presidential nominee who represents their interests.

title: Mexico Moves to Extradite Drug Kingpin Called El Chapo to the U.S.
description: MEXICO CITY  After long resisting requests from Washington, the Mexican government is moving toward extraditing Joaqun Guzmn Loera, the Mexican drug lord known as El Chapo, to the United States to face drug and murder charges there, Mexican officials said on Saturday.

title: There Are Debates That Even a Playoff Will Never Settle
description: Who was the national champion of the 1978 college football season? The world may never know.

title: A Start-Up That Aims to Bring Back the Farm-to-Vase Bouquet
description: Where Christina Stembel lives in California, she is surrounded by flower farmers, yet 80 percent of the flowers sold in the United States are imported. She is trying to help change that percentage with her San Francisco-based company, Farmgirl Flowers.

title: Dorthaan Kirk Is Newarks First Lady of Jazz
description: Dorthaan Kirk answers to a lot of names.

title: At Mens Shows, Vibrant Prints and Inventive Rain Gear
description: For fall/winter 2016, Craig Green creatively adorned anoraks, Topman focused on burnt golds and florals  and Alex Mullins was inspired by waiting in the rain.

title: At Westchester Broadway Theater, Show Boat With or Without Dinner
In Hartford Schools, Granting Artistic License to Learn
description: Students from Patricia Wakefields fifth-grade class at Rawson Elementary School in Hartford positioned their bodies collectively, to form a turtle. One boy sat on the floor to be the turtles head, another sat behind him to be the tail, and three children stood on each side and bent at the waist, arms outstretched, to form a bridge-like shell.

title: When She Gets Into the Kitchen, a Young Woman Gets in the Zone
description: Four mental illnesses, three suicide attempts and two absentee parents have left a collective mark on Jaslie Pulinario.

title: One Town at a Time in Iowa, With Ted Cruz
description: Senator Ted Cruz recently set off on a six-day, 28-town bus tour, which ends Saturday, and we sent one of our reporters, Matt Flegenheimer, along with him. Here are some interesting, selected moments from the tour.

title: As Fatherhood Nears, Love Is the High Score
description: BRISBANE, Australia  When Ben Mitchell won his semifinal match at the Australian Open wild-card playoffs in December, his girlfriends reaction was underwhelming, and he knew why.

title: Hillary Clinton Ad Blasts Republicans, Saying Only She Can Stop Them
description: Hillary Clinton has released an aggressive new attack ad, fanning fears about the main Republican presidential candidates to make the point that she, and no other Democrat, can stop them.

title: Museum Explores Trials and Triumphs of Female Artists
description: At first glance, You Go, Girl! Celebrating Women Artists, the exuberantly titled exhibition at the Heckscher Museum of Art, looks like many other surveys of American art, especially on Long Island, filled with lots of landscapes and abstracts. But step a little closer  close enough to notice details and read the texts on the walls  and youll learn about the difficulties that female artists have faced and how theyve adapted or triumphed over them.

title: Myanmars Peace Prize Winner and Crimes Against Humanity
description: SITTWE, Myanmar  SOON the world will witness a remarkable sight: a beloved Nobel Peace Prize winner presiding over 21st-century concentration camps.

title: A Year of Challenges in the News Business
description: What is the biggest domestic story of the year ahead for The New York Times? Pretty clearly, its the presidential election.

title: Germany on the Brink
description: ON New Years Eve, in the shadow of Colognes cathedral, crowds of North African and Middle Eastern men accosted women out for the nights festivities. They surrounded them, groped them, robbed them. Two women were reportedly raped.

title: To Be Happier, Start Thinking More About Your Death
description: WANT a better 2016? Try thinking more about your impending demise.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Scientists, Give Up Your Emails
description: IN recent months, the Obama administration has been locked in a battle with Representative Lamar Smith of Texas, the Republican chairman of the House Committee on Science, Space and Technology, who disputes the scientific consensus on climate change.

title: Obnoxiousness Is the New Charisma
description: IN a typical presidential campaign, the most successful candidates lay claim to leadership with their high-mindedness. They reach for poetry. They focus on lifting people up, not tearing them down. They beseech voters to be their biggest, best selves.

title: St. Teresa and the Single Ladies
description: vila, Spain  I made the mistake of falling for a man who wants a wife. I should clarify that I do not mean he wants me to be his wife. Men dont look at me and think Id make good wife material. Maybe because of how much I swear. But I go to Berlin to see him, he tells me his future plans for marriage and family, and I understand that I am not compatible with those plans. Then I flee, to huddle in the backs of cathedrals, an impulse that I do not fully understand.

title: Drone Regulations Should Focus on Safety and Privacy
description: Though it would have been inconceivable just a few years ago, among the most popular gifts this past holiday season was the drone. Increasingly coveted by hobbyists and businesses, these devices flew (as it were) off the shelves and into living rooms by the hundreds of thousands.

title: The Ideological Roots of the Oregon Standoff
description: IT is tempting to dismiss the antigovernment gunmen who took control of an animal refuge in Oregon on Jan. 2 as fanatics working at the fringes of American politics. But if the methods used by the rancher Ammon Bundy to seize the federal property were radical, the ideological roots of the operation were somewhat more mainstream.

title: The Joy of Psyching Myself Out
description: IS it possible to think scientifically and creatively at once? Can you be both a psychologist and a writer?

title: Is the Hoverboard Cool?
description: I RECENTLY visited a big-box electronics store, and decided to test-ride a hoverboard.

title: As College Footballs Popularity Expands, So Does Its Champions Jewelry
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  After Alabamas athletic director suggested last month that if college athletes were paid, many would spend the money on tattoos and rims, he clarified the statement as a frivolous reference to a recent scandal at another university. We hope to educate our student-athletes, he said, that those are not wise investments.

title: Casely-Hayford: Fall 2016
description: The latest designs from Casely-Hayford.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: Maybe Well Stick With Miniature Golf
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These are the places, faces and culinary selections of 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Leo, Hillary and Their Bears
description: WASHINGTON  ITS hard to say which of the three monomaniacal, monumentally grueling quests is the most riveting.

title: Egypts President Turns to Religion to Bolster His Authority
description: CAIRO  When President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi opened a much-heralded extension to the Suez Canal in August, the official Friday Prayer sermon that week hailed it as a gift from God.

title: Review: Eastern Comforts at Roots Asian Kitchen
description: On a recent weekday evening, Roots Asian Kitchen, pleasantly dim but for strings of white lights, looked doubly inviting tucked in between the glare of its strip mall neighbors.

title: At the Supreme Court, a Big Threat to Unions
description: A case the Supreme Court will hear on Monday morning threatens to undermine a four-decade-old ruling that upheld a key source of funding for public-sector unions, the last major bastion of unionized workers in America.

title: Review: Butchers Bar & Grill, a Newcomer in Williston Park
description: You might get confused if youre looking for the Butchers Bar & Grill, a steakhouse in Williston Park that opened in November. The restaurant is more commonly known as the BBG, which is the name on the sign youll see over the door as you enter.

title: America and Its Fellow Executioners
description: Aside from the barbarism and injustice of Saudi Arabias execution of 47 men on Jan. 2, the state-sponsored killings  some by beheading  bucked a strong trend against capital punishment in most of the world. According to the annual report of Amnesty International, executions were carried out in 22 countries in 2014, the year covered; there were 25 in 2004. The total number of people known to have been executed also fell. To its disgrace, the United States was still among the five countries that most often used capital punishment  alongside China, Saudi Arabia, Iran and Iraq  but the number of executions in America continued to decline.

title: How to Fix the Countrys Failing Schools. And How Not To.
description: A QUARTER-CENTURY ago, Newark and nearby Union City epitomized the failure of American urban school systems. Students, mostly poor minority and immigrant children, were performing abysmally. Graduation rates were low. Plagued by corruption and cronyism, both districts had a revolving door of superintendents. New Jersey officials threatened to take over Union Citys schools in 1989 but gave them a one-year reprieve instead. Six years later, state education officials, decrying the gross mismanagement of the Newark schools, seized control there.

title: Back in Postseason, the Redskins Move On From a Loss That Lingered
description: ASHBURN, Va.  For a long time, the Washington Redskins have been trying to exorcise the demons of their last playoff appearance. On Jan. 6, 2013, they were riding a seven-game winning streak, and Robert Griffin III, a rookie sensation and franchise quarterback in the making, was the N.F.L.s hottest story. The Redskins even grabbed a 14-0 lead in their wild-card game against the Seattle Seahawks before a hobbled Griffin tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee, and his team lost, 24-14.

title: Review: Cielo, an Italian Restaurant in Wilton, Brims with Variety
description: Emily and Hakan Basaran enjoyed some success with Carpe Diem, their Italian restaurant in New Canaan, but the building that housed it was going to be taken over by a post office, so they looked for a new location.

title: Two Sides of Gratitude
description: Readers respond to an essay about gratitudes rise to self-help celebrity status.

title: A Placebo Treatment for Pain
description: THE crisis of painkiller addiction is becoming increasingly personal: Sixteen percent of Americans know someone who has died from a prescription painkiller overdose, according to a recent Kaiser Family Foundation survey; 9 percent have seen a family member or close friend die.

title: Tom McCarthy
description: Tom McCarthy is the director and co-writer of Spotlight, a film about the journalists who exposed widespread sexual abuse of children by Roman Catholic priests in Boston and the wider institutional cover-up.

title: Florence King, Writer Who Wielded an Acerbic Wit, Dies at 80
description: Florence King, a columnist, author and professional misanthrope who was a constitutional crosspatch about all manner of things  in particular those things that smacked in the slightest of what she decried as touchy-feely late-20th-century liberalism  died on Wednesday at her home in Fredericksburg, Va. She was 80.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: Look Out Below
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These are the places, faces and culinary selections of 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Review: At Savannahs Southern House, Thinking Outside the Skillet
description: At Savannahs Southern House, the vibe is jolly and hospitable; the setting clean and airy; the cuisine unique in Westchester County. Prices are moderate and portions are huge. The restaurant supplies big cloth napkins for fingers glossy from sauce and deep-fried chicken. Not least, many entrees are available in half portions, a mercy that the prudent might consider, especially if one of the lovely desserts figures into the dinner plan.

title: Rick Cluchey Dies at 82; Prison Theater Was His Redemption
description: Rick Cluchey had never been in a theater  not even to rob one, as he was fond of saying  before he was convicted of armed robbery when he was 21 and sentenced to life in prison.

title: Vikings Coachs Trouble With Winning: Enjoying It
description: EDEN PRAIRIE, Minn.  Few N.F.L. coaches savor winning less than Mike Zimmer, the second-year head coach of the Minnesota Vikings.

title: Sibling: Fall 2016
description: Siblings fall 2016 show.

title: After Assaults in Cologne, Merkel Proposes Tougher Asylum Laws
description: COLOGNE, Germany  As Chancellor Angela Merkel proposed tougher laws regulating asylum seekers in the wake of the New Years Eve assaults on scores of women in Cologne, the city again bristled with violent tension on Saturday.

title: With No Winners in Powerball Drawing, Jackpot Is Expected to Surpass $1 Billion
description: In one of the most affluent neighborhoods of New York City, a pocket on the Upper East Side with stately buildings and ice cream shops where scoops can be as expensive as entrees, a street sweeper waited in line on Saturday to make a modest wager to join the economic ranks of those who live on the blocks where he works.

title: Rangers Take Unlikely Lead but Are Still Seeking a Turnaround
description: After Derek Stepan came agonizingly close to sending the Rangers to their most thrilling win of the season, Alex Ovechkin went to work.

title: Carmelo Anthony Shares the Load by Shooting Less and Trusting More
description: SAN ANTONIO  The words tumbled from Carmelo Anthonys mouth, louder and faster than usual.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: The Tattooed Hunk Had a Familiar Face
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These are the places, faces and culinary selections of 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Flint Wants Safe Water, and Someone to Answer for Its Crisis
description: FLINT, Mich.  A caravan of Genesee County sheriffs office cruisers snaked its way through the streets here on Thursday, doling out water filters and jugs of water to frustrated and terrified residents who have been trying to cope for more than a year with the public health crisis that has been flowing out of their taps.

title: Chinas Hunger for Commodities Wanes, and Pain Spreads Among Producers
description: Chile is expanding its largest open-pit copper mine below the northern desert to dig up 1.7 billion additional tons of minerals, even as metal prices plummet around the globe.

title: Political Promises
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  We here in the United States are coming up on an election year, on the off chance that you have recently been residing in an underground bunker with no access to media or the Internet. So its not surprising that we have been given a chance to practice listening with a straight face to all of the promises we can expect to hear as the presidential campaign comes to its ultimate, teeth-rattling conclusion.

title: Christopher Shannon: Fall 2016
description: Christopher Shannon presents looks for next fall.

title: All-Bedouin Tech Company Hints at Shift in Israel
description: ABU QREINAT, Israel  A resident of a ramshackle sprawl of shacks and houses in the Negev Desert, Rabaa Al-Hawashleh is an unlikely worker in Israels high-tech industry.

title: Separatists in Catalonia Select Leader to Avoid Vote
description: MADRID  The Catalan separatist parties on Saturday reached an 11th-hour agreement to replace the leader of the region, Artur Mas, and avoid new elections that risked derailing Catalonias push to secede from the rest of Spain.

title: A Tumultuous Housing Program in Algeria
description: ALGIERS  The air was festive on a recent morning as families moved into their new apartments, courtesy of the Algerian government. Womens shrieks of joy sounded from the balconies as children tried out the swings beneath a large banner that declared, Our aim, Algiers, a capital without slums.

title: Cubans Difficult Journey Through Central America
description: A circuitous route from the island to the United States has been blocked as Nicaragua, an ally of Cuba, refused to let a large wave of migrants pass from Costa Rica.

title: Cubans, Fearing Loss of Favored Status in U.S., Rush to Make an Arduous Journey
description: LA CRUZ, Costa Rica  In Gretchen Lpezs slumber, during whatever winks of sleep she could get in a crowded open air shelter, she dreamed she was sending money to her mother in Cuba to renovate her crumbling house and buy delicious food.

title: Republican Candidates, Minus Donald Trump and Ted Cruz, Play Nice at Poverty Forum
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  After a week filled with attack ads and months of caustic debates, six of the Republicans running for president gathered in the same place on Saturday and showed they can, after all, get along.

title: Stephanopoulizing
description: Glenn Hubbard and I will be on This Week tomorrow. I believe that were talking about The Force Awakens. Also Marco Rubios boots. Possibly some economics.

title: Insurers Say Costs Are Climbing as More Enroll Past Health Act Deadline
description: WASHINGTON  Eager to maximize coverage under the Affordable Care Act, the Obama administration has allowed large numbers of people to sign up for insurance after the deadlines in the last two years, destabilizing insurance markets and driving up premiums, health insurance companies say.

title: Taliban Step Up Urban Assaults, Testing the Mettle of Afghan Forces
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The urban attacks are suddenly coming at a dizzying pace  five in the first week of January alone. Three were relatively simple even if massive bombings, but in the others, Taliban gunmen entered important cities, seized buildings and hostages when they could, then set off their explosives vests when capture seemed imminent, sometimes after hours of fighting.

title: Chiefs End 22-Year Run of Playoff Futility by Thrashing the Texans
description: HOUSTON  The last time the Kansas City Chiefs won a playoff game, Joe Montana was their quarterback, Michael Jordan wanted a tryout with the Chicago White Sox, and Sonic the Hedgehog was all the rage. The teams owner, Clark Hunt, was 28 years old.

title: Girls Creator Lena Dunham Visits Iowa on Tour to Support Hillary Clinton
description: IOWA CITY  When Hannah Horvath, the lead character of the hit HBO series Girls, arrived in Iowa during the shows fourth season, the Brooklyn transplant was struck by the quietude, the cheap real estate and the fresh produce that is pervasive in Americas heartland. The infatuation faded, however, and she soon quit and returned home.

title: Sean Penn Met With El Chapo for Interview in His Hide-Out
description: Joaqun Guzmn Loera, the Mexican drug lord known as El Chapo, started out in business not long after turning 6, selling oranges and soft drinks. By 15, he said in an interview conducted in a jungle clearing by the actor and director Sean Penn for Rolling Stone magazine, he had begun to grow marijuana and poppies because there was no other way for his impoverished family to survive.

title: Remembering Hadiya Pendleton
description: During a State of the Union address in 2013, the president introduced Nate and Cleo Pendleton, parents of Hadiya, who was killed in Chicago by gun violence at age 15.

title: Long Dormant, the First Super Bowl Is Resurrected
description: NFL Network will show Super Bowl I on Friday night, which should please and surprise anyone who thought copies of the game had been lost, erased or turned to video dust.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: T-Shirts and Votes Must Be Earned
description: Ted Cruz is on a six-day, 28-town swing through Iowa. These are the places, faces and culinary selections of 2016s first proper bus tour.

title: Historian Group Rejects a Resolution Condemning Israel
description: ATLANTA  The movement among some scholars to condemn Israel suffered a setback on Saturday, when members of the American Historical Association, the nations largest organization for professional historians, rejected a resolution condemning what was characterized as Israels interference with the right to education for Palestinians in the West Bank and Gaza.

title: Donald Trump Ramps Up Attacks on Ted Cruzs Eligibility
description: OTTUMWA, Iowa  Donald J. Trump sharply escalated his rhetoric about Senator Ted Cruzs eligibility to be president on Saturday, suggesting that because he was born in Canada there were unanswered questions about whether he met the constitutional requirement to be a natural-born citizen.

title: Ted Cruzs Iowa Bus Tour: The Trip Ends
Woman Raped by 5 Men in Brooklyn Playground, Police Say
description: A young woman was walking with her father in a Brooklyn playground on Thursday night when five men approached them, pulled out a gun, ordered her father to leave and then took turns raping her, the police said on Saturday.

title: Spencer Stone, Airman Who Halted Attack on Train, Will Attend State of the Union
description: WASHINGTON  Staff Sgt. Spencer Stone of the Air Force was driving to work on a stormy morning a few days ago when a White House aide phoned with an invitation to join the first lady on Tuesday for President Obamas last State of the Union address to Congress.

title: Sharon Lu, Bryte Moa-Anderson
description: Dr. Sharon Marie Lu and Bryte Jason Moa-Anderson were married Jan. 9 at the Scripps Seaside Forum, an event space in San Diego. The ceremony was officiated by Leif Moa-Anderson, the grooms brother, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion.

title: Brigid Harrison, Paul Meilak Jr.
description: Brigid Callahan Harrison and Paul Meilak Jr. were married Jan. 9 at the National Arts Club in Manhattan. The Rev. Jay Pinkerton, a Catholic priest with CITI Ministries, officiated.

title: Carolyn Grossman and Adam Meagher: On One Knee, in an Unfinished Subway
description: Carolyn Jill Grossman and Adam Patrick Meagher were married Jan. 9 at the Charles Ringling Mansion at New College of Florida in Sarasota, from which the bride graduated. Hope C. Michelson, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Carrol Chang and David Osei: A Life Begins in a Cardboard House
description: Carrol Jung Chang and David Kodjo Owusu-Agyeman Osei were married Jan. 6 in Meridian Hill Park in Washington, under a feature of the District of Columbias marital code that now allows couples to join themselves.

title: Alison Gordon, Kyle Gugerty
description: Alison Brooke Gordon, the daughter of Glenda R. Gordon and Kenneth A. Gordon of Boca Raton, Fla., was married there Jan. 9 to Kyle Eugene Gugerty, the son of Francine A. Farber of Bethesda, Md., and Michael J. Gugerty of Rockville, Md. Rabbi Bennett Miller officiated at the Addison, an event space.

title: Jill Bloomfield, Benjamin Margolis
description: Jill Bloomfield and Benjamin David Margolis were married Jan. 9 by Rabbi Alan Litwak at the Eden Roc Resort in Miami Beach.

title: Sharon Csontos, Donald Myers Jr.
description: Sharon Esther Csontos and Donald Nicholas Myers Jr. were married Jan. 9 at the Ashford Estate, an event space in Allentown, N.J. Erika Barrett, a cousin of the groom who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Nara Lee, Byron Lichtenstein
description: Nara Lee and Byron Thornton Lichtenstein were married Jan. 6 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Edwina M. Townes, a staff member at the New York City clerks office, officiated.

title: Danielle Mazandi, Robert Cooper
description: Danielle Alexandra Mazandi and Robert Lawrence Cooper were married Jan. 9 at St. Aloysius Church in Washington. The Rev. Kenneth Meehan, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Victorious Steelers Twist Knife Handed to Them by Bengals
description: CINCINNATI  This city awoke Saturday by peeking out from under its covers, one wary eye at a time. Was it safe to come out? Did it even want to?

title: Review: In a New Book, Pope Francis Calls Mercy Essential
description: During his training as a Jesuit priest in the 1960s, Jorge Mario Bergoglio  who, decades later, would become Pope Francis  spent three years teaching literature and psychology in his native Argentina. He taught the classics, like El Cid, but when his students expressed an interest in authors like Antonio Machado and Fernando de Rojas, he taught them, too, as a way of nurturing a love of literature in his pupils. He also encouraged his students to write, and had his friend Jorge Luis Borges read their stories.

title: Corrections: January 10, 2016
description: METROPOLITAN

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I havent seen this large of a division in my career. You probably have to go back to Ford versus Reagan in 1976. But that was only two people.

title: Sean Penn and El Chapo: What We Know
description: Here is what you need to know about the secret mountaintop meeting between Sean Penn and the drug lord Joaqun Guzmn Loera, also known as El Chapo.

title: In Show of Alliance, American Forces Fly B-52 Bomber Over South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The United States flew a nuclear-capable B-52 long-distance bomber over South Korea on Sunday in a show of force after North Koreas fourth nuclear test.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: Nick Jonas Is a Topman Man
description: LONDON  Pics or it didnt happen, said the pop star and actor Nick Jonas, who, backstage after the Topman Design show at London Collections Men, had found a Wi-Fi connection and hopped onto his Instagram account to share a video with 5.6 million of his nearest and dearest.

title: Your Weekend Briefing: Ted Cruz, Hillary Clinton, Mexico
description: Here are the weeks top stories.

title: New Management Settles in at Huntsman, the Pride of Londons Savile Row
description: LONDON  A stones throw from the flagships of various global luxury behemoths on New Bond Street, the gentlemens tailors of Savile Row remain steadfast in their devotion to tradition and understatement. Bells tinkle in mahogany doorways to sound a customers arrival; swaths of checks, wool and herringbone from the finest mills in Britain are piled high; and cutters sit hunched in basements and poky back rooms to fulfill orders for wealthy clients around the world.

title: In Madrid, Hope Has a New Name: Zidane
description: LONDON  These are surreal times in Spain. Barcelona and Real Madrid ran in nine goals between them against opponents they are expected to beat nine times out of 10.

title: El Chapo Faces Array of Drug Charges in United States
description: WASHINGTON  In 1995, a federal grand jury in San Diego charged a little-known Mexican drug trafficker named Joaqun Guzmn Loera and 22 underlings with creating a cocaine ring that stretched from Southern California to New Jersey.

title: A Less Prominent Career, a More Primary Parent, and Satisfied
description: These days, when she judges the moment right, my wife has taken to praising me as a great dad in the mixed company of family and friends. Ive practiced an aw-shucks shrug for the occasion. I suspect many modern dads are paid similar compliments for doing things moms have done for eons.

title: 1941: Roosevelt Proposes Defense Bill
description: WASHINGTON  President Roosevelts much-discussed bill for converting the United States into an arsenal for democracy by giving him unlimited peace-time power to sell, transfer, exchange, lease, lend or otherwise dispose of the promised billions of dollars worth of warplanes, ships, guns and tanks to Great Britain, China, Greece and the Latin-American republics to fight off Axis aggression, was introduced simultaneously in both houses of Congress today [Jan. 10].

title: Margaret Howell: Fall 2016
description: The fall 2016 mens collection from Margaret Howell.

title: J.W. Anderson: Fall 2016
description: J. W. Andersons vision for mens fall 2016.

title: Cuomo Proposes Higher-Education Initiative in New York Prisons
description: ALBANY  It was nearly two years ago that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo floated a plan for the state to pay for college courses for inmates. But it sank in the face of withering opposition from critics who mocked Mr. Cuomos initiative as Attica University and Republican members of the states congressional delegation who argued that New York should put kids before cons.

title: James Long: Fall 2016
description: Designs from James Longs fall 2016 show.

title: 1966: Shastri Dies After Signing Kashmir Pact
description: TASHKENT, U.S.S.R.  Prime Minister Lal Bahadur Shastri of India died here early today of a heart attack, hours after he and President Mohammad Ayub Khan of Pakistan had signed an agreement aimed at bringing peace to Kashmir. The tiny, 61-year-old Indian leader collapsed after he and Marshal Ayub had attended a farewell banquet given by Soviet Premier Alexei Kosygin to celebrate their agreement.

title: 1920: Versailles Treaty Comes Into Force
description: The Treaty of Versailles was signed on June 28, 1919, ending, in principle, the state of war between the Allies and Germany. The treaty came into full effect after six months of negotiations in Paris. Below, an excerpt from an analysis on the agreement by the European edition of The New York Herald:

title: In London, Designers Embrace Music (and Boxing)
description: The Sibling and Coach collections, which showed in London, were inspired by everyone from Grace Jones to Bruce Springsteen.

title: Bernie Sanders Makes Strong Showing in New Polls
description: Hillary Clinton holds a three-point edge over Senator Bernie Sanders in Iowa, a tightening of the race with roughly three weeks until voting begins, according to a new set of surveys of likely voters from NBC/The Wall Street Journal/Marist.

title: Christopher Raeburn: Fall 2016
description: Mr. Raeburn presents his vision for fall 2016 mens.

title: The Larger, but Quieter Than Bundy, Push to Take Over Federal Land
description: DENVER  Ken Ivory, a Republican state representative from Utah, has been roaming the West with an alluring pitch to cattle ranchers, farmers and conservatives upset with how Washington controls the wide-open public spaces out here: This land is your land, he says, and not the federal governments.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Ted Cruzs Diligent Courting of Evangelicals Pays Off in Iowa
description: DES MOINES  On Sunday, Pastor Bradley Cranston stood at his pulpit in Burlington, Iowa, and, citing Exodus 18:21 (select out of all the people able men who fear God ... as leaders), endorsed Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, urging his parishioners to also consider voting for him.

title: Princess Cristinas Tax Fraud Trial Set to Begin in Spain
description: MADRID  Princess Cristina of Spain is scheduled to appear in court on Monday, accused of tax fraud as part of a corruption case centered on money embezzled from public contracts that is bringing a member of the countrys royal family to trial for the first time.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: The awards season officially begins with the Golden Globes, hosted again by Ricky Gervais. CBSs empowered women return in new episodes. And Je Suis Charlie looks back at the 2015 terrorist attack on the French satire magazine Charlie Hebdo.

title: Pringle of Scotland: Fall 2016
description: Fall 2016 designs from Pringle of Scotland.

title: Londons Mens Wear Shows Revel in the Club Scene
description: LONDON  Under intermittent rain and the occasional occlusion of cement-colored skies, London Collections Men began the international fall fashion season for mens wear on Friday, so hot on the heels of the new year, joked Dylan Jones, the editor of British GQ and the L.C.M. chairman, that we like to think of it as a continuation of New Years Eve.

title: Nets Dismiss Hollins and Reassign King; Owner Vows to Instill Winning Culture
description: The Nets, in a midseason shake-up after years of reckless spending and trades, announced Sunday that the team had fired Coach Lionel Hollins and reassigned General Manager Billy King.

title: Hospital Aided by Doctors Without Borders Is Bombed in Yemen
description: CAIRO  A hospital in northern Yemen supported by the medical charity Doctors Without Borders was struck by ordnance early Sunday, killing at least four people and causing several buildings to collapse, the organization said in a statement.

title: Strong Showing for The Revenant at Box Office
description: A savvy 20th Century Fox marketing campaign combined with the raw star power of Leonardo DiCaprio helped drive The Revenant to a grizzly-size $38 million in weekend ticket sales, adding sizzle to a soft box office season for prestige films.

title: Sold on a View, New Years Revelers Fall to a Forgery Scheme
description: Getting into the LOL Times Square Comedy Club should not be difficult: Go to Times Square, and when a person with an LOL sign or identification badge approaches you and asks, Hey, do you like comedy? say yes. Youre in. Make your way to the club on Seventh Avenue and head upstairs to the windowless bar and black-box theater crowded with tables for two. Enjoy the show.

title: Alexander McQueen: Fall 2016
description: Sarah Burton presents fall 2016 mens wear designs for Alexander McQueen.

title: An Uncertain New Chapter in Sinaloa, Home State of El Chapo
description: LOS MOCHIS, Mexico  The capture of the drug lord Joaqun Guzmn Loera stunned the world and earned President Enrique Pea Nieto of Mexico a much-needed round of applause. Yet here in the narcotics kingpins home state, Sinaloa, the news landed with a thud.

title: Young, Mexican and Ready to Raise Their Political Voices
description: Bundled up against the cold, Janet Perez walked down Willis Avenue in the Mott Haven section of the Bronx this month, politely approaching parents waiting for their children after school.
