The arrest of the couple followed the disclosure this week of formal charges for a number of legal workers who have challenged the grip of state power on citizens lives.

title: Stephen Karam Makes Broadway Debut With The Humans
description: It seems fitting that the career of the playwright Stephen Karam has a clean narrative structure. For years, he has been gradually moving toward what will be a well-deserved Broadway debut this week, with The Humans. His play Speech & Debate, which was the inaugural production of the new play initiative Roundabout Underground, drew critical praise in 2007. Sons of the Prophet was even more successful in 2011 and was a finalist for the Pulitzer Prize.

title: 1941: Changes to the Italian Army
description: ROME  Two months after taking command of the Italian forces in Albania, Gen. Ubaldo Soddu has been relieved of active duty at his own request, it was announced here today [Jan. 13]. Ill health, necessitating a long rest and care, was given as the reason for his retirement. All that the military command vouchsafed today concerning the fighting in Albania was that there had been normal activity of patrols and artillery and that Italian planes had machine-gunned and shelled enemy troops and columns of trucks on the march. No word has as yet reached the Italian people officially to confirm the claims of further Greek successes, which foreign broadcasts have reported. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 14, 1941

title: Hunters in the Dark, by Lawrence Osborne
description: I read this book in what is called an advance readers edition, a trade convenience generally made up of the first-pass pages from the forthcoming hardcover edition, bound in paper, with a version of the jacket art on the front and a version of the flap copy on the back. In this case, the flap copy was appropriately enticing (but when is it ever not?), and it opened by categorizing the work as literary suspense. Immediately the pedant in me reared its caviling head: Arent all novels literary, in that theyre assembled from letters and words? (From the Latin litteratura, writing composed of letters of the alphabet.) And arent all novels to some extent suspenseful  or else why would we ever finish one? Surely there must always be a managed momentum toward finding out what happens in the end, however slight that may be?

title: The Lovers: Afghanistans Romeo and Juliet, byRod Nordland
description: The sentimental title of The Lovers suggests a hopeful tale of youthful romance, of passion and perseverance against the backdrop of a war-ravaged Afghanistan. Zakia and Ali, the journalist Rod Nordlands Afghan Romeo and Juliet, are Tajik and Hazara, Sunni and Shia, disparate ethnicities and rived sects. They live in Bamiyan, where the Taliban destroyed two famed sandstone Buddhas in 2001. They fall in love as teenagers, exchanging flirty glances in the fields of their village, skirting elders and convention. Soon their parents find out; marriage is deemed impossible, and Zakia runs away to a shelter. The two elope but remain sentenced to a life on the run, with Ali facing criminal charges after Zakias family lodges a kidnapping case against him.

Under the proposal, asylum seekers who enter the country with more than 10,000 kroner, or about $1,450, in assets would have to help finance their stay.

title: When Children Say I Cant, but They Can, and Adults Know It
description: Over the last couple of months, Ive received a few emails asking a similar question, venting a similar frustration, written in a similar exasperated tone. When I hit send on my own version of the question in an email to a friend, I knew it was time to seek some answers. I appealed to a few of my favorite parenting experts and authors, Katie Hurley, Michele Borba, Alyson Schafer and Tina Payne Bryson.

description: LONDON  For two centuries the national anthem here has been a somber plea for the monarchs longevity, and God Save the Queen is routinely sung as Englands sports teams line up for international matches.

title: Bringing a Grandmothers Upstate Home to the Lower East Side
description: What if I said, Im an old soul, it all started in 1983? asks Meagan Delaney, the owner of the Lower East Side boutique the Rising States, erupting into a throaty laugh. Her story does begin in the mid-80s on Kodiak Island, Alaska; her mother, a Russian Aleut and the youngest of 13 children, hadnt left Kodiak before meeting Delaneys dad, a Manhattanite who moved north to deal in fishing boats. Two of my best friends still have the postcards that I sent to them while on a trip to the city when I was 8 years old, Delaney says. The funniest card reads, New York is so cool. They have this store called the GAP  Gap in capital letters. I bought a Blossom hat (a denim hat with a massive fake flower on the front), a sweater and some leggings, and I thought I was the coolest kid alive when I went back to Kodiak.

title: Hemophilia Patient or Drug Seller? Dual Role Creates Ethical Quandary
description: LaQuenta Caldwell-Moody considered it improper when a pharmacy sales representative tried to take her teenage son, when he was still a minor, to dinner without her.

title: Cuomo, in State of State Speech, Unveils $20 Billion Housing Plan
description: ALBANY  Proposing to address the challenges of homelessness and a lack of affordable housing, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York delivered a State of the State speech on Wednesday that called for a financial and spiritual commitment to rebuild the states social and physical infrastructure.

title: No Business Too Small to Be Hacked
description: Just as the holiday shopping season neared, a toy company, Rokenbok Education, was navigating a nightmare situation: Its database files had been infected by malware.

title: With Health Care Switch, Kentucky Ventures Into the Unknown
description: WASHINGTON  There is no longer any question that Gov. Matt Bevin of Kentucky plans to shut down the health insurance exchange his state built to enroll residents for coverage under the Affordable Care Act. Now that he has notified the Obama administration of his intention to do so, the question is, will it change the laws substantial impact there?

title: Casinos in Nassau County
description: To the Editor:

title: What the Next Green Revolution Will Require
description: To the Editor:

title: Paulson Reinsurance Company in Bermuda to Wind Down
description: The Bermuda-based reinsurance company set up by the hedge fund manager John A. Paulson is winding down as scrutiny of offshore tax strategies rises.

title: Obamas Plea to Fix Our Politics Leaves Both Sides Looking Inward
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas urgent call in his final State of the Union address to fix our politics posed a fundamental question: Who broke them in the first place?

title: Chris Christie Welcomes Attacks as a Sign of His Strength
description: BEDFORD, N.H.  Stuck under the windshields of cars parked outside a Christie campaign event on Wednesday was an article from The Boston Globe detailing the governors flip-flopping positions.

title: Ten Theses on Immigration
description: MySunday columnargued, fairly strenuously, that mass immigration on the scale of the last two years will putmore stress on the politics and culture of Germany than any prudentstatesman should accept, and that the German government should do everything in its power to not only limit migration but actually restrict asylum rights and begin deportation for some of the migrants who have already arrived.

title: Al Jazeera America to Shut Down by April
description: The cable news channel Al Jazeera America, which debuted in 2013 to great fanfare when it promised to cover American news soberly and seriously, will be shutting down by the end of April. The move was announced at a companywide meeting on Wednesday.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | The Revenant
description: Alejandro G. Inarritu narrates a scene from The Revenant, featuring Leonardo DiCaprio.

title: Alejandro G. Irritu Narrates a Scene From The Revenant
description: The Revenant, Alejandro G. Irritus bear-wrangling, Golden Globe-winning tale of survival on the American frontier, is the kind of movie where the difficulty of its execution can be seen in most every shot.

title: Saudi Arabia Frees Samar Badawi, Human Rights Activist, After Questioning
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Saudi Arabia released the human rights activist Samar Badawi on Wednesday, one day after advocacy groups reported that she had been arrested. Adam Coogle, a researcher for Human Rights Watch, said that Ms. Badawi was released after having been questioned in a police station and held overnight. She was not charged with a crime.

title: End the Looting of Antiquities: A Plea for Action
description: To the Editor:

title: Missing a Road in Russia? This May Be Why
description: MOSCOW  Corruption in Russia sometimes amounts to highway robbery, literally.

title: Hairspray to Be NBCs Next Live Musical
description: NBC, which has taken viewers from the musical hills of Austria to Neverland to Oz with its live musical broadcasts, has a humbler destination in mind for 2016: Baltimore.

title: Obamas Final State of the Union Speech
description: To the Editor:

title: Dec. 24, 1994: Day of Losses for Los Angeles, as Rams and Raiders Fell
description: In Anaheim, Calif., the 4-11 Rams lost to an even worse team in a meaningless N.F.L. game. At the same time, 25 miles away, the Raiders also lost, and missed out on the playoffs. All in all, a disappointing day for the home fans. Little did they know.

title: Paul Ryan Dada
description: OK, Paul Ryan is messing with our heads, although messing isnt really the word I want to use.

title: Donald Trumps Iowa Ground Game Seems to Be Missing a Coach
description: DES MOINES  One volunteer leader enlisted by Donald J. Trump to turn out Iowa voters has yet to knock on a single door or to make a phone call. Another is a 9/11 truther with a website claiming that the Sept. 11 attacks were a government conspiracy. A third caucus precinct captain, who like the others attended a training session in West Des Moines last month, said the campaigns goal of having them each enlist 25 supporters was unrealistic.

title: App Smart | Fresh From CES
description: Among the notable apps at International CES were the video-sharing apps MeVee and VidMob and the home DJ app Edjing Scratch.

title: Video Feature: Some Standouts at the International CES
description: LAST week, manufacturers from all over the world gathered in Las Vegas  as they do every January  for International CES, a giant electronics show where they displayed televisions, computers and weird and wonderful gadgets. Nowadays, apps are also showcased or previewed alongside the hardware.

title: Lawrence Phillips Is Dead in Suspected Suicide in Prison
description: Lawrence Phillips, the star Nebraska running back whose N.F.L. career was derailed by his many off-field problems, died Wednesday morning in a suspected suicide, the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation said in a news release.

title: Was He Gay, Bisexual or Bowie? Yes
description: When David Bowie died on Sunday, he  left behind legions of fans who will remember him as the godfather of glam rock and the patron saint of defiant outcasts.

title: An Election Where Angry Sells: Readers on the Brutalism of Ted Cruz
description: The strength of Senator Ted Cruzs presidential campaign reflects a Republican Party that increasingly represents the extreme right, readers said in response to a column by David Brooks about Mr. Cruzs brutalism.

title: New Polish Government Faces E.U. Investigation
description: WARSAW  The European Commission said on Wednesday that it had opened a formal inquiry to determine whether Polands new right-wing government had violated the democratic norms of the European Union.

title: In Fashion, Fat Is Still a Taboo
description: Rosy-cheeked and curvy, Madame de St.-Maurice smiles complacently on visitors to the 80WSE Gallery at New York University. The subject of a late-18th-century portrait by Joseph Siffred Duplessis, she flaunts multiple chins, her fleshy arms and bosom becomingly veiled in a demi-sheer frock.

title: Making Milton Babbitts Legacy Less Fearsome
description: Sometime in the mid-1920s, a 10-year-old clarinetist in the Jackson Boys Band in Mississippi had a small epiphany. The highest notes of his solo in an opera overture were, in fact, a transposition of the opening motif of the piece.

title: Avalanche in French Alps Leaves at Least 3 Dead
description: PARIS  An avalanche hit a group of students skiing in the French Alps on Wednesday afternoon, killing at least three people, the French authorities said.

title: For de Blasio, Cuomos State of the State Address Holds More Tough News
description: With his protracted feud with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo still simmering, Mayor Bill de Blasio trekked to Albany on Wednesday, bracing for bad news for his agenda in New York City.

title: MetLifes Spinoff Plan Hedges Its Fight With Regulators
description: Steven A. Kandarian is hedging his bets.

title: The Zappos Exodus Continues After a Radical Management Experiment
description: Zappos, the online shoe retailer experimenting with the radical self-management system Holacracy, is continuing to hemorrhage employees.

title: Paul Ryan Cuts Off Iran Vote in Rebuff to Tardy Lawmakers
description: The House on Wednesday passed legislation bolstering sanctions against Iran, seeking to check President Obamas ability to ease them without consulting Congress.

title: Lesson Plan | Analyzing Maps to Better Understand Global Current Events and History
description: Maps tell stories about natural and human geography and geopolitics, whether by displaying the shapes of landforms and locations of cities or by highlighting global fashion trends or the routes of explorers.

title: How David Bowie Challenged MTV on Race
description: David Bowie was always going somewhere  Africa, Japan, outer space, the hinterland, the hinterland (from Red Sails), up, down, in, out, across. One wavelet of Internet tributes paid to Mr. Bowie after his death on Sunday recalled a trip he took to a hotel room, in 1983, to pick a bone with MTV.

title: Per Se Stumbles: Readers Respond
description: Pete Wellss review of Per Se dropped the landmark restaurant from a four-star rating to two stars. Reader response ranged from shocked to sad, from angry to delighted. Selections from the comments are below; some have been edited for length.

title: Ricky Jay and the Met Conjure Big Magic in Miniature
description: The magician Ricky Jay, considered by many the greatest sleight-of-hand artist alive, is also a scholar, a historian, a collector of curiosities. Master of a prose style that qualifies him as perhaps the last of the great 19th-century authors, he has written about oddities like cannonball catchers, poker-playing pigs, performing fleas and people who tame bees. But probably his most enduring interest is a fellow polymath, an 18th-century German named Matthias Buchinger.

title: Ex-Marine Can Wear Medals He Didnt Earn. A Court Calls It Free Speech.
description: A federal court in California has ruled that a former Marine can wear service medals he did not earn, saying that displaying them was a form of free speech.

title: Review: HBOs Sesame Street, Fancy but Not Free
description: Like many an urban brownstone owner, Sesame Street has come into some cash, and its undertaken a lovely renovation.

title: North Korea Is Newest Frontier for a Daredevil Investor
description: He searched for oil in the badlands of Somalia and fueled a stock market boom in Mongolia. He sued the worlds smallest republic, far out in the Pacific, for a chunk of what it is worth.

title: Gear for the Next Level of Mobile Games
description: With state-of-the-art graphics, enhanced functions and multiplayer options, gaming on a tablet or smartphone is not always as simple as tap and swipe anymore. That means getting the most out of mobile games can require new equipment. Here are some noteworthy recommendations.

title: Musical-Theater Writers Awarded Kleban Prizes
description: The lyricist, librettist and playwright Stacey Luftig and the writer and director Daniel Goldstein are the recipients of the 2016 Kleban Prize for promising musical-theater writers, the sponsors of the prize announced this week. The awards each come with $100,000.

title: Super PAC Backing Jeb Bush Uses Conspiracy-Minded Journalist in Ad
description: Since shortly after Christmas, the super PAC supporting Jeb Bush, Right to Rise USA, has been criticizing Senator Marco Rubio of Florida for missing votes in the Senate. But the ad the group released delivering that message relied on a journalist who has highlighted conspiracy theories about major news events to make its case.

title: Understanding Health Savings Accounts
description: January signals the start of different health benefits for many people, based on the coverage they chose during open enrollment. Increasingly, consumers are enrolling in health plans that work with special health savings accounts. Here is some help in understanding how to use them.

title: Lawyer for Irans Central Bank Faces Skepticism at Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  A lawyer for Irans central bank faced skepticism at the Supreme Court on Wednesday as he tried to persuade the justices that his client should not have to pay nearly $2 billion to victims of terrorist attacks.

title: VWs Chief Meets Head of E.P.A. to Discuss Pollution Problem
description: Under pressure to devise a fix for its polluting diesel cars, the chief executive of Volkswagen, Matthias Mller, met for the first time with a senior government official in the United States to discuss the crisis that has engulfed the German carmaker since September.

title: To Rams Owner, Its Business; to St. Louis Fans, Its Personal
description: ST. LOUIS  Enos Stanley Kroenke, a native of Missouri and the owner of the Rams, is named after two of this citys most revered baseball figures, the hustling outfielder Enos Slaughter and the gentlemanly hitter Stan Musial.

title: Winter White and a New Lingerie Collaboration  Flirty, a Little Naughty
description: Plus: Bras on the red carpet and the comeback of brooches.

title: Retired Art Teacher Leaves $1.7 Million to the Detroit Institute of Arts
description: Not much more than a year ago, the Detroit Institute of Arts was in an existential crisis, its world-class collection in danger of being parceled off by its beleaguered city to help pay debts in Detroits federal bankruptcy.

title: Steve King Faults Nikki Haleys Conservatism, but Not Her Looks
description: Representative Steve King, the staunchly conservative and proudly plainspoken firebrand from Iowa, was among the handful of Republicans on Wednesday to take issue with Gov. Nikki Haleys State of the Union response.

title: Howard University Takes Step Toward Sale of Spectrum Rights
description: WASHINGTON  Howard University said Wednesday that it would join other broadcasters in taking part in a Federal Communications Commission auction that could entail selling the rights to the spectrum on which it broadcasts the nations only black-owned public television station.

title: All the Young Bands: The Artists David Bowie Championed
description: David Bowies dense catalog is a rich portrait of the ways in which he subverted rock and pop norms, exalted his fellow misfits and delighted in reinvention. Its also a testament to the power of collaboration: Throughout his career, Mr. Bowie teamed closely with writers and producers, including Tony Visconti, who has frequently worked by his side since Space Oddity in 1969.

title: The Former Kiehls Heiresss Luxury Line of Skin Care
description: When third-generation Kiehls heir Jami Morse Heidegger sold the family business to LOreal in 2000, she thought she was walking away from beauty for good. But the luxury of having time away ironically sucked her back in. I had been traveling so much for work and had three young children at home at the time, she recalls. I wanted to take care of myself, but there wasnt anything on the market that addressed all of my concerns. I wanted something that was anti-aging but with top-quality oils to address the dryness I felt living in California desert. So, she enlisted her longtime chemist from Kiehls to help formulate several products to rejuvenate her own skin. The requirement: Create mixtures with the highest possible concentration of effective ingredients.

title: Venerating Mao, Even Where Famine Remains a Memory
description: ZHUSHIGANG, China  Only the orange of thousands of freshly dug carrots, washed in icy water and packed for delivery by village women, brightened this fog-draped village last Friday, one day after the authorities razed a golden statue of Mao Zedong erected by local admirers that had towered over the dun fields.

title: Stocks Slide as Worries Persist Over Global Growth
description: Hopes for a recovery in the United States stock market were dashed on Wednesday as investors deepening fears about the strength of the worlds largest economies drove another wave of selling.

title: Justices Hear Case Over Puerto Ricos Sovereignty
description: WASHINGTON  Faced with the prospect of definitively resolving the status of Puerto Rico, the Supreme Court on Wednesday explored ways in which to render a narrow decision. But a lawyer for the Obama administration was adamant that the courts decision should be based on the fundamental ground that the commonwealth is a territory of the United States without independent sovereignty.

title: Teenager Killed in Shooting Near Brooklyn Schools
description: An 18-year-old man was killed and a second teenager was wounded on Wednesday in a shooting on a Brooklyn street busy with students who had just been dismissed for the day from a nearby high school campus, the authorities said.

title: Review: Now Im Fine, Ahamefule J. Oluos Take on Himself
description: Imagine if whenever anyone asked you to say a little something about yourself, you had your very own orchestra to back you up. Thats the privileged position in which Ahamefule J. Oluo finds himself in Now Im Fine, the engaging musical memoir that opened on Tuesday night at the Public Theater as part of the Under the Radar festival.

title: Hue Jackson Skips Giants Interview and Takes Browns Job
description: The Giants have been looking for a new head coach for about 10 days and were waiting to interview the Cincinnati Bengals offensive coordinator, Hue Jackson, before making a decision on Tom Coughlins replacement. Jackson was expected to meet Thursday morning with John Mara, one of the teams owners, and Jerry Reese, the general manager.

title: Transcript of Cuomos 2016 State of the State Address
description: Following is the transcript of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos State of the State address, as transcribed by the governors office:

title: Hillary Clinton Ad Seconds Obama on Guns, Rebuking Bernie Sanders
description: Seizing on gun control, an issue on which she sees an opportunity to align herself with President Obama and against Senator Bernie Sanders, Hillary Clinton has released a new ad titled Im With Him.

title: Review: Idiotsitter, on Comedy Central, Skewers the Rich
description: Fey and Poehler, Jacobson and Glazer (Broad City), Parham and St. Clair (Playing House), Lindhome and Micucci (Garfunkel and Oates). Female comedy duos  steeped in some mix of improv troupes, cabaret, web series and Saturday Night Live before scoring their own television shows  are establishing a small but growing beachhead in prime time. On Thursday Comedy Central throws Jillian Bell and Charlotte Newhouse (formerly of the Groundlings) unto the breach with Idiotsitter, a sitcom expanded from a short-form online series.

title: Times Insider Live: Your Money Matters
description: The ins and outs of financial planning from how to pick an adviser to knowing when youve got enough.

title: Officials Study Possible Tie Between Legionnaires Disease and Flint Water
description: Michigan health officials said Wednesday that they were investigating whether an outbreak of Legionnaires disease was linked to problems with the Flint city water system, which has caused a surge in lead poisoning in children.

title: Cricket Star Kieran PowellTosses His Bat and Picks Up a Smaller, Rounder One
description: Kieran Powell has had an enviable life as a professional cricket player. He has traveled the world playing a challenging game in balmy weather, while earning a lot of recognition and good money.

title: Steven Boyer Puts Down the Sock Puppet and Picks Up His Life
description: We look at our hands every day. If your dominant hand is your right, as mine is, you probably look at that one a bit more. But if you happen to have a demonic sock puppet attached to your left hand, it cant help but take up most of your attention.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Intensify Fight over Health, Guns and Costs
description: Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders escalated their battle over health care and gun control on Wednesday as the race for the Democratic presidential nomination intensified.

title: Review: In Colony, on USA, Los Angeles Is Occupied
description: Colony, USAs new sort of sci-fi, sort of geopolitical conspiracy series, gives up its secrets slowly. In truth, it hardly gives them up at all. As the hours roll by, the facts of life in the shows near-future Los Angeles remain vague. We know that much of the city has been surrounded by a shiny metal wall hundreds of feet tall. But who put it there? What do they look like? Are they extraterrestrial? Sorry  maybe next week.

title: Review: Death of a Bachelor, From Panic! at the Disco
description: Death of a Bachelor

title: Photos of the Day: The Netherlands and Elsewhere
description: The Netherlands and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Research Doesnt Back a Link Between Migrants and Crime in U.S.
description: In America, as in Europe, anti-immigrant backlashes have often followed episodes in which foreigners are blamed for crimes and other problems. But statistical studies show that in the United States, at least, immigrants are far more law-abiding than natives, regardless of race, class or education.

title: Review: Rova Channeling Coltrane Offers More Than a Live Performance
description: Rova Channeling Coltrane

title: Seven Essentials to Make (Truly) Yours This Year
description: Thanks to the startup boom, a host of companies have recently sprung up that aim to make everything from headphones to ballerina flats perfectly personal, with intuitive sites and apps that allow you to explore your own preferences in great detail. Here, seven of our favorite ways to customize your life this year  without leaving the house.

title: Review: Lisette Oropesa Scales Down Her Voice but Not Her Presence
description: Sometimes singers who are at home on the opera stage have trouble adjusting to the intimate requirements of a song recital. Not the lovely lyric soprano Lisette Oropesa, who on Tuesday night gave a rewarding performance with the stylish pianist John Churchwell in the Park Avenue Armorys Board of Officers Room.

title: Review: Ches Smiths The Bell Plays With Listeners Expectations
description: The Bell

title: Jan. 13, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from The Netherlands, Afghanistan, Israel and India.

title: Review: At American Dance Platform, Charm and Structure Without Flight
description: American Dance Platform is a new project at the Joyce Theater. From the audiences point of view, though, it looks much like what has been happening at the Joyce each year in the second week of January. This is APAP week (for the Association of Performing Arts Presenters), when curators and producers come shopping in New York and when a number of the citys performance spaces showcase multiple dance companies. With American Dance Platform, as in previous years, the Joyce gives a week to eight highly varied companies, appearing in four double bills.

title: Stella McCartney Unveils Her Pre-Fall Collection in Hollywood
description: Katy Perry, Johnny Depp and Elizabeth Olsen join fashion stars at the landmark Amoeba Music store.

title: Inside the Golden Globes Parties: Stars Find Their Cliques
description: If Hollywood is high school, the parties surrounding Golden Globes weekend were essentially an opportunity to show who belonged to which clique.

title: Finding the Keys for the Right Ballet Steps
description: There are only two tempos, too fast or too slow, Cameron Grant, the principal pianist with New York City Ballet, said with a melancholy laugh after rehearsal a few weeks ago. It was the middle of Nutcracker season, and that evening he was scheduled to play the celesta, the bell-like keyboard instrument that accompanies Sugarplums solo, in the orchestra pit. With his neat appearance and calm demeanor, Mr. Grant is a constant, quiet presence in the theater, someone relied on by dancers, ballet masters and the orchestra. And yet few outside the circle of his colleagues realize how central he and the other company pianists are to the life of the theater.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: David Bowie, N.F.L., Iran
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Danes Debate How to Handle Migrants
description: Politicians in Denmark reacted to a bill that would require refugees to help finance their stay. The proposal is the latest of several recent migrant-deterring measures taken by the country.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Clive James, Writing Toward the Twilight
description: Since 2010, when the brilliant Australian critic, poet and memoirist Clive James learned he had terminal leukemia, hes had his afterburners flipped on. He has been on a vivifying late-career tear.

title: Goldman Says It Supports IEX, but Raises Market Structure Issues
description: Goldman Sachs told the Securities and Exchange Commission in a letter dated Tuesday that it supported a proposed new stock exchange, but also pointed out that one exchange should not have an unfair advantage over another in its control of market data.

title: Studio Two-Step Sometimes Defies Oscar Labels
description: Far and away the biggest head-scratcher at the Golden Globes on Sunday was how on earth The Martian  that rip-roaring laugh riot about a marooned astronauts ingenious and desperate efforts to stay alive  walked away with the top award for best comedy or musical.

title: How Nikki Haley Was Redeemed by Donald Trump
description: It is a truth universally acknowledged that an Indian-American in possession of gubernatorial dreams must be in want of a name like Nikki or Bobby. If I had a name like that, I would not be in Brooklyn writing some online-only essay, wearing a Uniqlo hoodie. I would probably be in Jackson, Montgomery or Raleigh, wearing a red velvet robe, tweaking my State of the State address. And if my name were Nikki or Bobby, the state of the state would be pukka  sorry, strong.

title: Fourth Annual New York Portfolio Review
description: Applications are open for the Fourth Annual New York Portfolio Review, where editors, curators, gallerists and book publishers will conduct two days of private photo critiques.

title: Brian Bedford, Stage Actor Who Brought the Classics to Life, Dies at 80
description: Brian Bedford, the British-born actor, reared in working-class misery, who became a stellar portrayer of the princes, kings, fops and faded aristocrats of Shakespeare, Molire and Chekhov, died on Wednesday in Santa Barbara, Calif. He was 80.

title: Ted Cruz Didnt Report Goldman Sachs Loan in a Senate Race
description: As Ted Cruz tells it, the story of how he financed his upstart campaign for the United States Senate four years ago is an endearing example of loyalty and shared sacrifice between a married couple.

title: Republicans Lead Congress With Two Distinct Agendas
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker Paul D. Ryan has been pressing House Republicans to develop an aggressive, conservative policy blueprint that sets the contours of the presidential campaign.

title: Chocolate Armenteros, Trumpeter in Afro-Cuban Tradition, Dies at 87
description: Chocolate Armenteros, a Cuban trumpeter who was a standard-bearer of the Afro-Cuban musical tradition for almost seven decades, died on Jan. 6 in a nursing home in Mohegan Lake, N.Y. He was 87.

title: Bill Clinton Cites Personal Losses in Pushing Fight Against Drug Abuse
description: KEENE, N.H.  Hillary Clinton has made battling the drug epidemic a central part of her presidential campaign. But she has only briefly mentioned of her personal connection to it.

title: Museum of Natural Historys New Dinosaur Sticks Its Head Out
description: Curators hope a casting of a 122-foot long fossil can top a dinosaur exhibit that draws big crowds.

title: A New Dinosaur Takes Shape
description: The American Museum of Natural History unveils a new dinosaur exhibit this month. The process required careful planning and delicate handiwork.

title: C.D.C. May Warn Pregnant Women Against Travel to Countries With Zika Virus
description: Federal health officials are debating whether to warn pregnant women against travel to Brazil and other Latin American and Caribbean countries where mosquitoes are spreading the Zika virus, which has been linked to brain damage in newborn babies.

title: Former FIFA Vice President Arrives in Brooklyn to Face Charges
description: The 21st of 41 defendants in the United States sprawling corruption case focusing on world soccer was brought to Brooklyn on Wednesday to face charges.

title: New Dinosaur Poses Question: Does This Museum Make Me Look Fat?
description: The juvenile Barosaurus had just been laid out on the floor in the American Museum of Natural History when a staff member noticed a piece of candy corn wedged in the creatures mouth. So thats what killed the dinosaurs, said Alec Madoff, a senior preparator at the museum who had wielded the saw that felled the dinosaur.

title: Rams Departure Is Another Blow to St. Louis Area, and a Chance to Shift Priorities
description: ST. LOUIS  Five years ago, it was grim census data showing that the citys population had decreased by 8 percent at a time when officials were expecting it to grow.

title: Ailing Valeant Chiefs Return Date Is Uncertain
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It is still uncertain when J. Michael Pearson, the chief executive of the troubled drug maker Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, will return to the company, his temporary replacement told investors on Wednesday.

title: SurveyMonkey Names New Chief, Its Second in Six Months
description: SurveyMonkey, an online polling firm shaken by the sudden death of its chief executive last year, has replaced the man who took over in the aftermath.

title: Chilling Messages in Journal of Louisiana Theater Shooter
description: Before he opened fire at a Louisiana movie theater in July, a man with a history of mental illness filled dozens of pages with chilling references to violence and to a white man accused of killing nine black worshipers at a South Carolina church, as well as grievances against women, blacks, gay people and the news media.

title: Bronx Science Bans Cellphones From Wi-Fi as Students Devour It
description: When the New York City Education Department lifted a long-held ban on cellphones in school buildings last year, it acquiesced to the omnipresent reality of technology in daily life.

title: Amnesty International Reports Torture of Detainees in Tunisia
description: TUNIS  New evidence of the torture and deaths of detainees in police custody has emerged in Tunisia, indicating a rise in repression as the government has sought to crack down on terrorism, Amnesty International warned Wednesday.

title: For Help on Camera and Off, M.L.B. Orders Interpreters for Latino Players
description: In April 2014, Michael Pineda, the Yankees pitcher, had been ejected from a game for having pine tar on his neck. Later the same night, he answered questions from more than a dozen reporters in English about the embarrassing incident.

title: Gov. Cuomo on the State of New York
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo laid out an ambitious policy agenda for the coming year in a State of the State address on Wednesday that blended the personal and political. He harked back to a tough 2015, when he lost his father, Mario, pivoting deftly to a call for 12 weeks of paid family leave. He made a powerful economic and moral case for a $15 minimum wage, and pledged multibillion-dollar investments in transportation, infrastructure and housing, and an aggressive plan to attack homelessness.

title: Defense Secretary, in Speech to Deploying Troops, Lauds Push Against ISIS
description: FORT CAMPBELL, Ky.  Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter provided an upbeat assessment on Wednesday of the Obama administrations efforts to defeat the Islamic State and said that missions now underway by a new deployment of Special Operations forces are generating a virtuous cycle of action against the extremist group.

title: Anheuser-Busch InBev Sets $46 Billion Bond Sale
description: Anheuser-Busch InBev has completed a $46 billion, seven-part bond deal to help finance its acquisition of a fellow brewing company, SABMiller, in the second-largest corporate debt offering ever in the United States, according to Thomson Reuters.

title: Iraq and the Kurds Are Going Broke
description: Iraqi and American officials leading the military campaign against the Islamic State now have to wrestle with a challenge that has the potential to change battlefield fortunes: the slumping price of oil.

title: El Chapo Enticed by Star Power of Mexican Actress, Not Sean Penn
description: MEXICO CITY  Joaqun Guzmn Loera, the infamous drug lord known as El Chapo, had never heard of Sean Penn.

title: Giants Said to Promote Ben McAdoo to Head Coach
description: Two years ago, when the Giants named the little-known Ben McAdoo as their new offensive coordinator, the team co-owner John Mara, who approved the hiring, conceded that he did not know Ben McAdoo from Bob McAdoo, the 1970s-era Knicks forward.

title: Hello, They Must Be Going
description: Bye-bye.

title: Sylvan Barnet, Scholar, Is Dead at 89; Edited Signet Shakespeare Paperbacks
description: Sylvan Barnet, a literary scholar who introduced generations of college students to Shakespeare through the Signet Classic Shakespeare series, for which he was the general editor, died on Monday at his home in Cambridge, Mass. He was 89.

title: President May Have Exaggerated Role of Stimulus in Clean Energy, Experts Say
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, in his final State of the Union address on Tuesday night, boldly proclaimed the successes of what he called the single biggest investment in clean energy in our history, the 2009 economic stimulus that pumped $80 billion into clean and renewable energy projects.

title: Myra Carter, Dying Mother in Albees Three Tall Women, Dies at 86
description: Myra Carter, an award-winning stage actress who originated the grueling role of Edward Albees dying nonagenarian mother in his autobiographical play Three Tall Women, died on Jan. 9 in Manhattan. She was 86.

title: Los Angeles Greets Return of Rams With a Cool Eye
description: LOS ANGELES  And on the day after, the City of Angels ... went about its business.

title: Lawrence Phillips, Volatile Football Star, Dies at 40
description: Lawrence Phillips, a gifted running back who derailed his own career  and his life  with a series of violent criminal acts off the field, died on Wednesday in a hospital near Delano, Calif., where he was in prison. He was 40.

title: Do You Want to Be Chicagos New Police Superintendent?
description: The application to be Chicago's new police superintendent includes eight essay questions. Among the topics: accountability, use of technology and experience with matters related to terrorism.

title: In Chicago, a Fraught Opening Atop the Police Force
description: CHICAGO  The job requires extensive management experience, the ability to deal with significant distrust and skill at addressing highly publicized issues involving use of force. It includes an unhappy work force, an angry public and a boss who is immersed in his own battles for survival. Federal investigators have begun sniffing around.

title: Internet Yields Uneven Dividends and May Widen Inequality, Report Says
description: UNITED NATIONS  Can the Internet save the world?

title: Fire-Suppressing Compound
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  How much fun is this? Yesterday, I left you with a song by THE BEATLES, based on a clue about SIDE TWO of Magical Mystery Tour, and today the entire theme is about THE BEATLES.

title: Moonshot to Cure Cancer, to Be Led by Biden, Relies on Outmoded View of Disease
description: Last Friday a group of 15 cancer researchers cut short a meeting at the Food and Drug Administration. The reason: They had been invited to Vice President Joseph R. Bidens office to discuss his moonshot to cure cancer.

title: How Rams Move May Affect Broadcasts and Ratings
description: For a generation, Los Angeles football fans have grown accustomed to watching other cities teams on television. The Raiders fled back to Oakland. The Rams migrated to St. Louis.

title: Medical Device Maker Failed to Report Infections, Senate Report Says
description: Serious infections linked to poorly cleaned medical devices called duodenoscopes, used to examine the small intestine, have been more widespread than previously known, according to a Senate report released Wednesday.

title: Ethiopia Halts Regional Plan After Protests
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia  The Ethiopian government has canceled a widely promoted plan to integrate the capital, Addis Ababa, with the surrounding region after it touched off protests and violence that has killed scores of people since late last year.

title: Defense Lawyers in Etan Patz Retrial Seek to Bar Prosecutor
description: Defense lawyers asked a judge in Manhattan on Wednesday to bar a veteran prosecutor from taking part in the coming Etan Patz murder retrial because of statements she made about the case during her unsuccessful campaign to be the district attorney for Staten Island.

title: Newer N.F.L. Owners Show Muscle in Tug of War
description: HOUSTON  The N.F.L. hailed its decision on Tuesday to allow the St. Louis Rams move to Los Angeles and build a nearly $3 billion stadium and entertainment district in suburban Inglewood as a triumphant return to the nations second-largest market.

title: Tunnel Repairs Could Disrupt L Train in Coming Years
description: The chatter stunned riders of the L train on Wednesday: The tunnel that carries the subway line between Manhattan and Brooklyn could be shut down for more than a year.

title: A Family Emerges Even Closer From Times of Darkness
description: Over the course of 10 months in the Negron household, starting in spring 2014, darkness became routine.

title: A Skateboard Stunt Turns Fatal for a Former Chef
description: Richard Oates was a skilled chef with a deft touch that put him at the top of his class at culinary school  and sped him through the kitchen ranks to central positions at the New York City restaurants where he worked. But he was, perhaps, an even better father, according to friends and former colleagues, and skateboards were the vehicles by which they said he was committing his life to his two young sons.

title: N.C.A.A. to Let Underclassmen Return to College After Trying Out for N.B.A.
description: SAN ANTONIO  College mens basketball players who are not seniors will now be able to try out for N.B.A. teams, receive a draft grade and then decide on returning to college  a stark shift from the past, when players had to declare for the draft before the N.B.A. combine and in doing so renounce future college eligibility.

title: Powerball Has 3 Big Winners, in California, Florida and Tennessee
description: The worlds biggest lottery jackpot of $1.5 billion will be a three-way split of $528 million each.

title: Nets Rally Past Knicks Before Hostile Home Crowd
description: When the Barclays Center doors opened Wednesday night, an army of orange and blue infiltrated the lower and upper bowls of the arena.

title: As Islanders Evolve, Coach Jack Capuano Keeps a Steady Course
description: SYOSSET, N.Y.  Five years into the job, Islanders Coach Jack Capuano still straps a whistle to his left glove and uses it liberally at practice. He covers the rink like a Zamboni, rushing from one end to the other, smacking his stick on the ice to make a point.

title: Explosions in Jakarta, Indonesia
Global Markets Move Lower After Sell-Off
description: HONG KONG  Global markets continued their jitters on Thursday  with China a lone bright spot  as investors continued to show concern about the strength of the worlds largest economies.

title: Jakarta Attack Raises Fears of ISIS Spread in Southeast Asia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The Islamic State claimed responsibility for a terrorist attack in the Indonesian capital on Thursday, raising the specter of an expanded presence by the group in Southeast Asia.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | paradox
description: paradox  \per--dks, pa-r-\  noun

title: Bomb Blasts and Gunfire Rip Through Jakarta
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The center of the Indonesian capital was rocked by a series of explosions and gunfire on Thursday. The police seemed to have been the chief targets.

title: Italy: Arrest in Killing of American
description: The police in Italy have arrested a man in the death of an American woman whose body was found in her apartment in Florence last weekend, according to Italian news reports on Thursday. The man, who was not identified, was facing a charge of aggravated murder in connection with the death of the woman, Ashley Ann Olsen, 35, according to the news agency ANSA. The suspect, who was described as a 25-year-old African immigrant, was ordered detained by the prosecutor in Florence.

title: What to Watch Thursday
description: Dynamic duos: Josh Holloway and Carlton Cuse of Lost team up on Colony. Kevin Hart and Olivia Munn of Ride Along 2 make like Usher and Nelly on Lip Sync Battle. And Jillian Bell and Charlotte Newhouse bring their web series, Idiotsitter, to TV.

title: Corrections: January 14, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: This has been the elephant in the room that no one is prepared to acknowledge: that the great fear is the fear of Islam.

title: Applications for the 2016 New York Portfolio Review
description: What does it take to succeed as a photographer? It takes time, passion and obsession to make great work. But you also need the opportunity to get your work seen and celebrated.

title: Gov. Christie Leaves Gun Controls Behind in New Jersey
description: Its unfortunate that Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey started running away from his own record on sensible gun controls as soon as he began his campaign for the Republican presidential nomination. Shameless pandering to voters in gun-friendly states has ensued. Mr. Christie abandoned his onetime fierce support of an assault weapons ban and reversed his opposition to armor-piercing .50-caliber rifles that have no place in civilized society.

title: The Tempting of Bernie Sanders
description: The front-runner for the Democratic nomination is beset by scandal, trailing (some) Republicans in general-election polling, and at risk of losing to her socialist rival in the earliest two states.

title: Why I Will Never Vote for Donald Trump
description: Beginning with Ronald Reagan, I have voted Republican in every presidential election since I first became eligible to vote in 1980. I worked in the Reagan and George H. W. Bush administrations and in the White House for George W. Bush as a speechwriter and adviser. I have also worked for Republican presidential campaigns, although not this time around.

title: Politics: Everythings Relative
description: Have you noticed how often family members are turning up in the presidential campaign?

title: Stop Wasting Americas Hydropower Potential
description: PRESIDENT OBAMA has described climate change as one of the biggest challenges facing our country and has said he is open to new ideas to address it. He can start by supporting legislation to increase the nations hydropower capacity, one of our vital renewable energy resources.

title: In Myanmar, a Wifes Wrenching Decision
description: SITTWE, Myanmar  How much should you sacrifice to save your husbands life?

title: The Other Obama Legacy
description: On Tuesday, I spoke to a room full of beaming high school and middle school boys  about 150, a vast majority of whom were black  at the St. Petersburg College Allstate Center in St. Petersburg, Fla.

title: How You Justified 10 Lies (or Didnt)
description: Thanks to Stone readers who submitted a response  there were more than 10,000  to my article, Are These 10 Lies Justified? Judging from the number of replies, the task of determining when it is or is not acceptable to lie is obviously one that many people have faced in their own lives. Many of you gave your own examples of lies told and why you believed they were or were not justified. It was heartening to find so many people prepared to reason thoughtfully about important moral issues.

title: Pulling in the Welcome Mat as Fear of Attacks Rise
News Qs | Man Cuddles 1,500-Pound Bear (and Lives to Share the Video)
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Man Cuddles 1,500-Pound Bear (and Lives to Share the Video).

title: In Syrian Town Cut Off From the World, Glimpses of Deprivation
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Nisrine kept teaching school for months as the siege tightened around the Syrian town of Madaya, but had to give up a few weeks ago when her students got too weak from starvation to walk to class. A local medic has been surviving on the rehydration salts he gives patients, while a business school graduate makes soup from grass for his 70-year-old father, consulting shepherds about which kinds their long-since-slaughtered flocks liked best.

title: Elena Ferrantes Naples, Then and Now
description: The historic center of Naples drips with Old World charm  faded laundry strung between buildings, fish shops spilling tubs of clams and eels onto the sidewalk, pasticcerie tucked near Renaissance churches.

title: From Tesla, a New Car Smell That Vegans Can Get Behind
description: FOR the eco-conscious car buyer, Teslas luxury electric vehicles, with their neck-snapping acceleration, are proof that performance doesnt have to be sacrificed at the altar of saving the environment.

title: Four Titles in Last Five Majors, but Serena Williams Faces Doubts
description: Serena Williamss most recent official match did not end well  unless you were a Roberta Vinci fan  as Williams crashed out of last years United States Open in the semifinals without completing the Grand Slam.

title: Off-Season Weddings Can Be Quirky Good Fun, or a Disaster
description: It is very likely that youve seen this invitation before: the nuptials in Florida in August or the bridal procession in Maine in January. And though there was always a Crazy Pete in your life who wanted to bomb down the ski slope after saying I do atop an icy Vermont peak in February, Crazy Pete seems to have become far more the norm than the outlier.

title: Rego Park, Queens: A Rental Near the Relatives
description: When Shosa Karim and Romesh Narain met through friends nearly five years ago, she was living in Manhattans West Village, in a room she called my little shoe box. He was living with his parents at their house in Queens Village, Queens.

title: Republican Debate Spotlight Intensifies as Iowa Caucuses Near
description: Thursday nights Republican presidential debate in North Charleston, S.C., will be the sixth of the primary campaign, but only the next to last before the Iowa caucuses on Feb. 1. And as Newt Gingrich can attest, face-offs held in the final weeks and days before the nominating contests tend to matter more. And the attacks tend to get rougher.

title: Student Question | Where in the World Would You Most Like to Travel?
description: Mexico City? Mozambique? Abu Dhabi? Cuba? Dublin? Washington?

title: Seeking a Happy Gut for Better Health
description: For much of his life, Dr. Vincent Pedre, an internist in New York City, suffered from digestive problems that left him feeling weak and sick to his stomach. As an adult he learned he had irritable bowel syndrome, or I.B.S., a chronic gut disorder that affects up to 10 percent of Americans.

title: Food and the Single Girl
description: On a recent morning, my run took me past our local bagel shop, just early enough that the blooming scent of carby goodness wafted out the front door and chased me down the street.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Jakarta, Oscars, Alan Rickman
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Congressional Republicans Begin Annual Retreat to Define Their Agenda
description: The signal was visible on Wednesday afternoon, when Senator Mitch McConnell, the Kentucky Republican and majority leader, was spotted strolling through the Capitol in a pair of jeans. Republicans have begun their annual retreat, where their policy goals are hashed out in a hotel ballroom.

title: Godzillium vs. Trumpium: Some Suggestions to Add to the Periodic Table
description: What would you name a new element on the periodic table? Thats a question that groups of scientists from Japan, the U.S. and Russia will have to decide as they replace the current identifiers of four elements  113, 115, 117 and 118  with something a little more evocative.

title: During Mens Fashion, Flocks of Peacocks Descend on Florence
description: FLORENCE, Italy  Neither the high winds that diverted flights past Florences airport to nearby regional cities like Bologna or Pisa, nor security jitters that led to undercover patrols and sniffer dogs policing the streets near major monuments deterred the flocks of peacocks who descended on this city this week for the huge mens wear fair Pitti Uomo.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: New York Today: A Dinosaurs Debut
description: Updated 8:46 a.m.

title: Donald Trump Takes a More Frugal Approach in Second Week of Ad Buys
description: After a week of spending big on television advertising, Donald J. Trump appears to be slowing his pace.

title: Morning Agenda: Asia Markets Follow U.S. Lower, but China Rebounds
description: ASIA MARKETS FOLLOW U.S. LOWER, BUT CHINA REBOUNDS | Asian markets fell on Thursday morning after a sell-off in the United States on Wednesday as investors failed to shake concerns about the health of the global economy,Amie Tsang reports in DealBook.

title: Bill Clinton Shares Memories of Hillary Clintons Ability to Connect With His Adversaries
description: As Bill Clinton took to the campaign trail on Wednesday in New Hampshire to make the case for Hillary Clinton, he took a few trips down memory lane, the accomplishments of the 1990s still apparently fresh in the 42nd presidents mind.

title: Ask Well: Travel Constipation
description: Question:

title: Bernie Sanders Heads to New Hampshire, Following His Momentum There
description: As Republican presidential candidates converge on South Carolina for a nationally televised debate, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont will be looking to solidify his lead in New Hampshire.

title: This Year, Novak Djokovics Sights Are Set on Paris and Rio
description: The decade is still young, and Novak Djokovic has already put together two of the most dominant seasons in tennis history. But as another campaign begins in earnest in Melbourne on Monday, he still lacks two of the games biggest prizes: a French Open title and an Olympic gold medal.

title: Seven Potential Battle Lines to Converge in G.O.P. Debate
description: Donald J. Trump versus Ted Cruz. Marco Rubio versus Mr. Cruz. Mr. Rubio versus Chris Christie. Jeb Bush versus almost everyone. The list of fight combinations that could take place at the Republican presidential debate on Thursday night, hosted in South Carolina by the Fox Business Network, is long.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Sick Days
description: Now with computers on our laps, its hard to be perfectly, indulgently sick in bed. With our phones right there, we are tied to the life we were living yesterday, when we werent yet sick in bed. Its time to be truly sick in bed this winter  sick like in the old days, when there was ginger ale from the store and fresh magazines on the night stand. Put it on the autoresponder: Ill reply to you next week when Im no longer sick in bed.

title: Wine and Dine
description: Editors note: Were resurfacing this Eat column from last year for Smarter Living to give you some ideas for using up any leftover holiday wine.

title: What Caused This Mans Chest Pains if Not a Heart Attack?
description: A stabbing sensation followed by thunderous whooshing in his left ear made it difficult for him to sleep for almost a year.

title: My Return to Nepal, in Memoriam
description: Around the third hour on the third day of trekking uphill on a rocky trail in the rain, I felt a profound appreciation for the generous tolerance of my family. We had come to the foothills of the Himalayas by way of various story lines of my life, including President Kennedys 1961 inaugural address and my fathers death in 2014. These events led us to Nepal, and to a walk through the clouds.

title: Against Neutrality
description: The photograph and the words arrive simultaneously. They guarantee each other. You believe the words more because the photograph verifies them, and trust the photograph because you trust the words. Additionally, each puts further pressure on the interpretation: A war photograph can, for example, make a grim situation palatable, just as a story about a scandal can make the politician depicted look pathetic. But images, unlike words, are often presumed to be unbiased. The facticity of a photograph can conceal the craftiness of its content and selection.

title: The Happiness Code
description: Last summer, three dozen people, mostly programmers in their 20s, gathered in a rented house in San Leandro, Calif., a sleepy suburb of San Francisco, for a lesson in comfort-zone expansion. An instructor, Michael Smith, opened the session with a brief lecture on identity, which, he observed, can seem immutable. We think we behave in certain ways because of who we are, he began. But the opposite is also true. Experience can edit identity.

title: Where to Shop in Carmel-by-the-Sea, California
description: This alluring seaside town also has its charms in the winter, with specialty shops offering wares from around the world.

title: After an Enthralling Tennis Season, a Wish List for the Coming Year
description: Tennis dreamed big in 2015, with Serena Williams coming agonizingly close to the first Grand Slam in 27 years. Even when she faltered, the excellent story lines did not, as Flavia Pennetta seized the chance to fulfill her dreams by winning the United States Open  her first major singles title  at age 33.

title: Suketdhir, Indian Label, Wins the Woolmark Prize for Mens Wear
description: FLORENCE, Italy  Someone asked me if I expected this to happen, said Suket Dhir, an Indian fashion designer whose Suketdhir brand was awarded the International Woolmark Prize for mens wear on Wednesday night.

title: Deadliest Ebola Outbreak on Record Is Over, W.H.O. Says
description: DAKAR, Senegal  The World Health Organization declared on Thursday the end to the deadliest Ebola outbreak on record, which killed and sickened tens of thousands of people in West Africa, even as it cautioned that more flare-ups of the disease were likely.

title: Jakarta Attack May Signal Revival of Bloody Campaign in Indonesia
description: BANGKOK  Hundreds of Indonesians have traveled to Syria to join the Islamic State over the past two years, and more than 50 have been killed there, according to the Indonesian government.

title: First Draft Focus: Throwback Thursday  A Crowded Stage
JPMorgan Chases Cost-Cutting Helps Lift Profit 10%
description: JPMorgan Chase said on Thursday that its revenue and profit were up modestly in the fourth quarter of 2015, despite weakness in its global trading business.

title: Deadly Attack in Indonesia
description: The assault was the first major one in Jakarta since the twin bombings of two hotels in 2009.

title: Bill Bryson: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of The Road to Little Dribbling says hes been reading Anna Karenina at such a glacial pace that I have long since lost track of who most of the characters are.

title: Staceyann Chin Worries About Money, and Selling Out
description: The day she traded in her little two-door convertible for a crossover S.U.V.  a mom car, she calls it  the performance poet Staceyann Chin went home and cried. It wasnt enough that pregnancy had forever altered her body. Now, as she saw it, motherhood was taking away her sex appeal, too.

title: Why Spin Is Good for Democracy
description: BETWEEN Tuesdays State of the Union address and Thursdays Republican debate, and with the primary season around the corner, this week may well mark peak spin for the 2016 campaign. President Obama is making the case for his legacy, congressional Republicans are making the case against it, the candidates are puffing themselves up and tearing one another down, and the hired opinion mongers are blanketing us with spin of their own.

title: Student Contest | Our Third Annual 15-Second Vocabulary Video Challenge
description: Kleptomaniac by Quin, Kyle and Hayden, a winner of our 2014 contest.

title: Alan Rickman, Watchable Villain in Harry Potter and Die Hard, Dies at 69
description: Alan Rickman, the accomplished British stage actor who brought an erudite dignity to film roles like Hans Gruber, the nefarious mastermind of Die Hard, and Severus Snape, the dour master of potions in the Harry Potter series, died on Thursday in London. He was 69.

title: Ballet for Cab, Truck and Bicycle
description: Dear Diary:

title: Italy Arrests Suspect in Death of American Woman
description: ROME  The Italian police announced Thursday that a Senegalese migrant had been arrested in the killing of a young American found dead in her Florence apartment last weekend.

title: Video of 2013 Police Shooting Is Released as Chicago Relents
description: CHICAGO  For the second time in recent months, Chicago officials released video of police officers chasing and fatally shooting an African-American teenager, bowing to public and legal pressure amid calls for greater scrutiny of officers use of deadly force.

title: Oscar Nominations 2016
description: LOS ANGELES  Oscar voters showered The Revenant and Mad Max: Fury Road with honors on Thursday, including best picture nominations, but were less kind to some contenders and put forth, once again, an all-white field of acting nominees.

title: Living Under the Sword of ISIS in Syria
description: Raqqa, Syria  A FEW weeks ago, my friend Saeed tried to get his family out of Raqqa, the city in eastern Syria that since 2014 has been the de facto capital of the self-declared Islamic State. Its becoming very hard to get any kind of work in Raqqa, he told me. He was depressed that hed failed in his attempt to smuggle his family over the Turkish border to the north.

title: 3 Columbia Students Killed in Bus Accident in Honduras
description: It was an adventure. A chance to learn and explore and help people with urgent health care needs in a place far from the comfortable confines of Columbia Universitys campus.

title: Joel Klein, Ex-New York Schools Chancellor, to Join Health Insurance Start-Up
description: Joel I. Klein, the former chancellor of the New York City public school system, is moving beyond education to become a top executive at Oscar, a New York health insurance start-up with a focus on technology, the company announced on Thursday.

title: Nuclear Facilities in 20 Countries May Be Easy Targets for Cyberattacks
description: WASHINGTON  Twenty nations with significant atomic stockpiles or nuclear power plants have no government regulations requiring minimal protection of those facilities against cyberattacks, according to a study by the Nuclear Threat Initiative.

title: Officials Accused of Extortion to Clear Athletes Who Doped
description: International sports officials have occasionally run afoul of their own rules and even the law over the years, from the Olympic officials caught accepting bribes to award the 2002 Winter Games to Salt Lake City, to the soccer officials who were more recently accused of accepting bribes related to TV contracts and World Cup bids.

title: Some Cars by Renault and Other Makers Fail French Air-Quality Emissions Tests
description: PARIS  The French government said on Thursday that tests on exhaust emissions of nearly two dozen cars made by Renault and other automakers had found that several of the cars violated the countrys air-quality standards.

title: 1941: Japan Opens Propaganda Office
description: MEXICO CITY  Japan began to oil propaganda guns in Mexico today [Jan. 14] for immediate use in a twofold fight against United States economic penetration and against the newly announced plan of the Roosevelt administration to block Axis purchases of Mexicos war minerals and oil. High authorities disclosed that representatives of Domei, the official Japanese news agency, have established offices in this capital for distribution of news free of charge to Mexican and other Latin-American newspapers. The United States has no propaganda agency to combat this obvious effort by Japan to influence the Americas. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 15, 1941

title: Tate Makes Room for Louise Bourgeois in Its New Building
description: LONDON  Louise Bourgeois will be one of the first artists to be showcased at Tate Moderns new museum, which is scheduled to open on June 17, the Tate announced on Thursday.

title: New York Times 2016 Academy Awards Ballot
description: Make your Oscar picks and share your ballot with your friends.

title: Evictions in Walled Old City Stir Up a Hornets Nest
description: JERUSALEM  The Palestinian residents of the Khaldiyya Ascent, a narrow cobblestone alley in Jerusalems walled Old City, have for decades lived in tiny, crammed apartments with high, moldy ceilings and peeling paint. Now, at least seven of these families face eviction threats by Jewish organizations reclaiming properties they owned before Israel was established in 1948.

title: Daily Report: Tech Earnings Season Begins With a Warning
description: The tech earnings season got off to a rocky start on Wednesday with the surprise warning from GoPro, the maker of action cameras, that its quarterly results would be lower than expected by Wall Street analysts and that it had cut about 7 percent of its work force. A top executive also departed the company.

title: Everybody Loves a Winner. So What Happens if Trump Loses?
description: Donald Trump misses no opportunity to remind us that hes ahead in the polls for the Republican presidential nomination. During a rally in Claremont, N.H., last week, he said, When people say, Why do you always talk about the polls? I say, Because Im winning! Believe me, if Im not winning, I dont talk about them.

title: Amazon Prime Video, Home and Away
description: Q. Is there a way to watch Amazons Instant Video on my television instead of my tablet? If Im subscribed to Amazon Prime in the United States, can I watch the Prime Instant Video outside the country, like when Im traveling overseas for work?

title: American Horror Story Season 5 Finale: The Real Lady
description: And so began the era of Iris and Liz Taylor. Our heroines have taken over the Cortez (though, didnt The Countess leave it to Ramona at the end of the last episode?) and, flush with cash after liquidating their former employers art collection, do a little redecorating. Theres 400 thread-count Egyptian cotton! Complimentary champagne! Japanese toilets!

title: The Secret Behind Italys Favorite New Film
description: ROME  A BALDING government clerk in his late 30s has one true love: il posto fisso, a job for life. He doesnt want to compete in the labor market; he has no urge to move on. He doesnt even want to earn more. Give him a desk, a chair and a 9-to-5 job in the pubblica amministrazione, and hes happy. Clocking in late, chatting with colleagues, accepting small bribes from taxpayers (most favored: quail), a regular salary  thats life!

title: Ron Lieber: Your Money Matters
description: For many of us, new years bring resolutions  perhaps to exercise more, or eat better, or maybe be a little wiser with money.

title: Guantnamo Population Drops to 93 after 10 Prisoners Go to Oman
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon on Thursday announced that it had transferred 10 lower-level Yemeni detainees from the Guantnamo Bay prison to Oman. The departure of the unusually large group of prisoners  each of whom spent about 14 years in custody  reduced the prison population to 93, the first time it has been in double digits since the Bush administration began bringing Afghanistan war prisoners to the naval base in January 2002.

title: As Aid Reaches Syrians, U.N. Chief Says Withholding Food Is a War Crime
description: UNITED NATIONS  The head of the United Nations said on Thursday that the warring parties in Syria were committing war crimes by withholding food from civilians. He called for all sides to lift their sieges immediately and unconditionally as a confidence-building gesture ahead of peace talks scheduled for Jan. 25.

title: Candidates for the Harvard Board of Overseers
description: The five candidates have a mix of political, academic, business and legal experience. One is a household name, and all attended Harvard in some capacity.

title: In Wisconsin, Efforts to End Taunting at Games Lead to Claims of Coddling
description: For fans at a basketball game, there are few sights as satisfying as a rival players shot sailing cleanly beyond the rim and backboard.

title: Oscars 2016: Its a Nearly All-White Nominees List  Again
description: #OscarsSoWhite, that damning hashtag that made the rounds last year, can again, unhappily, be revived for this years Oscar nominations, which were announced Thursday morning.

title: Los Angeles Opera Names First Artist in Residence
description: The Los Angeles Opera announced Thursday that Matthew Aucoin, the rising young composer, conductor and librettist, would become its first artist in residence next fall, and that he would conduct, compose, and work with young artists there over the next three seasons.

title: 1966: Succession Crisis in New Delhi
description: NEW DELHI  A wide-open race developed today [Jan. 14] for the premiership of India as a cabinet dispute erupted over the four-day-old Tashkent peace agreement with neighboring Pakistan. A new air of crisis gripped the country as reports from West Pakistan revealed that two persons were killed and 12 injured yesterday in a clash between police and students in Lahore, who were protesting the Tashkent declaration. Reports said police used tear gas against the students, who carried banners demanding Liberation of the state from Indian rule.New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 15, 1966

title: 3 Found Guilty of Aiding $20 Million London Theft
description: LONDON  It has been called the largest burglary in Englands history: four aging thieves who conspired to steal about $20 million in gold, jewelry and gems from Hatton Garden Safe Deposit Ltd. in London, aided by the book Forensics for Dummies and diamond-tipped power drills that could penetrate concrete.

title: Symphony Spaces President to Retire
description: Symphony Space, the cultural center on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, will soon have a space to fill at the top: Cynthia Elliott, its president and chief executive office, plans to retire at the end of the 2016 season, the organization announced this week.

title: A Chess Prodigy, a Mentor and Still a Teenage Girl
description: There was no hurling of pawns or bishops at the second annual New Jersey All-Girls Chess Camp in Branchburg this month. But if there had been, the camps founder, Alice Dong, would have understood the impulse.

title: Snape Is Dead
description: Snape is dead.

title: Straddling Conventional and Alternative Cancer Treatment
description: When Dr. Nicholas Gonzalez died in July, there was not much notice. He did not get an obituary in The New York Times or in most other major media outlets.

title: In Britain, Major Parties Ensnared by Internal Strife
description: LONDON  Its common enough, as in the United States just now, for political parties to war internally in the run-up to an election  who will be the candidate, which faction will triumph, what jobs will go to which advisers?

title: Few Answers on True Owners of Art Found in Gurlitt Trove
description: BERLIN  After a two-year, nearly $2 million investigation, a German government task force set up to determine ownership of an art collection amassed by a Nazi-era dealer announced Thursday that it had identified the rightful owners of just five of the works whose provenance was in doubt.

title: Jeb Bush Takes Aim at Donald Trump in New Hampshire Ad
description: Jeb Bush is highlighting his recent stump speech criticism of Donald J. Trump in a new 60-second ad titled Enough, which is to run in New Hampshire.

title: New Louisiana Governor, John Bel Edwards, Is Off to a Volatile Start
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  John Bel Edwards was sworn in the Deep Souths only Democratic governor this week, and already he has experienced momentous triumph  and momentous defeat.

title: How to Watch the Republican Debate
description: The Republican presidential candidates will be in South Carolina on Thursday for the partys sixth nationally televised debate, hosted by the Fox Business Network. Clashes among the candidates are likely to be pointed, as they seek to make their case to voters less than three weeks before the first nominating contest, the Iowa caucuses on Feb. 1.

title: Jennifer Lawrences Red-Carpet Looks
description: Though the actress has been a proper mannequin for Dior since 2012, a style seems to be slowly emerging.

title: Jennifer Lawrence Is a Darling of Dior
description: When shes not jet-skiing with Amy Schumer, discussing her lady lumps, or taking on equal pay in Hollywood, Jennifer Lawrence, a self-professed workaholic, is likely to be found on the red carpet swathed in Dior. Ms. Lawrence, 25, was just nominated for an Oscar for her role in Joy and is in contention for her roles in that movie and in The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 2 at the Critics Choice Awards on Sunday. She was signed to a lucrative deal by the French luxury brand in 2012 and has, to some red carpet commentators lament, been a proper mannequin since.

title: Home Builder Countryside Properties Plans I.P.O. in London
description: LONDON  Countryside Properties, a British home builder that is majority owned by the American private equity firm Oaktree Capital Management, said on Thursday that it planned to list its shares in an initial public offering in London next month.

title: Donald Trump Disavows Actions by White Nationalist Promoting His Bid
description: Donald J. Trump has tapped into intense anger and anti-immigrant sentiment by part of the American electorate, exciting people who have paid little attention to politics and drawing approval from groups that some would consider to be fringe.

title: Barrington Stage Company Announces Summer Lineup
description: A new musical by Joe Iconis (Be More Chill) will be mounted this summer at the Barrington Stage Company as one of several new works having premieres by that nonprofit theater in the Berkshires.

title: Ben Carsons Campaign Finance Chief Quits
description: The disarray within Ben Carsons campaign continued Thursday as his campaigns finance chairman abruptly resigned hours before Republican presidential candidates were set to gather in South Carolina for a debate.

title: The End of Small Talk
description: When my relationship unraveled nearly two years ago, I decided to suspend my career as an actuary in Boston and take a long vacation in Costa Rica, where I planned to learn how to surf and do yoga. Yes, it was the most clichd response possible for a heartbroken 32-year-old Westerner like me.

title: Ragy Thomas of Sprinklr: How Navet Can Become a Strength
description: This interview with Ragy Thomas, founder and chief executive of Sprinklr, a social media software platform, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: 36 Hours in Quebec City
description: In Quebecs capital, hip and historic exist side by side, with cultural and culinary enticements for all manner of visitors.

title: Verbatim: Barack Obama on Michelle Obamas Presidential Ambitions
description: President Obama to a supporter in Baton Rouge, La., who asked whether the first lady might be persuaded to run for high political office someday.

title: How Some Would Level the Playing Field: Free Harvard Degrees
description: Should Harvard be free?

title: Heartburn Drugs Tied to Kidney Problems
description: Proton pump inhibitors, or P.P.I.s, the commonly used heartburn medicines, may increase the risk for kidney disease.

title: Why I Always Wanted to Be a Secretary
description: Lawrence, Kan.  I TOOK my first secretarial job in college, where I worked down the hall from a Triga Mark II nuclear reactor. I lasted just two lonely weeks, waiting to answer nonexistent phone calls and compulsively checking my radiation exposure badge.

title: The Shah of Iran, the Islamic Revolution and the Mystery of the Missing Imam
description: Even by todays standards, the Middle East in the 1970s was chaotic. Bombings, hijackings and assassinations were daily headlines. In the midst of the mayhem, one of the most revered clerics in the Shiite branch of Islam vanished while visiting Libya.

title: An Early Master of the Art of Collecting
description: The history of collecting will expand on Friday, Jan. 22, when the Morgan Library & Museum opens Pierre-Jean Mariette and the Art of Collecting Drawings.

title: Sleeping Giants Hand Eye to Have New York Premiere by Eighth Blackbird
description: Musicians, like highly skilled workers in many fields, have long sought strength through collective action. Sleeping Giant, a collective of six young American composers, has a more loosely creative goal in mind: This is no union; just a group of like-minded, stylistically varied composers who are generating collective works and commissions.

title: New York Jewish Film Festival Looks to the Past
description: As the New York Jewish Film Festival (Jan. 13-26) celebrates its 25th season at the Walter Reade Theater, its time to look back as well as forward. High points of the retrospective within the festival include Michael Hanekes 1997 screen adaptation of Franz Kafkas unfinished final novel, The Castle (Monday, Jan. 18); Andrzej Wajdas World War II drama Holy Week (Jan. 17); and Mahler on the Couch (Jan. 18), the 2010 drama about the marital woes of Gustav Mahler and his wife, Alma.

title: Globalfest and Brazilian Explorative Music Come to New York
