description: The Association of Performing Arts Presenters convention is the January thaw for music in New York  an audition for the presenters, a potential binge for the rest of us. It brings Globalfest, where 12 international performers are showcased in one building over five hours: among them this year, the New York debut of the Haitian group Lakou Mizik; deep Delta blues from the Music Maker Blues Revue; raspy-voiced and Arab-influenced Mexican cabaret from Astrid Hadad; the Arabic-flamenco-jazz reunion of the oud player Simon Shaheens ensemble Zafir; and Fendika, with its own twist on Ethiopian funk. (7 p.m., Sunday, Jan. 17, Webster Hall, globalfest.org.)

title: No Comment Necessary: Paul Ryan Attacks Obama For Criticizing Muslim Ban
description: During his State of the Union address on Tuesday, President Obama referred to people promising to restore past glory if we just got some group or idea that was threatening America under control, an implicit criticism of Donald Trump and his call for a temporary ban on Muslims entering the United States. In an interview with USA Today on Wednesday, Paul Ryan said he also opposed such a ban. But he lambasted the president for bringing the issue up in his speech.

title: MoMA Highlights Work of the Choreographer Jack Cole
description: The choreographer Jack Cole has flown under the radar of American dance history. A pioneer of theatrical jazz onstage and on the screen  and a performance coach to Rita Hayworth and Marilyn Monroe  he influenced the likes of Jerome Robbins, Alvin Ailey and Bob Fosse, yet we dont hear about him much. Beginning on Wednesday, Jan. 20, the Museum of Modern Art is bringing Coles work to light with All That Jack (Cole), a two-week film and lecture series organized with the dance critic Debra Levine, a Cole scholar.

title: Four Oscar-Nominated Actresses on Their Processes
description: Upstart ingenues and heavy hitters figure equally in todays  Oscar nominations for Best Actress and Best Supporting Actress  and in the pages of T. Read on to see what four of this years nominated actresses have told us about their craft.

title: JPMorgan Results Offer Strong Case for Financial Technology
description: JPMorgan Chases fourth-quarter results offer a compelling case for cranking up the industrys use of financial technology.

title: American Experience Looks Back at Bonnie and Clyde
description: Back in 1967, the Bonnie and Clyde story received the Hollywood treatment, with Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway starring as the outlaws Clyde Barrow and Bonnie Parker in Arthur Penns film.

title: Martin OMalley Makes the Cut for Next Democratic Debate
description: Martin OMalley, the former governor of Maryland who has lagged in polls by double digits as the Democratic voting contests approach, has qualified for the final debate before the Feb. 1 Iowa caucuses, NBC executives announced on Thursday.

title: Rousing Performance at Monmouth, and Thats Just on the Bench
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J.  Monmouth Coach King Rice was searching for talent at a high school basketball tournament in Philadelphia five years ago when he spotted a little fellow on an adjacent court who possessed a knack for penetrating and scoring.

title: Chairlift on the Arias, Beats and Jazz Grooves That Fed Moth
description: In the four years since Caroline Polachek and Patrick Wimberly last released an album as the Brooklyn electronic pop duo Chairlift, they have toured the world, written a Beyonc song (No Angel), built their own studio in a former pharmaceutical factory and become real New Yorkers.

title: Taste of Samarkand
description: Kosher Uzbek cooking in Queens.

title: Taste of Samarkand Is a Silk Road Oasis in Queens
description: The bread looks ready to levitate. Called noni toki, it is matzo-thin, a blistered expanse 14 inches across, the edges uplifted as if in supplication. At Taste of Samarkand, this is achieved by slapping and patting dough around the inverted underbelly of a kazan, a high-sloped Uzbek frying pan akin to a Chinese wok, then baking it over the stove until hard and crisp.

title: Pulled in 2 Directions, Marco Rubio Toughens on Immigration, a Little
description: MIAMI  A Latin singing duo had just finished warming up the crowd for Senator Marco Rubio on Sunday here when he looked out from the stage and asked if he might offer a few words in Spanish.

title: Strangely Self-Confident Permahawks
description: An odd thing about permahawks  people who have been demanding, year after year, that the Fed raise rates now now now. (The same is true, actually, about the overlapping group warning nonstop about fiscal crisis.) They are, by and large, free-market acolytes who insist that markets know best; yet they also insist that we ignore financial markets that have been telling us that inflation is quiescent and the U.S. government is solvent.

title: New Prison Rule in Russia: No Swearing
description: MOSCOW  Russias prison system, the successor to the notoriously harsh gulag, has issued an edict that would have shocked even the victims of Stalins purges: From now on, officials say, some prisoners will be forbidden to swear.

title: Powerball Winners, Beware: Good Fortune Can Trigger a Downfall
description: For some people who won the lottery, hitting it big turned out to be the worst thing that could happen.

title: Outrage
description: Greg Sargent marvels at the spectacle of Paul Ryan, who is outraged, outraged, at President Obama for devoting part of the State of the Union to a denunciation of politicians who encourage bigotry. In fact, Ryan says that Obama degraded the presidency by denouncing bigotry  because that amounts to an intervention in the Republican primary.

title: Everyone Here Is a Star: Oscar Nominees React
description: Thoughts from Jennifer Lawrence, Sylvester Stallone and other newly minted contenders.

title: My Favorite Alan Rickman Line
description: He was wonderful in everything he did; but this was from a not especially wonderful movie, Bottle Shock:

title: Division of Labor and Costs in a Relationship
description: My boyfriend and I live together. We split the cost of food and household goods 50-50. Recently, I was found to have an autoimmune problem that requires using more expensive cleaning products. My boyfriend was upset about splitting the cost. Living alone, he said, he would not use them. (He doesnt complain that I do all the cleaning.) Still, I proposed a 75-25 split, and he accepted. Now I feel bitter. Were only talking $20 a month, but it feels as if he doesnt appreciate my labor or sympathize with my condition. But I have to honor the compromise I suggested, right?

title: Turkey Strikes Islamic State Targets in Retaliation for Istanbul Bombing
description: ISTANBUL  Turkish ground forces have launched a major offensive against Islamic State targets in Iraq and Syria in retaliation for a suicide bombing that killed 10 German tourists in Istanbul this week, Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu said on Thursday.

title: Tacoma Art Museum to Build New Gallery to House Major Gift
description: The Tacoma Art Museum in Washington said Thursday that it has been given 225 works from various artists as gifts from Becky Benaroya, the widow of the Seattle-based real estate developer Jack Benaroya.

title: With Ride Along 2 and Other Films, Will Packer Blurs the Niche Lines
description: MIAMI  Twenty years ago, freshly graduated from college, Will Packer loaded 350 newspapers into his Honda Civic every day at dawn and drove around Atlanta, tossing them onto lawns and driveways. In the afternoons, he sold subscriptions door to door.

title: U.S. Lists Afghan Branch of ISIS as Terrorist Group
description: The State Department on Thursday designated the Afghan affiliate of the Islamic State, a splinter group mostly made up of former Afghan and Pakistani Taliban members, as a foreign terrorist organization.

title: Nerds, a Musical About Bill Gates and Steve Jobs, Heads to Broadway
description: Nerds, a musical satire about the rivalry between the tech pioneers Bill Gates and Steve Jobs, is coming to Broadway.

title: New Bernie Sanders Ad, on Wall Street, Fires Back at Hillary Clinton
description: As the race in Iowa and New Hampshire tightens, the Sanders campaign is drawing its most direct contrast with Hillary Clinton in a new ad, titled Two Visions, running in the two early states.

title: New Video Collections Examine Machines Modern and Less So
description: Early film artists were acutely aware of motion pictures as a machine-based art particularly qualified to embody the feel of modernity and the pace of urban life. Recurring preoccupations for the avant-garde of the 1920s included the mechanical man and the metropolis. Both can be found, somewhat battered by time, in the films of Manfred Kirchheimer and the Brothers Quay, contemporary artists with works newly out on disc.

title: In Alan Rickman the Stage Actor, an Erotic Blend of Desire and Conscience
description: No man, at least not since Nol Coward, wore a dressing gown with more slippery ease or dangerous intent. When the British actor Alan Rickman appeared on Broadway in Howard Daviess 2002 revival of Cowards Private Lives, he brought a refreshing, and slightly alarming, sexual frankness to the role of Elyot, that comedys fast-quipping, martini-sipping hero.

title: Mad Tiger and Other Films Join a New Wave of Punk Documentaries
description: In the opening images of Los Punks: We Are All We Have, the director Angela Boatwrights documentary about the thriving punk scene in the backyards of South-Central and East Los Angeles, two young women in miniskirts wrestle each other to the ground. A guitarist spins on his back, naked except for a small loincloth. There are guns, booze, vomiting and brawls, all set to the high-speed beats of the punk band Street Threat. It looks like chaos; indeed, a reveler describes it as such. But others speak of the camaraderie of these shows, how they give participants a keen sense of belonging. I dont feel at home anywhere else, one says.

title: N.F.L. Divisional Playoffs: Injuries and New Blood Could Sway Fates
description: The N.F.L. playoffs divisional round is this weekend. Here are the matchups and who we think will win them.

title: The Wines of Santa Cruz
description: An appellation defined by elevation in the mountains of Santa Cruz.

title: Santa Cruz Cabernet: Wines You Never Knew
description: WOODSIDE, Calif.  If you poke around the subdivisions in the foothills of the Santa Cruz Mountains, you may come across the remnants of La Questa Vineyard, which 100 years ago was thought to produce the finest cabernet sauvignon in California. It was first planted in 1884 by E. H. Rixford, a lawyer who modeled his 40 acres of vines on the blend used at Chteau Margaux. Now, the few remaining vines survive in one of the many yards in which residents enjoy the high-status hobby of grape-growing.

title: Review: In The Confidence Game by Maria Konnikova, the Siren Call of the Swindler
description: Almost all of us are suckers for books about suckers. Whats not to like? They flatter our lofty conception of ourselves  no chumps are we, with our wits about us and our nose for baloney as fine as a butchers  and they satisfy the secret part of us that delights in gossip and goggles at audacity.

title: Hurricane Alex, a Rare January Storm, Forms in the Atlantic
description: The first January-born hurricane in the Atlantic Ocean since 1938 formed on Thursday, and headed toward Portugals Azores islands.

title: A Bitcoin Believers Crisis of Faith
description: Mike Hearn, a British computer programmer, holed up in his two-bedroom apartment in Zurich over several days and nights last week, writing a cri de coeur.

title: Defense Secretary Says U.S. Sailors Made Navigational Error Into Iranian Waters
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The American sailors detained by Iran earlier this week made a navigational error that mistakenly took them into Iranian territorial waters, Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter said on Thursday.

title: Anglican Church Disciplines U.S. Episcopals Over Gay Marriages
description: After 13 years of rancor over conflicting views on homosexuality, the archbishops of the Anglican Communion have voted to impose sanctions for three years on the Episcopal Church, the American branch of the Communion, for its decision last summer to allow clergy to perform same-sex marriages, church officials said Thursday.

title: Vail International Dance Festival Announces Program
description: The American Ballet Theater principal Isabella Boylston will be artist in residence and the Philadelphia-based BalletX will be the company in residence at this years Vail International Dance Festival, which announced its 2016 program Thursday.

title: Savages Embrace Love With Controlled Chaos on Adore Life
description: LONDON  We always have to try things that scare us a little bit, said Ayse Hassan, the bassist in the English band Savages. A year ago, Savages spent most of January in snowy, blustery New York City, working six days a week in a shared loft and rehearsal space in Bushwick, Brooklyn.

title: Searching for Cancer Maps in Free-Floating DNA
description: Loose pieces of DNA course through our veins. As cells in our body die, they cast off fragments of genes, some of which end up in the bloodstream, saliva and urine.

title: As Refugees Flee Violence in Central America
description: To the Editor:

title: Foursquare Raises $45 Million, Cutting Its Valuation Nearly in Half
description: When Dennis Crowley helped found Foursquare in 2009, he was ahead of the pack in creating a social app that used location technology. Now Foursquare may be at the front of another coming wave: tech start-ups that are raising money at lower valuations than before.

title: In Florence, Transforming an Old Theater Into a Technicolor World
description: Tonight, Florences oldest theater, the Teatro Niccolini, will reopen after 20 years. And it will play host to a very different kind of show: a fashion presentation from the young designer Marco de Vincenzo, during Pitti Uomo, the Italian tradeshow here.

title: Bowie Tribute Concert to Have a Second Night, at Radio City
description: Shortly before David Bowies death, Carnegie Hall announced a concert honoring the singer on March 31. Now, the event, part of the City Winery founder Michael Dorfs annual tribute series, will be reframed as a memorial concert, and a second show has been added at Radio City Music Hall, with Michael Stipe, Laurie Anderson and Cat Power joining one or both of the lineups.

title: Inside the Armed Standoff in Oregon: Reporters Notebook
description: BURNS, Ore.  As a reporter covering the West for The New York Times, I have learned that bringing the story to readers often involves flying from my home in Colorado, driving hours through the mountains and  occasionally  hiking to reach the people whose voices we want to collect.

title: A Cure for Cancer?
description: To the Editor:

title: Alan Rickman (1946-2016)
description: Alan Rickman was a magnetic stage actor who found worldwide fame in film.

title: Astounding Feats in Pen, Ink and Magnifying Glass
description: Matthias Buchinger must have been some kind of genius. A draftsman, calligrapher, magician and musician, he traveled all over Northern Europe to entertain kings and aristocrats as well as hoi polloi with amazing feats of physical dexterity. Buchinger was especially noted for elaborate drawings featuring biblical passages written in letters too small to be read by ordinary naked eyes.

title: What Serendipity Requires
description: To the Editor:

title: Iran vs. Saudi Arabia
description: To the Editor:

title: ISIS Attack in Indonesia
description: Two civilians and five assailants were killed in the explosions and gunfire in Jakarta, Indonesia, on Thursday. The Islamic State has claimed responsibility.

title: How We Judge Women
description: To the Editor:

title: Once a Republican
description: To the Editor:

title: India, Praising Arrest of Militants, to Restart Talks with Pakistan
description: NEW DELHI  Indian officials on Thursday said they would reschedule diplomatic talks with Pakistan, originally planned for Friday, in the very near future, expressing satisfaction with Pakistans arrest of militants thought to be connected to a recent attack on Indian soil.

title: Intels Earnings Fall in Fourth Quarter, but Beat Expectations
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Not that long ago, Wall Street believed that as Intel goes, so goes much of the rest of the technology industry.

title: U.S. Proposes Spending $4 Billion on Self-Driving Cars
description: DETROIT  With automakers and technology companies rushing to develop self-driving cars, the Obama administration on Thursday pledged to expedite regulatory guidelines for autonomous vehicles and invest in research to help bring them to market.

title: F.D.A. Faulted for Problems With Drug Tracking
description: WASHINGTON  Federal investigators said Thursday that there were flaws in the way the Food and Drug Administration tracked drugs after they came to market, raising questions about the agencys effectiveness as the countrys main drug overseer.

title: Review: Band of Robbers Riffs on Mark Twain Characters in Todays Missouri
description: The whimsical crime comedy Band of Robbers might be described as a hipsters answer to the National Treasure movies, made for a more sophisticated audience and outfitted with literary credentials. This comic take on The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn and The Adventures of Tom Sawyer is infused with a gleefully absurdist sense of humor while retaining a childlike sense of wonder.

title: Review: Miles Okazaki Bends Conventionality to His Whims at the Jazz Gallery
description: Were not trying to trick you, the guitarist Miles Okazaki said at the Jazz Gallery on Wednesday night. Under the circumstances, the reassurance was understandable: Mr. Okazaki was introducing his new band, Trickster, and he didnt want to start off on the wrong footing, not with so many twists in the road ahead.

title: Mortality Lives Again as Funeral and Cemetery Items Pique Interest
description: The painful subjects of mourning and burying the dead are drawing attention at museums and auction houses, while some attractions in the field are reaching the ends of their runs.

title: Review: Tommy Tune, Tonight! Is the Musical Autobiography of a Showbiz Trouper
description: If the ageless song and dance man Tommy Tune seems to have one foot off the ground and his head in the clouds, one reason is that he stands tall (5 feet 17 inches, by his count) and can literally see over most peoples heads. At Tuesdays opening night performance of his show Tommy Tune, Tonight! at the Caf Carlyle, he was the suave, ebullient charmer we all know and treasure. Over the decades, this ingenuous grown-up boy from Texas has also acquired the glitter-crusted shell of a show business trouper like his spiritual godmother, Carol Channing.

title: Third Gunman in Attacks in Paris Area Is Identified
description: PARIS  The Paris prosecutor identified on Thursday a Belgian-Moroccan man as one of the previously unidentified jihadists involved in the terror attacks in Paris and its suburbs in November.

title: Review: Barb Jungr Applies Her Emphatic Voice to the Beatles Music
description: Who among us isnt familiar with the refrain Ah, look at all the lonely people from the Beatles classic Eleanor Rigby? To hear it performed by the great British cabaret singer Barb Jungr and the Broadway musical director John McDaniel at Feinsteins/54 Below on Wednesday evening was to find it clarified as never before.

title: A Second Chance for Sebastian Coe to Clean Up His Sport
description: In the world of Olympic sports, Richard W. Pound, the former chief of the World Anti-Doping Agency, is known as a straight talker who has no tolerance for corruption or doping.

title: Donald Trumps Popularity Hits New Heights in Latest National Poll
description: Donald J. Trumps popularity has climbed to its highest level to date less than a month before the first Republican votes will be cast, according to a national NBC/Wall Street Journal poll released Thursday that shows Republicans becoming increasingly comfortable with the idea of the billionaire businessman being their presidential nominee.

title: An Antarctic Art Project, Complete With Fake Passports
description: For more than five decades, the South Pole has remained free of any one nations rule; rather, under the Antarctic Treaty, which includes signatures from 53 nations, Antarctic territory is a demilitarized, nuclear-free, neutral zone. Or is it? Antarctic Flag, a work by the artists Lucy and Jorge Orta that was first unveiled during their 2007 expedition to Antarctica, stands as a symbolic bricolage of the territorys supporting nations and their shared values  but also raises the question of whether peaceful coexistence there is sustainable. The partners and artistic duo, also referred to as Studio Orta, based in France and internationally recognized for their socially mindful practice, are all too aware of potential danger in the region. Come 2048, a 1991 agreement protecting what lurks beneath the ice there  oil, coal and kimberlite (thus, maybe, diamonds)  will be open for review, and its unclear to what lengths some nations might compete to have sole ownership.

title: Review: In Turandot and La Bohme, a New Depth of Emotion
description: The frail seamstress Mim and the fierce princess Turandot are two opposite poles of Puccinian womanhood, and both are characters that can seem one-dimensional. But each have received a multilayered interpretation as Franco Zeffirellis lavish productions of Turandot and La Bohme have returned to the Metropolitan Opera with new casts.

title: Zane Zhou
description: The artists paired photographs capture summer nostalgia.

title: Dreamy, Sexy Photos of Sun-Drenched Summer Afternoons
description: Lovers, friends, the smell of the sea, the warmth of the sun on the nape of your neck: Zane Zhous photographs, redolent of summertime nostalgia, are a reminder of the powerful, universal intimacy a photographer can create with an unknown viewer. Both aspects of Zhous artistic background  he studied painting in Shanghai before moving to New York to pursue fashion photography at the School of Visual Arts in 2013  are evident in his photo pairs, which juxtapose dreamy, moody images of young men against perfectly composed trees, seascapes and roadsides. These photographs capture the ephemeral journey of the golden moments of summer and the ways we experience and spend our youth, Zhou says. (And if you cant get enough of the young photographers work, check out his contributions for T.)

title: Ben McAdoo Is Replacing, Not Replicating, His Boss With the Giants
description: The Giants pool of candidates to replace Tom Coughlin was short on pizazz from the beginning. Half the candidates were brainy tacticians in headsets, the football equivalent of Sheldon from The Big Bang Theory.

title: Review: In Michael Bays 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi, Clarity Isnt the Objective
description: Slipped into 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi, among the torrential bullets and convulsive mayhem, is a protracted advertisement for a Mercedes-Benz S.U.V. A dramatization of the 2012 attack on the American diplomatic mission in Libya that resulted in the death of four Americans, including Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens, the movie is a pummeling slog  45 minutes of setup and an eternity of relentless combat. So its a relief when the director Michael Bay, amid this bleak fusillade, provides a little zigzagging action-movie-style relief. You cant help but admire how well the truck holds up with its wheels aflame, like a 21st-century chariot of fire.

title: Martha Kelly in Baskets: Funny, if Youre O.K. With That
description: Martha Kelly isnt sure why Zach Galifianakis called her out of the blue a couple of years ago and asked her to star in his new FX comedy, Baskets, which debuts Thursday, Jan. 21. But shes pretty sure it wasnt for her dramatic gifts.

title: That Jeb Bush Freight Train? A Wreck, Marco Rubio Allies Chortle
description: After Jeb Bushs super PAC, Right to Rise, imagined Senator Marco Rubio as a weathervane and Mr. Bush as a freight train by comparison, Conservative Solutions PAC, which is behind Mr. Rubio, fired back with this ad, acidly titled Train Wreck.

title: Galleries to Mount Joint Carolee Schneemann Exhibition
description: Sure, the artist Carolee Schneemann may be best known for pulling a scroll out of her vagina.

title: Review: Morphia Series Presents a Duet of Darkness and Depth
description: The god of dreams is an apt subject for any dance, where reality is seldom the main focus. In Morphia Series, the Melbourne dancer and choreographer Helen Herbertson and the designer Ben Cobham present a morsel of a piece inspired by Morpheus, that god. Before it starts, audience members are offered an actual morsel: blue brie, passion fruit mascarpone, nectarine and a rose petal on polenta.

title: Chipotles New Mantra: Safe Food, Not Just Fresh
description: Not many business success stories rival Chipotle Mexican Grills.

title: Photos of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Turkey and More  Pictures of the Day

title: State Street Settles Pay-to-Play Charges for $12 Million
description: State Streets banking unit will pay $12 million to settle Securities and Exchange Commission charges that an executive and an outside lobbyist operated a pay-to-play scheme to win the firm contracts from Ohio pension funds.

title: This Weeks Movies | Jan. 15, 2016
description: The New York Times film critics review Ride Along 2, 13 Hours and In the Shadow of Women.

title: Goldman to Pay Up to $5 Billion to Settle Claims of Faulty Mortgages
description: More than seven years after the worst of the financial crisis, Goldman Sachs is again paying a price for the role it played.

title: Things to Do in Connecticut, Jan. 16 Through 24
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Kansas City Chiefs at New England Patriots Preview
description: Kansas City Chiefs at New England Patriots

title: Jan. 14, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Turkey, Beirut, Russia and Indonesia.

title: Review: Maurice Hines Tappin Thru Life, a Jazz- and Tap-Filled Journey Through the Past
description: Any committed theatergoer knows what a difference a day makes: how much a show can change, for good or ill, from one performance to the next. But critics rarely get to see that in action before we write. We swoop in just once, and whatever is happening in the moment is what we have to go on.

title: Review: Ride Along 2 Reloads Twin Barrels of Ice Cube and Kevin Hart
description: Ride Along 2, it may not surprise you to learn, is a lot like Ride Along, only less so. The buddy-cop action-comedy is a foolproof genre, though its also one that requires a fool. This franchise is lucky to have Kevin Hart in that role, and his manic comic energy is enough to make the sequel something other than a complete waste of time. But the genre is also stubbornly innovation-proof, and theres not much new to see here.

title: 4 Suspects Are Expected to Be Released in Brooklyn Rape Case
description: Four of the five defendants suspected of raping an 18-year-old woman at a Brownsville playground on Jan. 7 were expected to be out of jail by Thursday night, after the Brooklyn district attorney alerted the court that he would not make the initial deadline to obtain indictments against them.

title: Planned Parenthood Sues Activists Who Made Secret Videotapes
description: Planned Parenthood mounted a legal counterattack Thursday against the anti-abortion activists who used covertly taped videos to accuse the organization of trading in aborted baby parts, charging in a federal lawsuit that anti-abortion extremists had engaged in a three-year complex criminal enterprise.

title: Things to Do in the Hudson Valley, Jan. 16 Through 24
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Young Republicans in New York
description: On a recent Wednesday evening, a young woman wandered, alone, into the dimly lighted basement of the Penny Farthing, a bar in the East Village, and cautiously asked one of the few people there, Jen Saunders, 36, if she was a Republican. She nodded; the woman looked relieved. Its almost like were a secret society, Ms. Saunders said later, laughing.

title: Green Bay Packers at Arizona Cardinals Preview
Seattle Seahawks at Carolina Panthers Preview
Six Artists From Iran at Grey Art Gallery
description: Time decides. When an exhibition scheduled for the winter slot at Grey Art Gallery at New York University wasnt ready, a replacement had to be found, and Global/Local 1960-2015: Six Artists From Iran, set for a future date, was moved forward. If there was a scramble to pull it off, youd barely know. Organized by the gallerys director, Lynn Gumpert, the show looks great, thought through, with the improvisatory lift that adrenaline can provide.

title: Review: In the Shadow of Women Focuses on the Female Sides of a Triangle
description: At first, In the Shadow of Women, Philippe Garrels slender new drama, invites you to take its title ironically. Manon and Pierre, the married couple at its center, are Parisian bohemians who embrace a traditional asymmetry in their roles. They work together making documentary films, but they are Pierres films. Manon, who earns money serving lunch in a school cafeteria, is proud to subordinate her own ambitions to her husbands. Its not a sacrifice, its a choice, she tells her skeptical mother.

title: Painting Offered a Different Palette for David Bowies Talents
description: LONDON  One day in the early 1990s, Karen Wright, then editor of the British magazine Modern Painters, received a phone call asking if David Bowie could come to dinner with her editorial board. We arranged to meet at the Groucho Club in London, Ms. Wright said in a telephone interview. When I arrived, he was looking at a Picasso catalog, and we immediately began to talk about the images, and then quickly chose a cover for my next magazine. Mr. Bowie joined the board, and over the next few years he interviewed numerous art world figures, including Balthus, Damien Hirst, Tracey Emin, Jeff Koons and Julian Schnabel.

title: David Bowie on His Favorite Artists
description: This interview was published in The New York Times on June 14, 1998. It is reprinted here in full, with an updated introduction.

title: Review: Yesterday Tomorrow, a Meeting of Songs About Time
description: The computer is the conductor, and in some respects the composer, too, in Yesterday Tomorrow, a haunting and strangely beautiful musical theater piece that is as simple in its emotional appeal as it is complex in its conception and execution. Created and directed by Annie Dorsen, the work, which can be seen through Saturday at LaMaMa as part of the Coil festival from Performance Space 122, is the third in what Ms. Dorsen calls her algorithmic theater trilogy.

title: Hillary Clintons Campaign Outraged by Bernie Sanders Ad on Wall Street
description: In the pantheon of campaign attack ads, this one seemed gentle enough: Senator Bernie Sanders explains his intention to regulate the financial industry, including breaking up the big Wall Street banks.

title: Concrete Cuba Visits a Quieter Period of Latin American Modernism
description: The history of art is a giant puzzle that will never be complete. New pieces constantly arrive, unsettling one area or another, altering the overall shape.

title: Honoring Martin Luther King Jr.s Legacy and Focusing on Art and Activism
description: In 1964 the New School hosted a series of lectures called The American Race Crisis. In 2016 the subject still feels urgent.

title: Yoko Onos The Riverbed Has a Therapeutic Bent
description: As a conceptual artist, Yoko Ono practices a vapid kind of spiritual therapy. Visiting her two-gallery exhibition is like attending a New Age summer camp program run by a bossy teacher who treats everyone like children.

title: Stories Spill Out as Spotlight Is Shined on Sexism in Astronomy
description: Jessica Kirkpatrick, an undergrad student, was wearing dishwashing gloves to clean part of her research experiment when a senior member of her team walked by.

title: Zineb Sedira: Present Tense at the Taymour Grahne Gallery
description: Zineb Sedira was born in Paris in 1963 to Algerian immigrants, and has lived in London since the 1980s. Widely exhibited in Europe, she now has a very fine solo of recent work, Zineb Sedira: Present Tense, at Taymour Grahne. The idea of cultural gain and loss, and the complications both entail, is a constant theme in her art. A substantial part of this exhibition, organized by Sam Bardaouil and Till Fellrath, is devoted to a multipart project on the subject of lighthouses built under French colonial rule along the North African coastline, and still in use, weather-battered and outdated.

title: Sally Michel, Landscapes of Color and Texture
Review: Richard Gere, The Benefactor Who Pulls the Strings
description: Except for occasional glimpses, Richard Gere has always held his dark side in reserve, the better to embody romantic dreamboats like those in his box-office calling cards An Officer and a Gentleman and Pretty Woman. But that was then. At 66, with a snowy mane and an imperial demeanor, Mr. Gere now exerts the magnetism of a swashbuckling lion in winter.

title: Review: A Perfect Day About Aid Workers in the Balkans
description: Benicio Del Toro shambling around like a latter-day Robert Mitchum is the best reason to see A Perfect Day. A serviceable, watchable movie set someplace in the Balkans in 1995, this oddity was shot in Spain and features a tight, largely English-speaking cast  including the American veteran Tim Robbins, and two European actresses, Mlanie Thierry and Olga Kurylenko  that seems to have been tapped to reach as many film markets as possible. This talent sampler fits the movie, which primarily registers as a would-be business opportunity for investment types.

title: For Children Listings for Jan. 15-21
description: Rebecca Northan used to go on blind dates, with predictably unpredictable results. Now, at least half the time, she ends up with a knight in shining armor.

title: Review: Moonwalkers, a Conspiracy-Theory Comedy
description: The misguided Moonwalkers invests too much in the comedy potential of things that havent been funny for a long while. Its plot revolves around the notion  what, again?  that there was a conspiracy to fake the Apollo 11 lunar landing. And its writer, Dean Craig, and director, Antoine Bardou-Jacquet, seem to think theres nothing more hilarious than having characters stumble around stoned.

title: Review: In Intruders, a Surprise Awaits Home Invaders
description: Intruders, a distasteful thriller with a bludgeoning sensibility and little common sense, turns a cozy family home into a clockwork house of horrors.

title: Jazz Listings for Jan. 15-21
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: In Taiwan, Survivor Mentality Stymies Tech Innovation
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  With its offices sporting wood flooring, a roof painted bright orange and conference rooms named after target markets in Southeast Asia, AppWorks, one of Taiwans few start-up accelerators, has the look and feel of the American counterparts its modeled on.

title: Spare Times for Jan. 15-21
description: Black Comic-Book Festival (Saturday) The comic series Watson and Holmes is like an alternate reality of Arthur Conan Doyles Victorian detective duo. To start, the protagonists of these comic books are black; London looks a lot more like Harlem; and a subtitle like A Study in Scarlet becomes A Study in Black. The series is one example of many more in which black comic books have reimagined the world, or in some cases even created their own brand of speculative science fiction.

title: Review: In Norm of the North, a Polar Bear Takes a Stand
description: Of all the creatures in the animal kingdom, it is arguably the polar bear whose real-world behavior differs most starkly from that of its anthropomorphized iterations. Cartoon polar bears are almost unfailingly benign and cute; real-world polar bears will swipe your head off before you can contrive an observation of how surprisingly intimidating they appear. A real-life grizzly you might be able to run from, or successfully play dead for. With a polar bear, youd have to be really, really good at playing dead, I reckon.

title: A News Agency With Scoops Directly From ISIS, and a Veneer of Objectivity
description: The San Bernardino shootings. The killing rampage this week in a Baghdad mall. On Thursday, it was the explosion that ripped through a Starbucks in Jakarta.

title: How Pat Buchanan Has Come to Be More Than Another Trump Wacko
description: In one of his early flirtations with politics, Donald Trump took dead aim at a popular right-wing politician he denounced as a neo-Naziand appealing to the wacko vote Pat Buchanan, a conservative ideologue whose campaign for the 2000 Republican presidential nomination was laced with harsh anti-immigrant rhetoric and other bombastic foretastes of Mr. Trumps own run this year.

title: Review: In o death, Creation Stirs Amid the Specter of Imminent Death
description: Finding your seat at o death requires some groping in the dark. Perhaps audience members, fumbling in the faint glow of an ushers flashlight, are meant to identify with the dancer who eventually comes into view, scrambling on the floor of the nearly lightless room. That would be Marit Sandsmark, the lone performer in this postapocalyptic work by the Norwegian company Findlay//Sandsmark, which had its United States premiere at Ideal Glass Gallery in the East Village on Tuesday. (Ms. Sandsmark choreographed the show; Iver Findlay, her husband and a Wooster Group alum, directed and designed it.)

title: In Conservative Louisiana, Obama Finds Little but Love
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  After his State of the Union address, President Obama headed to two states that voted against him, in part, aides said, because he wanted more encounters in his last year in office with people who disagree with him.

title: Paul Kirk, Ex-D.N.C. Chairman and Ted Kennedy Confidante, Endorses Bernie Sanders
description: HANOVER, N.H.  Hoping to build on the momentum that has led to his rise in the polls in Iowa and New Hampshire, Senator Bernie Sanders on Thursday evening announced the endorsement of Paul G. Kirk Jr., a confidante of Senator Edward M. Kennedy and a former Democratic National Committee chairman.

title: Jets General Manager Mike Maccagnan Hints at Off-Season Plans
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Jets General Manager Mike Maccagnan cautiously laid out his teams off-season plans for the first time on Thursday, skimping on the details while he tiptoed around questions about the futures of soon-to-be free agents like Muhammad Wilkerson, Damon Harrison and quarterback Ryan Fitzpatrick.

title: Sixth Republican Debate: Analysis
Contracts Announced for Runs to Space Station
description: NASA announced on Thursday the companies it had selected for a second round of contracts to take cargo to the International Space Station. Two of the contracts will go to companies already performing that task: the Space Exploration Technologies Corporation of Hawthorne, Calif., better known as SpaceX, and Orbital ATK of Dulles, Va. NASA also selected the Sierra Nevada Corporation of Sparks, Nev., which has been developing a mini space shuttle known as Dream Chaser. The first mission is to fly in 2019, and each company will operate at least six cargo missions. NASA officials said the new contracts would provide many more options than they currently have. The Dream Chaser will be able to land like a plane on a runway, allowing payloads like scientific experiments to be unloaded within a few hours. The three contracts, which run through 2024, when the space station is scheduled to be retired, have a maximum value of $14 billion, but NASA officials said they did not expect to spend nearly that much.

title: Real Madrid Says Transfer Ban Over Youth Signings Is Unfair
description: MADRID  Real Madrid responded on Thursday to a transfer ban imposed by FIFA, soccers global governing body, by claiming the sanction was unfairly linked to some youth players whose relatives were already employees of the club, including two sons of its new coach, Zinedine Zidane.

title: Morgan Stanley Heeds Its Investors
description: In recent years, meetings between James P. Gorman, Morgan Stanleys chief executive, and the banks investors often came back to the same question: When was Mr. Gorman going to do more to deal with the banks most problematic business  its bond and commodity trading desks.

description: During the October 28 and December 19 debates, we asked you to tell us who made the most ridiculous comment. Tonight, we want to know the opposite  who made the most intelligent remark?

description: Following is immediate analysis of the sixth Republican debate. Read additional fact checks here.

title: Ted Cruz and Donald Trumps Familiar Feud Over New York
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas called out Donald Trump this week for the high crime of embodying New York values, which, translated into Republican primary-ese, apparently means that Mr. Trump has cooties.

description: Following is a transcript of the preliminary Republican debate, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: As Germany Welcomes Migrants,Sexual Attacks in Cologne Point to a New Reality
description: COLOGNE, Germany  In early December, the Cologne police made their New Years Eve preparations. Drawing on the previous years experience, they identified their biggest worry as pickpocketing and fireworks among the crowds. So they increased their holiday deployment, to 142 from 88, concentrating on the banks of the Rhine River, where revelers traditionally gather for a giant fireworks display.

title: In Climate Move, Obama Halts New Coal Mining Leases on Public Lands
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration announced on Friday a halt to new coal mining leases on public lands as it considers an overhaul of the program that could lead to increased costs for energy companies and a slowdown in extraction.

title: American Apparel Is Said to Reject Takeover Bid and Dov Charney Return
description: The board of American Apparel, a struggling retailer that filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in October, has rejected a takeover offer from investors aligned with the companys ousted founder, Dov Charney, according to a person with knowledge of the situation.

title: Cuomo to Continue Shrinking States Share of CUNYs Costs
description: Amid the billions of dollars that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo disbursed with dizzying speed in his State of the State address on Wednesday  $100 billion for infrastructure here, $20 billion for housing there  he left one half-billion conspicuously unmentioned: a third of the annual budget of the City University of New York, which Mr. Cuomos latest budget proposed to offload from the states balance sheet onto the citys.

title: Caitlyn Jenner on a TV Road Less Traveled
description: PASADENA, Calif.  After the first season of E!s I Am Cait, the reality series about Caitlyn Jenners first months as a transgender woman, there was no mistaking that it was a different show from the one she used to star on, Keeping Up With the Kardashians.

title: Cuomos Budget Opens New Chapter in Rivalry With de Blasio
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio issued a stern rebuke to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Thursday for placing new financial strains on New York City, saying he would use any means necessary to restore hundreds of millions of dollars in state financing that the governor appeared to have cut from his annual budget.

title: Investigation of SEAL Conduct in Afghanistan Is Reopened
description: The Naval Criminal Investigative Service has reopened its investigation into allegations that Navy SEALs and Afghan police militiamen beat several detainees, including one who died, at an isolated outpost in Afghanistan in 2012, agency officials said Thursday.

title: Luis Arroyo, Baseballs Best Reliever in 61, Dies at 88
description: Luis Arroyo, a stoutly built left-hander with a baffling screwball who was an All-Star in each major league, pitched in two World Series and as a reliever helped Whitey Ford achieve his finest season with the Yankees, died on Wednesday in Guayanilla, P.R. He was 88.

title: Giorgio Gomelsky, Impresario Who Gave the Rolling Stones Their Start, Dies at 81
description: Giorgio Gomelsky, a rock impresario and record producer who gave the Rolling Stones their first exposure, managed the Yardbirds and went on to champion an eclectic batch of progressive rock groups in the United States, died on Wednesday in the Bronx. He was 81.

title: Marine Veteran Held by Iran Received Care, His Family Says
description: A Marine veteran who is the longest-held American prisoner in Iran was allowed to receive medical treatment in a hospital outside his prison in recent weeks, his family said Thursday. It is unclear whether the hospital visit might be a precursor to his release.

title: Ren Anglil, Who Discovered and Then Married Celine Dion, Dies at 73
description: Ren Anglil, the producer who discovered the singer Celine Dion at age 12 and later married her after leading her to stardom, died on Thursday at their home in Las Vegas. He was 73.

title: A Long Way From Guyana, Near a Family He Rarely Gets to See
description: At his age, Frank Gaul said, he should be retired and spending his days lolling in a rocking chair. Instead, Mr. Gaul, 67, is on his feet eight hours a day, working as a security guard.

title: Review: Michael Frayns Noises Off Returns to Broadway
description: Where are we? asks the dazed-looking woman in a maids uniform, her voice throaty with fatigue. Looking around with confused wonder, she seems to have just awakened from a yearlong nap, or gone through a carwash without a car.

title: Cab Supplier
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Brighten up, buttercups, weve got a Patrick Berry puzzle to start our solving weekend and its a good one.

title: Citys Delayed Traffic Study to Guide Regulation of Uber Vehicles
description: After coming under attack last summer from the ride-hailing app Uber, the de Blasio administration shelved a proposal to cap the number of Uber vehicles and undertook a study of the services effect on New York City traffic.

title: My Take on the Republican Presidential Debate
description: Republican candidates for president dueled in another televised debate, the modern version of gladiatorial combat. Instead of writing a column, Im collecting some of my tweets about the debate in this blog post, which Im updating until it ends. These are raw and rushed ruminations, journalism on the fly, but its an attempt to hold politicians accountable instantaneously for their rhetorical stretches. I welcome your comments.

title: Uncertain Future for Pizzeria That Gave New Haven a Special Flavor
description: NEW HAVEN  Sallys or Pepes?

title: Islanders Rally for Tense Victory Over Rangers
description: Acrobatic saves, pucks off posts, a few skirmishes and near fights. It was no surprise that the second Brooklyn battle between the Rangers and the Islanders had them all. Finally, after nearly two scoreless periods of breathless action, there were a few goals, too.

title: At Republican Debate, Taunts and Quips as Rivals Battle
description: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C.  Donald J. Trump and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas sharply attacked each other on Thursday night over the Canadian-born Mr. Cruzs eligibility to be president and Mr. Trumps New York values, shedding any semblance of cordiality as they dominated a Republican debate less than three weeks before the Iowa caucuses.

title: A Sampling of the Xibe Language
description: He Wenjun, a teacher and Xibe language translator, sings a popular folk song, Xiao Qiao Cried for Zhou Yu, based on a tale from the Ming dynasty novel Romance of the Three Kingdoms.

title: In Song, a Remnant of Chinas Former Imperial Language
description: Manchu, the imperial language of the Qing dynasty (1644-1912), may be effectively extinct, but a close cousin clings to life in an unlikely place: a collection of towns near Chinas border with Kazakhstan, 2,800 miles from the languages former stronghold in northeastern China.

title: Trump and Cruz Set an Ugly, Nasty Tone
description: Remember that phase of the campaign when Ted Cruz spoke no ill of Donald Trump, who returned the favor?

title: Ohio State in High-Priced Apparel Deal
description: A 15-year contract extension between Ohio State and Nike is believed to be the largest college apparel deal ever. Once the deal goes into full effect in 2018, when Ohio States previous deal was to expire, its value will average $16.8 million per year. That is more than the amounts Texas and Michigan each get according to their recently signed deals with Nike, and more than Notre Dame reportedly receives in its deal with Under Armour, which went into effect in 2014. The Wall Street Journal first reported the extension.

description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The Australian Open draw was announced Friday morning, and in her first official match since last September, Serena Williams will face an Italian player entirely different from the one who dealt her a stunning loss in the semifinals of the United States Open.

description: For much of his career in Washington, Ted Cruz has been dismissed as a cartoonish sideshow  an ostrich-boot-wearing ideologue who once delivered a sleep-inducing 21-hour monologue on the floor of the Senate reading from the childrens story Green Eggs and Ham.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Serenas knees are doing very well if you consider that they are the knees of a 34-year-old professional player. They just need special attention.

title: A Tabloids Photographs That Dont Tell the Whole Story
description: The images here look trustworthy, dont they? After all, what captures the world more objectively, with less bias and distortion, than a photograph? Ralph Steiner, the great photographer and documentary filmmaker, warned anyone who looked at the images not to trust them.

description: How rich do we need the rich to be?

title: When Beauty Strikes
description: Across the street from my apartment building in Washington theres a gigantic supermarket and a CVS. Above the supermarket there had been a large empty space with floor-to-ceiling windows. The space was recently taken by a ballet school, so now when I step outside in the evenings I see dozens of dancers framed against the windows, doing their exercises  gracefully and often in unison.

title: Republican Deficit Hypocrisy
description: At the Republican debate last night in South Carolina, Republicans were happy to talk about, and denounce, the budget deficit and debt. Senator Marco Rubio said that we must bring our debt under control.

description: Venezuelas newly installed Parliament began work this week, though there is uncertainty about whether any laws it passes will be carried out by the countrys authoritarian leader, President Nicols Maduro.

title: Giving Obama His Due
description: I still hold onto a couple of magazine covers and newspaper front pages, despite their preservation in the digital afterlife, marking the moment when a nation that had embraced African-American slavery chose a black man to be its president.

title: The City Takes a Hit in Mr. Cuomos Budget
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomos new budget, released Wednesday, threw what looks like a gut punch at New York City: bam, hundreds of millions of dollars in state revenue suddenly pulled away. It was actually three punches: a proposal to withdraw state support for the City University of New York; a plan to require the city  and no other municipality  to cover the cost of increases in its Medicaid program; and potentially costly changes in how the state runs its STAR income-tax rebates. All told, the cost to the city is expected to reach nearly a billion dollars in the coming fiscal year, and keep growing.

title: Michigans Failure to Protect Flint
description: Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan is scrambling to deal with a terrible water crisis created by his administration in the city of Flint, which is poor and has a black majority. The damage to the nearly bankrupt city and its nearly 100,000 residents by lead-tainted water caused by corrosion in the pipes has yet to be totaled, but there is no doubt that the state has a moral obligation to provide clean water immediately for the citizens and to devise a long-term solution, no matter how costly.

title: G.E. to Sell Appliance Division to Haier for $5.4 Billion
description: HONG KONG  General Electric said on Friday that it had agreed to sell its appliances business to Qingdao Haier of China for $5.4 billion in cash.

title: Film Club | Chinas Web Junkies
description: Can video games and the Internet be addictive? Are teenagers, especially young men, particularly susceptible? And if Internet addiction is real, what kinds of treatment methods would be most effective to provide help to those who need it? These are some of the tough questions the short documentary Chinas Web Junkies investigates.

title: Living With Cancer: A Broken Covenant With Patients
description: As a cancer patient whose life has been miraculously extended by a clinical trial, I was shocked by Charles Pillers Dec. 13 essay Law Ignored, Patients at Risk in STAT News on lapses in reporting the results of such trials. My first response was to ask: Is he a reputable journalist? Is the online venue in which the article appears legit? When the answer to each of these questions came back a resounding yes, I began worrying that cancer doctors and patients have been imperiled by irresponsible researchers.

title: To Save Its Salmon, California Calls In the Fish Matchmaker
description: HORNBROOK, Calif.  On a frigid morning in a small metal-sided building, a team of specialists prepared to orchestrate an elaborate breeding routine. The work would be wet and messy, so they wore waders. Their tools included egg trays and a rubber mallet, which they used to brain a fertile female coho salmon, now hanging dead on a hook.

Gorman, Morgan Stanleys chief executive, on Tuesday, when the bank announces its 2015 financial results,Nathaniel Popper writes in DealBook. After holding off on an overhaul, Mr. Gorman last month began to make the cuts that investors were pushing for.
