title: At Pitti Uomo, Angles of Approach
description: FLORENCE, Italy  You know in cartoons, when a piano falls and theres, like, four keys sticking out, the model Charlie James said backstage at the Juun.J show here on Wednesday. Thats what my teeth were like.

title: Turkey Releases Detained Academics Who Signed Petition Defending Kurds
description: ISTANBUL  The Turkish authorities briefly detained 27 scholars on Friday, accusing them of spreading terrorism propaganda and of insulting the state after they signed a petition denouncing the militarys campaign against Kurdish militants in southeastern Turkey.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Personalized Diets, Stress and Travel Warnings
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Hospitalized, One of Them Brain-Dead, After Drug Trial in France
description: LONDON  Six men were hospitalized  and one of them was pronounced brain-dead  after a drug trial in northwestern France, the countrys health minister said on Friday.

title: As Taiwan Election Nears, Mainland Media Plays Down Politics
description: BEIJING  On Saturday, voters in Taiwan will go to the polls to elect a new president. Interest in Communist-ruled China, which claims the island as its own territory, is great, yet one word is almost entirely missing from the voluminous debate over the event: president.

title: The 1.3.16 Issue
description: RE: BRAIN SURGERY

title: To Catch a Scammer in Madrid
description: Some years ago, while house-sitting outside Rome, I was supposed to be working on a school paper. Instead I spent a lot of time surfing the Internet. One day I found an eBay auction for the kind of semiprofessional camera I coveted. The starting-bid amount was one-fifth the retail price. A few days later, just shortly before the end of the auction, no one had placed a bid. It was my first auction, and my heart started pounding as I prepared to bid my savings on this camera. I typed in the amount, took a deep breath, hit bid now and closed my eyes. When I opened them again, nothing had happened.

title: Trunk Show: A Vuitton Retrospective, From Keepall to D.J. Box
description: Today, Louis Vuitton is a luxury fashion label, a status symbol that usually hangs from a shoulder or elegantly dangles from a wrist by way of a leather logoed handbag. But rewind to 1835, and the name belonged to a man who left his home at the age of 14 and began walking 280 miles from eastern France to Paris. Upon arriving two years later, he worked as a box maker and packer before starting his own company in 1854, designing ergonomic trunks  or specialty packing for fashion as it was advertised  for the wandering elite.

title: Prithvi Raj Singh Oberoi Knows a Bit About Luxury Travel
description: There are not a lot of Indian hotel chains with international recognition, but Oberoi Hotels and Resorts in New Delhi is an exception. The family-run company has 30 properties, mostly within the country but also in locations like Bali, Mauritius and Dubai. It also operates two small cruise ships on the Nile River in Egypt.

title: Making Art on the Open Seas
description: Ninety percent of the worlds goods travel by sea. The efficient movement of all our stuff from the vague there to the present here is made possible by container ship. The San Francisco-based artist Martin Machado has an unusual firsthand perspective on this tool of globalization: He spends several months of the year working on container ships, on routes that have taken him through the Suez Canal and to ports in cities as far-flung as Honolulu; New York; Dubai; Karachi, Pakistan; Shanghai; and Singapore.

title: Poetry Pairing | Memento
description: This month we again feature the work of a young poet alongside a New York Times article. Here, Lily Caos poem Memento appears with a 2012 article, Its Not Me, Its You, by Alex Williams.

title: Ousted Communist Officials Brother Is Living in United States, China Says
description: HONG KONG  China for the first time acknowledged on Friday that the brother of a disgraced former Communist Party official was living in the United States.

title: How to Take Your Baby to Work
description: Leave the room if you have to change a diaper, says Licia Ronzulli, an Italian member of the European Parliament who started taking her daughter to work at the age of 6 weeks. More broadly, recognize the type of interruption that requires a quick exit (mostly soiled diapers and crying sprees), but otherwise get comfortable responding to a childs needs while on the job.

title: The Fourth Sign of the Zodiac (excerpt)
description: Selected by Natasha Trethewey.

title: New Yorks Week in Pictures: Jan. 15
description: Photographs from the past week in New York and the region include dogs on the subway, a rush for Powerball tickets and the State of the State address.

title: Narrowing Fight Offers a Clearer Glimpse of the Front of the Pack
description: The second-to-last Republican presidential debate before voting begins in Iowa was a fistfight, one that seemed to further clarify the contours of the race as it has winnowed in the remaining weeks.

title: Lopping Off Stars for Per Se: The Back Story
description: The ending of Pete Wellss review of Per Se, the glittering restaurant atop the Time Warner Center, summed up his findings memorably:

title: Why Cartels Are Killing Mexicos Mayors
description: Mexico City  ON the morning of Jan. 2, a team of hired killers set off for the home of 33-year-old Gisela Mota, who only hours before had been sworn in as the first female mayor of Temixco, a sleepy spa town an hour from Mexico City. Ms. Mota was still in her pajamas as the men approached her parents breezeblock house. She was in the bedroom, but most of her family was in the front room, cooing over a newborn baby. As the family prepared a milk bottle, the assassins smashed the door open. Amid the commotion, Ms. Mota came out of her bedroom and said firmly, I am Gisela. In front of her terrified family, the men beat Ms. Mota and shot her several times, killing her.

title: Whats on This Week Around the World
description: London

title: The Onion Predicted Ted Cruz
description: Does anyone remember the classic first post-9/11 issue, which declared Rest of Country Temporarily Feels Deep Affection for New York? (I cant find a direct link.) Sure enough, Ted Cruz has declared war on New York values.

title: Ronald Perelman to Explore Strategic Alternatives for Revlon
description: The billionaire businessman Ronald O. Perelman plans to explore strategic alternatives for Revlon, the cosmetics company he has controlled through his investment firm for more than two decades.

title: Neil Cavuto and the Dynamics of Misinformation
description: Josh Marshall notes that during last nights debate Neil Cavuto seemed to imply that the financial crisis happened on Obamas watch without saying anything explicitly false. Indeed. But theres something else going on here, and its part of a larger pattern.

title: Citigroups Profit Rises Even as It Builds Cushion for Energy Loans
description: Profit and revenue rose at Citigroup in the fourth quarter, but investors looked past those gains on Friday and fretted about the banks ability to weather turmoil in the emerging markets and oil industry

title: A Dog Meets the Co-op Board
description: Dear Diary:

title: Lindsey Graham Endorses Jeb Bush for President
description: Senator Lindsey Graham endorsed Jeb Bush for president on Friday in Charleston, S.C.

title: Oil Price Falls as Global Growth Anxiety Weighs on Markets
description: LONDON  Global markets sank sharply on Friday as crude dipped below $30 a barrel on concerns about China and a potential flood of new oil from Iran.

title: BlackRocks Profit Up as Money Pours Into Exchange Traded Funds
description: BlackRock, the worlds largest money manager, reported a 6 percent increase in its fourth-quarter earnings on Friday as investors continued to allocate money to the companys exchange traded funds despite a volatile stock market.

title: A Flat Fourth Quarter for Wells Fargo
description: Wells Fargos profit was flat in the fourth quarter and its revenue rose only slightly as the bank grappled with the strains on loans in the oil and gas industry.

title: Prices Drop for Luxury New York Real Estate
description: New York City real estate continues to sell for astronomical prices, but there are signs the market is heading back toward earth.

title: Tom Steyer Joins Forces With Group Pushing Hispanic Candidates
description: Tom Steyer, the billionaire environmental activist who invested heavily in the 2014 midterm elections, is joining forces with the Latino Victory Fund, the Democratic-leaning group that aims to elect Hispanics to higher office, a shift in approach for the 2016 elections.

title: How to Bridge That Stubborn Pay Gap
description: When the comedian Ricky Gervais joked that he was paid the same to host the Golden Globes as the actresses Tina Fey and Amy Poehler  combined  his barbed humor most likely resonated in many workplaces.

title: Search for 12 Marines Continues After Hawaii Helicopter Crash
description: Rescue crews with the Navy and the Coast Guard were searching off the coast of Hawaii on Friday for a dozen Marines and the debris of two helicopters that are believed to have collided over the high surf just before midnight Thursday.

title: No Comment Necessary: What Marco Rubio Thinks About Guns
description: Marco Rubio made his position on guns abundantly clear during Thursdays debate. In response to a question from Neil Cavuto, one of the moderators, he said: We cannot afford to have a president of the United States that supports gun control.

title: The Numbers Behind Baltimore's Record Year in Homicides
description: Searching for answers in the deadliest year in Baltimores history

title: Donald Trump Keeps Up Criticism of Ted Cruz After the Debate
description: Senator Ted Cruzs performance at the Republican presidential debate got low marks on Friday  from Donald J. Trump.

title: 1916: Amnesia Victim Finds Love
description: Fate has played many strange pranks with the men fighting in Europe, but none perhaps is more curious than that in which Mr. Thomas F. Trusler figures. Mr. Trusler, who is stopping at the Marseilles Hotel in New York, was a gunner in the Third Brigade, Canadian Field Artillery. The concussion from a shell which struck near him last winter caused him to lose all recollection of the past.

title: Burundis Forces Are Engaging in Gang Rape, U.N. Official Says
description: GENEVA  Burundis security forces are engaging in gang rape during a crackdown on political opponents that has included a sharp rise in torture, killings and disappearances in the past month, the top United Nations human rights official said on Friday, sounding an alarm over the increasingly ethnic character of the violence.

title: Daily Report: Why Intels Earnings Shouldnt Be Ignored
description: The personal computer era is over, but what Intel  one of the largest suppliers of chips to PCs  reports still matters.

title: Deleting User Accounts on a Mac
description: Q. How do I delete a user on a shared Mac that is on OS X El Capitan, and what would happen to all the photos, documents and other files in that persons account?

title: Jeb Bush Team Stresses to Donors That Substance, Over Style, Matters
description: In a private conference call with donors immediately after Thursday nights Republican debate, Jeb Bushs team seemed to tacitly acknowledge one of Mr. Bushs biggest challenges  projecting confidence and strength in the sound-bite culture of televised debates.

title: Anger and Scrutiny Grow Over Poisoned Water in Michigan City
description: FLINT, Mich.  Michigans attorney general opened an investigation Friday into lead contamination in Flints drinking water, and the governor asked President Obama to declare a disaster as National Guard troops fanned out across this anxious city to help distribute bottled water, water filters and testing kits.

title: Macedonian Prime Minister Steps Down, but Tensions Over Vote Linger
description: SKOPJE, Macedonia  Prime Minister Nikola Gruevski of Macedonia submitted his resignation to Parliament on Friday, clearing the way for elections as the country tries to recover from a wiretapping scandal that paralyzed the Balkan nation.

title: How the Bernanke Fed Decided to Pump Billions Into the Economy
description: Transcripts from Federal Reserve meetings in 2010 show, in real time, how the central bank under chairman Ben S. Bernanke came to the conclusion that the economy was in greater peril than it had initially seemed.

title: Retail Sales Were Lackluster in December, Signaling Fragile Economy
description: Gas is cheap, and while the stock markets are wavering, the job market is strong. Rising wages are putting more money in peoples pockets.

title: Can Germany Be Honest About Its Refugee Problems?
description: Hamburg  FOR all its horror, what happened on New Years Eve in Cologne and other German cities might help the Germans solve a longstanding problem. The issue is not the one-million-plus refugees who have come to us in the first place. It is how to deal with problems that immigrants might be, are or will be causing.

title: Audra McDonald to Make West End Debut
Tate Modern Names Frances Morris as Next Director
description: LONDON  Frances Morris, the top curator of international art at Tate Modern, has been named as the museums next director, Tate officials said Friday.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: State Tax Refunds May Be Delayed by Security Precautions
description: SOME taxpayers may get their state income tax refunds a little later this year because of extra security measures aimed at preventing fraud.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties include a five-bedroom in Irvington, N.Y., and a seven-bedroom in Teaneck, N.J.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in Union Square, Chelsea and Park Slope, Brooklyn.

title: Wrestlers Find Well-Worn Path to U.F.C. Title Bout
description: The much-anticipated Ultimate Fighting Championship main event on Sunday in Boston features T. J. Dillashaw, the bantamweight champion, against a former champion and No. 1 contender, Dominick Cruz. As in any mixed martial arts bout, the modes of combat will be varied: There will be punching, kicking, elbowing, grappling and submission holds.

title: 1941: Britain Placates Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Brazilian program of national defense is reported here to be more responsible for a recent wave of anti-British feeling here than any convictions the government may have about the European war. The British threat to the defense program which led to the trouble has since been significantly removed.

title: Letters: Fail Better
description: To the Editor:

title: Walmart to Close 269 Stores as Retailers Struggle
description: Walmart, whose supercenters once transformed the way Americans shop, announced on Friday that it would close a record number of stores in the United States and overseas, as it fights to hold its ground in a retail landscape under siege by the behemoth Amazon.

title: Paperback Row
description: GHETTOSIDE: A True Story of Murder in America, by Jill Leovy. (Spiegel & Grau, $16.) As a reporter for The Los Angeles Times, Leovy witnessed firsthand the impact of Americas staggering murder rates. Focusing here on one Los Angeles case, she delves into the plague of black homicides, including the fraught relationship between the police and civilians and the justice systems failure to protect black citizens. (African-American men account for nearly 40 percent of the countrys murder victims.)

title: Editors Choice
description: MY NAME IS LUCY BARTON, by Elizabeth Strout. (Random House, $26.) A writer and her estranged mother attempt to reconnect during a brief visit in a Pulitzer Prize winners exquisite novel of careful words and vibrating silences.

title: The Facts of Refugee Life in Fiction
description: This week, we review several books about global migration and fractured borders, including Ben Rawlences City of Thorns: Nine Lives in the Worlds Largest Refugee Camp. Rawlences book is nonfiction, but acclaimed and popular novels of recent years have brought the issue of refugees to wider attention by placing sympathetic fictional characters in situations much (sometimes very much) like real life.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Stuff We Liked: Bikes, Baristas and Powerball
description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: New Yorkers Quickly Unite Against Cruz After New York Values Comment
description: New Yorkers may be proud, ornery individuals, quick to voice their differences loudly and unabashedly.

title: They Have Not Yet Begun To Fight
description: In last nights Republican debate we finally got the Donald Trump vs. Ted Cruz clash everyone has been pining for not on policy, of course, but on the crucial questions of Cruzs Canuckishness and Trumps New York values. Cruz came prepared on both exchanges, and like others I would say that he won the night, though he did disappear for longish stretches later on and took some strafing fire from Marco Rubio (very) late in the evening. But then I also agree with the observerswho think Trump fundamentally had a good night as well: The Donald has learned a lot about debating since this show started, and even when placed on the defensive he was effective and disciplined responding to Cruz on the Canadian issue with more puckishness than bluster and then pivoting smoothly to 9/11 on the New York values issue. And then there was this moment, when a question about Nikki Haleys post-SOTU critique of the partys angriest voices allowed Trump to deliver pretty calmly and evenly what was probably the line of the night, if not of his campaign: She did say there was anger. Im very angry because our country is being run horribly and I will gladly accept the mantle of anger.

title: City of Thorns, by Ben Rawlence
description: In 2010, Ben Rawlence, then a researcher for Human Rights Watch, visited the refugee camp of Dadaab on the eastern Kenyan border, home to 300,000 people, many of whom had fled the chronic civil war in Somalia. The next year, he returned for what would be the first of seven long visits to follow the lives of nine of its inhabitants and to watch the camp grow until it became the largest refugee settlement in the world, more town than camp, with its own hospitals, cinemas and soccer teams, occupying an area the size of New Orleans. It would be good to be able to say that his story is encouraging or uplifting; but Rawlences City of Thorns is a deeply disturbing and depressing portrait of the violence, destitution, fear, sense of hopelessness and neglect in which a large number of the worlds estimated 60 million forcibly displaced people now live.

title: Shabab Say They Overran African Union Base in Somalia, Killing Dozens
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  The Shabab militant group said on Friday that it had overrun an African Union base in a village in southern Somalia and killed dozens of peacekeepers.

title: George Miller on Mad Max: Fury Road and Furiosa Tattoos
description: One of the surprise hits in the awards race has been Mad Max: Fury Road, which landed 10 Oscar nominations on Thursday, including best picture and best director. The films momentum was one of the many unexpected turns of this season: A sequel to a sequel to a sequel, Fury Road seemed too much a genre flick, and for a good while, Oscar watchers didnt consider it a contender. (Shows how much we know.)

title: Recipes for a Long Weekend
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: New Orleans Puts Poor on Waiting List for Lawyers, Suit Alleges
description: The cash-starved public defenders office in Baton Rouge faces chronic underfunding, a federal lawsuit contends, a situation that has led to poor people arrested in connection with crimes being placed on a waiting list, leaving them in jail without access to lawyers.

title: The Greatest Hoax in Sports Reporting History (The Times Fell for It, Too)
description: Before reviewing one of the greatest hoaxes in sports history, lets first meet the perpetrators: Morris Newburger, Lew Krupnick and Bink Dannenbaum.

title: Potatoes and Pregnancy
description: A new study suggests that the more potatoes in a womans typical diet, the more likely she is to develop gestational diabetes, a serious complication of pregnancy.

title: Goodbye, Golf Clubs. Hello, Hiking Boots and Kayak.
description: THEY call him Elusive, at least on the hiking trails. And thats pretty much where Dave Roberts spends his time these days, crisscrossing the country by foot, by bike, even by kayak.

title: Inside the List
description: The List Awakens: Alan Dean Fosters movie novelization Star Wars: The Force Awakens goes right to the top in its first week on the hardcover fiction list. This isnt the only best seller to spring from Disneys reboot  an illustrated junior novelization has spent three weeks on the middle-grade hardcover list, where its currently No.2, and other titles have landed on the kids series list and the miscellaneous list  but it is the first Force Awakens tie-in to hit adult hardcover. So what, besides Chewbaccas drunken sex scene, makes this an adult book? (Im only kidding about Chewie  sorry!  but readers curious about the mating habits of wookies can turn to The Guardian, where an Edinburgh zookeeper reports that I would assume they would do it pretty much the same way we do it. If youre like me, this will have you humming Cole Porter for days.) In fact, Fosters novelization does contain some scenes of graphic violence missing from the movie, but the most adult thing about it may be the florid vocabulary. Heres how it describes the villain Kylo Ren, for instance: saturnine of aspect, lithe of build, tortured of mien and troubled of eye. Keep the children away.

title: Many in Jakarta Seem to Shrug Off Terrorist Attack
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  If the militants who attacked the center of this city with explosives and guns on Thursday hoped to inspire fear and attract followers, they seem to have failed. Instead, life in Jakarta, the Indonesian capital, returned to normal on Friday, with traffic jams, long lines for public transportation and hasty breakfasts at streetside food stalls.

title: Passenger, by Alexandra Bracken
description: In present-day New York City, a focused young woman prepares for a recital on the violin, the instrument for which she has sacrificed both her social life and a sense of closeness to her peripatetic mother. She feels the pressure of making good on her training, along with confusion about her best path to the future she desires. While not every teenager is a violin prodigy, Ettas situation shares common themes with the lives of many driven young people, and right from the opening moments of Passenger there is much to like about her. When Ettas elderly teacher, the most supportive figure in her life, becomes suddenly discouraging on the night of the recital, and Etta overhears an argument between her teacher and her mother as she is about to go onstage, the dramatic tension is ratcheted up, promising an engaging narrative about ambition and family. But this is an adventure story, the first in a new series from Alexandra Bracken, the author of the Darkest Minds books, and Bracken is only just getting started.

title: Paper Wishes, by Lois Sepahban
description: The psychic pain from the forced removal and detention of American citizens and residents of Japanese ancestry during World War II is still felt profoundly today. Case in point: a nationwide protest last April that blocked a scheduled auction of artifacts made in United States detention centers, led by descendants of the internees, who could not tolerate the idea that remnants of this dark chapter of their families history were up for sale to the highest bidder.

title: What Are New York Values?
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas described Donald J. Trump as having New York values in the Republican debate on Thursday. What does that mean exactly?

title: Taller Condos on the Upper East Side
description: After clustering around 57th Street for the last several years, super-tall condominiums, which are coveted by buyers for their views and scorned by some others for their bulk, are turning up in other neighborhoods.

title: Junk Bonds Go Sour, but the Question Is How Sour
description: The tide has definitely turned against investors in high-yield debt, better known as junk bonds.

title: Strictly No Elephants, Big Friends and More
description: What are friends for? Children answer this question in a variety of telling ways, whether by opting for the safety of a playmate who might as well be a twin or the adventure of reaching out to a polar opposite or by steering some in-between course. Four new picture books offer different views of the risks and rewards for the very young of stepping outside the primal comfort zone of home and family.

title: Conquerors: How Portugal Forged the First Global Empire, by Roger Crowley
description: Afonso de Albuquerque died 500 years ago, after spending a dozen years terrorizing coastal cities from Yemen to Malaysia. He enriched thousands of men and killed tens of thousands more. Despite never commanding more than a few dozen ships, he built one of the first modern intercontinental empires. And this was just the beginning: The next step, he said, was to sail up the Red Sea, destroy Mecca, Medina and the Prophet Muhammads body and liberate the Holy Land. Perhaps, he mused, he could destroy Islam altogether.

title: Blood and Earth, by Kevin Bales
description: Kevin Bales argues in Blood and Earth that ending modern slavery could make a big difference in the planets health. If slavery were a country, he asserts, it would have the third-largest CO2 emissions on the planet.

title: Midnight in Broad Daylight, by Pamela Rotner Sakamoto
description: Pamela Rotner Sakamotos engrossing book opens simultaneously in Los Angeles and Hiroshima on Dec. 7, 1941. In Los Angeles, a 21-year-old Japanese-American gardener named Harry Fukuhara is mowing a lawn when his white employer steps out of her house and tells him, Harry, Japan has attacked Pearl Harbor. In Hiroshima, a 17-year-old high school student named Katsutoshi is about to board a train for a track meet when he hears a garbled shout behind him. During his race, Katsutoshi keeps turning over in his mind what he thought he heard. Had someone really shouted our victorious assault on Hawaii?

title: The Illegal, by Lawrence Hill
description: How do we stop them? How do we stop the dispossessed, the poor, the hungry, the terrified, from breaching our borders and overwhelming us with their need? How do we deal with those who have already managed to sneak in? And how do we distinguish between the truly desperate and the truly evil who hide (so we suspect) among them?

title: Your Heart Is a Muscle the Size of a Fist, by Sunil Yapa
description: With the dwindling of the anti-globalization movement over the past decade, the 1999 World Trade Organization protests in Seattle can now look like easily mocked millennial optimism: turtles, teamsters, Wiccans, the Free Mumia crowd and beanie-wearing save-the-forests types finding common cause with the victims of corporate capital and glowing with the belief in a better world. Although media coverage of what transpired over the protests five chaotic days in November focused on police brutality and destruction of property, in its full reality, the Battle in Seattle swung from hope-filled carnival to angry riot to a moment of real change  a polyvalent, ambiguous and high-stakes drama. In other words, a novelists dream.

title: The Blue Line, by Ingrid Betancourt
description: The literary style known as magic realism, incorporating fantastic elements into otherwise realistic fiction, has been deployed with much success by Latin American writers. It is also, lately, a Colombian tourism slogan. Now the Colombian politician Ingrid Betancourt, best known for a memoir describing her six years in the jungle as the hostage of anti-government rebels, has added her first novel to the ranks of the genre.

title: The Love of Strangers, by Nile Green
description: Great was the weight placed on young shoulders in the spring of 1815 when a small group of students left their home city of Tabriz in northwest Iran and set out for Inglistan, the land of the English. Led by the charismatic and doggedly determined Mirza Salih, they were taliban in the truest sense of the word  seekers of knowledge. Their desire for ulum-i-jadid, or new sciences, had become a matter of national security. Wars with Russia had battered the domain of the crown prince, Abbas Mirza, for more than a century, and he was eager to protect it from further destruction. When the young men were sent to the West, their instructions were clear, if daunting: They were to learn all they could in order to drag their country into an industrialized, czar-beating era.

title: The Kindness of Enemies, by Leila Aboulela
description: Perhaps we only imagine that questions of allegiance, of belonging, are more urgent now than they ever were. The war on terror asks for a pledge of loyalty: Whose side are you on? The question seems straightforward, but as Leila Aboulelas new novel reminds us, to ask where we come from, to choose where we belong, is not a simple matter at all.

title: The Invitation-Only Zone, by Robert S. Boynton
description: A 13-year-old Japanese schoolgirl walking home from badminton practice mysteriously disappears. So does a young couple strolling on a beach. A mother and her 19-year-old daughter also vanish on the way back from their routine grocery shopping trip. They are among at least 17 Japanese who were abducted by North Korea in the years between 1977 and 1983.

title: Republicans Intensify Attacks After a Pitched Debate
description: The battle for the Republican nomination appeared more splintered than ever between two halves of a bitterly divided party as several candidates scrambled on Friday to consolidate the support of more moderate conservatives a day after a raucous debate.

title: The Smartest Comments of the Republican Debate: Readers Weigh In
description: On Thursday night, we asked you who made the most intelligent comment during the Republican debate. In response, readers gave shoutouts to Donald Trump, Ben Carson, Chris Christie and Bernie Sanders. Below, some of the most popular choices for the smartest comment of the evening:

title: You Asked, Hillary Clinton Answered
description: During a visit to the editorial board, the candidate took a moment to answer a question from a Times reader.

title: Thoughts on a Poland in Flux: Readers Speak Out
description: There is intense debate in Poland about the direction the country is taking under its new right-wing government, a debate that has spilled over into the European Union and that has raised questions about the direction of democracy in Eastern and Central Europe more than a quarter-century after the fall of the Berlin Wall.

title: Sean Penn Says His El Chapo Article Has Failed
description: The actor Sean Penn said he has a terrible regret that the capture of the Mexican drug lord known as El Chapo has distracted from his article in Rolling Stone, which he had hoped would start a national conversation about the war on drugs.

title: Short Stories
description: YOUR FATHER SENDS HIS LOVEStoriesBy Stuart Evers312 pp. Norton, $24.95.

title: The Fashion News to Know This Week
description: And the stars look very different today

title: Iowas Heartland Beyond the Campaign Trail
description: On a Monday morning in early December I drove a rental car out of Des Moines and eventually made my way down a slender country road that cut a forthright path through cattle pastures and cornfields not yet glazed by snow. My destination was Winterset, the county seat of Madison County, whose covered bridges Robert James Waller immortalized more than 20 years ago in his best seller, The Bridges of Madison County. Mr. Wallers treacly love fable is not my personal favorite, but I confess to detouring at the sign for Hogback Bridge and being stirred by the lonely spectacle of that wooden sentry crouched over the North River in an unprepossessing crease of Middle America.

title: Oh, the Places We Tell You to Go: Inside the Travel Sections Special Issue
description: Temples of Malta. Pine forests in Dalat, Vietnam. How about a speck of volcanic rock in the South Atlantic? Itching to get out of town? Every January, The Times Travel section publishes a Places to Go Issue.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: City of Thorns
description: This week, Ben Rawlence discusses City of Thorns; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Janice Y. K. Lee talks about The Expatriates; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

title: Ian Rankins Even Dogs in the Wild, and More
description: Retirement isnt for everyone, least of all John Rebus, the hero of Ian Rankins mordant police procedurals set in the shadowy underworld of Edinburgh. In EVEN DOGS IN THE WILD (Little, Brown, $26), Rebuss unorthodox friendship with the aging crime boss Big Ger Cafferty allows this retired detective to attach himself to a police investigation into the murder of a former lord advocate and death threats against other high-profile citizens, including Cafferty.

title: Choreographer Revisits Epic Sanskrit Poem
description: LONDON  From the age of 13 to 15, Akram Khan traveled the world as a performer in the director Peter Brooks nine-hour theatrical version of the Mahabharata. Its not much of a surprise then, that Mr. Khan, now 41, and well-known in his native Britain, has returned to the epic Sanskrit poem  it contains more than 90,000 couplets and hundreds of stories and myths  for a second time in his choreographic career.

title: Big Ticket | 146 Waverly Place
description: A five-story Greek Revival townhouse in Greenwich Village sold for $23.28 million.

title: Greenwich Village Townhouse Flipped for$23.3 Million
description: An investment partnership sold a gut-renovated early-20th-century townhouse on a prime, tree-lined street in Greenwich Village for $23,282,932.60, more than twice what it had paid for the property just over two years ago  a transaction that was the most expensive closed sale of the week, according to city records.

title: You Asked, Hillary Clinton Answered
description: On Wednesday, we asked you to submit questions for Hillary Clinton. During her visit to the editorial board, she picked one of your questions from a hat to answer on camera. Watch her response below:

title: F.T.C.s Lumosity Penalty Doesnt End Brain Training Debate
description: A few years ago, Jennifer Perrine saw a television ad for Lumosity, an online brain training program, and decided shed give it a try.

title: In Online Dating, Sextortion and Scams
description: DATING websites and apps typically see a surge in activity this time of year as people who felt lonely over the holidays try to follow through on New Years resolutions to find someone special with whom to share their life, or maybe just someone agreeable to share their bed on a cold winters night.

title: Medical Aid Sent to Starving Syrian Town of Madaya
description: GENEVA  Alarmed by starvation in the besieged Syrian town of Madaya, aid agencies sent a mobile medical clinic there on Friday and planned to increase medical support.

title: Rams Move Raises Questions About Raiders and Chargers
description: On Tuesday, N.F.L. owners voted to allow the St. Louis Rams to return to Southern California and build a domed stadium in an entertainment district in Inglewood, a few miles from downtown Los Angeles.

title: Review: Billions Delivers a Dose of Charisma to Hedge Fund Titans
description: Men who make lots of money and growl at one another about profits and margins and winning and losing. Remember them?

title: Take Comfort in One-Hour Winter Vegetable Soup
description: I still have the cheap food mill I bought from a vendor at a market on the Boulevard Raspail when I lived in Paris decades ago. The knob has come loose from the handle, but it still does the job. I pull it out every time I make this soup.

title: What I Love | Andrew Livingston
description: Andrew Livingston, the majority owner of the Knickerbocker Mfg. Co., a clothing company, lives and trend-spots in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: A Fashion Entrepreneur at Home in Brooklyn
description: The first thing Andrew Livingston did when he moved into his two-bedroom apartment in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, was to furnish the guest room with a good mattress. I needed it up and running on Day 1, he said.

title: Monetary Economics at the GOP Debate
description: There wasnt much economics, or for that matter much connection with reality. But Ted Cruz delivered:

title: Supernova Has Energy of Hundreds of Billions of Suns
description: Astronomers have discovered a giant ball of hot gas, billions of light years away, that is radiating the energy of hundreds of billions of suns. The ball may be the most powerful supernova ever seen, a study in the journal Science reports. At the center is an object about 10 miles in diameter that scientists think might be a rare type of star called a magnetar. The gas ball, 3.8 billion light years away, was spotted through the All Sky Automated Survey for Supernovae collaboration. The project, led by researchers at Ohio State University, aims to find supernovae using various small telescopes in the Northern and Southern Hemispheres.

title: After Nuclear Test, China Resists Pressure to Curb North Korea
description: BEIJING  North Korea had detonated a nuclear bomb, and the president of China was urging caution. It was the fall of 2013, and the Norths third nuclear test in seven years, carried out several months earlier, had rattled much of the world.

title: Chipotle Will Close Stores for Food Safety Meetings After Outbreaks
description: As Chipotle Mexican Grill tries to  recover from a series of contaminations that have caused some customers and investors to flee, it said it would shut all its stores for several hours on Feb. 8 to hold food safety meetings with employees.

title: His Strength Sapped, Top Marathoner Ryan Hall Decides to Stop
description: REDDING, Calif.  Sprinting seven miles down a 9,000-foot mountain and then running back up to do it again may not appeal to even the most self-punishing of athletes, but Ryan Hall believes it is the kind of experimental workout that transformed him into the fastest American distance runner in history.

title: Carly Fiorina Is Not Even Good at Gratuitous Insults
description: Some political candidates are great at throwing around snappy one-liners. Donald Trump has an incredible facility with sound bites. They rarely have a passing connection to reality, and often dont even make sense, but they land well with his audiences. He knows he can just yell, Lets build a wall! and his crowds will go crazy.

title: Louvre to Start Restoring  Another Leonardo Painting
description: PARIS  The Louvre is preparing to start the restoration of Leonardo da Vincis Saint John the Baptist, a 16th-century work that has darkened over the years.

title: Stock Market Ends Sharply Lower as Worries About Economy Surface
description: It may be time for everyone to take the markets seriously again.

title: When Prisoners Had Ski Jumps
description: Q. I recently saw a photograph from the 1970s showing an inmate at the Dannemora state prison using a ski jump inside the prison! Can this be true?

title: Get the Look: Luke Spillers Glam Rock Makeup
description: The products and steps required to recreate the Struts frontmans on-stage beauty look.

title: Meet the Glam Rock Frontman Channeling Freddie Mercury
description: Luke Spiller knows that the Struts are headed for big things. Already, the U.K. rock outfit has played in front of 80,000 people in Paris as the opener for the Rolling Stones. More recently, Could Have Been Me, the hard-charging lead single from bands debut album, Everybody Wants (out March 4 via Freesolo/Interscope Records), has racked up more than 7 million plays on Spotify and has become a regular on rock radio. And Spiller, the Struts charismatic singer, has garnered comparisons to everyone from Tim Curry to the late Queen frontman Freddie Mercury (to whom he bears an almost eerie resemblance.) But today, hes worried about just one thing: getting his makeup right. Does it look all right? he asks, looking in the mirror.

title: Lawsuit Questions Ted Cruzs Eligibility to Be President
description: Donald J. Trump predicted that the lawsuits against Senator Ted Cruz, doubtinghis constitutional eligibility to be president, would start trickling in as questions continued to percolate about the fact that he was born in Canada. As the Republican candidates gathered to debate in South Carolina on Thursday, one had already been filed.

title: Americas Public Lands
description: To the Editor:

title: In Losing the Rams, St. Louis Wins
description: Dont cry for St. Louis, sports fans.

title: Iowa on a Plate
description: The dining landscape in the state that begins the presidential nomination process.

title: Another Reason to Caucus in Iowa: The Restaurants
description: LE MARS, Iowa  To get to Archies Waeside, the James Beard Award-winning steakhouse here that has been run by the same family for three generations, you drive past a branch of the ubiquitous Pizza Ranch chain, cross over a set of railroad tracks and inch down an unlit road toward a low-slung and scantly marked building hard by an R.V. dump.

title: How the Rev. Michael A. Walrond Jr. Spends His Sundays
description: The Rev. Michael A. Walrond Jr., 44, the senior pastor at First Corinthian Baptist Church in Harlem, wears jeans in the pulpit, rides a motorcycle and encourages posting on Twitter during his sermons. So far it has worked. Since he arrived in 2004, First Corinthian says, church membership has grown to 9,000 from 300. In 2014, he ran (unsuccessfully) for the congressional seat long held by Representative Charles B. Rangel. Known to congregants as Pastor Mike, Mr. Walrond lives in Harlem with his wife, the Rev. LaKeesha Walrond, 44, the churchs executive pastor.

title: Annie Leibovitzs Women Opens in London
description: The photographer kicks off a 10-city world tour with an installation at the Wapping Hydraulic Power Station.

title: Annie Leibovitzs Classic Portraits of Women, Now in Expanded Form
description: Down rickety stairs in an old red-brick power plant in the East End of London, images from Annie Leibovitzs 1999 Women project pulse on two giant screens. They alternate with more recent portraits: an image of the late LWren Scott lying across a chair, a tableau of New Yorks female gallerists  even the Kardashian-Wests mid-selfie. From a third screen glows the Queen in formal pomp.

title: New Donald Trump Ad Features Less Anger, Bold Goals and No Specifics
description: Donald J. Trumps campaign on Friday released its second advertisement, a conventional 30-second clip of Mr. Trumps Jan. 4 stump speech in Lowell, Mass.

title: Uber Not to Blame for Rise in Manhattan Traffic Congestion, Report Says
description: After an uproar last year between Mayor Bill de Blasio and the ride-hailing app Uber over the companys growth in New York City, the two sides reached something of a truce on Friday with the release of a very short  and very expensive  traffic report from the city.

title: How I Got Ejected From a Donald Trump Event
description: WAUKEE, Iowa  I was late to Donald J. Trumps unannounced visit to a Pizza Ranch on Friday, his first drop-by of this ubiquitous Iowa chain that is standard stop for candidates, but which Mr. Trump has avoided in favor of boisterous crowds in big halls.

title: Robust 4th Quarter Couldnt Redeem Market After an Anxious Year
description: The stock market withstood fierce punishment last year and had almost nothing to show for it. A strong fourth quarter healed some of the damage but as the year closed and 2016 began, the battering in the market began yet again.

title: The Reach of Lead in Flints Water Supply
description: How the crisis developed, and which neighborhoods had the highest lead levels.

title: Bookshelf: Back Again
description: Reissued books include Will Spring Be Early? Or Will Spring Be Late? and Arthur.

title: Dining in Thunder Bay, Where Sustainable Meets Delectable
description: Between the elk, venison and fish harvested by the First Nations and the pork-heavy diet of the French settlers, Canadian cuisine has always been known for its protein. But the Canadian steakhouse got a modern twist in early 2015 with Uptown Cut, a chef-focused spot that brings a tasting-menu approach to a classic concept.

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Terence Koh
Bird Flu Outbreak Confirmed in Indiana
description: The Department of Agriculture confirmed on Friday that a strain of avian influenza had hit a commercial flock of turkeys in Indiana.

title: A Last-Minute Guide to Picasso Sculpture at MoMA
description: This once-in-a-lifetime exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art, which brings together more than 100 Picasso works, will close on Feb. 7.

title: A Yacht Club in Brooklyn Elects Its First Female Commodore
description: Good evening, Madam Commodore. Congratulations, Madam Commodore. What are you drinking, Madam Commodore?

title: Alphabet Shakes Up Its Robotics Division
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Googles robotics division has been plagued by low morale and a lack of leadership since the units founder left abruptly in 2014. Now Alphabet is cleaning it up.

title: French Movie About Jihadis Wont Be Released in Theaters
description: PARIS  From the start, the subject hit too close to home. Out of security concerns in a country still in shock after the November terrorist attacks, Made in France, a French film about homegrown jihadists plotting strikes on downtown Paris, will head straight to video-on-demand this month and forgo release in cinemas.

title: Pizza, Made With a Light Hand, California Style
description: By mid-January, I often long for something brighter than the decidedly wintry vegetable offerings at the farmers market. I need a reminder of summers sweetness. And sometimes I give in to that longing. Does that mean Im not a seasonal cook? Or is this simply a lapsed locavores quandary?

description: An undergraduate degree from a flagship state university often comes with a six-figure sticker price for on-campus residents. A private college could cost a quarter of a million dollars nowadays.

title: Rebuke to Episcopal Church
description: To the Editor:

title: Gains Against ISIS Bring More Deaths Elsewhere in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  When tens of thousands of civilians escaped an Islamic State onslaught on the Iraqi city of Ramadi last year, Amir Mishaan and his three children, the youngest barely a year old, were among those who settled into makeshift lives here in the capital.

title: When Emerging Markets Roar, Stand Your Ground
description: While most forms of investing require a leap of faith, betting on emerging-markets stock funds this year  Chinese stocks have already had double-digit declines  may feel like jumping across the Grand Canyon.

title: Super Pac Backing Jeb Bush Looks to Crowdfund an Ad for the Super Bowl
description: The mega-donors who helped Right to Rise, the super PAC supporting Jeb Bush, raise over $100 million arent exactly the typical crowdfounding type.

title: Fund Managers Win With Tech Stalwarts and Burly Brand Names
description: Bets on the biggest purveyors of technology  companies like Amazon, Google and Microsoft  powered three of the top-performing funds of the fourth quarter.

title: Follow Your Conscience Without Losing Your Shirt
description: Investing can sometimes seem heartless. If whatever makes money is your mantra, you may find that you have put your cash into enterprises with which you fundamentally disagree.

title: Loose Lips Sink Careers, Even for C.E.O.s
description: Doesnt anybody know how to shut up anymore?

title: Signs of a Retail Rebound as Consumers Take On More Debt
description: Consumer debt is rising. How Americans handle that load and how much cash they spend will determine the fortunes of an important stock sector.

title: For E.T.F. Traders, Lessons From the Panic
description: A selling point of exchange-traded funds over traditional mutual funds is that they can be traded at any time during a market session, but when stocks plunged as soon as trading began on Aug. 24  that feature of E.T.F.s became a bug.

title: Small, Private Insurers Face Increasing Scrutiny on Avoided Taxes
description: SHOULD a Phoenix-area jeweler be able to create his own private insurance company to cover his jewelry stores against possible terrorist attacks, specifically those relating to radioactivity from a dirty bomb or from nuclear fuel or nuclear waste?

title: Investing Advice That Doubles as a Bookmark
description: Mastering the basics required to put together a solid financial plan is not too hard. Getting the most out of every investment dollar is.

title: Brownsvilles Broken Windows
description: Between Thanksgiving weekend and the first week in January, when the gang rape of an 18-year-old woman in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn was reported, the neighborhood could too easily have found confirmation that it was a place doomed to lurid violence, if its broader history hadnt proved the claim.

title: Review: Angie Tribeca, Steve and Nancy Carells Modern-Day Police Squad!
description: TBS is debuting its new comedy Angie Tribeca on Sunday, with a 25-hour Binge-a-Thon, playing the whole 10-episode season on repeat, without commercials. This is both unnecessary and perfect.

title: One Syrians Journey From Hometown Rebel to ISIS Bomber
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  IN the early years of Syrias revolt, he filmed protests in the streets of his rebel-held neighborhood, in the historic center of the city of Homs. He chanted for dignity and freedom with a green, white and black banner, the old version of the national flag.

title: Ronald Perelman Quits Carnegie Hall Board
description: In a quiet coda to a period of sturm und drang at Carnegie Hall, Ronald O. Perelman, the billionaire businessman, resigned from its board of trustees earlier this month, representatives of Mr. Perelman and the hall said Friday.

title: How Oil Prices Are Falling Again, Explained in Four Charts
description: A glut of crude oil on the markets is pushing the price of oil down to levels not seen since the global financial crisis.

title: El Chapos Affection for Actress Is Met With Mockery Online
description: MEXICO CITY  Affectionate cellphone messages left by the drug lord Joaqun Guzmn Loera for the actress Kate del Castillo have some in Mexico wondering if Mr. Guzmn, the former fugitive known as El Chapo, was interested in more than just a friendly interview with her.

title: Stock Prices Sink in a Rising Ocean of Oil
description: HOUSTON  The world is awash in crude oil, with enough extra produced last year to fuel all of Britain or Thailand. And the price of oil will not stop falling until the glut shrinks.

title: A Year Junk Bonds Lived Up to Their Name
description: Investors chasing high yields have been battling high anxiety.

title: More Programs Set for Rubenstein Atrium
description: The David Rubenstein Atrium at Lincoln Center will roughly double its number of free performances in 2016 in a makeover that includes the introduction of new recurring programs.

title: Farmers Markets and Food-Borne Illness
description: OVER the last two decades, more and more Americans have begun patronizing their local farmers markets. From 1994 to 2014, the number of farmers markets throughout the country increased almost fivefold. Many consumers frequent these markets because they believe that the foods they purchase there are healthier and safer than the same items sold at supermarkets, posing less risk of food-borne illness.

title: Justices to Hear Appeal by Bob McDonnell, Ex-Governor of Virginia
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear an appeal from Bob McDonnell, the former governor of Virginia who was convicted of public corruption and faces two years in prison in a case that offers an important test of what kinds of official conduct amount to forbidden corruption.

title: Ted Cruz Failed to Report a Second Campaign Loan in 2012
description: The Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz, already facing scrutiny for not disclosing a Goldman Sachs loan he used for his 2012 Senate campaign, also failed to disclose a second loan, from Citibank, for the same race, according to a letter he sent Thursday to federal election officials.

title: The Rambunctious Republican Debate
description: To the Editor:

title: Pictures of the Day: Greece and Elsewhere
description: Greece and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Marco Rubio Bought a Gun on Christmas Eve, Campaign Says
description: NEWPORT, NH  How did Senator Marco Rubio spend Christmas Eve?

title: Jan. 15, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Greece, France, Taiwan and Spain.

title: Portugal to Extradite Ex-C.I.A. Agent to Italy in Rendition Case
description: MADRID  A Portuguese court has ruled that a former C.I.A. agent should be handed over to Italy after being found guilty by an Italian court of taking part in the kidnapping of an Egyptian cleric in 2003, one of the renditions ordered by the administration of former President George W. Bush.

title: Autopsy of Chedrick Chatman
description: Newly released documents and videos shed light on the death of Chicagos Cedrick Chatman, a 17-year-old who was shot and killed by police in 2013.

title: Review: Mercy Street, a Civil War Hospital Drama on PBS
description: A stately building owned by a wealthy family whose fortunes are in jeopardy. A principled American beauty who married a European nobleman. Lavish helpings of period dresses, ball gowns and uniforms. Mercy Street may be the rare PBS drama thats set in the United States, but dont worry: Downton Abbey fans will find that it has some comfortingly familiar elements.

title: Review: Philadelphia Orchestra Plays Music From Vienna
description: In crucial ways, the charismatic conductor Yannick Nzet-Sguin, now in his fourth season as music director of the Philadelphia Orchestra, is excelling in the job. The players seem energized by his leadership. The orchestra sounded terrific on Thursday at Carnegie Hall, in a concert highlighted by an uncommonly sensitive performance of Beethovens Fourth Piano Concerto, with the pianist Jan Lisiecki.

title: At Least 20 Killed in Siege by Militants in Burkina Faso
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso  Gunmen from Al Qaeda stormed a luxury hotel frequented by foreigners in Burkina Fasos capital on Friday night, seizing hostages and killing others while fighting with dozens of security forces who began a counterattack hours later. It was Al Qaedas first major attack in this landlocked sub-Saharan country, a former French colony.

title: Rocky Road Ahead for Big Banks
description: Americas too-big-to-fail cabal is nursing $130 billion in damages. Thats the amount of market value lost by the nations top six banks in the last two weeks. The shares of all but Wells Fargo now trade below book value, suggesting stockholders are bracing for a year or more of pain. Whether theyre right looks like a tossup.

title: Giants KeptBen McAdoo by Keeping Eagles Away
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  By the middle of this week, Ben McAdoo had interviewed for vacant head coaching positions with the Giants and the Philadelphia Eagles. He knew that if either team was serious about hiring him, it would call him back for a second interview.

title: 18 Carmakers Agree to Share Safety Data
description: DETROIT  When Mark Rosekind became the nations top auto safety regulator in late 2014, the industry was reeling from record recalls prompted by a vehicle defect at General Motors that was later tied to 124 deaths.

title: Bill Cunningham | Free Spirits
description: If theres a revolution in fashion, its about mens wear.

title: Bill Cunningham |Free Spirits
description: If theres a revolution in fashion, its about mens wear. Shown here are men who wont be corralled by traditional style expectations. Two looks are at the center: a pencil-slim wrap coat in an unconventional gray, left, and a dusty pink coat shaped by exaggerated welt seams, right. The effect is such that the cloth seems to have been molded into a fitted shape. More important is the authority with which the young men wear these coats, which are far removed from the expected Wall Street uniform.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week.

title: Attack at Hotel in Burkina Fasos Capital
Evening Hours | Dinner at the Frick and a Jazz Dance
description: Plus: Remembering a fashion editor.

title: Oscars So White? Or Oscars So Dumb? Discuss.
description: Are these the whitest Oscar nominations ever? Or just the most recent Academy Award whiteout? For the second year in a row, the nominations failed to recognize any minority actors. Movies about black lives like Creed and Straight Outta Compton did receive recognition, but their nominations were for either white writers (Compton) or a white performer (Sylvester Stallone in Creed). The black directors of each movie along with their nonwhite actors were shut out.

title: Review: Key Change Hears From Women in Prison
description: Although the language occasionally takes on a darkly lyrical hue, music plays no role in Key Change, a moving, intimate and superbly acted drama about womens lives in (and out of, and in again) a British prison. Written by Catrina McHugh and directed by Laura Lindow, the play was devised with women from an actual prison, drawing specifically on their experiences both before and during incarceration.

title: E.U.s Open Borders Are in Danger, German Minister Warns
description: BRUSSELS  The pressures facing Germany as it contends with record levels of migration burst into the open on Friday as the countrys finance minister warned the rest of the European Union that freedom to move within the bloc could be close to ending.

title: Republicans in Congress WillWrite 2016 Campaign Platform, Ryan Says
description: BALTIMORE  Republican congressional leaders said Friday that they were moving aggressively to draw up a campaign platform for 2016 so that the party would be positioned to coalesce swiftly around a nominee after a bruising primary campaign.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Flint, Coal
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Jason Craigs Longyarn Features a Mom Who Wont Shut Up
description: Mom is a mountain in Longyarn, the uninhibitedly shaggy new comedy from Banana Bag & Bodice. Her bedraggled head nearly scrapes the ceiling of the Bushwick Starr in Brooklyn, where Jason Craigs play opened on Thursday night, and her scrawny torso is attached to a Brobdingnagian skirt that defies circumnavigation.

title: And the Oscar Goes to ... White People
Gingerly, Donald Trump Tries Out Some Campaign Conventions
description: In Manchester, N.H., on Monday, after a traditional town hall-style event, the candidate who prefers dashing home from speeches on his private jet stopped by the Red Arrow Diner and ordered a cheeseburger plate piled high with French fries.

title: Review: From Chile, Escuela, a Drama About Education
description: A chalkboard is not the most cheering sight to behold upon entering a theater. Nor is a slide projector. Both are on view, aptly enough, alas, in Escuela, a dull, didactic drama written and directed by the noted Chilean playwright Guillermo Caldern.

title: To Protect Against Zika Virus, Pregnant Women Are Warned About Latin American Trips
description: Federal health officials on Friday advised pregnant women to postpone traveling to 13 Latin American or Caribbean countries and Puerto Rico where mosquitoes are spreading the Zika virus, which has been linked to brain damage in babies.

title: He Irons. She Stitches.
description: San Toy Laundry in Park Slope, Brooklyn, is marked with old-fashioned, Charlie Chan-style lettering on its dated sign out front. The space, on Seventh Avenue, has housed a string of Chinese-owned laundries dating back more than a century, and like nearly everything else inside, the handwritten sign No Lost Tickets on Friday & Saturday is antiquated.

title: Donald Trump Says He Is Self-Financing Bid, Despite the Evidence
description: Speaking to reporters after Thursday nights debate, Donald J. Trump said, as he often does, that he was self-financing his campaign.

title: Review: In God Bless Baseball, Japan, Korea and Americas Pastime
description: God Bless Baseball at Japan Society has a few modest allegorical points to make and takes its time making them. Its intermittently amusing and often visually arresting, but  like, some would say, the game of baseball itself  it would benefit from being sped up.

title: Review: Samedi Dtente Looks Back at the Horrors of Rwanda
description: In Samedi Dtente, Dorothe Munyaneza uses spoken word, dance and music to explore the Rwandan genocide that forced her from her Kigali home at the age of 12. She describes how 800,000 people died in just 100 days, how she lost friends and family, how she and her father and brother escaped into the countryside, wearing lice-ridden layers of clothing and sleeping outdoors on a tarp.

title: Aterrizando en Venezuela:En busca del rostro de Bolvar
description: Nicholas Casey, el nuevo corresponsal de The New York Times en la regin andina, compartir en esta seccin todas las vivencias de su primer mes en Venezuela.

title: Review: The New York Philharmonic Offers Works by Modern Masters
description: For sheer sonic splendor, few programs could surpass the one Alan Gilbert and the New York Philharmonic are offering at David Geffen Hall this week. It shows three modern masters  Ottorino Respighi, Magnus Lindberg and Igor Stravinsky  using their orchestral wizardry well, if, in Respighis case, not always wisely.

title: Friday Night Music: Lucius, Born Again Teen
description: I love Lucius  their songwriting is terrific, their harmonies are exquisite, and their live performances are pure joy. Frankly, Im not quite as fond of their records  I bought their first, of course, and have an advance of their second  which are (to my taste) overproduced. But your mileage may vary.

title: Race, Civil Rights and Photography
description: The Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and other civil rights leaders relied on the power of photographs to persuade, enrage and motivate.

title: Campaign Aides Defend Bernie Sanderss Record on Gun Votes
description: As Senator Bernie Sanders soars in polls and faces criticism from Hillary Clinton over his record on gun control, his aides are finding themselves explaining his voting record over the years on the issue.

title: Kid Fury of The Read: From Digital Realm to the Stage
description: WASHINGTON  Kid Furys mentions on Twitter are often littered with story links and screenshots from his more than 100,000 followers, in which they ask if he has, say, seen the criticisms of the price of Michelle Obamas clothes or a singers shady comment on Instagram. Their goal is to provide fodder for The Read  the podcast he hosts with his friend and fellow Internet personality, Crissle  or for Furious Thoughts, the YouTube series he started in 2010. On each platform he has built a rabid, eclectic following  blacks, whites, older people, high schoolers  who seek out his irreverent, profanity-ridden takes on the latest happenings both online and off, from viral racism to The Real Housewives of Atlanta.

title: China Embraces Craft Beers, and Brewing Giants Take Notice
description: HONG KONG  When Jin Xin first started selling imported premium beer a decade ago, his bar manager predicted that it would take a month or two just to sell a single case. But within a few years business picked up, and soon customers started frequenting the bar for its India pale ales and other European beers.

title: Inquiry Faults Army Leadership in Anthrax Shipment
description: WASHINGTON  The Army on Friday issued a scathing critique of the management and oversight of a military laboratory that mistakenly sent live anthrax to facilities around the world, singling out a brigadier general and 11 other people for possible disciplinary action.

title: Dog Pants? Show a Little More Fur, Obama Says
description: [Video: Watch on YouTube.]

title: Despite Boycott Calls, Chicago Mayors King Day Event Goes On
description: CHICAGO  Despite calls to boycott an annual breakfast Mayor Rahm Emanuel was hosting in honor of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., a hotel ballroom was mostly full on Friday morning. The speech he delivered was greeted with polite applause. Some influential black leaders even offered friendly remarks from the stage.

title: In Praise of Blue Notes: What Makes Music Sad?
description: The idea of sadness connects the music of Adele, Kendrick Lamar, Billie Holiday, the English folk singer Nick Drake, the metal band Slayer and Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart.

title: Kuwait Airways Drops Flights to Avoid Israeli Passengers
description: Kuwait Airways will operate its last flight between New York City and London on Saturday, deciding last month to drop the route after about 35 years of service rather than transport Israeli citizens between the two cities.

title: In New Years Melee in Cologne, a Migrant Was One Womans Savior
description: BERLIN  Caught up in a melee of drunken revelers outside the Cologne train station on New Years Eve, Caitlin Duncan, a neuroscience student from Seattle, was terrified. She had somehow gotten separated from her German boyfriend, who had both their cellphones and her wallet. Ms. Duncan, 27, said that she was quickly surrounded and groped by several young men: One snatched her hat from her head, another tried to kiss her face and neck.

title: New York to Gain 30 Acres of Parkland From Catholic Nuns
description: UPPER NYACK, N.Y.  Sister Veronica Mendez adjusted her glasses and tried to remember the last time someone joined the religious order here. Joined and stayed? she pondered. It would have been the 1970s.

title: Gov. Cuomos Push on Justice Reform
description: When Gov. Andrew Cuomo went to Mount Neboh Baptist Church in Harlem last Sunday to give a speech on criminal justice reform, he said, Im going to go down in the history books as the governor who closed the most prisons in the history of the state of New York.

title: Death of 3 Columbia Students Raises Fears Over Trips Abroad
description: While many of their classmates were using the winter break to unwind, the 28 Columbia University students whose bus crashed in Honduras this week had chosen to spend part of their vacation volunteering by helping doctors provide basic medical care in one of Central Americas poorest countries.

title: States Should Raise the Gas Tax
description: The tumbling price of crude oil is helping many Americans save money. It also presents a good opportunity for state governments to raise their gasoline taxes to help pay for road repairs and other needed transportation investments.

title: Putting an Environmental Price Tag on Coal
description: One intriguing if slightly mysterious passage in President Obamas State of the Union address contained a pledge to accelerate the transition away from old, dirtier energy, in part by changing the way we manage our oil and coal resources so that they better reflect the costs they impose on taxpayers and our planet.

title: Federal Reserve Started 2010 With Hope, Then Fear and Fitful Activism
description: WASHINGTON  When 2010 began, the United States economy seemed to be on the mend and leaders of the Federal Reserve discussed how they would unwind their extraordinary rescue efforts  from the crisis that erupted in 2008. The term exit strategy was mentioned 37 times in their first two policy meetings of the year.

title: Disney Names Bob Weis as New President of Imagineering Unit
description: LOS ANGELES  The Walt Disney Company on Friday installed new leadership at its linchpin Imagineering division, which is responsible for designing and building rides, hotels and restaurants across Disneys $16 billion global theme park empire.

title: New York Values, According to New Yorkers
description: Senator Ted Cruz attacked Donald J. Trump, a Queens native, for having New York values. Amid much debate over what that means, we invited New Yorkers to share their own definition.

title: Looking at Later Primaries, Bernie Sanders Works to Strengthen Black Support
description: Even if he defeats Hillary Clinton in both Iowa and New Hampshire next month, Senator Bernie Sanders faces a daunting problem when the presidential race moves on to bigger, more diverse states: winning over black voters.

title: For Now, Anglicans Avert Schism Over Gay Marriage
description: Despite threats of a walkout or even schism over the issue of gay marriage, the archbishops of the Anglican Communion, the worlds third-largest body of churches, managed to keep their church intact after a week of tense meetings that ended with a symbolic washing of one anothers feet.

title: New Yorkers, Self-Assured and Opinionated, Defend Their Values
description: There is a broad and recognizable New York persona. It isnt entirely enviable, not to everyone. Assured. Brazen. Unapologetic about money. There is a New York speed, and its rocket velocity. You want directions in the Midwest, someone will take you there, buy you a coffee, invite you later for dinner and to stay overnight. In New York its: Two blocks down, take a left. Whoosh.

title: Jawbone Raises $165 Million at Half Its Last Valuation
description: Jawbone, the once-hot wearable technology start-up, said on Friday that it had raised $165 million in funding at a valuation of $1.5 billion, or roughly half the amount that the company was valued at as recently as 2014, continuing a burgeoning trend of start-ups raising money at lower values than before.

title: Girl, 15, Killed in Fall From Rooftop in Hells Kitchen
description: A 15-year-old girl died on Friday afternoon after she tried to jump from one rooftop to another in Midtown Manhattan and fell five stories, the police said.

title: Oregon: Police Arrest Two Tied to Standoff at Refuge
description: One man connected with the armed takeover of a federal wildlife refuge in rural Oregon was arrested, and a second was held in the disappearance of a vehicle from the refuge, the authorities said Friday. Both arrests were made without incident and far from the refuge itself. Kenneth Medenbach, 62, was arrested Friday at a grocery in Burns on probable cause for unauthorized use of a motor vehicle that the police said was the property of the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge, about 30 miles away. Brian Cavalier, who identified himself as Fluffy Unicorn, and as a bodyguard of the militant groups leader, Ammon Bundy, was arrested earlier in the week in Buckeye, Ariz., on a criminal warrant during the investigation of a suspicious vehicle. He was later released by a judge. A Buckeye police spokesman on Friday said Arizona law prevented disclosure of arrest warrant details. Protesters have occupied the refuge headquarters buildings since Jan. 2.

title: Workers Sickened at House Office Building
description: Several people were taken to hospitals on Friday after possibly being exposed to lead paint dust in a House office building, the authorities said. Officials said that overnight construction at the Longworth House Office Building may have released the harmful substance in the kitchen area of the cafeteria, according to the House sergeant at arms. The area was not being used for food preparation. Ten cafeteria employees were evaluated, and most were taken to hospitals with minor injuries, a Fire Department official said. A favorite of House staff members, the cafeteria will remain closed while tests are conducted. The area around the Capitol was largely empty on Friday, with Congress in recess.

title: Addressing Critics, White House Cites Diplomacy in Release of Sailors by Iran
description: WASHINGTON  The White House on Friday sought to defuse attempts by President Obamas critics to turn this weeks overnight seizure of two American patrol boats and their crews into a symbol of what they say are the administrations foreign policy failures and feckless relations with Iran.

title: Hillary and Bernie, Punching
description: Theres a Democratic debate Sunday night! The party honchos scheduled it in the middle of a three-day weekend, obviously in a bid to ensure maximum attention. The American public, perky from eight straight hours of football playoffs, will totally be in the mood for a serious policy dialogue.

title: 16-Year-Old Charged in Brooklyn Shooting Death
description: A 16-year-old has been charged with murder in the shooting death this week of a teenager near a Brooklyn school complex, the authorities said on Friday.

title: U.S. Pledges to Ease Pain of Closing Coal Mines in Shift to Cleaner Energy
description: For the past five years, President Obama has denied the Republican charge that he is waging a war on coal. On Friday, with the Obama administrations announcement that the Interior Department will halt new coal leases on public lands, Mr. Obama acknowledged that his climate change polices are hurting American miners and began offering ways to ease that economic harm.

title: The Real Problem With Lunch
description: Houston  THERES something about comparing Americas school food to the superior meals in other countries schools that we seem to enjoy, in a masochistic sort of way.

title: New England Is Abuzz (Oh, Is There a Game?)
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Last Sunday morning, Chandler Jones, the Patriots star defensive end, showed up in the parking lot of the Foxborough Police Department, inexplicably shirtless and disoriented.

title: Starvation in Syria Galvanizes U.N., but Accountability Seems Distant as Ever
description: UNITED NATIONS  The images of gaunt, hollow-eyed children in three besieged Syrian towns this week prompted even the usually cautious Ban Ki-moon to bluntly and publicly declare that the people starving civilians on the battlefield were committing war crimes.

title: In Life and on Field, Cardinals David Johnson Can Handle Traffic
description: TEMPE, Ariz.  David Johnsons first run in traffic was memorable, but not in a way that made his mother proud.

title: News Corp. and 21st Century Fox Wont Move to World Trade Center
description: News Corporation and 21st Century Fox, two media companies controlled by Rupert Murdoch, have decided against moving their headquarters into a skyscraper at the World Trade Center, the companies said on Friday.

title: After 85 Years in East Harlem, a Routine That Keeps Her Going
description: Most Tuesday mornings, Marta Benitez walks from her apartment on the corner of Fifth Avenue and 111th Street to the food pantry at St. Cecilias Church on East 105th Street. With other volunteers, she assembles bags of nonperishable items to be handed out to members of the community.

title: Mayor de Blasios Top Political Advisers Got $500,000 in 6 Months, Records Say
description: Mayor Bill de Blasios top political consultants, some of whom also represent clients with interests before City Hall, were paid about $500,000 in the last six months by the mayors campaign fund and a nonprofit group created to advance his agenda, according to financial records disclosed on Friday.

title: Venezuela Declares Emergency as Its Economy Falters
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  The Venezuelan government on Friday declared an emergency to address the countrys deteriorating economy.

title: Building Visions of Humanitys Climate Future  in Fiction and on Campus
description: Earlier this week I spoke at Arizona State University on ways to pursue a least-regrets approach to human development. My talk (building on one you can watch here) launched an interdisciplinary workshop on developing the capacity to manage the climate system in the face of relentlessly rising emissions of greenhouse gases.*

title: Sessions of Congress
description: Administrivial Heads Up For Sunday! Alert : There will be a note on some formats of the Sunday, January 17 puzzle that reads: The print version of the Sunday, January 17 puzzle contains small arrows between certain squares, which some formats cannot reproduce. We recommend using the Web version or the PDF.

title: Another Oscar Year, Another All-White Ballot
description: Is it the members who vote on the Oscars, the films, the campaigns behind them or something else?

title: Dan Haggerty, Who Played Grizzly Adams, Dies at 73
description: Dan Haggerty, who played a gentle mountain man with a luxuriant beard and a bear named Ben in the 1974 movie The Life and Times of Grizzly Adams and the NBC television series of the same name, died on Friday in Burbank, Calif. He was 73.

title: Dave Sime Dies at 79; Worlds Fastest Sprinter, but Far From Its Luckiest
description: Dr. Dave Sime, who passed up baseball and football careers to become the worlds fastest sprinter but who never won the Olympic gold medal he coveted, a victim of hard luck and the unforgiving rules of track and field, died on Wednesday in Miami Beach. He was 79.

title: Ted Cruz Apologizes to New Yorkers, Again and Again
description: TIGERVILLE, S.C.  Senator Ted Cruz of Texas stood onstage here with a mischievous smile, setting off on a stump speech he is typically loath to change.

title: At Fairfield Museum, Exploring Craftsmanship Across Centuries
description: In this era of mass-produced goods, when we can breezily purchase dishes and glassware by the set, browse for presized rugs online and build furniture by assembling kits from Ikea, its easy to take such quotidian household items for granted. But just a couple of centuries ago, the only way to create them was to fashion them by hand.

title: Walter Weissman Photographs Celebrities
description: Im a little bit like a fly on the wall, the photographer Walter Weissman was saying not long ago at Guild Hall in East Hampton, as he walked through an exhibition of his portraits of high-profile artists and other boldface names.

title: Chamber Music Society Aims to Expand Its Reach
