description: As the artistic directors of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center, David Finckel and Wu Han have expanded the groups reach over the past decade. Instead of just producing concerts at its home in Alice Tully Hall, the society produces and presents programs all over the world, from Seoul, South Korea, to Pleasant Hill, Ky.

title: Review: Rye Roadhouse Maintains Its Louisiana Charm
description: The Rye Roadhouse is a perpetual tailgate, no coolers, koozies, propane tanks, tongs or foot warmers required.

title: Review: Mazi, a Greek Taverna Refined by Time and Fire
description: Built into the bar at Mazi, a new Mediterranean restaurant in Riverhead, is a copper plaque of a phoenix rising out of the ashes. In the case of Mazi, the figure is more than a metaphor.

title: Review: Global Sensibility at the Plum and the Pear
description: America is a melting pot of cultures, and so is my food, said George Kalivas, the chef and owner of the Plum and the Pear, in Wyckoff.

title: An Ever-Changing Menu at Prospect Cafe in West Hartford
description: Goldilocks would have felt right at home at Prospect Cafe in West Hartford since its reopening four months ago.

title: Serena Williams, Rejecting Health Doubts, Insists Shes Ready
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Serena Williams has not played a meaningful match since losing in the semifinals of the United States Open in September.

title: Matt Harvey Re-Signs With Mets
description: The Mets agreed to a contract with Matt Harvey for the 2016 season, avoiding arbitration.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: Benedict Cumberbatch delivers one of the best performances of 2014 as the British mathematician Alan Turing in The Imitation Game. Six teenagers endure some vicious cyberstalking in Unfriended. And Adam Driver, the latest Star Wars baddie, hosts S.N.L.

title: Feud Adds Intrigue to Game Between Knicks and Grizzlies
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Inside their training complex on Friday, the Knicks maintained that they were more or less oblivious to the interest now surrounding their Saturday night game in Memphis, a midseason contest that did not stand out at all when the 2015-16 N.B.A. schedule was released in August.

title: Corrections: January 16, 2016
description: NEW YORK

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We may win an Oscar now and then, but an Oscar is not going to fundamentally change how Hollywood does business. Im not talking about Hollywood stars. Im talking about executives. Were not in the room.

title: Tsai Ing-wen Elected President of Taiwan, First Woman to Hold Office
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  Tsai Ing-wen was elected Taiwans president on Saturday, becoming the first woman to win the office. Voters gave her Democratic Progressive Party, which is skeptical of closer ties with China, control of Taiwans legislature for the first time, giving her broad authority to enact her policies in office.

title: How El Chapo Was Finally Captured, Again
description: MEXICO CITY  Stripped to his undershirt and covered in filth, the worlds most notorious drug lord dragged himself out of the sewers and into the middle of traffic.

title: With the Rise of Justin Trudeau, Canada Is Suddenly ... Hip?
description: Led by a handsome prime minister and artists like Drake, the Weeknd and Sarah Polley, Canada is shaking off its polite image.

title: David Bowie: Invisible New Yorker
description: About 10 years ago, the playwright John Guare got a call asking if he wanted to meet David Bowie to discuss a theater project.

title: Airing the Evidence on Dust Mites
description: Q. Does an unmade bed kill dust mites?

title: Eileen Myles, the Poet Muse of Transparent
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  Rocking a pinstriped Paul Smith suit and boots that she had picked up in Paris, Eileen Myles rolled into the Golden Globes here last weekend on the arm of her girlfriend, Jill Soloway, the creator of the Amazon series Transparent, who was outfitted in a pink tuxedo and platform sneakers. Cool? The epitome.

title: What Donald Trumps Plaza Deal Reveals About His White House Bid
description: The day Donald Trump called and asked for a one-on-one meeting in the winter of 1988, Tom Barrack was a relative newcomer to the high-stakes poker game of New York real estate. He had worked for nearly two years for Robert Bass, the Texas billionaire investor, and had played an important role in winning the Plaza Hotel for his boss the year before. Mr. Trump was the countrys most quotable and ostentatious financial celebrity, a guy with a jet, a 282-foot yacht and a fondness for peach-toned marble.

title: In Maine, Local Control Is a Luxury Fewer Towns Can Afford
description: CARY PLANTATION, Me.  Up here, near the end of Interstate 95, a single main road ridged with stately conifers runs past the odd house that at night casts an orange glow over the snow. There is no school. No police department. Not even a stoplight.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took Instagram followers from the inside of a dinosaur to Sesame Street, in Queens.

title: Corneliani: Fall 2016
description: The fall 2016 designs from Corneliani.

title: Liber8 BB-8!
description: A few months ago I was on a panel at ComicCon  hey, who knew CES utility functions would lead me down this road?  discussing Trekonomics. Manu Saadia has a fun book on the subject, focusing on the transformative powers of replicators that make anything you want, but as we discussed, what about services? My on-the-fly take was that there was a conceptual problem: if we made machines smart enough to provide all our services, wouldnt those machines effectively be people, deserving freedom from servitude?

title: Ermenegildo Zegna: Fall 2016
description: Ermenegildo Zegnas fall 2016 mens collection.

title: Oil Goes Nonlinear
description: When oil prices began their big plunge, it was widely assumed that the economic effects would be positive. Some of us were a bit skeptical. But maybe not skeptical enough: taking a global view, theres a pretty good case that the oil plunge is having a distinctly negative impact. Why?

title: Iran Frees Americans, Including Jason Rezaian, in Prisoner Swap
description: TEHRAN  Iran freed four Americans of Iranian descent from prison on Saturday, including a Marine veteran and a reporter from The Washington Post, in a delicately negotiated swap with the United States, which released seven Iranians who had been held on sanctions violations.

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: A Not-So-Basic Shift in Start-Ups
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Costume National Homme: Fall 2016
description: The fall 2016 designs from Costume National Homme.

title: Paul Giamatti Had a Busy Year of Mad Guys and Bad Hair
description: When Paul Giamatti is first seen in the new Showtime drama Billions, his character, a crusading United States attorney named Chuck Rhoades, has been bound and gagged as part of a sadomasochistic sex act. Shooting the scene last year had a curious effect on the actor. I got really sleepy and relaxed, Mr. Giamatti recently recalled over a cappuccino at the Lambs Club in Times Square. I think guys who normally get tied up have the opposite reaction. Or maybe this is why they swaddle babies?

title: Apartments That Feel Like Saunas
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: In Tehran, Iranians Play Down Milestone
description: TEHRAN  On the day that crushing international sanctions against Iran were to be lifted, state television opened its morning hourly news program with an item on childrens vaccinations. There were no flag-waving youths or cheering crowds on Tehrans streets, just the usual Saturday morning rush hour, the start of the Iranian workweek.

title: Exploring Des Moines and Beyond in Iowa
description: With the caucuses weeks away, a road trip reaffirms that our nation, beginning with Iowa, is full of unsung surprises.

title: Hawaii Baby With Brain Damage Is First U.S. Case Tied to Zika Virus
description: The first case of brain damage linked to the Zika virus within the United States was reported on Friday in Hawaii.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Dolce & Gabbana: Fall 2016
description: Dolce & Gabbanas Fall 2016 show.

title: Sgt. E. Castro: A Prison Peacemaker
description: Sgt. E. Castro, 40, is a correctional supervisor at Folsom Womens Facility in California. (Her full first name has been withheld for security reasons.)

title: Marni: Fall 2016
description: Fall 2016 looks from Marni.

title: Profiles of Saeed Abedini, Amir Hekmati and Jason Rezaian
description: Age: 39

title: Jil Sander: Fall 2016
description: Jil Sander presents looks for Fall 2016.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  You need a different kind of a mindset to decipher cryptic crossword clues. Occasionally, you might need more than one different kind of mindset.

title: The Place of Refuge in the West Village
description: Six years ago, it was decided that it would be fun to eavesdrop  with permission  on diners in the city as they sat in restaurants eating and talking. Since then, the At the Table column has covered group outings at grand hotels, holes in the wall, bistros, pizzerias, taquerias, dim sum palaces, barbecue joints, lunch counters, steakhouses, noodle shops, old classics and new finds, all in search of that ineffable combination of food, dcor and clientele that gives a restaurant a sense of place.

title: Unbeaten at Home, Warriors Are Still in Fight for a Playoff Edge
description: Off to a 37-3 start to the season entering the weekend, which had them tied for the best 40-game start in N.B.A. history, the Golden State Warriors have dominated most basketball conversations.

title: Clinton Campaign Underestimated Sanders Strengths, Allies Say
description: Advisers to Hillary Clinton, including former President Bill Clinton, believe that her campaign made serious miscalculations by forgoing early attacks on Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont and failing to undercut his archliberal message before it grew into a political movement that has now put him within striking distance of beating her in Iowa and New Hampshire.

title: In Forbes Media Sale, Five-Figure Battle Started a $100 Million War
description: Shortly after the Forbes family sold control of its magazine and publishing business in 2014, Tim Forbes held a meeting in Hong Kong with one of the new owners. Mr. Forbes, younger brother of Steve Forbes, had been trying for weeks to collect an interest payment from the buyers. But in the October meeting, Mr. Forbes said his family had waited long enough for the $46,000 payment. The refusal to pay, he said, was a disrespect to my family and disrespect to me personally.

title: TINA and the ACA
description: Lucy just snatched the football away, again. Republicans assured us that this year they really would, seriously, roll out their alternative to Obamacare. Or, maybe, not.

title: Whats Harder Than Renting a Car? Filing a Complaint
description: This jam-packed episode contains both a Haggler intervention and a head-scratcher of a mystery. That is called value, dear readers. The mystery, for those who cant stand suspense, will turn up at the end of the column, and a bit like Stonehenge and the career of Nicolas Cage, it will remain a mystery.

title: Bernie Sanderss Vision Makes Hillary Clinton Camp See Red
The Unluckiest Captain in China
description: Mayday. Mayday. Mayday. Call sign Alfa Bravo Charlie Delta. Mayday, Pacific Ocean. I am on fire in No. 4 hold and have dangerous goods on foredeck. It is a Wednesday morning in Guangzhou, China, and in a recording studio on the 22nd floor of a Zhujiang New Town skyscraper, terrible things are happening to ships.

title: Singers Apology for Waving Taiwan Flag Stirs Backlash of Its Own
description: BEIJING  A teenage singer made headlines in China and on her home island of Taiwan this weekend, but not for the winsome K-pop music that she hoped would attract fans. Instead, a glum, shaken apology after a controversy over a flag landed the singer, Chou Tzu-yu, in the maw of tensions between China and Taiwan, just as the island voted to elect an independence-leaning president on Saturday.

title: ChrisDaviss Deal With Orioles KeepsYoenis Cespedes in Play for Mets
description: The Baltimore Orioles have agreed to contract terms with Chris Davis, a development that gives the Mets a little more hope that they can sign Yoenis Cespedes to a short-term deal.

title: Neil Barrett: Fall 2016
description: The latest designs from Neil Barrett.

title: Ted Cruz Goes on Multipronged Attack Against Donald Trump
description: FORT MILL, S.C.  Disparaging Donald J. Trumps temperament, questioning his beliefs and even knocking his polling numbers, Senator Ted Cruz of Texas laid into Mr. Trump in earnest on Saturday and abandoned any reluctance to take on his popular Republican rival.

title: Prominent Jeb Bush Donor Questions Super PAC Strategist Over Negative Marco Rubio Ads
description: A prominent donor to Jeb Bush pressed the chief strategist of the super PAC supporting Mr. Bush over the groups negative ads about Senator Marco Rubio during a closed-door meeting in Manhattan on Friday, according to three people familiar with the encounter.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: On Making College Sports Explicitly, Unabashedly Professional

title: Soviet Star Defensemans Latest Turn
description: SOMERSET, N.J.  When Craig Romanok learned of his son Claytons new high school hockey coach this fall, he made Clayton, a goaltender on the team, sit down to watch Red Army, a documentary on the famed Soviet hockey team of the Cold War era. Romanok wanted to ensure that his son had the proper appreciation for the man who is now his coach.

title: Deadly Standoff Leaves Burkina Faso Stunned
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso  Terror came to this sleepy city this weekend, as armed fighters descended on a road nicknamed the Champs-lyses, where friends meet for coffee and foreigners relax in a familiar hotel. After a 15-hour siege, the assailants left behind more than the dead and wounded scattered across the charred road amid shell casings.

title: The Founders Intent
How Measurement Fails Doctors and Teachers
description: TWO of our most vital industries, health care and education, have become increasingly subjected to metrics and measurements. Of course, we need to hold professionals accountable. But the focus on numbers has gone too far. Were hitting the targets, but missing the point.

title: When Anger Trumped Progress
description: JOHN YOUNG was born into slavery, on July 4, 1855. By 15 he was a free man and an electrifying orator, recruiting black voters around his native South Carolina to the Republican Party with pyrotechnical rhetoric and mustache-waggling jokes. In the late 1860s, it looked as if he might help his party make real change in the post-Civil War South.

title: The Man Who Fell From Fame
description: BRETT SMILEY was no David Bowie.

title: Rocco Casagrande
description: Rocco Casagrande, a former United Nations biological weapons inspector, is managing director of Gryphon Scientific, a consulting company that last week delivered a federally commissioned report identifying the risks and benefits of allowing research that could make certain viruses, like influenza, SARS or MERS, more dangerous.

title: Why I Taught Myself to Procrastinate
description: NORMALLY, I would have finished this column weeks ago. But I kept putting it off because my New Years resolution is to procrastinate more.

title: Donald Trumps Existential Pickle
description: IF your very candidacy and identity rest on your supposed talent for victory, can you survive a defeat?

title: Cancer and Climate Change
description: IM a climate scientist who has just been told I have Stage 4 pancreatic cancer.

title: Some Inconvenient Gun Facts for Liberals
description: FOR those of us who argue in favor of gun safety laws, there are a few inconvenient facts.

title: Hallelujah College
description: LAST fall, as student activists around the country protested racism on their campuses, Senator Ted Cruz of Texas dismissed secular universities as havens for leftist, coddled kids. The protests proved that these schools teem with psychotic Marxists, declared The Daily Caller, a conservative website.

title: The Destruction of Progressive Wisconsin
description: SHORTLY after his exit from an abbreviated presidential run last fall, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin returned to a more successful undertaking: dismantling what remains of his states century-old progressive legacy.

title: The Bill Clinton Question
A Picassos Economics Lesson
description: QATAR, it seems, was gazumped.

title: Reigning Cats and Dogs
description: WASHINGTON  AFTER running as a man last time around, Hillary Clinton is now running as a woman.

title: After Losing a Daughter, Mustering Strength for 3 Who Remain
description: She called them her four M&Ms: Meghan and Mishelle, Makayla and Mya, each born a year apart, a tribe of sisters who walked in lock step and looked after each other when they got sick.

title: C. D. Wright, Poet of Ozarks and Beyond, Dies at 67
description: C. D. Wright, a MacArthur fellowship-winning poet whose work  characterized by linguistic experimentation, stylistic innovation and an ever-shifting thematic canvas  was rooted in her Southern heritage yet, at the same time, utterly beyond category, died this week at her home in Barrington, R.I. She was 67.

title: Maria Teresa de Filippis, Pioneer of Auto Racing, Dies at 89
description: Maria Teresa de Filippis, who in the late 1950s became the first woman to compete in Formula 1 world championship grands prix, widely regarded as the pinnacle of automobile racing, died on Jan. 9. She was 89.

title: With Triple Crown Winner at Last, Sport Aims to Ride the Momentum
description: HALLANDALE BEACH, Fla.  As racing prepared for a widely expected coronation of American Pharoah, the first Triple Crown winner in 37 years, as its horse of the year during ceremonies at Gulfstream Park on Saturday night, the industry recognized the need to build on the enormous lift he provided.

title: Operating on a Shoestring, Ireland Struggles to Develop First-Rate Tennis Players
description: More than 40 nations will be represented at the Australian Open, which begins Monday, more evidence of how truly global tennis has become.

title: The Death Penalty Endgame
description: How does the death penalty in America end?

title: Leonid Zhabotinsky, Strongman for the Ages, Dies at 77
description: Leonid Zhabotinsky, a record-breaking Ukrainian-born Soviet weight lifter who picked up Olympic gold medals in 1964 and 1968 and was Arnold Schwarzeneggers teenage idol, died on Thursday in Zaporozhye, Ukraine. He was 77.

title: When Oil-Rich Countries Need More Cash
description: The long slide in oil prices, which reached a 13-year low this week of less than $30 a barrel, means that oil-rich nations are not so rich anymore. And that is potentially a big problem for investors and policy makers in the United States and abroad.

title: Keep Guns Away From Abusers
description: While the gun violence debate often focuses on mass shootings of strangers,  hundreds of Americans are fatally shot every year by spouses or partners. In 2013, 61 percent of women killed with guns were killed by husbands, ex-husbands or boyfriends. And in 57 percent of shootings in which four or more people were killed, one of the victims was the shooters partner or family member, according to an analysis by the group Everytown for Gun Safety.

title: Broncos Movie Buff Harris Has Been Stealing the Show From Opposing Receivers
description: ENGLEWOOD, Colo.  The Oscar nominations came rolling in last week, and that afforded Chris Harris Jr., the Denver Broncos resident cinephile, an opportunity to handicap the race for best picture. Of the eight films nominated, he had seen most, including The Revenant (bloody but good), Bridge of Spies (fantastic) and Spotlight, his pick to win  though he reserved the right to change his mind, he said, after viewing them all.

title: Linebacker Luke Kuechly Quietly Leads a Brash Panthers Defense
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  A flashy new sign appeared in the Carolina Panthers locker room last week, pasted above the section where the defensive backs store their gear. It has gradations of pale blue and white and declares that the area is Thieves Ave.

title: Pal Zileri : Fall 2016
description: Pal Zileris Fall 2016 show.

title: Iran Complies With Nuclear Deal; Sanctions Are Lifted
description: VIENNA  The United States and European nations lifted oil and financial sanctions on Iran on Saturday and released roughly $100 billion of its assets after international inspectors concluded that the country had followed through on promises to dismantle large sections of its nuclear program.

title: With Iran Nuclear Deal Implemented, What Happens Next?
description: The International Atomic Energy Agency declared Saturday that Iran had fulfilled requirements to limit its nuclear activities, a step that automatically lifted nuclear-related economic sanctions imposed by the United Nations, European Union and United States. The move freed Iran to sell much more oil and gain control of roughly $100 billion in impounded money, ending a prolonged isolation that has driven the country into a deep economic malaise.

title: Versace: Fall 2016
description: The Fall 2016 mens collection from Versace.

title: Alabama Players Misfortunes Typify Pitfalls of College Sports
description: I first heard the name Altee Tenpenny about 10 years ago.

title: Maryland Takes Out Frustrations on Ohio State
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md.  No. 3 Maryland went into its practice Thursday bruised from Tuesdays 70-67 loss at Michigan, just its second defeat of the season. The team proceeded to have at it.

title: Twisting Ones Words
description: Administrivial Heads Up! Alert : There will be a note on some formats of todays puzzle that reads: The print version of the Sunday, January 17 puzzle contains small arrows between certain squares, which some formats cannot reproduce. We recommend using the Web version or the PDF.

title: Flamboyant Egyptian Politician Craves Public Eye
description: CAIRO  Mortada Mansour, a pugnacious Egyptian politician, likes to boast that he beats his rivals with his shoe so much, in fact, that he has lost count of the number of disputes he has settled in that manner. I ran out of shoes, said Mr. Mansour, who once spent time in jail for insulting a judge.

title: Huffington Post and CNN Waited to Report U.S.-Iran Prisoner-Swap Negotiations
description: Two news organizations have acknowledged that they knew about the negotiations between the United States and Iran over a prisoner exchange that included a Washington Post reporter before the arrangement was announced. But they chose not to publish information about the talks.

title: Standoff in Oregon Attracts Supporters Bearing Disparate Grievances
description: One of the people who have joined the Bundy family on a federal wildlife sanctuary in an arid patch of Oregon is an avowed anti-Semite from Ohio. One is an anti-Islamic ideologue from Phoenix.

title: On Paper, Italy Allows Abortions, but Few Doctors Will Perform Them
description: ASCOLI PICENO, Italy  After Benedetta, 35, found out 11 weeks into her pregnancy that the baby she wanted with all myself had extremely serious genetic problems, she made a painful decision, and asked her longtime gynecologist for an abortion.

title: New Guidelines Nudge Doctors to Give Patients Access to Medical Records
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is tearing down barriers that make it difficult for patients to get access to their own medical records, telling doctors and hospitals that in most cases they must provide copies of these records within 30 days of receiving a request.

title: Before Debris Collapse in China, Safety Fears Were Discussed
description: SHENZHEN, China  Four days before a mountain of dirt and debris collapsed here, killing at least 69 people, the government agency in charge of the construction dump convened a meeting to discuss safety concerns. In attendance were representatives of the company with the contract to manage the site and the independent engineering firm paid to monitor its work.

title: Virginia Man Is Accused of Trying to Join ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department charged two Virginia men on Saturday with terrorism-related offenses, one day after F.B.I. agents arrested one of them at an airport where officials believe he was planning to begin a journey to Syria to fight with the Islamic State.

title: Patriots Methodically Clear First Hurdle
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Two days before the first anniversary of the game that spawned a polemic controversy over deflated footballs, the New England Patriots and their fans gathered for the first playoff game since that contretemps shrouded the franchise for nearly nine months. The atmosphere was festive, with the home side clearly happy to host another mid-January postseason game. But there was also an edge in the air.

title: I.A.E.A. Report on Irans Nuclear Program
description: The agency found that Iran has complied with the accord reached last summer and has dismantled large sections of its nuclear program.

title: Taiwans New Leader Faces a Weak Economy and Chinas Might
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  Before Tsai Ing-wen felt the thrill of victory on Saturday by becoming the first woman to be elected president of Taiwan, she was no stranger to the sting of defeat.

title: Donald Trump Gets Personal in Attacks on Ted Cruz at Tea Party Convention
description: MYRTLE BEACH, S.C.  He told war stories about his old construction sites. He promised to build a beautiful Trump Wall along the border with Mexico. He poked some fun at Jeb Bush, saying that embracing his family name could do little to harm his low-polling campaign.

title: Manners Fit Jeb Bush, if Not an Uncouth Race
description: DERRY, N.H.  Tennis. Boating. Summers at Walkers Point.

title: For Broadcast of Super Bowl I, NFL Network Picks Excess Over Tact
description: Those of us who love the unearthing of old relics of sports television were excited by the NFL Films reconstruction of Super Bowl I. Every play was found in the NFL Films archive and stitched together for Friday nights presentation on NFL Network, which would have stood well on its own for a 90-minute broadcast, with added graphics, factoids and interviews spread out before, after or during breaks.

title: Bernie Sanders, Under Attack on 2005 Gun Vote, Says He Will Support Bill Rolling It Back
description: Senator Bernie Sanders announced on Saturday that he is supporting legislation to amend a 2005 law on gunmakers liability that he voted for and that Hillary Clinton has been using to attack him as weak on gun regulations.

title: Drug Overdoses Propel Rise in Mortality Rates of Young Whites
description: Drug overdoses are driving up the death rate of young white adults in the United States to levels not seen since the end of the AIDS epidemic more than two decades ago  a turn of fortune that stands in sharp contrast to falling death rates for young blacks, a New York Times analysis of death certificates has found.

title: After Forwards Strong Words Feed Rivalry, Grizzlies Earn Anticlimactic Win
description: MEMPHIS  Matt Barnes approached the scorers table midway through the first quarter, and the crowd at FedEx Forum erupted. Barnes was simply checking into Saturday nights game for the Memphis Grizzlies, but given his sordid history with the man standing no more than 15 feet away, in front of the opposing bench, it felt like so much more.

title: Cardinals Survive, Ending Carson Palmers Drought
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  Like his signature deep throws, quarterback Carson Palmers football rsum covers a lot of ground: two high school championships, one Heisman Trophy and five 4,000-yard passing seasons for three N.F.L. teams. But Palmers professional career had called to mind a long drive that peters out inside the red zone.

title: Among the Captives Freed by Iran, a U.S. Researcher Held for 40 Days
description: A researcher from Massachusetts who was in Iran to study Farsi was allowed to leave the country after more than a months detention, his family and the State Department said on Saturday.

title: Rachel Rosenblatt, John Bone
description: Rachel Linne Rosenblatt and John Hunter Bone are to be married Jan. 17 by Rabbi Rachel Steiner at the University Club in New York.

title: Hannah Gursky, William Theodat
description: Hannah Elizabeth Gursky and William Yee Theodat were married Jan. 16 at the Ashford Estate in Allentown, N.J. Philip S. Carchman, a retired New Jersey Superior Court judge, officiated.

title: Rena Fischler, Michael Jacobs
description: Rena Fischler and Michael Gilad Jacobs are to be married Jan. 17 by Rabbi Avi Weiss at the Angel Orensanz Foundation, an events space in Manhattan.

title: Tracey Atlas, Matthew Harrison
description: Tracey Jane Atlas, the daughter of Nancy Seligman Atlas of Boston, was married Jan. 16 to Matthew Charles Harrison, a son of Pamela S. Harrison and Thomas L. Harrison of Armonk, N.Y. Rabbi Dr. Ronald B. Sobel officiated at the Plaza Hotel in Manhattan.

title: Micaela Roberts, Daniel Morrison
description: Micaela Lee Roberts and Daniel Patrick Morrison were married Jan. 16 at Lighthouse Restaurant in Brooklyn. Joanna Vaught, a cousin of the groom who is a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Miriam Fischer, Eric Wachter
description: Dr. Miriam Ruth Fischer and Eric Marshall Wachter are to be married on Jan. 17 at the Willard InterContinental Hotel in Washington. Rabbi Jack L. Moline is to officiate.

title: Melissa Goldberg, Evan Mintz
description: Melissa Gayle Goldberg, the daughter of Carol C. Goldberg and Michael S. Goldberg of Houston, is to be married there Jan. 17 to Evan Irwin Mintz, a son of Lauren D. Mintz and Jordan H. Mintz, also of Houston. Rabbi Ranon Teller is to officiate at the Corinthian, an event space.

title: Carisa Jackson, John Hansbury
description: Carisa Lynne Jackson and John Walter Hansbury were married Jan. 16. Judge John B. Hansbury of White Plains City Court in White Plains, who is a cousin of the groom, officiated at Bills Food & Drink, a restaurant in New York.

title: Once Smitten Teenagers, Now Spouses
description: Giuliana Farrell Galant, a daughter of Dana L. Mark and Jeffrey A. Galant of New York, was married Jan. 16 to James Simon Beall, a son of Sandra L. Klihr-Beall and John W. Beall, also of New York. Christopher Shelley, who was ordained as a minister of the Universal Brotherhood Movement, officiated at the Lotos Club in New York.

title: Emily Parker, Jonathan Ivers
description: Emily Kathleen Parker and Jonathan Joseph Ivers were married Jan. 16 at Church of the Resurrection in Rye, N.Y. The Rev. Joseph Lim, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Kathleen Webb, Alexander Mattielli
description: Kathleen Meredith Webb and Alexander Louis Mattielli were married Jan. 16 at the Roman Catholic Parish of Guardian Angel/St. Columba in New York by the Rev. James Hauver, who is the churchs pastor.

title: Jillian Rudnitzky, Daniel Brand
description: Jillian Shira Rudnitzky, a daughter of Sandra F. Rudnitzky and Dr. Elliot M. Rudnitzky of Edison, N.J., is to be married Jan. 17 to Daniel Alexander Brand, a son of Dr. Rena S. Brand and a stepson of Dr. Philip Orbuch of New York. Rabbi Yosef Carlebach is to officiate at the Mandarin Oriental in New York.

title: Nina Wainwright, Nathan Strauss
description: Nina Walker Wainwright, the daughter of Alice Baldridge Wainwright and Delos Walker Wainwright of East Hampton, N.Y., was married Jan. 16 to Nathan Charles McCray Strauss, the son of Karen J. McCray and Michael Strauss of St. Louis. Rabbi Susan Talve officiated at Maidstone Club in East Hampton, with the Very Rev. Denis Brunelle, an Episcopal priest, taking part.

title: Annette Georgia, Michael Kolber
description: Annette Alexis Georgia and Michael Strauss Kolber were married Jan. 14 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Edwina M. Townes, a staff member of the New York City Clerks office, officiated.

title: Sasha Silver, Charlie Moran
description: Sasha Jacqueline Silver, the daughter of Lienna Silver and Jeffrey D. Silver of Los Angeles, is to be married Jan. 17 to Charlie Francis Moran, a son of Dianne R. Moran and Charlie R. Moran of Naperville, Ill. Peter G. Moran, the grooms brother, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, is to officiate at Millwick, an events space in Los Angeles. Max I. Silver, the brides brother, is to take part, leading the couple in their exchange of vows and wedding rings.

title: Rachel Spencer, Justin Turetsky
description: Rachel Anna Spencer and Justin Ross Turetsky are to be married Jan. 17 at the Yale Club in New York. Rabbi Marc Mandel is to officiate.

title: Richard Elliott, Kevin Tobia
description: Richard James Elliott and Kevin Patrick Tobia were married Jan. 11 at the United States District Court in Newark, where Joseph A. Dickson, a magistrate judge with that court, officiated.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Turn Focus to South Carolina, Courting Black Leaders
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Senator Bernie Sanders talked about the seemingly endless stream of tragedies in black communities from clashes with the police, while Hillary Clinton sought to closely align herself to President Obama, as the two Democratic candidates worked to woo black leaders ahead of this states Feb. 27 primary contest.

title: American Missionary Among the Dead in Burkina Faso Siege
description: Qaeda militants killed one American in an attack on two hotels and a cafe in the capital of Burkina Faso that left at least 28 people dead and 56 injured on Friday and Saturday, the State Department said on Saturday night.

title: Assailants Yell ISIS! ISIS! During Attack on Man in Bronx, Police Say
description: A man wearing traditional South Asian clothing was attacked by two men shouting ISIS! ISIS! as he walked near a school in the Bronx on Saturday night, the police said.

title: Corrections: January 17, 2016
description: ARTS & LEISURE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: There are large numbers of people who never get established in the economy, who live outside family relationships and are on the edge of poverty.

title: She Plays Hillary Clinton as Bernie Sanders Prepares to Debate
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  The debate moderator looked at the woman in a dark pantsuit standing beside Senator Bernie Sanders and said, Secretary Clinton, well give you one minute for an opening statement.

title: Indebted Chinese Companies Increase Pressures on Government
description: HONG KONG  Sainty Marine Corporation started small, buying and selling a few ships in the 1980s. But Sainty Marine, a Chinese state-owned company, went on a debt-fueled binge over the last few years, opening its own shipyards and signing orders worth hundreds of millions of dollars each.

title: Suicide Attack Kills at Least 13 in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A suicide bomber struck the home of a tribal elder in the eastern Afghan city of Jalalabad Sunday morning, killing at least 13 people, an official said. It was the latest attack in the increasingly volatile Nangarhar Province.

title: Bottega Veneta: Fall 2016
description: The latest designs from Bottega Veneta.

title: A Daughter Too Kind for Her Own Good
description: Mommy, I was kind to her like you told me to be and she was still rude, my daughter told me from the back seat of the car. She even laughed before walking away.

title: 1941: Relief Director Tells Plight of Jews in Europe
description: The miserable conditions of Jews in Nazi-dominated Europe were described yesterday by Morris C. Troper, chairman of the European executive council of the Joint Distribution Committee, an American Jewish organization engaged in relief for Jews throughout the world. Mr. Troper recently returned to the United States from Lisbon where he supervised European relief work. In an interview at the offices of the committee, 100 East Forty-second Street, Mr. Troper said that 1,500,000 Jews were absolutely destitute in Poland and many of them were living in walled-up ghettos which they were not allowed to leave even during the day.

title: 1966: Nigerian Rebels Surrender
description: LAGOS  The leader of Nigerias bloody weekend uprising today [Jan. 17] surrendered his forces to the West African republics new military ruler, Maj. Gen. Johnson Aguiyi Ironsi. The peaceful surrender appeared to end the threat of further violence in the country and consolidated Gen. Ironsis position as the new strongman of Nigeria. When dissident Nigerian Army leaders rebelled Saturday, the countrys civilian government handed over administration of the country to Gen. Ironsi.

title: Salvatore Ferragamo: Fall 2016
description: Fall 2016 mens wear designs from Salvatore Ferragamo.

title: 3 Freed Americans Leave Iran; U.S. Places New Sanctions
description: VIENNA  With three Americans long held in Iran flying to Europe on Sunday, President Obama urged young Iranians to pursue a new path with the West as he imposed modest new sanctions on the country for banned missile tests.

title: Calvin Klein Collection: Fall 2016
description: Fall 2016 designs from the Calvin Klein Collection.

title: In Milan, Ermenegildo Zegna and Ralph Lauren Zero In on the One Percent
description: MILAN  Horizontal is not the only direction for market expansion in the rag trade. Increasingly, designer ambitions are turning vertical. Considered in global terms, the population of the One Percent amounts to a nationality of its own, a new reality duly reflected in Stefano Pilatis Ermenegildo Zegna collection for men, titled Ermenegildo Zegna Couture.

title: For Italian Men, a Return to Elegance
description: It was vulgarity and not elegance that ruled the day in Italy when Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi was simultaneously running the country and staging bunga bunga bacchanals. Mr. Berlusconi was hell on traditional Italian cultural values, his years in office a prolonged populist takedown of the high-minded intellectual and aesthetic achievements that defined Italian architecture, art, industrial design and, not least, its fashion for much of the 20th century.

title: Theatergoers, Desperate to See Hamilton, Fall Prey to Ticket Forgers
description: Jason arranged to meet the seller on a Manhattan street corner on Dec. 31. He bought two tickets for $600 as an anniversary gift for his wife. Youre going to love the show, the seller told him. Its as good as everyone says.

title: Letters and Numbers: A Watch's Typeface
description: Brands know that well-chosen fonts can do much to convey the style of a timepiece.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Missoni: Fall 2016
description: The fall 2016 designs from Missoni.

title: How to Watch the Democratic Debate
description: We provided real-time analysis of the fourth Democratic debate and live fact checks.

title: Short Answers to Hard Questions About Zika Virus
description: Why scientists are worried about the growing epidemic and its effects on pregnant women, and how to avoid the infection.

title: Details of 7 Iranians Granted Clemency in Prisoner Swap
description: WASHINGTON  One was an aerospace expert convicted of helping Iran launch its first satellite into space. Another was a maritime engineer found guilty of providing navigation technology to the Iranians. And three men had ties to a company accused of illegally exporting millions of dollars in American technology with military applications to Iran.

title: At the Ready as New Yorkers Got Unbundled
description: Not at all, Nina Rochelle said, right off.

title: In Milan, Mens Shows Reference Couture  and Space Travel
description: Zegnas fall/winter 2016 show explored excessive embellishment, while Donatella Versace focused her collection around pioneers of the future.

title: Netanyahu Asserts Israel Will Be Irans Watchdog
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel warned on Sunday that his nation would ensure that Tehran never obtains nuclear weapons, while also taking credit for keeping Iran from already having them.

title: European Antitrust Chief Takes Swipe at Privacy Issue
description: MUNICH  Margrethe Vestager, the European Unions antitrust chief, warned on Sunday that the collection of a vast amount of users data by a small number of tech companies like Google and Facebook could be in violation of the regions tough competition rules.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Rashida Jones cuts up in Angie Tribeca, the new cop farce from Steve and Nancy Carell. Damian Lewis and Paul Giamatti spar as a hedge-fund titan and his nemesis in Billions. And PBS unveils Mercy Street, the Downton Abbey heir apparent.

title: Republican Candidates Assail Iran Agreements
description: News of the diplomatic thaw with Iran provided the Republican presidential candidates with more fodder to attack both President Obama and Hillary Clinton over the weekend on the campaign trail and on Sunday talk shows.

title: Peggy Anderson, Chronicler of the Nursing Profession, Dies at 77
description: Peggy Anderson, who never wanted to become a nurse, like her mother, but wrote a best-selling book to correct stereotypes about the profession, died on Sunday in Philadelphia. She was 77.

title: Ride Along 2 Is No. 1 at Box Office
description: Amid outrage over a lack of diversity among Oscar nominees, Ride Along 2, aimed squarely at black and Hispanic moviegoers, arrived to a robust $34 million in weekend ticket sales. Meanwhile, ticket sales for Michael Bays politically divisive 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi were on the soft side.

title: State of Emergency Declared Over Man-Made Water Disaster in Michigan City
description: President Obama has declared a state of emergency in response to the water crisis in Flint, Mich., where thousands of residents have been exposed to toxic amounts of lead.

title: Verbatim: Debbie Wasserman Schultz Says Democratic Debate Schedule Was Intended to Maximize Exposure to Voters
description: Representative Debbie Wasserman Schultz of Florida, the chairwoman of the Democratic National Committee, responding on CNN to criticism from some in her party that the Democratic debate schedule, which has included weekend forums, gives an advantage to Hillary Clinton.

title: Prada: Fall 2016
description: The Fall 2016 mens collection from Prada.

title: Netflixs Expansion Attracts Some Unexpected Customers
description: MUNICH  Just hours after Reed Hastings announced this month that Netflix, the video-streaming service that he co-founded, would become available in 190 countries, he got an unexpected surprise.

title: David Bowie Hits No. 1 on Billboard Chart with Blackstar, a First
description: David Bowies death has brought the legendary rocker a trophy he never had in life: a No. 1 album on the American chart.

title: As Track Atones, Some Athletes Seek More Than an Apology
description: There have been many doping scandals, too many, but if allegations about the demanding and extorting of bribes to cover up test results are true, track and fields former leader Lamine Diack and his minions and relations took the category to a new level of low by corrupting from the top.

title: Tracy Morgan to Star in Television Pilot for FX
description: Tracy Morgan is returning to television. The actor, who suffered severe injuries in a car crash in 2014, will star in an unnamed pilot for FX. This half-hour comedy will be written by Jordan Peele (Key & Peele) and John Carcieri (Eastbound & Down).

title: Damir Doma: Fall 2016
description: Damir Doma presents looks for Fall 2016.

title: Zika Warning Spotlights Latin Americas Fight Against Mosquito-Borne Diseases
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  In the campaign against mosquitoes, Brazil has deployed soldiers to destroy habitats where the insects thrive. Colombia is releasing swarms of mosquitoes treated with bacteria that limit their capacity to spread disease. Mexico is testing the first vaccine against dengue fever, a mosquito-borne virus raging throughout the region.

title: A Closer Look at Campaign Tax Promises
description: Two certainties, as Benjamin Franklin wrote, are death and taxes. Add a third: On taxes, American presidential candidates often promise more than they can deliver. And, if elected, they may pay a price.

title: Panthers Build a Big First-Half Lead, Then Outlast the Seahawks
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  As the Carolina Panthers ran roughshod over the N.F.L. this season, finishing a league-best 15-1, questions lingered. Sure, quarterback Cam Newton was performing like a most valuable player and the teams defense was among the leagues best, but the Panthers also had one of the easiest schedules, and they barely escaped with wins against teams like the New Orleans Saints and the Giants, who had losing records.

title: For Now, Self-Driving Cars Still Need Humans
description: SUNNYVALE, Calif.  Car enthusiasts, after hearing industry executives discussing the self-driving technology being built into their vehicles, might be forgiven for thinking robotic cars will soon drive themselves out of auto showrooms.

title: A Safer World, Thanks to the Iran Deal
description: This is a moment many thought would never come: Iran has delivered on its commitment under a 2015 agreement with the United States and other major powers to curb or eliminate the most dangerous elements of its nuclear program. The world is now safer for this.

title: Education Technology Graduates From the Classroom to the Boardroom
description: Judging by the number of learning apps available to classrooms around the country, the education technology market aimed at elementary through high schools is booming.

title: Die Hard Conservatives
description: Oh, my:

title: Richard G. Hendrickson, Who Recorded the Weather for 85 Years, Dies at 103
description: Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night could stay Richard G. Hendrickson from the swift completion of his appointed rounds. For 85 years, they were his appointed rounds.

title: Satellite Tracking Rising Seas Launches Successfully
description: A satellite to measure the heights of the oceans was launched successfully on Sunday from Vandenberg Air Force Base in California.

title: Review: In Excavation Site: Martha Graham U.S.A., a Bond Is Shared
description: To Michael Klin, choreography is more than a dance on a stage, but something akin to an archaeological dig. In Excavation Site: Martha Graham U.S.A., that Austrian choreographer, with the dramaturge Steve Valk, organized a one-time event as part of the Coil festival in which 24 dancers  all but one associated with the Martha Graham Dance Company  investigated their shared bond with that luminary of modern dance.

title: Review: In In Quietness, a High-Powered Wife Makes Sacrifices for Her Husbands Religious Zeal
description: In Anna Moenchs promising, frustrating In Quietness, produced by Dutch Kills at Walkerspace, a high-flying consultant leaves her job, her friends and her urban life to follow her husband to a seminary. At the outset of the play, Max (Kate MacCluggage) is burning up the frequent-flier miles and piling up the bonuses when she arrives home to find her husband, Paul (Blake DeLong), sitting in the dark. He confesses to an affair with a woman in his weekly Bible study group, relating that an accident has now left her in the hospital, unresponsive.

title: Horizon Events, Inspired by the Parameters of a PS1 Gallery
description: Because Rashaun Mitchell and Silas Riener are superlative dancers, a dancegoer wants them only to appear in work worthy of them, or in choreography thats at least remotely important. In their most recent show  the premiere performances of Horizon Events, on Friday through Sunday at MoMA PS1 in Long Island City, Queens  they gave mere glimpses of what they and their five companion dancers can do.

title: Review: With Two Star Lutenists, Boston Early Music Festival Comes to the Morgan
description: The Boston Early Music Festival traveled light for its latest concert at the Morgan Library & Museum on Friday evening, The program, For Two Lutes, offered just two performers playing easily portable instruments: the stellar and widely recorded lutenists Paul ODette (an artistic director of the festival) and Ronn McFarlane.

title: Patriots Winning Philosophy: Keep the Focus on Winning
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  After the Patriots 27-20 victory Saturday over the previously scorching Kansas City Chiefs, New Englands coach, Bill Belichick, was asked how he felt about sharing a piece of football history: The Patriots, like the Oakland Raiders from 1973 to 1977, were headed to their fifth consecutive A.F.C. championship game.

title: Review: Rockapella Sings Nostalgic a Cappella at Feinsteins/54 Below
description: What is it about a cappella pop groups that makes their spirit so playful? As Rockapella, an influential ensemble since the early 1990s, performed a sleek set of oldies at Feinsteins/54 Below on Friday, the show became the musical equivalent of watching the members of a basketball team happily toss a ball around. Camaraderie and comedy go together; theres something essentially lighthearted about human voices imitating instruments.

title: Narrowing a Gap in the Sci-Fi Universe: One Fangirl Giving a Voice to Others
description: Ashley Eckstein, a self-described sci-fi fangirl, believes women like her are often overlooked. So several years ago she started a company to sell apparel featuring brands like Doctor Who, Star Trek and Star Wars to other fangirls. Now, believing those same women need a voice, she is expanding into publishing.

title: Composers Collectives Offer Creativity and Challenges
description: The cellist Ashley Bathgate took her bow at Le Poisson Rouge last Tuesday after the premiere of Ash, an evening-long work inspired by Bachs six suites for solo cello. Then she squinted into the dimmed nightclub and made the usual hand motion of a performer beckoning the composer to share in the applause.

title: Cartoon: Heng on North Koreas Nuclear Testing
description: The latest nuclear test by North Korea earlier this month drew swift condemnation from the United Nations Security Council.

title: Review: 19-2, a Police Drama on Acorn TV, Is a Slow Burn
description: To watch 19-2 is to be reminded that there is more than one way to pace a police drama. This Canadian series, which becomes available on the streaming service Acorn beginning Monday, is a slow burn, and its pacing isnt the only thing that defies expectations.

title: At Art Students League, Air Rights and Airing Grievances
description: One can only imagine the debates that have flared up through the decades at the Art Students League, a 140-year-old nonprofit school on West 57th Street that counts Winslow Homer, Norman Rockwell, Georgia OKeeffe and Mark Rothko among its alumni.

title: Hail, Caesar! Explores the World of the Hollywood Fixer
description: LOS ANGELES  The stories begin. The stories end. But the work of Eddie Mannix will never end.

title: Review: In The Narrow Door, Paul Lisicky Opens a Window on Friendship
description: Almost all of us have friends who dont submit easily to categorization. Theyre our lifes towering originals, the difficult ones who infuriate us and exhilarate us in equal measure. And if we met them in our late adolescence or early adulthood, forget it  their significance is almost indescribable. We were still jelly in those years. Quivering, impressionable. How on earth to convey their outsize influence, the overlarge hand they had in molding who we became?

title: Moncler Gamme Bleu: Fall 2016
description: Moncler Gamme Bleus Fall 2016 show.

title: Review: Cramming War & Peace Into a Mini-Series
description: Interviewer: Ill be frank: Youre a bit older than most of the applicants. Start by telling me what qualifies you for the job of 21st-century TV scriptwriter.

title: Sublime Physical Performance
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Kathy Wienberg appears to be making her New York Times debut today, so lets welcome her. One of the things I really liked about her puzzle is that even though I didnt have to turn any real handsprings to solve it, it kept its theme secret from me until I got to the revealer at 49 Across. And when the penny finally dropped, I laughed out loud. Thats rare for a Monday puzzle.

title: NYC Winter Jazzfest Marathon
description: Scenes from this years festival.

title: At NYC Winter Jazzfest Marathon, New Faces Make Their Mark at Grooving Places
description: NYC Winter Jazzfest began in 2005 as a showcase, a way for arts presenters and music bookers to scope out artists for their coming seasons. The festival has outgrown that strict purpose, becoming a summit and a smorgasbord, a consolidation of talent from every tier of prominence. The options this year included two nights of artists from the ECM Records roster, performing in the handsome new 800-seat Tishman Auditorium at the New School: a distinctly aboveground setting, and a powerful lure for anyone in search of proven quality.

title: Hot Sets and Warm Chilly Nights at NYC Winter Jazzfest Marathon
description: One of the breakout stars of this years NYC Winter Jazzfest Marathon was a piano, or the combination of a piano and a room.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Jan. 18
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing includes the regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills, which will be held Tuesday as the markets will be closed Monday for Martin Luther Kings Birthday. The regular four-week bill auction will be moved to Wednesday.

title: Bernie Sanders Supporters Invoke Martin Luther King Jr.
description: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C.  On the eve of Martin Luther Kings Birthday, three black supporters of Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont sought to present his stances on race and the economy as the heir to the legacy of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: 3 Americans Are Missing in Baghdad, Embassy Says
description: BAGHDAD  The American Embassy is working with the Iraqi authorities to locate three American citizens who have gone missing in the capital, an embassy spokesman said late Sunday. Their disappearance raised fears that Westerners were once again becoming targets for the myriad militias and criminal gangs that are known to kidnap foreigners for money or for political reasons.

title: Missing Man Back in China, Confessing to Fatal Crime
description: HONG KONG  A Hong Kong publisher last seen in October outside his condominium in Thailand surfaced Sunday on Chinese television, tearfully confessing to violating his probation in a fatal drunken-driving accident and saying that he had voluntarily returned to China to face justice.

title: An Admans Big Pitch: His Lifes Work
description: I have a Hilfiger poster that Tommys begging for, said George Lois, an influential Madison Avenue art director and the creative force behind scores of famous advertising campaigns.

title: British Labour Leader Offers Compromise on Trident Program
description: LONDON  Stirring a divisive internal debate over defense, Jeremy Corbyn, the leader of Britains opposition Labour Party, suggested on Sunday that he might support the continued existence of the countrys Trident submarine fleet if it were sent on patrol without carrying nuclear warheads.

title: Fourth Democratic Debate: Analysis
Peyton Manning, the Broncos Flickering Star, Glows Just in Time
description: DENVER  It was getting late Sunday, the winds were swirling, and Peyton Manning grabbed his helmet from the bench, lunged twice from side to side and crept closer to the sideline. The Denver Broncos trailed by a point, and they had two, maybe three possessions remaining.

title: Covering War at Home Costs a Yemeni His Life
description: SANA, Yemen  For Almigdad Mojalli, a Yemeni journalist covering the civil war in his country, the trip early Sunday to the site of a deadly airstrike was another episode in what had long since become a painful routine.

title: In Rural Alabama, a Longtime Mistrust of Medicine Fuels a Tuberculosis Outbreak
description: MARION, Ala.  When Patricia Church, a 41-year-old warehouse worker, felt sick recently, she suspected that she had a cold. But she also feared something more deadly that has been going around this small, impoverished city: tuberculosis.

title: Ted Marchibroda, Who Led Colts and Ravens, Dies at 84
description: Ted Marchibroda, who coached the Baltimore Colts to three consecutive N.F.L. division championships in the 1970s and later installed a high-powered no-huddle offense that helped propel the Buffalo Bills to four straight Super Bowl games, died on Saturday in Weems, Va. He was 84.

title: Justifiable Homicides, Taken Off the Books, Alter a Murder Tally
description: It was just after 4 a.m. when an argument outside a hookah bar in Astoria, Queens, devolved into gunfire: Three shots were fired in the direction of Christopher King, a 23-year-old Long Island man in the city for a night out. The bullets missed him.

title: Questions on Subsidies and Local Hiring Surround Syracuse Project
description: The project known as Syracuses Inner Harbor looked like a feast for a starving city, the harbinger of the long-awaited turnaround of upstate New York: a $342 million constellation of hotels, upscale apartments and stores along a historic canal on a swath of disused land the city had been trying to transform for decades.

title: In 2016 Race, Local Matters Give Way to National Tone
description: In Iowa, corn is no longer king. In Florida, subsidies for the states powerful sugar producers are under attack. And almost all of the Republicans left in the 2016 presidential race want to abolish the Export-Import Bank, which has provided billions to one of South Carolinas largest employers, Boeing.

title: Who Made the Smartest Comment of the Democratic Debate?
description: Earlier this week, we asked you who made the most intelligent comment during the Republican presidential debate. Now its time to answer the same question for the Democrats.

title: Heres What You Missed in the Debate
U.N.-Appointed Panel Calls for a Tax to Pay for Crises
description: UNITED NATIONS  What if the next time you buy World Cup tickets or summon an Uber ride, you found yourself paying a few cents extra to pay for winter blankets for Syrian refugees or clean water for those displaced in Darfur, Sudan?

title: A Businessman Who Trades in Hand-Me-Downs
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Hajji Ramazan has built a modest empire from used clothes.

title: Chinas Growth Report and Oil Company Earnings
description: European policy makers and American tech moguls are in Munich for a three-day conference that began on Sunday to debate many of the contentious issues that have caused friction between lawmakers and companies on both sides of the Atlantic, including Europes tough competition rules.

title: Obamas Goal to Wipe Out Malaria May Be a Dream Too Far
description: WASHINGTON  Two days before delivering his last State of the Union address, President Obama called one of his top advisers into the Oval Office and said he had decided to add a major pledge to the speech that his team had neither discussed nor vetted: to rid the world of malaria.

title: Bryan Brothers Seek Return to Top of Their Game, and the Rankings
description: Throughout their record-setting doubles careers, Bob and Mike Bryan have been paragons of professionalism. But last year, they decided they were not professional enough  at least for their advancing age.

title: Netflixs Opaque Disruption Annoys Rivals on TV
description: PASADENA, Calif.  Tensions between Netflix and traditional television networks escalated this weekend after industry executives expressed mounting frustration over Netflixs refusal to disclose ratings.

title: As Knicks Slip, Kristaps Porzingis Learns He Must Add Greed to His Game
description: MEMPHIS  Kristaps Porzingis sat at his locker at FedEx Forum on Saturday night with an ice bag strapped to his right shoulder and a towel draped around his neck. His shoulder felt fine, he said, but the team would continue to be cautious.

title: U.S. Growth and Employment Data Tell Different Stories
description: Think of it as the looking-glass economy.

title: Atypical Pursuit of an N.H.L. Dream
description: On the ice, David Levin looks like any other teenager pursuing his dream of playing in the National Hockey League. Off the ice, his story is unlike those of any of his teammates on the Sudbury Wolves of the Ontario Hockey League.

title: Mini Brand Fits Celebrities Into Super Bowl Ads
description: Contrary to conventional wisdom, Super Bowl commercials featuring celebrities often fail to connect with viewers. They can be highly effective, however, when viewers see the celebrities as having an authentic connection with the brand. That is the creative strategy Mini USA will employ during CBSs telecast of Super Bowl 50 on Feb. 7.

title: Roosevelt Hotel Honors a Promise
description: Dear Diary:

title: Artistry and Joy, in Victory and Defeat
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Somewhere in the fourth quarter, as Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson spun and feinted and passed over and slid under pursuing Goliaths, and the Panthers coaching staff curled into a fetal position, you wondered if Carolina could achieve the impossible.

title: Marketing in the Moments, to Reach Customers Online
description: MOMENTS are having a moment in advertising. Or at least a micromoment.

title: Bernie Sanders Releases Details on Health Plan That Would Raise Taxes but, He Argues, Save on Costs
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, under pressure from the Clinton campaign to explain how he would pay for his progressive policies, unveiled a universal healthcare plan on Sunday night that includes sweeping tax increases and a drastic tax hike for the wealthiest.

title: Strat-O-Matic Builds Out Its Digital Game Roster
description: Before the World Series between the Kansas City Royals and the New York Mets last fall, a small number of baseball experts were confident they knew what would happen. Two Royals players, Alcides Escobar and Alex Gordon, would hit home runs in Game 1. There would be a David Wright homer in Game 3, and Matt Harvey would dominate in Game 5, giving up just four hits and a walk in the first seven innings.

title: AChildhood Crush Comes Back Into View in New York
description: Coincidence and a bit of technological ignorance are responsible for introducing Mercedes Rodriguez to her husband.

title: Mississippi Fights to Keep Control of ItsBeleaguered Child Welfare System
description: WAVELAND, Miss.  In 2003, a tiny girl weighing little more than 20 pounds arrived at an emergency shelter here on the gulf coast, after being shuttled between five foster homes and youth shelters in three months.

title: After Penalty, 23 Wins Recorded Only in Memory
description: The University of Missouri mens basketball team opened its 2013-14 season at home with the standard mismatch designed to invigorate fans. On that night in early November, the Tigers scored 89 points, kept visiting Southeastern Louisiana to just 53  and did not win.

title: 14 Testy Months Behind U.S. Prisoner Swap With Iran
description: WASHINGTON  For a year, Obama administration officials had been meeting in secret with Iranian counterparts, seeking to free Americans imprisoned in the Islamic republic. Finally last fall, a deal for a prisoner release seemed all but sealed.

title: Developer Reaches Settlements Over Luxury Buildings That Were Left Unfinished
description: The developer promised the building would have the kind of luxurious amenities befitting a 40-story condominium tower overlooking that citadel of capitalism, the New York Stock Exchange.

title: New York Parking Alert: Alternate-Side Parking Rules Suspended on Monday
description: Because of Martin Luther Kings Birthday, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Monday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: Downton Abbey Season 6, Episode 3 Recap: So Nice to See Him Again?
description: This recap contains spoilers for Sundays episode of Downton Abbey.

title: Scholastic Halts Distribution of A Birthday Cake for George Washington
description: Scholastic Publishing said on Sunday that it would halt distribution of a childrens picture book about George Washington and his enslaved household cook amid an outcry over its visual depiction of the former presidents slaves as happy, smiling workers.

title: My Take on the Democratic Presidential Debate
description: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders dueled tonight in the fourth Democratic debate, and heres my play-by-play commentary. This isnt in the form of a column, or even a formal blog post, but simply my collected tweets from live-tweeting. This is an experiment, a bit like my similar collection of tweets from the Republican presidential debate the other day. Conclusions at the end.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Warriors at Cavaliers
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Billions Recap, Season 1 Premiere: Money and Sin
description: With Oscar nominations announced this week, its tempting to think of Showtimes Billions as a natural companion to The Big Short, Adam McKays Best Picture-nominated film about the financial shenanigans that cratered the economy in 2008. After all, this is a show about a United States Attorney attempting to prosecute just the sort of hedge fund giant who made a fortune exploiting a system that McKay exposes as fraudulent. Adding to that impression is the presence of Andrew Ross Sorkin, the founding editor of DealBook for The New York Times, who created the show with the longtime screenwriting partners Brian Koppelman and David Levien (Rounders, Oceans Thirteen) and who brings a level of Wall Street credibility.

title: In Democratic Debate, Hillary Clinton Challenges Bernie Sanders on Policy Shifts
description: Hillary Clinton targeted Bernie Sanderss electoral appeal with some of her strongest language yet in a debate on Sunday night, seizing on Mr. Sanderss recent policy shifts on universal health care and gun control to try to undercut his image as an anti-political truth teller.

title: Transcript of the Democratic Presidential Debate
description: Following is a transcript of the Democratic debate, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: New York City Announces Deal on Carriage Horses in Central Park
description: The Central Park horse carriage industry would be significantly reduced  and its horses confined to a new stable within the park  under a deal announced late Sunday by the de Blasio administration.

title: Williams Lures Focus From Match-Fixing Report
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Monday was opening day at the Australian Open, and with Serena Williams already on court for her first official match in four months, tennis leaders filed into the tournaments main interview room and tried to allay fears that the game has a major match-fixing problem.

title: What to Watch Monday
description: Occupy yourself for the next four Mondays with Tolstoys War & Peace, or ride along with some Montreal cops in 19-2. Meanwhile, David Oyelowo portrays the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in Selma.

title: Charges Against Chinese Rights Lawyers Draw Foreign Criticism
description: BEIJING  The recent arrests of Chinese lawyers and their associates on subversion charges drew sharp condemnation from presidents of foreign bar associations, prominent lawyers and former judges in a letter issued on Monday. They said the charges were part of an unprecedented crackdown on Chinese advocates who take up contentious human rights cases.

title: Hillary Clinton Turns, Repeatedly, to a Democrat Not on the Debate Stage: Obama
description: Hillary Clinton may have been flanked by Martin OMalley and Senator Bernie Sanders at the presidential primary debate on Sunday night in South Carolina, but she wanted voters to see her as shoulder-to-shoulder with another Democrat: the one living in the White House.

title: Key Moments in the 4th Democratic Debate
description: Watch the liveliest exchanges from the fourth Democratic debate, as the presidential candidates Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders and Martin OMalley faced off in Charleston, S.C., on Sunday.

title: Who Won the Democratic Debate? Viewers Lean Toward Bernie Sanders
description: The final Democratic presidential debate before the first states begin voting was marked by heated exchanges between Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders on Wall Street regulation, guns and who would best preserve the legacy of President Obama. Many commentators from across the web thought that a more aggressive Mr. Sanders gave himself a boost by taking Mrs. Clinton on more forcefully. She scored points on his shifting positions on guns and taxes, but was not seen as dealing any decisive blows. Martin OMalley, meanwhile, was most notable for his unsuccessful efforts to get a word in.

title: Corrections: January 18, 2016
description: NATIONAL

title: Heidi Nelson Cruz Discusses Her Husband, Her Career and Campaign Fund-Raising
description: In a Republican presidential field dotted with spouses who have compelling stories of their own, Heidi Nelson Cruz stands out as the one who could most easily trade places with her husband, Ted.

title: Race, Civil Rights and Photography
description: The Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and other civil rights leaders relied on the power of photographs to persuade and to motivate. For many white Americans outside the South, it was easy to be unaware  or ignore outright  the segregation of the Jim Crow era.

title: Heidi Nelson Cruz: A Political Spouse Making Sacrifices and Courting Donors
description: Heidi Nelson Cruz stepped to the lectern in a black gown, waiting for the applause to settle. She was beaming.

title: For Martin Luther Kings Birthday, Black Leaders as Obituaries Portrayed Them
description: The New York Times culled its files for a retrospective on how black leaders including Rosa Parks, Jackie Robinson and Dr. King himself were regarded at their deaths.

title: Flexible Work Schedules for Parents
description: To the Editor:

title: Weighing the Risks of Home Births
description: The debate over whether its safer for a healthy woman to have a baby at home or in the hospital just tilted a bit in favor of hospital deliveries. The risks in both cases are very low, but a new study suggests that the risk to babies could be higher for out-of-hospital births.

title: Studying Ancient Greek
description: To the Editor:

title: Privacy and Drone Spying
description: To the Editor:

title: Guaranteeing an Income for Everyone
description: To the Editor:

title: A Tax on Views of Central Park?
description: To the Editor:

title: Health Reform Realities
description: Health reform is the signature achievement of the Obama presidency. It was the biggest expansion of the social safety net since Medicare was established in the 1960s. It more or less achieves a goal  access to health insurance for all Americans  that progressives have been trying to reach for three generations. And it is already producing dramatic results, with the percentage of uninsured Americans falling to record lows.

title: Shine a Light on Secret Real Estate Deals
description: The Treasury Department announced last week that it would start demanding the identities of the people behind the shell companies that rich foreigners use to buy real estate in Manhattan and Miami-Dade County. This is a good step that should help law enforcement agencies crack down on money laundering, tax evasion and other crimes. But the program should be broadened to cover the whole country, and it must be forcefully carried out.

title: The Gospel According to Trump
description: IT is no secret that Donald J. Trumps ruinous rise in the Republican presidential primaries has been powered, in large part, by a naked agenda of religious division and fear-mongering  an agenda that will likely inform his speech today at Liberty University, a conservative Christian college in Lynchburg, Va.

title: Stop Chinas Market Manipulations
description: Washington  THE other day while I was crossing the street in Beijing, a car almost flattened me. Both the driver and I were outraged at the others ineptitude. In China, if you want to avoid being hit, you keep your head down and avoid eye contact with the oncoming driver, since looking at him would signal that you saw the car and know you should let it pass. In the United States, the opposite rule applies: Making eye contact confirms that the driver has seen you and should yield to the vulnerable pedestrian.

title: G.O.P. and the Apocalypse
description: Last week I suffered through another dust-dry Republican debate in which a slimmed-down roster of seven candidates leveled many of the same attacks and regurgitated many of the same staid pitches.

title: Celebrating Martin Luther King Day
description: Like most schools across the United States, were off today in observance of the life and legacy of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. A new edition of Whats Going On in This Picture? will be available early next Monday.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: God leads you to where he can use you the most. And it may not look exactly like youd expect.

title: What Do We Owe Each Other?
description: The thousands of refugees who continue to arrive in Europe each day face barriers: not only physical barriers  walls, fences, barbed wire  but an even deeper resistance, in the nationalism and xenophobia bubbling up across the Continent.

title: New Watches at the Salon International de la Haute Horlogerie
description: The fine watchmaking fair opens Jan. 18 in Geneva.

title: Clydesdale Bank in Britain Could Be Valued at $3 Billion in I.P.O.
description: LONDON  National Australia Bank said on Monday that its British unit, Clydesdale Bank, could be valued at as much as 2.07 billion pounds, or about $3 billion, in an initial public offering next month as part of a spinoff.

title: Rural Oregons Lost Prosperity Gives Standoff a Distressed Backdrop
description: BURNS, Ore.  One of the largest wood mills in the West once belched its steam on the edge of town, sawing ponderosa pine. Out in the woods, tree fallers like Tex Ward were proud and prosperous.

title: Whats New in the Dietary Guidelines
description: Theres good news, and not-so-good news for some, in the new Dietary Guidelines for Americans, released Jan. 7 by the Agriculture and Health and Human Services Departments.

title: Lawmakers Conclude Debate Over Barring Donald Trump From Britain
1961 | Starring Martin Luther King Jr. (and Henry Fonda)
description: The Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. played many roles on the American stage: leader, orator, preacher, protester, exemplar, conscience, symbol, martyr.

title: Animals Die in Large Numbers, and Researchers Scratch Their Heads
description: Are die-offs occurring more often?

title: Stabbing of Israeli Woman in West Bank Suggests Shift in Violence
description: TEKOA, West Bank  In a charity store packed with used clothing on the edge of Tekoa, a Jewish settlement in the beige hills of the southern West Bank, Michal Froman, 30 and pregnant, was shopping on Monday when a Palestinian teenager walked in.

title: In Libya, U.S. Courts Unreliable Allies to Counter ISIS
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  The American Special Operations forces expected a warm welcome when they landed at the Libyan air base where an allied militia was stationed. Instead, armed men from another militia at the base threatened to detain the commandos, forcing the Americans to evacuate.

title: On the Stockholm Waterfront, Renewing a New City
description: The waterfront district of Hammarby Sjostad, on the southern edge of Stockholm, has been heralded as a model of sustainable urban development, a place where one can already glimpse the future of city living. And the areas growth, coupled with the steadily rising popularity of the island of Sodermalm to its immediate north, is pulling the inhabitable boundaries  if not the heart  of Stockholm southward.

title: What to Do in Elena Ferrantes Naples
description: Last week, we published an article about using the Neapolitan novels of Elena Ferrante as guidebooks to Naples. As I discovered during a visit in September, Ann Mah wrote, the series of books offered a unique view of this complicated city, leading me away from popular tourist sites and helping to explain the citys social, economic and geographic divisions. To view the Naples of Ms. Ferrante is to view Naples like a native.

title: The Living Dead
description: The bright aseptic room smelled of Pine-Sol and bleach and overripe Camembert. A white-bearded man lay on a stainless-steel examination table, his face angled toward the skylight and the cold, cloudless morning. An investigator read from his clipboard: 61-year-old white male discharged from a Detroit hospital last night was found at home, shirtless, in a wheelchair, a .38-caliber handgun in his right hand. On his chest was a burn that appeared to be an exact match of the guns barrel. Carl Schmidt, the medical examiner, wiped the contact wound with a wet sponge.

title: Blessed Are the Comedians
description: For Middle East watchers, who are accustomed to reports of shootings and explosions, learning about a banned or suppressed book might be the closest thing to receiving good news. Suppression of a book, after all, is a perverse acknowledgment that literature holds the power to subvert the status quo  and without a single shot fired. If books that imagine peace are still able to put fear in the hearts of warmongers, isnt it a sign that theres some hope for us?

title: Even Talking About Reducing Drug Prices Can Reduce Drug Prices
description: Both Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton are pushing for lower prescription drug prices as part of their campaigns. Debates about whether and how to reduce drug prices arent new. But they rarely lead to legislative success.

title: Barclays Completes Sale of Controlling Interest in Trust Business
description: LONDON  The British bank Barclays has completed the sale of a controlling stake in its trust business to an independent investor group led by the Nielsen and Sarikhani families for an undisclosed amount.

title: As Freed Americans Rejoin Relatives, Mystery Surrounds One Who Stayed Put
