title: Nikes Invitation to Climb a Skateboard, and Dover Street Markets Reopening
description: Escape the cold at Nike SB Garage, a pop-up indoor skate space in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, where you can hit the decks and try out the pro skateboarder Ishod Wairs new shoe, the Nike Dunk Low Pro Ishod Wair ($95), which offers a retro-cool silhouette with a flexible rubber outsole for enhanced grippy traction. Sign up at nike.com/events-registration/series for open skate sessions this weekend. At 646 Lorimer Street.

title: Pictures of the Day: Serbia and Elsewhere
description: Serbia and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Jan. 20, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Serbia, Afghanistan, Pakistan and India.

title: U.S. Plans Coalition Meeting on Fight Against ISIS
description: PARIS  The United States will convene a meeting next month of defense ministers from 27 countries participating in the fight against the Islamic State to discuss how each member of the coalition could contribute more to defeating the extremist group, Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter announced on Wednesday.

title: Rajat Gupta to Finish Insider Trading Sentence at His Home
description: During Rajat Guptas heyday as a globe-trotting management consultant, one of the highlights of January was the World Economic Forums annual gathering of global business titans in Davos, Switzerland.

title: As Water Problems Grew, Officials Belittled Complaints From Flint
description: LANSING, Mich.  A top aide to Michigans governor referred to people raising questions about the quality of Flints water as an anti-everything group. Other critics were accused of turning complaints about water into a political football. And worrisome findings about lead by a concerned pediatrician were dismissed as data, in quotes.

title: Senate Blocks Bill on Tougher Refugee Screening
description: WASHINGTON  A bill that would have greatly tightened screening procedures on refugees from Syria and Iraq failed on a procedural vote in the Senate on Wednesday, saving President Obama from another vexing veto scenario on an issue that has divided the country.

title: Next Installment of Star Wars Pushed Back to End of 2017
description: Walt Disney Studios on Wednesday created a large disturbance in Hollywoods release calendar, delaying the next installment in the Star Wars series from May 2017 to December of that year  on a date that Steven Spielberg and Warner Bros. had already staked out for their Ready Player One.

title: Bob Dole Warns of Cataclysmic Losses With Ted Cruz, and Says Donald Trump Would Do Better
description: Bob Dole, the former Kansas senator and 1996 Republican presidential nominee, has never been fond of Senator Ted Cruz of Texas. But in an interview Wednesday, Mr. Dole said that the party would suffer cataclysmic and wholesale losses if Mr. Cruz were the nominee, and that Donald J. Trump would fare better.

title: Spread of Zika Virus Prompts Travel Advisories
description: Travel warnings about the Zika virus, especially for pregnant women, are very much in the news now, but the germ was discovered more than a half century ago, and you may have already visited places where it flourishes.

title: Haider Ackermann: Fall 2016
description: Haider Ackermanns fall 2016 mens collection.

title: Castleton Festival to Go on Hiatus
description: The Castleton Festival, which the conductor Lorin Maazel founded in 2009 on his estate in rural Virginia, announced this week that it is canceling most of this summers offerings in what festival officials described as a temporary hiatus brought on by financial difficulties.

title: Sending the Trisha Brown Legacy Back Into the World
description: Once upon a time, a choreographer made dances, and extraordinary ones at that. Her works, full of wit and rigor, unfolded on rooftops and rafts and even on the sides of buildings as well as in lofts and galleries, and later on proscenium stages. And then she couldnt make them anymore.

title: Five Tips for Curing Winter Skin, From a Cult Facialist
description: The cult facialist Kristina Holey, whose holistic approach to skincare favors healthy habits (eating well, exercising, sleeping) over a medicine cabinet full of topical antidotes, might be the beauty industrys worst nightmare. Her modus operandi  that there is no universal rule for the skin, and each person requires a unique regimen  rejects the idea of any products touted as a quick fix cure-all. Yet it is this long-term strategy towards skincare that has seen Holey become San Franciscos most sought-after facialist (she opened her own skincare center in June), with clients also clamoring to see her in Los Angeles and New York, where she works out of the West Village boutique Calliope.

title: Early-Music Ensembles: Praised as Pure, but Seeking More
description: When the female vocal quartet Anonymous 4 retired last month, it left behind a discography spanning a thousand years of music. But the core of its repertory was medieval music in which, in plainchant passages, the four womens voices seemed to melt together into one silky, unison line.

title: Smart Guns and Shifty Politics As Governor Christie Runs for President
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey has been softening his past record on gun controls with each visit to gun friendly states as he vies for the Republican presidential nomination. As rival candidates on the gun lobbys A-list questioned his devotion to the cause, Mr. Christie reversed his previous support for an assault weapons ban  a position he strongly voiced in his earliest days of politicking for New Jersey office. In another reversal, he vetoed a ban that would have keptthe controversial, armor-piercing .50-caliber rifle out of the hands of civilians.

title: Lesson Plan | Teaching Star Wars With The New York Times
description: Are your students Star Wars fanatics? Are you?

title: Review: Dark Net Explores the Digital Ages Toll on Us
description: The scariness of the digital age has been the peg for a number of newsmagazine segments and docu-series, many of them not going, conceptually, much beyond Can you believe what some people are using the Internet for these days? Dark Net, an eight-part series that begins on Thursday night on Showtime, goes further, using examples of unsettling digital phenomena to ponder larger questions, like whether and how the digital age might be changing us as a species.

title: Review: London Spy Follows an Unlikely Investigator With Love on His Mind
description: Its hard not to care about a character played by Ben Whishaw, an actor whose nimble intensity has enlivened roles from Richard II, in The Hollow Crown cycle, to Q in the Bond movies. But during BBC Americas London Spy, a five-episode mini-series (beginning on Thursday) thats a loopy mix of love story and conspiracy thriller, you may find yourself managing it for long stretches.

title: Review: On Mad Dogs, an Amazon Series, Male Bellicosity Rules
description: American men, you love to fight, a supporting female character observes in the very male dark-comic thriller Mad Dogs, whose 10-episode first season debuts Friday on Amazon Prime.

title: Dover Street Markets (Almost) Overnight Transformation
description: Twice annually, Dover Street Market undergoes what it calls a New Beginning  in which elaborate visual displays and new brands are installed, with select departments strikingly reconfigured. Here is how it happens.

title: Review: Jeremy Pelts #Jiveculture, Exuding Chemistry
description: #Jiveculture

title: Review: Tortoise Revisits Its Elusive Identity on The Catastrophist
description: The Catastrophist

title: Russian Strikes in Syria Have Stabilized Assad, Top U.S. General Says
description: BRUSSELS  Russias campaign of airstrikes against opponents of President Bashar al-Assad of Syria has stabilized Mr. Assads government, Americas top general said Wednesday. That has probably given Mr. Assad a stronger hand to play next week, when negotiations toward a political solution to the conflict will begin in Geneva, American officials said.

title: New York City Is Set to Adopt New Approach on Policing Minor Offenses
description: New York City is poised to reshape how it treats many so-called quality-of-life offenses, softening its stance toward low-level infractions like public urination and drinking alcohol in public by steering those cases away from the criminal court system.

title: Did Obama Overstep His Authority on Immigration?
description: To the Editor:

title: Free Help for Tax Returns
description: Taxpayers have several options for getting free help to prepare and send their income tax return during this years filing season, which began on Tuesday.

title: Review: On Malibu Anderson .Paak Takes In All That His Surroundings Offer
description: Malibu

title: Overview of Flints Water Crisis
description: Months after the city of Flint, Mich., switched from a Detroit water supply to one from the Flint River, contaminants have sickened people. Residents have filed lawsuits, and the governor has apologized.

title: In Canada, the 8-Dollar Cauliflower Shows the Pain of Falling Oil Prices
description: OTTAWA  Steamed, sauted or stir-fried, cauliflower is standard fare on many dinner tables. In Canada, it is a luxury.

title: Animal Deaths Down and Adoptions Up Amid Reforms at New York Shelters
description: For a place often associated with confinement, suffering and death, the city animal shelter in Manhattan was a pretty happy spot last Friday afternoon, at least in the backyard.

title: 5 Accused of Stealing Drug Secrets From GlaxoSmithKline
description: Federal prosecutors in Philadelphia said on Wednesday that they had indicted five people, including two research scientists, on charges of stealing trade secrets about drugs to treat cancer and other diseases from GlaxoSmithKline, the British drug giant.

title: No Comment Necessary: Sarah Palin on Her Sons Arrest
description: At a Trump rally on Wednesday, Sarah Palin discussed her son Tracks recent arrest on domestic violence charges.

title: David H. Koch Leaves Natural History Museum Board
description: David H. Koch, a philanthropist who has given millions of dollars to the American Museum of Natural History in New York but whose businesses in energy and other industries have drawn criticism from climate scientists and environmental groups, has left the museums board after serving on it for 23 years.

title: Raf Simons: Fall 2016
description: The fall 2016 designs from Raf Simons, who resigned as Diors creative director in October.

title: Deutsche Bank Announces $7 Billion Yearly Loss as Legal Issues Weigh on Results
description: FRANKFURT  In a surprise earnings announcement, Deutsche Bank on Wednesday evening reported a huge yearly loss of 6.7 billion euros ($7.3 billion) as the cost of past wrongdoing continued to weigh on its earnings.

title: Bette Midler, Glowin, Crowin, Goin Strong and Ready for Hello, Dolly!
description: Bette Midler has never seen Hello, Dolly! onstage.

title: N.Y.C.F.C.s Patrick Vieira Acknowledges Long Learning Process
description: For the previous 11 hours, Patrick Vieira had been asked questions. But at the final stop of his daylong media marathon, which included a news conference and a dozen or so interviews, he was the one asking the questions.

title: Review: The Yid, Paul Goldbergs First Novel, Taunts Stalin
description: Paul Goldbergs provocatively titled first novel, The Yid, is set in the Soviet Union and begins in late February 1953, just as staggering change is about to occur. Only a small part of what the book describes is a matter of record: Joseph Stalin died on March 5 at his dacha just outside Moscow. He spent enough of his final hours unattended to give a vindictive alternative historian some wiggle room.

title: The Sundance Film Festival Trains Its Sights on the Gun Debate
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Gun violence can be an awkward subject at the Sundance Film Festival. Over the years, the event has helped popularize  some would say glamorize  extreme gun imagery in movies; Quentin Tarantino was incubated and hatched here.

title: Review: New York City Ballets Winter Season Blends Movement and Music
description: In ballet, sight meets sound. When the alchemy is right, this often trivial art takes off into the stratosphere. On Tuesday, New York City Ballet, the worlds foremost specialist in this music-movement fusion, opened its six-week winter season at the David H. Koch Theater with welcome new aspects of aural accompaniment inside the auditorium (the new music director, Andrew Litton, was conducting a program of American scores, admirably) and new aspects of design around the theaters other spaces (Marcel Dzama redecorated the main upstairs foyer with ostentatious triviality).

title: Review: Tackling Bach, Debussy and Prokofiev at Spectrum
description: More important than the question of whether Bach should be played on historical or contemporary instruments is the general approach performers bring. The music always needs a buoyant touch and rhythmic vitality, elements missing from a heavy-handed interpretation of Bachs Sonata for Viola da Gamba and Harpsichord in G (BMW 1027) by the pianist Taka Kigawa and the cellist Eric Edberg on Tuesday evening. The duo performed on modern instruments at Spectrum, a cozy, book-lined space on the Lower East Side of Manhattan.

title: On the Milan Runway, Assembled Fragments and Disconnected Thoughts
description: MILAN  When models start quoting Baudrillard, the creative director at Gucci name-checks Walter Benjamin and Miuccia Prada makes prints depicting Freud in a wrestling match, you know the world is upside down.

title: Philanthropist Donates to Smithsonians African-American Museum
description: The businessman and philanthropist David M. Rubenstein is donating $10 million to the Smithsonians National Museum of African American History and Culture, the Smithsonian announced Wednesday.

title: Flint Water Crisis: Emails Released by Gov. Rick Snyder
description: Michigan's governor released hundreds of pages of emails regarding Flint's lead-contaminated water supply.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Davos Participants Seek Out Stardust Moments
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  At the World Economic Forum here, heads of state, billionaire investors and corporate chiefs meet to discuss the state of politics and regulation, and tackle the biggest challenges facing societies globally. This year, they are sending warning signals about the state of the markets.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Sarah Palin, Pakistan, Flint
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Be a French Girl. Or Just Look Like One.
description: The fog comes on little cat feet, Carl Sandburg wrote in a 1916 poem, and he might have been talking about Kate Moss slinking around London for the last two decades in her trusty black ballet flats. The shoe itself has a feline cast  it rounds the foot into a pawlike shape  but theres also something feline about the women, like Ms. Moss, who have popularized ballet flats over the years.

title: Happy Hour Without the Booze
description: On a recent rainy afternoon over veggie burgers at NeueHouse, the co-working space in the Flatiron district, three Vedic meditators were discussing drink options for a new kind of happy hour they were organizing.

title: Where Wearable Technology Ends Up (Hint: Not Your Wrist)
description: The junk drawer in my home used to look just like yours, filled with loose change, batteries and birthday candles. But over the last year, a new category of junk has started to accumulate there: wearable devices.

title: Races of Mankind Sculptures, Long Exiled, Return to Display at Chicagos Field Museum
description: CHICAGO  For decades, the bronzes created by the artist Malvina Hoffman for the Field Museums Races of Mankind exhibit have had a ghostly afterlife at the institution. Hailed at their unveiling in 1933 as the finest racial portraiture the world has yet seen and viewed by millions of visitors, the sculptures were banished to storage in 1969, embarrassing relics of discredited ideas about human difference.

title: The Many Lives of Limelight
description: Its Harry Chapin going into Cat Stevens into the Beatles into James Taylor into Bob Marley, and then around 10, 11 oclock, Jay Z and Guns n Roses escalating the whole vibe, Stratis Morfogen said on a recent evening.

title: Treasury Secretary Visits Puerto Rico and Urges Fast Action
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  On his first official visit to the commonwealth, the Treasury secretary, Jacob J. Lew, said the financial crisis on the island was deepening and he urged Congress to act quickly to give the government the power it needs to restructure all of its debt.

title: Obama Relaxes Rules for Striking ISIS in Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama has made it easier for the military to get approval for strikes in Afghanistan targeting militias that have sworn allegiance to the Islamic State, according to several government officials.

title: Crumbling, Destitute Schools Threaten Detroits Recovery
description: DETROIT  In Kathy Aarons decrepit public school, the heat fills the air with a moldy, rancid odor. Cockroaches, some three inches long, scuttle about until they are squashed by a student who volunteers for the task. Water drips from a leaky roof onto the gymnasium floor.

title: To Fight Superbugs, Drug Makers Call for Incentives to Develop Antibiotics
description: More than 80 pharmaceutical and diagnostic companies from around the world are calling for new economic models to spur development of badly needed new antibiotics and to fight the rising global threat of drug-resistant superbugs.

title: How New York's Shelters Keep Animals Alive
description: The euthanasia rate for animals at three city shelters has plummeted to 13 percent, from more than 60 percent in 2003.

title: My Sarah Palin Romance
description: As a political journalist, you never forget the first time you stop just covering a politician and start identifying with her. The first time you wed your high-minded vision of what politics should be to a real candidates perishable breath.

title: Ex-Rikers Guard Sentenced to Jail in Attack on Inmate Causing Vision Loss
description: A former New York City correction officer was sentenced to 90 days in jail on Wednesday for beating a Rikers Island inmate, who sustained a broken nose and lost vision in one eye.

title: Panel Backs Janet DiFiore for New York Chief Judge; Senate Puts Off Vote
description: ALBANY  Everything seemed primed on Wednesday for the Court of Appeals, the states highest court, to receive its new chief judge. There were words of praise for the nominee, Janet DiFiore, and a unanimous vote of approval from the State Senate Judiciary Committee.

title: California Said to Target Exxon in Climate Inquiry
description: Californias attorney general is investigating Exxon Mobil on whether the company lied to the public and shareholders about the risks of climate change, and whether the companys statements over the years constitute violations of securities laws and other statutes.

title: Officials Object to Plan to Turn Hart Island Burial Site Over to Parks Dept.
description: It was a vision to beguile many New Yorkers: an all-but-forgotten island in Long Island Sound that a noisy city would transform into its most tranquil park. And there was a concurrent vision for the families of the dead long buried there, on Hart Island: a cemetery now run like a prison would become a place to freely mourn.

title: Pay Cuts for Top Leaders at Viacom
description: Viacom cut the annual pay for its executive chairman, Sumner M. Redstone, by 85 percent during the 2015 fiscal year, the company disclosed on Wednesday, in the face of growing questions about whether Mr. Redstone, an ailing 92-year-old, should continue in his role at the company.

title: U.S. Drops Bombs Not Just on ISIS, but on Its Cash, Too
description: WASHINGTON  With sanctions, blacklists and other measures doing little to financially break the Islamic State, the United States has turned to a far simpler tactic to empty the groups coffers: It is literally blowing them up.

title: Colleagues Express Disbelief Over Arrest of Doctor With Picture-Perfect Life
description: Dr. David H. Newman seemed to have it all: an impressive post in emergency medicine at Mount Sinai Hospital, a prominent and growing public presence as an expert in health care reform, a wife who is a doctor, two young sons, and a gracious home in the New Jersey suburbs.

title: Jack Dorsey Juggles Twitter and Square, Both Caught in Downdraft
description: It is not shaping up as a happy new year for Jack Dorsey and his two companies.

title: A Queens Nun With a Talent for Begging
description: To some of the workers at the Hunts Point Produce Market in the Bronx, it is a familiar sight: a nun or two darting around the concrete loading docks every Wednesday. Sister Elisabeth Anne, 76, has been making the weekly trip to the large industrial market for more than 35 years to pick up food for the older adults at the residence where she lives and works.

title: Wilkes Bashford, Clothier to Affluent San Franciscans, Dies at 82
description: Wilkes Bashford, a clothier whose eponymous emporium is famous for having dressed affluent, elegance-conscious San Franciscans for the last half-century, died on Saturday at his home in San Francisco. He was 82.

title: Efforts to Drop Charges Against Cosby Are Meritless, Prosecutor Says
description: A Pennsylvania prosecutor on Wednesday hit back at efforts by lawyers for Bill Cosby to have the criminal charges against Mr. Cosby dismissed, describing their claim that a former district attorney made a promise not to prosecute the entertainer a decade ago as meritless.

title: Big 5 Teams Celebrate Milestone With Throwback Doubleheader at Palestra
description: PHILADELPHIA  More than 50 years later, the memory remains as clear as ever for Don DiJulia. He will never forget Feb. 20, 1965, when a mens college basketball game between St. Josephs and Villanova was interrupted after the police received a call at halftime saying a bomb had been planted in the stands.

title: Two Sides of Ted Cruz: Tort Reformer and Personal Injury Lawyer
description: Ted Cruz says his uncompromising purity as a conservative crusader helped propel him to the top of the Republican presidential field. But his history suggests that when the cameras are off, a different Mr. Cruz emerges.

title: Ettore Scola, Italian Film Director of Satire and Farce, Dies at 84
description: Ettore Scola, a Golden Globe winner and five-time Oscar nominee who was considered among the great directors and screenwriters of Italian cinema, died on Tuesday in Rome. He was 84.

title: Buffalo Adds Woman to Coaching Staff
description: The Buffalo Bills hired the first full-time female coach in the N.F.L. on Wednesday when Kathryn Smith was appointed their special teams quality control coach.

title: Michel Tournier, French Novelist Who Fused Myth and Philosophy, Dies at 91
description: Michel Tournier, a French novelist who blended myth and philosophy in prizewinning novels that revisited Robinson Crusoe, Goethes elf king and the biblical tale of the Three Magi, died on Monday at his home in Choisel, near Paris. He was 91.

title: Republicans Unseat Mississippi Democrat Who Drew Winning Straw After Race Ended in Tie
description: ATLANTA  First, the re-election bid of State Representative Blaine Eaton II of Mississippi ended in a statistically improbable tie. Then  bizarrely, but in keeping with Mississippi statute  the outcome was decided by a drawing of straws, which he won.

title: 2 Lawyers Leaving Paul, Weiss to Form Boutique Firm
description: Two prominent lawyers at Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison are breaking away and forming their own litigation boutique with lawyers from other firms.

title: Film Academy, Under Fire, Is Expected to Take Steps to Improve Oscar Diversity
description: LOS ANGELES  The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences is expected to announce as early as next week measures aimed at making its Oscar choices more diverse, people briefed on the matter said Wednesday.

title: Ziegfeld Theater in Midtown Is Closing to Become a Ballroom
description: The famed Ziegfeld Theater in Midtown Manhattan will close its doors in the coming weeks, and reopen next year as an event space that caters to galas and corporate functions, the buildings owner said on Wednesday.

title: Trial Explores Whether Towns Discriminate Against Nonmembers of Polygamous Sect
description: PHOENIX  When an unfamiliar car drives into the small neighboring towns of Colorado City, Ariz., and Hildale, Utah, private security agents working for the polygamist sect that dominates the towns ask the local marshals, who act as the police for both towns, to run the license plates to see who is passing through, federal prosecutors said.

title: Executive in U.N. Corruption Case Pleads Guilty
description: A Chinese-born executive accused of helping to funnel more than $800,000 to a top United Nations official pleaded guilty to bribery on Wednesday, the second guilty plea in a week in the governments continuing investigation of corruption at the United Nations.

title: Misnomer on Skates: John Scott, N.H.L. All-Star, Is Neither in N.H.L. Nor a Star
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.  The captain of the Pacific Division team for the N.H.L. All-Star Game skated onto the ice of a less-than-half-full minor league arena on Wednesday, wearing a St. Johns IceCaps jersey. The game against the Bridgeport Sound Tigers was just another stop on his wacky road to becoming an N.H.L. All-Star.

title: Hillary Clinton Dismisses Bernie Sanderss Criticism of Groups Backing Her
description: BURLINGTON, Iowa  Hillary Clinton on Wednesday defended Planned Parenthood, the Human Rights Campaign and other Democratic-leaning organizations and labor unions that have endorsed her candidacy and that her main opponent, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, has deemed part of the establishment.

title: Among N.F.L. Coaches, a Lack of Diversity Trickles Up
description: The usual scramble of firing and hiring N.F.L. coaches displayed perhaps a touch more impatience this year: Some coaches were dismissed even before the season ended.

title: Donald Trump Is Forcing Ted Cruz to Rewrite His Playbook
description: WHITEFIELD, N.H.  Ted Cruz did not have to say a cross word about Scott Walker. Rick Perry and Bobby Jindal faded on their own. And when Ben Carson briefly rocketed to the top of the Iowa polls, Mr. Cruz and his team stayed cool, confident that the neurosurgeons support would wither.

title: Filing Alleges Bias at Success Academy Network Against Students With Disabilities
description: Parents of 13 current and former students of Success Academy filed a complaint with the Office of Civil Rights with the federal Education Department on Wednesday, accusing the charter school network of discriminating against students with disabilities by denying them accommodations and in some cases pushing them out.

title: Central African Republic: Hunger Threatens Population, U.N. Warns
description: Nearly 2.5 million people in the Central African Republic  half the population  are now facing hunger, double the figure from a year ago, the main food aid agency of the United Nations said Wednesday. The agency, the World Food Program, attributed the increase to years of conflict and insecurity that have kept people from tending their fields and livestock, exacerbated by a poor harvest. This is not the run-of-the-mill emergency, Guy Adoua, the agencys deputy director for the country, said in a statement. People are left with nothing. The agency called for an emergency cash infusion of $41 million from donor countries to deal with the crisis.

title: Attorney General Seeks Funding for Tighter Gun Rules
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans warned on Wednesday that they would fight President Obamas attempts to impose tougher gun restrictions in the wake of the San Bernardino shooting, and they accused him of doing an end run around the Second Amendment.

title: Massacre Came as Pakistan University Honored a Hero of Nonviolence
description: The university attacked by the Pakistani Taliban on Wednesday was named for a towering figure in Pakistani history  a nonviolent Pashtun activist who became known as the Frontier Gandhi for his advocacy of nonviolent resistance to British colonial rule.

title: Review: Our Mothers Brief Affair, a Play About Unmoored Lives
description: Every mother is Greta Garbo to her children, at least upon occasion. The woman you were closest to in the world, the one who weaned and wiped you, could suddenly seem so ravishingly remote it was scary. What was really on her mind those nights she tucked you into bed, deliciously lipsticked and perfumed for an evening out?

title: Amtrak Says New York Regions Rail Projects Could Cost Up to $23.9 Billion
description: Amtrak officials on Wednesday provided the most detailed public account yet for the projected costs of building a new Hudson River rail tunnel and improving other critical parts of the rail infrastructure in the New York region.

title: Off-the-Record Discussion
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Ive watched every episode of L.A. Law and selected parts of Perry Mason on YouTube, so I consider myself to be somewhat of a legal expert. This expertise came in handy today as I tried to solve David Phillipss crossword about SIDEBARS, because I was able to recognize that, from a totally legal and professional point of view, a SIDEBAR is one of the most efficient ways to inject drama into an otherwise mundane court proceeding, second only to pounding ones fist on the table and shouting Objection, Your Honor! At least on television.

title: Bernie Sanders Says He Would Defend U.S. Responsibly
description: Income inequality and greedy billionaires are neither seen nor heard from in Senator Bernie Sanderss sober-minded new foreign policy ad, Defend This Nation.

title: De Blasio Backer, Convicted of Sexual Abuse, Fails to Show Up for Jail Sentence
description: One of Mayor Bill de Blasios leading supporters in New Yorks Orthodox Jewish community failed to appear in court this week to begin a 15-day sentence on a previously undisclosed conviction for misdemeanor sexual abuse, and a warrant has been issued for his arrest.

title: With a New Child, Laying Claim to the Comforts of Home
description: Kayla Medinas apartment in Harlem, where she lives with her infant son, Kayden, is simple and small. He crawls around their living room floor, his interest shifting among his toys. He will turn 1 in April; Ms. Medina turned 21 this month.

title: Scarsdale Woman Is Stabbed to Death in Her Home
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y.  A 58-year-old woman was fatally stabbed on Wednesday inside her home in this Westchester County village, the authorities said. A man who also lived in the home, possibly the womans husband, was detained by the police, officials said.

title: Mets Add Antonio Bastardo to Bullpen
description: It was not a splashy move, but the Mets made a ripple in the free-agent waters on Wednesday. They reached an agreement with Antonio Bastardo, a left-handed reliever, on a two-year, $12 million contract.

title: As Amir Hekmati Sat in an Iranian Prison, Michigan Supporters Kept His Name in the News
description: FLINT, Mich.  After four and a half years in an Iranian prison, Amir Hekmati will return to a community where people he never knew fought to make sure the world knew his name.

title: Cavaliers, Coming Off a Drubbing, Dish Out Punishment Against the Nets
description: The N.B.A. regular-season schedule presents many challenging markers for every team from October to April, including difficult games on consecutive nights, cross-continental trips and fierce division rivalry games.

title: Porzingis, Lured by Pump Fake, Learns Lesson as Knicks Prevail
description: It was late on Wednesday night, much later than usual, when Derek Fishers postgame news conference finally wound down.

title: Asian Markets Follow U.S. Stocks Downward
description: HONG KONG  Markets in Asia sank on Thursday, as traders surrendered to the fears that had sent shares tumbling in Japan, Europe and the United States the previous day.

title: Centenarians Proliferate, and Live Longer
description: WASHINGTON  Move over, millennials. The centenarians are coming.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | brocade
description: brocade  \bro-kad\  noun and verb

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The whole system is warming up, relentlessly.

title: What to Watch Thursday
description: A man investigates his undercover lover in London Spy, BBC Americas latest espionage mini-series. Glenn Frey recounts his time soaring in History of the Eagles. And Zach Galifianakis tries to elevate clowning to an art in Baskets.

title: The X-Files: David Duchovny and Gillian Anderson Return to the Paranormal Beat
description: NORTH VANCOUVER, British Columbia  There they were in the midst of what looked like a spooky old-growth forest (Princess Park, actually, mere blocks from upscale suburban homes here), surrounded by clumps of moss, overgrown ferns and gigantic Douglas firs, looking for clues of yet another allegedly paranormal crime, the kind they used to solve almost every week. They addressed each other, as they always had, by only their last names.

title: Who Is Leading the South Carolina Polls
description: A look at the latest results for Iowa and New Hampshire, and how this year compares to previous election seasons.

title: Corrections: January 21, 2016
description: NATIONAL

title: European Central Bank Says Its Ready for New Stimulus  but Not Yet
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Banks president, Mario Draghi, issued a stronger-than-expected signal on Thursday that his policy team could step up its stimulus program as early as March in response to stubbornly low inflation and turbulence in the financial markets.

title: Among North Africas Berbers
description: Ferhat Bouda has made it his mission to document his people, the Berbers, whose culture and language have been suppressed over the centuries.

title: Putin Probably Approved Litvinenko Poisoning, British Inquiry Says
description: LONDON  In the dank, dark days of November 2006, as Alexander V. Litvinenko, a former K.G.B. officer turned foe of the Kremlin, lay dying in a London hospital, he and his associates composed a deathbed missive to President Vladimir V. Putin.

title: Self-Driving Cars May Get Here Before Were Ready
description: SOMETIME in the future  although no one quite knows when  your morning commute may look something like this: Open an app, summon a car and wait for the arrival of a driverless vehicle that will whisk you to work like a ghost chauffeur.

title: The Republican Establishment Is Losing at Its Own Game
description: A little more than a month ago, Ted Cruz tweeted: The Establishments only hope: Trump & me in a cage match.

title: Among North Africas Berbers
description: The first day Ferhat Bouda picked up a camera, he found his calling.

title: Palin, Trump, Cruz and Corn
description: Sarah Palin is really falling apart.

title: Kentuckys Bizarre Attack on Health Reform
description: Gov. Matt Bevin of Kentucky is dismantling the states highly successful exchange on which people buy private health insurance policies or enroll in Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act. His shortsighted and pointless show of defiance against the Obama administrations health care reforms could harm thousands of people in Kentucky, who may fall between the cracks as the state shifts their coverage from its own exchange, known as Kynect, to the federally run exchange at HealthCare.gov.

title: The Poisoning of Flints Water
description: In November, I was the guest speaker at the American Civil Liberties Union of Michigans annual dinner. Before I spoke, the group called to the stage a longtime investigative journalist who had done tremendous work bringing the Flint water crisis to light. His name was Curt Guyette. He, in turn, recognized the scientists, doctors, politician, lawyers and activists who had helped in that quest.

title: Scalias Putsch at the Supreme Court
description: IN his vitriolic dissent last June from the Supreme Courts same-sex marriage decision, Justice Antonin Scalia accused the majority of having carried out a judicial putsch. Justice Scalia should know. He and his four conservative colleagues were then in the process of executing one themselves.

title: An Important Win in the Supreme Court for Class Actions
description: On Wednesday, the Supreme Court gave an important victory to regular Americans, ruling that companies may not avoid class-action lawsuits by offering to buy off the individual plaintiffs before they can establish a class of similarly harmed people.

title: America the Unfair?
description: Donald Trump and Bernie Sanders dont agree on much. Nor do the Black Lives Matter movement, the Occupy Wall Street protests and the armed ranchers who seized public lands in Oregon. But in the insurgent presidential campaigns and in social activism across the spectrum, a common thread is people angry at the way this country is no longer working for many ordinary citizens.

title: Republicans Ignore a Poisoned City
description: EVER since I became a conservative as a teenager growing up in the city of Flint, Mich., Ive heard again and again from Republican leaders about their commitment to minorities and the poor. Even today, we are told that conservative solutions exist for persistent poverty, for joblessness, for the masses of people, like those in my hometown, who live lives of quiet despair. House Speaker Paul Ryan has been especially eloquent on this point. If only Republicans would get a chance to prove it.

title: Does Iran Remain a Threat?
Barclays to Scale Back Asia Businesses as Part of Overhaul
description: LONDON  Barclays plans to scale back its operations in Asia, end its physical presence in several countries and eliminate what could be hundreds of jobs in the latest reshaping of its investment bank under a new chief executive, James E. Staley.

title: News Qs | 2015 Was Hottest Year in Recorded History, Scientists Say
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article 2015 Was Hottest Year in Recorded History, Scientists Say.

title: VW Admits Cheating in the U.S., but Not in Europe
description: LONDON  Volkswagen is staking out an aggressive response to its emissions-testing crisis in Europe, where most of the affected vehicles were sold, by essentially saying: We didnt cheat here.

title: Viewing Los Angeles Through a Creole Lens
description: The pulse of the train on the tracks sets a rhythm as its passenger cars seem to skim over Lake Pontchartrain in New Orleans. These six miles of nothing but sky above and water below are the gateway into the city by rail. Next come the cemeteries at the edge of New Orleans, and all of a sudden, a day and a half of travel ends at the Amtrak terminal in the business district. I had just completed the first leg of my cross-country journeyby sleeper train, starting in New York, and was beginning the second: a foray into the cultural ties between the Crescent City and California.

title: In Jersey City, a Room of Her Own
description: Nastasya Tsultsumova arrived in the United States as an exchange student at age 15, spending a high school year in Tulsa, Okla.

title: Introducing Modern Love: The Podcast
description: Dear readers (and listeners),

title: Hillary Clintons Paid Speeches to Wall Street Animate Her Opponents
description: Nine months after leaving the Obama administration, Hillary Clinton sat on a stage under the life-size model of a blue whale that hangs in the American Museum of Natural History.

title: Student Question | What Role Does Hip-Hop Play in Your Life?
description: How important is hip-hop to you? How has it helped you understand the world and yourself?

title: Let the People Rule, by Geoffrey Cowan
description: The 1912 presidential contest was the first in which many of the delegates to a party convention were nominated directly by voters in primaries rather than by party insiders in a number of states. Thirteen states held Republican primaries, and Theodore Roosevelt won nine of them. The right of the people to rule, he said at Carnegie Hall, is the great fundamental issue now before the Republican Party.

title: Full Report of the Litvinenko Inquiry
description: Findings by Robert Owen, a retired High Court judge in Britain, present the most damning official link between the death of Alexander V. Litvinenko in 2006 and the highest levels of the Kremlin.

title: Verdasco, Like Others, Finds Defeating Nadal Doesnt Guarantee Success
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  With Rafael Nadals dominance flickering with increasing frequency at major tournaments, more players have won a moment in the spotlight over the past four years by beating him. But each time, the glow quickly dims.

title: Acupuncture Offers No Benefits Over Placebo for Hot Flashes of Menopause
description: Acupuncture is no more effective for menopausal hot flashes than a sham version of the procedure, a randomized trial has found.

title: The Right Way to Stretch Before Exercise
description: For generations, gym students were taught to stretch before working out or playing games. Then the practice fell out of favor: Studies seemed to show that such static stretching (holding a pose for anywhere from a few seconds to several minutes) temporarily reduces muscular power, weakens athletic performance and increases the risk of injury. So most fitness experts currently advise against static stretches before exercise. But now a comprehensive new review of decades worth of research indicates that they might not be such a bad idea after all.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Alexander Litvinenko, Flint, Academy Awards
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Morning Agenda: Asia Markets Succumb to Jitters
description: ASIA MARKETS SUCCUMB TO JITTERS | Markets in Asia sank on Thursday, as traders surrendered to the fears that had sent shares tumbling the previous day, Amie Tsang reports in DealBook.Investor concerns over growth in China and oil prices drove global markets lower on Wednesday, pushing London and Japan into a bear market.

title: Pravue Cafe and Albanian Grill
description: A restaurant in Ridgewood, Queens, serving Albanian comfort food.

title: At Pravue Cafe, Albanian Home Cooking in Queens
description: The fries at Pravue Cafe and Albanian Grill taste as if they have taken a tumble in a perfect bowl of ramen and have somehow still emerged crisp. First fried, then baked, they arrive slightly sticky with a truffle glaze and pecorino Romano gone lax in the oven. But the verve comes from Vegeta, a synthesis of salt, sugar, spice and dehydrated vegetables engineered a half-century ago in Yugoslavia.

title: New York Today: Making It Official
description: Updated 9:23 a.m.

title: Arts Program Will Commemorate Battle of the Somme
description: LONDON  The Syrian National Orchestra for Arabic Music and Damon Albarn, the artists Yinka Shonibare and Imran Qureshi, and the composer David Lang are among those commissioned to create work for 14-18 NOW, an eight-month-long arts program that will commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Battle of the Somme.

title: Poll Watch: What to Make of the Sanders Surge
description: As Senator Bernie Sanders appears to gain momentum in his race for the Democratic presidential nomination, the breadth and depth of his support remain uncertain.

title: Ways to Be Free
description: When you grew up in an unmapped, unwired world and find yourself in this one  observing the panic when GPS fails or the extent of online status anxiety  you cant help wondering if somewhere along the way freedom got lost.

title: Pearson, Ex-Owner of Financial Times, to Shed 4,000 Jobs
description: Pearson, the troubled British publisher, said on Thursday that it would eliminate 4,000 jobs worldwide as part of a continuing restructuring by the former owner of The Financial Times and The Economist to shift its focus primarily to its international education business.

title: Rockefeller Foundation to Take Food-Waste Fight to Davos
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  The World Economic Forum suffers from no shortage of lofty goals  its theme two years ago was no less than reshaping the world  and the gathering of global power players still lends itself to high-minded ideals.

title: John Kasich Embraces His Back Story in Congress
description: With Congress so unpopular, most Republican presidential candidates are intent on bashing the institution and its members. Not so with Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio, who served 18 years in the House before leaving in 2001 and evidently has fond memories of his Capitol Hill years.

title: Bob Odenkirk Thinks Other Comedians Are Lousy Critics
description: When you played the lawyer Saul Goodman on Breaking Bad, your opinion of him was pretty low. Was there a particular moment or episode when your sense of him as a character shifted? Episode 1, Season 1 of Better Call Saul.

title: A Cassoulet Worth the Effort
description: Cooking is not always about simplicity and ease. Sometimes, particularly when its cold outside and the dark comes early, what you want in the kitchen is a project, a culinary jigsaw puzzle to solve. There is no greater one than cassoulet.

title: In the Bahamas, Scuba Diving With James Bonds Trainer
description: I taught Sean Connery to scuba dive, Stuart Cove said with an impish grin. And Ive got to be honest: He was petrified.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Tech-Firm Snacks
description: Tom writes: I work for a big tech firm that offers its employees free snacks. A colleague of mine thinks its acceptable to conceal his favorite snacks behind other items to retrieve them later. I think this is unfair. All of us should have the chance to serendipitously discover a delicious treat.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Sleep, Dopesmoker
description: The origin story of Dopesmoker sounds like a light-bulb joke co-written by Nancy Reagan and Sisyphus: Three California stoners decide to write a song about how much they love marijuana, but theyre so high that it takes them four years. When they finally deliver the song to their record label, the label refuses to release it. And so the band breaks up without the world hearing their wonderful heavy-metal jam about weed. Dont do drugs. The end.

title: Kamasi Washingtons Giant Step
description: On a late October afternoon in South Central Los Angeles, Kamasi Washington was facing what is for him an increasingly familiar problem: making a lot of big ideas fit into a single space, even one as large as the nearby Club Nokia, a rock-star-size venue where he would be performing in December. His recent triple album, The Epic, is a nearly three-hour suite for a 10-piece jazz band, backed by a 32-piece orchestra and a 20-person choir. Washingtons show promised to be a typical swirl of activity, a sprawling procession of dancers, musicians, DJs and singers unified by the magisterial sound of Washington himself, a 34-year-old tenor saxophonist who has emerged as the most-talked-about jazz musician since Wynton Marsalis arrived on the New York scene three decades ago.

title: Let Me Tell You About My Big Baby
description: What happens when a doctor predicts the wrong birth weight?

title: Bernie Sanders, and Simon and Garfunkel, Put Focus on Voters
description: With the help of the Simon and Garfunkel song America, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont has released a powerful 60-second commercial in Iowa that seeks to remind his supporters how far he, and they, have come  and to inspire them anew to caucus for him on Feb. 1.

title: Daniel Alarcn: By the Book
description: The author of At Night We Walk in Circles and City of Clowns taught Toni Morrison to 10th graders: Teaching a book, talking about it with young people, is the best way to fall in love with it.

title: Surrogates Add Grudges to Donald Trumps Match With Ted Cruz
description: As the Republican presidential contest looks increasingly like a two-man race between Donald J. Trump and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, members of the Republican establishment are left contemplating which candidate it finds more palatable at the top of the ticket.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Ads Diverge on Road to Caucuses
description: One ad, to the humming and harmonies of the Simon and Garfunkel song America, shows Americans working, farming and excitedly flocking by the thousands to see Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont on the campaign trail. Hope, it projects.

title: Fire at Ritz Hotel in Paris Stuns the Fashion Crowd
description: PARIS  Something like shock swept through members of the fashion crowd arriving here for the fall mens wear shows last week when they learned of a fire at the Ritz hotel.

title: Draft of Inquiry Report on Jimmy Savile Cites Flaws in BBC Culture
description: LONDON  A culture of deference to untouchable stars, an above the law attitude among members of management and a climate of fear at the BBC allowed Jimmy Savile, the disgraced British television personality, to carry out sexual assaults on children for decades, according to a leaked draft of an inquiry published on Thursday.

title: Gun Control Groups Say Bernie Sanders Is the Wrong Candidate to Support
description: A centrist organization and two other groups devoted to gun control are denouncing supporters of Senator Bernie Sanders who have been arguing that he has a strong record against gun violence, the latest salvo between backers of the Vermont senator and Hillary Clinton on the topic of firearms.

title: Grease: Live Prepares for the Small Screen
description: BURBANK, Calif.  Thomas Kail, the celebrated director of Hamilton on Broadway, strode across the Warner Bros. back lot here earlier this month and broke into a verbal tap dance. Well, hmm, lets see, he started to say in response to an impolite query from the person walking next to him (me). I think that there is always a learning curve. Going first, second, third isnt easy.

title: Perfectly Reasonable Question: Why Use an Old Photo?
description: A reader, Alyssa Pack, wondered about the use of a 14-year-old photograph to accompany a recent news story about a bombing in Jakarta. She called it disappointing and potentially misleading to readers. Ms. Pack added: There are several photos from the most recent attack, so I do not understand the purpose of using the one from 2002.

title: Russian Economy Stumbles as Stocks and Oil Prices Fall
description: The turmoil in global stock markets and the plunge in oil prices are shaking Russias economy, already wobbly from being cut off from Western finance by sanctions.

title: First Draft Focus: Throwback Thursday  Driving Mr. Dole
Cats Will Return to Broadway This Summer
description: Cats, one of the most successful musicals of all time, is returning to Broadway this summer.

title: Night Vale Creators to Start New Podcast Platform
description: The world of Welcome to Night Vale, the popular fiction podcast made up of dispatches from a surreal Southwestern town, is getting bigger.

title: Another Win for a Player Getting in Touch With Her Japanese Roots
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Naomi Osaka liked to think she had a universal appeal to the crowd that watched her 6-4, 6-4 win over 18th-seeded Elina Svitolina at the Australian Open on Thursday afternoon.

title: A Toast to a 100-Year-Old Spy Catcher
description: Dear Diary:

title: Bracing for a Blizzard, From the Deep South to the Northeast
description: WASHINGTON  At a grocery store on H Street, not far from the Capitol, the shelves were nearly picked clean of water bottles by Thursday afternoon. Lawmakers, fearful of the coming blizzard, scurried to catch early flights out of town. And the regions mass transit system took the rare step of announcing it would shut down for the weekend.

title: 10 Sundance Movies With Heat
description: A look at select films screening at the Sundance Film Festival.

title: Airbnb Takes Its Case to U.S. Mayors Conference
description: WASHINGTON  Chris Lehane, Airbnbs head of global policy, appeared on Thursday before hundreds of American mayors with an enticing pitch: Team up with us to collect millions of dollars in taxes for you.

title: Rick Owens: Fall 2016
description: Fall 2016 looks from Rick Owens.

title: 1891: King Kalakaua Is Embalmed
description: The body of the late King Kalakaua was embalmed at San Francisco last night, and to-day the remains were placed in a metal casket hermetically sealed, and conveyed to the mortuary chapel in Trinity Church, where they will be guarded by United States soldiers. The remains will not lie in state, and will not be exhibited to the public. At one oclock on Thursday afternoon funeral services will be held at Trinity Church. King Kalakauas body will be taken from San Francisco by Rear-Admiral Brown to Honolulu in the United States cruiser Charleston. The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 22, 1891

title: Republicans Take Aim at Marco Rubio With Negative Ads
description: Senator Marco Rubio, who is placing only as high as third in most state and national polls, has been the target of more attack ads than any other candidate  more than $20 million worth since the first week in December, a huge sum that may help explain why the Florida senator is struggling to gain ground on his rivals for the Republican nomination.

title: Catholic Churchs Hold on Schools at Issue in Changing Ireland
description: DUBLIN  The Roman Catholic Church has lost the battles over divorce, contraception and gay marriage in Ireland. But it still wields what some parents call the baptism barrier: influencing admission to public schools.

title: In Britain, New Creative-Business Website Draws Support
description: LONDON  The fashion folk were arriving in Paris for the mens wear shows, and Prime Minister David Cameron was at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland. But the lights were still burning Wednesday night at 10 Downing Street for a gathering of Britains design talent and to toast the introduction of Creative Entrepreneurs, a website intended to help what it calls creative people become successful.

title: Daily Report: Mr. Dorseys Companies Go on a Wild Stock Market Ride
description: It isnt easy being a paper billionaire.

title: Editing a Gmail Inbox Trip Bundle
description: Q. I generally like the way Gmail Inbox collects all the messages related to travel, and groups them together so I have my flight information, hotel and rental car under one heading on my Android phone. However, I noticed that for a coming trip, the collected information has me listed in the completely wrong hotel. I dont know how this happened, but can I get rid of the incorrect information in the Trips grouping?

title: Evidence of Burial Ground Is Discovered in East Harlem
description: For nearly a decade, keepers of Harlems historical flame have insisted  in the face of official skepticism  that a significant antebellum landmark lay beneath an enormous bus depot near the Harlem River.

title: Kolor: Fall 2016
description: Kolor presents looks for fall 2016.

title: Kelly Zutrau of the Band Wet Has Plenty to Say
description: The band Wet is obsessed with endings. I think we better quit while were ahead, the songwriter and singer Kelly Zutrau announces on the single Youre the Best. But this is only the beginning of the road for this moody New York and Massachusetts electro-R&B trio. After building buzz last year with a barrage of immaculate singles and appearing on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, the band will release its debut album, Dont You, on Friday, Jan. 29, on Columbia Records. It will also tour the United States and Europe, with stops at the Bowery Ballroom on Jan. 28 and Rough Trade in Brooklyn on Jan. 29; unannounced major festival dates are looming on the horizon.

title: The Body of an American Visits Battle Zones of the Field and the Heart
description: One body you wont see in the seats for The Body of an American, Dan OBriens play at the Cherry Lane Theater starting Feb. 10, is its main subject and inspiration, the Canadian war reporter and photographer Paul Watson. Not because Mr. Watson, 57, is dead or incapacitated  he has cooperated happily with Mr. OBriens requests for documents and recordings from his work and life, and he participates willingly in post-show talk-backs when he can.

title: Lincoln Center Festival Announces Summer Season
description: The Lincoln Center Festival announced Thursday that its summer lineup would include the familiar and the new, including Noh theater, Shakespeare, music by Steve Reich, ballet, and, for the third time, appearances by Goran Bregovic, a Balkan musician and composer, and his Wedding and Funeral Orchestra.

title: Snowy Gridlock in Washington
description: Slick streets caused problems for drivers and pedestrians in Washington on Wednesday as snowfall paralyzed traffic in the evening.

title: Winter Storm Aftermath: Live Updates
Lleyton Hewitt Ends Aptly: Sprinting, Cursing, With a Few Tears
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  It was finally time to go for Lleyton Hewitt, and although it might have been time to go rather sooner, who could begrudge him this?

title: Assessing the Road to the Syrian Peace Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS  Diplomats have been working nonstop this week to set the groundwork for Syrian peace talks that were scheduled to, but will not, begin on Monday in Geneva. On Wednesday, Secretary of State John Kerry and Russias foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, met in Zurich to discuss the matter, but the meeting broke up inconclusively. On Thursday, Mr. Kerry said that the talks would take place soon, delayed by a day or two, but that the rivals would not sit in the same room. It was a stark measure of the gulf between them.

title: Brooklyn Rider Gets a New Cellist
description: One-fourth of the innovative string quartet Brooklyn Rider will soon change: Eric Jacobsen, its cellist, plans to leave to concentrate on conducting, the group said on Thursday. He will be replaced by Michael Nicolas, a classmate of his at the Juilliard School who has played with other groups dedicated to new music, including the International Contemporary Ensemble

title: Ted Cruz Mines Donald Trumps Twitter Feed for Policy Shifts
description: Senator Ted Cruz, who is scrambling to come up with ways to fend off sustained attacks from Donald J. Trump on his policies and personality, has been digging around in the archives of Mr. Trumps Twitter feed.

title: As Jeb Bush Struggles, Some Allies Blame His Super PAC
description: When Jeb Bush and his allies began helping the super PAC supporting him raise more than $100 million last year, his bid for the Republican nomination seemed like a safe bet. But as Mr. Bushs campaign continues to lag, his backers are increasingly turning their frustrations over his floundering candidacy on the group, Right to Rise, and its inability to influence the race.

title: Activists, Journalists and Celebrities: Chinas Televised Confessions
description: A look at some men and women whose confessions of crimes were aired on Chinese state television in recent years.

title: At Lemaire, Tailoring With a Sense of Ease
description: The fall/winter 2016 mens show drew inspiration from portraits of craftsmen and workers in the early 1900s.

title: Review: Youngblood, an Urgent Novel About the Iraq War
description: Matt Gallaghers 2010 memoir, Kaboom: Embracing the Suck in a Savage Little War, grew out of a popular blog he wrote while stationed in Iraq for 15 months, beginning in 2007. By turns thoughtful and irreverent and darkly funny, that book possessed an electric immediacy  a you-are-there sense of what it was like to be a grunt in the hot desert sands outside Baghdad, hunting for I.E.D.s and bomb factories, negotiating with local sheikhs and frightened civilians, and grappling with the absurdities of military bureaucracy.

title: At Raf Simons, Americana With a Dark Side
description: For his first mens show since exiting Dior, the designer was inspired by Twin Peaks and The Breakfast Club.

title: China Uses Foreigners Televised Confessions to Serve Its Own Ends
description: BEIJING  For seven years, the young Swedish man had directed a nongovernmental organization in Beijing that offered legal aid to Chinese citizens in trouble. Now he was a captive of Chinas legal system, forced in police detention to speak on video about his so-called crimes.

title: 1941: U.S. Lifts Embargo on Russia
description: WASHINGTON  In a surprise move late tonight [Jan. 21], the State Department announced the lifting of President Roosevelts moral embargo against the Soviet Union by which American manufacturers were prevailed upon not to ship airplanes, aeronautical equipment and materials essential to airplane manufacture to nations resorting to unrestricted aerial warfare against civilian populations. There is a catch remaining, however, in the fact that, although the moral embargo has been lifted against Russia, all the articles covered by the embargo are now subject to the export license system. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 22, 1941

title: Below the Line: Designing The Martian
description: The secret to building a believable-looking Mars on screen? Rocks, plenty of rocks.

title: Works Sighted: Ursula Le Guin on the Oregon Occupation
description: Ursula Le Guin, the author of the famous Earthseaseries and a longtime Oregon resident, was displeased with The Oregonians coverage of the armed occupation of the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge. In a letter to the editor of the paper, she wrote:

title: Donald Trump or Ted Cruz? Republicans Argue Over Who Is Greater Threat
description: WASHINGTON  With Donald J. Trump and Senator Ted Cruz battling for the Republican nomination, two powerful factions of their party are now clashing over the question: Which man is more dangerous?

title: Kevin Spacey an Unusual Davos Suspect
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  President Obama may not be here at the World Economic Forum, shaking hands with fellow dignitaries as the snow flurries swirl. But another American president  albeit a fictional one  has been a talk of the town this week.

title: Key Findings From the Litvinenko Report
description: A summary of the report by Robert Owen, a retired High Court judge in Britain, on the killing of Alexander V. Litvinenko.

title: Video Review: Chevy Volt Impresses With Tech, Design and Driving Pleasure
description: THE concept of the first Chevrolet Volt was simple  drive 40 miles or so on battery power alone and then continue the journey with a gas-powered generator. In short, driving to Duluth could be a drop-of-the-hat decision. From Anchorage.

title: Iggy Pop and Josh Homme Team Up for Post Pop Depression
description: LOS ANGELES  Now that youre all greased up, how about Lust for Life? Iggy Pop said in a voice that was part Midwestern twang, part grizzled prospector to his new band as they rehearsed at a North Hollywood studio. Although it was Mr. Pops first time singing with the group, which had been preparing on its own, the mood shifted quickly from tension to elation. After each song, Josh Homme of Queens of the Stone Age, who assembled the musicians, asked Mr. Pop if he wanted to wrap up, but Mr. Pop kept calling for more: first new songs and then oldies from The Idiot and Lust for Life, his two late-1970s collaborations with David Bowie. Mr. Pop, 68, wore a dark, patterned shirt, baggy black pants and sandals. He had started the rehearsal seated, conserving his energy, but by the end he was strutting.

title: Kent State Professor Investigated for Possible Ties to ISIS
description: An associate professor at Kent State University in Ohio is under investigation by the Federal Bureau of Investigation over possible involvement with the Islamic State.

title: How Much Should a University Have to Reveal About a Sexual-Assault Case?
description: Five years ago, the United States Department of Education got serious about addressing campus rape. In a 19-page Dear Colleague letter that was sent to almost every American college and university, the department reminded institutions of their obligation, under the federal law known as Title IX, to protect students from sexual violence. Universities that failed to take prompt and effective steps to investigate and adjudicate allegations of sexual assault, the letter warned, risked losing millions of dollars in federal funding. Most institutions took heed and adopted the policies laid out by the department.

title: Dresses Our Brides Have Worn
description: A selection of wedding day looks from brides recently featured in our announcements.

title: Guantnamo Detainee Refuses Offer of Release After 14 Years in Prison
description: WASHINGTON  Three Guantnamo detainees were slated to leave the American prison in Cuba this week after about 14 years in captivity. But early Wednesday morning, only two were willing to board the plane.

title: Sarah Palins Facebook Fans Say Backing Donald Trump Is Disingenuous
description: Sarah Palin made her return to national politics this week with a rousing endorsement of Donald Trump, praising the billionaire developer for his penchant for going rogue and lashing out at Republicans who say he is not sufficiently conservative.

title: High-Rise Living Linked to Lower Survival After Cardiac Arrest
description: The higher the floor you live on, the lower your chance of surviving a cardiac arrest, according to a new study.

title: Dear Yeti and The Thing About Yetis
description: When I was growing up, the Yeti  who back then went by the more formal and forbidding name abominable snowman  was a creature capable of stirring up serious fear. Like the Loch Ness monster, this gigantic people-eating being actually existed, we children knew. There were, predictably, adult doubters. That made the question of whether he was merely mythical a topic every curious child had to investigate. My own research resulted in a habit of mind Ive carried with me all these years, swinging between a creeping horror at all the unsettling supernatural realities most adults are too thick-headed to even acknowledge, and that feeling that comes after a good debunking  a mixture of emotional comfort, intellectual pleasure and condescending pity aimed at the still benighted myth-believers.

title: Lydia R. Diamonds Smart People Begins Previews at Second Stage
description: Lydia R. Diamond, whose Stick Fly was seen on Broadway in 2011, dives again into thorny territory in Smart People, which begins previews Tuesday, Jan. 26, at Second Stage Theater. Set just before President Obamas first election, the play explores the romantic interactions and careers of four racially diverse characters, all with ties to Harvard University.

title: Platonic, Until Death Do Us Part
description: Please check out the newly launched Modern Love: The Podcast.

title: The Beauty Parlors of Bangladesh
description: Dhaka, Bangladesh  EVERY winter, I return here to my hometown, and every year, I feel a little shabbier. This time, when I was meeting a few old school friends at a neighborhood cafe, I finally understood why: the blow-dry. Everyone else had one. Everyone else had gone to the beauty parlor, and I hadnt.

title: Building the Future in Israel
description: JERUSALEM  Dizengoff Street in Tel Aviv is always bustling. Youngsters, families and tourists fill its shops, cafes and bars. On Jan. 1, this boulevard became the site of another terrorist attack on Israelis. First, two young men were gunned down in a bar; then, as he fled the scene, the terrorist killed a taxi driver. Several others were injured.

title: Former Academy President Says Film Industry Needs More Diversity
description: LOS ANGELES  A former president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences on Thursday suggested in an unusual open letter to the entertainment industry that calls for an Oscar boycott be superseded by a broad effort to hire African-Americans, Hispanics, Asians, women, LGBTs, the disabled and all under-represented groups.

title: A Pinot Noir From Argentina That Stands Out in a Sea of Malbecs
description: MAINQU, Argentina  The flat, dry Ro Negro Valley on the northern end of Patagonia wont strike anybody as a glamorous wine region. For one thing, apple and pear orchards, along with platoons of poplar trees, far outnumber grapevines. For another, the restaurants, hotels and the usual camp followers of the winemaking life are nowhere to be found.

title: Dov Charney Argues in Court for His Return to American Apparel
description: Dov Charney, the colorful ousted founder of American Apparel, made a last-ditch effort to wrest back control of the company on Thursday, accusing former partners of stealing away his multimillion-dollar empire and declaring that his new alliance with investors was the only way to save it.

title: Marco Rubio, After Hitting Chris Christie, Is Suddenly All Too Glad to Go at Jeb Bush
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Senator Marco Rubio of Florida has directed much of his fire on the campaign trail in recent weeks at Gov. Chris Christie, using town halls in this state and in Iowa to unfurl a long list of the New Jersey governors deviations from conservative orthodoxy.

title: How Symantec Let Bad Math Lead to a Shaky Deal
description: If Benjamin Disraeli had been an investor, he might have been credited with saying Lies, damned lies and M.&A. math instead.

title: Telling Jewels From Junk in DNA
description: When you learned about genes in high school, chances are it went something like this:

title: Hsin Wangs De-Selfing Series
description: The photographer uses faceless subjects and vivid symbolic props to capture the melancholy of heartbreak.

title: Haunting, Beautiful Images That Capture the Melancholy of Heartbreak
description: After ending a serious relationship six years ago, the photographer Hsin Wang was left questioning not just the partnership but also herself: What did she do wrong? What could she have done differently? What was wrong with her?

title: Lindsey Graham Says Nominating Donald Trump or Ted Cruz Would Be Death of the Party
description: Unleashing perhaps the sharpest Republican criticism of the partys top presidential contenders, some Senate Republicans on Thursday said they doubted whether Senator Ted Cruz of Texas could win the general election.

title: Italys Famed Palio Horsemen Decline Royal Invitation
description: ROME  When Her Majesty calls, the commoners hasten? Not necessarily.
