Thousands of flights were canceled; governors and mayors warned people to stay indoors and off the roads.

title: Amit Singh of Google for Work: A Respectful Clash of Ideas
description: This interview with Amit Singh, president of Google for Work, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant

title: Whats on This Week Around the World
description: Various cities

title: Daily Report: Airbnb Urges Mayors to Please Tax Us
description: For a company that once resisted collecting local taxes, Airbnb has taken a decidedly pro-tax turn.

title: Pet Amenities for New Yorks Lucky Dogs
description: Its morning at Mercedes House, the apartment complex on West 54th Street in Manhattan, and the little ones are frolicking in the loft area, near a big caterpillar-shaped play structure. Later, they might be taken out for a walk. And when theyre all tuckered out, they can curl up on cots.

title: The Bundy Gangs Latest Stunt
description: There are many reasons to be disturbed by the fact that a band of armed thugs has occupied federal land in Oregon for nearly three weeks with hardly more than a shrug from the authorities. For one thing, if the ringleader were named Hassan instead of Bundy, the right-wing circus on the presidential campaign trail would have been demanding a nuclear response long ago.

title: Tunisia Sets Nationwide Curfew Amid Growing Unrest
description: TUNIS  The Tunisian government imposed a nationwide curfew on Friday after protests against unemployment spread across the country and grew more violent, in an echo of the Arab Spring uprising five years ago.

title: Israeli Forces Remove Dozens of Settlers From Hebron Homes
description: JERUSALEM  Israeli troops forcibly removed about 80 Jewish settlers on Friday from two houses in Hebron, in the West Bank, a day after they moved into the buildings they said had been purchased from Palestinians.

title: Making the Screen Easier to Read
description: Q. Is there a way to view all pale gray type as black on the computer? Sad to say, we are not all 19 years old with perfect sight!

title: Replicas of Ghiberti Doors to Be Unveiled in Florence
description: ROME  For nearly 600 years, Lorenzo Ghibertis panels depicting scenes from the life of Christ on the north doors of the Baptistery in Florence were exposed to the elements and other vicissitudes of time.

title: How Larry Pages Obsessions Became Googles Business
description: Three years ago, Charles Chase, an engineer who manages Lockheed Martins nuclear fusion program, was sitting on a white leather couch at Googles Solve for X conference when a man he had never met knelt down to talk to him.

title: Film Forum Presents a 15-Film Coen Brothers Retrospective
description: Its high time. On the eve of their latest opus, the sibling writers-directors Ethan and Joel Coen are receiving a 15-film retrospective at Film Forum, encompassing their first feature, the neo-noir Blood Simple (1984), and their new Hail, Caesar!, a satire of studio-system Hollywood, on Feb. 4 (it opens in other theaters the next day). Also present are the thrillers (No Country for Old Men), the comedies (Raising Arizona) and the cult favorites (The Big Lebowski), laden with the Coens pungent plots and morbid humor.

title: Lincoln Center Will Create a Performing Arts Hall of Fame
description: Lincoln Center announced on Friday that it was moving forward with plans to create a performing arts hall of fame, with its first honorees to be chosen next month, an induction ceremony planned for June, and firms selected to design related installations across the campus.

title: Stuff We Liked: Judge Judy, Best Countries, Unlikely Job Hunts
description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: Inside the List
description: Primal Bond: Readers of Elizabeth Strouts novel My Name Is Lucy Barton  new on the hardcover fiction list at No. 1  may not be surprised that the story involves a troubled mother-daughter relationship.

title: Voice for Hazaras Laments Lost Chances in Afghanistans Tumult
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  AFTER his return to Afghanistan from exile, in 1986, Azizullah Royesh immediately became a tireless advocate of education as a bridge over the divisions that have made his country a battleground for decades.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Dark Money
description: This week, Jane Mayer discusses Dark Money; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; David Greenberg talks about Republic of Spin; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

title: Match the Car to the Star
description: Alex Vega has customized automobiles for hundreds of athletes and performers. Can you match the ride with its owner?

title: Judge Dismisses G.M.s First Ignition Defect Case
description: In an embarrassing setback for litigation against General Motors over its defective ignition switch, the first federal civil trial to decide the automakers liability ended abruptly on Friday after the plaintiff agreed to dismiss his claims.

title: Does Jeb Bush Want His Familys Help? Its Hard to Say, Even for Him
description: HAMPTON, N.H.  The question came from a self-proclaimed Bush-o-phile, and the answer offered a fascinating, if free-form, glimpse into Bush family dynamics.

title: When College Scholarship Programs Falter
description: EIGHT years ago, Eric Suder decided he wanted to use some of the fortune he had made in telecommunications technology to help students who were the first in their families to attend college.

title: Where the Stars Get Their Rides
description: DORAL, Fla.  Pablo Sandoval pulled up to a custom car shop here on a recent Friday afternoon hoping to do some business. He wanted to trade in the Porsche Panamera he was driving, order new sets of rims for his two Range Rovers, pick up the gray one that was being worked on and discuss the next car he would buy  a 2016 Rolls-Royce Ghost.

title: Winter Antiques Show Offers a Collection of Recent and Rare Works
description: The Winter Antiques Show is a short-lived galaxy of colliding worlds. Nearly every booth provides a glimpse into some areas of visual culture, from Egyptian antiquities to American folk art to postwar Italian art glass.

title: Mihara Yasuhiro: Fall 2016
description: Fall 2016 designs from Mihara Yasuhiro.

title: Mens Wear, Poetically: Rick Owens, Raf Simons, Dries Van Noten and Louis Vuitton
description: PARIS  Fashion has a serious case of narrative mania. Designers and their fans alike are so stoned on storytelling and the seductions of reference that one starts to yearn for the preliterate  or pre-Internet, anyway  world.

title: Essential Home Staging Tips
description: The practice of staging homes for sale has evolved over the past decade. Some ideas have changed, while others remain the same. The following is a list of current staging tips from the pros:

title: Russian Fund Under Scrutiny for Loan to Company Linked to Kremlin
description: MOSCOW  When a new government-backed investment fund opened five years ago, Moscow wanted to send a simple message: Russia was ready to take the politics out of business.

title: Cook Cassoulet!
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Some Evangelicals Struggle With Black Lives Matter Movement
description: For some Christians, support for the Black Lives Matter movement is a no-brainer. After all, Jesus opposed violence, opposed the taking of life and opposed racial distinctions. As the apostle Paul taught in his letter to the Galatians, there is neither slave nor free, for you are all one in Christ Jesus.

title: Flight Canceled Because of the Winter Storm? What You Need to Know
description: After weeks of unusually warm, occasionally downright balmy, weather, a blizzard watch is in effect for the tri-state area from Saturday morning through Sunday afternoon. The National Weather Service, which issued the alert, is predicting extremely dangerous travel because of heavy snowfall and strong winds. If youve planning to fly this weekend, take a moment now to refresh your memory about what youre entitled to  a hotel room? food vouchers?  should your flight be canceled.

title: Many Moves, One Borough
description: Arthur Miller spent much of his time in Brooklyn moving from one place to the next, with many of his residences within blocks of each other.

title: Arthur Millers Brooklyn
description: When Arthur Miller first visited his country cousins in Brooklyn in the early 1920s, Midwood was not just a neighborhood, it was a description. Patches of woods stood thick enough near their East Fifth Street home that the boys could hunt squirrels, rabbits and other small game. There were muddy paths and tomato fields, and big sacks of potatoes in the cellar.

title: U.S. Moves to Limit Emissions of Planet-Warming Methane
description: The Obama administration on Friday proposed a new rule aimed at curbing emissions of planet-warming methane from oil and gas drilling on public land. It would force companies to use equipment to capture leaked gas and raise the costs they pay for extracting fuel on government property.

title: Grigor Dimitrov, a Federer-Like Player, Loses Again to the Real Thing
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  From the beginning of Grigor Dimitrovs career, his stylistic similarities to Roger Federer were obvious. But as he has stagnated over the past 18 months, their differences are becoming more apparent.

title: Gosha Rubchinskiys Punk Scene
description: To show his fall/winter 2016 collection, the designer sourced diverse models from around the globe  via Instagram.

title: Talking Media With The Timess New Media Columnist, Jim Rutenberg
description: The Timess new media columnist talks about gearing up for the new job.

title: Michigan Governor Says Race Had No Role in Flint Water Response
description: The governor of Michigan said on Friday that race was not a factor in the states response to lead contamination in the drinking water in Flint, a poor, majority-black city where the supply has been tainted for more than a year, but for much of that time, state officials insisted that it was safe to drink.

title: The Price of Requiring Regulators to Do More Cost-Benefit Analysis
description: A bipartisan, if mildly conservative, group of senators has indicated that it will introduce legislation intended to increase the rule-making requirements on Wall Street regulators like the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Consumer Financial Protection Board.

title: Donald Trump, Challenging Political Correctness, Strikes a Chord
description: At a rally in Iowa this week, Donald J. Trump explained in bold terms and broad brush strokes the many ways he would improve the United States as president: building a wall, rebuilding the military, beating China on trade. When a protester chimed in to question how the Republican would do the things that he promised, Mr. Trump decided that instead of removing the man from the audience, he would respond.

title: At Lille Hotel, Meeting the Countesss Standards
description: From 200 euros a night, or about $215 at $1.07 to the euro.

title: At Chicago Restaurant, Foraging Fuels the Kitchen
description: I grew those sunchokes, our waiter said, referring to the pure under my sons grass-fed, espresso-cured hanger steak. Then he grabbed his phone to show my daughter pictures of a mushroom he had foraged.

title: The Seven Best Mens Coats (We Cant Wear Yet)
description: Ahead of this weekends impending snowstorm, we round up the slickest, furriest, most desirable designs from the fall/winter 16 runways.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Dark Money
description: Listen to this weeks podcast | Subscribe: iTunes | Stitcher

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Gloria Steinem
description: For his bookshop and website One Grand Books, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is the activist and author Gloria Steinem, who shares her list exclusively with T. She adds: If I were marooned on a desert island, I would want a book on edible plants and building a raft, but here are 10 I would choose for the pleasure of big and new understandings.

title: Opposition and Confusion at Hearing on Mayor de Blasios Horse Plan
description: Men in the telltale top hats of a horse-carriage driver. Campaign pins declaring love for animals. Pedicab drivers packed into the balcony of the City Councils main hearing room.

title: Bill Johnson, U.S. Olympic Downhill Skiing Champion, Dies at 55
description: Bill Johnson, a swaggering skier who in 1984 became the first American man to win an Olympic gold medal in downhill skiing, but whose life took a sharp, precipitous turn soon afterward, died on Thursday at an assisted-living facility in Gresham, Ore. He was 55.

title: The Snow Goose, a Welcome Stop Sign in Winter
description: Nature in New York City can still, quite literally, stop traffic: 30-pound snapping turtles hauling themselves from swamps onto six-lane expressways, mallard ducklings blithely following their mothers across the Bronx River Parkway at rush hour, a rainbow arching between Brooklyn and Staten Island.

title: Pakistans Unnecessary Martyrs
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  According to our security analysts, the massacre of students and teachers at Bacha Khan University in Charsadda on Wednesday proves that we are winning against terrorism.

title: Berluti Livens Up Its Leather  With a Little Help from a Tattoo Artist
description: The Brooklyn tattoo artist Scott Campbell has inked marquee fashion designers like Marc Jacobs, A-list celebrities such as Jennifer Aniston and the late Heath Ledger, and more recently, a certain T editor. Over the past few years, hes expanded into the art world, applying his designs to a surfeit of unconventional surfaces including ostrich-egg shells, dollar bills and burned tortillas. And now, as part of a collaboration with the storied luxury shoemaker and mens wear brand Berluti, Campbell brings his artistic eye to another kind of skin  the houses signature leather.

title: Group Backing Jeb Bush Draws on Jeopardy to Attack John Kasich
description: Sensing a possible surge by John Kasich in New Hampshire, Right to Rise, the super PAC supporting Jeb Bush, has unveiled a game-show-style attack ad against the Ohio governor.

title: What a Million Syllabuses Can Teach Us
description: COLLEGE course syllabuses are curious documents. They represent the best efforts by faculty and instructors to distill human knowledge on a given subject into 14-week chunks. They structure the main activity of colleges and universities. And then, for the most part, they disappear.

title: Belinda BencicIs a Phenom Who Loves to Lob
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  A few hours earlier, Belinda Bencic, still just 18, had secured herself a fourth-round match with Maria Sharapova at the Australian Open.

title: The Fashion News to Know This Week
description: A coup de Grace

title: Charlotte Rampling Says Oscars Boycott Is Racist Against Whites
description: PARIS  Charlotte Rampling, an Academy Award nominee for best actress, on Friday waded into the furor over the lack of diversity in the Oscar acting categories, saying that the supposed calls to boycott the ceremony were racist against whites.

title: Taxi Dave Rides the Airwaves
description: David Pollack, a.k.a. Taxi Dave, settled behind a microphone last weekend in the TriBeCa studios of WOR-AM (710) for his taxi-themed talk radio show, which has become popular with New York City cabbies and other listeners at 8 p.m. Sunday nights.

title: Japanese Chicken and Root Vegetable Stew
description: This nimono, or braised root vegetable stew, is the perfect way to use up the last of your winter C.S.A. box.

title: 1891: American Pork Is Vindicated
description: BERLIN  How proud the American hog would feel if he had been present at the discussion to-day [Jan. 22]. Herr Barth, in a speech full of sense and statistical arguments, certified to his healthfulness and cheapness. Witness England, Holland and Belgium; witness the 400,000lb. smuggled into Germany under the Dutch seal without bad results except to the man caught smuggling.

title: A Japanese Stew Puts Root Vegetables to Good Use
description: After years of shopping at the farmers market in the depths of winter, I finally have my root-vegetable game down. Ive figured out the perfect way to braise turnips (lots of butter, a small amount of chicken stock), mastered the too-many-parsnips conundrum (roast with olive oil and cumin salt), and even gotten my 7-year-old to appreciate the finer points of kohlrabi (sliced thin and eaten raw).

title: Homes for Sale in New York and Connecticut
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties are five-bedroom homes in Greenwich, Conn., and a Hartsdale, N.Y.

title: Too Big to Fail Banks Thriving a Few Years After Financial Crisis
description: Nearly eight years after the onset of the financial crisis, its unintended consequences continue to startle and amaze.

title: Arrest of Leftist Israeli Activist Underlines Political Split
description: JERUSALEM  Ezra Nawi, an Israeli Jewish plumber, has a long history as a left-wing activist helping Palestinians in their struggle against Israels occupation of the West Bank. Now he is under arrest in Israel, after a right-wing activist surreptitiously filmed him bragging about exposing Arab brokers who tried to sell Palestinian land to Jewish settlers. Such sales are a capital crime under Palestinian law.

title: Jane Jacobs and Other Shrewd Observers
description: Jane Jacobs was so consumed in the late 1950s by the writing of her manifesto, The Death and Life of Great American Cities, that her hair turned from auburn to white. In Becoming Jane Jacobs (University of Pennsylvania Press, $34.95), Peter L. Laurence dispels the sexist and condescending contemporary view that her canonical book was a collection of home remedies from a housewife whose only credentials were as an amateur observer of the citys sidewalk ballet.

title: Free Tuition at Harvard? Its Already Affordable
description: To the Editor:

title: How Stories Drive the Stock Market
description: Since the stock market began falling at the beginning of this year, there seems to have been a palpable change in the stories we have been hearing. Suddenly there is more willingness to entertain the possibility of a major stock market correction, or of an economic recession.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in the East Village, Lincoln Square and Park Slope, Brooklyn.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: Hillary Clinton Defends Speaking Fees Paid by Wall Street Firms
description: Hillary Clinton defended her paid speeches to Wall Street firms, rejecting the idea that the millions of dollars she earned in fees would sway her views on financial firms.

title: Netflix and Blizzard: What to Watch During the Storm
description: The winter storm in the Eastern United States might make it difficult or inadvisable for many to leave their homes this weekend. But instead of viewing this as a snowtastrophe, lets think of it as an opportunity to finally catch up on movies and TV. Heres a list of some worthy streaming video options, organized into four categories. Consider watching any or all of these, preferably while nestled under a warm blanket with the heat cranked up to 11.

title: A Picture of the Blizzards Aftermath
description: A satellite image from NASA shows the extent of the huge winter storm that blanketed the East Coast with snow on Saturday.

title: After Preparing for the Snowstorm, Prepare to Shovel
description: This storm, if the forecasts prove accurate, could not be better timed for most New Yorkers.

title: Man Who Tried to Attack Paris Police Acted Alone, Germany Finds
description: BERLIN  A man shot to death by French police officers this month acted alone and not as part of a wider terrorist organization when he approached a Paris police station armed with a meat cleaver and fake explosives, the German authorities said on Friday.

title: Chicken Tacos Let You Think Fast
description: A roasted chicken, or the remains thereof, is a wonderful thing to have on hand. So is a boiled one. I often simmer the chicken till done, remove the meat and toss the bones back into the broth to enrich it. Sometimes I simmer a few thighs for the same purpose.

title: Panoramic Hudson Views for $13.17 Million
description: A loft-like apartment on the seventh floor of 150 Charles Street, the Witkoff Groups condominium in the West Village that sold all 91 luxury units just a few weeks after sales opened three years ago, officially closed for $13,172,500.71, according to city records, and was the most expensive sale of the week.

title: Sothebys Announces $12 Million Loss Over Taubman Sale
description: For months, the art world had been wondering: Would the biggest guarantee in auction history pay off? Would Sothebys come out ahead, break even or be left holding the bag on a $515 million commitment to the collection of its disgraced former chairman, A. Alfred Taubman?

title: From Hospital to Condo
description: As hospitals have closed across the city, condominiums have claimed many of their remains.

title: On Yoenis Cespedes,Mets Have Reason to Proceed With Caution
description: We have seen the Mets rebuild. It worked. They are the reigning National League champions. They have done some things right.

title: How the Snow Storm Is Affecting Travel
description: The winter storm that has hit the East Coast this weekend has scrambled travel plans, leading to 10,850 flight cancellations and more than 5,000 delays since Friday, according to FlightAware. Airlines, ground transportation providers, hotels and attractions are all adjusting their schedules and policies. The following is whats happening so far.

title: Whitesboro, N.Y., in Reversal, Will Change a Logo Called Racist
description: The official seal of the Village of Whitesboro in central New York, depicting a wrestling match between the communitys founding father and the local American Indian chief, has survived decades of debate and discussion.

title: Food Airdrops to Syrians

description: To the Editor:

title: Russians Anxiety Swells as Oil Prices Collapse
description: KRASNODAR, Russia  Last year was bad enough financially for Sergei and Victoria Titov, both music teachers getting along in years. Her government salary was slashed by one third, and rampant inflation put some basic groceries like eggplant and cucumbers out of reach.

title: Alphabet Close to Overtaking Apple as Most Valuable Company
description: Alphabet could soon become the most valuable company in the world.

title: The Drugstore on the Corner
description: Wyckoffs Corner Pharmacy feels a world away from the chain pharmacies that have opened in the Brooklyn neighborhood lately.

title: At Wyckoffs Corner Pharmacy in Cobble Hill, Its Personal
description: The city can sometimes seem like a battlefield for chain pharmacies, where the last vestiges of vintage apothecaries can be found only in kitsch restaurants that open in former pharmacies. But actual mom-and-pop drugstores still exist, even in gentrified Brooklyn neighborhoods like Cobble Hill, where Wyckoffs Corner Pharmacy has endured for the past decade.

title: Measuring Health Care
description: To the Editor:

title: House Democrats Prepare for Retreat, and a Few Laughs
description: Looking to chart a road map for the election year ahead, House Democrats will huddle next week in Baltimore at a three-day strategy session that will include speeches by President Obama, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and the comedian Trevor Noah, the new host of The Daily Show.

title: Comme des Garons: Fall 2016
description: Rei Kawakubos vision for fall 2016 mens.

title: In Gun Debate, the Sides Arent Equal
description: To the Editor:

title: Who Ever Said No Two Snowflakes Were Alike?
description: As the East Coast braces for the first ferocious snowstorm of the season, we wanted to revisit a frosty adage: Is it true that no two snowflakes are the same? Never, ever ever?

title: Megan Hilty, Broadway Star, at Home
description: The staff at California New York Express Movers are well acquainted with Megan Hilty. After all, Ms. Hilty, who just opened in a Broadway revival of the farce Noises Off, has had her worldly goods hauled across the country five times. So far.

title: A New Year Chill on I.P.O.s
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  The market for initial public offerings has been all but dead since late last year. Dont expect that freeze to lift anytime soon, according to two top officials for the United States biggest stock exchanges.

title: Director of Manhattans Museum of Arts and Design to Step Down
description: The Museum of Arts and Design in Manhattan said Friday that its director, Glenn Adamson, 43, would step down at the end of March to work on exhibition, research and institutional development projects.

title: What I Love | Megan Hilty
description: Megan Hilty, a star of the Broadway revival of Noises Off, and her husband, Brian Gallagher, live in an Upper West Side rental.

title: Rape by Strangers
description: Late last year, a Brooklyn judge sentenced a 26-year-old man, Dexter Bell, to a minimum prison term of 100 years for raping four women in the course of one week during the spring of 2013. In each instance, Mr. Bell had approached his victim in late afternoon or early evening, briefly initiating conversation before dragging her into an alleyway or stairwell and waging his assault. The B12 bus route between Crown Heights and Canarsie was a preferred corridor for his predations; his youngest victim was 15.

title: An American Designer Takes Cerruti Back to Its Roots
description: PARIS  It was both a new beginning and a return to the past for the designer Jason Basmajian, who presented his first collection for Cerruti 1881 on a dark, rainy Friday afternoon in a showroom off the Place Vendme. At least its not snowing, said one of the attendees as he shook the rain from his expensive-looking blazer, a reference to the snowstorm working its way up the East Coast that many of the Americans here for mens fashion week seem to be obsessing over.

title: Some Charges Against Former Penn State Officials Thrown Out
description: A Pennsylvania appeals court on Friday threw out some of the more serious criminal charges against three high-ranking former Penn State administrators whose handling of the Jerry Sandusky child molestation scandal continues to be a flash point for the states flagship university.

title: How Cynthia Rowley, Fashion Designer, Spends Her Sundays
description: To judge from the society pages, the fashion designer Cynthia Rowley and her husband, Bill Powers, seem to be out on the town six days a week. But on the seventh day, the couple downshifts (slightly) into the rhythms of family life. Which is to say, We do extreme activities, said Ms. Rowley, 57, for whom family means her husband, a 48-year-old writer and art dealer, and two school-age daughters, Kit and Gigi. If your idea of unwinding is racing go-karts or singing Iggy Pop songs, then let them be your relaxation counselors. If not, try to hang on until the rocket returns to home base, a house in the West Village.

title: Sundance Officially Sidesteps Oscar Controversy, but Its Opening Film Doesnt
description: PARK CITY, Utah  The Sundance Film Festival, which has long championed diversity, both behind cameras and in front of them, did its best on Thursday, the festivals opening day, to stick to its knitting and avoid getting drawn into the #OscarsSoWhite controversy.

title: Pentagon Chief on Turkey, ISIS and Asia
description: At the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on Friday, Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter said that he wanted to see Turkey do more in the fight against the Islamic State. He also discussed peace in Asia.

title: Lindsey Vonn Is One Victory From Downhill Skiing Record
description: CORTINA DAMPEZZO, Italy  Elite female ski racers, coaches and technicians sip cappuccino on the sun-drenched deck of the Rifugio Duca dAosta lodge while gazing in awe at the Schuss, the most harrowing section of Cortinas Olympia delle Tofane downhill course.

title: Chris Christie to Return to New Jersey to Prepare for Snowstorm
description: Residents of New Jersey who have been missing Gov. Chris Christie during his presidential bid now know what it takes to bring him home: the threat of a big snow.

title: Workhorses
description: The photographer Julie McGuire captured images of the carriage horses of New York City. A mayoral proposal under consideration could significantly change the industry.

title: Central Park Carriage Horses, Steady as They Go
description: After Mayor Bill de Blasio announced a plan this week to reduce the size of the Victorian-era carriage-horse industry and relocate carriage horses to Central Park, virtually the only parties involved not heard from were the horses themselves. As ever, they maintained a dignified silence amid the hubbub.

title: Takata Airbag Flaw Linked to 10th Death; 5 Million More Vehicles Recalled
description: Federal safety regulators on Friday said that a man had died in late December when an airbag made by Takata exploded in the vehicle he was driving.

title: Talking Media With The Timess New Media Columnist, Jim Rutenberg
description: The Times has a new media columnist. Jim Rutenberg, who has been the chief political correspondent for The Times Magazine, will fill a role that has been empty since the death of David Carr last Feburary.

title: C.D.C. Issues Travel Alert for 8 More Locations Over Zika Virus
description: Federal health officials on Friday added eight destinations to the list of those to which pregnant women should not travel in order to avoid infection with the Zika virus, which has been linked to brain damage in newborns.

title: What Donald Trumps Retweets Reveal
description: Donald Trumps Twitter account has long been famous for its creative spelling and less creative insults. Now its rapidly building a reputation for something else: endorsing the work of bigots.

title: Popcast: Tropical House Movement
description: Ben Ratliff and Michaelangelo Matos discuss the genre.

title: Mexican Politician Is Freed From Jail but Must Stay in Spain
description: MEXICO CITY  Humberto Moreira, the Mexican politician who was arrested last week in Madrid on suspicion of laundering money, was released from jail on Friday but must remain in Spain and surrender his passport, a judge from Spains National Court ruled.

title: Academy Board Endorses Changes to Increase Diversity in Oscar Nominees and Itself
description: LOS ANGELES  Confronting a fierce protest over a second straight year of all-white Oscar acting nominations, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said on Friday that it would make radical changes to its voting requirements, recruiting process and governing structure, with an aim toward increasing the diversity of its membership.

title: The Bartender Bob Quiz
description: Mr. Bozic, the legendary Fanellis bartender, was known for his outlandish exploits, usually self-reported. They couldnt possibly all be true. Or could they?

title: After Last Call: A Bartender Trades SoHo for Serbia to Reclaim His Mansion
description: If youve heard of Bartender Bob Bozic, then youve heard the stories.

title: Givenchy: Fall 2016
description: Givenchys fall 2016 mens collection.

title: Robo-Advisers for Investors Are Not One-Size-Fits-All
description: Since the last major stock market plunge, back in 2008 and 2009, a new type of investment adviser has arrived on the scene.

title: Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley Cut Chiefs Pay
description: Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley have both cut the pay packages of their chief executives after a year when Wall Street was challenged by increased regulation and market turmoil.

title: U.S. and AlliesWeigh Military Action Against ISIS in Libya
description: WASHINGTON  Worried about a growing threat from the Islamic State in Libya, the United States and its allies are increasing reconnaissance flights and intelligence collecting there and preparing for possible airstrikes and commando raids, senior American policy makers, commanders and intelligence officials said this week.

title: Popcast: The Rise of Tropical House
description: -Listen to this weeks podcast| Subscribe: iTunes | RSS | Stitcher| Audioboom

title: Presidential Candidates, Silent on Presidential Power
description: DONALD J. TRUMP has declared that as president, he would bring back waterboarding and more as options for interrogating terrorism suspects. But anti-torture laws forbid that. Does he believe the Constitution would empower him, as commander in chief, to override those limits?

title: After Six Years, Marianne Boesky to Close Uptown Experiment
description: When Marianne Boesky opens an exhibition on Tuesday that pairs works by Donald Moffett with a series of pieces by the Arte Povera artist Pino Pascali, it will be the final show in her space on East 64th Street.

title: Why the Surge in Merger Litigation Fizzled
description: The takeover litigation boom has ended.

title: Interview: The Directors Behind a Mapplethorpe Documentary
description: PARK CITY, Utah  They got their start in New York in the 1980s, when they performed in nightclubs as a rock disco group called the Fabulous Pop Tarts. They directed Party Monster, the 2003 film about Michael Alig, club kid turned murderer. They produce RuPauls DragRace.

title: Haiti Postpones Presidential Runoff as Violence Rises
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  A runoff election to choose the next president of Haiti was delayed on Friday, less than 48 hours before it was to take place, as protesters who expected a rigged outcome began to block roads and burn voting centers.

title: Review: Chelsea Handler Chats Up Racism, Marriage and More
description: If you let someone with a talk-show background make documentaries, what you get, apparently, are talk-show-like documentaries  ones that ramble and lack focus and are more akin to visiting with a topic than to making a point about it.

title: Kansas Court of Appeals Voids Restrictive 2015 Abortion Law
description: In a split decision, the Kansas Court of Appeals on Friday held that the state Constitution, like the federal one, protected a womans right to an abortion and affirmed a lower court order blocking enforcement of a restrictive 2015 law.

title: U.S. May Put Forces at Iraqi Bases in Effort to Retake Mosul
description: PARIS  American commanders are considering whether to establish a presence at Iraqi military outposts and bases north of Baghdad ahead of a looming fight against Islamic State militants in Mosul, defense officials said Friday.

title: At Dries Van Noten, Psychedelic Cues Meet Military Tailoring
description: The designer was inspired by the graphic designer Wes Wilsons 60s posters, synonymous with the peace movement of the time.

title: New Suspect in Paris Attacks Is Detained, Belgian Officials Say
description: PARIS  The Belgian prosecutors office announced on Friday that it had detained a new suspect in the attacks in Paris and had released one who had been previously detained. But it said it would still require the man who was released to appear before a judge and limit his activities.

title: True Scandal of Deflategate Lies in the N.F.L.s Behavior
description: John Leonard is a professor at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology who roots for the Philadelphia Eagles, listens to sports talk radio when he is exercising, and teaches a course called Measurement and Instrumentation. When the Deflategate story broke after last years A.F.C. championship game between the New England Patriots and the Indianapolis Colts, he found himself fixated on it, yearning to dig into it from a scientific point of view.

title: Gainsbourg and Birkin, Fearless on Film at Lincoln Center
description: Charlotte?

title: The Timeshare Hard Sell Comes Roaring Back
description: For more than 25 years, Mary Ann Gutierrez, 77, has spent several weeks a year at on the southern shore of Lake Tahoe, Calif., often playing host to her children and grandchildren at one of two timeshare units she owns.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Opposing Factions Take to Facebook in Oregon Wildlife Refuge Dispute
description: PRINCETON, Ore.  As more people beg the armed antigovernment protesters who took over the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge here three weeks ago to go home, the protesters this week embarked on a new quest: a search for allies.

title: Cavaliers, No. 1 in the East, Fire Coach David Blatt
description: The Cleveland Cavaliers own the best record in the Eastern Conference and are one season removed from appearing in the finals, but no jobs are ever safe in the coaching profession. The Cavaliers made that clear on Friday afternoon by firing Coach David Blatt in an organizational shake-up three weeks before the All-Star break.

title: Snow Starts to Spread Across the Country
description: As the East Coast prepared for a major winter storm, many parts of the United States were already being blanketed by snow.

description: Behind the scenes of T Magazines photo shoots with some of the biggest names in entertainment, fashion, design  and photography.

description: Plus: Storefront Academy Harlems reception and a party for conservationists.

title: Ts Fashion Videos
description: With on-camera interviews, behind-the-scenes footage and exclusive access to fashion designers and insiders, T Magazine explores the vast world of fashion.

title: With Calm and Experience, John Kasich Connects in New Hampshire
description: WOLFEBORO, N.H.  At a Rotary Club meeting in Laconia, N.H., on Thursday, a woman confided that she feared whether the United States would be safe for her children and grandchildren, citing dangers like the Islamic State.

title: At Louis Vuitton, an Ode to Paris for Fall 2016
description: The designer Kim Jones celebrated the City of Light with his fall/winter 2016 collection for the French fashion house. Many models wore berets.

title: Four Killed in Saskatchewan School Shooting
description: OTTAWA  Four people were killed and an unknown number were injured in a school shooting in a small town in northern Saskatchewan on Friday, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police said.

title: Donald Trump Blasts Ted Cruz Using the Senators Own Words
description: Fighting neck-and-neck in the Iowa polls with Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, Donald J. Trump has gone negative, with a 60-second advertisement assailing Mr. Cruz over a hot-button issue with conservatives in Iowa: immigration.

title: Art From the Holocaust: The Beauty and Brutality in Forbidden Works
description: BERLIN  When Nelly Toll was 8 years old, during World War II, she rewrote the Cinderella fairy tale with a feminist twist. Instead of Prince Charming, a powerful princess invited Cinderella to live in her castle and enjoy a pianist performing in a sun-drenched room.

title: Berluti: Fall 2016
description: Berluti presents mens wear looks for next fall.

title: Abortion Opponents Rally in Washington
description: Anti-abortion activists took part in a March for Life event near the National Mall on the anniversary of the decision in Roe v. Wade.

title: Review: John Epperson Steps Out, Leaving the Diva at Home
description: One thing weve learned from the Superman myth is that the Man of Steel has a mild-mannered alter ego, Clark Kent, who few suspect has any connection to that heroic crusader. A similar relationship exists between the drag actor, singer and pianist John Epperson and his brilliant, brassy creation Lypsinka, one of the greatest creatures to emerge from the New York club scene.

title: Bill Cunningham | Spotted
description: The cat family doesnt change its colorsbut the fashion world is in a playful mood with one of its most popular patterns: the leopard print. Its intriguing to see all the variations of black and gray, some of them with an overlay of subtle color. One wearer highlighted her coat with creative details, such as a gold-bronze envelope bag; a necklace that blended with the coat, and a color cast of pale pink and aqua; and leopard-print fingerless gloves. Perhaps surprisingly, this fashion lover works in investment banking; her personal style of dress is her hobby.

title: Review: Elektra Runs Wild, With Ann Liv Young
description: Its hard to imagine Ann Liv Young and company doing what they did on Wednesday night more than once, let alone eight times, the length of their run at New York Live Arts in Chelsea. The brutal rawness and immediacy that weve come to expect from Ms. Young, a divisive performer and choreographer, reaches new heights  or newly disturbing depths  in her Elektra, which had its United States premiere alongside its even rowdier companion piece, Elektra Cabaret.

title: Review: The Book of Disquiet, Opera as One Man, With Films
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  O.K., opera lovers, try this one on for size: No one sings live. The only two vocal numbers are rendered on film by a Portuguese fado singer. The lone figure onstage, apart from the small orchestra, speaks throughout. The drama is all internal and mostly philosophical.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing: Academy Awards, Donald Trump, N.F.L.
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Photos of the Day: Serbia and Elsewhere
description: Serbia and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Review: A Ride on the Irish Cream, Erin Markeys Tale of an Odd Affair
description: Huh?

title: Jan. 22, 2016  Photos of the Day
description: Photos from Serbia, Ukraine, India and the United States.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Dirty Grandpa Features Robert De Niro on the Prowl
description: Dan Mazers crude, mindless Dirty Grandpa is like watching a friends mediocre improv troupe do an extended spring-break sketch. And your friend just happens to be Robert De Niro.

title: Review: Daniel Wohls Holographic Is Performed for the First Time
description: Unsurprisingly, in a digital age, multimedia performances have become pervasive at both uptown and downtown spaces. While contemporary works are most often accompanied by visuals, the standard repertory is not immune: A coming series at the 92nd Street Y will offer multimedia takes on Beethoven violin sonatas, among other pieces.

title: Review: The Boy, in Which a Doll May be Alive, or the Heroine May Be Mad
description: A creepy doll and a creepy house are the main ingredients of The Boy, a small-cast horror movie that spends a lot of time building itself into a psychological thriller, only to veer in a more literal direction at the end. It still has enough scary moments to satisfy horror fans, but youre left wondering whether it might have been more disturbing had it stayed on its original path.

title: Review: Keanu Reeves Undertakes an Investigation in Exposed
description: Exposed, starring Keanu Reeves, opened on Friday in the 23rd of 25 theaters in a New York City multiplex, with little fanfare and no screenings for critics.

title: Julien Duvivier, a Gallic Auteur at Home, and Jacques Feyder, One Abroad
description: Perennially ripe for rediscovery, Julien Duvivier (1896-1967) was a prolific if uneven filmmaker with a five-decade career that included a short stint in Hollywood and encompassed a variety of genres.

title: Philips Halts Sale of Controlling Stake in LED Business
description: Philips, the Dutch electronics giant, said on Friday that it had terminated an agreement to sell a controlling stake in its automotive and LED components business because of regulatory concerns raised in the United States. A group led by GO Scale Capital, an investment fund sponsored by GSR Ventures of China and Oak Investment Partners, agreed in March to acquire an 80.1 percent stake in the Philips unit, called Lumileds, for as much as $2.9 billion. Philips combined the lighting and LED components operations into a stand-alone company in 2014. Philips said in October that the closing of the deal was uncertain after the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States, an interagency body that includes representatives from the Treasury and Justice Departments, raised unforeseen concerns about the deal. GO Scale Capital has offices in Beijing, Hong Kong and California. It has said that its goal is to scale up its investments in China for global markets.

title: Fears About Chinas Economy Fester at Davos
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  At the World Economic Forum here, chief executives and investors are blaming China for a slump in global markets.

title: Steven Moffat Leaving Doctor Who in 2017
description: After six seasons of overseeing the exploits of a centuries-old alien adventurer, Steven Moffat plans to move on to other parts of the space-time continuum.

title: Anger in Michigan Over Appointing Emergency Managers
description: LANSING, Mich.  In the spring of 2013, Detroit was groaning under the weight of its troubles. It had accumulated billions in debt, was riddled with crime and had seen much of its affluent tax base disappear. A former mayor, Kwame M. Kilpatrick, was convicted of racketeering and fraud.

title: Storage of Records of Background Checks Shifted After Last Years Security Breach
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Friday said that the Defense Department would take over the storage of records from federal background checks, part of an overhaul prompted by a colossal cybersecurity breach at the Office of Personnel Management.

title: In Case of Blizzard, Do Nothing
description: In the winter of 1985 my hometown, Buffalo, was engulfed in a blizzard  not an uncommon occurrence for the region, which is justly famed for epic snows. But this was a big one, and the citys blustery Irish-American mayor, Jimmy Griffin, was at pains to persuade people to stop trying to go about their business as conditions deteriorated. He urged Buffalonians to relax, stay inside and grab a six-pack, which must be the best advice any elected official ever gave the public in an emergency situation.

title: On The Road (Personal and Trivial)
description: Just a note on radio silence: Ive been traveling  back home yesterday, and then basically fleeing the New York area, moving up a family-related car trip so as not to get trapped by snow. Destination safely reached, but bandwidth very limited, so no posts, musical or otherwise, today.

title: Community Gardens Imperiled by New YorksAffordable Housing Plans
description: Apart from a colorful hand-painted sign, there is little to suggest that the Mandela Community Garden in Harlem, a lot piled with pieces of pavement and bounded by graffitied walls and a chain-link fence, is a garden at all. The volunteers who pulled up the concrete had made plans for the spring, however: to pepper the dirt with wildflower seeds, make sculptures from the rubble and turn the lot into a verdant little oasis.

title: Google Pays Britain $185 Million to Settle Back Taxes
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Google on Friday agreed to pay 130 million pounds, or about $185 million in back taxes to Britain, making it the latest United States technology company to settle claims that it does not pay its fair share of taxes in Europe.

title: Judge Orders Medical Examination of Sumner Redstone
description: A California judge has ordered the ailing 92-year-old media mogul Sumner M. Redstone to undergo a medical examination, a major development in the continuing legal battle over his mental competence.

title: 2 Women Hurt in Robbery at Hotel Near J.F.K. Airport
description: A woman who had traveled to New York with her daughter was shot and her daughter injured after they were robbed outside a hotel near Kennedy International Airport, the authorities said on Friday.

title: Their Boss Stays on the Sideline, but Obama Aides Tilt to Clinton
description: WASHINGTON  The two leading Democratic contenders for president are competing to wrap President Obama in a tight embrace. He is hugging only one of them back.

title: Biking Through a Snowstorm in Washington
description: Follow the Times video journalist A. J. Chavar as he takes a bike ride to the Capitol as a blizzard took hold of Washington on Friday.

title: Mosquito-Borne Zika Virus Found in 3 New York State Patients
description: State health officials said on Friday that three people in New York State, including one from Queens, tested positive for Zika, a mosquito-borne virus that has prompted concern as it has spread rapidly, mostly in Latin America and the Caribbean.

title: The Oscars and Hollywoods Race Problem
description: WHEN we talk about diversity, or the lack thereof, we refer to it as a problem. This or that industry, organization or group has a gender problem or a race problem or some other kind of diversity-related problem. We identify the problem and discuss it, exhaustively, often contentiously, because the problem is significant, pervasive, and for those of us who are most affected, the problem is personal.

title: Sarah Palin, This Is What PTSD Is Really Like
description: AS a veteran, I want politicians and public figures to try and understand what military deployment is like, and to relate to my experiences. But Im not sure I want Sarah Palin weighing in.

title: UConn Undaunted by Uneven Start (Its Not March Yet)
description: STORRS, Conn.  In the $40 million basketball practice center at UConn, there are subtle and more obvious reminders of the Huskies most recent mens basketball glory: a giant banner commemorating the 2014 national championship team, and the folding chairs scattered throughout the gym taken from that years Final Four.

title: Who Needs Assassins When Youve Got Hackers?
description: Moscow  A BRITISH inquiry announced this week that Alexander V. Litvinenko, a Russian security officer turned defector who died in a London hospital of polonium poisoning in 2006, was probably murdered on the instructions of President Vladimir V. Putin. Thats little surprise. For more than eight years the world has suspected that the Kremlin was behind the assassination. (Just as surely, Mr. Putin has denied his responsibility. His spokesman Dmitri Peskov denounced the inquiry as a quasi investigation and an expression of the elegant British sense of humor.)

title: Clues Emerge on Robert Levinson, C.I.A. Consultant Who Vanished in Iran
description: When the United States and Iran swapped prisoners last week, nothing was said to resolve the mystery about another captive: Robert A. Levinson, a Central Intelligence Agency consultant who disappeared in Iran in 2007.

title: Academy Members Respond to Swift Changes for Board
description: The reaction to the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences saying on Friday that it was taking steps to double the number of female and minority members by 2020 was varied.

title: France Plans a New Keyboard to Shift Control to Typists
description: PARIS  Bad spelling? Incorrect grammar? Its all in the keyboard.

title: Boxer Sells for $785,000 at Christies
description: Looks like a knock-out.

title: The Fading Two-State Solution
description: Given the brittle relations between the Obama administration and Israel, even truth-telling can ignite a firestorm. That happened this week when Daniel Shapiro, Washingtons ambassador in Tel Aviv, delivered a speech that drew unfair rebukes from Israels prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, and his right-wing government.

title: A Waiting List for Justice in New Orleans
description: On Wednesday, the New Orleans police arrested Deonca Kennedy after her 3-year-old grandson was killed by a bullet fired from a gun under her pillow as the two slept.

title: The X-Files in the Age of Truthers
description: To watch The X-Files in 2016 is a strange thing. The original television show was so much a child of the peaceful 90s that its easy to forget it actually limped along until 2002. Its best seasons aired after the Gulf War and before 9/11, and took place in a version of the United States where the government apparently had so few terrestrial problems to deal with that its highest priority was keeping its citizens in the dark about aliens.

title: Ted Cruz Condemns Donald Trump for His Use of Eminent Domain
description: Attacked first in a Donald J. Trump ad, Senator Ted Cruz swiftly responded on Friday with a commercial assailing Mr. Trump over his real estate background.

title: Coming to Terms with Donald
description: Americans of all races, creeds and political persuasions are united today in the realization that, good grief, Donald Trump actually could become the Republican presidential nominee.

title: Success Academy Founder Defends Schools Against Charges of Bias
description: Eva S. Moskowitz defended her Success Academy charter schools on Friday, two days after a group of parents filed a federal complaint accusing the network of discriminating against students with disabilities.

title: Mythological Subject for Leonardo, Correggio and Rubens
description: Administrivial Important PRINT solving Alert! Due to a production error, there is a clue missing at 58 Down in the Sunday, January 24 crossword puzzle in the Magazine. Apologies in advance for the spoiler, but that clue should be Follower of upsilon.

title: Spains Acting Prime Minister Declines Invitation to Form Government
description: MADRID  Spains acting prime minister, Mariano Rajoy, on Friday turned down an invitation by King Felipe VI to try to form a new government, prolonging the countrys political deadlock after inconclusive elections in December.

title: Lois Weisberg, Chicagos Cultural Connector, Dies at 90
description: Lois Weisberg, a whirlwind of civic enthusiasm whose decades of shepherding public arts projects to fruition deepened the cultural life and reputation of Chicago, died on Jan. 13 at her home in Miami. She was 90.

title: Clarence Reid, Singer and Songwriter Also Known as Blowfly, Dies at 76
description: Clarence Reid, a soul singer, songwriter and producer who under the alias Blowfly was a proto-rap innovator and a leading light of American outsider music, thanks to decades of parody songs, sexual and scatological in nature, died on Jan. 17 in hospice care in Lauderdale Lakes, Fla. He was 76.

title: Death of Man in Brooklyn Fire Is Called a Homicide
description: The death of a man discovered inside a burning apartment in Brooklyn on Friday morning has been ruled a homicide by the police, who said his throat was slashed and his body was covered with stab wounds.

title: Knicks Lose Their Cool, and a Game Slips Away
description: The Knicks watched Clippers center DeAndre Jordan put together a highlight reel for two and a half quarters before tempers finally boiled over.

title: Flood of Support After Bronx Councilman James Vacca Reveals on Twitter He Is Gay
description: James Vacca, a city councilman from the Bronx, had a message on Friday for his constituents  and the sundry users of the Internet: He is an out and proud gay man.

title: In Surprise, Mets Agree to a Deal With Cespedes
description: The Mets had spent the entire off-season leaving the strong impression that they did not expect the right-handed-hitting slugger Yoenis Cespedes to be with the team in 2016.

title: Review: At Communal Kitchen, a Local Harvest Through All Seasons
description: If you live on the east side of the Tappan Zee Bridge and head west to Nyack  which draws diners with its lively restaurant row  youre in for a show: The construction of the new bridge, alongside the existing span, features one of the worlds largest floating cranes, lit up like a Zipper ride on a midway. Called the Left Coast Lifter, the crane can hoist the equivalent of 12 Statues of Liberty.

title: Review: Laurel & Sage in Montclair Takes a Global Approach
description: Talk about tough acts to follow: Laurel & Sage opened last March at the address of the widely lauded restaurant CulinAriane, which closed in 2014 when its owners decamped to Verona.

title: Review: Da Legna, a Pizza Contenders Secret Weapon in New Haven
description: Some might say that the very act of opening a pizzeria in New Haven  the pizza capital (to locals, at least) of New England  takes serious audacia. This is, after all, the same town where hallowed institutions like Sallys Apizza, Frank Pepe Pizzeria Napoletana and Modern Apizza have for decades vied for the most critical raves and fervently devoted fans.

title: Cespedes Deal Proves Mets May Know a Thing or Two
description: We have seen the Mets rebuild. It worked. They are the reigning National League champions. They have done some things right.

title: Two Teenagers Charged in Hate Crime Attack Against Muslim Man in the Bronx
description: Two teenage boys were arrested on Friday and charged with assaulting a Muslim man in the Bronx last week while shouting Isis! Isis!, the police said.

title: Two Mets Reach Deals
description: The Mets reached agreements with Lucas Duda and Jenrry Mejia, avoiding arbitration with both of them, a person in baseball said. Duda, a first baseman who has hit 57 home runs over the past two seasons, could be called upon to provide much of the power in the teams lineup in 2016. Mejia, a relief pitcher, missed most of the 2015 season because of two suspensions after he tested positive for performance-enhancing drugs. The Mets will not have to pay him until his suspension ends midway through the season.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: Like a thruway pileup, Saturday is ripe for bottlenecking  whether the antics of the Entourage guys or the rise and fall of some R&B legends. Meanwhile, the comedians Whitney Cummings and Chelsea Handler assume the warrior position in the battle of the sexes.

title: Review: Venetian Warmth at Bacaro Italian Tavern
description: This is my kind of restaurant: warm and friendly, with good food, large portions and moderate prices, said one of my dining companions about Bacaro Italian Tavern in Massapequa Park, which opened in November.

title: Senior Care Facilities With World-Class Art
description: Artworks by Robert Rauschenberg, Ellsworth Kelly, Marc Chagall and Alex Katz adorn the walls. There is a fabric and paper collage by Romare Bearden, and a drawing by Diego Rivera. A corridor is lined with 10 silk-screened portraits by Andy Warhol and a few of William Wegmans photolithographs of his bedecked Weimaraner dogs.

title: Review: Passions Ignite in Lives of Reason at Two River Theater
description: It is likely that Robert Rechnitz and Kenneth Stunkel enjoyed some chuckles while collaborating on Lives of Reason, their play being presented in a world premiere at Two River Theater in Red Bank.

title: Review: At Hartford Stage, Friendship Forged Through Somalia War
description: The current Hartford Stage production depicts two men  one of them representing the playwright  talking mostly by email, with some bare-bones dramatization of a few of their stories.

title: The Art of Maxfield Parrish
description: For much of the first half of the 20th century, a quarter of American homes were decorated with art by Maxfield Parrish, said Judy Goffman Cutler and her husband, Laurence S. Cutler. They are the curators of Maxfield Parrish: Paintings and Prints From the National Museum of American Illustration, an exhibition at the Nassau County Museum of Art in Roslyn Harbor.

title: Corrections: January 23, 2016
description: NEW YORK

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We are watching all this with alarm. It is clear that the government lacks the necessary resources to give us a normal life.

title: Talks to Restructure Puerto Rico Power Companys Debt Collapse
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico  Negotiations to restructure roughly $9 billion of the debt of Puerto Ricos power company collapsed late Friday, according to a statement from a group of creditors involved in the talks.

title: In an Ancient Tomb, a Hierarchy of the Dead
description: A 6,000-year-old tomb in Northern Spain provides valuable information about an ancient Neolithic community, according to a new study in the journal PLOS One. The tomb holds the remains of 47 individuals, laid to rest in several layers. Individuals in the bottom tomb were closely related, and family members were buried side-by-side, DNA analysis suggests. In layers above, however, the bodies appear to be missing skeletal parts, including skulls. The bones were manipulated, possibly for ritualistic purposes. . The analysis also showed that the community relied on cereals and other plant-based food for sustenance.

title: The Cult of Marie Kondo
description: On Wednesday evening, the tidy and the would-be tidy sat very still on the fourth floor of the Barnes & Noble bookstore at Union Square in Manhattan, craning to hear the soft voice of Marie Kondo, the Japanese author of The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up, as she demonstrated her folding technique on ever more complex garments. She was balletic and masterly. When done, Ms. Kondo received a standing ovation.

title: Review: Remaking the American Patient
description: Does any modern American doctor or patient get through a day without thinking wistfully of simpler times? The process of providing or securing even basic health care is so endlessly complicated now, so perilous and frustrating, so entrepreneurial and expensive. Everything was so much easier in the old days. Just beam us back, someone, please.

title: The New Side Job for Actors and Artists in Los Angeles: Driving
description: LOS ANGELES  When Lauren McKnight, 27, isnt appearing on television shows for VH1 and ABC, shes driving a black Scion xA, picking up Hollywood executives on their way to the airport.

title: Alice Walker and Colm Toibin, and Their Trail of Words
description: One of the special pleasures of movies and plays based on great novels is the way they lead us back to their literary roots. Playing the images and emotions from stage or screen against the ones in our head while reading the original creates a doubled experience.

title: Palestinian Girl With Knife Killed by Israeli Guard, Police Say
description: JERUSALEM  A 13-year-old Palestinian girl was fatally shot by an Israeli security guard at the entrance to a West Bank settlement on Saturday after she ran at him with a knife, according to the Israeli police.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took followers from the campaign trail to the aptly named Jellyfish Lake.

title: Snowstorm Sends Heavy Snow Across East Coast
description: More than 25 inches of snow fell on parts of Washington and New York by the end of Saturday.

title: Kenzo: Fall 2016
description: Fall 2016 designs for Kenzo from Humberto Leon and Carol Lim.

title: Sacai: Fall 2016
description: Mens wear designs for next fall from Sacai.

title: As Frustrations With Mexicos Government Rise, So Do Lynchings
description: AJALPAN, Mexico  The lynching began around 7:20 p.m., not long after the brothers had finished conducting their final interviews on tortilla consumption.

title: Major Cities Grind to a Halt and Face Days of Digging Out Snow
description: Making up for a remarkably mild winter, the first major snowstorm of the season charged up the East Coast on Saturday, a blizzard propelled by tropical-storm-force winds that brought much of the Northeast to a standstill and left more than two feet of snow in New York City, where Mayor Bill de Blasio called it very likely one of the worst snowstorms in our history.

title: A Little Variety': We Welcome Your Comments
description: A LITTLE VARIETY  Were trying something new  a weekly place to gather and discuss the A Little Variety puzzles that publish online on Thursdays and appear in the Sunday Magazine. You are welcome to talk about the puzzles in the comments section.

title: Wonks and Minions
description: One of the differences between right and left in America is that the progressive infrastructure includes a contingent of genuine wonks  commentators on policy who really do make models and crunch numbers, and sometimes come up with answers that arent fully predictable from their politics. The list includes Ezra Klein, Jonathan Cohn, Jonathan Chait, Mike Konczal, myself some of the time, and others. Right now the wonk brigade has been weighing in on Bernie Sanders, and is in general not too impressed on either financial reform or health care.

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: The Chatter on Messaging Apps
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: An App Helps Teachers Track Student Attendance
description: Over the years, Etta Covington, a science teacher at Wadleigh Secondary School for the Performing and Visual Arts in Harlem, has seen her share of students who routinely show up late to class, cut classes or skip school altogether.

title: Bloomberg, Sensing an Opening, Revisits a Potential White House Run
description: Michael R. Bloomberg has instructed advisers to draw up plans for a potential independent campaign in this years presidential race. His advisers and associates said he was galled by Donald J. Trumps dominance of the Republican field, and troubled by Hillary Clintons stumbles and the rise of Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont on the Democratic side.

title: To Own or Lease?
description: Buying Financial Security

title: Terrorism Charges in Bangladesh for 14 Men Deported From Singapore
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  Bangladeshi authorities have filed terrorism charges against 14 Bangladeshi construction workers deported from Singapore on suspicion of involvement with Islamic militant networks.

title: Dior Homme: Fall 2016
description: The fall 2016 collection from Dior Homme.

title: Cordy Williamson: In Charge of the Branches
description: Cordy Williamson, 74, is a senior vegetation manager at Duke Energy Corporation in Florence, S.C.

title: S.E.C. Is Criticized for Lax Enforcement of Climate Risk Disclosure
description: As recently as 2011, shares in Peabody Energy, the worlds biggest private sector coal company, traded at the equivalent of $1,000. Today, they hover around $4 each. Over that time, investors who held the stock lost millions.

title: U.S. Students Detention by North Korea Was a Surprise, Tour Group Says
description: HONG KONG  An American student who is being detained by North Korea did nothing obvious during a five-day trip to the country that would have angered the authorities, a member of his tour group said Saturday.

title: Bing Xie of Texas Instruments: Simplicity and a Sense of the Familiar
description: Convenient crossroads

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: U.S. Relies Heavily on Saudi Money to Support Syrian Rebels
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama secretly authorized the Central Intelligence Agency to begin arming Syrias embattled rebels in 2013, the spy agency knew it would have a willing partner to help pay for the covert operation. It was the same partner the C.I.A. has relied on for decades for money and discretion in far-off conflicts: the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

title: Variety Puzzle: A Thoughtful Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Think carefully before you answer this question: What is the difference between the mind and the brain? You might not believe that there is a difference and, for some, the answer delves into spirituality. But for me, the brain is the THREE-POUND MASS OF JELLY inside our human skulls, and the mind is the consciousness that enables us to both CONTEMPLATE INFINITY and decide what we want to have for lunch. It makes us who we are individually, and it separates us from other species.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Enduring Fascination Of Imaginary Teams

title: Shoveling Snow Through the Decades
description: The snow itself has remained the same but the methods for clearing it have evolved over the last century.

title: Federer Is Aging Gracefully, but Australian Ken Rosewall Set the Standard
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Marvel at Roger Federer, who last year reached the Wimbledon final at age 33 and the United States Open final at age 34.

title: The Hairy Face of a Most Unlikely Winning Streak
description: VALENCIA, Spain  Five or 10 or 20 years from now, when all those who care about the basketball team here talk about the gloriously unexpected winning streak that began in October, stretched until mid-January and covered 28 games in six countries, they will talk about the upset in Madrid that started it all. Or the late comeback in Germany. Or maybe the overtime game against Bilbao.

title: How To Make Donald Trump President
description: Step 1: Democrats nominate Bernie Sanders. I dont think Sanders is unelectable, but when you look at polling, remember that Hillary Clintons numbers reflect her standing after more than two decades of constant character assassination, whereas Republicans havent even begun to go after him.

title: Levels, Rates, and Sweden
description: Ive been unhappily surprised by a lot of what has gone on within the economics profession since the 2008 crisis. But one of the most depressing things, in a way, has been the extent to which well-known economists seem confused about the difference between levels and rates of change. Unfortunately, you see this all the time  for example, in the constant assertions that because some country posted a year of pretty good growth after several years of austerity, this proves that austerity doesnt actually depress the economy.

title: A Streaky Hitter, a Poor Center Fielder and an Appealing Signing
description: At the height of the mania that surrounded outfielder Yoenis Cespedes after his trade to the Mets last season, some people talked of a $200 million contract in his future and debated whether he should be considered for the National Leagues Most Valuable Player Award despite having played in the league for just two months.

title: Status of Airports, Trains and Other Services in the New York Area
description: What is open and closed as the New York region copes with its first big snowstorm of 2016.

title: Suspect, 19, Arrested in Fatal Stabbing of Brooklyn Teenager
description: Police officials on Saturday announced the arrest of a man wanted for the stabbing death of a teenager in Brooklyn last week that investigators now believe was the culmination of a quarrel over an exchange of text messages.

title: Boban Marjanovic Is Entering Fans Hearts, if Not the Spurs Lineup
description: SAN ANTONIO  The Bobinator is a cartoon figure created by a friend of Boban Marjanovics back in Serbia. The Bobinators green skin matches the Incredible Hulks, but his face and left arm  which is metallic and culminates not in a hand but in a hook that grabs a basketball  is a reference to his primary inspiration.

title: David Stoliar, Survivor of World War II Disaster, Dies at 91
description: (The death of David Stoliar, in 2014, received little attention outside Oregon, where he lived. The New York Times, which had prepared an obituary, learned of his death on Friday.)

title: With Players in Better Shape, the Sun Is Setting on the Morning Skate in the N.H.L.
description: Joe Watson was in his eighth N.H.L. season, his sixth as a defenseman with the Philadelphia Flyers, when Coach Fred Shero, a mystical innovator known as the Fog, transformed the teams game-day routine.

title: Balmain: Fall 2016
description: The latest designs from Olivier Rousteings Balmain.

title: Clinton, Trump and Sexism
description: FOR most of her career, Hillary Clinton suffered for being a feminist.

title: Out of N.F.L. in Early Fall, Now Essential to Carolina Panthers
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  As he waited for a team, any team, to call him, Robert McClain grew to love the jogging trails around Buford, Ga. He ran daily, always on his own, unless you count Melo, his 6-year-old German shepherd.

title: Danger May Lurk in Denver for New England Patriots
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  What could possibly go wrong for the New England Patriots?

title: One Republican Candidate Wouldnt Mind Seeing Michael Bloomberg in the Race
description: NASHUA, N.H.  Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio offered welcoming words to Michael R. Bloomberg on Saturday, suggesting that an independent run by the former New York City mayor could have a positive effect on the presidential race.

title: A Canadian Threat to Alaskan Fishing
description: Sitka, Alaska  FROM fall through spring, the fleet of commercial fishing boats here in the panhandle of Alaska stalk winter king salmon. In the mornings prisms of ice sparkle beneath the sodium lights of the docks, where I live on a World War II tugboat with my wife and 8-month-old daughter. This winter Ive been out a few times fishing on the I Gotta, catching pristine wild salmon, torpedoes of muscle. But the work is slow, five fish a day, and my skipper recently traveled down to Reno, Nev., for knee surgery.

title: A Colleague Drank My Breast Milk and Other Wall Street Tales
description: I STILL think about a female job applicant I interviewed more than a decade ago, when I was a managing director at Bear Stearns and she was fresh from the Wharton School of Business.

title: Stranded in the Snow, Travelers Camp in Cars and Make Do
description: Sabrina Swidergal was among hundreds of Catholic high school and college students returning from an anti-abortion rally in Washington who started their weekend stranded on the Pennsylvania Turnpike.

title: Is Warfare in Our Bones?
description: The discovery of what looks like the aftermath of a brutal clash between two groups of prehistoric hunter-gatherers on the shore of an African lake is certain to stir up a debate about human nature that goes all the way back to Adam and Eve.

title: Home vs. Hospital Births
description: Readers discuss the risks and benefits of both settings and suggest ways to improve care.

title: The Way to Stop Trump
description: THIS is, of course, a pointless column. The Republican presidential race is over, as you may have heard. Donald Trump has the nomination wrapped up  in the most luxurious, velveteen packaging youve ever seen. Youve seen his polling lead: Its yuge. Youve watched his rallies: Theyre even yuger. Youve heard from the insiders, the panjandrums, the grand poo-bahs: Hes a man they can do business with; Bob Dole guarantees it. Youve heard from Sarah Palin, and when has her political judgment ever failed?

title: Facts, Fairness, and the Election
description: When youre Donald Trump, bashing The New York Times must always seem like a good idea.

title: U.N. Can Seal the Peace in Colombia
description: The government of Colombia and the countrys largest guerrilla group have made an unusual joint request to the United Nations Security Council. Nearing the final stages of an armistice negotiation, the two sides asked the Council to set up a mission of international experts to oversee a critical part of the proposed agreement: disarming the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC, a Marxist-inspired insurgency.

title: Sarah Palin Saves Feminism
description: WASHINGTON  ITS a tough call to figure out which place is more benighted: Hollywood or Saudi Arabia.

title: Tom Lutz
description: Tom Lutz is editor in chief of The Los Angeles Review of Books.

title: Fix Flints Water System, Now
description: The conditions on the ground in Flint still do not seem to have sunk in at the Michigan statehouse. Thousands of residents are still relying on trucked-in water, as if they were in a war-zone refugee camp, while worrying that their children may suffer developmental and other health problems from a water system poisoned by lead. Gov. Rick Snyder has been busy apologizing, but the tiny steps he is taking to repair the damage shrink beside the urgency of the problem.

title: Can Shame Be Useful?
description: MODERN American culture is down on shame  it is, we are told, a damaging, useless emotion that we should neither feel ourselves nor make others feel. This is particularly the case when it comes to drug and alcohol addiction. The nations drug czar, Michael Botticelli, has led a well-intentioned campaign to eradicate feelings of shame in addicted people by, in part, likening addiction to cancer, a disease outside of peoples control.

title: Our Insane Addiction to Polls
description: REMEMBER the poll last week that had Bernie Sanders ahead of Hillary Clinton in New Hampshire by three points?

title: Did the Man I Sentenced to 18 Years Deserve It?
description: IN 2006, I sentenced a man to 18 years in prison. I have been wrestling with that decision ever since.

title: Race, History and Baptist Reconciliation
description: WITH the protests in Ferguson, Mo., the Black Lives Matter movement and the massacre of black churchgoers in Charleston, S.C., on their minds, the presidents of the nations two major Baptist groups  one predominantly white, one predominantly black  decided it was time for a bold gesture. The Southern Baptist Convention, founded by slaveholders and their supporters before the Civil War, is now the nations second-largest Christian denomination after the Roman Catholic Church. Black Baptists formed their own churches and in 1880 founded what eventually became the National Baptist Convention, U.S.A.

title: No Split Between Simon and Garfunkel Over Bernie Sanderss Use of Their Song
description: Art Garfunkel is a Bernie guy.

title: Failed Talks Raise Specter of Biggest Default in Puerto Rico Crisis
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  Negotiations to restructure roughly $9 billion of the debt of Puerto Ricos power company collapsed late Friday, raising the prospect of the biggest default yet in Puerto Ricos deepening debt crisis.

title: Negative Words for Negative Ads From Bush-Aligned Super PAC
description: BOW, N.H.  Some of Jeb Bushs major donors have been worried about the negative tone that Right to Rise, the super PAC supporting Mr. Bush, has taken in criticizing his Republican rivals. They arent the only ones concerned.

title: #Blizzard2016 on Instagram
description: From Alabama to New York, people ventured out in the snow and shared it with the world on social media.

title: Hillarycare Failed, but Hillary Clinton Reminds Voters She Tried
description: After weeks of criticizing Bernie Sanderss plan for a single-payer Medicare for all health care system as budget busting and unrealistic, Hillary Clinton over the past few days has a new message for voters: Universal health care was her idea first.

title: The Y Embarks on Its First National Advertising Campaign
