description: The Y.M.C.A.  or the Y as it is now known  has existed for more than 160 years and has never felt the need to advertise. After all, even without the help of the ubiquitous song from the Village People, most people know what the Y is.

title: Duquesne Basketball Team, Stuck on Turnpike, Plays Cards and Makes a Snow Angel
description: When the team bus lurched to a halt around 9:15 p.m. Friday, Brian Baudinet, the player development coach of the Duquesne mens basketball team, assumed that an accident on the Pennsylvania Turnpike had caused the disruption.

title: For Many Workers, Staying Home Is Not an Option During Blizzard
description: There were the workers who boarded a Manhattan-bound subway train before sunrise in boots and denim shirts, looking for a place to sit between the men sprawled out and sleeping on the benches who had no other place to spend the night.

title: Herms: Fall 2016
description: Fall 2016 mens wear designs from Herms.

title: Health Scare Eclipses Action on Courts; Bottom of Draw Offers Path for Azarenka
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Ana Ivanovic was leading her third-round match against Madison Keys, 6-4, 1-0, on Saturday night at the Australian Open when a disturbance in her players box caught her eye. Nigel Sears, 58, had collapsed on a staircase inside Rod Laver Arena.

title: Milos Raonic Wins Match While Grieving for Victims of a Shooting in Canada
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Milos Raonics compatriots at Melbourne Park chanted his name and waved Canadian flags and handmade signs decorated with the countrys symbol, the maple leaf. If Raonic won his third-round match against Viktor Troicki, he decided, he would return the nationalistic show of support.

title: U.S. Prisoner Who Stayed in Iran Was F.B.I. Consultant, Expatriate News Service Says
description: An American prisoner recently freed by Iran, but about whom little is known, is a former California-based carpet seller and F.B.I. consultant, a news service run by expatriate Iranian journalists reported on Saturday. It said Iranian officials might have believed the man had links to the case of Robert A. Levinson, an American who went missing in Iran nearly nine years ago.

title: Crackdown by Egypt Draws Attention to an Anniversary It Aimed to Avoid
description: CAIRO  The normally invasive Egyptian authorities had long left Studio Emad Eddin alone, seeing no threat from a performance space that houses rehearsal studios and offers classes in set design and drama.

title: Afghan Officials, Voicing Security Fears on Facebook, Are Fired for Their Trouble
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  As the fate of Helmand Province hung in the balance last month during a withering Taliban offensive, the provinces deputy governor, Mohammad Jan Rasoolyar, found his urgent pleas for help from the central government going unheeded. So he did what millions of other people do every day: He ranted on Facebook.

title: Initial Turn
description: Administrivial Important PRINT solving Alert! Due to a production error, the print version of the Sunday, Jan. 24 crossword puzzle in the Magazine is missing the clue at 58 Down. That clue should be Follower of upsilon.

title: Mens Fashion Week: Comme, Junya, Margiela in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the Comme Des Garons, Junya Watanabe and Maison Margiela fall/winter 2016 collections, which were presented yesterday in Paris.

title: Iraqi Leader Asks U.S. for Help to Train Police Forces, Officials Say
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi of Iraq privately asked Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter this week for additional help training Iraqi police forces used to secure cities that have been retaken from the Islamic State, senior Defense Department officials said.

title: Donald Trump Would Love to See Michael Bloomberg Run
description: PELLA, Iowa  Donald J. Trumps reaction to the potential run of Michael R. Bloomberg in the presidential race was simple: Bring it on.

title: La Loche, the Canadian Town Where 4 Were Killed, Has a Bleak History
description: OTTAWA  Sudden deaths in La Loche, Saskatchewan, where shootings at two locations left four people dead and seven wounded on Friday, are an all too familiar event. But before Friday, suicide was the main cause of such deaths.

title: Des Moines Register Endorses Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton
description: PELLA, Iowa  The Des Moines Register, the largest newspaper in Iowa, announced Saturday night that it had endorsed Senator Marco Rubio in the Republican race and Hillary Clinton in the Democratic race.

title: El Salvador Advises Against Pregnancy Until 2018 in Answer to Zika Fears
description: SAN SALVADOR  Reacting to the rapid spread of the Zika virus in Latin America and the Caribbean, health officials in El Salvador are urging women not to get pregnant until 2018 in an effort to halt a surge of birth defects that are suspected to stem from the mosquito-borne disease.

title: In Support of Ted Cruz, Glenn Beck Slams Donald Trump
description: ANKENY, Iowa  Such is the state of the 2016 election that the following, apparently, needs to be said: I have no intention of shooting anybody in this campaign, Ted Cruz told reporters here on Saturday, with a now-official attack dog at his side.

title: In Surprise Showing, Iowas Senior Senator Appears at Donald Trump Rally
description: PELLA, Iowa  The 2016 presidential election just keeps surprising.

title: After a Double About-Face, Yoenis Cespedes Is Back in Queens
description: Late Friday night, David Wright was circling the room at his annual charity fund-raiser, a Vegas Night, in his hometown, entertaining the partygoers and making sure the end of the poker tournament was going smoothly, when his phone started buzzing in his pocket.

title: At Givenchy, Riccardo Tisci Celebrates the Freedom of Dress
description: For a second season, the designer showed womens couture looks during the mens wear presentation. A cobra motif snaked through all the designs.

title: When the Water Turned Brown
description: FLINT, Mich.  Standing at a microphone in September holding up a baby bottle, Dr. Mona Hanna-Attisha, a local pediatrician, said she was deeply worried about the water. The number of Flint children with elevated levels of lead in their blood had risen alarmingly since the city changed its water supply the previous year, her analysis showed.

title: The Big Four in Saudi Arabias Government
description: Brief background information on the most powerful figures in the kingdom, and how they stand in the sometimes complicated order of succession.

title: Gas Leak in Los Angeles Has Residents Looking Warily Toward Flint
description: LOS ANGELES  Health officials have tested the air and deemed it safe. Yes, the awful smell from a huge natural gas leak near the Porter Ranch neighborhood may cause vomiting, nosebleeds and other short-term symptoms, they say, but they have assured residents that it does not pose long-term health risks.

title: Donald Trump Says Megyn Kelly Should Skip Debate; Fox Says Shell Be There
description: Since Megyn Kellys pointed question to Donald J. Trump about his treatment of women in the first Republican debate, he has been attacking her regularly, through Tweets and on the campaign trail.

title: Bernie Sanders and Fans Embrace Tune of America in Ad Free of Attacks
description: For a blissful minute, the cacophony of political ads on Iowa television sets vanishes altogether. No speeches, no slurs, only the warm harmonies of Simon and Garfunkel singing America can be heard, as down-to-earth Iowa landscapes and scenes of daily life accompany the famous song, in a new ad from Senator Bernie Sanders with the same title.

title: Bernie Sanders Courts Elusive Voters: Young Iowans
description: UNDERWOOD, Iowa  With the Iowa caucuses just over a week away, the Bernie Sanders youth brigade is on the move.

title: A Day of Endorsements for Presidential Candidates in Iowa
description: PELLA, Iowa  After nonstop candidate traffic in Iowa for a full year, the gun was sounded on the final lap before the Feb. 1 caucuses, as the leading candidates in both parties crisscrossed the snowy plains and the states largest newspaper announced its endorsements.

title: In Return to Iowa, Bernie Sanders Picks Up Where He Left Off on Wall Street and Clinton
description: MAQUOKETA, Iowa  Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont tied himself to Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton to Wall Street as he returned to Iowa on Saturday for a weekend tour through the state.

title: Knicks Show Little but Midseason Malaise in Loss to Hornets
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  When Carmelo Anthony warmed up before the Knicks played the Charlotte Hornets on Saturday, something, he said, felt off. He couldnt make the ball do the things he typically can. He couldnt sink baskets with the ease that he normally does.

title: Stephanie Schneider, Matthew Schwartz
description: Stephanie Paige Schneider and Matthew Joseph Schwartz were married Jan. 22 at the Brooklyn Heights home of the brides parents, Harriet R. Weinberger and the late Frederic P. Schneider. A. Gail Prudenti, a former chief administrative judge of New York State, officiated. The couple celebrated their marriage the following day at Battery Gardens, a restaurant in Manhattan, where David Gilman, a retired judge who is now a judicial hearing officer in the Bronx, led the couple in their wedding vows.

title: James Purcell Jr., Barry Steinhart
description: James Francis Purcell Jr. and Barry Neal Steinhart were married Jan. 20 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau in New York. Edwina M. Townes, a staff member of the New York City Clerks office, officiated.

title: Amlie de Richemont, Thomas Atkinson
description: Amlie Mathilde Julia Marie Morgan Panon Desbassayns de Richemont, the daughter of Anne R. de Richemont Smithers of New York and Vicomte Patrick de Richemont of Paris, was married Jan. 23 to Thomas Atkinson, a son of Dr. Stephanie A. Atkinson and Dr. Peter L. Atkinson of Ilkley, England. The Rev. Anthony Nye, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Immaculate Conception in London.

title: Allison White, Matthew Alexander
description: Mary Allison White, a daughter of Nancy B. White and Robert R. White of Houston, was married there Jan. 23 to Matthew Kenton Alexander, a son of Susan P. Alexander and Neil K. Alexander, also of Houston. The Rev. Neil A. Willard, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Palmer Memorial Episcopal Church.

title: Danielle Borovoy, Daniel Greenberg
description: Danielle Minde Borovoy, the daughter of Michele L. Borovoy and Dr. Marc A. Borovoy of West Bloomfield, Mich., was married Jan. 24 to Daniel Michael Greenberg, a son of Myra S. Greenberg and Gary A. Greenberg of Ambler, Pa. Rabbi Yisrael Pinson officiated at 501 Union, an events space in Brooklyn.

title: Maria Simon, Adam Kushner
description: Maria Christina Simon, the daughter of Evey A. Simon and Basil T. Simon of Grosse Pointe Park, Mich., was married Jan. 23 to Adam Benjamin Kushner, a son of Ivy E. Kushner and Dr. Frederick G. Kushner of New Orleans. Rabbi Shira Stutman performed the ceremony at the Felicity Church, a former Methodist church that is now an events space in New Orleans.

title: Sarah Pous, Thomas Brown V
description: Sarah Joy Pous and Thomas Francis Brown V celebrated their wedding at the Brooklyn Winery on Jan. 23, during the East Coast blizzard. Because Mirelle Eid, the couples officiant and a Universal Life minister, was unable to attend that event, she legally joined the couple the following day at a Starbucks cafe in Manhattan.

title: Julia Groeblacher and Daniel Castillo: Theyll Always Have Baghdad
description: Julia Michaela Groeblacher, the daughter of Michaela M. Groeblacher of Lindsborg, Kan., and the late Johann H. Groeblacher, was married in Washington Jan. 20 to Marine Gunnery Sgt. Daniel Lee Castillo, the son of Dahlia S. Castillo and Francisco A. Castillo of South Padre Island, Tex. Gary Shaw, a friend of the couple who received authorization from the District of Columbia to preside, officiated in a Federal-style house in Georgetown thats part of the LEnfant Trust.

title: Bruce Gober, Donald Ratner
description: Dr. Bruce Anthony Gober and Donald Henry Ratner were married Jan. 18 by Ilana Rovner, a judge on the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit, in her chambers in Chicago.

title: Kenneth Cohen, Christopher Conway
description: Dr. Kenneth Robert Cohen and Christopher Peter Conway were married Jan. 23 on a red Silver Queen Gondola car that was ascending Aspen Mountain in Colorado. Troy Thibeault, a friend of the couple who became a minister of American Marriage Ministries for the event, officiated.

title: Elise Chang, Alastair Kusack
description: Elise Ese Chang and Alastair Grandus Kusack were married Jan. 23 by Kim Kirkley, a minister with the First Nation Church, at the LED Lab, a showroom in Manhattan.

title: Isabel Solmonson, Elliot Cohen
description: Isabel Ann Solmonson, a daughter of Leslie Morgan Solmonson and Steven J. Solmonson of New York, was married Jan. 23 to Elliot Burt Cohen, the son of Paula T. Cohen and Albert E. Cohen of Delray Beach, Fla. Rabbi Michael Resnick officiated at the Flagler Museum in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Margaret Howe, Sergio Vera Gutirrez
description: Margaret Saltonstall Howe and Sergio Oscar Alejandro Vera Gutirrez were married Jan. 23 at the Sulgrave Club in Washington. John H. Bayly Jr., a senior judge on the Superior Court of Washington, officiated.

title: Hena Daniels, Andrew Doba
description: Hena Nadia Daniels and Andrew Ronald Doba were married Jan. 23 at the Society Room of Hartford, an event space in Hartford. Gov. Dannel P. Malloy, a friend of the groom, officiated.

title: Corrections: January 24, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its not worth it. Its coming down as fast as we clear it away.

title: Maria Sharapova Looks to End 17-Match Losing Streak Against Serena Williams
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Sven Groeneveld was camped out in the media seats in Rod Laver Arena on Sunday, shifting his experienced gaze from his smartphone to Serena Williams, who was thumping winner after winner down below.

title: Novak Djokovic, Despite 100 Unforced Errors, Advances to Australian Open Quarterfinals
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The bottom line on Sunday at the Australian Open was that Novak Djokovic prevailed over Gilles Simon, 6-3, 6-7 (1), 6-4, 4-6, 6-3, to reach his 27th consecutive Grand Slam quarterfinal.

title: Looking for Signs That Apples Runaway Growth Is Waning
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Investors have long relied on Apple to deliver one crucial attribute: growth. Now they are beginning to wonder whether Apples days as a growth stock are coming to an end.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: Your Weekend Briefing: Blizzard, Bloomberg, N.F.L.
description: Here are the weeks top stories.

title: Loving a Grandpa Right Down to His Toes
description: It was early November when my youngest daughter, Sarah, asked her grandfather, Hey Pop, have you ever had your toenails painted?

title: Lanvin: Fall 2016
description: Lanvins vision for fall 2016 mens wear.

title: After East Coast Blizzard, the Cleanup and the Workweek Begin
description: Bounded by mountains of snow and slush-covered roads and sidewalks, millions of people along the Eastern Seaboard slogged to work on Monday morning, one day after one of the biggest blizzards ever recorded swept through the region, dumping more than two feet of snow in many cities.

title: Drone Lobbying Heats Up on Capitol Hill
description: WASHINGTON  The last time Congress weighed in on rules for nonmilitary drones, in 2012, the flying machines were hardly a hit with consumers. And companies said little about using them for commercial purposes.

title: 1941: Minister Says British Gains Aided Palestine
description: WASHINGTON  Declaring that British victories in Egypt and Libya have thrust the danger of attack upon Palestine by the Axis powers well into the background, Neville Montagu Butler, newly appointed Minister to the United States from Great Britain, said in a message today [Jan. 24] to Dr. Abba Hillel Silver, national chairman of the United Palestine Appeal, that Palestine can look forward to a bright future if American Jews do their utmost in support of Britain and the program of rebuilding the Jewish national home in Palestine.

title: For Those With Hamilton Tickets, a Storm of Disappointment
description: Don and Naiema Frieson flew up from northwest Arkansas, treasuring the Hamilton tickets they had bought for $1,500, eager to experience the musical they had heard so much about. Jessica Pride came in from San Diego, excited to see the show with her husband, who bought a pair of tickets for $1,450 as a Christmas gift. And Tamiko Brooks traveled from Los Angeles, the event an expensive birthday present from her husband.

title: Marriage, Poverty and the Political Divide
description: There remains some argument among lawmakers over which Americans should be able to marry, but nearly everyone agrees that marriage itself offers stability and economic benefits to couples and to society at large.

title: The Snowstorm Is Over, but Travel Delays Arent
description: The snow may have stopped falling but the blizzard that brought travel in the Northeast to a standstill is still wreaking havoc on transportation and tourism. Here is how it is affecting your trip.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Where Addiction Treatment Programs Are Taking Shape
description: These law enforcement agencies are offering addicts referrals to treatment programs, either in lieu of arrest, as in Gloucester, Mass., or through direct outreach, according to the Police Assisted Addiction and Recovery Initiative:

title: Massachusetts Chiefs Tack in Drug War: Steer Addicts to Rehab, Not Jail
description: CANTON, Ohio  Leonard Campanello, the police chief of Gloucester, Mass., took the microphone here in mid-December and opened with his usual warm-up line: Im from Gloucester, he said in his heavy Boston accent. Thats spelled G-l-o-s-t-a-h.

title: The East Coast, Coated by a Winter Blast
description: Near-record amounts of snow accumulated in places along the East Coast, leaving cities and residents with huge piles to clear on Sunday.

title: Candidates React to Bloomberg With Dismissals and Differences
description: Senator Marco Rubio dismissed Michael R. Bloomberg as just a private citizen who owns a big company. Hillary Clinton said she would relieve Mr. Bloomberg of any need to enter the presidential race. Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey was uncharacteristically charitable, calling Mr. Bloomberg a good mayor of New York City.

title: Hillary Clinton Says Senator Charles Grassley Wants to Defeat Me
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa  Hillary Clinton on Sunday accused Charles E. Grassley, the senior Republican senator from Iowa, of trying to undermine her presidential campaign by leaking negative information about her tenure as secretary of state. She also criticized him for showing up at an Iowa rally for Donald J. Trump on Saturday for the simple reason to defeat me.

title: Mens Fashion Week: Herms and Sacai in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the Herms and Sacai fall/winter 2016 collections, which were presented yesterday in Paris.

title: Patriots vs. Broncos: Who Has the Edge?
description: 3:05 p.m. Eastern, CBS. Line: Patriots by 3.

title: Chris Christie Attacks Marco Rubio Over Blizzard Remark
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey angrily scolded Senator Marco Rubio of Florida on Sunday for his sarcastic remark about the blizzard that crippled much of the Northeast this weekend, calling the comment a sign of his immaturity and inexperience.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Mulder and Scully are back, and if their chemistry in the newfangled iteration of The X-Files isnt immediately evident, sit tight, because the mini-series gets better, says the New York Times critic James Poniewozik. The snowbound can brush up by streaming the original shows. Not in the mood? Check out Amy, Asif Kapadias Oscar-nominated documentary about the troubled chanteuse Amy Winehouse.

title: N.F.L. Playoffs: How the Arizona Cardinals and Carolina Panthers Match Up
description: 6:40 p.m., Fox. Line: Panthers by 3.

title: Republicans Risk Repeating Mistake on Hispanic Vote
description: Three years ago, high-level Republicans declared that after losing the popular vote in five of the past six presidential elections, the party needed to appeal more to Latinos to win the White House. Immigration was a threshold issue.

title: 1966: Indira Gandhi Becomes Prime Minister
description: NEW DELHI  Mrs. Indira Gandhi was sworn in today [Jan. 24] as Indias third prime minister and the first woman to lead the nations millions. The 48-year-old daughter of Indias first prime minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, took the brief oath before turbaned President Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan in the same room where he administered the same oath 19 months earlier to Lal Bahadur Shastri. Fifteen other cabinet ministers were sworn in at the same time by Mr. Radhakrishnan, including Gulzarilal Nanda, home minister; Y. B. Chavan, defense; Chidambaram Subramaniam, food; and the Untouchables leader, Jagjivan Ram, labor and employment.

title: Broncos 20, Patriots 18: A.F.C. Championship Highlights
Umit Benan: Fall 2016
description: Umit Benans fall 2016 mens wear collection.

title: At Sundance, a Focus on Fetishes and Flatulence
description: PARK CITY, Utah  It will be hard to beat Swiss Army Man, a comedic drama centered on an extremely flatulent, sexually aroused corpse, as the most warped entry at this years Sundance Film Festival here.

title: The Revenant Tops the Box Office
description: With theaters in major cities like New York, Washington and Philadelphia closed on Saturday because of a severe winter storm, new wide-release films  all with terrible reviews  arrived to modest box-office results.

title: Manhunt for Three Escaped Inmates in Southern California
description: SANTA ANA, Calif.  A manhunt spanning Southern California was underway Sunday for three inmates described as very dangerous who escaped from a maximum-security jail in Orange County, using tools to cut through steel bars and then rappelling from the jails roof with makeshift ropes made of linens.

title: Chris Christie Warns New Hampshire Against Voting for Donald Trump
description: PORTSMOUTH, N.H.  Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey warned primary voters in New Hampshire that their ballots must be more than an expression of anger, and that picking Donald J. Trump as their candidate could hand the White House to Hillary Clinton.

title: Panthers vs. Cardinals: N.F.C. Championship Highlights
Studio in a School Expands Arts Education Nationwide
description: Studio in a School, a New York City nonprofit that enlists professional artists to teach visual arts to public school students, is expanding its mission and scope by creating a Studio Institute to bring its program to the rest of the country.These are programs that can be replicated, said Agnes Gund, the organizations founder and chairwoman. They have substance, they work for children in schools that dont have many opportunities. Art is the first thing thats cut.

title: Thom Browne: Fall 2016
description: See what Thom Browne dreamt up for fall 2016 mens.

title: Europes Top Digital-Privacy Watchdog Zeros In on U.S. Tech Giants
description: PARIS  The latest standoff between Europe and American tech companies runs through a quiet street just north of the Louvre Museum, past chic cafes and part of the French national library, to the ornate office of Isabelle Falque-Pierrotin.

title: As Jack Dorsey Tries to Reshape Twitter, Revolving Door Takes Another Spin
description: Jack Dorsey began his tenure last year as Twitters chief executive with layoffs and a string of new personnel appointments. It turned out those moves were just a prelude.

title: ISIS Video Appears to Show Paris Assailants Earlier in Syria and Iraq
description: PARIS  The Islamic State released a video on Sunday apparently showing footage of the men who carried out the November attacks in Paris while they were in Syria and Iraq, where they are pictured carrying out executions, including beheadings.

title: Italy Divided Over Effort to Legalize Civil Unions for Gays
description: ROME  Six years ago, Andrea Rubera married his partner in Canada, where the couple later became parents of three young children. But when they returned to their native Italy, a transformation occurred. Mr. Rubera suddenly became a single man, and his legally recognized husband in Canada became his single male roommate in Italy. Italian law also divided custody of their children.

title: Making a Haute Couture Look: Atelier Versace
description: On the above image, we take a closer look at the making of this spring 2016 Atelier Versace haute couture look.

title: Review: In Pairing of Pagliacci and Cavalleria Rusticana, One Rises Above the Other
description: Of course the audience at the Metropolitan Opera on Thursday clapped at the end of Vesti la giubba, a pivotal moment in Leoncavallos Pagliacci. As the cuckolded and heartbroken clown Canio, the tenor Roberto Alagna had invested the aria with self-destructive despair, pushing his muscular voice close to the breaking point. But when applause broke out, he turned with a start and fixed the crowd with a look of blank horror.

title: Review: The Velveteen Rabbit Is a Tribute to the Less Flashy Toy
description: Do you remember the toy you most adored? A blanket? A doll? Some shabby bit of plush and stuffing? Unicorn Theaters The Velveteen Rabbit, a stage adaptation of Margery Williamss beloved 1922 picture book at the New Victory Theater, pays sweet and occasionally sorrowful tribute to every plaything loved, gnawed and hugged into tatters.

title: Carson Palmers Memorable Season Ends With a Forgettable Night
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Heading into Sundays N.F.C. championship game, Arizonas Carson Palmer had been the forgotten man of the playoffs.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Jan. 25
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Donald Trump Hears a Lesson in Humility at Church
description: MUSCATINE, Iowa  Donald J. Trump is not usually a candidate who invokes the words of evangelical voters. But on Sunday, he went to church in eastern Iowa, where he studied humility, he later told attendees at a rally.

title: Versace: Couture
description: Donatella Versaces vision for couture 2016.

title: Tech Giants Earnings, the Fed Meets and a Deadline on a Data-Sharing Deal
description: This weeks quarterly earnings announcements will include results from three of the technology sectors most important companies: Apple, Microsoft and Amazon. Investors on Tuesday will try to divine from Apples numbers just how quickly the companys growth is decelerating. Their focus will be on iPhone sales. On Thursday, Microsoft and Amazon investors will want to see strong growth in both companies computing services businesses. Although Microsoft is an important software maker and Amazon is one the worlds most successful e-commerce businesses, those companies also run two of the largest cloud services companies, selling remote computing services and information storage. Katie Benner

title: Match-Fixing Suspicions Raised at Australian Open After Site Stops Bets on Match
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  A major sports gambling website suspended betting on Sunday for a mixed doubles match at the Australian Open, raising suspicions of match fixing at one of the worlds most prestigious tennis tournaments.

title: Review: Loudon Wainwright III Offers Tart Folk-Song Sentiments at Appel Room
description: How did it happen? All at once, it seems, the enfant terrible of yesteryear is a grand older man. Or in the language of Loudon Wainwright III, the singer-songwriter who was mislabeled a new Bob Dylan four decades ago, he has become the graying patriarch of a distinguished folk music clan.

title: Cartoon: Heng on Taiwans New President, Tsai Ing-wen
description: Voters gave Tsai Ing-wen and her Democratic Progressive Party, which is skeptical of a closer relationship with China, control of Taiwans legislature for the first time.

title: Winter Wonderland in Manhattans Heart
description: Snowflakes started falling at Central Park on Friday night, forming a smooth white blanket that by Sunday would wrap the area in the pristine quiet of winter.

title: Review: The Magicians, on Syfy, Draws Students Into a Fantasy Thats Real
description: Young magicians joining forces against a malevolent, balance-of-life-threatening adversary? Check. A picturesque, hard-to-find campus where young mages learn to harness their skills? Check. Quidditch? No, thank god.

title: Egyptian Museum Officials Face Tribunal for Damaging King Tutankhamens Mask
description: CAIRO  Eight Egyptian museum officials are to face a disciplinary tribunal for their role in a botched repair job that caused lasting damage to the famed golden burial mask of King Tutankhamen, one of the countrys most prized artifacts, the countrys administrative prosecutor has said.

title: For the Love of Broadway
description: Despite a massive storm, the show went on at the first BroadwayCon, a theater-themed fan convention in New York.

title: BroadwayCon Carried On, Even as Broadway Went Dark
description: There were pops of Wicked green and Sweeney Todd red among the whiteout conditions in Manhattan over the weekend at the first BroadwayCon, a theater-themed fan convention that hopes to do for Broadway devotion what Comic-Con International, in San Diego, has done for superhero worship. Nearly 6,000 people from around the world, most of them young women, turned out for the three-day event at the New York Hilton Midtown, according to event organizers.

title: Knoedler Gallery Heads to Trial in Sale of a Fake Rothko
description: No scandal in recent years has hung over the art market as heavily as the Knoedler & Company forgery case.

title: Despite Decades of Stealth, Sticking Points Bedevil F-35 Jet
description: One of the earliest stealth weapons on record was a stone used by the young Israelite David to kill the Philistine giant Goliath. In the biblical account, David shunned the conventional armaments of his time: sword, helmet, armor. Instead, he went forth with a slingshot and a few stones, kept undetected in a pouch. As any schoolchild knows, one well-aimed fling was all it took to put Goliath down for good. The big guy never saw it coming.

title: Review: In Cure, Accepting the Minds Role in a Bodys Health
description: Its been almost 40 years since Jeff Goldblum appeared in Annie Hall as an unnamed party guest who couldnt remember his mantra. Mr. Goldblum has done very well since then; mantras, alas, have had a rougher go of it. But perhaps its time to ask: Must the mantra be forever impugned?

title: Betting That Rock Is Back (Again)
description: For nearly two decades, Now Thats What I Call Music! has churned out what passive pop consumers want to hear  compilations of hit songs of the moment. In the United States, there have been 56 volumes, plus spinoff Latino versions, Christmas collections and more than a dozen country albums.

title: Review: On Lucifer, a Fox Drama, the Devil Tries to Fit In
description: Even Satanists will be reaching for the remote when

title: Puppy Amuser
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Guess who got a puppy! No, not me. Ian Livengood, todays constructor, got a puppy, her name is Josie and shes adorable. Im sure that, in no time at all, Josie will have Mr. Livengood and his wife properly trained to obey each and every one of her commands. Lets congratulate him.

title: Review: City Ballet Celebrates Balanchine and Heeds Mother Nature
description: New York City Ballet had planned to celebrate the birthday of George Balanchine as usual, with performances and demonstrations of his works. Instead, Mother Nature showed up on Saturday with the kind of enchanting yet hazardous gift common to fairy tale ballets: a waltz of the snowflakes voluminous enough to cause transit shutdowns that forced the troupe to cancel performances for the first time this century. Climatically, this may have been a climax, but for the company, it was an unfortunate interruption of the momentum built in the first week of its winter season.

title: Pentagon Wants Psychologists to End Ban on Interrogation Role
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon has asked the American Psychological Association to reconsider its ban on the involvement of psychologists in national security interrogations at the Guantnamo Bay prison and other facilities.

title: Public Divide on Police Hangs Over Brooklyn Officers Manslaughter Trial
description: On Thursday, the final day of jury selection in the trial of Peter Liang, the New York police officer charged with manslaughter in the shooting of an unarmed man in the stairwell of a Brooklyn housing project, a prosecutor asked jurors if they thought the charges were heavy-handed.

title: Tyco International and Johnson Controls Are Said to Be Merging
description: Tyco International, the remnant of the industrial conglomerate that was marred with corporate scandal and later broken up, is in late-stage discussions to merge with Johnson Controls for as much as $20 billion, a person briefed on the discussions said on Sunday.

title: Broncos Defense Bruises Tom Brady, Lifting Peyton Manning to Super Bowl
description: DENVER  His Broncos teammates came bounding through the tunnel, dispensing hugs and high-fives, and then here came Peyton Manning, shadowed by boom mikes and television cameras and mayhem.

title: A Beloved Bronx Teacher Retires After a Conflict With His Principal
description: Tom Porton is used to drama: Since arriving at James Monroe High School as an English teacher 45 years ago, he has taught and staged plays. Outside, in the Bronx River neighborhood where the school is, there was plenty of drama in the 1980s, when AIDS and crack ravaged the area. His response then was to establish a group of peer educators who worked with Montefiore Medical Center to teach teenagers about H.I.V. prevention. His efforts earned him awards, including recognition from the City Council and the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, and led to his induction into the National Teachers Hall of Fame.

title: Fishing for Donations, With a Coat Hanger in Hand
description: Ioannis Amanatidis  known to his customers as Johnny the Greek  would drive to his busy corner of Northern Boulevard in Bayside, Queens, in the morning with his food cart in tow. Lunch was still hours away, but every day for six or seven years, he said, an older man would be waiting when he arrived.

title: Precipitous Rents in Ski Country Push Workers to Edges
description: BRECKENRIDGE, Colo.  On nights when she could not crash on a friends couch or unroll a sleeping mat on an attic floor, Chelsea Lilly tucked her silver Subaru into a supermarket parking lot or a dark spot along a mountain pass, wrapped herself in a green Army blanket and watched movies on her phone until she fell asleep.

title: China Considers Larger Role in Afghanistan Peace Process
description: BEIJING  As a  bloody offensive by the Taliban spreads in Afghanistan and with American combat operations there officially ended, anxious Chinese leaders find themselves under pressure to take a more active role in the long-stalled peace process, according to scholars and current and former diplomats.

title: Aboriginal Brass Band Offers Burst of Hope in a Bleak Community
description: YARRABAH, Australia  This remote stretch of coastline in north Queensland has much to offer: pristine beaches dotted with mango and palm trees, tropical breezes, an azure ocean.

title: China Deepens Its Footprint in Iran After Lifting of Sanctions
description: ZARRINABAD, Iran  Rising from the yellowish, treeless plains so typical for central Iran stands a square labyrinth of pipes and conveyor belts, topped by a silver chimney that glitters in the summer sun.

title: Fighting to Preserve the White Barn Theater
description: NORWALK, CONN.  Lucille Lortel, an actress and theater producer who was known as the queen of Off Broadway, staged hundreds of plays during her lifetime at her theater on Christopher Street in the West Village.

title: In Portugal, Voters Pick Center-Right President
description: Portugals voters elected a veteran center-right politician and television commentator as their new president on Sunday, two months after a Socialist administration took office following inconclusive parliamentary elections.

title: A Struggle to Quell Investor Fears Over Unsettled Emerging Markets
description: Currency turmoil in China and fears of a global slowdown have led investors to abandon emerging markets in droves, rattling the large asset management firms that have long promoted such investments in their hunt for higher returns.

title: Southern Jersey Shore Hit With Severe Flooding by Snowstorms High Tides
description: The southern end of the Jersey Shore, which was largely spared by Hurricane Sandy three years ago, had the most severe flooding in the state during the weekend blizzard, as high tides sent icy water rushing into darkened homes and businesses.

title: Second-Year Super Bowl Advertisers Face Their Own Pressures to Succeed
description: To say Alvaro Luque, the president of Avocados From Mexico, was nervous during last years Super Bowl would be an understatement. His company had decided to advertise during the game for the first time, and millions of dollars were at stake.

title: Employee Wellness Programs Use Carrots and, Increasingly, Sticks
description: It may be an offer employees simply can no longer refuse.

title: Protesters in Haiti Demand That President Quit
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  Volcy Assad, a Haitian political activist, stood before an enormous plume of black smoke emanating from a pile of burning tires and made it clear that the demands of protesters had changed.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Battle for Partys Future
description: DES MOINES  The race between Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders, which voters will begin deciding a week from Monday, is not just about the White House anymore. It has intensified into an epochal battle over their vastly different visions for the Democratic Party.

title: Mother and Son, 1, Die of Carbon Monoxide Poisoning in Car During Snowstorm
description: A woman and her 1-year-old son died of carbon monoxide poisoning in Passaic, N.J., on Saturday after sitting in their parked car with the engine running, the police said.

title: French Jews Fear a New Strain of ISIS-Inspired Anti-Semitism
description: MARSEILLE, France  It was the heavy leather-bound volume of the Torah he was carrying that shielded Benjamin Amsellem from the machete blows.

title: Broncos Defense Keeps Patriots Off Rhythm
description: DENVER  New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady was already having a day to forget by the time Denver Broncos safety Darian Stewart intercepted a pass late in the first half of the A.F.C. championship game.

title: Peyton Manning Is Primped and Primed for, Perhaps, a Final Showdown
description: DENVER  After the Denver Broncos won the A.F.C. championship game on Sunday to make it to the Super Bowl, Peyton Manning primped.

title: Donald Trump Means Business in Iowa: Night in Motel, and a Day in Church
description: MUSCATINE, Iowa  Donald J. Trump spent the last seven months saying he wanted to win. Now he is really acting like it.

title: Bob Bradley Climbs the Global Soccer Ladder With an Impediment: Hes American
description: LE HAVRE, France  In the conference room of a smart hotel in the center of this port city, four Frenchmen were talking loudly over one another and gesticulating toward a flip chart in front of a row of empty chairs.

title: A Resurgent Marco Rubio Sprints to the Finish in Iowa
description: MARION, Iowa  For months, it was the biggest question nagging at the Rubio campaign here: Wheres Marco?

title: Bobby Wanzer, 94, Hall of Fame Player From N.B.A.s Early, Patient Days, Dies
description: Before the arrival of the 24-second shot clock in 1954 turned pro basketball into a fast-paced game, many a victory came from clever passing and ball-handling in the backcourt that set up good shots.

title: Jeb Bush on the Stump Sounds Different From the TV Version
description: BERLIN, N.H.  Expectations are not always high at Jeb Bushs campaign events, where impressions of his halting performances in debates and other TV appearances often precede him.

title: Donald Trump Did Stay at a Holiday Inn Express on Friday Night
description: It wasnt a Trump-branded hotel, but Donald J. Trump found the Holiday Inn Express in Sioux Center, Iowa, to be a perfectly suitable stand-in for Trump Tower or Mar-a-Lago.

title: Shutting Down Aboveground Subway Service in New York, and Learning From Previous Missteps
description: For many New Yorkers, riding the subway is an underground experience, calling to mind dark tunnels and fluorescent-lit stations. But the blizzard over the weekend was a reminder of just how much of the system runs aboveground.

title: Boston Globe Endorses Hillary Clinton
description: The Boston Globe, New Englands largest newspaper, has enthusiastically endorsed Hillary Clinton for the Democratic presidential nomination.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Clash on Issues and Vie for Votes of Iowa Women
description: NORTH LIBERTY, Iowa  From universal health care and paid family leave to college costs and the Keystone XL oil pipeline, Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders challenged each others priorities and courted female voters on Sunday as they began the final week of their increasingly hard-fought campaign to win the Iowa caucuses next Monday.

title: Panthers, Led by Flashy Cam Newton, Swamp Flailing Cardinals
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Fifteen minutes in, the party had already started: the laughing, the singing, the Dabbing, the crowing. The U2 song Sunday Bloody Sunday rang through the loudspeakers, and towels waved, and it continued to feel, justifiably, as if the Carolina Panthers were on the verge of another score.

title: Downton Abbey Season 6, Episode 4: The Engine Purrs
description: Mary: So! You really are a car man. I wasnt sure how much you meant it.

title: Over 200 Educators in New York Receive Erroneous Scores Linked to Student Performance
description: More than 200 teachers and principals received erroneous scores from New York State on a contentious measurement that ties their performance to how well their students do on tests, according to state documents obtained by The New York Times.

title: Return to Normalcy Will Be Halting as Mid-Atlantic Starts Digging Out
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md.  In Washington, there was a massive snowball fight in Dupont Circle, and on Capitol Hill, families went sledding. But in suburban Rosslyn, Va., Lila Hertz, 22, fell down in the snow Sunday as she struggled to find transportation to her job at a popular lunch spot two blocks from the White House. She was rescued by a passing cab  and was the only person who showed up for work.

title: For Gadget Geek in the Oval Office, High Tech Has Its Limits
description: WASHINGTON  In this always-on, always-connected world, what good is a Fitbit with no GPS or an iPad that cant connect to the cloud?

title: Weiner Directors Say Film Is About Medias Sensationalism
description: PARK CITY, Utah  The directors of Weiner, which follows Anthony D. Weiner and his wife, Huma Abedin, as they navigate the public fallout from an explicit texting scandal, sought in remarks at the Sundance Film Festival on Sunday to position their documentary as less political personality study and more dissection of the news media.

title: Woman, 59, Is Killed in Machete Attack in Bronx
description: A 59-year-old woman was fatally attacked by a man wielding a machete in the Mott Haven section of the Bronx on Sunday afternoon, the police said.

title: Broadway Panhandler, Longtime Manhattan Cookware Retailer, to Close in Spring
description: Broadway Panhandler, a packed-to-the-rafters kitchen store that opened in Manhattan 40 years ago and is beloved by home cooks, celebrities and restaurant chefs, will close by the spring when its owner and founder, Norman Kornbleuth, retires.

title: Billions Season 1, Episode 2: Part of the Firmament
description: Axelrod Hall will not be named Axelrod Hall forever. Even Bobby Axelrod understands that. His name will be there, he says, until some guy richer than me wants it to come down.

title: The X-Files Season 10 Premiere: A Crazier Mulder Than Usual
description: When I heard that The X-Files was coming back to TV, it was like hearing that I would see some dear old friends again. I spent every Friday night of my young adulthood with Agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully. News of their coming six-week mini-series started me on a mega rewatch  I mainlined the original episodes in five-hour chunks.

title: The Cigarette Smoking Man of The X-Files Resurfaces
description: When we last saw the Cigarette Smoking Man, in The X-Files series finale in 2002, he was living as a guru in an old Anasazi settlement in New Mexico. Or at least he was, until a couple of black helicopters blew it and him to smithereens, seemingly ending his run as the storys nefarious conspirator and prime concealer of whatever truths may, in fact, be out there.

title: Updates on Schools, Subways and Commuter Rails After the Storm
description: The near-record storm in the Northeast this weekend crippled transportation systems and left huge piles of snow in New York and floodwaters in parts of New Jersey. On Monday morning, however, New York schools are open and subway and commuter rails are mostly up and running. Here is what else to expect on Monday:

title: Alone, in a Crowd, With Gregory Crewdson
description: Gregory Crewdsons photographs almost always project solitude and intimacy, even if his images take a team to organize. The subject of one of his images looks back at the experience.

title: Alone, in a Crowd, With Gregory Crewdson
description: One push through a revolving door and I was in complete darkness. I walked to the right to get a sheet of resin-coated paper and then turned toward the enlarger, where I could finally rest my mind. The most sacred moments were when I could just stand there and dissolve into the test prints. There were no New York hospitals, no expectations of my fathers recovery or death. Not even the constant companion of intensive care beeping sounds, those Montefiore monitors I couldnt get out of my head.

title: Michigans Great Stink
description: In the 1850s, London, the worlds largest city, still didnt have a sewer system. Waste simply flowed into the Thames, which was as disgusting as you might imagine. But conservatives, including the magazine The Economist and the prime minister, opposed any effort to remedy the situation. After all, such an effort would involve increased government spending and, they insisted, infringe on personal liberty and local control.

title: New York Citys Promising Step on Criminal Justice
description: The New York City Council is poised to take what could be a step toward a fairer and smarter criminal justice system. A package of bills to be introduced on Monday seeks to resolve an old impasse over how to deter minor lawbreaking without punishing too many people unjustly.

title: The Obama Theory of Trump
description: It was so obvious, Im embarrassed I missed it.

title: Ending the Horror of Myanmars Abuse of Muslims
description: The government of Myanmars departing president, Thein Sein, oversaw the systematic persecution of the countrys Rohingya Muslim minority  a human rights debacle that one study has described as genocide. Mr. Thein Sein also signed four bills into law last year regulating interfaith marriage, birth spacing and religious conversion that clearly targeted Myanmars Muslim minority.

title: Drug Deaths Reach White America
description: Congress has historically treated drug abuse as a malady afflicting mostly poor, minority communities, best dealt with by locking people up for long periods of time. The epidemic of drug overdose deaths currently ravaging white populations in cities and towns across the country has altered this line of thinking, and forced lawmakers to acknowledge that addiction is a problem that knows no racial barriers and can be best addressed with treatment.

title: Hillary Clinton Stumbles
description: In October, when Hillary Clinton made a spectacle of the congressional Benghazi committee during a marathon interrogation that seemed designed to make a spectacle of her, she emerged stronger than ever. Her polls numbers surged.

title: Convicted of Corruption, but Still Getting a Pension
description: IN New York State, both the former Assembly speaker Sheldon Silver and the former Senate majority leader Dean Skelos have recently been tried and convicted on numerous federal charges of corruption. They share another distinction: Since their trials, they have both applied for their state pensions. Sadly, they have every right to do so.

title: Girlfriend, Mother, Professor?
description: Im not their mother. And Im not their girlfriend either.

title: The Weight of Her Husband's Sins
Strong Earthquake Rattles Spain and Morocco
description: A 6.3-magnitude earthquake struck in the Mediterranean early on Monday, causing some material damage in southern Spain and northern Morocco, although no deaths or injuries were reported.

title: Paul Krugman Reviews The Rise and Fall of American Growth by Robert J. Gordon
description: Back in the 1960s there was a briefly popular wave of futurism, of books and articles attempting to predict the changes ahead. One of the best-known, and certainly the most detailed, of these works was Herman Kahn and Anthony J. Wieners The Year 2000 (1967), which offered, among other things, a systematic list of technological innovations Kahn and Wiener considered very likely in the last third of the 20th century.

title: African Economies, and Hopes for New Era, Are Shaken by China
description: JOHANNESBURG  Years of rapid economic growth across sub-Saharan Africa fueled hopes of a prosperous new era. To many, the worlds poorest continent was finally emerging, with economies that were no longer dependent on the fickle global demand for Africas raw resources.

description: PARK CITY, Utah  Were hearing a lot about diversity, the director Ava DuVernay, steadfast champion of diversity in film, told a roomful of people gathered for lunch Sunday in a restaurant here. I hate that word so, so much.

title: Travelers in the Dark
description: At 5, whenever my mother turned off the bedside lamp, an inexplicable terror catapulted me out of bed. Crawling on the floor, I checked to see that everything still existed.

description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said in an interview released Monday that politics in America had become meaner than when he took office, but expressed hope that Republicans would eventually turn away from the expression of frustration and anger that Donald J. Trump and Senator Ted Cruz were offering to voters.

The settlers are fleeing, and the Governor has ordered out the militia.

title: 1941: Rome Concedes Loss of Tobruk
description: ROME  Loss of 20,000 men at Tobruk and complete occupation by the British of that fortified zone was finally admitted today [Jan. 25] by the Italian high command. To give the people of this country some cheerier word, however, the military communique asserted that an Italian submarine had sunk the British armed merchantman Eumaeus, said to have been loaded with troops at the time, and that German airmen had dropped a large caliber bomb on an enemy heavy cruiser in the central Mediterranean.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 26, 1941

title: Chinese Journalist Seeking Refuge in Thailand Disappears
description: BEIJING  A Chinese journalist who was traveling across Thailand on a frantic quest for political refuge messaged his wife recently to say that he would soon reach the border with Laos. Two weeks ago, the journalist, Li Xin, disappeared.

description: Fifteen or so years ago, by her recollection, a woman named Robin Chapman made a pot roast in her slow cooker. Now known as Mississippi Roast, it would eventually become one of the most popular recipes on the web, an unlikely star with unlikely ingredients, a favorite of the mom-blog set.

title: Henry Worsley, a British Adventurer Trying to Cross Antarctica, Dies at 55
description: The message, transmitted on Friday via satellite telephone from freezing isolation in Antarctica, sounded resigned, melancholy and indisputably weary, as the speaker recalled the end of a previous explorers attempt to traverse the most inhospitable terrain on earth and now found himself in his predecessors snow boots.

title: Security at Paris Fashion Shows Less Strict Than Anticipated
description: PARIS  The City of Light was plunged into darkness on a mild night last November, when 130 people were killed in terrorist attacks across Paris. Two months later, France is still in a state of emergency, with security barriers and increased patrols of police officers and soldiers carrying automatic weapons a common sight, even though residents say the fear that hung over the city before Christmas is less palpable now.

title: Monkeys Built to Mimic Autism-Like Behaviors May Help Humans
description: Scientists have genetically engineered monkeys so that they exhibit behaviors similar to autism, with a goal of testing potential therapies on the animals in hopes that their resemblance to humans will yield more answers about the disorder.

title: During Market Turmoil, Just Listen to Your Financial Plan
description: Every year, right around this time, all the big brokerage firms, economists and banks come out with projections of whats supposed to happen next in the financial world. This year is no exception. Especially prominent in the news has been the Royal Bank of Scotland warning, in no uncertain terms, that people should sell everything and prepare for a fairly cataclysmic year ahead.

title: A Party of Nay-sayers, Anarchists and Unregulated Militias: Readers on Reforming the G.O.P.
description: Its too late for more moderate leaders to overtake Donald Trump and Ted Cruz in 2016, but the Republican Party definitely needs reform, readers wrote in response to a column by David Brooks.

title: Group Backing Ted Cruz Labels Donald Trump as a Liberal
description: One of the super PACs supporting Senator Ted Cruz is airing two attack ads against Donald J. Trump, using his own words against him to paint him as a liberal and as someone who has warmly praised the senator from Texas.

title: Summers Choice
description: We all remember the bad kids from high school: the pregnant teen, the kid who was always getting into fights, the truant student, or the one who just couldnt keep up with the rest of us.

description: Over the weekend, just when a grueling, bloated yet surprising race seemed to have boiled down to two front-runners, a surprise third candidate popped up, upending things all over again.

description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Unearthing the Past to Create New Yorks Buildings of Tomorrow
description: Cherubs danced at the feet of muses as they plucked lyres on the domed ceiling of the old Steinway Hall on West 57th Street in Manhattan. Their joy was reflected in the face of Marci Clark, who stood below them last week, expounding on the grandeur of the 91-year-old room.

title: Atelier Versace and Dior: The New Abnormal Normal?
description: PARIS  The world may be in the middle of the Fourth Industrial Revolution, at least according to the financial and political powers of The World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, which ended on Saturday. But in Paris, as of Sunday, fashion was still championing the preindustrial art of couture: garments made entirely by the human hand, to order, for one client at a time.

title: Dispatch From Dakar: Mom, Did You Get Kidnapped?
description: Dionne Searcey chronicles her adventures in Senegal, where she moved her family and works as The Timess West Africa bureau chief.

title: Chasing a Title, Andy Murray Must Weather the Swings of Real Life
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  It is not as if Andy Murray does not already have plenty on his active mind in normal Grand Slam circumstances. He likes a wide lens during big tennis tournaments, keeping tabs on the margins of his sport as well as the more central issues and figures.

title: American Apparels Founder Dov Charney Loses Court Bid to Return
description: Dov Charney, the ousted founder of American Apparel, on Monday lost an 11th-hour bid to return to the troubled retailer, clearing the way for the company to exit from bankruptcy as early as next week.

title: Round Robin
description: This weeks challenge timed to coincide with the final few days of this years Australian Open tennis tournament wassuggested by Marco Moriconi, a regular Numberplay contributor and professor of physics at the Universidade Federal Fluminense, in Niteroi, Rio de Janeiro. (Dr. Moriconi also writes a monthly math column for the Brazilian national science magazine, Cincia Hoje (Science Today), called Qual o Problema, or Whats the Problem?)

title: Why Martin Shkreli Will Talk on Social Media but Not to Congress

title: China to Expel Peter Dahlin, Swedish Human Rights Advocate
description: BEIJING  Peter Jesper Dahlin, a human rights activist from Sweden detained this month in Beijing on charges of violating national security laws, was to be expelled from China on Monday, the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

title: Vincent Prices Cookbook Lives On
description: In 1965, Vincent Price, the actor and connoisseur of art and food, wrote a cookbook with his wife, Mary, featuring recipes from restaurants in destinations including New York, California, France, Italy and England. The book became a collectors item; now a 50th-anniversary edition has been published with the help of the Prices daughter, Victoria, who has written the preface. The Proust in all of us will relish the profiles of ghosts like Le Pavillon and the Forum of the Twelve Caesars in New York, the original La Pyramide in France and Bali in Amsterdam. Reproductions of menus, with prices like $3.25 for Lchows Wiener schnitzel and $5.95 for roast duck at the Four Seasons (soon to be another fond memory) will give you pause. There are well-detailed, pre-food-processor recipes, including an unapologetic quiche Lorraine calling for eight egg yolks: A Treasury of Great Recipes: 50th Anniversary Edition (Dover, $50).

title: 2016 Executive Power Survey Responses
description: Only Rand Paul and Ben Carson have responded to questions submitted by The New York Times about their understanding of the scope and limits of executive power.

title: Frustration in Queens as New Yorkers Dig Out From the Piles of Snow
description: Where there had once been visible curbs and intersections, there were now snowy hillocks to navigate, puddles of unknown depth to vault and daunting bogs of slush to challenge balance and reflexes.

title: Hispanics and Asian-Americans Face Barriers to Lower Offices, Report Finds
description: A new report from a nonpartisan organization focused on getting more Asian-American and Latinos elected to state and local offices found that the two groups are facing obstacles as they seek to achieve greater representation to match their fast-growing populations.

title: Photos From California Jail Reveal Inmates Escape Route
description: SANTA ANA, Calif.  On Friday, three inmates escaped from a maximum-security jail here, the authorities said, and the hunt for them is underway.

title: Trans-Pacific Trade Pact Would Lift U.S. Incomes, but Not Jobs Overall, Study Says
description: WASHINGTON  A far-reaching trade pact binding a dozen Pacific Rim nations would increase incomes, exports and growth in the United States but is unlikely to add to overall employment, according to an independent analysis released Monday.

title: Supreme Court Upholds Efforts on Managing Electricity Use Through Pricing
description: The Supreme Court on Monday ruled that federal regulators may encourage electricity users like schools, hospitals and shopping centers to reduce consumption at peak times in exchange for price breaks. The regulatory approach, known as demand response, lowers costs for consumers and lessens the risk of system failures that can cause blackouts.

title: Jewish Heirs Sue Swiss Museum to Recover Constable Painting
description: PARIS  Jewish descendants of the owner of a John Constable landscape have sued to reclaim the painting from a regional Swiss museum where it hangs now with a note acknowledging that it was illegally seized during World War II.

title: Marco Rubios Campaign Playlist Is More MercyMe Than Nicki Minaj
description: DES MOINES  Marco Rubios musical tastes run toward electronic dance music, Nicki Minaj and rap. But dont expect to hear them playing over the speakers at his campaign rallies.

title: Lawsuits Claim Disney Colluded to Replace U.S. Workers With Immigrants
description: Even after Leo Perrero was laid off a year ago from his technology job at Walt Disney World in Orlando, Fla.  and spent his final months there training a temporary immigrant from India to do his work  he still hoped to find a new position in the vast entertainment company.

title: U.N. Envoy for Syria Says Peace Talks Will Begin Friday
description: GENEVA  The United Nations announced on Monday that it would aim to start Syria peace talks on Friday, as Syrian military forces, aided by Russian air power, made new gains on the battlefield, suggesting that even these still precarious diplomatic negotiations would bring little respite in the fighting for the next several months.

title: An Art Powerhouse From North Korea
description: SIEM REAP, Cambodia  The giant mural in the foyer depicting a smiling stone face offers a mere taste of the grandiosity within the new Angkor Panorama Museum here. Inside, a 360-degree painted vista covers an area the size of nearly four basketball courts. Over 45,000 figures populate this cyclorama, a depiction of 12th-century Angkorian history.

description: Florida State University agreed on Monday to pay $950,000 to settle a lawsuit filed by a former student who accused the former Seminoles football star Jameis Winston of raping her in 2012.

title: Centerview Partners Hires Top Deal Maker From Rival
description: Centerview Partners, one of the top boutique investment banks around, has poached yet another senior deal maker to fill its ranks.

title: For Super Bowl, Focus Is on Passing, Perhaps of a Torch
description: There was a moment at the end of Sundays tense A.F.C. championship game when Peyton Manning seemed to be saying goodbye to his old self.

title: Ethics Reform in Albany
description: To the Editor:

title: Why a Trump Victory in Iowa Would Matter So Much
description: Ted Cruz was thought to be an easy favorite in Iowa. Now its not nearly as clear.

title: Twitters Turmoil May Invite Takeover Attempts
description: At least Twitters chief executive is using the companys product.

title: Honoring Piazza? Paying Cespedes? Meet the Suddenly Generous Mets
description: In the past few days, the Mets owners have altered two perceptions about the way they run the team.

title: Deforestation Threatens Pygmies, Study Finds
description: There are about 920,000 pygmies in central Africa, but their forest communities are fragmented and endangered by logging, mining and land clearance, according to a consortium of researchers who collaborated to create the first scientific estimate of the size of the population.

title: Deep Manure and the Future
description: I review Robert Gordons new book.

title: Woody Guthrie Wrote of His Contempt for His Landlord, Donald Trumps Father
description: More than a half-century ago, the folk singer Woody Guthrie signed a lease in an apartment complex in Brooklyn. He soon had bitter words for his landlord: Donald J. Trumps father, Fred C. Trump.

title: N.H.L. This Week: Jockeying Before the All-Star Game
description: With a light schedule because of the All-Star Game break, its time for a special Monday edition of The New York Timess look at the week ahead in the N.H.L. (All times Eastern.)

title: Johnson Controls and Tyco Can Take a Political Punch
description: Johnson Controls acquisition of Tyco International is insured against politics.

title: An Artists Monograph That Tests the Limits of Language
description: Language, notes the filmmaker and artist Wu Tsang, is always present in my work. And as her first monograph, Not in My Language (Walther Knig, $50), makes clear, how we say things extends beyond simply the words we use. Intended as a companion to Tsangs 2015 group exhibitions at the Kunsthalle Dsseldorf and the Migros Museum in Zurich, the publication surveys the artists prodigious output and highlights themes recurrent throughout her work. Combining stills and reproduced screenplays from six of her films  including DAMELO TODO, 2010, centering on the story of an El Salvadorian teenage refugee who finds sanctuary in L.A.s transgender community, and her documentary Wildness, 2012, which profiles the habitus of Silver Lakes legendary trans bar the Silver Platter and was included in the 2014 Whitney Biennial  Not in My Language foregrounds Tsangs interest in communities and subcultures often relegated to the margins of society.

title: Guardian to Slash Costs and Renew Online Focus
description: The Guardian said on Monday that it intended to cut its costs sharply in an effort to reduce its losses and break even at an operating level in three years time.

title: Unprompted, John Kasich Makes Light of His Tenure at Lehman Brothers
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  John Kasich is campaigning for president as the good-humor man, eschewing what he calls the doom and gloom of his rivals for the Republican nomination.

title: As Iowa Caucuses Approach, Political Ads Swamp TV Channels
description: DES MOINES  Ted Cruz was accused of proposing a socialist tax plan. Marco Rubio was called out for supporting amnesty for illegal immigrants. Bernie Sanders denounced the rigged economy, and Jeb Bushs campaign was called a train wreck.

title: Vintage Photos of Jeanne Lanvin, Jean-Paul Gaultier, Christian Dior and More
description: Fashion flashback! To celebrate haute couture week in Paris, T visited the New York Times photo archives and unearthed historical gems of couture designers at work (and play).

title: Michigan Attorney General Picks Investigator for Flint Water Case
description: CHICAGO  The attorney general of Michigan said Monday that a former county prosecutor would lead his offices investigation into the water crisis in Flint, where a 2014 switch of the citys drinking water source led to contamination and widespread health concerns.

title: Emotional Accounts of Financial Struggle at a Bernie Sanders Event
description: IOWA FALLS, Iowa  Carrie Aldrich, 46, wept Monday as she told Senator Bernie Sanders and 200 other people about her struggles cycling though minimum-wage jobs, fighting to get disability checks for a joint disorder, and having to rely on her elderly parents for survival.

title: Missouri Professor Who Called for Some Muscle at Protest Is Charged
description: COLUMBIA, Mo.  A University of Missouri assistant professor who called for some muscle as she tried to remove journalists from a campus protest last year was charged on Monday with misdemeanor assault, court documents showed.

title: Arguments Over North Carolina Voter ID Law Begin in Federal Court
description: WINSTON-SALEM, N.C.  The bitter dispute about North Carolinas elections laws returned to a federal courtroom here on Monday as the states voter identification requirement went on trial.

title: The Bugs Sharing Your Home (Get Out a Calculator)
description: Humans share their homes with hundreds of species of flies, spiders, beetles, lice and other arthropods, a new study reports.

title: Mens Fashion Week: Lanvin and Thom Browne in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections, which were presented yesterday in Paris.

title: The College Admissions Frenzy
description: To the Editor:

title: How Well Do You Know Your X-Files Monsters?
description: Test your knowledge of X-Files monsters-of-the-week in this interactive quiz.

title: ScienceTake | Carnivores Puzzle Box
description: In experiments with zoo animals, relative brain size was the best clue to problem solving ability in carnivores.

title: Some Carnivores Are Better Than Others at Unlocking Dinner
description: Spotted hyenas are the animals that got Sarah Benson-Amram thinking about how smart carnivores are and in what ways.

title: New York Officer Charged in Akai Gurleys Fatal Shooting Goes on Trial
description: At about 11 oclock on the night of Nov. 20, 2014, Melissa Lopez was in her kitchen in the Louis H. Pink Houses in East New York. Her partner was getting ready for his workday, which started at midnight, and her two girls were in their rooms.

title: Review: Outsiders, the Latest Iteration of the American Family as Criminal Enterprise
description: To the line of television shows that imagine the American family as an embattled criminal enterprise  The Sopranos, Sons of Anarchy  add Outsiders, a 13-episode series starting Tuesday on WGN America. Like the New Jersey wiseguys and drug-dealing California bikers in those shows, the Farrells, the moonshine-making Kentucky clan in Outsiders, are morally compromised but representative of traditional American values. They may engage in armed robbery, vandalism and matricide, but its because they really just want to be left alone.

title: If Bloomberg Enters the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor:

title: Giambattista Valli: Couture
description: Giambattista Vallis couture show.

title: A Birds-Eye View After a Winter Storm
description: Drone and aerial footage show a peaceful, snow-covered Northeast after a winter storm coated parts of Pennsylvania, New York, New Jersey and several other states.

title: Justices Expand Parole Rights for Juveniles Sentenced to Life for Murder
description: The Supreme Court on Monday ruled that its 2012 decision banning mandatory life-without-parole sentences for juvenile killers must be applied retroactively, granting a new chance at release for hundreds of inmates serving life sentences without the possibility of parole for murders they committed in their youth.

title: The Skinny, About Bulimia, to Debut at Sundance
description: PARK CITY, Utah  A couple of years ago, Jessie Kahnweiler was interning at Bad Robot, the movie and television company owned by J. J. Abrams. But she found herself wanting something else. Finally, all around her in Hollywood, or so it seemed, were intrepid women making boundary-pushing shows: Girls, Broad City, Transparent.

title: Rock Is Back as Panic! At the Disco Tops Billboard Chart
description: Its not often that a rock album tops the Billboard album chart, but Panic! At the Disco did it this week with its new release, Death of a Bachelor (Fueled by Ramen/DCD2), which sold 169,000 copies and had 17 million streams, according to Nielsen.

title: New From Hilton: Midpriced Hotels Geared Toward Millennials
description: Hilton Worldwide has announced a new hotel brand today, Tru by Hilton, that is positioned to be the first design-forward hotel chain in the midscale category where rooms start at $80.

title: Review: Donny McCaslins Quartet, Fresh Off the Release of Bowies Blackstar
description: Donny McCaslin dedicated an untitled new song at the Village Vanguard on Sunday night to someone he said had been a great influence in his life, someone who recently passed away. The song, which began in a hush, sounded faintly familiar: The brooding dignity of its melody, carried by Mr. McCaslin on tenor saxophone against a spooky stir of keyboards, bass and drums, evoked the mood of David Bowies last album, Blackstar.

title: Palestinian Assailants Are Killed After Knife Attack on 2 Israeli Women
description: JERUSALEM  Two Palestinian assailants stabbed two Israeli women in a Jewish settlement in the occupied West Bank on Monday, wounding one of them severely, before being fatally shot by a security guard, according to the Israeli police.

title: J. Crew Puts Its Own Spin on Classic Sunglasses Shapes
description: Every time I see myself in a picture and Im wearing aviators, I think ugh, says Jenna Lyons, the president and creative director of the J. Crew Group. They have a tendency to tilt down, so that the top of the glass lifts away from your eyebrow and the bottom hits the top of your cheek. They arent that flattering in photos  I know that sounds silly, but for us, its a big thing.

title: Diors Couture Show Has a Different Look
description: PARIS  Traditionally, the front row of the Dior couture show, which was held Monday in the gardens of the Muse Rodin, has bloomed with the radiant faces of its campaign stars and A-list Hollywood actresses. Emily Blunt, Lupita Nyongo and Charlize Theron are just a handful of stars who have attended in recent seasons.

title: Linking Arthritis to Old Injuries
description: Q. Why does arthritis tend to develop in joints that have experienced trauma earlier in life?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: E.U. Ministers Spar as Blocs Promise of Free Movement Wavers
description: AMSTERDAM  European Union interior ministers clashed on Monday over how to check the flow of migrants across their countries borders amid growing concern that the Continents commitment to the free movement of people within the bloc is at risk of collapse.

title: Facts & Figures: What Democrats and Republicans Want From Politicians
description: A recent Monmouth University poll asked respondents which caused more problemsin the federal government: elected officials failure to compromise, or their failure to stand by their principles. Sixty-eight percent of Democrats said lack of compromise was the bigger problem, while 25 percent chose failure to stand on principle. Among Republicans, meanwhile,54 percent said failure to stand on principle was the bigger issue, and just 36 percent picked lack of compromise.

title: Hillary Clinton Holds Fire on Bernie Sanders, Taking Aim at Republicans
description: KNOXVILLE, Iowa  Hillary Clintons remarks on the campaign trail a week before the Iowa caucuses are harking back to a simpler time in her candidacy: last month.

title: Opposition Groups in Moldova Unite to Protest New Government
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  Frustration with the political establishment is boiling over again in Moldova, where more than 15,000 people took to the streets of the capital on Sunday to vent their anger at the new government that was sworn in just last week.

title: Where the Wild Things Arent: A Sendak Museum
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn.  The characters of Maurice Sendak may live in the imaginations of children around the world, but many of those characters were born in a wooded residential neighborhood on the outskirts of this small town, in a rambling shingle house where Mr. Sendak lived and worked beginning in the early 1970s.

title: Review: Milton Babbitt Inspires a Focus! Festival Tribute
description: Street crime, of all things, might have been what caused the brainy composer Milton Babbitt to abandon his Concerti for Violin, Orchestra and Synthesized Sound in 1976. Thats what Joel Sachs, the founding director of the New Juilliard Ensemble, suggested to the audience that nearly filled the Peter Jay Sharp Theater at the school on Friday for the opening concert of the 32nd Focus! festival, a free weeklong centennial tribute to Babbitt.

title: In Napa Valley, Future Landscapes Are Viewed in the Past
description: NAPA, Calif.  San Francisco Bay, the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta and the watershed that feeds them make up one of the worlds largest estuary systems, a wildly varied tableau of beaches, river, creeks, grasslands and tidal marshes. Forty percent of the land in California drains into this rich ecosystem.

title: Ted Cruz on Feud With Donald Trump: He Started It
description: MANCHESTER, Iowa  Senator Ted Cruz of Texas suggested a simple explanation on Monday for his sudden antagonism toward Donald J. Trump in recent weeks: The other guy started it.

title: Billy Donovans One-on-One Game Plan to Connect With Thunder Players
description: Not long after Billy Donovan became coach of the Oklahoma City Thunder last spring, he had a member of his staff reach out to the players. The team had scuffled through an injury-marred season, and most of the players had scattered for the approaching summer. Steve Novak, for example, was home in Wisconsin when he got the phone call.

title: Pictures of the Day: New York and Elsewhere
description: Photos from New York, France and England

title: As Population Ages, Where Are the Geriatricians?
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Ruth Miles, 83, sat in a wheelchair in a small exam room, clutching a water bottle, looking frightened and uncomfortable.

title: Jan. 25, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from the United States, France, Israel and London.

title: Review: Drunk Shakespeare, Where the Tipsy and the Sober Take Liberties
description: It seems inevitable that soon all performing will be done either plastered or stoned. Among the early adopters of this trend, probably no one is applying more verve to the conceit than the members of the Drunk Shakespeare Society. Heres hoping others learn from their sloshy example.

title: Joni Ernst, Standing Next to Marco Rubio, Is Not Endorsing Anyone
description: DES MOINES  Senator Joni Ernst of Iowa wants you to know that she is remaining neutral in next weeks caucuses.

title: Celebrities and Their Sundance Style
description: Sundance fashion doesnt have to be Canada Goose puffers, hats and bulky boots. Here are celebrities who are stepping out stylishly in the Utah weather.

title: Citadel Punishes Students for Costumes Evoking the K.K.K.
description: Fourteen cadets at the Citadel in Charleston, S.C., were disciplined on Monday after several of them appeared last month in photographs wearing white pillowcases on their heads. The pillowcases evoked a likeness to the hoods worn by the Ku Klux Klan.

title: Some Areas Hit by East Coast Blizzard Can Only Crawl Toward Recovery
description: The storm is over. But as millions of people from North Carolina to Massachusetts tried on Monday to dig out from the weekends massive snows, it was clear that for many of them it could still be several days before life returns to normal.

title: Review: Young Pianists Offer Rich Duos
