description: Music may not offer a better mixture of grandeur and intimacy than the piano duo. Just two people on stage, yes, but each playing this instrument of fearsome potency. In range of colors and sheer volume, the combination surely has no equal in the chamber repertory.

title: Review: Peter Bergens United States of Jihad Surveys Homegrown Terrorism
description: Since Sept. 11, 2001, Peter Bergen reports in his new timely book, 330 people in the United States have been charged with some kind of jihadist terrorist crime, and a startling four out of five of them were American citizens or legal permanent residents.

title: Bill de Blasio Not Keen on a Bloomberg Presidential Run
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York weighed in Monday on a potential presidential run by his predecessor, Michael R. Bloomberg, saying he did not believe Americans would turn to billionaires to solve problems created by billionaires.

title: 2 Abortion Foes Behind Planned Parenthood Videos Are Indicted
description: HOUSTON  A grand jury here that was investigating accusations of misconduct against Planned Parenthood has instead indicted two abortion opponents who made undercover videos of the organization.

title: Sarah Palin, Rage Whisperer
description: DONALD J. TRUMP has made a shrewd bet. For the first time since he descended an escalator in Trump Tower last June to announce that this time, he really was running for president, he ceded control of his campaign message. He handed the Trump-bedecked podium over to Sarah Palin.

title: Zika Virus:Two Cases Suggest It Could Be Spread Through Sex
description: Zika virus has already been linked to brain damage in babies and paralysis in adults. Now scientists are facing another ominous possibility: that on rare occasions, the virus might be transmitted through sex.

title: A Space Station, With Surveillance Cameras for Hire
description: LONDON  The two cameras sit on the Russian part of the International Space Station. They are named Theia and Iris. And they are available to hire out for space-based video surveillance.

title: Bernie Sanders Mailing in Iowa Defends His Record on Guns
description: The rah-rah atmosphere at campaign events for Senator Bernie Sanders is often punctured, if only momentarily, by a sharp question from a voter asking him to explain his record on gun regulation and his vote affording special legal protection to the gun industry.

title: Review: The Burial at Thebes, a Vicious but Poetic Tale Retold
description: A few things feel off in The Burial at Thebes. But one big thing  the script  is on, and that saves this version of Antigone from failure.

title: Looks from Schais fall/winter 2016 collection
description: The military-inspired line is also an homage to her team.

title: For One Designer, Inspiration That Began With Hand-Me-Downs
description: Listening to the designer Suk Chai describe a garment in thorough detail is almost like seeing it and touching it for yourself. She fine-tuned her fashion vocabulary as a child, watching items that originally belonged to her eldest brother get passed to her second-oldest brother, then to her older sister, and finally to her. I waited for this particular tweed coat and red beret for at least six years, says Chai, now 43, who was born in Korea and raised in Seattle. Her first non-hand-me-down came in the form of a white, crew-neck, short-sleeved, all-cotton dress with patchwork and a poofy skirt (the occasion: her second-grade piano recital). Both outfits were special, she remarks. The tweed coat  I had my eye on that for a long, long time, and I loved it and knew itd eventually be mine; but I did like having my own clothes.

title: New York Weddings Blanketed in White
How to Build Affordable Housing in New York City
description: Hurricane Sandy was the last straw for many residents of Ocean Village, a housing project in the Rockaways. Heralded as state of the art when it opened in 1972, this beachside campus of high-rises and four-story townhouses had, over the years, taken a nose dive, the victim of bad management, crime and rot. Sandy left homes flooded, and poor tenants bereft of electricity and hot water. Residents who could, fled.

title: As Iowa Caucuses Near, Jeb Bush Goes to Nevada
description: Iowans head to their local caucus precincts a week from Monday  and Jeb Bush on Tuesday is headed to  Elko, Nev.

title: Budget Office Lowers Its Forecast for Obamacare Enrollment
description: When the Affordable Care Act was drafted, the Congressional Budget Office expected people to sign up quickly for new health insurance.

title: Hillary Clinton Gets Personal on Christ and Her Faith
description: KNOXVILLE, Iowa  Hillary Clinton is Methodist, but she rarely talks about her faith on the campaign trail.

title: The Best Womens Looks  on the Mens Runways
description: As the fall/winter 2016 mens shows wrap up in Europe, a look back at a surprising trend: the inclusion of womens wear.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing: Planned Parenthood, Jameis Winston, Ted Cruz
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Hillary Clinton, Battling in Iowa, Turns Warm Under Pressure
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa  At big ballroom dinners on the campaign trail, Hillary Clinton often emerges from behind a curtain to deliver a speech, then disappears again behind the folds when finished.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Consultant Gets $7 Million More to Plan Reform at Rikers Jails
description: In the latest indication of how daunting it has been to remake the troubled New York City jails, the de Blasio administration is spending an additional $7 million on an international consulting firm that it first hired in 2014 to develop a blueprint for reform.

title: Marvin Minsky, Pioneer in Artificial Intelligence, Dies at 88
description: Marvin Minsky, who combined a scientists thirst for knowledge with a philosophers quest for truth as a pioneering explorer of artificial intelligence, work that helped inspire the creation of the personal computer and the Internet, died on Sunday night in Boston. He was 88.

title: Seeking to End Gerrymanderings Enduring Legacy
description: WASHINGTON  Buried less than two miles from the Capitol is the man many blame for the toxic partisanship infecting Congress today even though he died 202 years ago.

title: Argentina Scrambles to Fight Biggest Plague of Locusts in 60 Years
description: BUENOS AIRES  Farmers and fumigators in Argentina are running out of time as they scramble to control the countrys worst plague of locusts in more than half a century, officials warned on Monday.

title: Bernie Sanders, Backed by Image of a Bright Horizon, Lays Out His Vision
description: In Part 2 of his closing argument to Iowans, Senator Bernie Sanders lays out his vision and explicitly asks Democrats to caucus for him.

title: Three Styling Take-Aways from Dior Couture
description: With Raf Simons gone, Diors spring/summer 2016 haute couture collection, which showed today in Paris, was left to studio heads Lucie Meier and Serge Ruffieux. Though Simonss modern sensibility was certainly felt in Meier and Ruffieuxs designs, the duo introduced small styling suggestions in several looks that were entirely fresh. Here, three tricks from the show that were cool, laid back  and far more approachable than is typical for couture.

title: Atelier Versaces Athletic-Inspired Haute Couture Collection
description: For spring 2016, Donatella Versace celebrated strength and femininity with ergonomic lines, sporty hues and cutout silhouettes.

title: Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump Far Ahead in New Hampshire, Poll Finds
description: Senator Bernie Sanders and Donald J. Trump appear to be the candidates to beat in New Hampshire, according to a poll released Monday that showed them with commanding leads two weeks before the states primary.

title: Iran Still a Leading Executioner of Minors, Report Says
description: Iran is one of the leading executioners of juvenile offenders, despite its improved legal protections for children and a pledge more than two decades ago to end the death penalty for convicts younger than 18, Amnesty International said Monday.

title: Tumult in World Markets Damps Conviction at Davos
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  The World Economic Forum has long been a citadel for corporate chieftains and government officials to bask in their collective stature, coming together to chat about what they can do as leaders about the worlds troubles.

title: Pope Francis, Catholics and Lutherans Will Recall Reformation
description: Nearly 500 years ago, Martin Luther nailed his 95 theses to the door of a German church, beginning the Protestant Reformation that led millions to break with the Roman Catholic Church and ushered in more than a century of conflict and war.

title: 2 Offices Wont Investigate New York Constitutional Amendment on Adirondack Mining
description: The offices of the New York attorney general and inspector general have declined to open investigations into the 2013 constitutional amendment that allowed a private company, NYCO Minerals, to conduct open-pit mining on state land in the Adirondack Mountains.

title: The Supreme Court Says Again: Juveniles Are Different
description: The Supreme Court has ruled repeatedly over the last decade that it is morally and constitutionally wrong to equate offenses committed by emotionally undeveloped adolescents with crimes carried out by adults. It made this point again on Monday when it ruled that people who were sentenced to mandatory life in prison without the possibility of parole as juveniles have the right to seek parole.

title: Comforts of a Hotel Thats Close to Home in Dangerous Weather
description: When Robert Kruszka of Virginia saw last weekends storm heading for the Washington area, he did not hesitate to find a place where he and his family could stay warm and comfortable  the nearby Hyatt Regency Tysons Corner Center.

title: Quintonio LeGriers Three 911 Calls
description: Audio released Monday of calls placed to the Chicago police by Mr. LeGrier on Dec. 26. Mr. LeGrier was fatally shot by officers as he emerged from a home holding a baseball bat.

title: California: Help Sought to Find Escapees
description: Two of the three inmates who escaped Friday from a maximum security jail in Orange County are believed to be members of Vietnamese gangs, and sheriffs officials said on Monday that they believe the men could be embedded within the countys sizable Vietnamese community. Officials identified Jonathan Tieu, 20, and Bac Duong, 43, as likely members of Vietnamese gangs, which they declined to name. Officials put out a message in Vietnamese asking for any information about the fugitives. The family of Mr. Tieu spoke to a local television station, and asked him to turn himself in. The two men and a third inmate, Hossein Nayeri, 37, have not been seen since the Friday morning head count at the Orange County Central Mens Jail in Santa Ana. It is unclear if they had help from jail employees or contractors.

title: Dean Skelos and His Son, Convicted on Corruption Charges, Seek New Trial
description: Lawyers for Dean G. Skelos, the former New York State Senate majority leader, and his son, who were convicted on federal corruption charges last month, filed a motion on Monday seeking a judgment of acquittal and a new trial.

title: Climate Deals First Big Hurdle: The Draw of Cheap Oil
description: Barely a month after world leaders signed a sweeping agreement to reduce carbon emissions, the global commitment to renewable energy sources faces its first big test as the price of oil collapses.

title: Yemen: Top Judge and 6 Relatives Are Killed in Airstrike
description: Airstrikes by the Saudi-led military coalition on Monday hit the home of a senior judge in Sana, Yemens capital, killing the judge along with six relatives, according to witnesses and medics. The judge, Yayha Alrubaid, who headed a court that dealt with national security matters and terrorism, had recently prosecuted members of Yemens Saudi-backed government in exile for high treason, officials said. Saudi Arabia entered Yemens civil war in March on the side of President Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi, who was driven from power by Houthi rebels last year. Coalition airstrikes have routinely hit civilian targets and killed hundreds of people, according to human rights workers. The Obama administration, which has supported the Saudi-led campaign in Yemen, issued an unusual statement on Saturday, criticizing recent airstrikes that killed a Yemeni journalist and an ambulance driver working with Doctors Without Borders, though the statement made no mention of Saudi Arabia or the coalition.

title: So Far, Amazon and Netflix Are Sundances Top Buyers
description: PARK CITY, Utah  It was the independent film equivalent of a crack of thunder.

title: Zephyr Teachout Announces Bid for New York Congressional Seat
description: ALBANY  Zephyr Teachout has a name that can be both hard to remember and, for Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, probably hard to forget.

title: El Salvadors Advice on Zika Virus: Dont Have Babies
description: SAN SALVADOR  When in human history has an epidemic become so alarming that a nation feels compelled to urge its people not to have children for two years?

title: A Tidal Wave of Corporate Migrants Seeking (Tax) Shelter
description: In the fall of 2008, with General Motors and Chrysler on the precipice of bankruptcy, executives at the car parts supplier Johnson Controls flew to Washington. The companys president testified before a Senate panel and implored lawmakers to bail out the auto industry.

title: Upset Over Megyn Kelly, Donald Trump Says He May Skip Debate
description: With anticipation building over the final Republican debate before the Iowa caucuses next week, one candidate is contemplating skipping it: Donald J. Trump.

title: Police Presence in Egypt Mutes Most Protests on 5th Anniversary of Uprising
description: CAIRO  The few dozen protesters seemed to emerge from nowhere, surging down a narrow street and waving a four-finger salute that identified them as likely supporters of Egypts outlawed Muslim Brotherhood.

title: Libya: Parliament Rejects Cabinet Plan
description: Lawmakers in Libyas internationally recognized Parliament overwhelmingly rejected a proposed United Nations-backed unity cabinet on Monday, dealing a blow to diplomatic efforts to swiftly reconcile the countrys splintered factions. Parliament, which sits in the eastern city of Tobruk, rejected the 32-member cabinet out of concern that it was too large and that its members had been chosen not for their competency but to satisfy various regional factions, according to Abu Bakr Buera, an influential lawmaker. Diplomats have been urging Libyan officials to bridge the divisions that emerged after the 2011 revolt against Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: Budget Office Sharply Cuts Health Exchange Estimate
description: WASHINGTON  The Congressional Budget Office on Monday sharply reduced its estimate of how many people would get health insurance this year through the Affordable Care Acts public marketplaces, to 13 million, from a prior estimate of 21 million.

title: Central African Republic: Court Invalidates Legislative Election
description: The Central African Republics constitutional court certified presidential election results Monday but separately scrapped results from a legislative election, citing irregularities like illegible ballots and poor training for election workers. The courts validation sets the stage for a runoff for the presidential election that pits Anicet-Georges Dologul against Faustin Archange Touadera, two former prime ministers. They will face each other in a vote scheduled for no sooner than Feb. 7. Election observers said that redoing the legislative vote, which took place simultaneously with the presidential vote, would be costly. Candidates were puzzled by the courts decision. This is illogical, said Lydie Nzengou, the communications officer for Karim Meckassoua, a presidential candidate. Why would the results for the presidential vote be more credible than those of the legislative vote?

title: Donald Trump to New Hampshire: Give Me a Mandate
description: FARMINGTON, N.H.  Donald J. Trump asked New Hampshire voters on Monday to hand him a victory so big, so beautiful, that only one word in the political lexicon could describe it.

title: The X-Files Season 10, Episode 2: Thats More Like It
description: Part human, part alien siblings who can shatter glass; stolen babies; evil parents; our heroes in danger; and suits for everyone. The X-Files is back!

title: Online, Egypts Internet Activists Mourn Their Stifled Revolt
description: As my colleague Declan Walsh reports from Cairo, a crackdown by Egypts security forces managed to suppress even the slightest echo of the massive street protests that began on this date in 2011 and led, 18 days later, to the ouster of President Hosni Mubarak.

title: Chris Christies Momentum Tested as Opponents Attack
description: HAMPTON FALLS, N.H.  Gov. Chris Christie has seized every chance to show voters that he is a man with true grit. In a summer of Black Lives Matter protests, he cast himself as a flinty defender of the police. He responded to the attacks in Paris and San Bernardino, Calif., by campaigning as a fearless former antiterrorism prosecutor.

title: Libyan Lawmakers Reject U.N.-Backed Unity Government
description: CAIRO  Lawmakers in Libyas internationally recognized Parliament overwhelmingly rejected a proposed United Nations-backed unity cabinet on Monday, dealing a blow to diplomatic efforts to swiftly reconcile the countrys splintered factions.

title: Obama Bans Solitary Confinement of Juveniles in Federal Prisons
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Monday banned the practice of holding juveniles in solitary confinement in federal prisons, saying it could lead to devastating, lasting psychological consequences.

title: Waiting in the Sky
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  The world lost DAVID BOWIE, one of its most innovative musical artists, recently. More than that, we lost someone who made it acceptable to be just who you happened to be at the time: fluid, sparkly, experimental without fear, both human and alien at once. He made it easier for kids who were discovering their own styles and their own sexuality to be themselves, and we will not see his kind again. Weve lost our Starman.

title: Man Killed by Chicago Police Called 911 Before Being Shot
description: CHICAGO  A man who was fatally shot by the police in December as he emerged from a home with a baseball bat had called 911 seeking help from the police three times in the minutes before the shooting, but was met with curt dispatchers, according to audio of the calls made public on Monday. One of the dispatchers hung up on him when he was unwilling to elaborate on what was wrong.

title: Red Wings Halt Islanders Momentum
description: Playing for only the third time in 11 days and skating in their last game before the All-Star break, the Islanders had a chance on Monday to vault into the winter break in style.

title: Bernie Sanders a Target of Ads by Republican Donor
description: A super PAC founded by the former TD Ameritrade executive Joe Ricketts is spending more than $600,000 on a television ad in Iowa lashing Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont as too liberal in the final days of his close race against Hillary Clinton in the states caucuses.

title: Trial Begins in Art Forgery Case Against Knoedler Gallery
description: Perhaps the most anticipated trial exploring the art market in recent years began Monday in United States District Court in Manhattan with a lawyer for a couple that bought a fake Rothko asserting in her opening argument that Knoedler & Company, a once-celebrated Manhattan gallery that is now defunct, had deceived its customers while selling them dozens of fake works that it said were by master artists.

title: Suspect in Machete Killing in the Bronx Said Neighbors Spied on Him, Officials Say
description: A 26-year-old man who told the police his neighbors in a Bronx public housing complex were spying on him was charged on Monday with killing a 59-year-old woman in a machete attack outside her mothers apartment, the authorities said.

title: Serena Williams Rolls Past Maria Sharapova at Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Maria Sharapova gives herself and her public plenty of time to think as she takes her now-characteristic long pause between first and second serves.

title: Traffic Comes to a Halt, and a Kitten Is Saved
description: Stopped at a light on Ocean Parkway in Brooklyn on Monday afternoon, a block from her house in Windsor Terrace, Geraldine Cassone saw a little black kitten run in front of her car.

title: Rangers Savor Win and a Week to Relax
description: Coach Alain Vigneault stepped briskly to a lectern two hours before his Rangers were to face the last-place Buffalo Sabres on Monday in their final game before the N.H.L. All-Star break and announced that Rick Nash had sustained only a bruised left knee Friday.

title: Film Academy Gives Guidance on Oscar Voting Rights
description: LOS ANGELES  As its members struggled to understand new diversity-oriented rules that may cost many their Oscar voting rights, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences late Monday disclosed guidelines meant to settle at least some questions about who remains in and who may be out of Hollywoods exclusive professional association.

title: Miley Cyrus Joins the Cast of Woody Allens Amazon Series
description: For his first foray into streaming television, Woody Allen is relying on one of his tried and true formulas  casting an attention-grabbing young actress alongside himself. In this case, Miley Cyrus, the former Disney kid turned outr pop star, will appear in his coming streaming series for Amazon.

title: Judge Upholds Gun Arrest Made by New York Officer Who Was Later Killed
description: One of the last gun-possession arrests made by a New York police officer who was killed in the line of duty last year remained intact on Monday, after a state judge denied a request by the defense to exclude the weapon from evidence.

title: 2 People From New York Are Found Dead in Cars After Storm
description: Two people from New York were found dead in their cars on Monday, and the authorities were investigating whether their deaths were related to the weekend blizzard.

title: Obama to Urge Easing 401(k) Rules for Small Businesses
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will propose in his 2017 budget new rules that would make it easier for small businesses to join together to form 401(k) retirement plans for their workers, even if the businesses are in different industries, administration officials said Monday.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | halting
description: halting  \hol-tiN\  adjective

title: Ted Cruz Reminds Iowans That Donald Trump Called Them Stupid
description: Senator Ted Cruz is trying to antagonize Iowans against Donald J. Trump, with whom he is locked in an increasingly contentious fight, in this new ad, New York Values.

title: In Iowa Forum, Democrats Promote Themes for Final Stretch to Caucuses
description: DES MOINES  Democrats made their final arguments to Iowans on Monday night, with Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont offering contrasting views about whose vision would best move the country forward.

title: What to Watch Tuesday
description: Justified all over again? Not so much, our critic says of Outsiders, which features English as a second language. Elsewhere, watch Jack Black do his panda shtick without having to buy a movie ticket. And John Quiones brings back his shame game.

title: Malaysia Closes Investigation Into Prime Minister Najib Razaks Funds
description: BANGKOK  Malaysias attorney general said on Tuesday that he had closed an investigation into transfers of hundreds of millions of dollars into Prime Minister Najib Razaks personal bank accounts because no laws had been broken.

title: Editors Note: January 26, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its not up to the government. Its up to God.

title: Christies 2015 Sales at $7.4 Billion, a 5 Percent Drop
description: After a year that included its $170.4 million auction of Amedeo Modiglianis Nu Couch in November, Christies on Tuesday announced total sales of $7.4 billion for 2015, down 5 percent over the previous year.

title: Liberals Turn to Cities to Pass Laws and Spread Ideas
description: If Congress wont focus on a new policy idea, and if state legislatures are indifferent or hostile, why not skip them both and start at the city level?

title: Amid Bay Area Gentrification, One Mans Three-Year Struggle
description: A chance encounter with a man trying for a new start in Oakland led to a complex, three-year tale with no easy answers.

title: Merger of Huntington and FirstMerit to Create Banking Giant in Ohio
description: Huntington Bancshares said on Tuesday that it would buy FirstMerit Corporation in a deal worth $3.4 billion in stock and cash.

title: Amid Bay Area Gentrification, One Mans Three-Year Struggle
description: Amid the political and cultural fervor a half-century ago, Oakland and the Bay Area were once home to founding members of the Black Panthers, Beats and hippie movements. These days its attracting many white middle-class residents who bring with them rising rents and displacement. When Sam Wolson moved to Oakland, he became keenly aware that he was a part of that influx.

title: What Voters Want
description: Imagine youre discussing the presidential election with a group of friends who live in Iowa or New Hampshire. You ask them who they intend to vote for next month.

title: Opening a New Front Against ISIS in Libya
description: The Pentagon is ramping up intelligence-gathering in Libya as the Obama administration draws up plans to open a third front in the war against the Islamic State. This significant escalation is being planned without a meaningful debate in Congress about the merits and risks of a military campaign that is expected to include airstrikes and raids by elite American troops.

title: Stay Sane America, Please!
description: In January of 2017 someone will stand at the U.S. Capitol and deliver an Inaugural Address. This is roughly the place where Abraham Lincoln, Franklin Roosevelt, Dwight Eisenhower and Ronald Reagan once stood. I am going to spend every single day between now and then believing that neither Donald Trump nor Ted Cruz nor Bernie Sanders will be standing on that podium. One of them could win the election, take the oath, give the speech and be riding down Pennsylvania Avenue. I will still refuse to believe it.

title: The Punctual Patient
description: It was two years into the treatment, and T., a retired executive, still continued to fantasize about being my ideal and favorite patient. She repeatedly attempted to please me by trying to say whatever she thought I would like to hear, despite the fact that I kept reminding her that this was her treatment, not mine.

title: Democracy on Hold in Haiti
description: A runoff election on Sunday for president in Haiti was postponed indefinitely late last week. The decision made sense, because with protesters in the streets, violence and gunfire and the torching of electoral offices, it was clear that any vote would be marred by bloodshed and chaos.

title: EKG Screening for College Athletes
description: LAST March, the N.C.A.A.s chief medical officer, Brian Hainline, announced that he was going to recommend that all male college basketball players undergo an electrocardiogram, which measures the electrical activity in the heart, presumably as a requirement for being cleared to play competitively. He said his action was in response to research suggesting that the risk of sudden cardiac death in Division I basketball players was about one in 5,200 per year, much higher than previously thought.

title: Whats Our Duty to the People Globalization Leaves Behind?
description: A FEW days ago, I visited the shiny headquarters of the Peterson Institute for International Economics on think tank row in Washington  basically, the locker room of the Team Globalization and Free Trade cheering squad.

title: Reducing Preventable Harm in Hospitals
description: First of two articles.

title: Could Bloomberg and His Millions Save Us From Ourselves?
Chinese Stocks Fall Sharply, Leading Asian Markets Lower
description: HONG KONG  Chinas stock market sank on Tuesday amid accumulating evidence of the Chinese economys deeply rooted troubles and as the central bank pushed huge sums of money into the banking system.

title: News Qs | Justices Expand Parole Rights for Juveniles Sentenced to Life for Murder
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Justices Expand Parole Rights for Juveniles Sentenced to Life for Murder.

title: Afghan Police Officer Suspected of Helping Taliban Kill 10 Comrades
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  Ten police officers in the southern Afghan province of Oruzgan were poisoned by a rogue colleague and shot in the head by Taliban fighters the officer was working with, the second insider attack on the police in the province in less than two weeks, officials said Tuesday.

title: Ted Cruzs Evangelical Gamble
description: On Nov. 13, 2013, one year after his son was elected to the United States Senate, the pastor Rafael Cruz delivered a speech at Liberty University in Lynchburg, Va. The topic  What does the Bible say about why Christians need to be involved in the political arena?  was one of his favorites, and notably appropriate for a school founded by Jerry Falwell, who also founded Moral Majority, the once-powerful political action committee. Over the course of a 30-minute speech that touched on everything from the need for school prayer to the similarities between President Obamas Washington and Fidel Castros Havana, the question of why slowly gave way to the question of who. The pastor concluded by telling his audience, God is saying to you: Vote for righteous people.

title: In Race for FIFA President, Two Front-Runners and Many Possibilities
description: The election to select the next president of FIFA, world soccers governing body, is a month away. On Feb. 26, a special  the official word is extraordinary  congress of FIFAs 209 member associations will be held in Zurich, and the successor to the now-suspended Sepp Blatter will be chosen. While some of the five official candidates have trumpeted commitments recently, plenty of speculation remains about voting support, back-room deals and campaigning tactics. Through interviews with federation officials and people connected to the candidates, all of whom spoke on the condition of anonymity, here is a look at the state of the race with a month to go:

title: Free the Nipple?
description: The debate about exposed female nipples intensified in 2015. Many women wonder why their nipples are censored, while mens arent.

title: Student Question | How Have You Helped a Friend in a Time of Need?
description: Have you ever had friends who were going through a rough time? Maybe they had a family member who died? Or they were struggling with depression or addiction? Or maybe they just needed a helping hand after a difficult breakup or a bad situation at home?

title: As Donald Trump and Ted Cruz Soar, G.O.P. Leaders Exasperation Grows
description: DES MOINES  Republican leaders are growing alarmed by the ferocious ways the partys mainstream candidates for president are attacking one another, and they fear that time is running out for any of them to emerge as a credible alternative to Donald J. Trump or Senator Ted Cruz of Texas.

title: The Wreck of Amtrak 188
description: From 30th Street Station, the train glided northwest out of Philadelphia, tracing the arc of the freeway. Near the old Schuylkill River Bridge, it jogged right, gathering speed, bound for the New Jersey border. Had you been standing anywhere near the tracks, you would have heard Amtrak 188 before you saw it, in the hum of the rail bed and the metallic shiver of the electricity in the overhead catenary wires. And then you would have felt it, in the vibration of the earth: the combined weight of a 98-ton locomotive and seven 50-ton cars, carrying a total of 258 people, eight of them employees.

title: Working, and Assimilating, on New York Farms
description: Twenty-three Bhutanese refugees have taken part in a state program, learning to be milkers at a state college and then getting jobs on local farms in Western New York.

title: From Bhutan to New Yorks Dairy Heartland
description: WARSAW, N.Y.  Purna Gurung and Hem Gurung stood in dung-slopped boots and rubber gloves, the heady perfume of wet cow, raw milk and manure permeating the room. They washed down the dirty stalls in the rotary milking parlor at Noblehurst Farms in western New York, some 7,500 miles from their birthplace in Bhutan.

title: The Fight to Free the Nipple
description: On a warm fall day, members of a literary group gathered in Prospect Park to soak in the sun and snack on chocolate pretzels. Most book clubs in a park in Brooklyn wouldnt cause much of a stir, but as the mostly female group read, men gawked and children stared. Police officers were called to the scene. The members of the Outdoor Co-ed Topless Pulp Fiction Appreciation Society are used to such attention. They are part of a larger movement called Free the Nipple, and see themselves as proponents of gender equality.

title: Ask Well: Taking All Your Antibiotics
description: Question:

title: Your Tuesday Morning Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start the day

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Hillary Clinton, Planned Parenthood,Novak Djokovic
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Giorgio Armanis Capsule Collection, Complete With Tea
description: PARIS  What is the new normal? Does such a state even exist, or is the idea that something can embody both the hitherto unseen and the standard an oxymoron?

title: New York Today: Your Local Glacier
description: Updated 9:18 a.m.

title: Republican Says Malleable Donald Trump Is More Electable Than a Rigid Ted Cruz
description: While there has been a lot of hand-wringing among conservatives about the damage they fear Donald J. Trump is doing to their brand, one centrist leader among congressional Republicans sees a potential silver lining for Mr. Trump: electability.

title: Guo Pei, Creator of Rihannas Met Gala Gown, Is Ready for Paris
description: PARIS  Until nine months ago, Guo Pei was a Chinese haute couturire known by millions in the East yet virtually unheard-of in the West. That all changed last May when the pop star Rihanna wore one of Ms. Guos designs to the Metropolitan Museum of Arts Costume Institute gala in New York, after finding her work on the Internet. The look in question, a 55-pound canary-yellow fur-trimmed gown and cape, took seamstresses 50,000 hours and more than two years to make and landed on the cover of American Vogue  and Ms. Guo on the haute couture schedule in Paris.

title: Morning Agenda: A Tidal Wave of Corporate Migrants Seeking Tax Shelters
description: A TIDAL WAVE OF CORPORATE MIGRANTS SEEKING TAX SHELTERS | Until lawmakers in Washington reform the tax code, American companies will continue their exodus in search of lower tax rates,

title: Bank of Englands Andrew Bailey Named C.E.O. of Financial Conduct Authority
description: LONDON  The Financial Conduct Authority of Britain on Tuesday named a longtime Bank of England official to serve as its new chief executive.

title: Seeking to Sway Iowans, Conservative Group Grades Candidates Exceptionalism
description: Hoping to sway undecided voters in Iowa, a conservative group has issued grades to the candidates, which it says are based on who is the most effective and principled leader.

title: From Paris With Love: Valentines Day Packages Aim to Boost Tourism
description: Hotels in the quintessentially romantic city are offering Valentines Day packages and amenities to help counter the dip in tourism attributable to last Novembers terrorist attacks.

title: In Toronto Cafes, Board Games Rule
description: Even on a sunny afternoon at Snakes & Lattes Annex,  many Torontonians didnt mind acting like kids inside. A few months ago, an elderly man traded pawn moves with a school-age girl. A cluster of millennials dug into the German-style strategy classic Carcassonne. Up front, where board games are sold, an Ottawa entrepreneur held a stack of boxes under one arm as he consulted Steve Tassie, one of the cafes game-teaching gurus, on what to stock in his own board-game cafe.

title: How -Phobic Became a Weapon in the Identity Wars
description: It started, innocently enough, at Hooters. A waitress who goes by Zola got to talking with a diner named Jessica. The two bonded over a shared romantic philosophy (each had a sugar daddy at home) and career focus (each moonlighted as an exotic dancer), and when Jessica invited Zola on a road trip to Florida to strip at some local clubs, Zola strapped in. Little did Zola know, she was hurtling toward the center of a backwater psychodrama in which she would face off against a series of pimps, johns, kidnappers, one very weepy white boy and Jessica herself, who had pulled her new friend into this nonconsensual weekend tour of the underground sex trade.

title: Poll Watch: Terrorism and Economy Are Top Concerns for Primary Voters
description: Heading into next weeks Iowa caucuses, much has been written about which candidate voters trust, who is most electable, and who seems prepared to get things done.

title: Donald Trump and Ted Cruz Are Nearly Side by Side in Iowa, Poll Shows
description: DES MOINES  Little daylight sits between Donald J. Trump and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas in Iowa, according to a new poll that shows the two presidential candidates essentially deadlocked less than a week before Republicans head to the caucuses.

title: New York Citys Pension System in Danger of Operational Failure, Report Says
description: New York Citys pension system, which encompasses $160 billion in retirement funds, is rife with problems that leave it vulnerable to an operational failure, according to an independent report commissioned by the city comptrollers office.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Jan. 19-25, 2016
description: Have you been following the past weeks news? Take our quiz to see what you know and to learn more.

title: Our Man in Iowa: Early Signs of a Big Turnout for Republicans
description: Good morning from Iowa, where premium gasoline is $1.67 a gallon at Git-n-Go, and where a warming trend has arrived, which could last through the caucuses six days from now, favoring a strong turnout.

title: Chanel: Couture
description: Karl Lagerfelds designs for couture 2016.

title: Democrats Gather to Make Final Arguments in Iowa Sprint
description: On what was perhaps the best day of Hillary Clintons primary campaign since October, she ended with a strong presence at a town-hall-style forum hosted by CNN, the final appearance by all three Democrats in the same place before the Iowa caucuses.

title: A.I.G. Opts for Streamlining, Spurning Calls for a Breakup
description: At American International Group, big is still better, at least for now.

title: Man With Knife in East Village Is Shot by Police
description: A knife-wielding man who charged at New York City police officers in the hallway of his grandmothers East Village apartment early on Tuesday was shot and wounded by a sergeant after refusing orders to drop the weapon, police officials said.

title: Wait. Which Party Is Imploding?
description: Gail Collins: Arthur, Im so pleased to be conversing with you about this election. I miss my old pal David Brooks, but Davids just got too much on his plate to pick up one more project right now. And I get another Brooks! I will refrain from making any water-related jokes.

title: Tangled Passages
description: Heres another sampling of overstuffed or impenetrable sentences in recent stories. As weve noted often, such passages are an unnecessary burden for hurried readers, and often lead to grammatical trouble.

title: 1916: Spain to Intern German Troops
description: The British successes in Cameroon are likely to be of indirect consequence to this country. In December last the Spanish Government, wishing to prevent any possible breach of Spains neutrality, entered into correspondence with the German, French and British Governments. Even at that time it appeared evident that the Germans would eventually be defeated in Cameroon, and Spain insisted upon a German assurance that, should the German troops be forced to take refuge in Spanish territory at Guinea, they would consent to be disarmed and interned. After lengthy negotiations, Germany reluctantly gave this assurance, with a rider to the effect that a German defeat was impossible.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Jan. 27, 1916

title: Netanyahu ChidesBan Ki-moon for Settlement Remarks
description: JERUSALEM  Hours after an Israeli woman who was stabbed by Palestinian assailants in a West Bank settlement died on Tuesday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel rebuked the United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, who criticized Israels settlement activity and said it was human nature to react to occupation.

title: A Retro Super Bowl, Putting Defense and Running First
description: Perhaps no N.F.L. team has reinvented itself as quickly and successfully as the Denver Broncos  from No. 1 offense headed into the 2014 Super Bowl to No. 1 defense headed into the 2016 trophy contest, from postmodern quick-snap to traditionalist ground-and-pound.

title: Taxi Drivers and Air Traffic Controllers Go on Strike in France
description: PARIS  Taxi drivers and air traffic controllers in France went on separate but simultaneous strikes on Tuesday, blocking traffic in major cities and disrupting flights at several airports.

title: United by African Music
description: Dear Diary:

title: Twitter Recruits a Chief Marketing Officer From American Express
description: The reshaping of Twitters top ranks under Jack Dorsey continues.

title: National Tour Is Planned for Hamilton
description: Hamilton is hitting the road. The Broadway musical, which has already announced that it plans to begin an open-ended run in Chicago this fall, is also planning a separate national tour next year, starting in San Francisco, moving to Los Angeles, and then on to other cities.

title: Review: A Widow Documents Her Loss in The Iceberg
description: Tom Lubbock, the chief art critic for the English newspaper The Independent, had alert blue eyes, a big laugh and terrible teeth. He was said to be a world-class mimic. His beard, a colleague recalled, gave him the air of a 19th-century Russian anarchist. People liked to be around him.

title: Ukrainian War Veterans Trade Heat of Battle for Pizza Ovens
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Out in the fields of eastern Ukraine, they fought the Russians. Now, as men in a kitchen, they are no less fearsome.

title: To Love, and Maybe Lose, a Foster Child
description: On the day it became clear to me that my time with my foster son is likely coming to an end, the bench under me was hard. The walls surrounding me were grand and white. The ceiling above me was as high as that of a cathedral.

title: Daily Report: Tepid Response to Twitter Shake-Up
description: If Jack Dorsey and the other leaders at Twitter thought news of a high-level shake-up would excite investors, they were wrong. On Monday, shares in Twitter fell once again, by 4.6 percent. The companys stock has fallen more than 40 percent in the last three months.

title: Bouchra Jarrar: Couture
description: The latest couture looks from Bouchra Jarrar.

title: Making Music on an Android Tablet
description: Q. GarageBand looks like a fun app, but not everyone uses Apple hardware. Is there a version of the program (or something similar) for the Android tablet community that isnt expensive and is also simple enough for normal people to use?

title: Undoing Years of Progress in Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  Entire towns and districts are under siege. Tanks ram through narrow alleys closed off by barricades and trenches. Residents are trapped indoors for weeks because of curfews. Those who venture outside risk sniper fire. Their bodies lie on the streets for days before they can be collected. Bullets fly in through windows and buildings collapse under shelling, killing those seeking shelter at home.

title: Strategists for Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Aim for Every Inch of Iowa
description: DES MOINES  Inside the Iowa campaigns of Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders, the latest polling and reports from volunteers in the field told a tantalizing tale: There were votes to be had in Mason City.

title: 1941: Nazi Flyer Escapes Canada
description: A garrulous young German aviator with taped ears and an exuberant grin arrived in Grand Central Terminal early yesterday, eager to tell the world how he escaped from a Canadian prison train. Baron Franz von Werra found no time for conversation, however. A brusque German consular attache shouldered his way down platform 32 when the train from Ogdensburg pulled in at 6:45 a.m. and collared the twenty-six-year-old pursuit pilot as soon as he alighted. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 27, 1941

title: U.S. Eases Restrictions on Financing Exports to Cuba
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration announced Tuesday that it was removing major impediments to contact between the United States and Cuba by lifting restrictions on American financing of exports to the island nation and relaxing limits on the shipping of an array of products, from tractors to art supplies.

title: Nebraska Senator Raises Issue of Donald Trumps Sexual Affairs
description: Senator Ben Sasse of Nebraska reeled off a stream of Twitter messages going after Donald J. Trump on Monday night, questioning the candidates flip-flopping on gun rights and health care policy, his expansive view of presidential power  and his well-publicized history of bedroom exploits.

title: Jane the Virgin Season 2, Episode 9: Pride and Prejudice
description: Most network TV shows have breaks and hiatuses, but there is always so much happening in any given episode of Jane the Virgin that trying to remember each plot line after a few weeks away can be nearly impossible.

title: G-Dragon in Paris, Another Appearance on Chanels Front Row
description: PARIS  The latest stage of the Asian invasion of the Paris couture season occurred at the Chanel show, held at the Grand Palais on Tuesday morning.

title: The Spurs Are Great, but the Warriors Are Much, Much Better
description: The San Antonio Spurs were supposed to be the team that slowed the Golden State Warriors inexorable run to the N.B.A. title. The arrival of LaMarcus Aldridge, the continued transformation of Kawhi Leonard into a star, the veteran leadership of Tony Parker and Tim Duncan and the craftiness of Coach Gregg Popovich seemed to add up to a formidable challenge for the defending champions.

title: Report on Troubled New York City Pension System
description: An independent report commissioned by the city comptrollers office found the citys retirement system needed additional resources, staffing and the basic tools required to understand the complicated risk embedded in its investments.

title: El Nio Storms Put Pacifica Cliff Apartments at Risk
description: On a stretch of coast between San Francisco and Half Moon Bay, rows of apartments sit on cliffs, dangerously close to falling into the Pacific Ocean.

title: From Movement in Ancient Art to Radical Choreographers
description: Trisha Brown and Steve Paxton

title: When Made in Israel Is a Human Rights Abuse
description: Just before Christmas, Ron Dermer, Israels ambassador to the United States, sent the White House a box of holiday gifts with a pointed political message. Inside were items (body lotion, halvah, olive oil) produced in Jewish settlements in the West Bank. Or rather, as Mr. Dermer put it in an accompanying letter, in Judea and Samaria  the term used by religious nationalists who see the settlements as no less a part of Israel than the Galilee or Tel Aviv.

title: Inquiry in China Adds to Doubt Over Reliability of Its Economic Data
description: HONG KONG  The veracity of Chinas economic data has been increasingly questioned as the slowing pace of the countrys growth has startled the world. And a new investigation into the official who oversees the numbers is unlikely to inspire confidence.

title: Disneys Aladdin to Begin National Tour in 2017
description: The Broadway musical Aladdin has already taken its magic carpet to Europe and Asia. Now the show is ready to travel America.

title: Panel Calls for Depression Screenings During and After Pregnancy
description: Women should be screened for depression during pregnancy and after giving birth, an influential government-appointed health panel said Tuesday, the first time it has recommended screening for maternal mental illness.

title: Fed Fumble
description: US growth seems to have slowed sharply. Fed Kremlinologists are already wondering how the FOMC will word its next statement, so as to acknowledge the reality without sounding too panicky. But panic may be warranted; given the combination of slowing growth and a big deterioration of financial conditions, theres growing talk that the Fed made an error in hiking rates.

title: Crumbling Cliffs on California's Coast
description: Drone footage shows apartment buildings along Esplanade Avenue in Pacifica, Calif., that have been declared uninhabitable in the wake of the eroding coastline.

title: Panzanella to Suit the Season
description: Id always thought of panzanella as a summer salad made with stale bread and tomatoes.

title: Carnegie Hall Announces Its 2016-17 Season
description: With an early-music festival exploring works from the Venetian Republic, a Bruckner symphony cycle and a celebration of Steve Reichs 80th birthday, Carnegie Halls 2016-17 season, announced on Tuesday, bears the unmistakable imprint of Clive Gillinson, who survived a power struggle last year to remain artistic and executive director.

title: Reporters Notebook: Navy SEAL Commanders Suicide
description: In looking into the suicide of  a Navy SEAL team commander, Job W. Price, during a deployment in late 2012, Times reporters learned more about the stresses on elite Special Operations troops, the stigma that many have felt about seeking help for mental health issues and what the military is trying to do to change that. Christopher Drew, one of the reporters who worked on the story, discusses these issues.

title: Venezuelan Opposition Seeks Housing Giveaway
description: Now that former President Hugo Chvezs old adversaries have taken over Parliament, they want to give away the deeds to hundreds of thousands of homes that he built.

title: Foes May Hate Hugo Chvez, but They Like His Political Playbook
description: CIUDAD MIRANDA, Venezuela  Twenty thousand people live in this concrete bastion built by President Hugo Chvez. He gave them the keys, and they gave him their votes.

title: Russia Will Reset Relations With West on Its Own Terms, Official Says
description: MOSCOW  The Russian foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, said on Tuesday that while he wanted to see a reset of Russias relations with the United States, Moscow would not budge on any of the issues that put it at odds with Washington.

title: Billie Joe Armstrong Warns of Censorship After School Cancels American Idiot
description: In what could be a scene straight from the punkish musical American Idiot, a Connecticut high school has canceled a planned production of the show, citing its sex, drugs and foul language.

title: Tiny Leech Named for Amy Tan
description: Amy Tans novel Saving Fish from Drowning (2005) included a number of references to jungle leeches, such as a teasing suggestion that one character eat them as part of a mock reality show called Darwins Fittest.

title: Passport Expiring Soon? Renew It Now, State Dept. Says
description: If you have a United States passport expiring any time in 2016, the State Department has a message for you: Renew it now.

title: John Kasich and Chris Christie Pick Up Endorsements in New Hampshire Race
description: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio, whose campaign has seen some positive signs in New Hampshire, has been endorsed by two more newspapers in the region, The Boston Globe and The Concord Monitor.

title: Pope Francis and Hassan Rouhani of Iran Discuss Mideast Unrest
description: VATICAN CITY  Pope Francis met with President Hassan Rouhani of Iran on Tuesday  the first meeting between a pope and an Iranian leader in nearly 17 years  and urged Iran to play an important role in finding political solutions for the various conflicts afflicting the Middle East.

title: Depression in Mom or Dad Increases Risk of Premature Baby
description: Having a mother or father who is depressed increases the risk of preterm birth, a new study has found.

title: Chanel and Valli: Odes to the Natural World
description: PARIS  The climate change conference held in Paris late last year represented many things  a political breakthrough, the first real global agreement on the subject, a triumphant narrative for France after the tragedy of the November attacks  but for some in fashion it was also an inspiration.

title: At Schiaparelli, Inspiration Comes From Fine Dining
description: The houses spring/summer 2016 haute couture show was filled with references to food  with, of course, a heavy dose of shocking pink.

title: Super Bowl Spotlight on Santa Clara Reveals How It Has Changed
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif.  Santa Clara hosting Super Bowl 50 is a miracle along the lines of the Catch. Before the 49ers moved their practice center here in 1988, it would have been hard to fathom the N.F.L. champion being crowned here, even for someone with an imagination like mine, which grew as wild as the cottontail plants along the Guadalupe River trail.

title: Achilles Heel and Resto
description: Wine-bar fare at a restored dockworkers bar in Greenpoint, and Koren Grieveson, the former chef of Avec in Chicago, takes over at Resto in Kips Bay.

title: Meat Matters at Achilles Heel in Greenpoint and Resto in Kips Bay
description: In its more peaceful hours, Achilles Heel, a revived waterfront bar with a painted stone facade in the Greenpoint section of Brooklyn, reminds me of McSorleys Old Ale House.

title: Antibirth, Natasha Lyonne and Chlo Sevignys Sundance Reunion
description: PARK CITY, Utah  There was a time when Natasha Lyonne and Chlo Sevigny personified the Sundance circus. It was 2003, and the festival was becoming more of a celebrity party zone than a film showcase. The film that brought the two gregarious actresses to Sundance that year was even called Party Monster.

title: Activist Investors May Have Met Their Match: A Down Market
description: The stock market slump has hit activist hedge funds particularly hard, raising the question of whether shareholder activism can survive a down market.

title: In a Different Key: The Story of Autism, by John Donvan and Caren Zucker
description: Through history, the commandment to act with empathy has been more honored in the breach than in the observance. In their new book, John Donvan and Caren Zucker chart Americas path to recognizing autism as part of the human condition, making a case that the arts as well as advocacy have been central to the process. The authors come from the world of television news  Donvan is a correspondent for ABC, and Zucker is a journalist and producer  and their book is crafted like a tightly edited news special: The prose is vivid, the tempo rapid and the perspective intimate, as if each character has been filmed with a hand-held camera. They depict history through biography, recounting the stories of individuals with autism and their families, physicians and psychologists  focusing on those who challenged traditional concepts of cognitive and behavioral debility and led the way to broader acceptance of autism.

title: Argentina and Aramco Are Deals for Difficult Times
description: Two big deals dominated the agenda in Davos, Switzerland, last week: Argentinas negotiations with holdout creditors and Saudi Arabias potential sale of a piece of its national energy leviathan, Saudi Aramco.

title: Rapper B.o.B Insists Earth Is Flat. Take That, Neil deGrasse Tyson.
description: People at one time did not have the privilege of seeing a famous rapper debate a famous astrophysicist about whether the earth was flat. We are deprived no more.

title: Donald Trump Receives Backing From Jerry Falwell Jr.
description: The evangelical leader Jerry Falwell Jr. endorsed Donald J. Trump for president on Tuesday, giving the Republican candidate another boost in the final days before the Iowa caucuses, in which religious voters usually play a crucial role.

title: A Gentleman in the Water Lilies
description: Dear Diary:

title: Amherst College Drops Lord Jeff as Mascot
description: AMHERST, Mass.  Lord Jeffery Amherst, the colonial-era military commander who gave this town its name, will no longer represent the prestigious liberal arts college here.

title: Why Its So Hard to Be a Third-Party Candidate, Even if Youre Bloomberg
description: The dream of a centrist third-party presidential candidate will never die.

title: At Christian Dior, a New Era of Approachable Couture
description: For spring/summer 2016, the house paid homage to its roots while celebrating a more modern approach to dressing.

title: An Odd Diplomatic Dance as U.N. Prepares for Syria Peace Talks
description: GENEVA  Ever get an invitation and think to yourself, I wonder who else is going? Should I go?

title: Switzerland to Finance Research Into Disputed Art
description: PARIS  The Swiss government announced this week that it would spend almost $2 million to finance research to help museums to track down the ownership of art that may have been illegally taken by the Nazis during World War II.

title: Djokovic Seeks Big Four Supremacy in Semifinal With Federer
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Great and enduring rivalries have been the motor for mens tennis in the age of the Big Four: Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray, the Ringo Starr of this supergroup.

title: Computerized Trading Firm to Take Over Barclayss N.Y.S.E. Seats
description: The high-frequency trading takeover of the New York Stock Exchange is now essentially complete.

title: Jonas Kaufmann Cancels Met Opera Production
description: Jonas Kaufmann, the star tenor, has canceled his performances in a highly anticipated new production of Puccinis Manon Lescaut that will open at the Metropolitan Opera next month. The company said in a statement that Mr. Kaufmann was suffering from illness.

title: Submit Questions for Nahnatchka Khan of Fresh Off the Boat
description: Nahnatchka Khan answered the questions here.

title: Lorne Michaels, Saturday Night Live Creator, to Be Subject of a New Biography
description: For all but a few of the 41 seasons that Saturday Night Live has been on the air, Lorne Michaels has been at the helm of this NBC sketch-comedy institution, helping to give national attention to stars like Tina Fey, Bill Murray, Tracy Morgan and Jimmy Fallon. Now a new book will tell the story of Mr. Michaelss life and a trailblazing comedy career spanning nearly half a century.

title: Danish Law Requires Asylum Seekers to Hand Over Valuables
description: LONDON  Denmark passed a law on Tuesday requiring newly arrived asylum seekers to hand over valuables, including jewelry and gold, to help pay for their stay in the country. The move underscored an anti-immigration backlash that has prompted several European countries to seek ways to discourage migrants from entering.

title: Pok, a Hawaiian Specialty, Emerges in Chelsea
description: Wisefish Pok Not that restaurants are any more reliable than finance, but Drew Crane and Bryan Cowan have fled the world of money management to bring their passion for pok (poh-kay), the Hawaiian specialty they encountered in the islands, to New York. We love pok and saw that it has exploded on the West Coast, Mr. Crane said. We want to make it acceptable here. (Actually, New York now has a number of pok options.) The dish is simple: raw fish, often tuna, diced in a bowl with rice, garnishes and dressings. And it is well suited to fast casual dining; bowls, in three sizes, are assembled at a counter according to set combinations or the customers choice of ingredients: 263 West 19th Street, 212-367-7653, wisefishpoke.com.

title: Sundance Roars for a Black Film, and Fox Searchlight Bids $17 Million
description: PARK CITY, Utah  With the outcry over an all-white field of acting nominees for the coming Academy Awards, and the shutout of several films focused on black characters from the best picture race, Hollywood has come under extreme pressure in recent weeks to find more prestige-minded movies with diverse casts.

title: Tennis Announces Review of Anticorruption Efforts
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Tennis officials on Wednesday announced an independent review into their sports anticorruption program, including its internal integrity unit.

title: Human Trafficking: It Can Happen Next Door
description: To the Editor:

title: A.I.G. Does Not Go Far Enough in Overhaul
description: The American International Group is making a renewed push to improve returns.

title: Potemkin Ideologies
description: As I keep saying, the Republican and Democratic parties, as revealed by their primaries, are not at all symmetric.

title: From Paris, Instagrammable Mens Fashion
description: PARIS  No matter what anybody  critic, stylist, editor, photographer, buyer  thought or felt about the mens wear designs rolled out here over the last five days, there was finally a single determinant of success: social media metrics.

title: Trademark Park Names?
description: To the Editor:

title: Capping Off London Collections Men With a Champagne Dinner
description: GQ magazine hosted a dinner for about 120 dapperly dressed guests, including Lucky Blue Smith.

title: The Anti-Fiscal Bubble
description: Jonathan Chait has been having some fun with the GOP orthodoxy that the Obama stimulus was a complete failure; as he notes, the overwhelming majority of economists, both in universities and in the private sector, disagree  but Republicans apparently know nothing about this.

title: How to Get Five Planets Into a Single Photograph
description: Greg Hogan, an amateur astronomer from Kathleen, Ga., woke up at 5:30 a.m. on Sunday with two of his sons and went to a nearby wilderness area known as Oaky Woods to capture this image of five planets as they danced across the dawn sky. The rare celestial performance is set to repeat every morning until late February, creating stellar photo ops for early morning risers.

title: Dealing With Iran: The Key Word Is Respect
description: To the Editor:

title: Frequently Asked Questions: How to Travel to Cuba
description: [UPDATED SEPT. 29, 2017]

title: Dont Distract Me
description: In 1893, Grover Clevelands doctor peered into the presidents mouth and discovered a tumor. He deemed it a bad-looking tenant and recommended immediate surgical removal. Im reminded of this every time I spot my iPhone on my desk or bedside table, or hurtling around in my purse. The iPhone is a bad tenant: It makes disturbing noises, it keeps me up at night, it devours my attention, it costs me dearly. It should be banished from my life, yet I do not have the courage to evict it.

title: A Teacher, Disillusioned
description: To the Editor:

title: Advice on Rikers Island
description: To the Editor:

title: Beatrix Potter Manuscript About a Cat With a Double Life Is Found
description: Once upon a time there was a serious, well-behaved young black cat.

title: Carter and Dempsey Offer Condolences
description: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter and Gen. Martin E. Dempsey, in Washington to testify about ISIS strategy before Congress, spoke of the military helicopter crash off the coast of Florida.

title: National World War I Memorial Proposal Is Unveiled
description: WASHINGTON  It is a war without any living veterans, fought on another continent and overshadowed by subsequent, more bloody American campaigns.

title: Freddie Grays Sister Appeals for Calm
description: Fredericka Gray, the twin sister of Freddie Gray who suffered a spinal cord injury in police custody, appealed for calm on Saturday before a peaceful protest gave way to violence in Baltimore.

title: Abe Vigoda, of Godfather and Barney Miller, Dies at 94
description: Abe Vigoda, the sad-faced actor who emerged from a workmanlike stage career to find belated fame in the 1970s as the earnest mobster Tessio in The Godfather and the dyspeptic Detective Phil Fish on the hit sitcom Barney Miller, died on Tuesday morning in Woodland Park, N.J. He was 94, having outlived by about 34 years an erroneous report of his death that made him a cult figure.

title: Sheriff Joe Arpaio to Endorse Donald Trump in Iowa
description: Joe Arpaio, the hard-line anti-immigration sheriff from Maricopa County, Ariz., will appear with Donald J. Trump in Iowa on Tuesday and endorse his candidacy, according to Mr. Trumps campaign.

title: Obama Addresses United Nations
description: On the final day of the Sustainable Development Summit, Obama addressed world leaders about economic inequality and limited opportunities for women.

title: Obama Meets With the Emir of Qatar
description: President Obama hosted the emir of Qatar, Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad al-Thani, on Tuesday, and both said they were committed to defeating the Islamic State and other terrorist organizations.

title: Donald Trump Assails Iowa Religious Leader
description: As word spread that Donald J. Trump had picked up the endorsement of the evangelical leader Jerry Falwell Jr., Mr. Trump took to Twitter to attack a leading Christian conservative supporter of his main rival, Senator Ted Cruz of Texas.

title: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Acquires Frida Kahlo Work
description: The Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, announced Tuesday that it had acquired its first painting by Frida Kahlo, the Mexican modernist whose unsettlingly beautiful works are few and far between in American public collections. Dos Mujeres (Salvadora y Herminia), from 1928, depicts two Mexican women, maids whom Kahlo had known since childhood, set against dense tropical foliage.

title: Beyond Labels
description: A new generation of chefs is fusing history and innovation.

title: A Belle poque for African-American Cooking
description: At Salare, a restaurant in Seattle, Edouardo Jordan serves winter squash with fried okra and a seed-based sauce modeled on the egusi stews of Nigeria.

title: Food Lovers Aim to Give the Bronx Its Due
description: As a child in the Bronx, Jon Gray used to entertain himself by reading The Joy of Cooking. On nights when his family ventured out to a restaurant, he took charge.

title: Giorgio Armani Priv: Couture
description: The couture 2016 collection from Giorgio Armani Priv.

title: Undercover Planned Parenthood Video
description: Video from the Center for Medical Progress, an anti-abortion group, purported to show Planned Parenthood officials trying to illegally profit from the sale of fetal tissue. A leader and another employee of the anti-abortion group were indicted.

title: Daniel Doctoroff Takes His Business to Hudson Yards
description: Daniel L. Doctoroff, the powerful former deputy mayor who pushed to add glittering offices and apartments to industrial areas in New York, giving much of the skyline its current look, is moving to a neighborhood of his making.

title: Meredith Is Said to Be Set to End Media General Deal
description: The Nexstar Broadcasting Group may finally get the deal with Media General it has been trying to consummate for six months.

title: Christie Announces Plan for State Control of Atlantic Citys Finances
description: ATLANTIC CITY  The elected officials of this struggling seaside gambling resort will yield control of the citys finances to the state government in a deal announced on Tuesday by Gov. Chris Christie that is intended to stave off bankruptcy.

title: Making a Haute Couture Look: Dior
description: Yesterdays spring/summer 2016 haute couture show marked Diors first show since the departure of Raf Simons  and the first designed by the houses studio heads, Lucie Meier and Serge Ruffieux. In the show notes, they described the collections shapes: Volumes are freestyle, the Bar jacket changes appearance depending on whether it is worn closed or loose; the shoulder is sensual, bare. On the above image, we take a closer look at the making of one Dior haute couture look.

title: Fox News to Donald Trump: Megyn Kelly Stays as Debate Moderator
description: As Donald J. Trump continues to criticize Megyn Kelly before the Republican presidential debate on Thursday, Fox News is showing no signs of giving the candidate an inch in his request to remove Ms. Kelly from the debate moderating panel.

title: 'X-Files' Ratings Stay Strong
description: Foxs revival of The X-Files has come crashing out of the gates with some big ratings. For its premiere Sunday night, it drew 16.2 million viewers, following Foxs broadcast of the NFC Championship Game. On Monday night, the second episode attracted an audience of 9.7 million viewers. It also drew a 3.2 rating in the 18-to-49 year old demographic important to advertisers, which was the highest rating in that bracket on network television for the night.

title: Regulators to Return $21.5 Million to Hedge Fund Shut After Raid
description: A little more than five years after federal agents raided the offices of Level Global Investors, securities regulators are returning $21.5 million in settlement money that the hedge fund paid to resolve an insider trading investigation.

title: In The Piano Lesson, a Family Fight Over an Heirloom Rooted in Slavery
description: You already know their words will be wonderful. But pay attention, too, to the actors eyes. They offer a kind of punctuation that conjures still more magic in an already outstanding production of The Piano Lesson, at the McCarter Theater Center in Princeton.

title: Marco Rubio Tries Distancing Himself From Elites He Hopes to Lead
description: OSKALOOSA, Iowa  Senator Marco Rubio of Florida is fond of telling voters hungry for a political outsider that he is not the candidate with the most endorsements from leading Republicans. He doesnt mention that he has the second most, behind only Jeb Bush.

title: 3 Democrats May Debate Next Week in New Hampshire
description: The Democratic presidential candidates may gather one more time in New Hampshire for a televised debate days before voters head to the polls there.

title: Clinton vs. Sanders: The Struggle for the Democrats Soul
description: To the Editor:

title: Hillary Clinton Attends Cities Conference
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton participated in a conference on U.S. cities in Washington on Monday, saying that cities are driving prosperity despite the persistence of wealth gaps.

title: The Dollar Keeps Rising, for Good or Evil
description: Just the other day I got an email in which Ron Paul, libertarian icon, former member of Congress from Texas and father of the Republican presidential candidate Rand Paul, eagerly proclaimed that his final prediction of a dollar collapse is about to become reality.

title: Brazil Will Deploy Troops to Spread Awareness of Zika Virus
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils government has decided to deploy 220,000 troops for a day next month to spread awareness about the Zika virus, which has been linked to severe birth defects in thousands of infants.

title: Chris Christie Apologizes to One Critic  but Only One
description: Gov. Chris Christie apologized Tuesday for having labeled a New Jersey mayor as crazy after the mayor suggested that flooding from last weekends blizzard was worse than during Hurricane Sandy.

title: At Dior, a (Surprise) Matte Red Lip
description: There wasnt a single red lip on Christian Diors spring 2016 couture runway  which was presented yesterday in Paris  until well into the show. After a sea of models with nude lips, the makeup director Peter Philips sent out the vibrant beauty look, which was inspired by the houses founder. Christian Dior had this idea: Halfway through the show when people were getting bored, hed do a surprise  and quite often it was a red dress that suddenly came out of nowhere, Philips said, referring to what has come to be known as the coup de Trafalgar. He lined a handful of models lips with a Dior lip pencil in Rouge Royale before painting them with Diorific lipstick in Fabuleuse. To get the same soft edges, another classic trick: gently blot.

title: Short Answers to Hard Questions About Postpartum Depression
description: Answers to questions about depression screening and maternal mental illness, following new recommendations saying that women should be screened for depression during pregnancy and after childbirth.

title: Judge Approves Settlement in Head Injuries Suit Against N.C.A.A.
description: A federal judge granted initial approval of a settlement Tuesday between the N.C.A.A. and a group of athletes who sued the association over its handling of head injuries. The agreement, which still needs N.C.A.A. approval, does not contain cash settlements for the plaintiffs in the proposed class-action suit, but mandates a new national protocol for head injuries sustained by players.

title: Japanese End Drought in Sumo Wrestling, Their National Sport
description: In Tokyo on Sunday, the sumo wrestler Kotoshogiku won the first of the years six top-level tournaments. The result was big news because of his nationality: Japanese.

title: Apple Says Sales of iPhones Have Slowed
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The iPhone fueled Apples ascendance into the worlds most valuable company. But even iPhone sales have their limits.

title: Pictures of the Day: Israel and Elsewhere
description: Israel and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Dangers for Female Prison Guards
description: An investigative video shows that female correctional officers around the country face many threats in the workplace, including at the hands of their co-workers.

title: Harassment and Attacks From Fellow Officers in U.S. Prisons
description: In Americas hidden world of prisons and jails, officers are unarmed and outnumbered by inmates: Their peers are their only protection.

title: Jan. 26, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Israel, Indonesia, Paris and South Africa.

title: Sri Lanka Destroys Illegal Elephant Tusks
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka  A group of saffron-robed monks chanted as officials crushed more than 300 elephant tusks in a seaside ceremony on Tuesday, as the new government of President Maithripala Sirisena sought to differentiate itself from its predecessor by sending a powerful message of intolerance for elephant poaching.

title: Familiar Faces Lend Star Power to Video Game Voices
description: To Star Wars fans he has been the face of one of the most beloved characters in film, Luke Skywalker. To video-game players, though, Mark Hamill is the unmistakable voice of the Joker in Batman: Arkham Asylum and its sequels.

title: Face in the Crowd: Iggy Azalea at Armani
description: The Australian rapper Iggy Azalea, known for her singles including Fancy and Goddess, held court in the front row of the Armani Priv show in Paris Tuesday next to the actresses Charlotte Rampling and Juliette Binoche.

title: Touring the Ruins of St. Peters Seminary in Scotland
description: A night tour of one of Scotlands most famous modern ruins, St. Peters Seminary, above, will open the countrys first Festival of Architecture. For the ticketed event, called Hinterland, held March 18 to 27, audiences will walk through woodlands to explore the derelict buildings, backed by moving light installations and a specially commissioned recorded choral work performed by St. Salvators Chapel Choir of the University of St. Andrews. Built 50 years ago, the structure was heralded as a modernist masterpiece of glass and concrete, but fell into disrepair after being deconsecrated in 1980. A planned restoration will transform it into an arts facility.

title: Mayor de Blasio Makes New York Citys Fiscal Case to a Wary Legislature
description: ALBANY  Mayor Bill de Blasio arrived here on Tuesday with a substantial wish list for the State Legislature, urging lawmakers to deliver money for several of New York Citys needs, including public housing, infrastructure and health care.

title: MoMA Trims Back Some Features of Its Planned Renovation
description: Gone is the Art Bay, with a glass garage-like door that would have allowed visitors to enter galleries straight from the street.

title: The Panettone That Big Chefs Cant Get Enough of
description: Its beginning to look a lot like  Valentines Day? Barely a month after launching his virtual luxury bakery From Roy with two Christmas panettones  one scented with candied orange and raisins, the other a less traditional chocolate-streaked loaf  the pastry chef Roy Shvartzapel has unveiled a third in honor of the holiday at his workshop in Los Gatos, Calif. The news is cause for celebration among Shvartzapels discerning devotees  many of the countrys most respected chefs among them. His domed wonders are unworldly in their featherweight texture: the tender crumb dissolves on your tongue, almost like cotton candy, were cotton candy spun from butter. They seem paradoxically rich and ethereal at the same time.

title: Migrant Influx in Germany Raises Fears of Anti-Semitism
description: BERLIN  These days, all talk here is of the ramifications of taking in more than one million asylum seekers who arrived over the past year.

title: Octo Telematics, Whose Technology Monitors Driving, Prepares I.P.O.
description: In a market that has scared off potential initial public offerings of stock, one company whose purpose is to manage risk is taking steps toward a market debut.

title: A Pair of Cousins Who Make Furniture, and Sometimes Partner With Daft Punk
description: The cousins Cdric and Nicolas Hervet first partnered on a construction project as teenagers; their fathers, who are brothers, both had workshops filled with machinery that the boys used in an attempt to recreate the hoverboard theyd seen in Back to the Future II. We took the entire thing seriously, sketching and welding an aluminum box that was filled with helium, Nicolas says. Our grandfather ran over the prototype with his car. Of course, in the end, it didnt work anyway.

title: Egyptian Satirist Threatened for Giving Police Condom Balloons
description: An Egyptian comedian who works as a correspondent for a popular satirical television program could be in legal trouble for handing balloons made of inflated condoms to police officers in Tahrir Square on Monday, the fifth anniversary of the uprising against former President Hosni Mubarak.

title: Bernie Sanders Wont Attack Hillary Clinton, but Hell Point Out Her Ties to Wall Street
