description: Couture from the designer who created Rihannas gown for the 2015 Met Gala.

title: Review: Emily Wells Layers Art-Pop, Filament by Filament
description: Promise

title: Theranos Lab May Pose Threat to Patient Safety, Regulator Says
description: A federal regulator has found that a lab run by Theranos, the Silicon Valley laboratory that promised to perform blood tests with a simple finger stick, violated several clinical standards, including one it said posed a threat to patient safety that had to be immediately corrected.

title: Review: Florist Offers Skeletal Songs That Find Strength in Damage
description: The Birds Outside Sang

title: Review: Alessia Cara, Voice for Outsiders, Becomes an Insider
description: Wallflowers have a champion in Alessia Cara, the 19-year-old Canadian singer and songwriter who headlined Webster Hall on Tuesday night. Ms. Caras lyrics pivot from self-doubt to self-affirmation in songs like Wild Things, which declares, Dont wanna hang around the in crowd/The cool kids arent cool to me. The hit that sold out the club for Ms. Cara is Here: a jazzily sung, finely detailed depiction of a party she wishes shed never attended. She calls herself an antisocial pessimist and sings on the chorus, I ask myself, what am I doin here? Its far and away the best song on her 2015 debut album, Know-It-All (Def Jam).

title: Bernie Sanders Insists Hell Keep Pledge to Release Medical Records Before Iowa Caucuses
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont has said that he plans to release his medical records before the Iowa caucuses on Monday. But with just five days to go, his campaign is not saying when exactly those records will be made public.

title: January Letter From Government Regulators
description: A federal investigation of Theranos found in January that it violated several clinical standards, including one that it said posed an immediate threat to patient safety.

title: Review: In This Is Acting, Sia Adheres to Her Victim-to-Victory Formula
description: This Is Acting

title: Review: You, Me and the Apocalypse Looks at the End
description: There has been so much apocalyptic television over the years that once in a while the genre needs a blast of fresh air to disperse some of the gloom and earnestness. Last winter, the offbeat Fox comedy The Last Man on Earth, created by and starring Will Forte, provided it. On Thursday night, You, Me and the Apocalypse takes on the task, making the end of the world an unpredictably enjoyable ride, as it ought to be.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Oregon, Bernie Sanders, Donald Trump
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Drakes Secret Weapon Is All Set to Break Loose
description: Most musicians perform live for the first time in front of a few close friends. Majid Jordans live debut came before a televised crowd of millions.

title: Cate Blanchett to Make Broadway Debut in Play Directed by John Crowley
description: Cate Blanchett, one of the most acclaimed actresses of her generation, will make her Broadway debut next season in a new adaptation of a lesser-known Chekhov play.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Fox News vs. Trump: Setting Free the Golden Goose
description: Who would win in a fight: a Fox or a golden goose? Were about to see.

title: Ben Carsons Campaign Beset With Frustration, Disappointment and Grief
description: DES MOINES  As Ben Carson got ready for a television interview beside the pulpit of a Pentecostal church this week, campaign aides asked his supporters to move across the room and sit in the empty pews behind him.

title: Donald Trump Details His Debate Night Plans
description: Donald J. Trump is moving forward with his Thursday night campaign event, which will serve as counter-programming for the Republican presidential debate that he has decided to skip.

title: Samantha Hunts Mr. Splitfoot, and More
description: MR. SPLITFOOTBy Samantha Hunt 322 pages. Houghton Mifflin Harcourt. $24.

title: Spotify Is Said to Be Seeking $500 Million in New Funds
description: Spotify is looking to raise at least $500 million in new funding to continue its global expansion and compete with powerful outlets like Apple, Pandora and Google, according to a person briefed on the companys plans.

title: The Supreme Court Rules for Common Sense in Electricity Case
description: The Supreme Court earlier this week upheld a federal regulation that encourages factories, shopping malls and other users of electricity to reduce their consumption during periods of high demand, like hot summer afternoons. The well-reasoned decision will save consumers money and improve the reliability of the electricity grid.

title: Few Answers on When Flint Will Have Clean Water Again
description: FLINT, Mich.  More than three months after officials declared that Flint residents should not drink the lead-tainted water from their taps, people who live here are still lugging bottled water from a Walmart or firehouse back to their homes, where they use it to drink, prepare food, brush their teeth and bathe their children.

title: Chris Christie Ratchets Up Attacks on Marco Rubio
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, smarting from weeks of negative commercials against him in New Hampshire, has struck back at several Republican opponents in animated appearances on the campaign trail this week.

title: In Oregon, This Is Less the End Than It Is the Beginning
description: Why would the F.B.I. even want to come in here and risk bloodshed? Jason Patrick, one of the armed protesters occupying the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge in Oregon, wondered aloud to me a week and a half ago, as we stood smoking in the snow, watching the daily flow of trucks carrying volunteers and supplies into the compound. Over a marsh with some birds in it? I dont see it.

title: Report Exposes Widespread Abuses in Ticketing Industry in New York
description: Free tickets to an appearance by Pope Francis were resold for thousands of dollars, in ways that most likely violated New York State law.

title: Ex-Department of Justice Lawyer Faces Penalties in Leak of N.S.A. Program
description: WASHINGTON  The District of Columbia bar is pursuing ethics charges against a former Department of Justice lawyer who has said he was one of the sources for a 2005 article in The New York Times about the National Security Agencys program of wiretapping without warrants.

title: M.T.A. Bans Hoverboards on Transit System
description: First it targeted manspreading. Now hoverboards.

title: Gilead Faces Fights Over Hepatitis C and H.I.V. Drugs
description: The attorney general of Massachusetts said on Wednesday that she had opened an inquiry into whether Gilead Sciences had violated state consumer protection laws by charging too much for its hepatitis C drugs.

title: Anna Laerkesen, Danish Ballerina With Poetic Originality, Dies at 73
description: Anna Laerkesen, a leading ballerina in the Royal Danish Ballet who, breaking a traditional mold, won international acclaim for her poetic originality as a dancer in the 1960s and later as a choreographer, died on Jan. 14 in Copenhagen. She was 73.

title: New Engineering Firm Called Upon to Fix Squibb Park Bridge
description: The Brooklyn Bridge Park Corporation has finally acknowledged what everyone else has known for months: The $4.1 million Squibb Park Bridge, closed for 17 months, is not reopening anytime soon.

title: Concepcion Picciotto, Who Kept Vigil by White House for Three Decades, Dies
description: President Obamas closest neighbor died on Monday, just a few days after vacating the peace vigil encampment behind the White House that she had occupied for more than 30 years in what was considered the longest political protest in American history.

title: Rihannas New Album, Anti, Is Leaked Online
description: The surprise release of a new Rihanna single, Work, went smoothly on Wednesday morning as the song shot to the top of the iTunes charts in dozens of countries. But by 7 p.m. Eastern time, what appeared to be her entire eighth album, Anti, had leaked online, another misstep in an already fraught rollout.

title: Deprivation in Syria Deepens as U.N. Talks Loom
description: Two top United Nations relief officials expressed growing frustration on Wednesday over the organizations inability to deliver aid to destitute Syrians trapped by war, saying that the number of besieged areas has risen to 18 from 15 in the past few weeks and that nearly half a million people may be at risk of starving to death.

title: Lawyers Assail Runaway Grand Jury in Indictments of Abortion Opponents
description: HOUSTON  Lawyers for anti-abortion activists, including one who was a leading figure in the defeat of the citys anti-discrimination ordinance last year, on Wednesday called this weeks indictments of Planned Parenthood critics legally flawed. They said they would ask the district attorney not to proceed with the case.

title: Open Subway Cars May Come to New York City as Early as 2020
description: Moving from one subway car to another is no easy task.

title: Other Candidates May Join Donald Trump Away From Debate
description: DES MOINES  Donald J. Trump may have some company from other candidates at his counterprogramming event here on Thursday night during the Fox News-hosted Republican presidential campaign debate.

title: Water Pollution in Hoosick Falls Prompts Action by New York State
description: ALBANY  Scrambling to contain an environmental scare in the small upstate village of Hoosick Falls, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo directed two New York State agencies on Wednesday to use Superfund money, filtration systems and testing to address the presence of a toxic chemical in the local water supply.

title: Jets Become Latest N.F.L. Team to Settle a Wage Lawsuit Filed by Cheerleaders
description: The Jets have become the fourth team in the N.F.L. to settle a class-action lawsuit over wages paid to their cheerleaders.

title: 100 Pounds of Heroin Found in Truck in Queens
description: Investigators this week found 100 pounds of heroin, with an estimated street value of $14 million, hidden in an axle and drive shaft casings in the bed of a pickup truck pulled over after a drug task force stakeout in Queens, the authorities said on Wednesday.

title: Sothebys Narrows Its Loss in Final All-Taubman Sale
description: In its final auction devoted wholly to its former chairmans collection, Sothebys sold $24,128,750 worth of Old Master artworks on Wednesday night, right in the middle of the $21 million to $30 million it had projected.

title: With Deals in Baseball, Opting Out Is Very In
description: Dave Dombrowski had never given an opt-out clause. He had never seen a benefit for his team and had never faced the choice that confronted him this winter, his first as president of baseball operations for the Boston Red Sox. Dombrowski could give an opt-out to the free agent David Price or miss out on the ace his team needed.

title: With No Dtente, Donald Trumps Feud With Fox Takes Center Stage
description: For months, Donald J. Trump had kept up a relentless and sometimes personal barrage against the Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly, in retaliation for the tough  and, he said, unfair  questioning she submitted him to in the first Republican debate last summer. And for months, Fox News and Ms. Kelly had avoided taking the bait, intent on sticking to Ms. Kellys vow to avoid becoming part of the story.

title: Marvin Lipofsky, Ceramist Who Elevated Blown Glass to Fine Art, Dies at 77
description: Marvin Lipofsky, a founder of the studio-glass movement, which took blown glass from the realm of interior decoration and functionality and showed its potential as a fine-arts medium, died on Jan. 15 in Oakland, Calif. He was 77.

title: Mets GotCespedes With a Give-and-Take: More Money but Fewer Years
description: Last week, the agent for Yoenis Cespedes, Brodie Van Wagenen, called Mets General Manager Sandy Alderson and requested a more substantive conversation, setting in motion the process that brought Cespedes back to the Mets.

title: Reports of Zika-Linked Birth Defect Rise in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils health ministry issued new figures on Wednesday about the Zika virus that offered reason for continued concern, but also a glimmer of hope.

title: Walt Williams, Outfielder Known as No Neck, Dies at 72
description: Walt Williams, a high-energy, free-swinging outfielder who played for four major league teams but who was probably best known for the unusual physique that earned him the nickname No Neck, died on Saturday in Abilene, Tex. He was 72.

title: New York Will Shed Clock for Some Statewide Tests
description: Statewide exams given to third- through eighth-grade students in New York will no longer be timed, the State Education Department said on Wednesday, ending the call of pencils down.

title: Change of U.S. Command Set in Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama nominated Lt. Gen. John W. Nicholson Jr. to lead American military operations in Afghanistan, where the United States is at a critical juncture in the fight against the Taliban, the Pentagon said on Wednesday.

title: Review: I and You Is Lauren Gundersons Sentimental Character Study
description: If you have dipped into the tear-filled pools of young adult literature  or the films inspired by it  you have probably encountered a couple like Caroline and Anthony. Theyre the sparring, sparking high school students in I and You, Lauren Gundersons perky two-character study in adolescent confusions and cosmic mysteries, which opened on Wednesday at 59E59 Theaters.

title: Party Staple
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Let me float this by you: Its Thursday, so it wouldnt be out of place for there to be some sort of trick today, right? As tricks go, a rebus is not a terribly complicated one, but what if, in addition to the rebus, there was an extra layer of goodness?

title: A Fox News Host Implores Donald Trump to Debate. Its Still No.
description: Donald J. Trump, boycotting the Fox News debate but not one of the networks hosts, insisted to Bill OReilly on Wednesday night that he wasnt walking away from a tough situation even as Mr. OReilly said he thought Mr. Trump had erred in skipping the final face-off before the Iowa caucuses and pleaded with him to change his mind.

title: Donald Trump, Barely Mentioning Debate, Returns to the Comfort Zone of a Large Rally
description: GILBERT, S.C.  The political world was still shaking with the news that Donald J. Trump would sit out the next debate, but on Wednesday night the candidate himself, full of self-flattery and short on time, barely mentioned it.

title: Unsealed Complaint: United States v. Bundy, et al
description: The criminal complaint against eight arrested on Tuesday night.

title: Serena Williams Routs Radwanska and Nears a 22nd Major Title
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  As Serena Williams recovered from a run at history that ended with the finish line in sight, Agnieszka Radwanska spent the months following the 2015 United States Open chasing titles all over Asia, winning in Japan, China, the Womens Tennis Association finals in Singapore and, at the start of this year, again in China.

title: Queens Man Sought in Shooting Death of His Girlfriend
description: The police on Wednesday were searching for a man who they said shot and killed his 36-year-old girlfriend in their Queens apartment, then wounded a neighbor whose son he thought was having an affair with her.

title: Obama Takes First Step in a Cancer Moonshot
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama signed a presidential memorandum on Thursday creating a White House task force on cancer, the first step in what Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has called a moonshot to cure the disease, administration officials said.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | augury
description: augury  \o-gy-re, -g-\  noun

title: New York Arts Organizations Lack the Diversity of Their City
description: New York Citys cultural sector does not match the demographic diversity of the its population, though the sector is more diverse than arts organizations on the national level, according to a survey released on Thursday by the citys Cultural Affairs Department.

title: Fox Names Golf Analyst
description: Fox Sports named Paul Azinger its lead golf analyst, a week after the company parted with Greg Norman. Azinger has worked for ABC and ESPN for a decade; Norman was a novice at broadcasting when Fox hired him last year.

title: What to Watch Thursday
description: You, Me, and the Apocalypse plays doomsday for laughs. Josh Gad makes like Donald Trump and rides a wrecking ball in Lip Sync Battle.

title: Corrections: January 28, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: After Factory Closing, Iowans Live Realities of Global Economy
description: When Electrolux closed its factory in an Iowa town, residents learned how globalization is more than just a buzzword tossed about during presidential caucuses.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: They keep telling us, We dont know when you can drink it again. How much longer can we keep doing this, using bottled water for everything?

title: After Factory Closing, Iowans Live Realities of Global Economy
description: Every fourth winter, Iowas cities and small towns become the center of nonstop attention from political elites as presidential hopefuls court voters while media scrums record closely stage-managed campaign events. For photojournalists, this process of recording campaign set pieces can lead to a distorted and shallow view not just of the candidates but also of Iowans (who are pretty much left alone after the quadrennial spotlight).

title: Zika Virus Requires an Urgent Response
description: No sooner was the Ebola virus subdued in Africa than another virus, Zika, began sweeping through South and Central America. It has been linked to serious birth defects and is threatening to invade the United States. It is imperative that the World Health Organization not repeat its sluggish response to the Ebola crisis and act urgently this time to mobilize international action.

title: Why Isnt Marco Rubio Winning?
description: Late in October, when it was still possible to envision a somewhat normal Republican primary season, Marco Rubio and Jeb Bush had a moment on the debate stage that seemed as if it might be a turning point in the campaign.

title: Deconstructing Hillary and Bernie
description: The Democratic presidential race hasnt been getting as much attention as the Republican side. This is for the same reason that professional wrestling gets more viewers than Book TV. Theres something compelling about a lot of grunting and body slams.

title: Compassionate Conservatives, Hello?
description: Back in 2000, George W. Bush did something fascinating: On the campaign trail he preached compassionate conservatism, telling wealthy Republicans about the travails of Mexican-American immigrants and declaring to women in pearls that the hardest job in America is that of a single mother.

title: Hillary Clintons Crucible
description: Monday nights presidential town hall provided the best format and platform yet for the Democratic candidates. Each was able to play to his or her strengths without the back-and-forth conflict-baiting that debate moderators seem to demand.

title: The Need for a Tax on Financial Trading
description: A financial transaction tax  a per-trade charge on the buying and selling of stocks, bonds and derivatives  is an idea whose time has finally come. It has begun percolating in the Democratic presidential campaign, with all three candidates offering proposals.

title: So What Would It Mean to Beat China on Trade?
description: If you were Donald Trump, you would probably summarize the academic papers finding as follows: China is beating us.

title: Deutsche Bank Says Managers Wont Get Bonuses Amid Record Loss
description: LONDON  Deutsche Bank, confirming that it would post a record loss for 2015, said on Thursday that members of its management board would not receive bonuses for the year and that shareholders should not expect a dividend until 2017 at the earliest.

title: Rival Confirms Bid for Australian Port and Railroad Operator
description: HONG KONG  The Australian port operator Qube said Thursday that it had formalized an offer to buy Asciano, another Australian port and railroad operator, for about $6.3 billion.

title: Racial Reparations and the Limits of Economic Policy
News Qs | Familiar Faces Lend Star Power to Video Game Voices
description: The following lesson activities are based on the column Familiar Faces Lend Star Power to Video Game Voices.

title: The Brooklyn Apartment That Almost Got Away
description: When Nate Katz, originally from Maine, came to New York, he lived with a roommate, moving a few times within Park Slope, Brooklyn. By the time he met Julia Rogawski, a native of Manhattan, he was living by himself there in a rundown railroad one-bedroom.

title: Wedding Gifts That Evoke the Wild
description: Gifts for adventurous newlyweds who go on safaris, or those who prefer to enjoy wildlife at home.

title: What to Look for in a Republican Debate Without Donald Trump
description: Following is immediate real-time analysis of the seventh Republican debate. Read additional fact checks here.

title: Blooks: The Art of Books That Arent Explores the World of Fake Books
description: Mindell Dubanskys romance with fake books began nearly two decades ago at a Manhattan flea market, where she picked up a small volume carved from a piece of coal and bearing the name of a young man who had died in a mining accident in 1897.

title: New Snow-Plowing Strategy Left a Mixed Bag in Queens
description: Well before the blizzard of 2016 descended on New York, city officials had prepared a new blueprint to tackle the accumulating snow, creating new plow routes and a different hierarchy of roadways.

title: Colleges That Ask Applicants About Brushes With the Law Draw Scrutiny
description: The online admissions application for Auburn University appears simple, until you get to this question on Page 7:

title: Kate Winslets Red Carpet Looks
description: The actress knows what looks good on her and often dresses herself for big events.

title: Kate Winslet Keeps It Simple and (Sometimes) Stylist-Free
description: On screen, its been impossible to pigeonhole Kate Winslet. Shes variously played a Jane Austen heroine (Sense and Sensibility), rebellious Edwardian (Titanic), artsy hipster (Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind) and intelligent villain (the Divergent series). Most recently, she won a Golden Globe and has been nominated for an Academy Award for her role as a Polish-Armenian computer marketing guru (Steve Jobs).

title: Akira Amari, Japans Economic Revitalization Minister, Resigns Amid Scandal
description: TOKYO  A chief architect of Prime Minister Shinzo Abes plan to resuscitate Japan, the worlds third-largest economy, resigned on Thursday after reports by a magazine that he had accepted money from the head of a construction company in exchange for political favors.

title: Student Question | Do You Wish Your Conversations Were Less Small Talk and More Big Talk?
description: In a recent Modern Love essay, a man tries instituting a no small-talk policy on first dates. He asks:

title: What Its Like to Live in Iowa Before the Caucuses
description: How the lives of six residents intersected with the campaigns in the last week.

title: Voter Registration Doesnt Point to Huge Iowa Surge
description: Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump are counting on a surge of new, irregular and independent voters to turn out in Iowa and propel them over rivals with greater support among traditional caucus voters.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Donald Trump, Oregon, Serena Williams
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start the day.

title: New York Today: Making History, on Ice
description: Updated 8:57 a.m.

title: Hillary Clinton Reverts to Previous Stump in Final Days Before Iowa Caucuses
description: Fresh off a fund-raiser with Jon Bon Jovi in Philadelphia, Hillary Clinton will return to rural Iowa on Thursday for a whirlwind schedule of events across the state in the final days before Mondays caucuses.

title: Africa Kine
description: A Senegalese restaurant reopens in Harlem.

title: Africa Kine in Harlem Returns to Its Humble Roots
description: The restaurant was once named Africa, as if embracing an entire continent, when in fact the focus was on the cooking of the western coast, mainly Senegal.

title: Morning Agenda: Markets Wobble After Fed Affirms Its Plan
description: MARKETS WOBBLE AFTER FED AFFIRMS ITS PLANS | The Federal Reserve did not raise its benchmark interest rate, but indicated that its plan to gradually increase it remained intact,Binyamin Appelbaum reports in The New York Times.

title: Couture Season Ends With Valentino and Guo Pei
description: PARIS  In a telling piece of accidental theater, as the Paris couture shows drew to a close with the debut of the Chinese designer Guo Pei, whose work went viral last year when she made the poached-egg extravaganza Rihanna wore to the Met Gala, news also broke that Chanel, a tent pole of the Paris couture system and a notoriously private company, was losing its chief executive.

title: With Iowa Caucuses So Close, Campaign Intrigue Spills Onto Capitol Hill
description: With the Iowa caucuses just days away, the fractious presidential primary campaign was the talk of Capitol Hill on Wednesday. Senator Harry Reid, for one, probably wishes he had stayed quiet on the subject of Donald J. Trump.

title: Roger Federer the Craftsman Is a Victim of a Novak Djokovic Masterpiece
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The match that broke a 22-22 tie started out as a mismatch.

title: Our Man in Iowa: Reading the Donald Trump Tea Leaves
description: Good morning from Iowa, where seven Republicans are preparing for Thursday nights debate, the last one before Iowans caucus, and where one high-profile abstainer is not.

title: Hugh Hewitt Doesnt Care for Billionaires
description: When CNN announced that you would join the team moderating its Republican presidential debates, you justified your inclusion, despite being a partisan journalist, by saying that conservative-specific issues are not the standard issues we hear about. Do you think your presence has changed the debates? Yes. And the debates are working. Theyre working very, very well, in fact. A very sophisticated group of voters is absorbing information. I compare it to the way you combat a serious illness. You accumulate information about the illness as you go along. The countrys really sick, so were getting a lot of information.

title: Helen Macdonald: By the Book
description: The author of H Is for Hawk and, most recently, Shalers Fish says reading mystery novels is hugely comforting when youre freaking out about your own writing.

title: Letter of Recommendation:Cracker Barrel
description: In 2001, my family went on a road trip from Houston to Toronto  the place where my parents first lived when they immigrated from the Philippines  and along the way, we stopped at every single Cracker Barrel we saw. I cant remember exactly why we did this, but its effects on my psyche have proved long-lasting. Even now, a Cracker Barrel works on me like Vegas on gambling addicts or Disney World on children: I know the optimism is fleeting and the fantasy is imagined, but I never manage to keep my cool.

title: Review: The Finest Hours Stars Chris Pine, Leading a Mission Against All Odds
description: The waterlogged disaster movie The Finest Hours is a moderately gripping whoosh of nostalgia that shamelessly recycles the 50s clich of the squeaky-clean all-American hero. In this Disney movie, adapted from a book by Michael J. Tougias and Casey Sherman and based on real events in February 1952, Bernie Webber (Chris Pine), a Coast Guard sailor based in Chatham, Mass., leads a next-to-impossible rescue mission during the most fearsome noreaster this side of The Perfect Storm.

title: In Vermont, the Lure of Skiing in the Mad River Valley
description: A few years ago, I was skiing high above the Sugarbush resort in Vermont with John Egan, a legend of extreme skiing 20 years before the genre had even been identified. Mr. Egan has starred in audacious ski movies from Argentina to Siberia and everywhere in between. He could live almost anywhere, his teaching skills and reputation making him welcome at dozens of skiing resorts. But he has instead called Mad River Valley in central Vermont home for decades.

title: The Generosity in Senegalese Stew
description: Rama Dione rubbed chicken with heady garlic and ginger before simmering it with onions and tomato paste. She thickened the pot with a serious amount of peanut butter, and when the sauce cooked to a blanketing gravy, I marveled at the deep, nutty flavor of the dish called chicken mafe. Its believed to have origins in Mali, then to have spread to the rest of West Africa, and from there across the Atlantic to the American South, where it evolved into Virginia peanut soup. I asked Ramas husband, Papa Diagne, why he thought this dish became so popular in his native Senegal, hoping to find a little homesick romance. We have a lot of peanuts, he said. We had to find something to do with them.

title: In Kung Fu Panda 3, a New Dad Who Talks Like Bryan Cranston
description: Kung Fu Panda 2, in 2011, ended with a surprise: The title panda, genial Po (Jack Black), wasnt an orphan, after all. So we knew that when Kung Fu Panda 3 inevitably came along, it would be about Pos reunion with the father he hadnt seen since he was a cub.

title: Anticipating the Metrics of a Trumpless Debate
description: The hypothetical question of what would happen at the Republican debates without Donald J. Trump has loomed over the first six face-offs. That question is about to be answered.

title: What Does a Parrot Know About PTSD?
description: Nearly 30 years ago, Lilly Love lost her way. She had just completed her five-year tour of duty as an Alaska-based Coast Guard helicopter rescue swimmer, one of an elite team of specialists who are lowered into rough, frigid seas to save foundering fishermen working in dangerous conditions. The day after she left active service, the helicopter she had flown in for the previous three years crashed in severe weather into the side of a mountain, killing six of her former crewmates. Devastated by the loss and overcome with guilt, Love chose as her penance to become one of the very fishermen she spent much of her time in the Coast Guard rescuing. In less than a year on the job, she nearly drowned twice after being dragged overboard in high seas by the hooks of heavy fishing lines.

title: The Challenger Space Shuttle Disaster, 30 Years Later
description: The explosion of the space shuttle Challenger on Jan. 28, 1986, remains one of the worst accidents of the American space program.

title: Williams vs. Graf, and Grafs Disciple
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The previous hour had been a blur for Angelique Kerber, who was digesting a lot on Thursday: the first Grand Slam semifinal victory of her 14-year professional career, a postmatch meal and sound bites rationed to the news media. She had one more treat to savor, which she waited to open until after fulfilling her news media obligations.

title: Sixth Ex-Broker Cleared in London Libor Trial
description: LONDON  A sixth former broker was acquitted on Thursday of charges that he helped a onetime trader at UBS and Citigroup manipulate an important benchmark interest rate known as Libor.

title: Sellers of Donkey Gelatin, a Chinese Cure in Crisis, Seek a State Remedy
description: BEIJING  As if there had not been enough scares out of China lately, a new threat looms: a shortage of donkey skin gelatin.

title: First Draft Focus: Throwback Thursday  Familiar Faces
British Government to Delay Retail Sale of Lloyds Stake
description: LONDON  The British government said on Thursday that it would delay plans to sell a stake in Lloyds Banking Group to retail investors this spring, the second time in two years that it has delayed the sale because of turmoil in the financial markets.

title: Everybody Hates Ted Cruz? No, Not Even Close
description: Donald Trump recently appeared on the Fox News Channel show Fox and Friends to declare, Everybody hates Ted.

title: Donald Trump Divides Gods Voters
description: Nearly four decades after his father founded the Moral Majority, Jerry Falwell Jr. is presiding over the biggest crisis the modern evangelical coalition has ever had to face.

title: Patients, and Doctors, Arent Dying at Home
description: The daughter of one of my long-time patients recently pulled me aside to ask, uncomfortably, What do I do if  when  my mother dies at home? Her mother was 90 and had been hospitalized, again, for difficulty breathing. We were able to get her back home and, thankfully, avoid the intensive care unit. Shed already signed a do-not-resuscitate order and had specified that she did not want intubation.

title: Zika Virus Spreading Explosively in Americas, W.H.O. Says
description: The World Health Organization rang a global alarm over the Zika virus on Thursday, saying that the disease was spreading explosively in the Americas and that as many as four million people could be infected by the end of the year.

title: Alibabas Strong Earnings Are Seen as Good News for Chinas Economy
description: HONG KONG  Gu Minghuis sugar-cookie business is enjoying growing sales and continued profits. The big question, for Chinas Alibaba Group and the Chinese economy, is whether the countrys appetite will last.

title: Suburban Dreaming in Woodstock
description: Dear Diary:

title: Illness That Diverted American Airlines Flight Remains a Mystery
description: LONDON  American Airlines Flight 109, traveling to Los Angeles from London, was more than two hours into its journey and close to Keflavik, Iceland, when several passengers and crew members suddenly and mysteriously became ill. Those aboard were startled, news reports said, and the pilot decided to fly back to London.

title: The Four Big Questions About Donald Trumps Chances
description: Donald Trumps path to the Republican nomination has become a lot clearer over the last month. Some prominent members of the partys beleaguered establishment have backed him against Ted Cruz, and Mr. Trump now leads in Iowa. It gives him a chance to run the table in the early states over a still divided field of mainstream candidates.

title: Iranian Oil Shipper Hopes to Make Up for Lost Time as Sanctions End
description: TEHRAN  Until 2012, the leaders of the National Iranian Tanker Company relished their work, playing cat and mouse with the Western authorities as they tried to keep a portion of their fleet on the seas despite an array of economic sanctions.

title: Review: Rihanna, Blissfully Adrift, Juggles Styles on Anti
description: There are vocal powerhouse pop stars, who dominate with the sheer magnitude of their gift; kaleidoscopically vivid pop stars, who dazzle with enthusiasm and energy; diligent pop stars, who chip away at success until they strike oil; cheeky pop stars, who understand the absurdity of the situation but manage to convincingly stay the course.

title: Blackstones Fourth-Quarter Profit Plunges
description: Score one for Mr. Market.

title: French Comedian Dieudonn Says Hes Barred From Hong Kong
description: The comedian Dieudonn Mbala Mbala, whose anti-Semitic comments have put him at the center of a free-speech debate in France, said on Thursday that he had been detained at the Hong Kong Airport and barred from entering the territory.

title: Russians Learn the Ways of the Cowboy From American Ranch Hands
description: VALUETS, Russia  A visibly tiring but stubborn Aberdeen Angus cow sank all of her four feet in the rich black mud of central Russia, refusing to budge. Try as they might, the two Russians yanking on the rope lassoed around her wide, wet neck could not pull that massive body out of the icy December slush.

title: Daily Report: Facebooks Lucrative Long View
description: Mark Zuckerberg has told investors over and over: Dont expect Facebook to focus much on quarterly earnings. The company is taking the long view.

title: Disconnecting From a Virtual Private Network
description: Q. I installed a virtual private network program on my iPhone to use for protection when public Wi-Fi was the only connection option around, but now I cant turn it off. In the iPhones connection settings, I keep flipping the VPN button to Off, but it turns itself back on. What do I do?

title: 24 Die After Iraqi Kurdish Refugees Boat Sinks Off Greek Island
description: LONDON  At least 24 people drowned and 11 others were missing after a boat carrying Iraqi Kurds sank off the Greek island of Samos in the Aegean Sea, close to the Turkish coast, the authorities said on Thursday.

title: Fords Annual Profit Surges to $7.4 Billion
description: DETROIT  Record sales in the American auto industry last year translated into big profits for Ford Motor, which on Thursday said that it earned $7.4 billion in 2015 primarily because of strong sales in the United States market.

title: Must Rhodes Fall?
description: LONDON  When America catches a cold, Britain sneezes  eventually. The argument about the proper limits of free speech and political correctness that has raged for years on American campuses has arrived at British universities with a vengeance.

title: Washington Gives $1.3 Million in Parking Fines During Snowstorm
description: During its six-day snow emergency, the city of Washington, D.C., reportedly issued thousands of parking tickets carrying $1.3 million in fines.

title: A Paul Taylor American Modern Dance Program for $5
description: Paul Taylor American Modern Dance has added a performance to its coming season: a triple bill that, while resembling other programs of Taylor favorites, differs in one key respect. All tickets cost $5.

title: Todd Haynes Collects Images to Guide the Feel of His Films
description: The first shot of the drama Carol begins on a subway grate and tilts up to reveal the bustling streets of 1950s New York. That shot and the many that follow show art deco hotels, crowded and meticulously designed department stores, beautiful suburban homes, and smart fashions, and they sometimes feel as if they were taken from the pages of magazines or photography books that depicted the period. And in a way, they were.

title: 1941: Axis Forces Rally in Italy
description: ROME  New life, vigorous and confident, is flowing into the Axiss war machine in the Mediterranean zone, and while neither the daily communiques of the high command nor the Italian press gives any hint of it, a mighty counter-offensive against the Greco-British forces in Albania is being carefully prepared. The Fascist regime has more reason now to be confident that the tide of battle may shortly turn against the British in the Mediterranean region than it had before the recent meeting between Fuehrer Adolf Hitler and Premier Benito Mussolini in Germany. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 29, 1941

title: Corporate Lawyers Say They Are Spending More In-House
description: Chief legal officers at corporations in 41 countries say they are spending more  and hiring more staff members  in-house, according to a new study by the Association of Corporate Counsel, a legal professionals membership group, that asked 1,300 corporate lawyers and chief legal officers.

title: Art Institute of Chicago Names New Director: James Rondeau
description: James Rondeau, a contemporary-art curator who has organized several highly regarded exhibitions over the last decade, has been named the new director of the Art Institute of Chicago, where he has worked for 18 years and recently helped to usher in one of the museums largest art donations.

title: Barbie Adds Curvy and Tall to Body Shapes
description: When it comes to Barbies body, it will no longer be one size fits all.

title: Jos Limn Dance Foundation Appoints New Artistic Director
description: Colin Connor, a former soloist with Limn Dance Company who went on to a career in choreography and education, is returning to the Jos Limn Dance Foundation as its artistic director.

title: Russian Dissident Artist Is Said to Be Sent for Psychiatric Evaluation
description: MOSCOW  Russian prosecutors have sent a dissident performance artist best known for having nailed his scrotum to Red Square to a psychiatric hospital for evaluation, his partner, Oksana Shalygina, said on Thursday.

title: For House Democrats, Support for Obama Agenda Came at a Cost
description: BALTIMORE  When President Obama addressed the annual retreat for House Democratic lawmakers in 2009, the event had the buoyant exuberance of a pep rally as he urged his partys robust majority  then 257 members strong  to help muscle through his economic stimulus plan.

title: Its Still Bill Clinton, but the Old Magic Seems to Be Missing
description: MASON CITY, Iowa  Bill Clinton came to vote-rich Mason City on Wednesday night and recounted his wifes life experiences, recited her policy ideas, and ripped into the Republicans a bit. But what Mr. Clinton used to do so well, and what Hillary Clinton needs only days before the Iowa caucuses on Monday, was nowhere to be found: a polished, piercing critique of an opponent, in this case Bernie Sanders.

title: Making a Murderer Towns Answer to Netflix Series: You Dont Know
description: MANITOWOC, Wis.  In the tourism office here, where workers are accustomed to cheery inquiries about Manitowoc Countys best jogging paths and beach views, the questions have suddenly turned dark: How could you possibly promote tourism in such a corrupt town? Why would anyone visit here?

title: Marsannay, Modest but Fully Realized Burgundy
description: Of the many beautiful things about good red Burgundy, the most striking is the way the wine keeps changing before you. From the moment you open a bottle and pour the first glass, a cascade of elusive aromas and flavors captures your attention.

title: Your Next Lesson: Etna Rosso
description: From the ancient vineyards of Burgundy, we travel to the newly emerging region of Etna in Sicily.

title: The Coming Mess in Venezuelan Debt
description: Ive always considered sovereign debt to be as much about politics as debt.

title: The Meaning Behind Bernies Yearning
description: Ben Cohen, a co-founder of Ben & Jerrys, explained the companys new Bernie Sanders-themed ice cream flavor.

title: 1966: Attack on Vietnam Policies
description: WASHINGTON  Sen. J.W. Fulbright, chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, sparked an open revolt on Capitol Hill against President Johnsons Vietnam policies. In a four-hour inquisition of Secretary Dean Rusk, Sen. Fulbright joined other Democratic members of his committee in questioning the basic assumptions of U.S. policy in Southeast Asia during the last 15 years. Committee members said the interrogation was the sharpest grilling that Mr. Rusk had ever received in Congress during his entire five-year career as secretary of state.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Jan. 29, 1966

title: In Greeces Populism, Precious Lessons for Europe
description: Athens  It may just be coincidence, but in the year since a radical left movement and an extreme right-wing party joined forces to govern Greece, the resilience of the European Union has been tested. But it may be also that the forces released in Greece have emerged in many other countries, poisoning relations among member states.

title: How the Zika Virus Is Affecting Travel
description: The travel industry is beginning to react as vacationers rethink their trips amid growing concern over the Zika virus, the mosquito-borne disease that experts say is possibly linked to microcephaly in babies. The spread of the virus has led the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to warn pregnant women and those planning to become pregnant against travel to affected areas, including popular Caribbean tourist destinations like Puerto Rico, the United States Virgin Islands and Barbados, as well as Mexico, Brazil and Panama.

title: A Menu With Perfume at Its Core
description: Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten put another perfume blotter to his discerning nostrils  the eighth of 26 he would sniff on a recent afternoon. His eyes rolled up in concentration, looking beyond the dining room ceiling of his flagship restaurant. What was his encyclopedic mind of flavors seeing? Berries, he guessed tentatively.

title: Rouhani Goes Shopping in Europe as Iran Enjoys New Economic Freedoms
description: PARIS  Europe, whose economic struggles have grown that much greater with recent problems in crucial markets like China and Russia, is rushing to do business with a newly accessible and eager, if still problematic, partner: Iran.

title: How to Watch the G.O.P. Debate
description: Following is immediate real-time analysis of the seventh Republican debate. Read additional fact checks here.

title: Candidates and God on the Campaign Trail
description: The expectation from organized church groups that political candidates must bear emphatic witness to a belief in God is giving rise to a rich array of candidate comments this time around the primary circuit.

title: Berlin Show Features German Ethnologists Copies of Art From Prehistoric Times
description: BERLIN  Among the exhibitions at the fledgling Museum of Modern Art in New York in 1937 was a show of 150 watercolor copies of prehistoric rock paintings and engravings that, the museum noted, had been selected by its director, Alfred H. Barr Jr.

title: On the Beat of Black Lives and Bloodshed
description: IN my early years as a police reporter, I often pulled up to a crime scene minutes before the homicide detectives arrived. Too many times to count Id find a young black man my age or younger dead with a halo of blood or brain matter splashed on the pavement. Often there were shell casings sprinkled around freshly fallen bodies.

title: Protecting Water and Wildlife
description: To the Editor:

title: Bomb Kills 8 in Yemen Near Presidents Residence
description: AL MUKALLA, Yemen  A bomb-packed car driven by a suicide attacker exploded at a checkpoint near the presidential palace in the southern city of Aden on Thursday, and security officials said at least eight people were killed.

title: To Text or Not to Text: A Dating Conundrum
description: Check out our new Modern Love podcast.

title: Phil Jacksons Vision for the Knicks: How It Looks in Year 2
description: One year ago this week, Phil Jackson sat down in a Midtown Manhattan restaurant to discuss the sorry state of the Knicks and spoke what might have been the most humbling words of his charmed professional life.

title: Iowas Republican Governor Warms Even More to Donald Trump
description: DES MOINES  Gov. Terry E. Branstad of Iowa, a Republican and the longest-serving governor in American history, is something of a guardian of the Iowa presidential caucuses.

title: Armed Man Arrested at Disneyland Paris
description: PARIS  A 28-year-old man carrying two guns, ammunition and a Quran was arrested at a hotel in Disneyland Paris on Thursday afternoon, according to a Disney executive, raising a new round of fear two months after 130 people were killed in a coordinated series of terrorist attacks on the French capital.

title: Riding in Shepards Posse: Actors Talk About Buried Child
description: Actors who have worked on the three major New York productions of Sam Shepards Buried Child  the 1978 Theater for the New City premiere; the 1996 Broadway run; and the New Group revival that begins performances on Tuesday, Feb. 2  share stories about performing in the play. ALEXIS SOLOSKI

title: Senate Democrats Seeking Federal Aid for Flint Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats said Thursday they would seek $600 million in federal aid to help Michigan clean up the contaminated water emergency in the city of Flint, the most far-reaching financial solution proposed to manage the crisis.

title: N.R.A. Victories in Congress Grow With Chief Lobbyists Role
description: WASHINGTON  The day after the massacre last month in San Bernardino, Calif., Senate Democrats, sensing an opportunity, rushed to pass a measure denying guns to anyone on the no-fly terrorism watch list. The timing of the vote and the nature of the bill gave them reason to hope that they could, for once, thwart the gun lobby.

title: At Paris Couture, Viktor & Rolfs Wearable Art  and Giant Cubist-Inspired Masks
description: The houses all-white collection was inspired by a simple polo shirt and culminated in a theatrical show that included outsize sculptures over models heads.

title: Sam Shepard Takes Stock of Buried Child and the Writers Life
description: You change, the playwright and actor Sam Shepard said. You go through all kinds of contortions. But the play is the same.

title: In a First, the Rio Games Will Include a Team of Refugees
description: A small team of international refugee athletes will participate in the Summer Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro this year, Thomas Bach, the president of the International Olympic Committee, confirmed on Thursday.

title: Video: The Inspiration for Ben & Jerrys Bernie Sanders Ice Cream
description: DES MOINES  Bernie Sanderss presidential campaign sent a slew of celebrity surrogates to a What Is a Caucus? event at Drake University on Wednesday night.

title: Affluenza Teen Returns From Mexico
description: Ethan Couch, the 18-year-old from Texas better known to the tabloids and the 24-hour cable news cycle as the affluenza teen, returned Thursday morning from Mexico, where he had fled last month with his mother.

title: Bernie Sanders Releases Tough Ad on Wall Street Speaking Fees
description: DES MOINES  Speaking with reporters on Thursday morning, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont was asked if he would satisfy some of his frustrated supporters by making a more direct contrast with Hillary Clinton in the final days before the Iowa caucuses.

title: Huckabee and Santorum to Attend Trump Event During Fox News Debate
description: Mike Huckabee, the winner of the 2008 Iowa caucuses who has been struggling to gain traction in this years race, will appear with Donald J. Trump and an event for veterans that the billionaire businessman has scheduled as counterprogramming to tonights debate on Fox News, which he is skipping.

title: Attack Ad From Ted Cruz Signals Marco Rubios Gains in Iowa
description: DES MOINES  Senator Ted Cruz, who has been harshly criticizing Donald J. Trump all week on the campaign trail and in television commercials here, is now broadening his attacks to include Senator Marco Rubio, an unmistakable acknowledgment that Mr. Rubio is gaining support in the closing days before the Monday caucuses.

title: In Iowa, Jobs Are Plentiful but Workers Are Not
description: AMES, Iowa  Unlike the indoor basketball court, foosball tables or fireside lounge at Workivas sprawling campus here, the oversize green prize wheel centered among a hive of work stations is not meant for break times.

title: Alibaba Searching for New Revenue Sources
description: Alibaba is benefiting from Chinas shift toward a consumer economy. The e-commerce groups earnings in the last three months of 2015 offer another insight into Chinas economy as well. Both the company and the country need to find new ways to grow.

title: Syrian Opposition Bloc Still Wont Commit to Joining Peace Talks
description: GENEVA  A day before the Syria peace talks were to begin, there was no sign of when the opposition would show up to negotiate, raising the possibility that months of high-level diplomatic efforts to bring the parties to the table could unravel even before the talks started.

title: Sondra Radvanovsky, Opera Royalty, Takes On Donizettis Triple Crown
description: ONE of the largest voices in opera was ricocheting through a small Upper West Side apartment recently, as the soprano Sondra Radvanovsky practiced some fiendishly tricky bel canto passages for her radio broadcast singing the title role of Donizettis Anna Bolena live from the Metropolitan Opera. Then she had to switch hats, or crowns.

title: Dr. Herbert L. Abrams, Who Worked Against Nuclear War, Dies at 95
description: Dr. Herbert L. Abrams, a radiologist at Stanford and Harvard universities and a founder of International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War, which won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1985 for its work in publicizing the health consequences of atomic warfare, died on Jan. 20 at his home in Palo Alto, Calif. He was 95.

title: Iowa Caucus Envy
description: To the Editor:

title: How Two Little-Known Actors Became the Obamas
description: In preparing to film Southside With You, which premiered at the Sundance Film Festival earlier this week, Parker Sawyers and Tika Sumpter had some impressive shoes to fill. In the film, they play Barack and Michelle Obama (ne Robinson) as they were in 1989: he, a Harvard Law summer associate at a prestigious Chicago firm, and she, an ambitious young lawyer and his adviser. Telling the story of their first date, its the first major depiction of the Obamas in a feature film, and Sawyers and Sumpter portray the future first couple with such sweetness and magnetism that youd be forgiven for thinking them an item offscreen. But it didnt come without baggage. I was worried that the CIA would come shut us down! Sumpter says, laughing. It is the leader of the free world, after all.

title: The Ravages of Lead: Readers on the Water in Flint
description: With just a few exceptions, readers condemned what they described as ideologically driven policy decisions that put thousands of children in Flint, Mich., at risk of lead poisoning, in response to recent editorials and columns.

title: Rural Voters Can Swing the Iowa Caucuses. Meet Five of Them.
description: Small-town Iowans have a huge role in picking the next president. Their deep commitment to the process paints a distinct portrait of democracy.

title: Chains Clink, Water Splashes: A Composers Beautiful Noise
description: A few months ago, Ashley Fure, the focus of a Composer Portrait concert on Thursday, Feb. 4, at the Miller Theater, was experimenting with fluid sound. A speaker hung in the corner of a studio in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, that was crammed with equipment hoarded by Levy Lorenzo, the electronics wizard of the International Contemporary Ensemble. Taped to the speakers cone was a thin plastic tube, cut off at one end near the woofers rim and reaching down to a water pump at the other.

title: Gina Rodriguez Asks Latino Audiences to Support Latino Actors
description: The actress Gina Rodriguez has responded to the #OscarsSoWhite controversy with her own call to action for Latino audiences.

title: At Maison Margiela, an Artisanal Approach to Collage
description: Multiple references and an abundance of fabrics came together in each of John Gallianos spring/summer 2016 couture looks.

title: Officer Shot Man After Brooklyn Robbery, Police Say
description: A New York City police officer on Thursday morning shot and wounded an armed man who led the police on an erratic chase through the quiet streets of Midwood, Brooklyn, after robbing a cellphone store, the authorities said.

title: 130 Years Ago: War and Peace Finally Published in English
description: Scully and Mulder werent the only TV couple burning up the screen this week. How about Natasha and Andrei, stars of an eight-hour mini-series on the Lifetime, History and A&E channels?

title: 36 Hours in Porto, Portugal
description: From its stunning Beaux-Arts station to its cool bars serving Portos signature drink, this charming city combines the best of old and new.

title: Tight Race for Second Place in New Poll of New Hampshire Republicans
description: The battle for second place in New Hampshires Republican primary has intensified, with Gov. John Kasich of Ohio, Senator Ted Cruz of Texas and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida all pulling about 11 or 12 percent of the vote, and Senator Marco Rubio of Florida about 10 percent, according to a poll released Thursday.

title: Puerto Rico Debt Negotiations Resume
description: Negotiations to restructure roughly $9 billion of the debt of Puerto Ricos power company have resumed after breaking down last week, reviving hopes that a default can be avoided.

title: Shakespeare in the Park to Offer Taming of the Shrew and Troilus and Cressida
description: Central Park is still coated in snow but the Public Theater is getting ready for warmer weather among the trees.

title: Bernie Sanders Is Healthy, His Doctor Declares
description: DES MOINES  Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont has suffered a variety of ailments over his 74 years, including gout, diverticulitis, hernias and a cyst on his vocal cord, but he is in very good health, according to a letter from the congressional physician whose office has treated the senator for more than 20 years.

title: Volkswagen May Buy Back Diesel Cars It Cant Fix
description: FRANKFURT  Volkswagen may buy back some diesel cars in the United States if it cannot make them compliant with air quality rules fast enough, a lawyer for the company says.

title: Snapchat Offers Original Political Coverage, Good Luck America
description: DES MOINES  Tucked atop the Discover tab in Snapchat on Thursday is a new red, white and blue icon that says,Good Luck America.

title: Some Iowans Who Like Carly Fiorina Worry About a Wasted Vote
description: ANKENY, Iowa  For nearly four minutes, Carly Fiorina clasped the hand of Brian Thielges and tried to change his mind.

title: F.B.I. Releases Video Showing Death of Oregon Refuge Occupier
description: BURNS, Ore.  The F.B.I. took the extraordinary step of releasing surveillance video on Thursday showing the shooting death of LaVoy Finicum, a member of the armed occupation of a federal wildlife refuge here in eastern Oregon, as the occupation continued by a handful of followers.

title: A Single Cell Shines New Light on How Cancers Develop
description: It was just a tiny speck, a single cell that researchers had marked with a fluorescent green dye. But it was the very first cell of what would grow to be a melanoma, the deadliest form of skin cancer. Never before had researchers captured a cancer so early.

title: Taxing Google and Other U.S. Giants Is Dividing Europe
description: BRUSSELS  For some European nations, big American corporations like Google are seen primarily as employers and technological innovators whose presence can help with their global competitiveness.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Rams
description: Grimur Hakonarson narrates a sequence from Rams.

title: Donald Trumps Childish Debate Boycott
description: The squabble between Donald Trump and Fox News over the latest Republican presidential debate may seem as completely vapid as the debates themselves. But there is a silver lining. Mr. Trump has given the world the perfect three-word description of his campaign style.

title: Grimur Hakonarson Narrates a Scene From Rams
description: The Icelandic drama Rams follow two sheep-farmer brothers who havent spoken for 40 years, yet live next door to one another. A tragedy that affects their animals further tests their relationship. This scene involves a particularly intense moment between the brothers. In an interview at The Times, the director Grimur Hakonarson talked about his own experiences on a farm and how to cast sheep. Here are excerpts from that conversation.

title: Valentinos Very Byzantine Couture Collection
description: The house showed magical spring/summer 2016 looks, heavily infused with Greco-Roman influences  but no shoes.

title: Las Vegas Review-Journal Names Publisher
description: Craig Moon, a former president and publisher of USA Today, has been named as the new publisher of The Las Vegas Review-Journal, the newspaper announced on Thursday.

title: Unraveling the Pop Art Image of Tom Wesselmann
description: Tom Wesselmann, the late Cincinnati-born artist who was a contemporary of Andy Warhol, Roy Lichtenstein and Jasper Johns, found fast fame in the 1960s with his supersized and visceral vision of the female form. But in the new David Zwirner gallery show of his portraits and nudes in London, 30 of his early collage works, which date from 1959 to 1964, reveal his softer, more nave side. There are no gargantuan nipples or smoking mouths here; rather, these pieces have an undone feel thats at odds with the slickness of his later and better-known works  albeit with familiar flashes of vivid, ad-world color.

title: Photographing the Effects of Zika
description: A Getty Images photographer visited Recife, Brazil, an area affected by the Zika virus, this week.

title: Couture in Slow Motion
description: A closer view of looks from the spring 2016 haute couture shows.

title: 7 Hamas Members Are Killed in Tunnel Collapse in Gaza
description: GAZA  The military wing of Hamas, the Islamic group that controls Gaza, said Thursday that seven of its members were killed when a tunnel into Israel collapsed as they were working on it.

title: Modern Love: The Podcast | Not So Simple Math
description: Welcome to the third episode of Modern Love: The Podcast. This week, youll hear the actress Sarah Paulson (Carol, American Horror Story, 12 Years a Slave) read a 2010 Modern Love essay by Amy Seek titled Open Adoption: Not So Simple Math.

title: Six of This Seasons Biggest Couture Moments  in Exquisite Detail
description: During spring/summer 2016 haute couture week in Paris, T teamed up with the photographer Iring Demeter to create a series of six videos that premiered exclusively via Instagram, capturing all the precise, meticulous detail of couture  in slow motion. Now that the shows have wrapped, catch up on all of the videos here, and on Ts Instagram page.

title: Bernie Sanders Tops His Rivals in Use of Outside Money
description: DES MOINES  As he swung through Iowa this week, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont rarely passed up a chance to bash the rising tide of money in politics, a system he said on Tuesday was corrupt and undermining American democracy.

title: Springsteens Early Days, in a Feast of Photographs
description: Bruce Springsteens The River tour is making a stop in SoHo. But dont expect to hear live renditions of Hungry Heart or The Ties That Bind. This event, a photography exhibition, is all about the Bosss iconography.

title: Has Your Student Experienced Racism in High School?
description: Students at the nations oldest public school have taken to social media to protest the way race is approached in their high school, extending the conversation over racial inclusion that erupted on college campuses in the fall, Jess Bidgood writes in The New York Times. The school, Boston Latin, is at the center of a campaign that includes two YouTube videos and a hashtag  #BlackatBLS  which students and alumni are using to detail their experiences with racism or insensitivity at the school.

description: To the Editor:

title: Republicans Slam Trumps Debate Decision
description: Campaigning in Iowa, the presidential candidates Ted Cruz, Marco Rubio, and Chris Christie all weighed in on Donald J. Trumps decision to skip Thursdays debate.

title: Student Contest Winners | The 2015 Year in Rap
description: While our own year-end news quizzes spotlight the 50 or so stories we find most important each year, every December we also invite teenagers to write raps about the news that mattered most to them.

title: Advice on Out-Debating Ted Cruz From Someone Who Did
description: The morning after Donald J. Trump dropped out of the Fox News debate and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas challenged him to a mano a mano contest in a forum of his choosing, Mr. Cruz took a break from debate prep in Des Moines to get a bite to eat.

title: A New Nike Web Series (and Tips) to Inspire Resolution Making  and Keeping
description: A far cry from its Just Do It commercials featuring serious athletes performing superhuman exercises, Nikes fun new eight-episode original web series is refreshingly relatable  and aims to inspire real women to accomplish a single, realistic anything. Margot vs Lily is part of the brands #BetterForIt campaign, which encourages hard work towards specific goals (running your first race, graduating to the heavier set of weights at SoulCycle), and stars two sisters who couldnt be less alike, save their competitive spirit.

title: Researchers Weigh Risks of Zika Spreading at Rio Olympics
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  With about 500,000 people expected to visit Brazil for the Olympics here this year, researchers are scrambling to figure how much of a risk the Games might pose in spreading the Zika virus around the world.

title: Justices Take On a Muddled Issue: Insider Trading
description: In the 30 years since I chronicled the 1980s insider trading scandals in the book Den of Thieves, Ive never seen the insider trading law in a greater state of confusion.

title: Review: Darryl Pinckneys Black Deutschland Is Set in 1980s Berlin
description: Darryl Pinckneys brittle and bloodless second novel, Black Deutschland, is about a young man, fresh out of rehab, who flees his hometown, Chicago, in the early 1980s for Berlin.

title: Shopping for an ExpensiveRing? Ask Everything but That
description: Is it appropriate to ask salesmen if they are working on commission? I know we dont typically go around asking people how they are paid. That would be rude. But I have been shopping for an expensive and significant ring, and I would like to ask the woman at the jewelry store how she gets compensated. That could affect how much I have to pay, correct?

title: Pakistan School Closings Stir Confusion, and Fears of More Attacks
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  Fears about potential follow-up attacks on Pakistani schools by Taliban militants created widespread confusion and school closings this week, even as officials urged calm.

title: Joe Biden Calls Republican Presidential Race a Gift From the Lord
description: BALTIMORE  Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. called the Republican presidential primary campaign on Thursday a gift from the Lord, drawing hoots of laughter from House Democrats gathered here for three days of strategy sessions.

title: Comedy Listings for Jan. 29-Feb. 4
description: For news about comedy, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Amazon Sales Soared 22% in Holiday Quarter, but Profit Fell Short
description: Amazon was expected to run away with the holiday season. Instead, it merely strolled.

title: An Alice Waters Recipe, to Celebrate an Ambitious New Museum
description: Tonight, the Bay Area inaugurates a new landmark with a gala anticipating the opening of the new Berkeley Art Museum and Pacific Film Archive, designed by Diller Scofidio + Renfro, following on another high-profile Left Coast cultural institution completed just a couple months ago: the Broad in Los Angeles.

title: A Buddhist Deity Returns to Boston
description: A Buddhist deity sculpture, absent from the galleries at the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, for 17 years, will go back on view there next month after undergoing analyses and treatments throughout its gilded surface.

title: Signs of Modern Astronomy Seen in Ancient Babylon
description: For people living in the ancient city of Babylon, Marduk was their patron god, and thus it is not a surprise that Babylonian astronomers took an interest in tracking the comings and goings of the planet Jupiter, which they regarded as a celestial manifestation of Marduk.

title: Pepsi Turns Restaurateur, to Serve Up Some Buzz
description: Behind black doors, what used to be a trendy restaurant in New York had been stripped to its concrete bones. Wires and cables snaked along the floor. Ceiling lights twinkled in the gloom.

title: Walgreens Says No Customers Tests Will Be Done at Theranos Lab in California
description: Walgreens, the giant drugstore chain, offered the latest vote of no confidence for Theranos, the Silicon Valley laboratory testing company it had collaborated with to offer blood tests for some of its customers.

title: Oscar Nominated Shorts in Pictures
description: Images from the Oscar-nominated short films, playing in a series of programs in theaters around the country.

title: Facebook to Shut Down Parse, Its Platform for Mobile Developers
description: Facebook acquired Parse, a toolkit and support system for mobile developers, in 2013. At the time, the social networks ambitions were high: Parse would be Facebooks way into one day harnessing developers to become a true cloud business, competing alongside the likes of Amazon, Google and Microsoft.

title: Pictures of the Day: Tunisia and Elsewhere
description: Tunisia and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Jan. 28, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Tunisia, Venezuela, Democratic Republic of Congo and Greece.

title: John Kasich May Campaign in Iowa, but His Focus Is on New Hampshire
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa  Fielding questions from voters on Wednesday night, Gov. John Kasich of Ohio boasted about how many town hall-style meetings he had held, including more than 75 in New Hampshire  an hour apiece, and then pictures and all that.

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week
description: A guide to the galleries from Times critics.

title: Review: Burnished by Grief, About Living in Close Quarters
description: The vicissitudes of cheek-by-jowl urban housing are the subject of Ellen Maddows Burnished by Grief: A Romantic Comedy, a mildly morbid but irrepressibly effervescent lark at La MaMa. Despite the presence of lurking neighbors and suggestions of voyeurism, the play evolves into an exuberant celebration of color and quirk, with a tune or two to underscore its sentiments.

title: Matteo Renzi, Italian Premier, Pushes for a Place at Europes Power Table
description: ROME  Italy has given Europe many things, but rarely leadership.

title: Theater Listings for Jan. 29-Feb. 4
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Oscar-Nominated Shorts, Mirroring a World of Pain and Fortitude
description: Suffering, embattled nobility and a dash of whimsy. Those emotional currents define this years Oscar-nominated short films, with pain and strife dominating.

title: Chad Johnson of New York Attorney Generals Office Moves to Private Practice
description: After nearly four years as a top lieutenant to New Yorks attorney general, Chad Johnson is stepping down as head of the states Investor Protection Bureau and moving to a private litigation firm, Quinn Emanuel Urquhart & Sullivan.

title: Flatlands, Where the Familiar Becomes Hypnotically Strange
description: The idea of deskilling has incited considerable chatter in the contemporary art sphere in the past decade. In economics the term refers to the technically undemanding labor performed by most modern industrial workers. In art discourse it identifies the deliberate rejection of traditional craft in the service of conceptual provocation and expressive freedom.

title: Review: In Wagners Ring: Forging an Epic, Valkyries on Their First Flight
description: It wasnt a typically relaxing summer holiday. In 1876, the conductor Leopold Damrosch traveled from the United States to Bayreuth, Germany, to attend the premiere of Wagners epic, epochal four-opera cycle, Der Ring des Nibelungen.

title: For Children Listings for Jan. 29-Feb. 4
description: If the printed word is a threatened species, the written one seems severely endangered  glimpsed only rarely, and often starved of sentiment.

title: Microsoft Profit and Revenue Fall, but Cloud Computing Grows
description: SEATTLE  Satya Nadella has put cloud computing at the center of Microsofts strategy. It is a move that looks to be paying off, at least in the eyes of investors.

description: For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: For Jean Dubuffet, the Art Brut Founder, a Gallery Show
description: Jean Dubuffet is not necessarily the hottest artist around; in fact, his colorful oil painting Cote Chipote failed to sell at Christies in November, despite a relatively low estimate of $9 million to $12 million.

title: Review: Amos Gitais Rabin, the Last Day Looks Back in Anguish
description: On Nov. 4, 1995, after addressing a large peace rally in a Tel Aviv square, Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin of Israel was assassinated by a law student named Yigal Amir. In March of the following year, an official commission of inquiry, headed by the president of the Israeli Supreme Court, documented lapses in security on the night of the killing and intelligence failures in the months before.

description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.
