title: Nigeria Plans Inquiry Into Deadly Clashes Between Army and Shiite Sect
description: KADUNA, Nigeria  Government officials in northern Nigeria on Friday announced plans to appoint a judicial commission to investigate clashes in the northern city of Zaria between the Nigerian Army and a Shiite Islamic sect that the sects members say ended in a massacre.

title: Sundance Actors, Ages 10 and 16, Join the Breakthrough Ranks
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Many of the actors referred to as breakthrough stars each year at the Sundance Film Festival never go on to do much of anything. But Sundance is supposed to be about discoveries, so entertainment reporters dutifully compile lists of performers who  maybe, possibly, with any luck  could become The Next Big Thing. (Its not that hard to find candidates; publicists do most of the work.)

title: After Settlement, Florida State Shows Sympathy for Victim: Itself
description: John Thrasher, the president of Florida State University, is a former politician who once was chairman of the Rules Committee in the Florida Senate and served a stint as chairman of the Republican Party of Florida. He knows how to spin, and how to play hardball. He proved it this week when he issued an astonishingly disingenuous and meanspirited statement after settling a Title IX lawsuit brought by a student who accused Jameis Winston, the former star quarterback of the Seminoles who won the Heisman Trophy in 2013, of raping her in 2012.

title: Mike Huckabee and Rick Santorum Slammed for Appearing at Donald Trump Event
description: From the looks of the polls, they had little to lose, but Mike Huckabee and Rick Santorum might have lost something by choosing to attend a Trump campaign rally: respect.

title: Annuities as an Alternative to Shaky Markets? Not So Fast
description: CHECKED your retirement savings plan lately? Januarys global stock market plunge is one of those moments that stoke fear among baby boomers that they might run out of money before they run out of years.

title: The Dear Abby of Death
description: I guess you could say Im the Dear Abby of Death, Florence Isaacs, 78, said as she scanned her email queue for new questions about the subject, one recent morning in her West Village apartment.

title: Peter Stuyvesant and the Fun-House Mirrors
description: Q. Theres a story going around the Internet that Peter Stuyvesant, the Dutch colonial ruler of what became New York City, was the father of fun-house mirrors. Is there any truth to it?

title: Study Finds Growing Reason to Be Wary of Some Reflux Drugs
description: Maybe you have seen television ads starring the beefy, affable comedian and actor known as Larry the Cable Guy.

title: Modify Prison Sentences
description: To the Editor:

title: Curtailing Sexual Violence on Farms
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Biographies of Hillary Clinton for Kids of All Ages
description: This month brings four new biographies of Hillary Clinton  for kids. The wonder is that whether its for preschoolers or for teenagers, each in its own way presents a coherent picture of her. Getting a handle on the Democratic presidential candidates swerving, crowded life is a challenge for any biographer, and turning her into a subject for children seems yet more daunting. Even putting aside her husbands PG-13 affair with an intern, its still not clear what the ending of Hillarys story will be. (As of now, no childrens books about the other candidates are on the horizon.) Yet publishers have done an admirable job packaging just plain Hillary as someone whose life story children may find inspirational, and perhaps even relatable.

title: Besieged Syria Towns Emerge as Crucial Sticking Point in Talks
description: GENEVA  For the third time in four years, world powers have persuaded warring parties in Syria to come to Switzerland, sit around well-appointed rooms and figure out a way to stop the killings.

title: Syria Talks Are Complicated by Competing Opposition Groups
description: The latest attempt to reach a negotiated end to the conflict in Syria was meant to include participation by armed opposition groups.

title: Editor of Esquire, David Granger, Steps Down
description: David Granger, who has led Esquire since 1997, will leave the mens magazine on March 31, Hearst Magazines announced on Friday.

title: Payment Processor to Stop Working With Daily Fantasy Sports Clients
description: A payment processing company that handles a significant number of transactions for the two dominant daily fantasy sports companies notified the operators this week that it would no longer handle their payments and in fact was leaving the industry altogether. It is perhaps the biggest blow yet to an industry that has been pummeled by legal challenges in recent months.

title: No Terror Link Found in Gun Arrest at Disneyland Paris
description: PARIS  A 28-year-old man who was arrested carrying two guns at a hotel in Disneyland Paris on Thursday has no known links to terrorism but was still being detained by the police, the French authorities said on Friday.

title: Obama Plans Speech in Springfield, Where He Announced Candidacy
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will return next month to Springfield, Ill., where he began his campaign to become president, to call for something he has struggled to deliver in Washington: a less divisive politics in America.

title: Chicory Rocks the Salad Bowl
description: Give me a leafy salad any day. Make it romaine, butter lettuce, watercress, red oak or a mixture of sturdy midsize leaves, and dress it simply with a good vinaigrette or with nuts, fruit and cheese. In cooler weather, compose it with as many kinds of multicolored chicory as possible.

title: Haute Couture in Paris: Portfolio
description: The photographer Landon Nordeman takes us through the weeks shows in Paris during haute couture fashion week.

title: Lavish Spending by the Wounded Warrior Project
description: To the Editor:

title: The Eight Best Films T Saw at Sundance This Year
description: Each year, there is a moment at Sundance when the murmurs begin and a narrative develops around a single film. Increasingly, this groundswell of admiration happens on Twitter, where one can either participate in the discourse or miss it completely. This year, however, it was hard to miss Sundances big story. On Monday, Nate Parkers The Birth of a Nation premiered to rapturous applause  and by Tuesday morning, it had been rewarded with a blockbuster deal. Fox Searchlight bought the film for a reported $17.5 million, besting the previous Sundance record  held by 2006s Little Miss Sunshine  by over $7 million. And by noon that day, after waiting in line for over an hour at a press screening of the film only to be stopped tantalizingly close to the front, I had missed the movie completely.

title: Couture: In Perspective
description: PARIS  Picture this: There you are, beside a serene expanse of green grass and oaken pathways, a pleasingly symmetric wood plank house in the distance, soothing music playing in the background. A puppy barks somewhere close by. A handsome gardener in patchwork trousers and a beige jacket appears, and points a garage door opener at the house.

title: X Games Kick Off Without Shaun White, Their Biggest Star
description: The Winter X Games, ESPNs extravaganza of extreme snow sports, kicked off on Thursday with its crowd-pleasing showcase of some of the worlds best aerial athletes.

title: Republican Face-Off In Iowa (Silly)
description: Cant help myself:

title: Notable Daily News Covers
description: A series of attention-grabbing covers that have shifted the conversation around the struggling paper.

title: Drop Dead? Not the Newly Relevant Daily News
description: On a recent afternoon, Jim Rich, the editor in chief of The Daily News, sat at his computer playing around with front-page headlines, a few well-chosen words that would capture the days biggest news: Sarah Palins endorsement of Donald Trump in the Republican presidential primary.

title: The Films of Michael Mann
description: Images of the directors work, which is being shown in a series at BAMcinmatek called Heat & Vice: the Films of Michael Mann.

title: Sanders Campaign Introduces Text-to-Donate App
description: Its a familiar way of donating, mastered by the Red Cross during global catastrophes: Simply text a five-digit number and a donation is made seamlessly through a phone bill.

title: What Data Can Do to Fight Poverty
description: IF social scientists and policy makers have learned anything about how to help the worlds poorest people, its not to trust our intuitions or anecdotal evidence about what kinds of antipoverty programs are effective. Rigorous randomized evaluations of policies, however, can show us what works and what doesnt.

title: Adam Silver and the Art of Giving Dap
description: When you are a professional athlete, the commissioner can sometimes seem like your high school principal: He is a lot older than you, he always wears a tie and he can suspend you.

title: Michael Mann in the Spotlight at BAMcinmatek
description: Though Michael Mann has directed only 11 theatrical feature films in 35 years, he has left his mark on a wide range of movie types, including period drama (The Last of the Mohicans), sports biography (Ali), corporate thriller (The Insider) and the ever-popular Nazi paranormal horror flick (The Keep).

title: Hillary Clinton Says Bernie Sanderss Health Plan Will Never, Ever Come to Pass
description: DES MOINES  Hillary Clinton said on Friday that Bernie Sanderss proposal for a single-payer health care system would thrust the nation into a terrible, terrible national debate and would never, ever come to pass.

title: Oregon Town Torn Apart by Protest at Wildlife Refuge
description: BURNS, Ore.  The courthouse is still blocked by concrete bollards. Tires have been slashed. Family members and old friends have argued and refused to speak again. Fights have broken out in church.

title: A Day at the Shvitz
description: Boris Tuberman and David Shapiro, the two owners of the Russian and Turkish Baths, run the business on alternate weeks and, increasingly, draw different crowds.

title: What I Love | Cynthia von Buhler
description: The artist, author and playwright lives with her husband, Russell Farhang, on the Upper East Side.

title: Where Cynthia von Buhlers Fantasies Have Free Rein
description: Cynthia von Buhler is a painter, playwright, performance artist and childrens book author and illustrator with a reputation for being offbeat. So its not a complete surprise to find a miniature pig roaming around her Upper East Side apartment.

title: Daughter-in-Law of Chiles President Faces Corruption Charge
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  Prosecutors on Friday charged President Michelle Bachelets daughter-in-law, Natalia Compagnon, and 12 others in a corruption case that touches the presidential family and has damaged Ms. Bachelets popularity.

title: Review: I make me [sic] by Will Rawls
description: The Latin word sic, when bracketed inside a quotation, indicates that the material comes straight from the source, mistakes or eccentricities included. (Its short for sic erat scriptum, meaning thus it was written.) So how should we read the title of Will Rawlss new lecture-dance, I make me [sic]? Does it suggest that the phrase I make me could be questioned, read as erroneous? Is sic a play on sick? Are these much too literal interpretations?

title: Review: Jerusalem Quartet Starts a Weeklong Marathon
description: A good string quartet, wisdom has it, is like a single instrument with 16 strings. That sort of unity of sound and purpose is a given in any performance by the extraordinary Jerusalem Quartet, which on Thursday completed the opening leg of a marathon in which it will play all six Bartok quartets and the first six quartets by Beethoven within a single week at the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center. But during the Andante of Bartoks Quartet No. 5 on Thursday, the ensemble seemed to morph not so much into a super-instrument as into something organic and animalistic that moved with louche and unpredictable grace.

title: After 124 Years, the Russian and Turkish Baths Are Still a Hot Spot
description: On a recent Monday evening, it was hard to find a bit of bench at the Russian and Turkish Baths in the East Village. It was cold out, and people crowded the saunas  young, slim and in skimpy bathing suits.

title: Review: American Experience Traces President Garfields Assassination
description: The description of the 1880 Republican convention in Tuesday nights American Experience on PBS sure sounds like a possible future for both major parties as they choose their 2016 presidential candidates.

title: The Republican Debaters (and a Nondebater)
description: To the Editor:

title: Super PAC Backing Hillary Clinton Says It Will Raise More Than It Did in 12
description: A super PAC backing Hillary Clinton raised more than $25 million during the last six months of 2015, officials with the group said on Friday, with $10 million more arriving in January.

title: Greater Diversity Sought for New York Citys Community Boards
description: New York Citys ethnic diversity is on full display on and around Main Street in Flushing, Queens, a once predominantly white neighborhood that has become an overwhelmingly Asian enclave, home to another Chinatown.

title: 22 Clinton Emails Deemed Too Classified to Be Made Public
description: WASHINGTON  The State Department on Friday said for the first time that top secret material had been sent through Hillary Clintons private computer server, and that it would not make public 22 of her emails because they contained highly classified information.

title: Evening Hours | Fairy Tale Fashion
description: Plus: Celebrating a retirement, art works and antiques.
