description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Syria and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Jan. 29, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Syria, Serbia, India and Greece.

title: Six Wild, Western Projects at L.A.s Least Stuffy Art Fair
description: Art fairs, typically housed in convention centers and white tents, are rarely wild and woolly affairs. But as the art industry flies southwest this winter for its fair season  anchored in Art Los Angeles Contemporary, held at the Barker Hanger, and Photo LA, at the LA Mart downtown  they will find an exception to this rule at Paramount Ranch. Situated in the Santa Monica Mountains just north of Malibu, the three-year-old event takes place on the eponymous Western film set that served as the backdrop for such horse operas as Gunfight at the OK Corral and Gunsmoke.

title: The Complete Guide to New York Mens Fashion Week
description: From Joseph Abboud to Siki Im, its all here: Every designer who will be showing at the second round of mens wear shows in Manhattan.

title: Review: A Dream of Red Pavilions, a Love Story Born in the Spirit World
description: Life could be complicated for Chinese aristocrats in the 1700s. Just ask the members of the Jia family, who populate A Dream of Red Pavilions, Pan Asian Repertorys handsome and solemn new production at the Clurman Theater. They think everything is going to be fine when one of the daughters is chosen to be a royal courtesan. And they never even know that they have two immortal beings living with them, incarnated as family members.

title: Review: From Trisha Brown, Three Last Dances (Maybe) in Brooklyn
description: Rigor; wit; experimentalism; sensuousness. The three works by Trisha Brown being performed at the Brooklyn Academy of Music  Set and Reset (1983), Present Tense (2003), Newark (Niweweorce) (1987)  blend these virtues so provocatively that they make the best case to date for her greatness as a choreographer.

title: Sundance Fights Tide With Films Like The Birth of a Nation
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Art and industry are still slugging it out at the Sundance Film Festival. Thats true even if you no longer hear many anguished discussions about the meaning of independent cinema. These days, chatter about distribution deals, a movies commercial potential and even if a title will be in play at the next Academy Awards tends to drown out meaningful discussions of cinema and whether independence can be quantified by vision, spirit, money or some ineluctable combination of these. Then again, given how thoroughly the industry has colonized the festival (as the clusters of agents at screenings suggest), anguishing about it can feel like misplaced nostalgia.

title: Review: In The Astronauts Tale, a Farm Boy Dreams of Flying to Mars
description: Jack Larson, who died in September, was well known for his portrayal of the cub reporter Jimmy Olsen on The Adventures of Superman. His less-heralded achievements included several opera librettos, including the one for Virgil Thomsons Lord Byron.

title: Does Anybody Still Loathe Phil Collins? (Even In the Air Tonight?)
description: For many who were blessed to enter adulthood during the 1980s, it seems as if that decade will hover over us forever, its synth-pop bleats and recycled doomsday sound bites accompanying us into the twilight. Today, that feels truer than ever, as we all welcome back a familiar face: Phil Collins, the amiable sprite of pre-Internet pop. (Both the fairy-tale and computer-graphics definitions of sprite apply.) Emerging from semiretirement, Collins is launching a multimonth campaign of remembrance. Hes reissuing eight of his solo albums, including the four blockbusters  Face Value; Hello, I Must Be Going!; No Jacket Required; and   But Seriously  that blanketed the 1980s, selling a combined 24 million copies in the United States alone and generating seven No. 1 singles. He has announced that hell record new music and launch a tour. Come October, hell publish his autobiography.

title: A Deal on Concealed Handguns Stirs Virginians
description: It seemed a major victory last month for gun safety advocates: Virginias attorney general announced that the state would stoprecognizing concealed-carry gun permits from states with firearm standards rated inferior and unsafe. But it was overturned this week by a compromise between Gov. Terry McAuliffe, a Democrat, and Republican legislative leaders in a surprise deal presented as a public safety advance but denounced as a sellout by angry families of Virginia shooting victims and gun control advocacy groups.

title: Review: In Tonight/Jungle by Philip Ridley, Darkness Rules
description: Just how dark do you like it? The British dramatist Philip Ridley, whose excellent Dark Vanilla Jungle and Tonight With Donny Stixx are in repertory at Here, is notorious for testing the palates of theatergoers who think they prefer their humor black, strong and bitter.

title: Pinter Estate Shuts Door on The Room
description: For decades, the Wooster Group warily circled Harold Pinters first play, The Room. The theater troupe  a fixture of the downtown New York experimental theater scene  never had quite the right configuration of actors, never quite the right opening in its schedule.

title: Apple Sets Its Sights on Virtual Reality
description: Facebook, Google and Microsoft have all delved into virtual and augmented reality technology. Now Apple is dipping a toe into the space too.

title: Gilmore Girls Set to Return on Netflix
description: Friday afternoon is usually a time to release unwelcome news but this annoucement from Netflix will be anything but for Gilmore Girls fans: A new limited-series reunion of the show is officially in the works. It will feature the stars Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel and be overseen by the series creator, Amy Sherman-Palladino.

title: Review: Fifty Shades of Black Sells Sex With (Intentional) Laughs
description: Fifty shades of terrible! says Christian Black (Marlon Wayans), as he reads E. L. Jamess erotic best seller Fifty Shades of Grey. Who wrote this, a third grader? Other trenchant observations pepper Fifty Shades of Black, a scattershot satire of the books 2015 screen adaptation, but a lot of wading is required to find them.

title: Facebook Moves to Ban Private Gun Sales on Its Site and Instagram
description: Facebook is banning private sales of guns on its flagship social network and its Instagram photo-sharing service, a move meant to clamp down on unlicensed gun transactions.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Oregon, Flint
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: In Jane Got a Gun, Clear Skies, Followed by a Hail of Bullets
description: Jane Got a Gun, a western directed by Gavin OConnor, is a prime example of what French critics used to call a film maudit, or cursed film. The production, started in early 2013, was thrown into disarray when its original director, the visionary Lynne Ramsay, left mere days into shooting. At least two key cast and crew members followed her. In addition, the movies original distributor, Relativity Media, lost the rights to the picture in a bankruptcy proceeding. The final film was released by the Weinstein Company, without screenings for reviewers.

title: Swiss Question Use of Malaysian Sovereign Fund Run by Prime Minister
description: Days after the prime minister of Malaysia was cleared of wrongdoing in an investigation into transfers of money into his bank accounts, the Swiss government announced Friday that it had found serious indications that funds had been misappropriated from Malaysian state-owned companies.

title: NYT Politics on Facebook Messenger
description: Our Facebook messenger experiment is over. Thanks to everyone who joined.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Bernie Sanders Rallies Volunteers in Iowa With a Call for Turnout
description: MUSCATINE, Iowa  Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont met with campaign volunteers on Friday to energize the people who will spend their weekend knocking on doors and begging residents to caucus for him on Monday.

title: The Facts About Lead Exposure and Its Irreversible Damage
description: The crisis in Flint, Mich., over lead in the citys water supply has many focusing on the long-term effects of lead exposure for children there. Lead exposure in childhood can have lifelong consequences. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention emphasize that preventing exposure is critical, but so are prompt efforts to mitigate leads effects. Here are some common questions about lead and lead poisoning.

title: Ex-Associate of Pharmacists in Al Jazeera Report Assists Doping Inquiry
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  A prominent sports chiropractor who works for the Seattle Seahawks and has treated Olympic athletes from Canada and Britain is cooperating with Canadian antidoping officials in the wake of an Al Jazeera report that explored a network of people who claimed to have provided performance-enhancing drugs to professional athletes.

title: Friday Night Music: Lucius, Madness
description: On Tuesday I attended a small performance by the band Lucius, one of my favorites, and had a wonderful time despite Kylo Ren in the way:

title: Hillary Clinton and the Huge 3D Printer
description: DUBUQUE, Iowa  If there is a single symbol to sum up the standard Hillary Clinton stump speech, it is, perhaps, the enormous 3D printer she first encountered at a technical training center in Waterloo, Iowa.

title: My Classified Life
description: Gah. Another Clinton email story, this time involving emails covering material that wasnt classified when sent but is now deemed top-secret  with the Clinton campaign demanding that they be released, presumably to show how innocuous they really were. Max Fisher at Vox suggests that its basically a story about the craziness and excesses of the classification system, and my own experience  although deeply out of date  suggests that hes probably right.

title: California: Escapee Turns Himself In
description: One of three men who escaped from an Orange County jail turned himself in to the police on Friday after a week on the run. The man, Bac Duong, 43, contacted a civilian on the streets of Santa Ana and stated he wanted to turn himself in, said Sandra Hutchens, the Orange County sheriff. Mr. Duong is charged with attempted murder and had been in custody since December. The sheriff did not release any details of his capture. The search continues for the other two men who broke out of the Orange County Central Mens Jail  Hossein Nayeri, 37, and Jonathan Tieu, 20  neither of whom has been seen since a 5 a.m. head count on Jan. 22. Sheriffs department officials previously said they believed the three escapees were together in Southern California and could be receiving assistance from Vietnamese organized crime groups.

title: Unfamiliar Terrain for Corporate Lawyer in Planned Parenthood Drama
description: Last July, Derek F. Foran, a partner at the large corporate law firm Morrison & Foerster, got an alert that an abortion rights organization was desperately seeking help.

title: Police Leaders Unveil Principles Intended to Shift Policing Practices Nationwide
description: WASHINGTON  Police officers should aid anyone they hurt immediately. They should abandon a so-called 21-foot rule, which in some encounters with emotionally volatile people can result in fatal shootings. And they should follow standards higher than those set by the United States Supreme Court for using force.

title: Henry Worsley and the Undiscovered Earth
description: THE world of polar exploration is mourning the death of Henry Worsley, whose attempt to make the first unsupported traverse of the Antarctic continent failed only 30 miles short of his goal.

title: Leaders Deny Strife Caused Departures From Politico
description: In recent weeks, the staff at Politico noticed nearly all of its bosses  including the political publications founders, Jim VandeHei and John F. Harris  going in and out of meetings at its sleek new offices in Virginia.

title: France Plans Mideast Peace Effort, and Recognition of Palestine if It Fails
description: UNITED NATIONS  France said Friday that it would organize an international conference aimed at resolving the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and that France would recognize Palestine as an independent state if that effort failed.

title: Mayor de Blasio Announces Plans to Boost Security and Mental Health Staff at New York City Shelters
description: The de Blasio administration announced steps on Friday to increase security at 27 shelters and add medical staff to help identify people with mental illness among the citys growing homeless population.

title: Some in Iowa Surprised by Hillary Clintons Ease With Faith
description: KNOXVILLE, Iowa  There was the rally in Indianola, Iowa, where Hillary Clinton told a crowd that it was the teachings of John Wesley, a founder of the Methodist religion, that had inspired her to seek the presidency, and to get back up after setbacks.

title: Vaccine for Zika Virus May Be Years Away, Disease Experts Warn
description: As public health officials warn that the Zika virus is swiftly spreading across the Americas, the search is on to develop a vaccine to halt the disease, which could infect as many as four million people by the end of the year and has been linked to severe birth defects.

title: Diagnoses of Concussions Increase by Nearly a Third Over Last Season
description: The N.F.L. has taken measures in recent years to detect concussions by placing unaffiliated neuro-trauma consultants on the sideline, adding spotters in the press box and permitting medical personnel to call a timeout if the on-field staff misses a possible head injury. Those advances contributed to the most diagnosed concussions the league has seen in four years, according to data released Friday.

title: Tears and Bewilderment in Brazilian City Facing Zika Crisis
description: RECIFE, Brazil  So many distraught mothers stream into the infant ward clutching babies with abnormally small heads that the receptionist sends them outside, to see if they can find a chair to wait under the mango tree.

title: Chargers Will Play at Least One More Season in San Diego
description: The Chargers will stay in San Diego at least another year.

title: Puerto Rico Proposes Plan to Delay Its Debt Payments to Free Up Cash
description: Puerto Rican officials, meeting with creditors on Friday, proposed a broad debt exchange program meant to ease the islands painful cash crisis by slowing down the payments it owes on its $72 billion debt.

title: Trumps Sons Are Still Stumping for Dad, Far Off the Trail
description: OSCEOLA, Iowa  The closest Id ever come to hunting before was buying steaks from an organic farm in upstate New York. But on Friday, three days before the Iowa caucuses, I pulled on a bright orange vest and went pheasant hunting with Donald J. Trumps sons.

title: Yvonne Chouteau, Native American Ballerina, Dies at 86
description: Yvonne Chouteau, a former principal dancer of the Ballet Russe de Monte Carlo who emerged as one of a celebrated group of dancers known as the American Indian ballerinas of Oklahoma, died on Sunday at her home in Oklahoma City. She was 86.

title: 2 Lives Collide in Fatal Night at a Harlem Shelter
description: Deven Black was 62, and his life was falling apart. In a few short years, he had gone from respected, award-winning teacher to unemployed felon, losing his marriage and his home, moving into his car for a time and slipping into a depression that went largely untreated. He had nowhere to go.

title: Las Vegass Soft Spot for Hockey
description: Despite being a warm-weather city, Las Vegas says it has the strong hockey foundation necessary to support an N.H.L. team.

title: British Woman Is Convicted of Joining ISIS
description: A British woman who the police said had traveled to Syria to become a jihadi bride was convicted Friday of joining the Islamic State, as the authorities continued to push back against a small but steady stream of women who seek to join in jihad by going to the militants self-declared caliphate.

title: New York Council Resists Renaming Effort to Honor Evacuation Day
description: Evacuation Day was New Yorks biggest holiday in the 19th century. Today, the anniversary of the British evacuation of New York in 1783 has been so forgotten that City Council lawyers are resisting efforts to name a street after the historical event the holiday commemorates.

title: The Corporate Tax Dodge Continues
description: Johnson Controls, an industrial and auto parts supplier headquartered in Milwaukee, announced this week that is was selling itself to Tyco International, a maker of fire safety products based in Ireland. The deal will let Johnson Controls pass itself off as Irish and, in the process, cut its taxes in the United States by at least $150 million a year.

title: To Las Vegans, Hockey in the Desert Isnt So Strange
description: LAS VEGAS  An N.H.L. team in Las Vegas may seem like a marriage made in one of the citys notorious wedding chapels, but the city has supported professional hockey before, with several minor league hockey teams having called it home as far back as 1968.

title: Missing and Presumed Held by China
description: China has long had one of the worlds worst human rights records because of the way it treats its own citizens. Now, Beijing appears to be reaching beyond its territory and abducting critics from Hong Kong, a semiautonomous city, and from other countries, an alarming expansion of the governments ruthless determination to crush dissent.

title: A Misguided Plan for Carriage Horses
description: Having failed to kill New York Citys carriage-horse industry, Mayor Bill de Blasio has settled for crippling it. He has sent a bill to accomplish this to the City Council, which is expected to vote on it next Friday.

title: David Bowies Will Splits Estate Said to Be Worth $100 Million
description: In the 1980s, David Bowie and Iggy Pop vacationed in Bali. The place made an impression on Mr. Bowie: He directed that his body be cremated and his ashes scattered there, according to his will.

title: An Iowa To-Do List
description: Iowa Republicans have a lot of choices on Monday, none of whom bear any resemblance to the second coming of Abraham Lincoln.

title: Cuomos Plan for Financing Affordable Housing Worries City Officials
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos budget this year calls for more state control over the financing of affordable housing, a move that New York City officials and affordable housing representatives say would slow and undermine efforts to build and maintain such units for low-income New Yorkers.

title: The War for the West Rages On
description: Bozeman, Mont.  THE armed siege of a federal wildlife refuge in Oregon, which continued Friday even after one of the occupiers was killed in a confrontation with authorities, is the latest battle in a Nevada familys war with the federal government.

title: Parenthetical Figures
description: Administrivial Contest Alert! George Barany and Friends is holding a crossword contest called Eliminating the Competition, which ends at midnight P.S.T., February 8, 2016. There are multiple prizes, but I cant talk about them because that would be a spoiler. Click here for more information.

title: New York City Rejects Federal Findings That Many Elementary Schools Defy Disabilities Law
description: The administration of Mayor Bill de Blasio has rejected federal government findings that the vast majority of New York Citys public elementary schools are not fully accessible to children with disabilities, in violation of the Americans With Disabilities Act.

title: How to Speak of the Dead
description: A MINOR media kerfuffle followed the recent passing of the Eagles guitarist, songwriter and co-founder Glenn Frey.

title: Prosecutors Recommend Keeping Oregon Protesters in Custody
description: Ten of the protesters in Oregon who were arrested this week appeared before a federal magistrate in Portland. The judge ordered the Bundy brothers and three others to remain in custody; two others will be released once the occupation ends; and the judge delayed decisions on three.

title: Ammon Bundy Tells Oregon Court He Wants to Preserve Freedom
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Ammon Bundy, the leader of the armed occupation of the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge in Oregon, told a judge here on Friday that his actions were intended to preserve freedom.

title: Bill Cunningham | Blizzard City
description: Saturdays snow storm led to the inevitable parade of businessmen in leather shoes jumping over puddles.

title: Knicks Look Spry as They End 4-Game Slide With a Win Over the Suns
description: Sasha Vujacic was lying on the hardwood floor at Madison Square Garden, his arms and legs spread at midcourt as if he were making a snow angel.

title: The Best Sellers: Filed Under Sports
description: The best-selling sports books in December 2015, according to the New York Times best-seller list:

title: Review: In Buyer & Cellar, a Shopkeeper in Barbra Streisands Home
Review: God of Carnage Puts Parents in a Metaphoric Bull Ring
description: The ceramic red bull prancing on a shelf could be considered a symbol for the action that takes place before it, in a chic living room in Brooklyn.

title: In Putnam County, a Humble Home for Arts on the Lake
description: Whether or not it qualifies as a trend, the conversion of former firehouses into arts centers has been going on across the country for years. Some of the repurposed buildings are stylishly hip, like the Wasserman Projects contemporary arts center in Detroit, and some are impressively grand, like the Firehouse Arts Center in Pleasanton, Calif.

title: Review: Spice Kitchen in Mamaroneck Lives Up to Its Name
description: One of the first things you will see when you enter Spice Kitchen, a North Indian restaurant that opened in Mamaroneck in early September, is a lovely metal carving of Annapurna Devi, the Hindu goddess of nourishment. One evening we were seated beneath a mural of the Buddha at a comfortable banquette, and the ambience had a wonderfully calming effect, which, as it turned out, was very helpful because sometimes the patience of Job was needed when dining there.

title: Review: Shan Shan Noodles in Parsippany Favors the Foods of Northwestern China
description: Food-obsessed souls like myself are on a perpetual quest to uncover a culinary treasure. The unspoken rule in the search for authenticity: The more unassuming the exterior, the more likely we will find an edible jackpot inside.

title: Hot Toddies That Will Keep Long Island Winter at Bay
description: The weather during the holidays was unusually balmy, so Bobby Gulinello strung colored lights around South Shore Dive Pub & Kitchen and used a snow machine to simulate frost on the windows.

title: Review: At Unionvilles Cure Restaurant and Bar, Bacon Is Basic
description: Cure Restaurant and Bar, in Unionville, is a hard place to pigeonhole. A lively, boisterous bar area occupies half its footprint, while the nearby dining room is the image of uncluttered refinement, with sufficient space between linen-draped tables to provide a sense of intimacy.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: The Great Escape is on TV, rendering all of Saturdays other programming a pleasant superfluity. If Dateline, Cops or Sex Sent Me to the E. R. dont grab your attention, go the other direction and stream the Wes Anderson film Rushmore.

title: Fame Is Fleeting. The Wall Is Forever.
description: Celebrities like New York's pizza joints, and customers like the celebrities.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If you were going to put something in a population to keep them down for generations to come, it would be lead.

title: Corrections: January 30, 2016
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: At Some Restaurants in China, a Shortcut to Addictive Food: Poppies
description: BEIJING  It is no secret that fans of Chinese food often find it addictive. They speak longingly of the numbing spice of Sichuan peppercorn or the sour herbs found in Yunnan cooking.

title: Angelique Kerber Upsets Serena Williams to Win Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  At the Australian Open on Saturday, all that stood between Serena Williams and Steffi Graf was Angelique Kerber, who took 33 majors to reach her first Grand Slam final. Kerber was trying to become the first German to win a womens major since Graf won in 1999. Williams was trying to join Graf as a 22-time major winner in singles.

title: Fake Online Locksmiths May Be Out to Pick Your Pocket, Too
description: Maybe this has happened to you.

title: Obamas Budget Urges a Deeper Commitment to Computer Education
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will call for spending $4 billion to help states pay for computer science education in the schools when he presents his 2017 budget to Congress, administration officials say.

title: She? Ze? They? Whats In a Gender Pronoun
description: WASHINGTON  What happens when 334 linguists, lexicographers, grammarians and etymologists gather in a stuffy lecture hall on a Friday night to debate the lexical trends of the year?

title: At Sundance, Rubbing Shoulders With A-Listers, for a Price
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Meet and greets with top D.J.s. Easy entry into celebrity-packed parties. Private rides to and from the most popular hotels, bars and restaurants in town, without Ubers chatty drivers and ubiquitous surge pricing.

title: Clinton to Attack Sanders in Iowa on Gun Control
description: Hillary Clinton will spend her last Saturday before the Iowa caucuses hitting Bernie Sanders on the issue that could potentially hurt him the most: guns.

title: Miners in China Are Rescued After 36 Days Underground
description: BEIJING  Four miners have emerged alive after 36 days trapped 720 feet underground in eastern China, after a huge, intensely reported rescue effort in this country that has been plagued by mine disasters.

title: Our Man in Iowa: A Signal of Who Might Win the Caucuses
description: CLINTON  Good morning from Iowa, where the campaigns have entered the final wind sprint to the finish line. As Donald J. Trump returns to the state, joining nine other Republicans and all three Democrats, campaign operatives and the news media will be anticipating one thing more than any rally: the release at 5:45 p.m. Central time of J. Ann Selzers final Iowa Poll.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took followers from the midst of the blizzard to the streets of Soho in London.

title: In India, a Small Band of Women Risk It All for a Chance to Work
description: On a humid, sweaty, honking afternoon last summer, two women were making their way through the court complex in the north Indian city of Meerut, searching for the office of the subdivisional magistrate.

title: Bernie Sanders Is Making Surprising Gains With Less Affluent Whites
description: Bernie Sanderss coalition once looked very familiar: He had strong support among well-educated and affluent liberal white voters of the sort who backed Barack Obama, Bill Bradley and Jerry Brown. He struggled among less affluent voters.

title: We Will Not Apologize: Chronicling the Defiant Women of India
description: Eight months ago, on one of my first visits to the village of Peepli Khera, India, I saw a scene that captivated me, the way a character in a novel can sometimes captivate me.

title: A Little Variety
description: A LITTLE VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Chuck Hagel Encourages Michael Bloomberg on 2016 Race
description: Chuck Hagel, the former Republican senator from Nebraska who served as President Obamas secretary of defense, says he is likely to back an independent presidential bid by Michael R. Bloomberg if Republicans nominate a candidate he considers unacceptable.

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: Lessons From Earnings Season
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Rules for Clearing Off Snow and Ice
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Bill Cunningham | Blizzard City
description: The legendary Times fashion photographer Bill Cunningham spots and distills the latest trends from the runways of Paris to the colorful streets of New York.

title: 10 Children Among the Dead as a Migrant Boat Capsizes Off Turkey
description: GENEVA  One photo showed a small boy, perhaps 3 years old, dressed for a mild winter  dark blue pants and coat, a sky blue sweater for extra protection. The grown-up who had dressed him for the journey  barely five miles across the Aegean Sea  had cared enough to put on matching socks, with little blue cars. The boy was lying face up on the rocks. A winter hat, sky blue with a white pom-pom, covered his lifeless face.

title: Hillary Clinton for the Democratic Nomination
description: For the past painful year, the Republican presidential contenders have been bombarding Americans with empty propaganda slogans and competing, bizarrely, to present themselves as the least experienced person for the most important elected job in the world. Democratic primary voters, on the other hand, after a substantive debate over real issues, have the chance to nominate one of the most broadly and deeply qualified presidential candidates in modern history.

title: A Chance to Reset the Republican Race
description: The battle to be the Republican choice for president has been nasty, brutish and anything but short. The hope among some Republicans is that the Iowa caucuses on Monday and the New Hampshire primary on Feb. 9 will promote a candidate who can appeal to the half of their electorate that doesnt support the two current front-runners.

title: A Little Walmart Gift Card for You, a Big Payout for Lawyers
description: In this episode, we learn a new definition of the word gift and plumb the meaning of the word coupon. No, you dont need a dictionary. But a sense of humor might help.

title: Ve Neill, Oscar-Winning Makeup Artist: Putting a Face on Fantasy
description: Ve Neill  is an independent makeup artist for the movie industry in Studio City, Calif.

title: U.S. Challenges Chinas Claim of Islands With Maritime Operation
description: BEIJING  China on Saturday accused the United States Navy of violating its laws by sending a warship within the 12-mile territorial zone of an island it claims in the South China Sea after the Pentagon said a Navy vessel had conducted a freedom of navigation operation.

title: Variety: Spiral
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I love these Spiral puzzles. On the surface, they seem really easy, but keeping track of the entries going inward and outward can be tricky.

title: New Weapon to Fight Zika: The Mosquito
description: Every weekday at 7 a.m., a van drives slowly through the southeastern Brazilian city of Piracicaba carrying a precious cargo  mosquitoes. More than 100,000 of them are dumped from plastic containers out the vans window, and they fly off to find mates.

title: Students Say Racial Hostilities Simmered at Historic Boston Latin School
description: BOSTON  With court-ordered desegregation of public schools unfolding violently across this city in the mid-1970s, Boston Latin, then about 90 percent white, began admitting more minority students, remaining a place of relative calm in a city engulfed in protest.

title: Iowa Will Gauge Ardor to Upend Politics as Usual
description: DES MOINES  The presidential race hurtled over the weekend toward a watershed moment: voting that will start to reveal the true depth of Americans desire to cast aside traditional politicians and Washington-style compromise and embrace disruptive outsiders appealing to their passions.

title: Kerber Keeps Cool in Australia, Long a Williams Safe Haven
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  You cannot accuse Serena Williams of not providing fair warning.

title: Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump Voters Share Anger, but Direct It Differently
description: DES MOINES  They are angry at a political system they see as rigged. They feel squeezed by immigration, or the power of big banks. They sense that America is heading in the wrong direction, but emphatically believe only their candidate has the strength and vision to change things.

title: Start-Ups Take Rites From the Funeral Home to the Family Home
description: When people call Undertaking LA, they might ask a question like: My mom just died of cancer in our home. We want to keep her until noon tomorrow. Is that legal? Is that O.K.?

title: Leadership Means Learning to Look Behind the Mask
description: I waited until it was too late to get the best feedback I ever received in my life.

title: Meredith Wild, a Self-Publisher Making an Imprint
description: One chilly morning this month, Meredith Wild, the best-selling romance novelist, was sitting in her library in Destin, Fla., wrapped in a loose black sweater in front of a crackling fire. Most mornings, Ms. Wild writes her novels in this spot after her children leave for school, but that day she had other business to attend to. She had a call with a reality TV production company that is developing a show about her, and later, a conference call with a team at Waterhouse Press, the small imprint that is publishing her new novel in June.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Its Time to End Favoritism Toward College Athletes

title: Uncomfortable Question for Ted Cruz on Obamacare Silences the Room
description: HUBBARD, Iowa  Senator Ted Cruz is often asked about doing away with President Obamas health care law. He is rarely pressed by voters on what will replace it.

title: Anna Robbins
description: Anna Robbins is a costume designer best known for her work on Downton Abbey, which airs on Masterpiece on PBS.

title: Honing Skills in U.S., a Group of Teenagers Is Fueling Chinas Hockey Shift
description: A decade ago, when sporting interests in Beijing gravitated toward the coming 2008 Summer Olympics, a small group of boys began Chinas hockey revolution by happenstance.

title: An Internet Surprise From Louis C.K.: Barroom Drama Flecked With Dark Humor
description: The comedian Louis C.K. pulled a Beyonc on Saturday, releasing a new online show called Horace and Pete directly to fans with no prior warning.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: A Plague of Helicopters Is Ruining New York
description: IN recent years, New York City has invested over $2 billion in spectacular new waterfront parks. But that investment, and New Yorkers enjoyment of their parks and neighborhoods, is being ruined by an invasion of noisy, polluting tourist helicopters.

title: Welcome to the Age of the Commando
description: A FEW months ago, my wife and I had dinner with a couple we didnt know very well. It was awkward at first, but there was wine, and conversation soon followed. At one point, the wife asked about my tour in Iraq, where I served four years as a cavalry officer. I began talking about the desert, the tribal politics and the day-to-day travails of counterinsurgency. Thats all fine, the husband interrupted. But tell us about the super-soldiers. The Special-Ops guys. Thats what people care about.

title: Heres the Beauty of Trump
description: DES MOINES  THE White House has a strange, mind-warping effect on its occupants.

title: Bernie Sanders, Made in Vermont
description: Rutland, Vt.  BERNIE SANDERS gained his largest margin of victory as a member of the House of Representatives the same year that Vermont experienced its fiercest conservative backlash. In the wake of a bruising fight over civil unions in 2000, Republicans regained the Vermont House and gave the popular Democratic governor, Howard Dean, his severest test.

title: Calls for More Diversity in Academy Awards
description: Readers discuss the protests over the all-white nominees in the acting categories.

title: Trump, Sanders and the Revolt Against Decadence
description: ONE of the puzzles of the 2016 campaign, unexpectedly defined by the ascent of a billionaire reality TV star and a septuagenarian Vermont socialist, is why now? Yes, voters are angry, yes, theyre exhausted and disgusted and cynical about everything. But why is everything boiling over in this particular cycle, in this presidential campaign?

title: Is This the Oldest Image of the Virgin Mary?
description: THE Virgin Mary, the mother of Jesus, is the most revered woman in the Christian tradition. In the history of art, she appears almost as frequently as Jesus himself. But for the past 80 years, one of the oldest paintings of her may have been hiding in plain sight.

title: Her Father Shot Her in the Head, as an Honor Killing
description: WHETHER it wins or not, the Oscar nominee with the greatest impact  saving lives of perhaps thousands of girls  may be one youve never heard of.

title: How to Raise a Creative Child. Step One: Back Off
description: THEY learn to read at age 2, play Bach at 4, breeze through calculus at 6, and speak foreign languages fluently by 8. Their classmates shudder with envy; their parents rejoice at winning the lottery. But to paraphrase T. S. Eliot, their careers tend to end not with a bang, but with a whimper.

title: Everybodys a Critic. And Thats How It Should Be.
description: NEXT month, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences will complete its annual ritual of designating the best in two dozen cinematic categories. The Oscars have come under fire this year for the predictable, shameful racial homogeneity of their nominations, but that is not the only reason to complain.

title: The G.O.P.s Holy War
description: DES MOINES  IN the final, furious days of campaigning here, it was sometimes hard to tell whether this states Republicans were poised to vote for a president or a preacher, a commander or a crusader.

title: Fall in Logging Leaves Myanmars Elephants Jobless
description: Shrinking forests and a ban on raw timber exports have left an uncertain future for Myanmars 5,500 or so pachyderms in captivity.

title: Unemployed, Myanmars Elephants Grow Antsy, and Heavier
description: WA KALU PU, Myanmar  Dragging giant tree trunks up and down the steep hillsides of sweltering jungles is a tough job. But there is something worse, say owners of Myanmars logging elephants: having no job at all.

title: De Blasio Arrives in Iowa to Help Hillary Clinton Before Caucuses
description: DES MOINES  Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York landed in this Midwestern city last spring as a man on a mission, delivering a fiery speech on the evils of inequality and calling on presidential contenders to adopt his liberal views.

title: Jamie Murray Wins in Doubles; Andy Murray Has a Long Night, Too
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  It was after midnight, meaning it was officially Sunday, the day of his Australian Open singles final against Novak Djokovic, and Andy Murray was in the audience at Rod Laver Arena shooting video with his smartphone. On the court, Murrays older brother, Jamie, paused in mid-interview to scold him. Andy, you should be in bed, he said.

title: Why Sports Fans Risk Life and Limb for a Rolled-Up T-shirt
description: At Knicks games, its the 7th Avenue Squad. The Mets have the Pepsi Party Patrol. The Nets have the inanimate Team Hype. But every team in sports with any semblance of a marketing department has its own version of the Fan Patrol or Fun Police. This unnaturally peppy collective represents a cross between a cheerleading squad and the motivators at a bar mitzvah party. Their demeanor and high energy often totally at odds with the tenor of the game, they attempt to energize the crowd by cavorting with the mascot and dancing with kids on the Jumbotron and hosting the fan contest during breaks in the game. But the highlight of their shift comes when they launch T-shirts into the crowd.

title: Icy Surface Ahead (Please Speed Up)
description: About 20,000 spectators flocked to Eagle River, Wis., known as the snowmobile capital of the world, for the annual World Championship Snowmobile Derby in January.

title: The Iowa Push
description: With the caucus on the horizon, the presidential candidates blanketed the state with events.

title: Remaining California Jail Escapees Are Captured in San Francisco
description: LOS ANGELES  The two remaining fugitives who escaped from a maximum-security jail in Southern California were recaptured in the Bay Area on Saturday, ending an eight-day manhunt, law enforcement officials said.

title: Tentative Agreement Reached for More Democratic Debates, Aides Say
description: After days of jostling over whether to meet for more debates, and how many, aides to Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders have reached an agreement, of sorts, they said Saturday: The two will meet next week in New Hampshire and will hold three more debates thereafter.

title: A Warrior Can Join the Likes of Chamberlain, Bird and Fat Lever
description: In the midst of the Golden State Warriors championship run last season, Draymond Green became nearly as famous for his offbeat personality as for his lockdown defense.

title: John Kasich Courts New Hampshire Independents
description: KEENE, N.H.  Of all the Republicans campaigning in New Hampshire, Gov. John Kasich of Ohio has appealed most explicitly to the states population of unpredictable independent voters and moderate Republicans, who play an outsize role in presidential primaries here.

title: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York, a Distinct Sight in Iowa, Rallies the Clinton Troops
description: DES MOINES  The tall man arrived at the house around noon, bending slightly to avoid a ceiling beam, and smiled at the sight of two dozen Hillary Clinton supporters in a sunlit living room.

title: Donald Trump Offers to Let Children Run Through His Plane While He Speaks in Iowa
description: DUBUQUE, Iowa  Donald J. Trumps golden-lettered plane is one of the biggest toys in national politics. And he used it as such on Saturday, to keep children happy after waiting more than an hour in a chilly airport hangar for his first of three rallies today.

title: As Deaths Mount, an Ever Expanding Recall
description: The Takata airbag recalls have mushroomed to an estimated 28 million inflaters in more than 24 million cars at 14 automakers.

title: Takatas Faulty Airbags Still Exact Toll as Recalls Lag
description: ROCK HILL, S.C.  The shrapnel from the Ford Ranger airbag punctured Joel Knights neck with so much force that investigators initially did not rule out a fatal shooting.

title: Kenny Sailors, a Pioneer of the Jump Shot, Dies at 95
description: There was just one witness to the moment Kenny Sailors helped revolutionize the game of basketball  his brother, Bud  but by all accounts, no one has ever doubted their story.

title: Iowa Official Criticizes Cruz Campaign Over Mailer
description: HAMLIN, Iowa  Iowas secretary of state chastised the presidential campaign of Senator Ted Cruz on Saturday for sending a mailer that he said violated the spirit of the Iowa caucuses and misrepresented state election law.

title: Message to Buyers
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  We last met up with Yaakov Bendavid nearly two years ago, when he was caught cheating by turning failing F grades to passing Ds. Today, Mr. Bendavid presents us with a list of warnings to buyers that are clued in a punny way. Caveat emptor. Five of the six theme entries make their debuts today, and some work better than others. I liked Offer of free pillow fill? for NO MONEY DOWN, Desert supermarket? for STORE IN A DRY PLACE and Sign on the N.S.A.s entrance for INTEL INSIDE. For some reason, Note on a watered-down assault indictment? for BATTERY NOT INCLUDED made me cringe a bit.

title: Republicans Attack Hillary Clinton Over Classified Emails
description: DES MOINES  With the final hours before the Iowa caucuses ticking away, Republicans are seizing on new and potentially damaging revelations about Hillary Clintons handling of sensitive information as evidence that she is unfit to be president.

title: Liz Cheney to Run for Wyomings Only House Seat
description: WASHINGTON  Liz Cheney, the daughter of former Vice President Dick Cheney, has filed with the Federal Election Commission to run for Wyomings only House seat, a return to politics after her short-lived but much discussed bid for the Senate two years ago.

title: Review: Louis C.K.s Horace and Pete, Mournful and Unshakable
description: Sometimes you dont want to go where everybody knows your name. Sometimes it becomes oppressive  the history, the choking familiarity, the endlessly repeated fights. Sometimes you want to go just about anywhere else. But what choice do you have?

title: Donald Trump Leads Ted Cruz in Top Iowa Poll
description: DES MOINES  Donald J. Trump has widened his edge against Ted Cruz in Iowa, according to a Des Moines Register/Bloomberg Politics poll on Saturday that shows the billionaire gaining momentum right ahead of Mondays caucuses.

title: Why This Is the Iowa Poll That Everyone Was Waiting For
description: Perhaps no political poll is more eagerly anticipated and receives more attention than the last Des Moines Register poll before the Iowa caucuses.

title: One Dead and Several Wounded in Shooting at Colorado Motorcycle Expo
description: Shots rang out when a violent confrontation between biker gangs erupted on Saturday at a motorcycle show in Denver, leaving one person dead and several others injured, the police said.

title: Greece Resists Its Role as European Unions Gatekeeper
description: IDOMENI, Greece  On a recent weekday, 40 buses jammed into the parking lot of a gas station near the Macedonian border, carrying thousands of refugees who had survived a perilous crossing on wintry seas from Turkey.

title: Now a Survivor, Rod Carew Weeps Without Shame
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The black vest that Rod Carew wears everywhere these days has pockets on both sides, giving him a choice of where to carry the battery-powered medical device that keeps him alive.

title: Special Election Is Set for April to Fill Seats Left Vacant in Albany
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York said on Saturday that April 19 had been set as the date for a special election to fill four vacancies in the State Legislature, including seats left empty when Sheldon Silver, the former Assembly speaker, and Dean G. Skelos, the former Senate majority leader, were convicted on federal corruption charges last year.

title: Screen Actors Guild Awards Red Carpet
description: Kate Winslet, Alicia Vikander and Brie Larson were among the celebrities walking the carpet at the awards ceremony on Saturday evening.

title: Screen Actors Guild Awards Red Carpet
description: Laverne Cox, Kiernan Shipka and Ellie Kemper were among the celebrities walking the carpet at the awards ceremony on Saturday evening.

title: Brett Brown and Steve Kerr: Coaches With Much in Common, Aside From Records
description: PHILADELPHIA  Steve Kerr and Brett Brown began to form their relationship during the 2002-3 season with the San Antonio Spurs. Kerr was in his final season as an N.B.A. player, and Brown was in his first season as the teams director of player development. They took to each other instantly.

title: Authorities Arrest Son of Ex-Leader in Sri Lanka
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka  Sri Lankan authorities arrested a son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa on money-laundering charges on Saturday, the governments latest attempt to prosecute members of the previous administration, many of whom have been under investigation since Mr. Rajapaksas election defeat last year.

title: Dispatches From the Final Dash of Presidential Candidates in Iowa
description: After hundreds of campaign stops and tens of thousands of television ads, candidates are crisscrossing Iowa this weekend on a final, frantic dash, cajoling the last undecided voters and energizing supporters to head to Monday nights caucuses. Fending off drowsiness with Red Bull and Katy Perry songs, they are racing through a mind-muddying 55 events, from Dubuque in the northeast to Council Bluffs in the southwest, in a blur of speeches and handshakes.

title: President Xi Jinping of China Is All Business in Middle East Visit
description: BEIJING  When President Xi Jinping of China traveled to the Middle East this month he dropped in on two regional rivals, Saudi Arabia and Iran, a feat few global leaders could pull off.

title: Ted Cruz Counters Donald Trump With Targeted Approach in Iowa
description: URBANDALE, Iowa  Senator Ted Cruzs leading Iowa supporters say his get-out-the-vote operation is the best they have seen for a presidential campaign here. He had better hope they are right.

title: Myanmars Unemployed Elephants
description: Myanmars newly democratic government has banned the export of raw timber, to help fight deforestation. But that has idled thousands of the elephants that toil in the logging industry.

title: Bernie Sanders Exudes Confidence About Iowa (and Elsewhere)
description: DES MOINES  Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont ruminated on the final two questions asked of him about the Iowa caucuses as he rose from a table packed with reporters here on Thursday morning.

title: Turkey Accuses Russia of Again Violating Its Airspace
description: Turkey on Friday accused Russia of violating its airspace for the second time in recent months, injecting fresh rancor into a relationship that has been badly strained since Turkish fighters shot down a Russian plane that entered the country from Syria in November.

title: A Bloomberg Poll Finds Little Support for Michael Bloomberg
description: DES MOINES  A Bloomberg-sponsored poll, made public in extravagant Bloomberg style amid shrimp and champagne, delivered some sour news about Michael R. Bloomberg himself: Few Iowa voters like him as he weighs a third party White House run.

title: Bernie Sanders Sings This Land Is Your Land With Vampire Weekend
description: Bernie Sanders held a rally and concert at the University of Iowa tonight with thousands of students, whom he urged to vote for him on Monday and make the pundits look dumb.

title: From Hillary Clinton, a Single Message Told Across the Decades
Tax Scams Are Targeting Uninsured, I.R.S. Warns
description: WASHINGTON  The Internal Revenue Service is warning consumers about tax scams involving the Affordable Care Act and penalties imposed under the law on people who go without health insurance.

title: Rabbi Eugene B. Borowitz, Influential Reform Theologian, Dies at 91
description: Rabbi Eugene B. Borowitz, a leading theologian of Reform Judaism who argued that the modern emphasis on reason and self-imposed ethics needed the undergirding of what he called a covenantal relationship with God, died on Jan. 22 at his home in Stamford, Conn. He was 91.

title: Iowa Anomaly: A Town Ignored by Candidates
description: EAGLE GROVE, Iowa  There is a high school auditorium here that could fit 200 people, give or take. Some wood-paneled furniture stores, a pharmacy, a three-garage firehouse and a popular deli dot downtown, looking like a postcard from Americas heartland, if not its heart.

title: Hillary Clinton Criticizes Bernie Sanders and Ted Cruz on Healthcare
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa  Making her final push before the Iowa caucuses, Hillary Clinton staked out her position as the lone defender of the Affordable Care Act on Saturday night, warning that her Democratic rival, Senator Bernie Sanders, would scrap it and start over and that Republicans would hand healthcare back to insurers and drug-makers.

title: The Birth of a Nation Sweeps Top Awards at the Sundance Film Festival
description: Setting up an expected 2017 Oscar run, The Birth of a Nation, a searing slave-revolt drama, swept the top prizes at the Sundance Film Festival on Saturday night in Park City, Utah.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Shia LaBeouf showed all of his movies at the Angelika Film Center in Manhattan in November. You can stream one of them. Elsewhere, Vice reports on the battle against the Islamic State, and 60 Minutes investigates the increasing popularity of the United States as a place for corrupt officials and foreigners to stash money. And the search for Bigfoot trudges onward.

title: Blair Thomson-Levin, Jason Oberman
description: Blair Elise Thomson-Levin, a daughter of Janice I. Thomson and Roy Levin of Palo Alto, Calif., was married Jan. 30 to Jason Andrew Oberman, a son of Nancy S. Oberman and Jeffrey L. Oberman of Weston, Conn. Steve Goldbloom, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the Carneros Inn in Napa, Calif.

title: Michelle Chin, Brandon Wong
description: Michelle Chin and Brandon Wong were married on Jan. 30 by the Rev. Donald Williams, a Presbyterian minister, at Coral Cove Villa on the beach in Discovery Bay, Jamaica.

title: Michelle Isaacson, Jonas Curchack
description: Michelle Rebecca Isaacson and Jonas Aaron Curchack were married Jan. 30 at the Yale Club of New York. Rabbi Lev Herrnson officiated.

title: Thayer Adams and Thomas McKenzie: A Lifelong Bachelor Turns the Page
description: Thayer Wendell Adams and Thomas William McKenzie were married Jan. 30 at the Ocean Reef Club in Key Largo, Fla. The Rev. Dr. Robert W. Henley, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

title: Annette Graumann, Chase Welles
description: Annette Graumann and Chase Bassett Welles were married Jan. 30 at Grace Church in New York. The Rev. Stephen C. Holton, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Katie Rogers, John Chinoransky
description: Katie Rogers and John Charles Chinoransky were married Jan. 28 at the Audubon House and Tropical Gardens in Key West, Fla. Liz Weinstock, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Maureen Trantham, Brian Turner
description: Maureen McCotter Trantham and Brian Hughes Turner were married Jan. 28 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Edwina M. Townes, a staff member of the New York City Clerks office, officiated.

title: Autumn Doerr, Lynn Malchow
description: Autumn Doerr and Lynn Malchow were married Jan. 29 at the Clara Shortridge Foltz Criminal Justice Center in Los Angeles. Roberto Longoria, a judge on the Superior Court of Los Angeles County, officiated in his chambers at the courthouse.

title: Jacqueline Lonier, Andrew Dikman
description: Dr. Jacqueline Yuey Lonier and Dr. Andrew Evan Dikman were married Jan. 30 by Rabbi David Adelson at City Winery, an event space in New York.

title: Christine Motley, Irtiaz Ahmad
description: Christine Marie Motley and Irtiaz Uddin Ahmad were married Jan. 30 in Monmouth Junction, N.J. Imam Shair Abdul Mani officiated at the home of Fatima and Fakrul Sayeed, an aunt and uncle of the groom. The ceremony incorporated Muslim and Christian wedding traditions.

title: Sarah Corsaro, Matthew McGrath
description: Sarah Elizabeth Corsaro and Matthew Levin McGrath were married Jan. 30 in the Dahlgren Chapel on the campus of Georgetown University in Washington. Msgr. Robert Harris, a Roman Catholic priest and a cousin of the groom, performed the ceremony, with Rabbi Daniel Levin, also a cousin of the groom, taking part.

title: Kaneesha Parsard, Ryan Jobson
description: Kaneesha Cherelle Parsard, the daughter of Sheryl K. M. Parsard and Keston O. Parsard, both of Lynbrook, N.Y., was married Jan. 30 to Ryan Cecil Jobson, a son of Lisa R. Jobson and Dr. G. W. Mark Jobson of Woodstock, N.Y. Glossie Stone, a Pentecostal minister and a marriage officer for Jamaica, officiated at Hummingbird Hall in Montego Bay, Jamaica.

title: Corrections: January 31, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Now something that was supposed to save him killed him.

title: Applications Sought for New York Portfolio Review
description: Once again, an intense weekend of critiques, conversation and community will take place at the Fourth Annual New York Portfolio Review. Its free, but space is limited, so apply now.

title: Seeking Applications for the 2016 New York Portfolio Review
description: Whether you are a budding photographer trying to get a foothold in the profession, or a veteran looking for new challenges, The Fourth Annual New York Portfolio Review could provide the break youre looking for. And its free  because we think that its the quality of the work that matters, not how much money you can pay.

title: Your Weekend Briefing: Donald Trump, Oregon, Novak Djokovic
description: Here are the weeks top stories.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: How Europe Protects Your Online Data Differently Than the U.S.
description: All the talk about data privacy can get caught up in political wrangling. But the different approaches have practical consequences for people, too.

title: U.S. and Europe Fail to Meet Deadline for Data Transfer Deal
description: American and European officials failed on Sunday to reach an agreement over how digital data  including financial information and social media posts  could be transferred between the two regions.

title: Terror Threats Thaw Budgets Across Europe
description: PARIS  A phalanx of soldiers wearing bulletproof vests and wielding machine guns fanned out beneath the Eiffel Tower on a recent afternoon, scanning the crowd for potential terrorist threats. Across the country, nearly 10,000 more armed troops patrolled streets around landmarks, stores and government buildings.

title: 1891: Ernest Meissonier Dies
description: Meissonier is dead. The news spread throughout Paris yesterday as only sad tidings can. Most people had heard that this greatest of living painters  as he was until yesterday morning  was in ill-health, and had indeed been forced to resign the presidency of the National Society of Fine Arts in consequence.

title: In Iowa, Voters on the Edges May Set Tone for Primaries
description: DES MOINES  Iowa, widely derided for being unlike the rest of the United States, was supposed to be irrelevant this year as the presidential race became nationalized  thanks to widely viewed televised debates and the rise of social media.

title: Why the Iowa Caucuses Loom So Large
description: Iowa is overrun by presidential candidates and the media following them. The New York Times reporter Trip Gabriel explains why such a small state has such an outsize significance.

title: Novak Djokovic Wins Sixth Australian Open to Tie Record
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The Grand Slam was there for the taking in September in New York, and although Serena Williams faltered there and then faltered in the final in Melbourne on Saturday, a Grand Slam is still very much on the table.

title: Hillary Clintons Quiet Support Will Carry Iowa, Ex-Governor Predicts
description: WASHINGTON  Neither Bernie Sanders nor Donald J. Trump will repeat Barack Obamas 2008 victory in the Iowa caucuses.

title: Coming of Age, Whether They Like It or Not
description: Shortly before my sons bar mitzvah last fall, I purchased some Arnold Palmer lemonade/iced tea in what we call the Man Jug. It was part of a ritual created by my older son, Charlie, when he came home from his bar mitzvah service, chug-a-lugged the tea straight from the bottle, and proclaimed, Im a man, I can drink from the Man Jug. His little brother, Theo, wasnt going to miss this opportunity for himself.

title: Nostalgia for a Dot-Com Casualty
description: Dear Diary:

title: 1966: Belgian Miners Killed
description: HASSELT, Belgium  Two coal miners were killed and dozens wounded in a violent daylong clash with state police in Waterschei near here today [Jan. 31]. The first was killed by a bullet in the stomach as police stood off attacking miners, police said. The second was killed when police counterattacked.

title: Our Man in Iowa: Polls Point to Donald Trump, as Do Odd Indicators
description: DAVENPORT  Good morning from Iowa, where there are many ways of trying to predict Monday nights caucus results  candidates crowd sizes, the enthusiasm, the highly regarded Des Moines Register/Bloomberg Politics poll, which overnight showed Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton with small leads.

title: For Victims, an Overloaded Court System Brings Pain and Delays
description: It had gone on for almost four years, Maxima Allen said as she sat on a hard bench in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn over the summer.

title: SAG Awards Red Carpet
description: Kate Winslet, Alicia Vikander and Brie Larson were among the celebrities walking the carpet at the awards ceremony on Saturday evening.

title: Syria Peace Talks Inch Ahead as Bombings Near Damascus Continue
description: GENEVA  As a suicide attack killed more than 40 people near a revered shrine in Syria on Sunday and government forces pummeled a besieged town, peace talks inched forward in Geneva, where a reluctant opposition delegation met for the first time with a United Nations mediator.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Spotlight Takes Top Screen Actors Guild Award
description: At the Screen Actors Guild Awards on Saturday night, the journalism drama Spotlight won the top prize: outstanding performance by a cast.

title: Far From Home, Djokovic Is a Favorite Son
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Novak Djokovic was trying to explain to the television studio hosts how he had managed to tie two Australian legends with his 6-1, 7-5, 7-6 (3) victory over Andy Murray in the Australian Open final Sunday. But he could not hear himself think.

title: Bernie Sanders Says Tax Plan Would Not Hurt Democrats 2016 Prospects
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont was asked on Meet the Press on Sunday whether his health care plan, which would raise taxes to pay for more government benefits, would create a problem for House Democrats running for re-election in 2016.

title: How Donald Trump Tried to Protect His Name From Others Who Shared It
description: Bygones are bygones, Jules Trump said, looking back on a legal skirmish that involved nothing more than whats in a name: his name, or, specifically, the Trump Organization (Donald J. Trump) and the Trump Group (Jules Trump and his brother, Eddie).

title: Sanders Sings With Vampire Weekend
description: Bernie Sanders joined musicians from Vampire Weekend to sing This Land Is Your Land at a rally in Iowa City, Iowa.

title: Bernie Sanderss Campaign Says It Raised $20 Million in January
description: On the eve of the Iowa caucuses, Bernie Sanderss campaign said Sunday is has already raised $20 million this month, an enormous haul that backs up the campaigns assertion that it will have enough money for a long, hard-fought nominating fight against Hillary Clinton.

title: Hillary Clinton Campaign Declined Bill de Blasios First Offer to Help in Iowa
description: DES MOINES  Hillary Clintons team declined Mayor Bill de Blasios initial offer to campaign in Iowa for her candidacy, the mayor said in an interview here on Sunday morning.

title: Choice to Conduct Independent Tennis Review Has Ties to the Sport
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  At the announcement of an independent review into the tennis anticorruption program on Wednesday, Chris Kermode, chairman of the Association of Tennis Professionals, pledged that tennis would do more than a hollow internal inquiry.

title: Barclays and Credit Suisse to Settle Dark Pool Inquiries
description: Barclays and Credit Suisse will pay a combined $154.3 million to settle allegations that they misrepresented their private stock trading services.  The systems, known as dark pools, are supposed to offer a haven to traditional traders and investors from predatory trading behavior.

title: Review: Impractical Jokers Is Played for Laughs Live at Radio City
description: Impractical Jokers is just dumb fun, but what do you expect from a prank show in which loud comics accost strangers on the streets?

title: Kung Fu Panda 3 is No. 1
description: Hollywood had a bumpy weekend. In its first three days of release, DreamWorks Animations high-stakes Kung Fu Panda 3 may have left money on the table at home in search of riches abroad. The Finest Hours, yet another ocean disaster movie, failed to attract an initial audience big enough to justify its cost. And tumbleweeds blew through theaters playing Jane Got a Gun, produced by and starring Natalie Portman.

title: O.J. Simpson Drama Depicts an Old Trial, and Renewed Tensions
description: For the last two decades, O. J. has been on ice.

title: Email Issue Dogs Hillary Clinton on Eve of Iowa Caucuses
description: This is not what Hillary Clinton wanted to discuss the morning before the Iowa caucuses.

title: Donald Trump Field Organizer Accuses Campaign of Sex Discrimination
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa  A former paid organizer for Donald J. Trump who was fired this month has accused his presidential campaign of sex discrimination.

title: Trying to Separate Bill Cosby From Cliff Huxtable
description: Bill Cosby looked haggard and old as he stumbled on his way to the courthouse. And when his mug shot flashed across my screen, I felt a sharp stab of grief.

title: Palestinian Officer Is Killed After Attacking Three Israeli Soldiers
description: JERUSALEM  A Palestinian policeman shot three Israeli soldiers, seriously wounding two, at a West Bank checkpoint on Sunday before being killed by soldiers, the Israeli military said.

title: Battered by War, Iraq Now Faces Calamity From Dropping Oil Prices
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqis seeking to withdraw money from banks are told there is not enough cash. Hospitals in Baghdad are falling back to the deprivation of the 1990s sanctions era, resterilizing, over and over, needles and other medical products meant for one-time use.

title: Restored Williamsburg Bell to Be Celebrated
description: Dionne Warwick, Esperanza Spalding and Danny Glover will be among the performers on hand Monday night at a gala concert honoring the restoration of the bell at the First Baptist Church in Williamsburg, Va., founded in 1776 by slaves and one of the oldest black churches in America.

title: The Rev. John Romas, Leader of Greek Church at Ground Zero, Dies at 86
description: After St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church in Lower Manhattan was destroyed on Sept. 11, 2001, by the collapse of the World Trade Center nearby, the Rev. John D. Romas held his small congregation together as its worship services moved to Brooklyn and instilled in his parishioners the hope that they would live to see their church rebuilt. He, however, did not.

title: Israel Approves Prayer Space at Western Wall for Non-Orthodox Jews
description: JERUSALEM  After years of rancor over rituals at the Western Wall, one of the holiest sites in Judaism, the Israeli government on Sunday approved the creation of an upgraded egalitarian prayer space there for non-Orthodox Jews.

title: More Democratic Debates in the Works
description: The Democratic presidential candidates have asked for more debates, and it appears they are going to get their wish.

title: How Moon Dust Languished in a Downing Street Cupboard
description: It was a space problem of sorts for the new British prime minister: where to put the minuscule sample of the lunar dust that Americas Apollo 11 astronauts had scooped from the surface of the moon in their giant leap for mankind?

title: As Family Helped Build Betting System, It Witnessed Horse Racing History
description: Late Sunday afternoon, when the tote board went dark after the final race of the day at Aqueduct Racetrack, Pat Mahony called it a career, one he has cherished and one that has been part of his family history for more than a century. Like his father and grandfather before him, Mahony is a mutuels man.

title: In Iran, New Battle Brews Over Contracts With Foreign Oil Giants
description: TEHRAN  A political battle is taking shape in Iran over any new foreign role in developing the countrys enormous oil wealth, only a few weeks after the Iranian nuclear deal with foreign powers relaxed tough economic sanctions.

title: Pre-Iowa Notes
description: I dont know what will happen in the caucuses tomorrow. Actually, I know what will happen on the Republican side: someone horrifying will come in first, and someone horrifying will come in second. The names are less clear.

title: Twisting Inquiry Into Buenos Aires Bombing Takes New Turn
description: BUENOS AIRES  For more than two decades, an investigation into the suicide bombing of a Jewish center here in 1994 that killed 85 people has faced setbacks and controversy. It caused an intractable rift between Argentina and Iran. A former president has been put on trial, accused of orchestrating a cover-up. And a prosecutor involved in the case died last year in murky circumstances.

title: The Rise and Fall of the Bush Campaign
description: The biggest stories of this young political year are the surprising surges of the outsider presidential candidates Donald J. Trump and Bernie Sanders, the Democratic senator from Vermont. Close behind is the possible collapse of the once-formidable front-runner, Jeb Bush.

title: Review: Quicksand, Robert Ashleys Enigmatic Spy-Thriller Opera
description: Robert Ashley is no longer with us, but his voice  calm, mellow, reassuring, quizzical, amused, earnest  lives on. Surrounded by a shifting, unstable electronic haze, it is the only thing you hear at the Kitchen during Quicksand, the opera that he wrote in the final years before his death, at 83, in 2014.

title: Facebooks Sensible Ban on Gun Ads
description: Facebooks decision last week to prohibit private gun sales on its social networking site and on its photo-sharing app Instagram should make it harder for convicted felons and other dangerous people to acquire deadly weapons. Thats a very good thing, especially considering the unwillingness of lawmakers in Congress to enact sensible gun safety policies.

title: Jaap van Zweden, Philharmonics Maestro-to-Be, Sharpens His Baton
description: DALLAS  It was the morning after he had been named the next music director of the New York Philharmonic, and Jaap van Zweden was already back at work here at his current job, rehearsing the Dallas Symphony Orchestra in Mozarts Symphony No. 39 with the fastidiousness  and relentlessness  for which he has become known.

title: Boko Haram Burns Villages in Northeastern Nigeria
description: KADUNA, Nigeria  More than 50 people were killed in a series of raids on villages in northeastern Nigeria that officials say was the work of the Islamist extremist group Boko Haram.

title: Review: Quicksand, Driven by the Rhythm of Words, Light and Bodies
description: Told from the point of view of a wry, vodka-swilling composer and freelance spy, Robert Ashleys Quicksand, a 2011 opera written as a novel, anticipates action from the start: Im sitting on the bathroom floor, leaning back against the sink. I have the gun in my hands.

title: Review: The Grand Paradise Summons a 70s Pleasure Palace
description: I had barely arrived for my tropical holiday in Brooklyn before I was deflowered. Yes, my lei, which had been hung welcomingly around my neck when I entered the resort called the Grand Paradise, was taken from me (gently) by a vulpine blonde in a pink satin bathing suit and pearls.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Feb. 1
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Review: Jordi Savall and Juilliard415 Perform in Shakespeare and Cervantes
description: Cervantes and Shakespeare died 400 years ago, though not on the same day, as many continue to maintain. For Cervantes, the date on his tombstone  April 23, 1616  may refer to his burial, and for Shakespeare, the same date was based on the Julian calendar; by the modern Gregorian calendar, it is May 3.

title: Cartoonist Is Arrested as Egypt Cracks Down on Critics
description: CAIRO  A popular Egyptian cartoonist was arrested Sunday on charges of running a website without a license, the Interior Ministry said, in the latest escalation of a campaign to silence the governments online critics.

title: A Word With Spike Lee: They Want to Rewind the Clock
description: In his latest feature, Chi-Raq, Spike Lee tells the story of the epidemic of gun violence in Chicago through the eyes of a gangsters girlfriend, who persuades women to withhold sex until their menfolk disavow firearms. During production last summer, the film made headlines when the citys mayor, Rahm Emanuel, criticized the title, which borrowed a nickname Chicagoans had coined for their towns violent turn.

title: Simile and Metaphor as Critique: Jaap van Zweden Speaks to an Ensemble
description: Jaap van Zweden, who will become the music director of the New York Philharmonic in 2018, is known for his intense, demanding rehearsals. Drilling his current ensemble, the Dallas Symphony Orchestra, in a Mozart symphony last week, he used a battery of tools to coax out the sounds he sought: singing out phrases in his pure tenor voice, giving precise technical instructions, and, quite often, venturing into analogies.

title: Trump or Cruz? Clinton or Sanders? Iowa Hears Last-Minute Pitches
description: DES MOINES  They have munched on pork chops in the heat of summer and hunted game in the dead of winter. Spouses and children have been dispatched as surrogates across the plains. But with the caucuses on Monday hours away, the presidential candidates are leaving nothing to chance, furiously crisscrossing Iowa and making direct appeals to voters to stand for them in the elections first nominating contest.

title: Review: In No Ms Bebs, Forced Sterilizations at an American Hospital
description: Outrage may be Americas leading source of energy right now, and it seems endlessly renewable. No Ms Bebs adds to the supply but in an understated, melancholy way that leaves you more sad than angry.

title: For the Vanguard Jazz Orchestra, Monday Becomes an All-Week Affair
description: The Vanguard Jazz Orchestra opened its first set at the Village Vanguard on a recent Monday night with a familiar blend of purring saxophones and punchy brass, carving up Big Dipper just as it had in its first performance in the same room almost exactly 50 years ago.

title: Review: In Maria Stuarda, Sondra Radvanovsky Makes a Vivid Impact
description: When an announcement is made that a singer is sick but will perform anyway, listener sympathy is sought for any potential flaws. But there was no evidence that Sondra Radvanovsky had a cold, as had been indicated, during her magnificent rendering of the title role of Donizettis Maria Stuarda on Friday evening, when David McVicars production returned to the Metropolitan Opera.

title: Review: Ostend: Stefan Zweig, Joseph Roth, and the Summer Before the Dark Revisits Moments in Exile
description: Not that long ago, most American readers had never heard of Stefan Zweig, even though he was one of Europes most popular authors  every bit as famous as Thomas Mann, certainly  at the sunny peak of his career.

title: Four-Baggers
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  One of the things I like about Gary Cees crosswords is the nod to his profession as a radio D.J. and program director in most of, if not all, of his puzzles. He opens his puzzle today at 1 Across with AM/FM.

title: Review: In Saala Khadoos, a Female Boxer Rises From the Streets in India
description: You know the story or one like it: Underdog boxer from the mean streets is taken up by a coach, himself in need of redemption. Together, this scruffy pair hope to make it to the big championship.

title: Man Slashed in Face After Argument on Harlem Subway Platform
description: A man was slashed in the face as he stood on the subway platform at 110th Street and Lenox Avenue in Harlem early on Sunday, after getting into an argument with a woman he did not know, the police said.

title: John Kasich Relishes Attacks From Jeb Bush Backers in Iowa
description: SALEM, N.H.  Senator Marco Rubio of Florida and his team have complained  and complained  about the attacks the outside group supporting Jeb Bush has lobbed their way.

title: Cond Nast Adapts to New Forces, Leaving Some Employees Unsettled
description: A few years ago, Anna Wintour, David Remnick and Graydon Carter went to see S. I. Newhouse Jr., the man who turned Cond Nast into a gilded publishing empire and who handpicked them to lead its flagship magazines.

title: Microsoft Plumbs Oceans Depths to Test Underwater Data Center
description: REDMOND, Wash.  Taking a page from Jules Verne, researchers at Microsoft believe the future of data centers may be under the sea.

title: Two Virginia Tech Students Arrested in Girls Death
description: Two Virginia Tech students were arrested over the weekend in connection with the abduction and death of a 13-year-old girl whose remains were found on Saturday, school and law enforcement officials said.

title: Theater Flashback: Grease on Broadway
description: That hair! Their gum! Those songs!

title: Swedish Police Foiled Planned Attack on Immigrants in Stockholm
description: HALMSTAD, Sweden  Scores of masked men dressed in black, some carrying wooden weapons, descended on the center of Stockholm, gathering near the entrance to the citys main subway station.
